The owners Anne and Rich are both lovely people who make you feel like you are visiting your local from the moment you step inside. (by Danielle Davis) [2 years ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Anne and rich are perfect hosts . Warm atmosphere and always great service with a smile (by Arlene Cooney) [10 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Can‚Äôt fault the food and drinks
Loved it all
Would highly recommend (by Cian O Hara) [7 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Very nice looking place. Super clean and modern. The owner is American and VERY pleasant. Highly recommend. It is a Must Visit in my book. Will definitely go back. (by Rich Brady) [6 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - The Brewery now serves really good pub food, in addition to drinks and nice decor. A great place to grab a pint and a Sunday lunch. (by Anne Brady) [Edited 3 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Great place & atmosphere, from the interior to the drink/cocktails this place is fab. (by S) [7 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Gorgeous pub with great atmosphere and friendly staff :) (by Suzanne Murphy) [7 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - They have live music for St Stephens day and Friday and Saturday night and free food and champagne toast on New years Eve üòç ‚Ä¶ (by AnneM Brady) [Edited 5 years ago]

name: Farnham Arms Hotel
reviews:
Review 1: None - Even as a 'solo' traveller, the Farnham arms Hotel is like a 'home from home. |The location is excellent with car parking also available at the back of the hotel. |The staff are friendly and ensure that your stay is memorable. They will 'go ‚Ä¶ (by georgefQ1035ZT) | Review 2: None - Dropped in for a drink as its next door ( I thought) to the People's Restaurant as it turned out they are one off the same  and the same menu available. Initial welcome by staff was not great but when we indicated we were having food the ‚Ä¶ (by pauldQ1902AG) | Review 3: None - Excellent location. Excellent value. Excellent service, in particular Catherine in the office. Nice rooms. Nice bar. Great breakfast. Friendly staff. We'll be back in the future. (by Bigmike2110) | Review 4: None - Walls are paper thin. Gorgeous interiors, lovely staff, but 100% the people in the next room will have the walking sound effect + room shake combo as the big stone fella from Mario 64 DS.

It's a sweet little bubble if you're intentionally seeking a no-thrills getaway.

My partner and I were intentionally looking for something very mild and isolated. It's a good area for coffee dates & the hotel bar (Percy French) is very nice. Lots of takeaways very close to the hotel if you fancy something fun to bring back to the hotel.

Overall I liked it a lot. There's something special about hotels that can invoke the feeling of a liminal space. The simplicity of it is great for spending time together without  distractions or buzz from the outside world.

Edit: my partner has pointed out that we can hear & feel when people are walking on the ground floor below us. I don't know how that's possible but upon further observation I can say this is true. (by A.V. Caomh√°nach) | Review 5: None - We could not fault the room and the hotel it's in a fabulous location, the only negative was the receptionist she was very unfriendly by no means a people person which is bad as it's your first impression but the bar staff and the breakfast staff this morning were warm friendly and helpful (by Leanne Corcoran) | Review 6: None - Lovely hotel. Food really good. A must to try is the Sunday dinner..   parking can be found near hotel but there is a big car park just around the corner.  You do need to pay but not on a Sunday. (by Eileen M) | Review 7: None - This is a great hotel! Its location is ideal. Our cozy room overlooked the charming town square. The room was clean and comfortable.
The staff was helpful and pleasant. The full Irish breakfast and the coffee was superb.
Adjoining is a bar-lounge which was well stocked!
The best part was the delightful staff member, Jacinta, who was very kind and helpful (by rosemary mcgettrick) | Review 8: None - Went in for the carvery dinner, very poor portions for the price of ‚Ç¨16, it was like a child's portion, was still hungry leaving. The meadow view would put them to shame, and some of the deli dinners around the town for that matter, won't be back in a hurry (by martin 0000) | Review 9: None - I‚Äôm lying here at 2230 and the music is blasting downstairs. Can‚Äôt sleep. Bass shaking the entire room. Called reception who said it‚Äôll be over shortly but that‚Äôs just the way it is when the restaurant/bar plays music. Not ideal when you have to work in the morning. Walls must be made of paper. Also the breakfast doesn‚Äôt start until 0900 which is great when you‚Äôve to be in work for 0800 and the ‚Äúcontinental‚Äù before that is cardboard toast, apples that were picked in 1997 and have more wrinkles than my nan and pan au chocolates wrapped in plastic you could wedge a door with.
The staff are fantastic and the beds are very comfortable so at least I‚Äôll be cosy as I lie awake listening to someone else‚Äôs music. (by Jack Rafferty) | Review 10: None - Lovely old hotel right in the centre of Cavan. It's on the main street close to all amenities.
Has off street parking.
Staff at reception very pleasant and helpful.
Restaurant not open on the night I stayed due to staff party.
Rooms were well laid out and comfortable.
Breakfast was excellent served by hand not buffet style.
Staff at breakfast were very polite and informative about the area.
I would have no hesitation staying in this hotel again. (by Frank Duggan)

name: KFC
address: Lakeland Retail Park, Dublin Rd, Pollamore Near, Cavan, H12 PK29, Ireland
service_options: Roma Takeaway ¬∑ 4.3 stars ¬∑ 126 reviews ¬∑ Takeout restaurant, Smith's Diner & Takeaway ¬∑ 4.3 stars ¬∑ 714 reviews ¬∑ American
reviews:
Review 1: 1 star - Absolutely Disgusted ‚Äì Will Never Return (KFC Cavan)
I ordered a Zinger Stacker burger from KFC Cavan and was shocked at how bad it was. The chicken tasted awful ‚Äì like dry, shredded fibres that had been sitting for years. I actually gagged eating it. I brought it straight back and showed the staff, but instead of giving a refund, they told me to go online to complain and only offered a replacement. I refused  and insisted on a refund, reluctantly I got after threatening to post online about my experience ‚Äì I don‚Äôt think I could ever eat anything from there again. Extremely disappointed with both the food and the customer service. (by pauline rehill) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 1 star - Don't know why I bother with KFC. Hasn't been good in years. Greasy under cooked chips, chicken fillets are thinner and smaller, it's always dirty even after it's cleaned and you don't feel full after any meal. Only constant is the gravy is still good (by Adrian O'Brien) [7 months ago] | Review 3: 1 star - I don‚Äôt recommend KFC in Cavan because the meat is raw and it‚Äôs not done. The food is very dry. This place had gaved me food poisoning I am very disappointed of this service. (by Diana covaci) [a year ago] | Review 4: 3 stars - The food was good but the service wasn‚Äôt to good we ordered a rice plate that came with corn but did not get it so we had to provide evidence to get it (by Tikhon) [a month ago] | Review 5: 1 star - The staff is inattentive and speaks indistinctly.  They took your order and gave you popcorn instead of nuggets.  Half of the menu is out of stock.
We took food with us, 4 portions of potatoes were scattered in a bag, disgusting
I took a photo of what my order looked like when I received it
I don't recommend (by Alie Abdurakhmanova) [a year ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Food is always lovely and fresh, never had any complaints however drive through service cancelled be difficult with having to repeat your order multiple time (by Shane Kennedy) [3 months ago] | Review 7: 4 stars - The staff is really rude, they should learn how to behave towards costumers
The food is fine  tho (by Sreshta Sreshtavenugopal) [a month ago] | Review 8: 4 stars - Nice food but please start delivering near drumgola, gallops, latt hills and sean bothair area since it‚Äôs on just eat now. (by Maddy 36884) [3 weeks ago] | Review 9: 1 star - Hair and paper found in food on 3 July at 4pm. (by kes kse) [3 months ago] | Review 10: 1 star - I ordered a chicken baguette meal on Friday, it was the only thing I ate all day, it's now Sunday and I still haven't ate since, due to severe vomiting. Definite food poisoning, my weekend was ruined laying up with severe abdominal pain and puking, I will never darken the doorstep of that establishment again. (by martin 0000) [6 months ago]

name: Dungimmon House
reviews: Review 1: None - Fabulous stay in your wonderful guest house, thank you. Really enjoyed the extensive breakfast menu & choices. Will look forward to staying again. We enjoyed reading and having tea in the living room too especially when the host put on the fire. We highly recommend this for an overnight stay or a duration. Will be definitely returning. Cheers! Our room was spacious and had a nice view to the garden. In the sitting room you can obviously sit and enjoy a cup of tea or coffee. The breakfast was delicious. The host was incredibly nice. We really enjoyed our stay. (by Nicole Britz) | Review 6: None - Very nice place to stay. Just lovely. (by Pa Hos) [a month ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Good food, friendly staff, and reasonably priced. (by C M) [2 weeks ago] | Review 8: 1 star - The chicken was overcooked and extremely dry, tasted like it was cooked without any salt. The noodles that came with the chicken dish were cold, dry and stuck into one lump. It was obvious that they served cheap instant noodles which they cooked well in advance and just heated a little in the microwave. The side dish of garlic potatoes (not in the pictures) would have been delicious but the potatoes were undercooked. The duck was ok but too greasy and burnt quite badly on one side. Only the fish was delicious and nicely cooked. We couldn't eat the chicken, noodles or potatoes so they took them away and offered a replacement dish but we refused. At least we weren't charged for the chicken dish. We paid for the other dishes and left immediately. The whole dinner experience was ruined. The food was way too overpriced compared to its quality. (by Inga Andriuskeviciene) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Excellent spot. 100%.

Spacious building inside with plenty of parking outside.

All round highly recommended. (by Faol√°n K) [5 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Today we had my daughters communion in lisgrey house, it had a lovely relaxed atmosphere staff were so helpful and food great and on top of this it was great value for money. I will not hesitate to have future functions in lisgrey again, thanks to lovely staff and owner. (by Catherine Liapis) [4 months ago]

name: St. Kyran's Restaurant
reviews:
Review 1: None - We had our wedding reception in St Kyrans on June 29th 2024. We cannot express how over the moon we were with the service provided. Firstly the venue is absolutely beautiful. We live locally and were so happy to celebrate our wedding with amazing views of lough ramor as the backdrop.

We contacted Helena and Patrick about our wedding plans in May 2023 after getting engaged and from that moment onwards they could not have been more helpful. We had a BBQ style meal outside on the terrace and the sun shone down on all the guests as we took in the amazing views while we ate. We were absolutely blown away by the food and desserts served. As two foodies seeing everyone so satisfied with their meals was certainly one of the highlights of our night.  I cannot keep track of how many guests contacted me afterwards to compliment the quality of the food. It was absolutely outstanding and on a whole other level to other wedding venues in our opinion. The venue did an amazing job of catering for all of our guests with dietary requirements and made sure guests were never left without a topped up drink in their hand.

In the run up to the wedding Helena and Patrick helped us feel at ease by reassuring us that they had thought of every little detail. This meant we could relax on the day knowing our guests were taken care of. Some of our guests had cancelled flights the night before the wedding and arrived much later than planned. Helena went above and beyond for these guests stay up late to check them all in.

We highly recommend St Kyrans as a wedding or party venue. Helena and Patrick are clearly passionate about what they do and provide an exceptional service with a warm personal touch. (by itsgrainne) | Review 2: None - Enjoyable but expensive for afternoon tea... two of our three were missing a number of items - no apology when pointed out. Had to ask for coffee refill & one pot brought for 8 of us and waitress sighed when asked to bring another. She was not the only one forcing a smile when the bill arrived. Tip reflected the experience. Poor this time!! (by Patricia Boyle) | Review 3: None - Don't judge it by its exterior. The inside of the hotel/restaurant is magnificent. The hotel rooms are well decorated with fantastic bathrooms and extremely comfortable beds. The restaurant has a great range of delicious dishes and the hotel breakfast is excellent. (by C T) | Review 4: None - Great place very pleasant staff and great food. Can't wait to get back. (by Ken Hegan) | Review 5: None - We stayed at St. Kyrans over the weekend and from the time we arrived  it was amazing.  The staff were so friendly & helpful, the room was beautiful and the food was first class. There was a lovely atmosphere in St. Kyrans and we will definitely be back, can't wait.  noeleen kennedy (by Noeleen Kennedy) | Review 6: None - Thanks to all the staff for a wonderful evening. We were there to celebrate a 30th birthday. Food was fabulous. Even the young children with us eat everything they got. That says a lot about a place. Thanks again everyone. (by Marian Pakenham) | Review 7: None - Really good food.  The staff so friendly. amazing . (by Noeleen Mc Keown) | Review 8: None - ‚ù§very beautiful, clean and atmospheric place. unearthly care of the owners. feel that the staff takes care of every detail. very warm and family. I will definitely go back there more than once (by Kinga Ja) | Review 9: None - I can not recommend St Kyrans enough, eaten here a few times and every time it's the  same fantastic food and amazing service every time. The dinning room is cosy and welcoming making you want to return again and again. (by Becky East) | Review 10: None - Top class. Great food and excellent, very pleasant service.
Gone downhill I regret to say. The food is nothing like it used to be (by See Lon)

name: Hard Boiled Egg Cafe
address: Dublin Rd, Townparks, Cavan, H12 X5W5, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - What a lovely place to eat.  The food was fantastic.  The decor was amazing.  It gave a great atmosphere.  And to top it off, the staff are absolute gems.  The young man that served us was so polite, friendly and attentive.  I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a great place to eat out. I would normally pay ‚Ç¨3 because of how close I live and I‚Äôve attached a pic of their most recent menu with a copy of the recipe, you can clearly see on the menu the it‚Äôs ‚Ç¨3 yet they sneak the ‚Ç¨11 delivery charge on without saying anything??

name: Roadside Tavern Lisdoonvarna
address: Kincora Rd, Rathbaun, Lisdoonvarna, Co. Clare, V95 T85K, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - We stopped here for lunch on a Sunday afternoon and the food was absolutely fantastic! We had the goat cheese croquettes and salad, as well as their wagyu beef hamburger and a big bowl of their wonderful handmade soup with Irish brown bread and butter. Our food was fantastic! (by Mary Biancalana) [2 weeks ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - My friend and I stopped in here on a whim as we road tripped through the Irish countryside. And LET ME TELL YOU - 10 out of 10 experience. It was voted #1 seafood restaurant for 2025. I had 1/2 dozen oysters (amazing) and the the asparagus and mushroom tarte. Hit the spot like the best lunch in the mouth. Also had the local craft beer - it‚Äôs from the nano brewery on site, you can‚Äôt get it anywhere else. As a beer connoisseur, one of the best lagers I‚Äôve tried in a long time!! Plus the atmosphere is a quintessential pub, so gotta love that (by Chelsey Winchell) [a week ago] | Review 3: 4 stars - Popped in on what seemed to be a rare quiet Saturday lunchtime, and had 2 smalls dogs with us. They weren't able to serve food outside that day but welcomed us inside to the perfect corner with the dogs which we really appreciated as we were hungry after doing the Burren trail.

There was a stag in providing great entertainment but not rowdy and staff were very engaging with all customers throughout the time there.
Food was nice (risotto and chicken burger), chips/onion rings could do a with a little more cooking time. The local ale was sampled for good measure too. Would definitely recommend especially for the friendly staff. (by Karen Hopper) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Really nice bar staff. Table service was a bit slow side upstairs compared to main area but lovely staffs even though it was busy dinner time.
Foods are really nice. We had bunch of starters to have it like tapas style. Recommend all seafood dishes. Smoked salmon was better than anywhere else.
Highly recommend their own brewed beers rather than getting other drinks.
We tried gold and black and they were really good. Wish they have the bottle so that we could take home.
We went there every day and twice a day while staying in Lisdoonvarna. (by Eunju) [3 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - I recently had great meal at Roadside Tavern. Guinness pie and quinoa burger was our choices, which was excellent. Pie shell was flaky and buttery, chunky meat pieces were so tender that melted in your mouth. The sauce for potato mash was excellent as well. Cauliflower and quinoa burger was so good, the patty was yummy and the sauces with crunch fresh lettuce and tomato slices were excellent. Onion rings and french fries came with blue cheese sauce, which was the best.
The staff was very helpful and friendly, patient with my indecisiveness as well. It was overall great experience. (by J P) [5 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - This place is a must visit. Everything I ate there blew me away. We shared the scallops that were on special as an appetizer and they were amazing. Best fish and chips I've ever had. I tried a bite of the beef and stout pie and that was absolutely perfect as well. (by Joe Severino) [4 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Stumbled upon this place and I am so happy that I did!!! The food is amazing absolutely divine so flavoursome and the portions are good. The staff are so nice we asked questions about the brewery as they have some local craft beers and they were more then happy to help!! (by nicole mcguire) [2 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - One of the most stand out pubs & meals I‚Äôve had in a very long time in Europe.
Exceptional food (amazing chef), fantastic beer from the microbrewery upstairs, and lovely friendly staff.
Atmosphere was great too which made for a very relaxing & enjoyable meal.
Astro pub of the year in 2024 & Seafood pub of the year in 2025 üëèüëèüëè.
Already our personal recommendation has let to other bookings so give this place a try. You won‚Äôt be disappointed. (by David Wilson-Green) [3 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - I LOVED this pub & Andrew was THE BEST!! He was our first encounter of the trip of an Irish pub and a wealth of knowledge for a few tourists. He was adorable & made me dream of Irish pubs for awhile since being back home (by Rachel Engelhart) [4 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - The server was warm and friendly.  She gave us the specials and served us quickly.  Our food was delish!  The best French frys.  Husband loved their beer. (by Noanie) [4 months ago]

name: The Corner Stone Bar and Restaurant
address: Main St, Dough, Lahinch, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - The lady behind the bar was super nice, the server however had an attitude. I get it, I've worked customer service for 15+ years. You're in one of the most beautiful areas in the world, starting work midday. Relax. You have a good life.
We just came in quietly and placed an order but somehow we were a problem. The food was good and not pricey but after my hubs told me what the server said under her breath, we wont be back! Sept 16, 2024. (by A J (Lexi)) [2 weeks ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - had perhaps the best fish & chips of my life here? and the mussels were divine too. extremely friendly and hardworking staff. so happy we found this place after a long day‚Äôs journey. (by Taylor Maple) [5 days ago] | Review 3: 4 stars - I tried the fish and chips but lacked flavor, in my opinion. I did eat most of it, though. My husband had the beef stew, and he said it was delicious! The service was very friendly, and the establishment was cozy. It was a great experience for us when we visited during our trip. (by Janet Saucedo) [6 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - We stopped in for a bowl of soup and a Guinness and were very impressed.  The soup of the day was potato leek and it was hot and delicious.  It was served with a healthy serving of yummy soda bread.  The Guinness was tasty as usual.  Staff was kind and friendly.  Would recommend! (by Bill ~) [3 weeks ago] | Review 5: 2 stars - Of all the places we ate in Lahinch this is the only one we wouldn‚Äôt go back to. I had the soup which was fine, my husband had the fish & chips which he said was mushy and awful. It was breaded when really you would expect it to be in a nice light batter especially in a coastal restaurant, it seemed more like frozen fish. The restaurant was incredibly loud so we couldn‚Äôt leave fast enough and when we went to pay the server actually made a point of directing us to where the tip was and to let us know it was for him and in a very pushy way, unsurprisingly after that he didn‚Äôt get one anyway. (by Clare Mercer) [2 weeks ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Went here as had heard a lot about it and I was not disappointed. Food was excellent, lovely traditional bar at the front but the staff were exceptional, they just interacted with every one and every age group, excellent and highly recommend (by Padraig McGuire (BusManPaddy)) [3 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Very cozy restaurant/pub with a traditional Irish feel. We had beef stew and side salads - both were delicious. The beef stew was perfectly comforting after a chilly day in the wind. (by Lily Jamil) [4 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - The staff was lovely and the seafood chowder healed my soul. It's served with a whole basket of brown bread, and it's all delicious. I wanted to get something else on the menu, but I was too (pleasantly) full after the chowder to get more. (by Alycia Washington) [5 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Nice pub / restaurant in tourist resort town near cliffs of Moher and golf links. Nice homey and local atmosphere. Ordered fish and chips for 19 Euro. The service was a little slow, but acceptable because the establishment was basically full. You get a large amount of fish along with salad and two dipping sauces. Very filling meal and good on a cold and wet day. Note ‚Äî they do not accept split checks for parties. (by James Horsley) [8 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Delicious food, big portions, live music after 21:30 (by Saar Rachamim) [2 months ago]

name: Taminga Hotel
address: 302 Main N Rd, Clare SA 5453, Australia
reviews:
Review 1: 4 stars - Was driving through Claire with my mother and we decided to stop off at the Taminga Hotel for a feed given we have loved their food and service other times we have been out that way.
It was just our luck we stopped in on Seafood Sunday.
We were tossing up against a few of their menu items (menu looked amazing with lots of variety) but settled on the whiting - when I tell you it didn‚Äôt disappoint I mean it!

Thank you to the staff at the Taminga Hotel for your friendly service and delicious food! üòÅ (by Rebecca Bubicich) [a month ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - Grade 7 scotch was like fairy floss, young fella behind the counter was very friendly. Great food all round. Best steak I have had in Clare üíØ‚úäüèª (by James Furstenrecht) [a week ago] | Review 3: 4 stars - Great food the Greek Platter for two was delicious and the chef went out of his way to provide a gluten free option. Service was friendly and efficient. Would definitely come back (by John Gleeson) [a month ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Haven‚Äôt been here for a while but will definitely return - ordered the salmon special because I saw the video of new chef Lenny cooking it on their FB page - it was a very generous serve and spices were simply amazing.  My friend had S&P squid which was large, delicate and flavourful al The dining area is really welcoming too.  Absolutely recommend. (by Rosie van Heerde) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 1 star - Our first time since the new menu and new Chef
Wait time for meals: 40 to 50 minutes, mind you they weren‚Äôt very busy
Cost: Around $90
Our Order:
Scotch fillet, Medium Rare. Came over cooked on three occasions after being sent back.
Steak was like eating drywall and tasted as bland as their service.
The chips were very obviously re-fried multiple times and had chips from different batches based on how some were overcooked or undercooked.
The side of guacamole wasn‚Äôt even a guacamole (definition of guacamole: a dish of mashed avocado mixed with chopped onion, tomatoes, chilli peppers, and seasoning) instead we got mashed avocado with a jaw dropping amount of lemon

Wild Barramundi came over cooked, oily and dry all at the same time.

The side of truffle mash had no flavour of truffle or seasoning.

Waiting staff asked about the meal when taking our plates, and when I explained our experience, we were told I didn‚Äôt know what I was talking about and didn‚Äôt even listen to what we had to say, much rather just tried to start an argument. We were never rude and only spoke in a respectful manner.
As a Chef of more than 50 years experience I was insulted by the response I got from the senior staff member and would not recommend your food outlet to anyone. (by Glen Randall) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Came here a few times past owners ruined the taminga reputation as eating something as simple as a schnitzel was revolting... However the great new staff considerate and polite. The aussie parmi I had the other night was excellent with well salted chips and I will be coming back again (by Isaac _8) [a month ago] | Review 7: 4 stars - Nice place for a drink and some pool. We didn't eat here but definitely keen to give it a shot, regardless of all the bad reviews..
The pub itself inside and out definitely is the nicest in appearance and charm. (by Mick Micallef) [2 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - What a fabulous hidden gem!
I was so lucky I spotted this hotel on my way into Clare from Jamestown.  It's a pub on the main street. Right on a roundabout unfortunately so easy to miss when driving.
The adjoining restaurant is at the rear of the historic building and wow so bright and airy.
The modern menu coupled with house specialities sets this venue apart from the usual pub fare. I had the daily roast while my partner indulged in the crepe suzette! And to top it off the bill was below expected (by Geoffrey Renc) [2 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - We eaten there twice now the food is amazing.
The variety of meals is great.
The price is good. (by Paul Briggs) [a month ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - A few different bar options, good range of food options, spacious dining room.  Maybe book for dinner on Friday night. (by Rich Lawrence) [a week ago]

name: ƒ∞STANBUL Kebab & Grill Restaurant Takeaway
address: 1&2 River Lane, Parnell St, Clonroad Beg, Ennis, Co. Clare, V95 H398, Ireland
service_options: ƒ∞STANBUL Kebab & Grill Restaurant Takeaway, Actions for ƒ∞STANBUL Kebab & Grill Restaurant Takeaway, About ƒ∞STANBUL Kebab & Grill Restaurant Takeaway, Information for ƒ∞STANBUL Kebab & Grill Restaurant Takeaway, Popular times at ƒ∞STANBUL Kebab & Grill Restaurant Takeaway, Photos of ƒ∞STANBUL Kebab & Grill Restaurant Takeaway, Remix pizza and kebab ¬∑ 4.1 stars ¬∑ 54 reviews ¬∑ Pizza Delivery
reviews:
Review 1: 1 star - This used to be a great spot. However I'm not eating there anymore sense they charged me 45 euro for 3 plates of food. The amount of food for the price was shocking, my kids didn't even feel full. I asked if this really were the correct plates and not children meals, and was told ut was the right size. You could literally count the chips on the plate without moving them. 14 chips... and a tiny bit of meat. I felt scammed as I can get double that portion in limerick for a lower price. (by Fredrik Osterberg) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - YUMMY!
We had the mixed shish tray and one was enough for two people in our case. Really looking forward to go back and try more stuff! (by B√°rbara) [7 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - We'd been looking forward to dining at Istanbul Kebab & Grill as it's the only halal restaurant with seatings in Ennis. We came here twice that day. For lunch, my wife had a scrumptiously juicy & crunchy snack box meal ( 2-piece chicken, salad, chips & can drink, while I had a chunky half-quarter pounder. We also ordered the Turkish specialty coffee. For dinner we had a yummy mixed shish kebab. Fast service, we didn't have to wait long for our meals and friendly staff. Highly recommended! (by toft A) [Edited 2 years ago] | Review 4: 2 stars - Only half pounder burger is good. Rest everything is of average quality but at extremely high prices. Visited the restaurant at least 8-10 times. Not going anymore due to latest scam done by the cashier.
He lured us to order apparently 10 euro food. Which was actually 18 euros. The quality and taste of that particular item was not what i expected (by Mazhar Iqbal) [5 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Very tasty kebab. Always enjoy meal in here. (by Michal Pikalek) [3 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Best Kebab in the town! Very fast delivery. And great fresh grilled meat! ü§úü§õThx! (by Norbert Wlodarczyk) [Edited 2 years ago] | Review 7: 1 star - The most delicious food in the city. But, lads, be careful with home delivery, in my experience I never received my order in full, although everything was paid for. Once they didn't add chips, okay, the second time they didn't add mushrooms - they said that there were 2 portions in 1 bagü§î, okay, I didn't count, yesterday they didn't bring 2 portions of naan bread at all, when I called the first time - they said that it wasn't in the order, but it was, when I called the second time, they said that I didn't pay for itü§®, but everything is in the order and in the invoice and fully paid! And no sorry!üò† I'm just furious!!!üò° (by tatjana puskova) [7 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Best kebab shop in Ennis, value for money. Tastes very authentic, recommended. Quality meat and everything is very good. (by Saad Kazi) [5 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Great fresh food,  clean place, great atmosphere. the mixed wrap kebab coul use some more meat, there's barley any meat and filled with lots of vegetables. (by C P) [Edited 2 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - The food is absolutely incredible, so happy to have found halal food here! (by Nisha Mohamed) [a year ago]

name: Oar Restaurant & Rooms
reviews:
Review 1: None - The place was absolutely great ! The room was super clean, pretty with all the amenities you could expect. But what was the best was the person that welcomed us with great tips about the area and made us save about 30‚Ç¨ at the Cliff of Mohers & have an awesome time there with barely anyone around. It was magical and worthed waking up a bit early. Thanks a millions ! Hope we'll come back and try the food ! (by 3llie) | Review 2: None - We had a wonderful evening at The Oar in Doolin. The place is gorgeous, the wine list fantastic, and the food‚Ä¶ out of this world. Between the six of us we had nearly everything on the menu and loved it all. I had the summer salad, halibut and souffl√© - every bite was amazing. The staff couldn‚Äôt have been more attentive and friendly. Kieran came over to chat with us - he's warm and charming, and made the night even more memorable. He‚Äôs created something truly special here. (by Crist√≠n Duerinckx) | Review 3: None - The owner was lovely and the food was divine! We ordered the steak and the salmon. We were treated to fresh oysters as well. This was our 2nd Michelin Star dining experience (1st overseas) and it did not disappoint. Highly recommend! Worth the drive! (by Amy Shields) | Review 4: None - We recently returned for our second visit this year. First time was for the location, and outstanding accommodation.
But this time we just stayed to have dinner.

Absolutely FLAWLESS!!

Our only fault (if it could be a fault?l is that we were so full after two outstanding courses,  we had no room for dessert. A week later, I'm getting a terrible dose of "FOMO" (Fear of Missing Out).

A huge thank you to Kieran and your excellent staff, for looking after us so well.

See you soon. (by Tomas G. Kiely) | Review 5: None - Dined there last night - fantastic food and great staff. They even catered with some creative vegetarian dishes for us. Kieran Was super friendly, as were all the staff. Food was perfectly cooked and presented. Only regret was that I shouldn‚Äôt have driven as they have an excellent wine list! Highly recommended (by Mark Cunningham-Hill) | Review 6: None - Have eaten here on a few occasions. Kieran helps to set a relaxed atmosphere and Roxy was friendly, professional and mannerly.

The food is excellent. Whatever your taste it is catered for. If you are dining as a couple or as a larger group all are catered for. Whether the restaurant is full or empty on your visit, the standard is the same.

Highly recommended, excellent experience. (by Se√°n O'Riain) | Review 7: None - Beautiful little room with a view of the Cliffs of Moher. I did not realize the quality of the restaurant when I booked it and Kieran got us in due to a cancellation and we were blown away. The experience of booking this place and having dinner is truly one we‚Äôll remember for our entire lives. I would recommend this place in a heartbeat and book again if I‚Äôm ever in western Ireland again. But be smarter than me and book the restaurant in advance!! (by Natalie Osenbaugh) | Review 8: None - We celebrated a family members milestone birthday at Oar last night and couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better experience. Kieran and his team run an exceptional restaurant where every detail is clearly driven by passion and care. The food was fresh and outstanding (the salad starter is a must!), the service warm and attentive, and the atmosphere perfectly relaxed. It‚Äôs a place that values quality and genuinely cares about each guest‚Äôs experience. Oar fully deserves every award it‚Äôs received ‚Äì and then some. Highly recommended! (by Cameron Fahy) | Review 9: None - 5 star !! I had a wonderful experience at Oar. The food was delicious, fresh, and beautifully presented. The staff were friendly, attentive, and made us feel very welcome. The atmosphere was cozy and perfect for a relaxed meal. I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for quality food (thank you to Chef Sepo) and great service. I‚Äôm definitely coming back! (by Marlena Wi) | Review 10: None - Never stayed there, don't like the idea of no breakfast included or available.
But.....
Go for the dinner..... simply amazing.... it sounds expensive but when you experience it you'll realise what a steal your getting.
Eat here several times now and so far haven't got a bad dish.
Bad points... can be hard to hear yourself talk if the place is very busy. Parking not great so go early.
Waiting staff are brilliant, and chef must sit at the right hand of God..... amazing product. (by Mike Mc Grath)

name: La Strada Restaurant
address: 59 Parnell St, Clonroad Beg, Ennis, Co. Clare, V95 XF67, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Best Chicken Alfredo we'd ever had, HUGE portion of chicken. The server was kind, sweet and attentive. You won't be disappointed.  Good grub, great prices, nice atmosphere and AMAZING people! (by Jimmy and Nicole Hall) [4 months ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - I tried the rice paella at an Italian restaurant for the first time, and it turned out to be a good choice. Though it‚Äôs a Spanish dish, it was well-prepared and flavorful. The portion size was satisfying, and the price felt reasonable for the quantity. A nice experience overall! (by Fawaz Ahmed) [10 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Really lovely experience here, food was very good and the price is very reasonable, Defo worth the visit. The peppered chicken was really good, friends also had the pizza which was also very good. The staff were very courteous! (by Tony O'Brien) [a month ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Lovely food, really authentic.
Extremely friendly staff, lovely atmosphere and a nice location!
Would recommend (by Shane Kearney) [4 weeks ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Compliments to the chef!!! Ive ordered takaways from here many times off justeat and it never disappoints the food is amazing. If your looking for a healthy takeaway option i would recommend this restaurant for sure. (by Zero to Sixty Auto Valet Service) [a month ago] | Review 6: 4 stars - Came here to dine with friends. They had carbonara and I had margherita pizza. Their carbonara was ok. My pizza was dry and lacked sauce. Service was fine. House wine was acceptable but slightly overpriced. There wasn't much atmosphere as it was coming up to closing time. Might come back if in town to try something else. (by Samuel ‚Äúthe reviewer‚Äù Paulino) [Edited 2 years ago] | Review 7: 1 star - First time there, food was fine, at best. Place is like a work canteen & the service was the WORST I have ever experienced & I‚Äôm pretty old. My advice, go somewhere!! (by Brendan Doherty) [2 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Food was fresh and very good.  Easy to get to in downtown Ennis.  Lots of options on the menu.  We had a very nice dinner here. (by Paul Quella (PQ5876)) [3 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - The food is very good and With generous portions the staff was friendly and the price is ok not to spensive (by Pablo Sanz) [2 months ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - Bruschetta was great, got the La Strada pizza I was ok really bland could use some more flavor! Maybe some spices on the chicken. Service was excellent (by clayton petryshyn) [a year ago]

name: The Silver Oak Indian Restaurant
address: Wood Quay, Clonroad Beg, Ennis, Co. Clare, V95 EAP5, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Restaurant staff here were kind enough to accommodate us after our late arrival into Shannon airport and I can honestly say our visit to this restaurant was one of the highlights of our trip. The food was exceptional and the service we experienced in such a beautiful setting was second to none. Absolutely gorgeous restaurant. Cannot say enough good things about the food, the service and the wonderful staff and we‚Äôd say to anyone to make this restaurant a destination on a West of Ireland trip. (by Catherine The Grape) [4 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Finally found some good Indian food around this area. Excellent staff and great food. The gentleman at the reception and the kind lady serving us were great hosts. (Sorry could catch their names). They keep little lanterns to keep you food hot while you eat and that‚Äôs a great touch.
Loved the food!! (by Being Soham) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - ‚ÄúThis was my second visit to the restaurant, and I must say, it was just as delightful as the first time. The food was delicious and served with care, the staff were attentive and friendly, and the overall ambiance made the experience even more enjoyable. It‚Äôs clear that they maintain high standards consistently, and I‚Äôm already looking forward to my next visit!‚Äù (by Noman Abbasi) [2 weeks ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - The best Indian restaurant I have tried in Ennis so far. I love it!
I tried and loved chicken tikka massala, mahkani chicken tikka, the cashew rolls and bread ‚ù§Ô∏è (by Teresa Pezzi) [4 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - We‚Äôve been coming here regularly for the past few months and have never been disappointed. The service is always excellent and the food is divine. There‚Äôs a relaxed, calm atmosphere in the restaurant and we always enjoy our visits (by R√≥is√≠n Curran) [a month ago] | Review 6: 2 stars - Food was delicious, service was not.
After waiting a very long time to have our order taken and then receive our food, it took 3 requests to receive a carafe of water for the table. The final straw, however, was the lack of a chocolate mint when paying for our bill. Are we un-mint-worthy??? (by Siobhan Butler) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Me and my family went here for a meal, and everything was perfect. The food was beautiful, and the service was first class. The quality of food was amazing especially considering the price, super reasonable but  a high quality dining experience! Will definitely be back. (by Daisy C) [2 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Food was absolutely incredible and miles ahead of other restaurants in the Limerick area. Portion sizes could have easily fed 2 people with 1 main dish, and for very cheap as well. Staff were very friendly and chatted with us for multiple minutes about our experiences. Genuinely the best desi restaurant I have ever had, worlds apart from the typical curry houses you could find in the bigger cities ie Dublin. Nice and quite as well, not overwhelming or overstimulating, a quality place to eat, especially for desi families who wouldn‚Äôt eat out too much. (by veerpal kaur) [5 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Lovely staff and warm atmosphere.  Excellent food.  Butter chicken was the best I have had in years.  We will be back! (by Christine Alpiger-Sala) [a month ago] | Review 10: 1 star - Poor service.  2 had finished they starters before the 3rd got they'd. Food and drinks were bad. Sent some rice back as it was cold and hard. Still charged for the rice. 1 star for the food and serve is to much but the lowest score I could give. (by colin McDonald) [3 weeks ago]

name: Cafe 1871
address: 245A Main N Rd, Clare SA 5453, Australia
service_options: Just Julies Cafe Takeaway ¬∑ 4.4 stars ¬∑ 117 reviews ¬∑ Cafe
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - The staff are super friendly and made me feel welcome right away. The food was fresh, delicious, and clearly made with care. It‚Äôs a cozy spot with a nice atmosphere perfect for a casual meal or coffee break. Definitely recommend checking it out! (by Gayantha Withanage) [a week ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Breakfast was a standout from the roasted pumpkin and smashed avo in the build your breakfast to the doorstop with cheddar and bacon. Large coffees ordered and large coffees got! Can‚Äôt fault the service. A superb cafe in the heart of Clare! Well done to the those who make it happenüëèüëè (by Louise Vassil) [a week ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Great place to relax. Amazing food and best coffee.
Worth driving 100 km drive here to just having breakfast and coffee. Thanks Darcy and team.
Will back again some times. (by P Hundal) [3 weeks ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - My wife and I shared a Cheese Toastie with pickles and it was perfect. Coffee was great as well. Cannot fault this cafe. Would drive from Adelaide again just to eat and drink here (by Andrew Baker) [a month ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - This is an outstanding cafe. It cannot be faulted. The food is sublime, the service is attentive and the staff are warm, engaging and friendly. We had breakfast at the cafe. I could have licked my plate clean as it was a delight to eat. The freshly squeezed juice served in a tiki cup was fun. It was garnished with a candied dried orange lid that was also delicious. The metal straw was a nod to sustainability and beats a collapsable paper straw any day. Well done team. It was a wonderful experience to eat at your cafe. I highly recommend the ‚ÄòBuild a Brekkie‚Äô menu. It was great value for money. üçµ (by Shane Hancock) [7 months ago] | Review 6: 4 stars - Caf√© 1871 sits proudly on Clare‚Äôs main street, like a caf√© that knows it‚Äôs the place to be‚Äîand honestly, fair enough.

The breakfast? Solid. Eggs and bacon cooked just right‚Äîcrispy edges, fluffy insides, everything your hangover hoped for. But then there's The Sauce. Oh yes. A local hot sauce that clearly doubles as industrial paint stripper. It's as if Hades decided to grow his own chillies, wept into them, and bottled the result. One drop had me briefly reconsidering every life choice that led me to this plate.

To be clear: this is not your average ‚Äúooh, it‚Äôs a little spicy‚Äù situation. This is a tongue-melting, soul-evicting, ‚Äúdo I still have lips?‚Äù kind of heat. The locals treat it like a badge of honor. You? You have nothing to prove. Save your dignity. Keep your taste buds.

I also ordered a ‚Äúlarge‚Äù coffee. Now, in the city, that means an extra shot. In Clare, it means a bucket. Like, you could water a garden with it. Or bathe a small dog. That being said‚Äîit was Melbourne-level quality. Smooth, rich, no burnt aftertaste, and enough caffeine to give me Wi-Fi signal from the moon.

The service? Unbelievably efficient and charming. Like, ‚Äúhow do you remember all these orders and ask how my nan is?‚Äù kind of charming. Either they‚Äôre robots, or there‚Äôs some serious coffee-fueled wizardry happening behind the counter.

Pro tip: get there early or accept your fate in the queue of regret. This place is swarmed by locals for a reason. (by Rob) [4 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - I ordered Doorstop Bacon & Eggs with Sauerkraut but ended up receiving Jalapenos instead. wow, did it pack a punch and my taste buds were doing flip flops but it was delicious, thoroughly enjoyed it. Coffee was great and the staff very friendly. Thank you for a great breakfast. (by Della) [8 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Absolutely first class. Lovely mild coffee and a chocolate brownie sandwich with peanut butter and cream. OMG the calorie count must be huge but who cares. Presentation was excellent and it tasted delicious (by Dawn Hendrick) [4 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Such a lovely spot.

The food was delicious and plenty! The same goes for the coffee. Really great coffee (and we have a coffee snob in the family). The large latte was the biggest latte I‚Äôve ever seen!

The atmosphere and service were warm, welcoming and charming. (by Veronika Birnkammer) [2 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Awesome little Cafe. Fabulous coffee, lovely menu with great healthy options. The Granola with stewed fruit was out SO good. My photo does not do it justice. Staff were really switched on and understand good customer service. Highly recommend (by Alli Rooke) [a year ago]

name: Ennis Gourmet Store
address: 1 Barrack Court, Clonroad Beg, Ennis, Co. Clare, V95 VEY9, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - We were on our honeymoon and on our way to Galway when of course we got hungry. We came across this adorable shop in what appeared to be a hidden plaza. Tom served us. He was friendly and gave great local advice. The food was high quality and the ambiance was very pretty! We recommend this stop! (by Stacy Rivera) [2 years ago] | Review 2: 1 star - Waiter refused to give us the drinks menu and chose for us, without letting us know the prices. He almost took our plates before we were done eating, even though we ate quickly and the place was not crowded.
Food was OK, nothing less but nothing more. (by Logan B.) [a year ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Lovely place and people. Don't miss it as it's somewhat hidden around corners. We found it as we exited the public parking garage through a back door, otherwise we might have not found it .

Small cozy place, perfect atmosphere, great food for a snack or a full meal. Great prices too. (by Isidro Zoroza) [10 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - This place should be on everyone who visits western Ireland's itinerary. We came here on a recommendation from the house owner that we were staying in. The service was of the highest quality. They were able to recommend 2 great meals off of what we like. They gave us travel tips on where to visit which paid off in the end. The food was probably the best we had in Ireland. Highly recommended. (by Joseph Rineer) [7 years ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Charming little restaurant stuffed with all sorts of delightful products. Chatty host makes everyone feel welcome. Delicious food, pastries and desserts (by Conor McGarry) [3 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Little bit of Europe in the middle of little old Ennis ‚ô•Ô∏è (by Aisha Jedir) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Very small, quaint shop with tasty quiche and sandwiches, served with an assortment of little salads! (by Dan Silverman) [8 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - We stopped here on a night in Ennis. We were brought to Ennis partially to trace my partner's family roots and heritage. Several extremely kind people asked us what brought us in, and upon our answer they peppered us with questions and information about where to trace both of our roots. This was a lovely, moving experience for both of us. Additionally, the food was delicious and the owner and staff were exceptionally kind and provided speedy service, even on a very busy night. Would recommend this restaurant and shop to anyone passing through Ennis for any reason. The atmosphere was lovely and the food was great as well. 10/10! (by Devin Malanaphy) [2 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Always lovely coming here for coffee or a bite and meet owners Ann & David who are very warm and kind. Nice cosy atmosphere inside with a varied menu of tasty continental & Irish food. I love their turkey & brie sandwich, antipasti/cheese board and their deserts esp the meringue roulade are divine. They sell gorgeous gourmet food treats and gift hampers. Lovely sitting outside there in Summer, it feels a bit like France. (by Louisa Mc Mahon) [2 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - We stopped in for lunch and the owner overheard us talking about our plans for the day and was more accommodating than I could‚Äôve ever imagined. He recommended a hotel for us in the south of Ireland, called on the phone so that we would not pay the ‚Äúup charged‚Äù American price and provided us with countless other tips on travel to the south. He was an amazing ambassador for the country and for his restaurant which was also completely amazing. I‚Äôll never look at turkey and Brie the same way again. You can‚Äôt ever go wrong by stopping in to see him for a nice lunch. I can‚Äôt recommend it highly enough! (by Sheilah Rauh) [3 years ago]

name: Storehouse Restaurant
address: 18 Abbey St, Clonroad Beg, Ennis, Co. Clare, V95 AX83, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 3 stars - The steak looked white and pale and for medium rare had not a bit of pink inside. I asked for the garlic butter with my steak and what‚Äôs usually meant to come melted already came in a big blob and tasted of pure butter . It‚Äôs not hard to make onion rings or mushrooms edible but the potato gratin tasted like left over potato bake from the night before. Let‚Äôs get the basics right first and just served chips with the steak. The staff outside the kitchen were great through. (by Evan smith) [a year ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Had a fabulous meal here with my family last Friday, great options and the server was super friendly. The manager Se√°n was also really helpful via email when I had queries before booking a table. Definitely would recommend! (by Niamh Doyle) [6 years ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Lovely restaurant in the heart of Ennis. Food is always good every time we go there. Great choice & excellent food to match. (by Declan Mc Naboe) [6 years ago] | Review 4: 4 stars - Excellent restaurant handily located upstairs over the very good Knox's Bar. Friendly and professional. One of the best spots on the town. (by tom√°s conneely) [Edited 6 years ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - I love steak here, the best in Ennis. (by Hoang Chi Mai) [6 years ago] | Review 6: 4 stars - Great food with friendly staff. (by Robert McNally (Falconire)) [4 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Fun and local music (by Gerald Sandoz) [2 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Is closed (by Maite Rozada) [4 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - With the reputation of serving the best steaks in town, we came here.

Four steaks (and a burger) later, we're full and satisfied. Whether these are truly the best ‚Äì we don't have a comparison. But it would certainly be difficult to find anything comparable. 100% recommendation! (by Jo Br√∂) [6 years ago] | Review 10: 3 stars - Good products that are unfortunately not implemented well But nice service (by Lothar F√§nger) [7 years ago]

name: Barrtr√° Seafood Restaurant
address: Barrtr√°, Lahinch, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - The environment is very good.
Feel like having lunch home.
The waitress is lovely, I mean it, lovely!
She explains the menu clearly and she‚Äôs patience. Unfortunately we don‚Äôt have lunch alcohol habit, otherwise we could have some drinks and try out the different life style.
Foods, great. We all have our plate emptied!

Recommended. (by Louis Yu) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - This place truly stole my heart! üíï The service was so warm and friendly. And the food‚Ä¶ oh, the food! I had the best lobster and mussels of my life here ‚Äî fresh, perfectly cooked, and absolutely unforgettable. A hidden gem I‚Äôll be dreaming about until my next visit! ü¶û‚ú® Thank you! (by Maria Dukhina) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - One of the best seafood restaurants have ever been to, highlight of the trip so far and would highly recommend for anyone staying in the area!
We had a mix of the seafood surprise menu (which is a surprise!) and the a la carte, all of which were excellent. Really well thought out flavours, and the seafood was all cooked to perfection.
Staff were very friendly and attentive.
Wonderful view, relaxed atmosphere and feels quite understated letting the food do all the talking. Thank you for a brilliant evening! (by Liddy Ellis) [a year ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Love this place, super food nice low key relaxed atmosphere great service from the friendly staff. Visited for my birthday with my wife, had a super experience, went for the surprise seafood menu and it was fantastic. Felt like I got looked after personally but the chiefs choices of course. All the food tasted great, excellent presentation and verified complementary flavours. Would recommend and will be going back as soon as I can. (by James White) [Edited a year ago] | Review 5: 3 stars - The food was nice but I had to order a side dish with my main dish otherwise I would be still hungry. It happened before when I order fish. The fish was small and had to order vegetables separately. I was still hungry after. The atmosphere and staff are nice. I think a bit over priced for what you are getting. That just me. (by benevolence smith) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - I have been thinking about this restaurant and its amazing Irish brown bread since coming here in 2018 with a tour group. So when my husband and I planned our Ireland trip for this year, I knew we had to go back. Our seafood surprise dinner did not disappoint! Each course was fabulous and delicious - our favorite meal of the whole trip. Love that the chef incorporates seasonal produce from the garden. The sunset view was spectacular as well! (As were the adorable neighbor cows!) The waiter who took our order suggested that we order sides as he said the portions were small, however we didn‚Äôt think sides were needed - the five courses felt appropriately sized to us. Service was slow between courses, so just allow time to not be in a rush. (by D. S.) [2 years ago] | Review 7: 4 stars - Wonderful food, great service, incredible views. We had the place to ourselves from 6pm to 7pm, felt like a reserved experience. Sea Food Surprise dish ended up being ‚Ç¨60, but was worth it for the presentation. (by Ryan Thompson) [a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Had an amazing lunch, the oysters were fresh and the atmosphere very welcoming and friendly. I will dream about the house bread. (by Anna Horvath) [a month ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Best Food Restaurant of the West
We had such a wonderful experience here. I would recommend the surprise menu.....its such a unique experience of fresh food and the range of courses was just superb. Michelin standard just out side Lahinch and Miltown Malbay. Great service, ambience and food. Love this place. Going to go back in 3 weeks. (by Ray O Brien Technologies) [a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - A lovely family run restaurant hidden in the country side with the charms of a nice view on the coast and flowery garden to enjoy. The food is absolutely delicious and made with care. Take a small side road from the N67 and you will not be sorry. Irish hospitality at its best. (by Mieke Zwart) [2 months ago]

name: üåüHassetts/Le Ch√©ile
address: Barefield Or Gortlumman, Barefield, Co. Clare, V95 YX37, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 3 stars - Nice atmosphere and friendly staff. The lamb special was delicious! ...very tender lamb, veg and mash were nice along with gravy. The club sandwich wasn't great and the string chips were soft and greasy. Coffee was good. Had the  cookies tasted ok - seemed a few days old as they were soft because the chocolate bar on top was stale. A bit overpriced for what we got. Overall, I would go back just for dinner and the coffee. (by Lauren King) [a year ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - We arrived after 4pm on a Sunday after a cycle. It was our own fault that we didn't go earlier as their main specials and desserts were gone. No fault in the food we ordered, everything was delicious, friendly staff and nice atmosphere.  One thing that does come to mind was that there were a lot of flies in the dining area. Probably due to the doors opening but it was a turn off while eating. Cant wait to go back (at an earlier time). (by Aoibheann H) [3 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - First time there and was worried as it was very busy, but staff were excellent, food fast and tasty. (by Paschal Whyte) [a week ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - This is a savage spot for food and beverages, I would also like to thank the owners and Especially Eamon for his hospitality and just to say the new stove is fabulous looking. (by Darren Roberts) [10 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - We had a beautiful lunch. Great service. We will visit again when we are in the area. (by Katarina Hruskova) [2 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Excellent friendly Staff and the food was great.  Nice busy atmosphere (by Deirdre Burchell) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Love the homely, welcoming atmosphere. Staff were SO accommodating re my 8 year old's very specific dietary needs. My children loved it the food! I had fish cakes and they were perfect for lunch. (by Cari Gleeson) [7 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Wonderful caf√©. Great food and atmosphere. Definitely worth a visit. The avocado, egg and black pudding dish was delicious. Will definitely be returning. (by Mairead) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - First time here very happy with everything, we had pancakes and smashed avocado on sourdough. Delicious food excellent service. Will definitely be back üòä (by Joan McAllen) [Edited a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - We stopped here for breakfast on our way from Galway to Limerick, and what a nice and cozy place it is‚Äîboth inside and out! They even have outdoor dining under a roof, which I found really lovely.

The staff were very friendly, and our server, Line, made sure we got our food quickly and exactly as we ordered.

I highly recommend this place! (by iPcrash) [8 months ago]

name: Old Ground Hotel Ennis
reviews:
Review 1: None - Once again, I brought my bus tour consisting of 59 people  to the fabulous Old Ground Hotel for the last night of our musical tour around Ireland.  If you don't know, the Old Ground is THE place to stay in Ennis and one of the finest ‚Ä¶ (by pearllodea) | Review 2: None - I was here as part of a tour group. So glad our tour started at The Old Ground hotel as it set the tone for a beautiful start to our tour. The hotel is beautiful. The location is great and the rooms very  clean comfortable. The hotel and ‚Ä¶ (by beach_7864) | Review 3: None - Lovely hotel - very "old world" style.  The staff are super friendly and helpful.  I had a very nice quiet room on the 4th floor and was provided with a small fridge.  Very nice view of the garden in the back and the church across the ‚Ä¶ (by 191marthes) | Review 4: None - Great hotel. Main elevators were not operating due to a part. The hotel allowed the service elevator to be used which was a big help. Food is amazing.  The lamb chops were one of the best I have ever had. Tender, lots of flavor and paired with mashed potatoes. The Poets Corner offers Pub food and has trad sessions. We enjoyed our stay and hope to return. (by Joseph McClash) | Review 5: None - This afternoon checked into this beautiful establishment and as in all of Ireland we were warmly greeted. But, the Old Ground went 2 step above! At check in I was told that I was upgraded to a Jr suite...what a beautiful pleasant surprise. The room was beautifully decorated with fine linens and tapestry..the bathroom ...well beyond expectations. Centrally located with a charming dynamic pub...make this place your home away from home when in Ireland. (by patricia delorey) | Review 6: None - We spent a week in Ennis earlier this month and stayed at the Old Ground.
Its location is perfect in town centre. Walkable distance from most attractions, including a lovely beauty salon just cross the road (Beautique).
The service is professional and friendly, at the reception and in the restaurant/bar. The poet's corner is great to relax after an excursion, to meet friend or to enjoy quality time with family. The food is good and good value.
My partner forgot a hanger with a jacket. We called the hotel reception, they took our details and a few days later, the jacket was home. The address tags on the packaging had been typed on a computer in big letters, telling a lot about their attention to detail.
The rooms are nice, very clean however, in our room the bathroom just had a big bathtub with a shower inside (working perfectly). We didn't mind but someone with limited mobility could find it hard to access the shower.
We were in the 229, room on O'Connell street. The night is calm but in the morning on week days a council cleaning car is beeping shortly after 8.
Last but not least, the staff includes a lovely cat very friendly with guests.
Enjoy! (by Agn√®s Verrelle) | Review 7: None - If you're in search of exceptional luxury accommodations in Ennis, Ireland, look no further than the Old Ground Hotel. Our arrival coincided with a grand wedding, but the staff went above and beyond, ensuring our room was ready well before ‚Ä¶ (by davecookthetravelguy) | Review 8: None - We stay here last week on holiday for a wonderful three nights!!!!
The location of the hotel is perfect to explore the sights and shops in Ennis---and is great to use as a base to see the Cliffs of Mohr, Doolin and to the south--Limerick and Bunratty.
The rooms were very very nice---and the service was fantastic!!
One of the highlights was our dining experienca at the hotel...The The Town Hall Restaurant was better than Fantastic---the food was delicious and the service was professional and very SPECIAL ( please pass on our SINCERE thanks to both Natalia--she was TERRIFIC --- and also to Grace who was very accommadating).
ALL AROUND-----A real 5 star experience!!! (by Michael Brennan) | Review 9: None - 3rd time here,  gets booked out very quickly so take your chance when you can. Lovely hotel in the centre of Ennis town, rooms large, clean and very comfortable. Kettle and coffee machine,  safe and plenty of storage. Bathroom with bath and shower in. Staff always very friendly and helpful. Had dinner outside I the garden as the weather was lovely. (by Peter Burns) | Review 10: None - We recently celebrated my grandmother‚Äôs 90th birthday at the Old Ground Hotel and were blown away by the exceptional service. The private function room was perfect, and the staff went above and beyond to make the night special.||A special ‚Ä¶ (by MeadhbhSlattery)

name: Carrygerry Country House
reviews:
Review 1: None - Overall we had a good one night stay. The food is nicely prepared and presented.  There is a bar for pre dinner drinks and a nice restaurant area. Breakfast was very good. All the staff we met were very helpful and friendly and the hotel ‚Ä¶ (by 666JimM) | Review 2: None - This is a very welcoming place in a beautiful location, close to Shannon airport and in easy reach of several notable beauty spots on the West coast of Ireland. It serves an excellent breakfast. ||We stayed one night in a courtyard room. ‚Ä¶ (by R8633EAfionat) | Review 3: None - My birthday celebration at Carrygerry Country House on the 26th of July was a brilliant experience much enjoyed by my cousin and partner.  The setting and atmosphere in the Hotel is wonderful exceeded only by the warm welcome and brilliant ‚Ä¶ (by U6992VMdennisw) | Review 4: None - We came into Shannon 2 days before meeting up with a tour group in Limerick and stayed here and are so glad we did!  From the moment we stepped into the front door, we were greeted with utmost hospitality.  Our room wasn‚Äôt quite ready, so ‚Ä¶ (by lisabA2846VV) | Review 5: None - Disconnect between the restaurant and the hotel rooms. (Restaurant was very good)|We were in the Hawthorn room - a standard room- it felt dirty; furniture felt sticky; bed with noticeably sagged in the middle; furniture was old and beat up. ‚Ä¶ (by bennywho) | Review 6: None - Exceptional hospitality as my partner got stranded by Ryanair at Shannon airport late in the evening and this lovely country house answered the phone and graciously made arrangements for the 1 room they had left for him to stay, even when ‚Ä¶ (by emmapO6207QB) | Review 7: None - Beautiful place to stay and very close to the excellent Shannon airport.  Staff did a nice job, the rooms are comfortable and clean.  It's an old historic house so it needs a few updates in the bathroom.  All in all, it's a very nice place to stay with really nice food, parking and grounds. (by karsamdad) | Review 8: None - We had the most lovely stay at Carrygerry. The house and location are just beautiful, and the staff were all so kind, warm, and friendly. Everything was very clean, and the FOOD - absolutely delicious! The strawberry jam made in house was so delicious, I had to bring a jar home (they also sell their own jams and chutneys!). We were in the Orchard room, and the bed was very comfy. The en suite bathroom was very clean and included some small toiletries. There were also radiators in both the bathroom and bedroom in case you needed some warmth, as well as a courtesy hairdryer, tabletop fan, and alarm clock. I loved all the old charm in the decor, and everything seemed lovingly maintained. Would absolutely recommend and I would definitely stay here again if we come back to Ireland! (by Elizabeth Lian) | Review 9: None - For a one night stay over we loved Carrygerry. A really great and welcoming experience! The restaurant was a special treat! Food delicious and marvellous service! (by Mim) | Review 10: None - The Perfect Wedding at Carrygerry Country House

Wehad our wedding at Carrygerry Country House in September 2024 , and it was everything we had hoped for and more. From the moment we first visited, we knew it was the right place‚Äîfull of charm, warmth, and character.

Gillian was simply outstanding. Her professionalism, calm nature, and incredible attention to detail made the entire planning process feel effortless. She was always available to answer questions, offer advice, and make sure every little detail was just right. On the day itself, she ensured everything ran like clockwork so we could truly relax and enjoy every moment.

The food was a real highlight. Chef Niall created a menu that was absolutely phenomenal‚Äîbeautifully presented, full of flavour, and made with the freshest ingredients. Our guests are still talking about how amazing the meal was, with many saying it was the best wedding food they‚Äôve ever had.

The venue itself is stunning, with a cosy, intimate atmosphere and beautiful views of the surrounding countryside. The staff were friendly, attentive, and genuinely cared about making the day special for us and our guests.

We honestly couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better experience. If you're looking for a wedding venue that combines elegance, exceptional service, and unforgettable food, Carrygerry Country House is the one. We‚Äôll be forever grateful to Gillian, Niall, and the entire team for making our day so perfect.

Davitt and Susan (by Davitt Connolly)

name: Keogh's Restaurant Kinvara
address: Main St, Kinvarra, Co. Galway, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - The food was absolutely amazing and they give you giant portions for very good prices! I got the veggie omelette with the brown bread and a baileys and coffee. My family members got the breakfast bap, the regular omelette and the full Irish and we were all blown away by how tasty all of it was. The scone that comes with the full Irish was delicious and we recommend eating it with the jam and the cream on top. Our server Nichola (might be spelling that wrong sorry) was SO wonderful and gave us great recommendations on where to stop in town and cool sights to see. Overall was just a great experience and we will definitely be stopping there again if we ever find ourselves back in Kinvara:) (by Samantha Nolan) [3 weeks ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Great place with cozy atmosphere and very friendly service:) Seafood chowder is a must! Very tasty fish&chips and calmari. Portions are really solid and prices are affordable. (by Joanna So≈Çtys) [4 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Was there. Had coffee. I was sitting outside. The waitress was there. She was friendly. I got extra sugar. The sugar was sweet. Too much sugar is bad for your health. The coffee was good. A group of tourists came. I think they liked it. My time was up. I left. Goodbye. (by Alexander SpecLED) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Good food here? You bet. Today took us to Keogh‚Äôs restaurant in Kinvarra. I ate the best BBQ pork sandwich I ever had outside of America. The sandwich was had a lightly toasted panini with a slice of mental on top of a large portion of pulled pork BBQ. The serving was so large, I brought half of it back to our AirBnB. See for yourself. (by Gail Suratt Davis) [4 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Great varied selection of breakfasts and similarly have extensive day/evening menus with specials also! Staff are very sound and attentive. Would highly recommend if visiting/around Kinvara! (by Sean Kelly) [3 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Nice dinner experience. Good Pub food. We enjoyed it. And they offer gluten free dishes, like Pizza with glutenfree dough! (by Jochen Klink) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 3 stars - I used to love Keogh's, but hadn't been here for about 12 years. I visited recently and wasn't impressed. It has (apparently) changed from a pub into a cafe/restaurant but the layout inside is unchanged, with a bar in the front of the building.
I was seated at a table in the bar room, and ordered food and a drink. The room had a musty smell, and the floor was a bit sticky. It just wasn't very inviting. The staff were friendly enough but didn't engage in any conversation.
The food was underwhelming. Edible but not enjoyable. My Coke was almost flat and just cool, not chilled.
It was sad really. Keogh's used to be a lively pub serving good food, so it was really disappointing to see what it has become. It's a prime location in a major tourist attraction and there's not much competition in Kinvara unless you like seafood. It really should be a little gold mine... (by Simon James Dean) [a month ago] | Review 8: 2 stars - Struggling to understand the good reviews here. The chowder was watery and tasted like it was from a can. The fish was good but the peas were watery and tasted like they were also from a can. The salmon was definitely not fresh. The steak sandwich was decent but overpriced for what it was. Very basic, steak, mushroom and onions in a ciabatta with chips.

Service was slow and the food we waited so long for was well below par. It makes me believe some of the other reviews are not real.

Proceed with caution (by James Condon) [a month ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - This place serves the best food around. We both enjoyed the delicious cod meal with creamy mash and vegies. The fish was firm and tasty and the sides were generous and wonderful. If you're staying in beautiful Kinvara, this is the place for dinner! (by Robyn Brock) [a month ago] | Review 10: 1 star - A less than pleasant experience this evening. 2/3 of us left hungry as we watched tables around us served their meals-same food one of us ordered. Brought a main meal for one the same time as the started for another. Waited 45 minutes and were told after we asked where our meals were that there was one table ahead of us ( that table came 20 minutes after us) We just left. (by Eileen Burke) [3 months ago]

name: Jade Cottage Chinese Restaurant
address: Unit 3/4, Roslevan Shopping Centre, Tulla Rd, Rosslevan, Ennis, Co. Clare, V95 HT63, Ireland
reviews: Review 1: 4 stars - Food very good especially the duck pancake starter. Huge portions and early bird menu excellent value for money (by SlimeQueen47) [3 years ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - Very clean! Friendly staff and the food is good. A little pricey but the portions are generous. (by Crs Ni Mhaoldomnaigh) [5 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Always a great welcome when you arrive here. Girls are so friendly and helpful. Food is delicious and I must say very generous portions indeed. And a great selection of Chinese food also. Definitely worth a visit (by Monica Cassidy) [8 months ago] | Review 4: 1 star - Food quality dropped dramatically over last year or more, and it feels like a difference chef cooking  food, just not the same. Something changed  not ordering again üòï (by Coded Pipe Welder TIG ORBITAL MIG MMA) [Edited 5 months ago] | Review 5: 4 stars - The house special was supposed to be a variety of meats ( please see photos) the food is good. (by AEGV V) [2 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Lovely  meal and friendly staff (by Elaine Sturt) [2 weeks ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Just went in for a meal with my 8 year old. We were going to be given two seats by the entrance and when I asked for somewhere warmer, we were brought to a booth. Very friendly staff. Got a veggie hot pot, delicious. (by John Lee) [a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - All I ever had here was the hot and sour soup. It was the best I have ever had. (by William Stanners) [6 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Delicious crispy duck and a lovely chicken dish to follow. (by Valerie Broom) [3 months ago] | Review 10: 1 star - Terrible Terrible food never again will I order from here never again (by Joe) [5 months ago]

name: The River Run Bar and restaurant
address: Main Street, Mountshannon, Co. Clare, V94 A894, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - I love this place. I come in every year on my hollidays.The food is consistently good, the staff friendly and very helpful and accommodating with allergies. Along with the beautiful setting what more could you ask for? (by Di–∞n–∞ –úull–µr) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Food, service and staff = 10 stars. Only problem we had - we didn't want to leave ü´£ thanks so much for everything. Top class üëç we will be back. Thank you (by Louise O'Sullivan) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Best lunch I had in Clare in a while. Extremely tasty and well done, with care. The staff is really nice and fast. Totally worth it (by Sarah Galeone Matarazzo) [3 years ago] | Review 4: 3 stars - If you want a place with a poor selection of drinks and empty shelves then this is the place. (by Alan Cremin) [3 months ago] | Review 6: 4 stars - Great place in the neighbourhood but unfortunately have not yet tried the food as we always have our dog with us and the outdoor area does not allow dogs .. the sign is big enough to warn anyone off! üòÇ I don‚Äôt understand why Mountshannon is so unwelcoming to dogs. I really hope they reconsider and we would support this business. (by Emma) [Edited 3 months ago] | Review 7: 1 star - Probably the worst food that I've eaten in a very long time. I got the fish & chips it was all batter with very little fish and hard. It was like a reheated meal. (by Damian Mulvey) [2 months ago] | Review 8: 4 stars - Irish sprtsbar & restaurant
Very friendly staff - very good homemade food (by Marion Rockstroh-Kruft) [2 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - What a gem. Have eaten there 15 or 20 times over the last 4 years and every single time, the food has been top class. Extremely fresh and piping hot. Lovely vibe in there as well and Geraldine, Joan and the team are always very warm and welcoming. The place is a credit to ye. We were treated to a free desert on our last visit to say congratulations on the birth of our daughter, a really nice touch. You would have to travel a fair distance to beat the service and quality on show here. (by Eamonn Torpey) [2 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Got off the boat in the harbor and brought the family for dinner.
The pub had a lovely old but new feel to it. There was a lovely menu to choose from and the food was absolutely amazing.  Out of the six of us that ate there the plates went back with nothing on them..üòÅ  would highly recommend it ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è (by Kim Heavin) [a year ago]

name: The Locke Bar
address: 3 George's Quay, Englishtown, Limerick, V94 K8KX, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 4 stars - This is a great spot to go for a local taste of Limerick. You can tell it's been around for a while and it's not too far from King John's Castle. We stopped in to get a small bite and found a cozy table inside. It's very pub-like but family friendly. The service was friendly and helped us to order since we were a little undecided. We ended up getting the Burata di Bufala, seafood chowder, and some chicken wings. Everything was about what you'd expect from a Sunday lunch menu at a pub. It didn't blow us away but it hit the spot and we got to soak in the Limerick atmosphere while we ate. I wish we could have come back in the evening to experience the more night-life version of this place because it seems very cool! Maybe we'll plan to do that next time we're in town. Sl√°inte! (by Geoffrey Holtsclaw) [a week ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Had a great meal at the Locke Bar last night. Servings are plentiful, I had the steak and ale
pie. It was delicious. My partner had the special fish. It was cod with a spicy sauce, a salad and roast potatoes. Really flavoursome. Great selection of drinks, all the beers you could want.
The atmosphere was excellent. Irish music and dancing. Good tip if you want to eat on a Saturday evening, go fairly early or make a booking. By 8 o‚Äôclock, the place is bulging.
