(by Michael McInerheney) [2 weeks ago] | Review 3: 4 stars - The Locke Bar has plenty of seating both inside and outside. If you want to sit indoors with a view of the Irish dancing, I highly recommend making a reservation several days in advance, as they don‚Äôt accept bookings within 24 hours. They offer plenty of Irish beer on tap, which pairs perfectly with their dishes. I ordered the fish and chips, which came out hot, crunchy, and fresh. It was served with something green ‚Äî I thought it was mashed avocado, but it turned out to be mashed green peas, which was surprisingly good. The people were pleasant and welcoming, though the service was a bit slow. Prices are on the higher side. (by Yuki) [a month ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - We really enjoyed the hour we spent today on a wet, gray mid-September afternoon having a cuppa and a ham sandwich at the outside tables of Locke Bar. The tea was just as tea should be ‚Äî strong enough to trot a mouse across it, as the Irish used to day. And the sandwiches were well-made and generous.

In addition, the young woman who greeted us inside at the bar and took our order couldn't have been nicer, and the woman who brought our tea and sandwiches to us was equally cordial and smiling. The interior of Locke Bar is classic pub, dark, lots of beautiful woodwork, gleaming spigots for dispensing Guiness and other beers. Altogether a first-rate pub in the heart of Limerick's old city. (by William Lindsey) [2 weeks ago] | Review 5: 3 stars - The Locke is a great spot to relax with a few drinks lovely atmosphere and a nice place to sit by the river.

The food, however, was just okay. For the prices they charge, I expected something a bit more refined.

I wouldn‚Äôt recommend the beef nachos‚Äîthey tasted off, and the cheese had a sour flavor that was quite unpleasant.

The staff are nice, the girl that served us was so nice and happy to help with what ever we wanted.

The bar was very busy so it was quite difficult to try get served, no real structure to the queue. (by Geoff Hassett) [5 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - We got off the plane about 3 hours ago. First time to Ireland and this is the place we came to eat after traveling 17 hours. I ordered the Steak and Ale. My wife had the fish tacos and my son had the chicken burger. I didn't try the chicken burger. He inhaled that thing so it must've been good. My dinner was absolutely incredible. The mushy peas were really good, too. One of the best dishes I've ever had. My wife and son even ate some of mine. Her fish tacos were very good as well. Love the atmosphere and very friendly staff. Do not miss this restaurant! (by Bryan Hood) [6 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - The Liscannor chowder is excellent and my son really liked the cheese burger with caramelized red onion. Being able to sit outside beside the river is great on sunny days. The service was also friendly and efficient. If you are sitting inside I recommend getting a table in the old part of the pub (on the right) if possible. (by John Ryan) [a month ago] | Review 8: 4 stars - Food was better another time we recently went mid week when it was slower and I had family staying from America. We went for the music. Service was great and food was good too but I think it was better another time when it was busier. I had the steak and ale pie and family had the fish dinners and it was very good. (by Mantzy Vlogs) [a month ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - I stopped in for an early dinner and it was already busy. If you choose to sit outside, you have to tell the hostess which table you‚Äôre at so they know where to send the food. Inside though, a server comes to your table. I got a table inside and enjoyed the live music.

The cocktails were pricy, so I went with an IPA. The fish and chips were fantastic. The breading was perfect, the dipping sauce was the best tartar I‚Äôve ever had, and even the mushy peas were the best I‚Äôve ever had. I would definitely come here again for dinner, or late night beers with a group.

A beer and fish & chips cost $31/¬£22.85/‚Ç¨26.54 (by Lesley Longstreth) [2 months ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - Fish tacos and fries were good. The live music added a great atmosphere and made the evening enjoyable. However, we did have to wait quite a bit to be served. Overall, a solid spot for tasty food and lively Irish music. (by Santosh D√∂nmez) [4 months ago]

name: Deerfields Restaurant
address: Inn At, Dromoland, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews: Review 1: 3 stars - This place feels like it is out of a generic 60s British hotel. The breakfast buffet is perfectly adequate but the staff are great. (by David Jarvis) [a year ago]

name: Glas Restaurant
address: Glas Restaurant Hotel, Rivervale, Doolin, Co. Clare, V95 DE2X, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - We booked Glas Restaurant for our rehearsal meal the evening before our wedding in Doolin. Our guest list for the evening was made up of 31 people which the restaurant accommodated without issue. We had a private room available to us and felt like the evening was relaxed and without pressure to hurry through things.

The food was EXCELLENT. As an international bride I had no ability to try the local restaurants in advance of our day and had to book everything hoping things would work out. Wow. Did things ever turn out. The menu was wonderful and accommodated our guests with food allergies/intolerances. The service staff were amazing to our group and very friendly.

I couldn‚Äôt have imagine a more perfect evening for the night before our wedding. Thank you to the Niahm for answering all of my emails (which was a lot) - you went above and beyond to make this happen for us. (by Pippa Girling) [3 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - This was our favourite food experience in Doolin and one of our tastiest meals all year. The menu is focused around great quality produce, locally sourced, and at very reasonable prices. We opted for the vichyssoise and oysters to start and both were delicious. The monkfish and lamb mains were the show stoppers though - we wiped the plates clean with the leftover bread (which was another winner!) from the start of our meal. The servers were extremely friendly and attentive. Everything was 5*. It was a cut above any of the other dining experiences in Doolin. (by Barry Gallagher) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - TL;DR: good food, great service

I did a cliff walk from the Hags Head tower, along the Cliffs of Moher and into Doolin. By the time I arrived I was hungry and I wandered into Glas. It was a bit fancier than I expected, but I knew I didn't want pizza so I gave it a try. The room is beautifully decorated, with candlelit tables adding to the ambiance -- it would definitely be appropriate for a nice date night, but I was a dirty, tired solo traveler and they didn't mind at all when I asked for a table for one. I ordered the scallops and the mussels, both of which were sourced from the Galway Bay. The food was amazing and the bowl of mussels was huge. I also had one of their signature cocktails which I can't remember the name of but it was delicious. The staff were all polite and attentive.

The best thing about my dining experience there, however, was Nikolas the waiter, who told me that he recognized another solo traveler and made sure I was comfortable and had a bit of extra gin in my cocktail -- he could tell I needed it! When I left he sent me on my way with some warm bread that had just come out of the oven. I would have loved to stay and chat about travel some more but I had to rush to catch the bus -- and the fresh bread made the bus ride much more pleasant! If you want to have a nice date night come here, but if you're traveling and tired and hungry, DEFINITELY come here and ask for Nikolas. (by Angie Cosey) [a year ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Food and service was incredible! We had tapas and breakfast here and we were completely blown away by how amazing everything was! Would definitively recommend this place (by Ryan Holley) [10 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Amazing place!
My friends were visiting from Dublin and we couldn‚Äôt have picked a better place to celebrate my birthday. The food is gorgeous, staff are amazing and the restaurant looks incredible.
Thanks for having us ‚ú®ü•∞ (by Mariany McNamara) [8 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - OUT OF THIS WORLD! The whole menu comes from within 30 Miles. Yep‚Ä¶48km.

For those who follow‚Ä¶You know I never just give 5-Stars to a first time visit. It takes a few to get those. WOW!

From the veggies to the beef, fish, and more. Super fresh.

Seriously the best meal we have had in Ireland üáÆüá™.

Basically it is swarm waiting, tapas, and share plates. We had everything we could.
- Oysters
- Steak
- Carrots‚Ä¶the BEST, like eating a steak. Charred and cooked awesome.
- Salads.
- Charcuterie board
- and the list goes on.

From the drinks to the delivery of every dish and service, it is worth every dollar for the experience. (by J. Jordan) [a year ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Delicious breakfast and friendly service. Highly recommended. We had egg benedicts & full irish breakfast. (by Shyeen Fong) [8 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - It was incredible. Food was great, service outstanding. Best Pork Belly I had in the world and the Beef was outstanding too. (by Andr√© Zenklusen) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Great restaurant! The 30mile menu was incredibly good - on Michelin-Level! Very nice people with a lot of skill and enthusiasm (by Philipp Kobi) [a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - I had an amazing dining experience at Glas Restaurant in Hotel Doolin. Their ‚Äú30-Mile Tapas‚Äù concept, using all locally sourced ingredients, is brilliant. The dishes were beautifully prepared and packed with flavor.

The atmosphere was cozy yet elegant, and the staff were friendly and attentive. I loved their commitment to sustainability and supporting local producers, it made the meal feel even more special. If you‚Äôre in Doolin, Glas is a must visit. I can‚Äôt wait to return! (by Carlos E S√°nchez H) [9 months ago]

name: Subway
address: 402 N McEwan St, Clare, MI 48617, United States
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Great place to grab a bite to eat! Friendly staff! Nice seating area with lots of windows. The Chipotle Southwest Steak & Cheese wrap was very tasty! (by Matthew Miller) [7 years ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Easy in and out downtown, nice clean place, with good service!  Can‚Äôt go wrong with SubWay! (by Tommy Andrew) [2 years ago] | Review 3: 1 star - Today when I stopped there to get lunch, the young lady making my sandwich had a horrible attitude and was completely rude. She didn't give me time to answer any of her questions and was almost yelling at me. I walked out before anything could escalate. I normally have a good experience there but after today won't be going again. (by Mara Costanzo) [a year ago] | Review 4: 1 star - Absolutely horrible customer service!! We will NEVER choose to eat here again! The store "accidentally" canceled our $46 online/app order. When I called they told me the pending charges will be refunded within a week and I would need to reorder and pay AGAIN for my family to be able to eat tonight!! Are you kidding me??? Not everyone has the ability to just fork over another almost $50 for a dinner or for a mistake that wasn't even theirs. I requested that the manager or owner call me back and it's now after 7 and I've yet to hear anything. Absolutely despicable customer service. (by Terrie Bergeron) [a year ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - A fantastic location to stop and grab some well made food at an affordable price. I've been stopping here on my way to Gladwin for over 20 years (gotta mosey thru Clare to get to I-10 east). This store has always been on its best game, and is still proving this. Thanks for continuing to provide excellent service to this beautiful place. (by Marcus McGuire) [a year ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Our sandwiches were wonderful, made just how we wanted and tasted perfect. Everything was fresh and the place was clean and fresh smelling also. (by Julia Ripley) [a year ago] | Review 7: 1 star - I ordered toasted subs for all three and I also ordered extra lettuce or the more option and got barely any the bread was super soft almost gooey (by Kara Shea) [a year ago] | Review 8: 1 star - My wife ordered me a Turkey sub; In it was a slightly larger than an 8th inch bone that I spit out.  It was very sharp, and though it may have splintered off the breast bone when the Turkey was shaved, it could have injured me had I swallowed it!!  I threw away my sub.  When I called, the employee said only the owner could extend a refund, and told me she‚Äôd leave a message for him.  That was almost a week ago.  No call back, and no refund has posted back to our account.  I suggest you avoid this place.  Or chew your food carefully!! (by Todd Crawford) [2 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - I love this subway!!! I think a service member named Graham helped me the other day, and he was extremely friendly and personable! I will definitely be coming back to this subway next time
I‚Äôm in town!üòä (by Kitty) [2 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - It was a great dining experience,  and the most comfortable old chairs . Seriously though I've been to Subways in multiple states and so far Clare is my favorite (by Daniel Cornell) [a year ago]

name: Catch
address: 10 Armada Holiday Cottages, Leagard South, Spanish Point, Co. Clare, V95 NX57, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Stopped off for fish and chips and was not disappointed. The fish was fresh and all food was cooked to perfection. We will definitely revisit again before the summer ends. (by Niall Larkin) [3 years ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - The fish was ok but the chips could have stayed in the fryer longer. Music was traditional Irish and very good. (by jose lourenco) [a year ago] | Review 3: 2 stars - Nice chips crispy but very very very average fish. Wasn't a big portion was barely crispy and was expecting a lot more. Taste was meh. Really disappointing. Salt is in these tiny little packets which is insane to have a fish and chips business and no salt shaker!!! They cost like ‚Ç¨3 to have only teeny tiny salt packets is terrible form and bad business foresight. Seriously the business can't stretch ‚Ç¨3 for a salt shaker??? Salt in packets? Why????

Pub fish and chips is everybit as good. This place is living off a lot of good hype and publicity it seems. (by Colin Foley) [2 years ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Just had the cod and chips here and it was superb. Hard to fault. The curry sauce is phenomenal, more like a Thai green curry sauce you would find in a full dish rather than the generic instant curry sauce you usually get in a chip shop.

Extra points for the draught Guinness/Moretti you can get in the van beside it.

It‚Äôs a shame the weather was dreadful. But that‚Äôs Ireland for you. (by Dave H) [3 years ago] | Review 5: 3 stars - Disappointed.. honestly for the price
.small fish in enough batter for two fish.chips ok.. not value for ‚Ç¨15. Plus closes and
music ends at 8.30 after that place dead. (by john hughes) [a year ago] | Review 6: 1 star - Just waited for 1hour 10 minutes for very average fish. When asked if they could give me an estimate, they indicated they have no idea how long it would take to fry fish and chips. (by Beverley Kellly) [3 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Amazing seafood, good portions with just the right amount of spices!
They can also get some good wines from the hotel nearby for a delicious match!
Thank you! (by Norbert Bar√°t) [3 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Quite good food but the queue for waiting can be super long (by zyncblade) [Edited 2 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Stopped for food after a swim, food is unbelievably fresh, service was quick didnt have to wait long until food was done (by Chloe Carroll) [2 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - A place with charm and lights, facing the sea. (by Ricardo Caudevilla) [2 years ago]

name: Temple Gate Restaurant
address: The Square, Clonroad Beg, Ennis, Co. Clare, V95 HOXK, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - There was nothing I could fault from our meal there on saturday night PERFECT and the staff were so friendly and helpful to. (by Karen Griffey) [8 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Temple Gate Restaurant
Lovely servers , pleasant, polite and attentive
Food amazing :  had the chef special rib of beef
Prices very good and bang on for the quality and quantity of food
Would definitely recommend and I‚Äôll definitely come back again (by Dave Anon) [7 months ago]

name: Teach Nan Phaidi
address: Kilmurvey Inis Mor ARAN ISLANDS, Co. Galway, H91 VX31, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - One of the best meals we had in Ireland. Very fresh. I haven‚Äôt stopped dreaming of the  Guinness cake. Amazing latte and lovely atmosphere and service. (by Katie K) [5 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - The highlight of our visit to Inis M√≥r! Such a cute and cozy cafe, the perfect place to stop and warm up on a rainy day. The stew and mash was delicious, and the staff were beyond kind. We went on a rainy Friday, and every table was full, so I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs even busier on a nice weekend day. (by Maddy Eichenberg) [3 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - This was unbelievably good. Definitely the best vegetarian food I have had in Ireland. And the Guinness cake was amazing! The women who work here were also so friendly, and it was very cute. (by Alyson Robinson) [4 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Great location. Beautiful place. I really enjoyed the food. Fish pie with salmon and mash. I had cancer of the oesophagus 11 years ago. The food was tasty and nice and soft which really suited me (by Michael Phylan) [a month ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - The stew is fabulous.  The vegetable soup is awesome. Actually, everything we tried was awesome and at a very good price. (by Nay R) [3 weeks ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - What a good surprise!
Such a lovely and cozy restaurant, with homemade and delicious food, with fair prices. We were there early and it's quiet. There is a machine specially to give tips, I love it!!! (by A E) [a month ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Not only is this the prettiest cafe you‚Äôll ever see, they also just happen to serve the best carrot cake you will ever have in your life. And I am a carrot cake fiend! A huge slab and so moist. Perfection! (by Kate Brennan) [4 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - This place has one of the best tasting soups I have had. The tomato and vegetable soups are absolutely beautiful. I have been here several times, and I have always loved the soups. The ambience is very cute and the colourful flowers against the white painted wall outside give it a very unique vibe. Always feel my happy self here! :) (by Tushti Singla) [11 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Gorgeous wee spot with a very lovely scone and tea. Coffee was lovely too. Lovely atmosphere. (by Audrey Kyle) [a month ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Travelled and stopped the last November Friday. Was windy with cold rain. Stew for myself and lasagna for my teen were gorgeous and kept us full and fueled for the whole rainy cold day. Staff was Nice and friendly, the fireplace was cosy and smelled with turf/peat. (by Anna Barschewskaya) [10 months ago]

name: The Hungry Veggie
address: Derreen, Liscannor, Co. Clare, V95 AH63, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Great vegetarian-only food truck with a large selection of burgers and fries (also vegan options available). The Halloumi and Pineapple burger was perfect and I would recommend it 100 %.
It is located just a few minutes away from the Cliffs of Moher and thus the perfect spot to stop by and have a snack.
The owner was very kind and welcoming! (by Felix Bretz) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Great food truck with all veggie burgers. Loved the grilled halloumi and pineapple burger! The fresh chips were also delicious. (by Marie Tschurtschenthaler) [3 weeks ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - I don‚Äôt usually like veggie places because I often find them to be overrated, but these burgers were amazing. So much flavour ü§§ will definitely go back! (by Laura Alexandra) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Fantastic food van that specializes in veggie burgers, and I couldn't be more impressed! They offer a variety of delicious burgers, making it a great option for vegetarians. The food van owner was incredibly friendly and made us feel very welcome.
The burgers we enjoyed here were the best we've had in Ireland, surpassing all the other places and restaurants we've visited so far. Highly recommend giving this place a try! (by Tushar Sonawane) [a year ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Amazing veggie spot on our route to the Cliffs of Moher. Food was really good and the location was perfect - just off the road and with a really sweet picnic area that faced some gorgeous views. However the service topped everything. The owner was lovely and was really helpful and forthcoming in offering some suggestions for camping in the area that evening. We ended up finding one of the most beautiful spots to set up camp in the Burren and couldn‚Äôt be more grateful for the guidance :) would definitely come again! (by Leah O'Reilly) [2 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Good coffee. Not Dog is great. Delicious home made ketchup. Great service, nice guy, marvelous view. The best chips I have ever eaten. (by Andrea) [a year ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Absolutely delicious!!! Owner is very friendly and the food doesn‚Äôt disappoint. Everything was made fresh to order and was super satisfying. We got the spicy falafel burger, not-dog and garlic cheesy chips and can highly recommend them all. Beautiful views too, easy stop before seeing Cliffs of Moher with plenty of parking. It‚Äôs so nice to get some fresh vegetables, and did not miss the meat at all. (by Mollie) [3 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - We stopped here for lunch after the Cliffs of Moher and I'm so happy I did my research beforehand to find out this food truck existed! What a gem! If you're Vegan (or not) and/or Gluten Free too (or not) this is a MUST when visiting the cliffs either way. The food was SO GOOD and the guy running the truck was very hospitable, just an overall lovely experience. (by Jennifer Gazzillo) [5 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Absolutely delicious ü§§ The Hungry Veggie food cart serves fresh, flavourful vegetarian dishes with great portions and friendly service. A must-try for plant-based food loversüå± (by Louckik Trivedi) [3 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Great tasting food and very fair prices- this place is definitely worth the stop! I went to goto the Cliffs of Moher and stumbled upon this great food truck near the Gem Shop. Tom is a great chef, friendly Irishman and everything is local and made from scratch. Fast and tasty- plus I could eat outside with the dogs! 10/10 Highly recommend (by Clair Sentient) [2 months ago]

name: The Good House
address: Carrowkeel East, Inagh, Co. Clare, V95 HW68, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Crab claws, prawns & perfect desserts!

Incredible food here, especially the crab claws and prawns in creamy sauce. Cozy candlelight, friendly service, and we ended on a high note with cr√®me br√ªl√©e and cheesecake. So good!
A must-visit in Inagh! (by Ammy C Warny) [3 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Went for sunday lunch here, absolutely lovely place very busy when we arrived so service was a little slow, but over all the food was very good! the sunday roast was excellent, and staff were very courteous, there is a Lovely beer garden as well! Very nice experience. (by Tony O'Brien) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - This place has made me not want to go home. This is truly good food for good prices. All I have to say is wow. This place was so delicious and the person working here was so fast and nice. Couldn't have chose a better place to eat. (by Karon Colon) [6 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - We had a table of 8, all of us really enjoyed the food here. It was arguably the best meal I have had during our trip to Ireland. (by Jamie Murray) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 3 stars - Food was  very average at best, not freshly prepared, reheated.. female staff member was very rude and disrespectful with no idea about personal space and wanted eye contact bending over unnecessary no manners creepy experience....i hope service  and food improve... (by Coded Pipe Welder TIG ORBITAL MIG MMA) [4 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - I didn‚Äôt expect to find some of the best gluten free fish and chips in a town this small but I did. The place feels upscale but also has a bit of a bar like vibe and everyone seems to know everyone. The fish was light and flaky with a crispy layer of breading that wasn‚Äôt greasy at all. I asked for a side of the gluten free curry for my chips. Also very mild and tasty. The chips were clearly made fresh from potatoes and were crunchy but not dry. The gluten free menu was extensive and I even include the dessert menu. Incredible! (by Dale Huntington) [Edited 3 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - We journeyed out to Inagh for a Saturday treat and boy did we feel treated!

The door opens into a clean, traditionally styled bar with a section of the open plan room reserved for dinning. We sat in the corner by the window and beside the fireplace. We sat, went through the menu and all decided to get 3 course dinners (why not!!). The staff took our order and without delay, we were served well presented and deliciously fresh food. Starting with mains, we got soup, brie and goats cheese. We enjoyed everything set out on the table. Next, the mains were bacon cabbage, fish and chips and turkey and ham. To finish, we got an apple crumble, Christmas pudding and tiramisu. We enjoyed every bite of everything and left feeling very satisfied.

I must admit, we did object to paying the separate prices of some dishes, but we can also say that the staff handled the situation very well and must be commended for their care and due diligence.

Well done all the staff in the business and the people in management. You run a wonderful show. (by Chloe Walsh) [a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - We stumbled upon this place on our way to the Cliffs.  What an exceptional place to stumble upon.  Food was outstanding and service also out of this world.  A quaint charming local restaurant with many locals and all very friendly and welcoming.

We are coffee officiandos and the coffee here was an Italian blend they use all the time and was also excellent with the food we had.  For a full review of this coffee and restaurant see our YouTube channel #brew2foru (by Jennifer Simmons) [10 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Summer of 2023 did not disappoint! We found this gem while driving around Ireland. We found this lovely pub restaurant. The food and desserts were well prepared. Our server Michael knew the menu and offered great suggestions. We felt like we hit a gold mine with this place on our was to Dingle. My boys loved their fish and chips (by Matthew Schoeffler) [a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - We recently celebrated my godson‚Äôs First Holy Communion at Good House, and everything was absolutely perfect. The food was delicious ‚Äì freshly prepared, beautifully served, and enjoyed by everyone. The service was outstanding ‚Äì friendly, professional. Thank you to the whole team at Good House for making this special day even more memorable. Highly recommended! (by Aneta Dutkiewicz) [4 months ago]

name: Vagabond Restaurant Lahinch
address: 1 Church St, Lehinch, Lahinch, Co. Clare, V95 XPN7, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Really lovely experience, food was absolutely delicious went with the sea food spegetti and calamari was beautifully cooked. Staff were kind and courteous, Fantastic place! (by Tony O'Brien) [a month ago] | Review 2: 2 stars - Ordered food for takeaway. Absolutely shocking. A burger served with no chips. Portion sizes tiny for the prices charged. Chips not even like chips..more like potatoes thrown into the fryer and the bigger ones not even cooked properly..paid extra for a salad. About 10 small lettuce bits in the tub. Will not return which is very disappointing. (by M√°ir√≠n Gallagher) [6 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - We were already in the restaurant when I checked the reviews and I was a little worried, but everything was great. A longer wait than other places, but the scenery was gorgeous, the staff were friendly, and the food was delicious. Great value too considering the location. (by Sharon Leavy) [a month ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Great place, delicious food,  friendly atmosphere. Highly recommend this place‚ù§Ô∏è (by Barbara P) [3 months ago] | Review 5: 2 stars - Definitely a bit of a toxic work environment going on!
1st night when we went to walk in - we were unable to put a name or number down and kinda laughed at
Second night - we had reserved but nothing explained. My special - 5 prawns and garlic bread  was on cooked and tasty but
More appropriate for a starter
Lack of skill of staff noticeable
It location give it so much potential (by Yvonne Hand) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Very cozy place with a beautiful view of the ocean. The staff is nice and polite (by Olga Magar) [a month ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Today we were at this wonderful restaurant. The appetizers were incredible. Thanks to our waitress for the good recommendation. For dinner we had sea bass and strogonof. Everything was very tasty. The service was great. (by John Green) [2 weeks ago] | Review 8: 1 star - Despite its impressive 4.5 rating from last year, or so, this restaurant no longer lives up to the hype. The atmosphere felt off, with an oddly empty dining area that lacked warmth or energy. We waited nearly 50 minutes for three pizzas, only to be served something distinctly underwhelming‚Äîbland, poorly made, and far from what the rating promised. A disappointing experience that suggests the quality has slipped considerably since the great reviews were written or pictures have taken. (by Barnab√°s Csarnai) [4 months ago] | Review 9: 4 stars - The pizza here was excellent, you can choose vegan mozzarella if you want, the food wasn't too pricey either. Great service too, and the tap stout is Murphy's, a real gem of a restaurant. (by Stuart Saint) [a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Excellent place for a bite to eat. Staff was friendly and helpful. The food was delicious and worth the value. Will be back!
Thank you (by joey joey) [2 years ago]

name: Seasons Restaurant
address: main street, Mountshannon, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 3 stars - Food was average. As you can see from the pictures the fish and chips where well over cooked. On the menu it said the fish came with homemade tartar sauce. It wasn't on the plate. When asked they said it was all gone and the tartar sauce in a packet was available. It would be polite to inform guest if options on the menu are not fully available before ordering. Pizza was tasty. Soft drinks are in 200ml bottles. House wine ‚Ç¨6 a glass.  It was a busy Sunday evening. Food took 30mins from ordering to be served. Overall prices are similar to other pub foods around. (by Orla Illien) [3 years ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - Good place to take kids for dinner. Friendly relaxed atmosphere. Pub with food. (by Laura Green) [2 years ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Fantastic new restaurant, very inexpensive, good food, amazing staff (by Stefan Smyth) [6 years ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Amazing food, lovely staff, nice place to eat, I got the pasta it was amazing. (by Abigail Magowan) [4 years ago] | Review 5: 2 stars - Not very welcoming once we mentioned we had a dog, not all dog owners are irresponsible.  We quickly moved onto Portumna where they are far more accommodating in pubs and restaurants. (by Mary Hughes) [a year ago] | Review 6: 1 star - Came here on Sunday,  asked what seemed to be a middle aged lady with short black hair to see the menu, her response was have you booked. I said no sorry I was just looking to order for my daughter. She told me they are fully booked up. I asked can we sit out side in the massive outdoor area , I was told no they don't do out door dining. OK I said no problem can I get it to go. I was told no their to busy. I wouldn't return, the service at the bar was awfull also. (by Jennifer lynch) [2 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - What a wonderful surprise! Plates are loaded, food is delicious. A truly hidden gem. Stayed at golf club in bodyke, they advised us to try this restaurant for a special occasion. Staff were so nice and friendly. Maybe a little bit pricey but got our dollar's worth. Thanks Trish for the tip off! Will definitely be back. (by Trish Bolton) [6 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Excellent food, great variety on menu. Staff very friendly and accommodating. Highly recommend it to anyone. (by Jules McCorran) [2 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - This restaurant has been a super addition to the historic and picturesque village of Mountshannon. Proprietors and staff always give a lovely warm welcome. The menu offers wholesome food with good variety and generous servings. A tastefully renovated upstairs space with views of Lough Derg. Highly recommended for all, whether arriving by boat to the recently redeveloped harbour, or by road, which affords great views of the lake and surrounding landscape. (by Noel Murphy) [6 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Lovely friendly restaurant
Went this eve family of six, portion sizes were very generous and food was exceptional will definitely return and tell others to call here too. (by alison murphy) [6 years ago]

name: The UPPside European Restaurant Clare Valley
address: 7812 Horrocks Hwy, Penwortham SA 5453, Australia
reviews:
Review 1: 4 stars - Overall good experience.

We ordered two entrees, roasted pork belly and special potato dumplings. Nice flavours.
Ordered two main dishes, gnocchi and roasted duck leg.

Overall, the portions are quite small. Most dishes were quite salty as well.

Desserts: hot cross bun w ice cream was okay. Worth a try.
Ordered Portugese tart for takeaway. The pastry skin doesn‚Äôt have nice butter smells. It was cold and so sweet, super expensive for a tiny small tart. $6.4 (plus surcharge). (by Rosaline H) [5 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - What a wonderful meal.
My sicilian pizza was just the best. The others couldn't stop raving about the salmon, long pasta, dumplings, and pork belly.
Truly wonderful meals, deserts we also terrific.
Excellent food and good service. (by dh716574) [6 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Recently had lunch here while staying in the Clare Valley, staff were very friendly and the food was divine. We had Portuguese chicken wings, perogies, crispy pork belly, lamb moussaka and chicken cord en bleu - outstanding fresh food loved it! Very reasonably priced. (by lisa doveston) [3 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Glad to have found this restaurant while staying in the Clare Valley.
Let them feed us, and Wow!
Very happy with the food, service and great atmosphere also üëåüèª (by The Loud Abouts) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Delightful restaurant, excellent food, great service. The hosts know very well what they are hoping to achieve.  My moussaka was sublime. Highly recommend. Disappointed so few diners but it was midweek. (by Christine Bolvig) [Edited 5 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - A fabulous family run business with Incredible attention to detail and commitment to the quality of the product. The dumplings are to die for, and the gnocchi was incredible. Even the sangria, (I'm a sangria fan), that I randomly had for lunch, was about the best I've had the pleasure of imbibing. If I lived nearby I'd be here every other week. Highly recommended. (by Brett Taylor) [a month ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Delicious food and great local wines! We sat by the warm cozy fire. Highly recommend the cheese pierogi like Baba used to make they were so good! Great comfort food during this cold weather.
Gnocchi made with mushrooms and truffles very tasty, Veal cutlet also tender and crispy.
We left happy with our appetite satisfied.
You need to try this place you will not be disappointed! (by Kerrie Lee) [a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Celebrated our wedding anniversary with sharing Tapas ü•Çüíï great food, enjoyed the vodka and definately will return to sample the full menu (by Debbie Sparre) [7 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Food was fantastic. Staff great and friendly. Lots of locally produce used. Chef Christian made the effort to come and talk to us at the end of the meal and explain his locally grown produce. A must visit. (by Joe Valente) [10 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - What a hidden gem! Beautiful European food- could not fault any of the dishes we ordered, but the Polish dumplings were the highlight for us. A lovely selection of local wines as well. (by Sarah Sobels) [9 months ago]

name: Cassidys Pub and Restaurant
address: The Heart of, The Burren, Ballyconry, Carran, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - We have been living in Ireland since the end of 2019 and went back to Cassidy's the day before yesterday after it reopened and had a pizza. It was the most delicious pizza we have had since we moved to Ireland. It was super tasty and we will definitely be back. The service is also super nice and friendly and the pub itself is really beautiful. (by Pinewood Cat Lodge) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Try the gourmet steak burger with blue cheese. I wanted to lick the plate when I was finished it, but my friend told me that's inappropriate. The fries are good too, basically perfect. Furthermore, the pub has great service. Even though they were closing, they didn't mind us staying while they were done cleaning up. I was very satisfied and would definitely eat there again if I had another night in The Burren. (by Egehan Yildirim) [7 years ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - What a lovely  200 Yr old (in the same family) pub to have stumbled upon on a grey and drizzly day!  The fire was lit and cozy and the ladies were kind, friendly and helpful. We ordered burgers which came with generous servings of chips and a really nice salad! I was so full and the burger was amazing! My husband ordered dessert: death by chocolate brownie (of which I stole a generous amount) and it was delicious. Our friend ordered a mango ice cream and it was very refreshing (I tasted it too :) ) the view of the Burren was great even though it was raining. There was outdid seating with views as well which I imagine are lovely in a sunny day. We will be back for certain! (by Brenda Taylor) [7 years ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - The owners Michelle and Robert made you feel like family.  The food was delicious. Friday nights people bring their instruments and just play.  Highly recommend. (by Susan Drobysh) [6 years ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - THE wedding venue in the West of Ireland for an intimate event hosted by a professional family run team delivering the best of Irish produce, taste and the hospitality that Ireland is known for.

We had our wedding in August 2021 in Cassidys, Co. Clare with 90 guests. Approachable, professional, experienced and listeners to the customers ideas, Michelle, Robert and the entire Cassidys team made every minute of our wedding an unforgettable experience. Michelle was on hand to sound board ideas and we were safe in the knowledge that the advice comes from years of successful business in hospitality. Cassidy‚Äôs is a name and viewpoint we trust. The team have eye for detail and know what works.

Food served in buffet style was a major hit with our guests, allowing them to try and experience a range of locally sourced fresh produce. People loved this style. Michelle helped us pair wines to the menu and really helped us every step of the way. Different wedding guests have individually commented on their favourite dish of the day at our wedding‚Ä¶crab claws, sushi, the beef, the fish, the broccoli cashew nut roast‚Ä¶there was something delicious for every taste bud! Never left a glass empty and no guest left wanting.

Covid restrictions brought its obvious challenges to our special day. Cassidys worked with us to ensure our day was special while also safe for our guests.

The Burren backdrop, a unique and secluded location for a private event and a very high standard of food and drinks, Cassidys delivered everything we could have looked for in our wedding reception.
Working with a team like this made us feel very assured in the lead up to our big day. They knew our vision and delivered beyond our expectations.

We had so much fun and I think everyone did. Cassidy‚Äôs made it! While the sun didn‚Äôt stay out long enough to enjoy what the backdrop has to offer, simply view images to see how amazing this setting is.

We never once had to look over our shoulder to see if something could be done. The team were so impressive in their intuition and attentive nature to run a great wedding.

We plan to celebrate our 1st and future wedding anniversary‚Äôs in Cassidys to relive our special day made so memorable by this gem in the West of Ireland. We wish Amy and the team continued success in their future wedding events and ventures. It goes without saying that we would highly recommend Cassidy‚Äôs to any couple looking for a unique wedding reception venue.

Thank you for everything, Roisin & Will. (by Roisin Kelly) [3 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Absolutely fantastic restaurant. Amazing service, wonderful food and spectacular views. My family of 8 arrived late with little ones. It was the best find in Ireland in the past 10 days. (by ELIZABETH BRENNAN) [3 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Fabulous food and service. Highly recommend it, lovely crab claws and fresh fish (by Paula Tansey) [a month ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - The most amazing, cheery and helpful staff I've met on a pub so far!
Couple that with a superb hamburguer made with local meat, so simple and yet so delicious, and you've got a recipe for success!
Mandatory stop if you are anywhere around here! (by Pedro Nuno Pacheco) [6 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - The best fish and seafood pie I've ever had! The stone oven baked pizza is also amazing. Highly recommended! (by Anita Schneider) [6 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Lovely traditional Irish pub There is a lovely atmosphere when entering, traditional Irish music playing with a lovely open fire in the hearth. The food was locally sourced and cooked as it should be.
Highly recommended (by Stephen Lee) [7 years ago]

name: Naughton's Bar
address: 46 O'Curry St, Dough, Kilkee, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Absolutely amazing experience! The food was not only delicious but beautifully presented ‚Äî every dish looked like a work of art. The service was warm, fast, and made us feel truly welcome. And the prawns... wow! So fresh and full of flavor ‚Äî a must-try! (by Mary Wolf) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - We had an excellent dinner at Naughton‚Äôs Bar in Kilkee. Our group of five showed up with one more than our reservation allowed, but Elaine handled it with ease and got us seated quickly without fuss. The service throughout the evening was prompt, friendly, and clearly well organized ‚Äî the whole team is on point.

Before dinner we had the pleasure of chatting with Paddy Collins behind the bar. His knowledge of Kilkee‚Äôs history, his great personality, and his warm hospitality set the tone for the night. He‚Äôs a gem.

The food itself was absolutely delicious ‚Äî starters and mains alike were top-notch, beautifully prepared, and full of flavor. Combine that with the very fair pricing and you get excellent value for money.

Naughton‚Äôs is truly a testament to what makes Kilkee special: great food, genuine people, and welcoming service. Big thanks to Elaine, Paddy, and the whole team for a wonderful evening. We‚Äôll definitely be back! (by Johnny O'Brien) [a month ago] | Review 3: 4 stars - Excellent chowder and prawn curry and everyone else at my table were happy were their food too. A few things letting it down. The bread was dry and thin, butter was skimpy and just out of the fridge, meals not coming at the same time and having to ask for the bill a number of times. I would have given a tip as I felt the staff were friendly and accommodating, unfortunately a service charge was added in without prior notice. (by Aisling Burke) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - A welcoming and cosy pub with local fresh food.
Lovely prompt service and a great vibe. (by Claire McMahon) [3 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Quite simply - the star attraction from a foodie‚Äôs perspective in Kilkee! Naughton‚Äôs and Naughton‚Äôs Yard serve up delicious food in restaurants to rival any! Well run by the owner ! Staff so well trained and all in a gorgeous ambience of delicious food, decor and atmosphere . Bravo Naughton‚Äôs ! Thoroughly enjoyed every visit whilst on hols here ! Great bar too for before and after dinner drinks . Thanks Paddy, Elaine and Robert !  Xx (by Valerie Keating) [2 months ago] | Review 6: 3 stars - Arrived and it took 10 minutes for someone to take our food order (no biggy) the food was excellent I would recommend the burger. Nicest food in Kilkee. However when we were trying to leave (we understood we had our table for 2 hours) we struggled to find someone to get the bill from (for 5 mins) A waitress came over and asked us nicely to leave as she had another table coming in. We mentioned that we never got the bill and she apologised and left. 5 minutes later my grandfather goes up to the bar to pay the bill as still no sign of anyone dropping it to our table. After the bill is paid my grandfather returns to the table and briefly gathers his things (in his late 80s) before the manager comes over and asks us to leave again? Just left us with a sour taste in our mouths. I will of course be returning to naughtons as I have since I was a child with hopefully better communication between staff management and customers. (by the nugents) [a month ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - If you're ever in Kilkee, Co. Clare, Naughton‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant is an absolute must-visit! From the moment you step inside, the warmth of the welcoming staff and the cozy yet vibrant atmosphere set the tone for a fantastic dining experience. The food is nothing short of exceptional‚Äîeach dish is a perfect blend of local flavors and culinary creativity.

I opted for the fresh seafood platter, and it was a feast for both the eyes and the taste buds‚Äîabsolutely brimming with fresh, locally sourced delights. The portions were generous, and the presentation was artful. I also tried their renowned fish and chips, which were perfectly crisp on the outside and tender on the inside.

The service was impeccable. The team is attentive, friendly, and genuinely passionate about what they do. They made sure that we felt at home from start to finish, offering great recommendations and making sure we were well taken care of throughout our meal.

The ambiance is perfect for any occasion‚Äîwhether you‚Äôre on a romantic date, a family dinner, or a casual night out with friends, Naughton‚Äôs has the perfect vibe. They even have a great selection of craft beers and wines to complement your meal.

I can't recommend Naughton‚Äôs enough‚Äîit's one of those rare places where the quality of the food, the service, and the atmosphere all come together perfectly. A true gem in Kilkee! (by Deep Nation Records) [6 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Amazing seafood dishes here. Love it. We will definitely be back. üëçüëçüëç (by Ammy C Warny) [a year ago] | Review 9: 4 stars - Great restaurant.  Food was amazing. The scampi has to be tried !! Lovely friendly staff. Reasonable priced. (by Fiona OShaughnessy) [2 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Had the nicest tiger prawns I‚Äôve ever had! Everything we had was amazing! Even the cocktails!  Thank you (by Louise Traynor) [2 months ago]

name: Brogan's
address: 24 O'Connell Street, Clonroad Beg, Ennis, Co. Clare, V95 XRW8, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 4 stars - Cosy restaurant with a nice warmed terrace. The food was good, of high quality and looked great when served. The price of the food was correct. Rather the service was friendly but a little unorganized. They came too early to clean the table and even asked for dessert while we were still eating our main dish. (by Victor Drieskens) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - One night in Ennis and Brogan‚Äôs did not disappoint!

I popped in after a quick Google search for a good local restaurant, and I‚Äôm so glad I did. I ordered the chicken curry with rice‚Äîit was a generous portion and absolutely delicious. Cozy atmosphere, friendly staff, and great food. Highly recommend if you‚Äôre passing through Ennis! (by Marissa Talbot) [3 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - It's difficult to beat the ambiance of a classic Irish pub and this one is a great example. Eclectic decorations, cozy seating setup, delicious food and cold beer. Makes you want to stay all night. (by Chet Amus) [3 months ago] | Review 4: 4 stars - We had four of us for lunch. Place was quiet for a Tuesday afternoon. Food/service was good, place was clean, and has a large bar, and plenty of tables. (by Tim) [3 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Good simple food in a cosy typical atmosphere. Very generous portion.
Highly recommend üòã (by Pauline) [2 weeks ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Lovely restaurant, good lighting so can ser other tables but also feel private. Food was delicious and lots of gluten free options. (by Peter McDonagh) [2 weeks ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Busy, bustling and crowded but you are welcomed, appreciated and provided with exceptional service.
Food menu is extensive and reasonably priced. The food arrives hot, promptly,and with a smile. It is tasteful and filling especially the fish and chips though every one enjoyed whatever they ordered.
Make it a priority if you are looking for a decent meal and a drink while in the town!! (by Michael Duffy) [a month ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - We stopped by chance once but the second time we made it back to eat here. Cozy atmosphere, friendly and fast staff. Lots of choice for the courses, all of which are decidedly generous and accompanied with various sauces and side dishes. We'll be back! (by Anna MRT) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - In our 3 weeks trip in Scotland, Ireland, this restaurant provided the best quality food, we loved it.

We had mussels for entree, they are tender, juicy & full of flavour. Our steak was again tender & cooked medium rare as per our request and good size of salad as well, no mushy peas!

loved it. (by E H) [3 weeks ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Absolutely fabulous menu, loads of options, high quality food, great atmosphere and staff, would highly recommend here. (by Amanda Troy) [6 months ago]

name: Joe's Caf√©
address: Marine Parade, Dough, Lahinch, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 3 stars - Atmosphere:
The inside is quaint. It has a colorful beachy vibe. There are a good amount of seats inside.

Staff:
Friendly considering how busy they were. We had no napkins and a gentlemen said he would bring some. He must have forgotten so I grabbed some from the counter. Near the end of the meal he must have remembered he forgot to bring napkins because he brought some by. Not a big deal because I know they were busy.

Ham & Garlic Pizza:
Pros: the pizza crust was good and the portion size of ham was generous.

Sourdough Chicken & Pesto Sandwich:
Really good homemade pesto sauce but the rest of the sandwich was average.

Not so good: the cheese and ham had no flavor. I asked for garlic and did not taste any garlic whatsoever. Either they used a very light amount of garlic powder or they forgot.

Water:
All the glasses were completely dirty, inside and out. Either they dunked washed the glasses or have a broken dishwasher because they were warm when brought out.

Overall, the food was good. It wasn‚Äôt horrible. (by Jon Jong) [5 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Excellent place for Brunch. We were there on Saturday and the place was lively, mainly locals. Service was super friendly and they accept dogs üê∂! The plates were really full of good quality ingredients and coffee is delicious. (by Ruta Sasnauskaite) [4 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Ambience: Cosy and upbeat üèùÔ∏èüé∂
Food: Delicious (Menu: quite extensive with plenty of vegetarian,vegan and gluten free options)‚òïü•û
Service: Top-notch (Complemented by personal touches) üñçÔ∏èüé®
Staff: Warm and friendly ‚ô•Ô∏è
Pets: Totally welcomedüêà
Overall pretty chill vibesü´êüå∏üåä (by Niyati Shah) [5 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - We were there on a blustery, drizzly afternoon in want of samies and salad - Joe‚Äôs hit the mark and then some.  We had the BLT with chips, the salad (with a lime chili sauce from another item on the side) and the chicken burger - everything was grand!   Place had a great vibe with all the locals and surfers round.  There were a few open tables when we got there and they were full up when we left.  The servers were lovely! (by World xpler) [6 months ago] | Review 5: 3 stars - This place was absolutely lively. Had the Joe‚Äôs eggs and my husband had the Eggs Benedict. The food was amazing and coffee was delicious.
The bagel was a little toasted too hard but otherwise was amazing. Always good stop for breakfast. (by Anaghaa Jayakumar) [5 months ago] | Review 6: 3 stars - Suuuuuper loud. Photos of the food look great in other people‚Äôs reviews, but ours were served on very basic plates with very basic presentation. The hash brown in my breakfast was barely cooked. Chairs are uncomfortable. (by Christopher Conlan) [2 weeks ago] | Review 7: 4 stars - GrI at food, vibes and friendliness.
Toilets need a facelift for the win! (by Mag Leahy) [a month ago] | Review 8: 3 stars - Check this place out, it was very busy, cramped. Not a seat was empty. 1 waiter seemed kinda annoyed when we came in.

Food was okay. I got hollandaise eggs and my fainc√® got pancakes.

The skinny waitress with black was really friendly. (by Marsha Mailander) [6 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Unreal grub. So many veggie choices. Meat eater enjoyed his burger. Music is great too (by Rebekah Dunne) [5 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Delicious and healthy salads and entrees with a Mediterranean flare. Generous portions. Would highly recommend as a break from traditional Irish food. (by John Munson) [a year ago]

name: Wild Honey Inn
reviews:
Review 1: None - Really enjoyed our (2) night stay in August. We had 2 rooms and they were clean and well appointed. The breakfast included with our stay was wonderful. We were sorry the restaurant attached to the Inn is now closed, but Aidan's chef skills ‚Ä¶ (by jvb129) | Review 2: None - Great hotel in terms of location and charm. Breakfasts were fantastic and hosts very attentive. Would have loved to been able to enjoy a drink in the bar but seemed to be closed up for the season. (by ux4uigo63a) | Review 3: None - Kate and her staff were lovely and hospitable. She answered every question we had and keeps the place in picture perfect condition. Unfortunately the restaurant was closed for the season but the breakfast room is open and the spread that is ‚Ä¶ (by eileenkK5454JC) | Review 4: None - Stayed here for the matchmaker festival. Perfect place to stay. Walking distance to wherever we wanted to go. The service was excellent and they were so friendly and helpful. Very homely and comfortable hotel. Everything was spotless and perfect. We'll definitely be back. (by mariabmurphy) | Review 5: None - The Wild Honey inn is a super quaint and we'll appointed inn located conveniently in Linsdoonvana. It was a great jumping off point to see the Cliffs of Moher, Doolin, the Burren National park and the Burren in general. The husband and wife ‚Ä¶ (by markefried) | Review 6: None - A sleepy town with a top of the line old world inn. The innkeeper Kate was welcoming, friendly and informative. Rooms were furnished with quality chairs, chest and bed. Bathroom was clean and decorated with tasteful tile and fixtures. ‚Ä¶ (by jdgriesing) | Review 7: None - Terrible experience, especially for this price!

First of all, it is not a 4 star property. The check in was available only from 4-6pm, like it was some sort of Airbnb. Then the receptionist or owner woman was very rude all the time. The restaurant is not working, so all the nice photos we saw were misleading. We paid ‚Ç¨250 per night and breakfast was not included (in every hotel we stayed in Ireland breakfast was included within ‚Ç¨180-250 price range). Then the breakfast has to be booked for a specific time which was not convenient. The door to our room was not closing from the inside and there was loud noise every time someone in the property had a shower. The communal lounge had a bad smell. Also there was no kettle and tea/coffee in the room, which is not common for 4 start accommodation as well as for that price tag. Overall, the place looked empty and abandoned. But the biggest problem was the rudeness and the attitude of the receptionist/owner women. (by Victoria) | Review 8: None - Kate (the owner) and staff were lovely. Rooms had charm and were clean. Breakfast was great too! Do wish we had all day tea and coffee available. We also could not bring any outside food in. She and her staff were able to accommodate a family of 20~/10 rooms. (by Sabina Balbale) | Review 9: None - This little guesthouse is seriously gorgeous and the owner, Kate, is an absolute delight.  She was full of great local recommendations and made my favorite breakfast I had on that trip.  I would go back to Lisdoonvarna just to stay here.  Honestly, I wish I could hire Kate to decorate my home, too - this place is so charming. (by Katherine Wooten) | Review 10: None - We both had beautiful rooms and excellent showers.||Spotlessly clean.||The house is gorgeous with wonderful furniture and every room has especially beautiful curtains and fabrics. ||The only let down is that the bar is closed and there is ‚Ä¶ (by AdTed)

name: Town Hall Bistro
address: O'Connell Street, Clonroad Beg, Ennis, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Went for lunch Saturday.. the staff could not have been more helpful with an above and beyond  service attitude. It's very hard to find this level of service anymore. We were travelling for work.  I really wanted a proper steak. They sorted me out with request including dietary needs. Tasty food, steak cooked as requested. Wholesome food. We did only try the steak.   Highly recommended.  Nice toilets, nice room, comfy seating and decent sized tables. Will be backif back in Ennis!. Thanks all! (by Shani Williams) [a week ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - Good food and nice staffs but plain environment. I thought lamb cutlets would be a fried one but actually it's similar to US version of a lamb shank. I ordered a lamb shank but that's not what I expected. (by Justin L) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - What an incredibly nice place ! Service is wonderful ! The food is amazing ! The Irish Cream Liquor cheesecake is amazing ! (by Maria Mejia) [a month ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Town Hall Bistro in Ennis to celebrate a friend's birthday, and the experience was outstanding! From the moment we walked in, the service was impeccable. Special thanks to Rafa, Paulina, and Kathlyn for making our evening so memorable.

The food was absolutely delicious, with each dish beautifully presented and bursting with flavor. The staff went above and beyond to ensure that our celebration was perfect, and their attention to detail did not go unnoticed.

I highly recommend Town Hall Bistro for any special occasion or just a fantastic meal out. We‚Äôll definitely be back! (by Huri Huerta) [a year ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Wow üëå  absolutely delicious food, excellent service, highly recommend (by Colisa Print Limited) [a month ago] | Review 6: 3 stars - The place is lovely, as is the staff, but the food simply didn't cut it.

We had the St Tola's Goats Cheese Salad and Asian Style Spiced Pork Belly for starters - both were way too sweet. Why they chose to mix something pink and sweet INTO the cheese was beyond me. The end result are starters that offer no complex tastes but just an overwhelming sweetness.
For mains we had the Sirloin Steak and the Medallions of Pork Fillet. Both were fine and enjoyable on their own, though the weird hash brown served with the sirloin and the risotto served with the pork were bad.
The rhubarb tart was class though! (by B M) [a month ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Had a lovely dinner that was included with our stay in the hotel. Food exceeded our expectations. Setting was fabulous and the service stellar. Loved it. (by Elk Hunter) [10 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - I would give it more than 5 stars if I could. The atmosphere is warm and welcoming. The staff were attentive and friendly. The food was do die for. I had the cod and crab risotto and loved it. My husband had the lamb. I had a taste and was blown away. And my son has the chicken which can be boring but was anything but. (by Ann Brennan) [2 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Very popular bistro in town, always crowded with tourist. Food and drinks was great and reasonable price. Big portion! Service staff very friendly, helpful and polite. My advice, make a reservation before you plan to go there because always busy and full. Nice ambience and atmosphere. Good location, nearby to the city centre. Highly recommended to anyone! (by toft A) [Edited 2 years ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - The girls enjoyed their meal but the goat cheese salad was only ok. The fillet steak was well done when I asked for medium rare. It eatable but nothing special. The dessert was the best part. I loved the panna cotta. (by Loren Purcell) [10 months ago]

name: Cruises Bar & Restaurant
address: 41 Abbey St, Clonroad Beg, Ennis, Co. Clare, V95 XFX4, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 4 stars - This place was absolutely hopping when we arrived. Very popular with millennial and particularly hens and stag parties. It appears that they start at the farthest point and work their way in.
Everyone well behaved (by Michael Ralph) [5 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Holy crap! Amazing!
Music, friendly faces, great spirits, this is why I came to Ireland! (by Brian Labore) [4 days ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Was at bingo loco. Had a great night. Some of the security very friendly and a pleasure. A few bot so much. Bar staff were a pleasure and overall a good night (by Sassoon79) [3 years ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - This place is the best...very cozy...great music...not too loud. Bartender is very welcoming and sweet. (by Gina Cook) [6 years ago] | Review 5: 1 star - Enquired about reserving a table for ten people for a hen, was informed I could not unless I was going to have finger food..Food was not necessary as we had dinner booked.
We booked another establishment nearby which also had music. The manager went above and beyond to ensure we were looked after and we stayed there all night. (by Siobh√°n O'Grady) [2 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - The service was great.  The atmosphere was awesome, and had musicians coming and going for a trad session! This really added to the vibe and made our group want to stay longer! (by jeff singleton) [a year ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Great food in a typical Irish pub setting. Service was really nice. Live music but we sat in the back where we could still have a conversation but still listen to the music. Highly recommend if you are in the area. (by Rick B) [8 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Great staff and venue (by Michelle scully) [3 weeks ago] | Review 9: 1 star - This place is absolute rubbish. I tried to go here for food and was ignored for the first 5 minutes I was inside. When I finally got the attention of a waiter he told me the restaurant was full (it was clearly not based on all the empty tables) and said I could go sit in the pub and he would come find me to take my order. I went to the pub and sat in the only place available at a counter right next to a band playing loud music. I waited for 10 minutes and the waiter never showed back up. The rest of the staff ignored me so I left and went down the street to Knox's pub where I was greeted as soon as I walked in the door. At Knox's pub I got great service and was able to watch the England vs. Russia game. Would never go back to Cruises again and will tell everyone to stay away. (by Kegan Clark) [9 years ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - Have always had good time for Cruises. Great mix of live music. A large bar in a stellar location in the heart of Ennis.

Staff are always on point and a great atmosphere. (by Tommy Lanigan) [3 years ago]

name: Bonfire Restaurant
address: 49 Parnell St, Clonroad Beg, Ennis, Co. Clare, V95 DA36, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 2 stars - Very poor oily curry, chicken not fresh. No flavour.  Tried it out based on the reviews. I don't understand how it is highly rated. (by Jason Culligan) [3 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - The food was amazing, very reasonably priced, and staff was extremely friendly. Highly recommended!! (by Jason Pfaehler) [3 years ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - I really liked chicken biryani! It was amazing. Overall the food was very tasty, portions were big so we took left overs with us because it was too good to let it go just like that. The service was also quick and nice. Overall I would really recommend! (by Robert Kulikowski) [a year ago] | Review 4: 1 star - Horrible place, got food poisoning. Staff very rude (by Jim) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Went here last night with our 3 year old. It was pretty quiet but the lady who was serving us could not have been nicer or more friendly. She was great wih our little girl. The food was also amazing. Really, really enjoyed it. Would love to go back again just on our own so we can relax and enjoy the place. (by Donna N) [9 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Delicious food!!! Seasoned beautifully.

They‚Äôre also really knowledgeable on what‚Äôs vegan and what‚Äôs not. They even informed me which rice had butter.

Vegan friendly and delicious ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

Also the chips are lovely (by Saheeda Wilson) [2 years ago] | Review 7: 1 star - Ordered from their own website (as encouraged by the restaurant) and received all of our orders wrong. Having waited over an hour for our food initially, we were told to come back with the incorrect orders and only then would they start to prepare our correct order. So had to go back in and sit and wait. After waiting 2 hours total to get our food, we were only told to be more specific in the notes section of the website next time. Woman I dealt with was very unapologetic and blamed it all on the website (THEIR website). Not even a free poppadom did we get. Very bad customer service, won't be returning. (by Ailish McCarthy) [5 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Such nice food at a really good price, and the service at Bonfire is always so friendly and helpful. We have gotten take away here a few times and it's always ready to collect so quickly. Would definitely recommend. (by alannapower21) [4 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Popped in tonight for dinner and it was the best Indian food ever. The server was very nice and the food was amazing.  Definitely recommend (by Sue Jones) [2 years ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - Good excellent. Nice seats. Very quiet the night we were in. Over ordered not knowing the helping sized so bill steeper than needed. So service speed was good but could have been more informative. (by David Madden) [6 years ago]

name: The Frantic Chef
address: Mermaid House, Liscannor, Co. Clare, V95 DKF7, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 4 stars - Cafeteria style good food for our tour bus stop. Quick and ready to eat. Some rearrangement of food bar may help so as to make the line go faster a bit during the food rush but all ok. The food was tasty and quite a variety of fish, meat, sandwich and salad options. There is plenty of space - An upstairs and outside as well. Bathrooms were nice and clean for the space. Nice decor around the restaurant. Someone came by to check if everyone was ok, so the extra touch was nice. Also, it was great to have ketchup at the tables included with other condiments. All items were easy to find. Would recommend this spot to others! (by rex n) [3 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Delicious food. Came here during the Paddywagon tour to have lunch.  Do expect to pay 15+ on your warm meal though! However, the braised lamb is worth it ~ (by Carmen L.) [5 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Beautiful place with healthy food and good views. There's indoor seating and outdoor seating. The fries were the best! The food is delicious and the service is quick. Lots of options with detailed information on the ingredients and allergens. Highly recommend visiting this place during your next Cliffs of Moher trip. (by Kshitija Kulkarni) [11 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Stopped here while on tour of the Cliffs of Moher. The lamb was wonderful and the gluten free carrot cake was nice. (by Paul Richardson) [3 weeks ago] | Review 5: 4 stars - Our tour bus (Paddywagon Tours) stopped here for lunch, and it was a pleasant experience. You order cafeteria-style, starting with drink options available in the fridge as you walk in to your left.

There‚Äôs a nice selection of fresh salads, sandwiches, warm soups, and ready-to-eat hot meals that seem to rotate daily. Grab a tray and head to the line to order. When we arrived at 2 p.m. on a Saturday, the options included beef with Yorkshire pudding, fish and chips, and beef stew, all served with mashed potatoes and carrots. The sandwiches all appeared to be pared with a green salad and crisps (American potato chips).

We opted for a can of pale ale from a local brewery and the roast beef. The gravy was phenomenal! I enjoyed the Yorkshire pudding since this is typically unavailable in the USA. For those that don‚Äôt know, it‚Äôs similar to a popover or bread.

Credit cards are accepted, and there‚Äôs plenty of seating upstairs, which makes it easy to enjoy our meal in a less crowded space. It was a nice stop to support local on our journey! (by Tara Konya) [9 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - A surprisingly amazing place to eat. We stopped here for lunch on our tour. The service was fast and friendly. The restaurant was almost cafeteria style but there was quick service. I even ordered vegan dumplings that weren't ready made and I was able to get them fast and fresh! Everything was so tasty. We tried almost every category of food offered and can completely recommend it. I was so pleasantly surprised by this place! Highly recommend! (by Nicola Flynn) [11 months ago] | Review 7: 3 stars - We stopped by here for lunch after our trip to the Cliffs of Moher. The lunch was average. There‚Äôs a good variety to choose from, but nothing special in terms of taste. Chicken wrap, chips, and a bit of salad ‚Äî everything was cold. The staff were friendly and very helpful. (by Marija V) [5 months ago] | Review 8: 4 stars - Good and tasty food for fast lunch even not too big choice. Very polite and nice staff. I can recommend this restaurant. (by Petr Bla≈æek) [4 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Absolutely perfect! The food was great, the staff was incredibly friendly, and the decor was tasteful. We got the beef stew, veggie soup, chickpeas, chocolate mouse , and bread. There wasn‚Äôt a single thing that disappointed us. (by Crystal Herzog) [a year ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - Food:
The stew was beyond amazing tender meat and creamy mash, and the fries were a bit too dry. barely potato mostly crust /coating crisp tasted in every bite.
Service:
served with a smile good portion asked if needed anything and explained where everything was available.
Atmosphere:
The washroom needed a bit of maintenance,
No high pressure on the flash when using the toilet.
As for tables too crowded to each other no personal space for smaller groups. (by Yuval Manor) [a year ago]

name: Sourdo'Farrell Bakery
address: 16 St Michael's Villas, Clonroad More, Ennis, Co. Clare, V95 YF7K, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Such a great bakery. The sourdough toastie was delicious and a cup of soup hit the spot. Nice folks - happy to see you üòä (by Lisa young) [a month ago] | Review 2: 1 star - Given this place a few chances and the service is often hit or miss but this is the final straw. ‚Ç¨9.50 for a goats cheese toastie with what can only be described as a scrape of goat cheese. There is barely anything on the sandwich! I grabbed this as a takeaway on my lunch break, had I sat in, I would have complained. ‚Ç¨9.50 for two slices of toasted bread essential. Disgraceful. (by Nadine Wall) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Slightly in an odd area but as it has such amazing reviews I decided to go out of my way as I do love a good bakery.
It was very busy which is a good sign, the goods are baked in-house too.
Well worth the trip as the food was outstanding.
The pictures of the food speak for itself ü§§ (by Philip Cunningham) [6 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Lovely spot for baked goods in Ennis. Range of pastries, toasties/sandwiches, and loaves. Small amount of seating indoors and outdoors. (by Le D) [a month ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Enjoyed a perfect coffee & tasty sweet treat this morning - gutted we're not local otherwise we would be regulars! A gem of a place! (by Natalie Rooney) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - I edited my review because a lot has changed, they redecorated and now there's more space to stand in line, though still hardly a place to sit down, unless the weather is well enough for sitting outside. It also seems to be better managed, since the pastries selection is wider and is still offered by noon, in the past they used to run out of the best items by noon.

This is definitely the best bakery in Ennis, maybe in all of Clare county.
Extremely good bread and morning pastries. Their cinnamon knot is perfection. The focaccia sandwiches (I like the vegetarian and the vegan, they're excellent!) are recommended, so rustic and flavourful, though the ones I bought today were a bit drier than I remembered, whoever made them was a little cheap with the spreads. (by gal silky) [Edited 6 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Best sourdough in the area! Worth every penny and I will definitely be coming back! Pastries are truly delicious and authentic- some even better than the originals in France - and this says a lot! Tasty coffee that you can enjoy for take out or inside. (by Magda Chelstowska) [a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Came for breakfast. Had a cappuccino, toastie, cinnamon roll, and apple turnover. Everything was tasty. The apple turnover was crazy buttery but the filling was amazing. The toastie was a nice grilled cheese with ham. The staff was friendly and the service was quick. Would recommend! (by Karla Mendez) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Amazing pastries and sandwiches! Came here both days we were in town because it was that good. The service is great and the queue is worth it. Highly recommend! (by Erin London) [2 months ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - To be honest the pastry is not great. We had maple pecan, pear almond and brioche and the dough was average not flaky not buttery - i have comparison to angel dust pastry in limerick, and compared with their crossaint which is flaky and buttery-  this is simply not good enough. Eaten it all but not worth returning (by Kate Ramsey) [8 months ago]

name: Aileens Restaurant
address: Leagard South, Spanish Point, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Great restaurant with plenty of exciting options! The scallops were delicious, and the duck was perfectly cooked ‚Äî tender, juicy, and nicely glazed.

The sommelier was very knowledgeable and gave us excellent wine recommendations! (by NotYourTypicalReviewer) [a week ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - Fabulous restaurant in the Armada hotel at Spanish Point. Excellent professional staff, wonderful service and great food. It is not cheap, but food and service this good never is. The salted seaweed butter that came with the bread was delicious. As was the duck. Mostly seafood but not exclusively. 08/2025 menu pictured. . (by Xray Mike) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Amazing carvery at the Willie Clancy Festival. One of the best carverys I‚Äôve ever had. Beef was still pink, lovely fresh crunchy vegetables and great choice. Staff were very attentive too. (by Michelle Glynn) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Would recommend
Food is really nice (by Colin Mcnamara) [3 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Stunning food, superb service, sublime views. (by Anne Casey) [3 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Absutelty incredible food. What a gem! (by Bradley Wickham) [3 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Everything is impressive. (by Dmitry Lunev) [5 months ago]

name: Gus O'Connor's Pub
address: Fisher St, Doonmacfelim, Doolin, Co. Clare, V95 FY67, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 2 stars - We came after seeing all the good reviews but left disappointed. We took the beef burger which was ok, nothing exceptional, the chicken wings which had a weird sauce on it, like ketchup cut with hot sauce, the beef stew which consisted of more carrots than meat and the mussels that were fine though we wondered if the pepper didn't fall entirely into the dish. I had a side of fries which were definitely not homemade. Very loud inside and music came late, at the end of our dinner. The bartenders were nice though. (by Chlo√© Morineau) [a week ago] | Review 2: 1 star - I was recommended this place by a friend, unfortunately our experience was a little different. We visited this pub yesterday for dinner (23.09.25), and unfortunately spent all day today with FOOD POISONING! We had the guinnes beef stew, fish and chips, and smoked salmon as starter, all to share. We are not sure which one was the problem but the place definitely needs to adjust their hygiene standards!
Beef stew was nice but felt like a standard stew no guinness flavor. The main dish service was too slow, we had to ask if our food is coming or not. Ambiance is nice, but never seen a pub that is not nice anyway. Servers were fine in service. (by Dilara Ademoƒülu) [a week ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Very lively place! Great atmosphere and really really good food! We were staying walking distance from the pub and went twice during our visit and loved the food each time. All the staff are very friendly and work so hard during busy dining hours. I loved the vegan pasta dish and the portion sizes are big. Only small gripe is that the little stools wrecked our bums after sitting for too long üòÇ (by Tee MacPherson) [5 days ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Great food, drinks and atmosphere. Staff greeted us very nicely and was very accommodating. There was great irish music at evening time! Highly recommended to visit while in Doolin, you wont regret it! (by Jean-Francois LeBlanc) [a week ago] | Review 5: 4 stars - Entered with no reception , chose table on our own preference. Sat for a while , then bar guy came to give suggestion how they run the order.

Semi-Self Serviced‚Ä¶
Order must be placed at the service counter and paid upfront.

Food is amazing (by Kingkarn K) [a week ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - This pub was genuinely one of my family‚Äôs favorite restaurants in Ireland. We stopped by in early June after visiting the Cliffs of Moher, and we haven‚Äôt stopped talking about it since. The atmosphere is warm and welcoming, offering a true glimpse of local Irish life.
