Live trad music added to the experience, and the Guinness stew was phenomenal. Plus, there‚Äôs a great selection of drinks to choose from. Seating can be hard to find depending on the time you visit, but it‚Äôs worth it :) (by Kyra Moore) [2 weeks ago] | Review 7: 4 stars - VERY crowded for dinner but very delicious food! ü•ò we had to wait a few minutes for our table because it was so full of people! If you want a chilled quiet place to enjoy your meal, you are probably wrong in this pub. It‚Äôs alive and bubbly (by Karsten R√ºbe) [2 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - On a wet and windy day, this was a warm welcome for lunch.  When you arrive, grab some menus from the bar and find a table of your choosing!  Place your order at the bar and make sure you know your table number for food delivery.  You‚Äôll receive the drinks when you order. The food was quick and quite good. (by Kristen & Colleston Morgan) [4 days ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - We have been Traveling now for 10 days in Ireland and  today add Gus O'Connor's we tasted the best food till now. We had the stew, Lamb and chicken breast. Loved the combination with drinking a glass of Murphy's red.

It can be very crowded and the tables are very small but that did not bother me.  The host is helpful to get you on a table and the food is served quickly. (by Marco Vronik) [2 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Excellent place.  Lively group of staff and patrons.  This place is HAPPENING.  The drinks and food were all great.  People were spot on.  And the live music was a real treat.  I'm part of the Gus Club, now. (by Mo) [Edited 3 weeks ago]

name: O'Donohues Pub
address: Craggagh, Fanore, Co. Clare, H91 DE29, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - We had a very nice dinner at the pub. There was a decent wait for a table, but they were very kind and did their best to seat us, even taking our order before our table was ready so when we sat the food came out pretty quick.

There aren't a ton of gluten free options but they did their best to accommodate. The seafood chowder was absolutely amazing, and they even substituted gluten free bread. Others in our group got the smash burgers and they said they were fantastic.

We didn't stick around for music unfortunately but the band members were very fun during their setup. Highly recommended!

Additional:

We enjoyed ourselves enough that we went back for dinner again. It was less busy this time. Everything was fantastic again! We all enjoyed our meals and the staff was great! (by Jesse K) [Edited a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - We stopped at this restaurant during our road trip with no expectations‚Äîand were absolutely blown away. The service was incredibly fast; within five minutes of ordering, our food was on the table. The menu is simple, but every dish we tried exceeded our expectations.

The beef burger was bursting with flavor, and the Irish beef stew was the perfect way to warm up after our chilly journey. The goat cheese beet salad was one of the best I‚Äôve had during my entire stay in Ireland. My only wish? Slightly larger portions.

The calm, peaceful ambience made the experience even better. (by Sang R) [a month ago] | Review 3: 3 stars - Visited as a tourist couple. Lots of parking opposite the pub and spotted easily on the way into town. Nice decor inside, very authentic, a little dark since we were sat away from the windows, not an issue on the whole. Considering the majority of the reviews state that the service is 5 star, sadly, we didn't feel all too welcome. No hello or smile when we entered the building. Then when our drinks came, the staff member proceeded to throw the placemats on the table which was surprising and rude?! The food arrived soon after and it was amazing, we ordered fish and chips and massaman curry, couldn't fault anything on either dish. However, nobody came over to ask how we were doing and didn't offer any more drinks unfortunately. After we finished it was some time before staff took our plates, even though there was only us and one other table. we were considering a dessert but honestly didn't feel like it due to the poor service all round. Settled the bill at the bar, gentleman who took our payment was the most friendly and asked us how the food was and gave us a friendly smile. Think it was a one-off as the service is usually great from what the reviews say. Stomachs full but a little dissapointed on the whole. (by Noah Sage) [3 weeks ago] | Review 4: 3 stars - Three of us had dinner here on a Tuesday night when it‚Äôs half empty. The food tasted ok and the Guinness and treacle brown bread was delicious. Hands down the top among those we ate in Ireland. The restaurant is located 20 minutes outside Doolin facing the ocean. The indoor decor and outside view was very nice. However, the service was nonexistent at the best. After more than 10 minutes of waiting nobody came to offer us water or even gave us menu. After prompting we were given menu but still were not asked about what we would like to drink , while there were at least three girls standing at the bar doing nothing. The staff at least past our table half dozen times, but no one stopped by or offered us menu or drink and apparently they had noticed that our table was empty.
I don‚Äôt want to jump to conclusion but we were the only non Caucasian family in the restaurant.
We have been to at least a dozen European countries through the years and this is the fist time I noticed the correlation between our skin color and service.

Aug 7, 2025 update:
I want to thank the management team for the thoughtful and sincere apology and feedback. I am happy the Google review eco system is working as it‚Äôs intended and business is receptive to the feedback.
Because of this I am updating the overall rating and the service rating from one star to three star, because I believe the lack of service we received was an honest mistake.
I‚Äôd love to come back one day if I am visiting Fanore again. In fact we stayed in the village within the walking distance of the restaurant for three nights and would‚Äôve returned for the sake of the lovely brown bread alone. (by Yongmei Zhang) [Edited a month ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - We ended up in Fanore yesterday unexpectedly. I quickly rang ahead and a table was reserved outside so we could take our little dog. From the moment we arrived, a fantastic chap called Donal warmly welcomed us and looked after us so well. He was helpful and entertaining without even trying to be! The food was excellent, highly recommend the O'Donohue's seafood linguine.
The view from the outside seating at the front was spectacular. There was great buzz to the place. Big thanks to Donal for top class Irish hospitality. (by Claire Wood) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - What a great pub. Fantastic food and friendly staff. We stopped in on a bus tour with 90 people, they had us all seated, fed and ready to go on time. Absolutely fantastic. (by Clive Dawson) [4 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - We came during a slow hour while traveling.  The fish and chips was the best of our travels in ireland thus far and the service was superb. Kind of sad we couldn't see it a bit busier.  But still very good (by Helen Harrell) [5 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Stayed in Fanore for a two week vacation. O‚ÄôDonohue‚Äôs was our home base pub and fast favorite during our time there. The service is great, food is delicious, and atmosphere is warm and inviting. Stop in for a pint or a bite- you won‚Äôt be disappointed. (by Charles ‚ÄúReggie‚Äù Elam) [6 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Stop over here on the way to the Cliffs of Moher, Doolin etc. you will not be disappointed.
Fine fare, the best Hake I have ever tasted  -a feast after a long trip and hike.
Staff lovely, attentive and chatty without being intrusive -don't pass it by. (by M M McGrath) [a month ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Very üòä nice place, along the road, good food, fast service!
Old pub, warm and full of history. (by Francois Mandonnaud) [a month ago]

name: The Grove Restaurant, Ennis
address: Tulla Rd, Rosslevan, Ennis, Co. Clare, V95 E03Y, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - A lovely spot for a light meal and a catch-up with a friend üòä
Crispy prawns and tasty dip were delicious, and the sticky toffee pudding was warm and sweet.
Relaxed vibe and friendly service at The Grove Roslevan, always a nice local choice! (by Ammy C Warny) [a month ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - We were staying about 10 mins away, but came into Ennis for dinner.  Enjoyed our meal here.  We asked about splitting a meal and they said they could serve us half portions (less expensive than two full portions).  A half portion was a lot of food!
Enjoyed another cold pint of Irish beer too.
Well worth the drive! (by Larry Hudson) [3 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Excellent food, service and atmosphere! Our dinner was so delicious, we had the cod & chips and the roast chicken with mushrooms in a creamy sauce and it was so good!!! Thank you!!! We will come back here next time we are in Ireland! ‚ù§Ô∏è (by Wendy Cruden) [a month ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - We were here for dinner as a group of 10 adults and 6 kids. From the moment we arrived the service and care provided for us was exceptional. The staff were excellent, the food was brilliant and the service was amazing.
Highly recommend. (by Daith√≠ Kilcourse) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Enjoyed the food immensely, the staff were friendly and very attentive.
Lovely relaxed atmosphere would highly recommend. (by Brian Malone) [Edited 3 months ago] | Review 6: 4 stars - We were a couple enjoying dinner. Starters onion rings and fried brie cheese. Main roasted beef (forgot the picture). Dessert Baileys cheese cake. Great and tasty food, friendly staff and relaxed environment. When we were seated the table wasn't nicely cleaned but nothing too bad. (by Ricardo Moura) [a year ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - The dinner of roast chicken and bacon was lovely,staff were welcoming and attentive. The only thing I fault today was the dessert, I ordered the sticky toffee pudding, when it arrived, the cream was already all melted into the sauce which was very watery, the pudding was served way too hot so ice cream and cream had all melted before I could finish the pudding, all tasted lovely tho but the texture wasn't good. My husband ordered the brownie and same thing, the brownie itself was completely melted and was like glop, nothing like a brownie being honest (by Jade Eirinn O Connor) [2 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - This is my first time in Ireland and the pub feed this establishment presents makes me never want to leave the country. As an Aussie, we know a good meal, take my word. Come for yummy food and lovely service. My brother refuses to go elsewhere, he has had the loin of bacon three nights in a row. He‚Äôll have it again every night til our flight back to Aus next Tuesday. (by Elsie M) [2 weeks ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - We went to the Grove restaurant to celebrate a family christening. The restaurant was busy but that didn't take away from the service we received. Food was excellent,Staff were friendly and helpful. Overall a very nice place to eat. Bar service was also excellent. (by john mccahill) [2 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Great choice of food for all tastes.  Brilliant service from Great  staff (by Valerie Rushe) [4 days ago]

name: The Sheridan Bar
address: Shannon Airport, Shannon, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews: Review 1: 5 stars - I visited the Sheridan Bar with some friends I was traveling around with at the time.  We hadn‚Äôt had a drink in several months and when stopped to layover at the Shannon airport in the middle of the night, so excited for the first drink in a while, and they were closed right then.  Well, the hospitable Irish weren‚Äôt about to let us go thirsty, so they opened it right up for us.  I was so impressed I made my way back a few years later so I could show it to my wife. (by Charles Hudson) [Edited a month ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - Great place to have a quick and hot bite before you fly from Shannon Airport. The food quality is excellent, but the service and atmosphere could be improved. (by Dr. Faisal) [a year ago] | Review 3: 4 stars - Catching a flight to M√†laga, needed food because we would be landing late, lovely simple menu but has everything you need, Fairly reasonably priced, wait time between 15 to 25 minutes, lovely food, you scan a QR and order online so no confusion, would definitely recommend (by Brian McHugh) [a month ago] | Review 4: 2 stars - Just had the worst fish and chips ever. It use to be a lovely bar with nice food. Don't know what happened but it has been getting worse and worse for the last year or two. Recently someone came up with a great idea to replace the waiting staff with an app. Unfortunately the app doesn't clean the tables and they look like mess. (by Piotr ≈ªurek) [5 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - I wanted to leave a review especially for one of the team members Faye- went out of her way to really help myself & my nephew this evening & I really appreciated it. She is great at her job. Thank you again Faye!! üòä (by Nuala Garvey) [2 months ago] | Review 6: 1 star - Not sure what's changed here in the last yr but it's gone seriously downhill, filthy dirty, loads of flies, inedible food, rude staff. Customers having to clear tables to sit down, while staff chatted behind bar. Real shame was always a nice end to our trip this side of Ireland. (by Olivia Gleeson) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Reasonably good food, although the seafood chowder was full of bones so it put me off. Nice calm place to sit and relax though, whilst waiting for our flights. (by Emo Bish) [3 months ago] | Review 8: 2 stars - Online ordering was not open despite notices saying it was. Toast was cold. Scrambled egg, toast and cappuccino cost ‚Ç¨13.  Not great. (by L. A.) [5 days ago] | Review 9: 1 star - The Chinese woman that was working there has no business working in hospitality the rudest person I ever came across. Literally threw our food at us place is busy dosnt seem to be enough staff to cope with the business. Lots dirty tables & people sitting at tables not eating or drinking. Food was ok could have been hotter (by Tanya Ryan) [a week ago] | Review 10: 2 stars - Absolute rip off....‚Ç¨18.50 for a single breakfast...wasn't even great....absolute disgrace...chap serving the alcohol was good but the food section taff they were awful, so slow...one girl on her phone while people waited to be served...food tray was filthy and the tables were sticky....not good at all...obviously abusing the fact it's the only place open for early flights....won't be getting my money again (by Gerard Plunkett) [2 weeks ago]

name: Peppermill
address: Business Park, Quin Rd, Bunnow, Ennis, Co. Co, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 4 stars - I went here with my husband and kids for breakfast/brunch on a Saturday morning and we were very pleased with all the delicious options available. The servers were very polite and quick. They make some delicious suggestions if you are undecided because all the food is so good!!!
The prices are very reasonable and the portions are huge!! Very good value for money and the seating upstairs was comfortable and very well spaced

We will definitely be visiting again whenever we want to get out for a quick meal. (by Juliana Antoine-Hargreaves) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Chosen from Google maps restaurants search, and then ‚ÄòIrish‚Äô we were nor prepared to be directed to the back end of a business/retail park!

But we were very glad that we found it.  Excellent food and good size portions, no room for sweet, three mains, 2 coffees and a Coke for under ‚Ç¨54 or ¬£45.

Evidently popular with people on the park, but also noticed some retired, and also drivers getting takeaways.  Everything very slick at a busy time of the day. (by Ian Billings) [a year ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Location is inside an industrial area.  It's surprisingly excellent ! Very good breakfast! The best waffles I've eaten anywhere in Ireland,  hands down! Would recommend big time. The staff was very friendly (by AEGV V) [Edited 6 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - The Peppermill is a brilliant restaurant with fabulous quality food, friendly staff and top notch service.  I've dined at the Peppermill several times and the food has always been excellent and  the price is reasonable.  Their barista coffee is fantastic and they do a lovely sourdough bread. I'd highly recommend the Peppermill. (by Breand√°n √ì L√∫anaigh) [Edited 11 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - A fast casual coffee shop, bakery, and lunch counter. Warm, friendly interior and homemade classics. Get a hot lunch (think mash, roasted meats, juicy messy sandwiches) or a lovely breakfast (pancakes, eggs, house made toast) with tea or full coffee bar. Tucked into an unassuming little warehouse-type collection of buildings. (by Julie Fox) [4 weeks ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Generous portions of excellent food served by friendly staff at fair prices. Best meal I've had in Ennis in 7 days.  I'll be back to try more.  The breakfast looks really good. (by Jerry James) [2 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Love eating here.  The food is delicious and very good quality. (by Claudiana C) [Edited 2 years ago] | Review 8: 2 stars - Very disappointing. I visited here on Thursday morning for breakfast with my mam and granda and the portion is so ridiculously small for the price. It wasn‚Äôt a mini breakfast we ordered, it was the full Irish!!  The ‚Äòpotato cakes‚Äô were definitely yesterdays mash , beans or anything else were add on. I visited here about a year ago or so and the portions were normal but they have since switched to tiny rectangular plates to get away with small portions but still the price was expensive for what you get and the quality. Anyway I won‚Äôt be returning. (by Jessica Power) [2 months ago] | Review 9: 3 stars - Was in there today, with my 10 month old, and I asked for 1 single egg, scrambled on a plate for him to eat. I was charged ‚Ç¨8 euros for this. An absolute joke. Surely this can't be right? Definitely won't be returning if this was correct and this is how much they are charging. (by Meg xxx) [2 months ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - Casual counter-service restaurant with overwhelming options and very little guidance on how/where to order.  Food was great, especially the Peppermill Toastie!  People were friendly. No wifi (by Remy L-Wi) [2 months ago]

name: The Snack Shack
address: Abbey Street Car Park, Clonroad Beg, Ennis, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Going to the snack shack for years and love it in there. The staff are brilliant always greeting you with a smile and a chat. It's worth stopping in and the sandwich box's you can get are just perfect and tasty. Highly recommended (by BrenKdrone Works) [a year ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - If you happen to be in Ennis, maybe on the way to Cliffs of Moher and looking for a good place to get a quick sandwich. I would highly recommend the Snack Shack. This was by far the best sandwich I have had in all of Ireland and the people there couldn‚Äôt be more friendly and accommodating. The bread was fresh and delicious and they make it to order. Highly recommend! (by Michael Faustgen) [a year ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Excellent service & superb value for high quality food. The Snack Shack is the best place in town for lunch or a cuppa tea or coffee. The Atmosphere is great, the staff are warm & welcoming.
When I leave the Snack Shack, I don't just leave with my lunch & tea, I leave with a smile on my face and a feeling of community & connection.
Highly recommend the lunchitto üëåüíØ
‚úåÔ∏è&‚ù§Ô∏è (by Shane Dillon) [a year ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Absolutely outstanding staff. I was having a bad day and the absolute kindness of these friendly staff completely changed my day. What amazing people!! You cannot put a price on that! I was just buying a sandwhich and they restored my faith in humanity! (by Jessica) [Edited a year ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - So good.  Very delicious.  They offer many different kinds of sandwiches and different types of breads.  I got mine toasted and was very happy with it. (by Molly Deimeke) [a year ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - My uncle Noel has been going to the snack shack for years and we popped in today so I could see it for myself!! We got sandwiches and coffee - absolutely delicious. Food and coffee was great quality for the price and service is top tier. Trina is a star!! X (by Niamh Russell) [4 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Been going since I was in school and it‚Äôs still the best cheap lunch in Ennis. (by Scott Molloy) [9 months ago] | Review 8: 4 stars - Great atmosphere, lovely staff, good hearty sandwiches at cheap prices  . Seating area to accommodate up to 30 people. Delicious and nutritious. Would recommend this to students. Student deals available. (by Rian Costello) [7 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Absolutely love going here. Great selection of salads sandwiches wraps etc. Nothing is too much trouble for them. You get a great service here and Terena, Edel, Damian and all the gang are so friendly and welcoming. Definitely well worth a visit. (by Monica Cassidy) [7 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - We love the Snack Shack in our house! Everytime we go to town the boys want to go for their hot chocolate treat. Food is great and the staff are friendly and it's always service with a smile!!  catering for parties etc always top class and you can be sure there will always be enough for everyone! (by Pamela McCarthy) [9 years ago]

name: Shannon Palace
address: Shannon Town Centre, Tullyvarraga, Shannon, Co. Clare, Ireland
service_options: Panda Chinese Takeaway ¬∑ 3.0 stars ¬∑ 1 review ¬∑ Chinese Takeout
reviews: Review 1: 5 stars - Amazing food,very clean,attentive staff! (by Victoria G) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Food is delicious, the staff are very helpful and friendly. The restaurant is very clean and they also do parties. (by Geraldine Hickey) [4 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Best Chinese I had in years. You can tell everything is very fresh. Chicken chesse rolls are the best I have ever had. Chicken curry fried rice was so fresh it‚Äôs 10/10 for me. A lot of Chinese food I eat I feel like crap after it because it‚Äôs not fresh but this Chinese has to get the credit it deserves for freshness. (by adam Kid) [8 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Great food and great customer service. I have to give extra credit for when I called in asking for gluten free options and spoke to two different people who were extremely informative and got me a perfect order. (by Dominika T) [9 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Fantastic restaurant, best salt and chili shredded chicken I've ever had üòÅ (by L C) [7 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - We ordered takeaway. Starters which was chicken and corn soup and spring rolls. Mains were sweet and sour pork with rice and beef chow mein with noodles. Portions were generous and service was super quick, 15 min till we could collect. Reasonably priced and the food was really amazing ü§© We ordered for a family of 5 and received two complimentary ‚Äúdishes‚Äù. Prawn crackers and some spicy chicken wings. We will definitely be back. (by Sandra Rose) [2 years ago] | Review 7: 1 star - Well delivery was a pure 10 out of 10. Food was  Dismal at best I ordered compo chicken what I got was a watery soup absolutely tasteless. As I said it as a delivery so the meal I bought came with chips that were as cold as the night air. Absolutely sorry I ordered with them. The delivery guy was nice and polite. So to recap food was extremely tasteless watery more nuts then chicken. Extremely poor guys. I Won't bother with this restaurant again. (by Thomas Fitzgerald) [2 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Fancy Restaurant indeed!. The food is fresh and absolutely delicious!. Food isn't fatty or filling. Great selection on the menu. The staff is very friendly and welcoming. I would 100% recommend this to anyone! (by m ‚ÄúMM‚Äù m) [2 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - I went here with my friend and we ordered a  take away, It was the first time I was coming here and the inside of the restaurant was very nice and the food menu had a great selection. I was greeted by the lovely staff and it only took about 10-15 mins to wait to get my food. The food I ordered was a spicy box and it was pretty good for the price, nothing too major. Overall I think that this place has good prices for its food and it is fast. (by Phil Ryan) [2 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Love the food. Fast and effecient service. Very good value for money. Will come back many more times. (by Kevin B Doherty) [4 years ago]

name: Hochak Asian Street Food
address: Br√∫ Na Sionna, 9E Shannon Town Centre, Tullyglass, Shannon, Co. Clare, Ireland
service_options: Panda Chinese Takeaway ¬∑ 3.0 stars ¬∑ 1 review ¬∑ Chinese Takeout
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - The food here was absolutely great, great quality meat in the dishes and portions were big, also threw in some free momos which were amazing, highly recommend this place for food (by Chris Sheehan) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - Food is OK, I got generous portion. On the down side, the place was empty. (by Mov iR) [3 weeks ago] | Review 3: 3 stars - Decent Chinese. Starters aren't upto standard for the price. Ordered momo. Which is a Nepalese dumplings. If you look in the picture they are just frozen gyoza's !!
Ordered calamari. Was very very rubbery. ‚Ç¨7 gone waste in that.
Pad thai was good for the price. ‚Ç¨7.50 and a decent portion üëå next time won't order any starters.

N.B. Shannon town deserves good quality food. Since my takeway haul in Shannon I'm very disappointed üòû (by Jamiur Rahman Choudhury) [3 years ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Good Chinese style Asian food. The crispy chicken and fried rice was good. They have only take away for lunch and dine in for dinner. (by Shaadhanaa) [a year ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - The spicy bag is the only thing that I hav gotten so far and the both times that I have got it it had been delicious. The workers there are really kind and helpful. The price is worth it.  The spicy bag is only ‚Ç¨7.80 but it would feed two people. The first time I got it it was really spicy and the chips were the spiciest. The chicken was lovely as well. I would really recommend it as a place if you love Chinese food or just spicy food in general. (by Mollie Trew Whelan) [8 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Lovely people here and the place was very nice I love the atmosphere, I got a boba drink (by Phil Ryan) [2 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Delicious food, very nice and friendly people, and free ice cream. (by Tania Rodrigues) [7 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - My family adores their takeaway pizza boxes with salt and chilli selection. The biggest one is enough to feed several ravenous teenagers, they are really packed to bulging. I tried their duck and it was also lovely. The service is super friendly and we got the prawn crackers for free. Highly recommended! (by Axik Fumbles (Axik Fumbles)) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Spicy, tasty and delicious food! Service was amazing, let us eat in the restaurant even though they were only doing takeaway that night (by Paige Rigby) [11 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Absolutely lovely staff who let us dine inside even though they weren't doing service. The food (bento box + pineapple fried rice) was also really nice, with special mention to the delicious honey boba tea. Very reasonably priced. We'll definitely come back next time we are in the area. (by Am√©lie V.V.) [2 years ago]

name: The Quilty Tavern
address: Ennis Rd, Quilty West, Ennis, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 4 stars - Nice cozy pub with ample seating.   Decent selection on the menu.  We went for Club sammich, BLT, classic ham and cheese , all came with chips and slaw. Youngest had pasta. (by Jay Carpenter) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Stopped at Quilty Tavern on our way through town on a whim. We are so glad that we did! The food was delicious and the view out the bar windows on the front while we ate was amazing. The service was great and everyone was very friendly. Also, the bathrooms were very clean which was SO lovely. Would definitely recommend!! (by Kylie) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Always an excellent stay
Rooms are immaculate
Amazing showers and right beside the water and there a bar and restaurant downstairs.
Highly recommend (by Padraig McGuire (BusManPaddy)) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - What a beautiful little pub on the country side. We visited for a friend‚Äôs wedding and stayed at the bnb upstairs and loved our little weekend at the Quilty. Wonderful food, crips pints, and beautiful scenery. (by Jeremy H) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Christening set up was totally unexpected,Cora went all out with the decorations, we just added the balloons. Fantastic staff as always, super friendly and helpful. Hats off to the kitchen staff and Brian food was delicious and massive portions.
The rooms are lovely, clean and cozy and quiet. (by Catherine o'dea) [Edited a year ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - We're at the BBQ on the 2nd day of a fabulous family wedding in the  family owned and run Quilty Tavern. B&B overhead is newly refurbished and really lovely. Great pub downstairs serves food , the Chowder is the business! Owner Brian and his wife  can't do enough for everyone. Great place to stay for Spanish Point and Armada Hotel functions.
What a view from the bedrooms. (by Fajon Construction) [a year ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - On way back to home we make stop to eat some food with kids. The food whose nice. Soup need to be more mixed for sure. Fish and chips very good. Lamb whose ok too. Staff very friendly. (by Pix360_adam) [7 years ago] | Review 8: 4 stars - Recommended for dinner, and 4 out of five were very happy. Waitress was friendly and busy as dealing with a birthday party in the function room too.  It has a very small menu but I'd recommend you  deffo go 4 the fish and chips. Massive portions and beautiful soft fish. Everything is piping hot. The only disappointment was the special of the day, a pepper chicken dish which had overcooked chicken covered in a poor effort of a pepper sauce. Almost no flavor at all from the dish. So 1 was disappointed and 4 happy ( kids had chicken nuggets and chips). It's a dining room in a pub, so grand for a casual night, but if you want a greater variety of menu or a very classy night out, this may not the place to dine. (by K O'R) [Edited 2 years ago] | Review 9: 4 stars - Food was great.. server not the friendliest:(  wouldn't go back... service folks can make or break you! (by Karen Guidry) [a month ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - The food here is top class and  plentiful
Highly recommended (by Dave Mullins) [2 weeks ago]

name: The Pier Head Bar & Restaurant
address: The Quay, Kinvarra, Co. Galway, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - They were able to squeeze us in rather quickly on a busy night, we were very grateful! The food was delicious as well. I loved the lamb! Beautiful setting right by the water. We got to sit outside in the little enclosed patio area. Servers were attentive and pleasant. Sept 15, 2024. (by A J (Lexi)) [2 weeks ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Recommended to us by Fallon‚Äôs B&B. I was a bit apprehensive when I sat down and saw the prices - it was a little more than I usually like to spend, but OMG the food was so mouth-wateringly good it was worth every penny! The service was excellent too, very friendly and attentive staff without being overbearing. The fish of the day (Seabass) came with a dreamy buttery white wine sauce - 100% recommend! (by Amanda) [a week ago] | Review 3: 4 stars - A great view of the bay from most windows. Seating available in a Friday at 2PM. We got seafood chowder which was nice and creamy and had a good amount of seafood. Nice flavor too. That comes with bread, both brown and white and butter. Also ordered some battered mushrooms which came with salad, was so so. Service was good until it was time to checkout we had to chase them down lol. It was packed, you think they'd want us out but no rush so. Dinner menu looked pretty good too. (by Elk Hunter) [a month ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Great local food experience,  massive portion. Great service. Loved the local vibe. I even loved the local ale which I do not ofter drink. (by DaBoss Robert) [2 weeks ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - The Pier Head Bar and Restaurant in Kinvara exceeded all expectations! We ordered local Irish beer, fish and chips (haddock), lamb, and the seafood trio ‚Äî and every single dish was absolutely delicious. The fish was fresh and flaky, the lamb was tender and flavorful, and the seafood trio was a highlight with generous portions and perfect seasoning.

The atmosphere was warm and inviting, with stunning views of the harbor that made the meal even more special. The staff were friendly and attentive without being overbearing.

A must-visit spot if you‚Äôre in Kinvara ‚Äî fantastic food, great drinks, and a cozy coastal vibe! (by Praneet Raj) [2 months ago] | Review 6: 4 stars - The staff were attentive lovely views over the bay.the food was great but the steak was served without any garnish at all (by Joe Connolly) [3 months ago] | Review 7: 4 stars - Lovely, friendly place. Dogs welcome in the outer conservatory area. High quality, delicious food. Quick service. High standard of decor. Excellent location with lovely views from the restaurant, if you don't have a dog with you! Highly recommended. As well as the  rack of lamb and half a roast duck, we enjoyed the delicious house French Merlot, Orchard Thieves Cider and an Irish coffee. I can also recommend the sticky toffee pudding. (by Anna Neal) [3 weeks ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Beautiful restaurant at the harbour of Kinvara. The service is friendly and quite fast. The food is very delicious and of high quality. In addition, the plates looks really great when served and the price of the food was very reasonable as well! (by Victor Drieskens) [2 months ago] | Review 9: 4 stars - Really liked this place. I have eaten in it a number of times from a few people to around 15 people. The food was excellent and the service was very good. There were no complaints by any of the groups I was with. (by John Dunne) [6 days ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - Enjoyed lunch here on a drive from Galway to Doolin. Kinvarra is only about 15 mins from Galway but such a pretty place to stop and take a stroll after getting out of the traffic in the town and the best option on that part of the coast road. (by Claire Hornsby) [4 months ago]

name: The Lodge Restaurant
address: Ennistymon Rd, Dough, Lahinch, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Best dining experience in Lahinch, Liscannor and Doolin!
Fantastic food with incredible attention to detail‚Ä¶ super staff, and the entire hotel is spotless!
We love Vaughan‚Äôs Lodge! (by Claire Ella) [a year ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - I recently had the pleasure of dining at Vaughan, and it was truly an unforgettable experience. This charming and cozy restaurant is perfect for special occasions, offering an intimate atmosphere that makes you feel right at home. The food was absolutely delicious, with every dish bursting with flavor and beautifully presented. The attention to detail, both in the service and the menu, made the evening exceptional. Whether you're celebrating a special moment or simply want to enjoy a fantastic meal, Vaughan is the perfect choice. Highly recommended. (by –†–æ–∑–º–µ—Ç–∞–Ω—é–∫ –õ–µ—Å—è) [a year ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Amazing experience ! Daniel took care of us and was very attentive. We will definitely be back. Highly recommended (by MrsRedhead Photography (Ireland)) [a year ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - We had a lovely dinner that was very special from start to finish.  The amuse Bouche, Caesar salad, scallops, halibut, and wine were all superb. The waiter was wonderful: so well informed and friendly and helpful about our travels. The meal was as good as we had in Paris or in New York. (by Libby Doggett) [a year ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - We had Daniel as our waiter and he was amazing! Such a lovely friendly fella & made the night special! Food was gorgeous, ambience was lovely & we‚Äôll definitely be back! What a lovely night! (by Dee Foley) [a year ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - This was an incredible meal, better than some Michelin restaurants I‚Äôve eaten at. It probably will get a star at some point. It also wasn‚Äôt crazy expensive. The service was great and atmosphere was very relaxing. (by Daniel) [a year ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Just a wonderful dining experience with some good friends. Best lamb I have had in many years and the service from Daniel was just terrific. Will be back :) (by Tim M) [a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Great food, great service. (by Sinead Corcoran) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Food was top notch, service so friendly yet professional. This place is somewhere I would definately recommend, a real treat, Daniel is a master of his craft üòç (by Jessamy OConnor) [a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Delicious food made with quality produce.
Vegan and vegetarian options were exceptional.
Excellent seafood too (and the rest). (by Hugh Galloway) [a year ago]

name: Beag Cafe
address: Corner House, Henry St, Kilrush, Co. Clare, V15 Y966, Ireland
service_options: Coffeys Takeaway ¬∑ 3.8 stars ¬∑ 95 reviews ¬∑ Takeout restaurant
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Perfect stop on your way to Cliff of Moher, when you get off the Shannon Ferry.
Excellent coffee, amazing toasties and delicious bakes. Everything is homemade, included the sourdough. Small by place, wood and stone, warm atmosphere and professional service. (by Ana√Øs Recco) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Having walked through the town of Kilrush we stumbled into Beag cafe.
What a surprise, excellent coffee and the best selection of cakes ever. The food menu includes tosties, salads, breakfast bowl amongst many others. By the time we finished our coffee the cafe was full of happy customers.
Don‚Äôt miss it! (by Xavier Kingsland) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Beyond gorgeous, such a really beautiful spot, cute touches all around. Very delicious food and great coffee! (by Leonie Kerins) [4 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Beag is definitely a must when visiting the beautiful Killrush.
A wide variety of toasties, coffees and bakery, with a deep research for quality ingredients that perfectly translate into curious and tasty dishes.
Service was smooth and all the staff seems passionate about their job.
It's a very welcoming and aesthetically pleasing location that perfectly mixes tradition with a few modern elements of decor.
I will be back soon!
P.S definitely try "The Open" toasty! (by Cristian Pineda) [a year ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Nice little cafe but get here early, selection of pastries dwindles as the day goes on. Staff is super sweet. (by Beth) [Edited 2 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Fabulous little Cafe for excellent coffees and the most amazing ham and cheese toastie I ever had!!! Great options for vegetarians too üòã I would highly recommend a stop here for breakfast or lunch in the beautiful maritime town of Kilrush Co ClareüòÄ Their delicious coffee and walnut buns are incredible, staff so friendly and helpful! (by Fiona Glynn O'Shea) [a month ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Such a beautiful spot. Sweet treats and sandwiches homemade with love using local suppliers such as gubbeen and calendar coffee. Cheese and ham toastie dunked into leek and potato soup ü§§ followed by a cinnamon and orange cookie and coffee perfect !! Owners Andrew and Aoife are so sweet and friendly (by Anna Flood) [2 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Beag is a wonderfully unique caf√© in this charming coastal town. The ingredients are locally sourced - and you can taste the difference! I enjoyed a Classic Toastie and a delicious latte made to order - with a few freshly baked cinnamon raisin buns ordered to-go (I couldn't help myself). The staff and ownership add to the cozy experience. Beag owners Andrew and Aoife spent time conversing with me and my travel companions after learning we were over from the States. Aside from their quick wit and cooking talents, they were able to make recommendations for shopping and sightseeing around Kilrush and beyond. It was a five star experience all the way - I can't wait to be back in West Clare for another Toastie ASAP! (by Sean Hannon) [6 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Delicious food and coffee in a beautiful setting. Gorgeous local produce and a perfect menu of toasties and baked treats. Can't wait for our next visit. (by Hannah O'Reilly) [Edited 2 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - The sandwiches are incredible with vegan and vegetarian options. The ‚Äúcheesie‚Äù with smoked gubeen cheese is the best grilled cheese sandwich I‚Äôve ever had. The coffee is the best around (no charge for alternative milk!) and the sweet treats are out of this world. Really enjoyed the vibe, the decor and the wonderful service. Such an amazing cafe! (by Josh Donnelly) [Edited a year ago]

name: Burren Fine Wine & Food
address: Corkscrewhill Road, Croagh North, Ballyvaughan, Co. Clare, H91 WY94, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Lovely little place right by the road which you only really stumble over by coincidence.
Incredible food, quick service and a charming and pleasant setting makes for a real highlight for anyone who's hungry after visiting Galway or the Cliffs of Moher.
We had a platter of local meats and cheeses and a Peperoni Pizza, both arrived fast and matched our expectations.

Big recommendation. (by Philipp Sch√ºtz) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - This place was unbelievably good. As an american, the water was a bit strange, but everything else we had was superb, which included the meaty and special pizzas, the soup and the mango chicken salad.  This place is difficult to find, but very much worth the drive. It seems a bit slow for business which is sad because the public is wasting the value and potential of such a great gem, however, this does translate into the excellent service, making it more personal. This is by far the best food we've had in our two days in Ireland. (by John Dyer) [13 years ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Really wonderful experience. After visiting the cliffs, we stumbled upon this place in the pouring rain. The food was excellent and the service was quick. The restaurant is small, warm, and cheerful. The mother and daughter who own the restaraunt were lovely and personable. Would highly recommend! (by Sophia Meehan) [9 years ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Amazing place, little hidden paradise. The food is great, best pizza had in long time for the kids, other adult main dishes are exceptional too, great coffee, very child friendly. The interior of the restaurant is an refurbished old 18 century coachhouse, plenty of charms and characters. The outdoor seating area is beautiful, really relaxing. Strongly recommend. (by Dara Dunne) [11 years ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - I had gone there for a special dinner night, it was a multiple course meal all planned out and every step of the way was great. Wonderful service and great atmosphere. Next time I'm in Ireland I will definitely find my way back here. (by Matthew Pearce) [6 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - We came across this lovely caf√© as we drove north from Doolin to Galway.  It is an unbelievable gem tucked into the hillside.  Beautiful furnishings, wonderful food, and an extensive collection of wine curated by an award-winning proprietress.  Can't give this one enough stars.  They offer a walker's lunch of soup, salad, homemade bread, dessert and tea for only 10 euros. (by Pam Brewer) [10 years ago] | Review 7: 4 stars - Excellent local winery. Spectacular setting- the challenging driving conditions and amazing scenery will assure that you take home rather than consume there! (by Martin Hynes) [3 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Went here for lunch. There is a lovely menu and gorgeous freshly made food. I would highly recommend this place. They close down for the Winter. (by Mai Rooney) [8 years ago] | Review 9: 4 stars - Small little place with good selection of austrian wines and some local cheeses and cuts to try. Nice breads and soups too. (by Feech23) [9 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Stopped in for lunch with friends before I headed out of town. Great pizzas and other food. (by Henry) [9 years ago]

name: Shannon Fresh Grill
address: Old ESB Office, Unit 1 Shannon Town Centre, Tullyvarraga, Shannon, Co. Clare, V14 R202, Ireland
reviews: Review 1: 5 stars - Best food fresh chips and fish I like it (by awais awais) [3 days ago]

name: Kenny's Bar
address: Main St, Dough, Lahinch, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 4 stars - Enjoyed our visit to the Cliffs and stopped off here to grab a bite before heading back to Dublin.  The food was served hot and tasted great.  The wraps were full of food and the burgers tasted great.  Thought the patties were an odd shape, almost a ball opposed to flat making it a little harder to eat without making a mess.  Overall we enjoyed our visit and atmosphere, we also loved the fact it was dog friendly. (by Rob Stirling) [4 weeks ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - There is nothing else I would ask to a Bar/Restaurant. The food was absolutely delicious and goes accordingly with it's price. The staff was quick and kind and we didn't have to wait too much for the meals to come.
The ambient favored small talk with friends and family without any trouble, with no loud noises and with some beatiful music playing at low volume.
Absolutely stunning!!! (by Iv√°n Cant√≥ Gisbert) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - We were on the way to Moher Cliffs. We decides to stop here to have lunch. The place is lovely!! The decorations are from around the world, and its full of colour.

The food is on another level. We had the Catch of the day, Goujon chicken wrap and the curry. OMG one of the best places in Ireland I have tasted. We are going to repeat for sure.

The staff was great always caring about how our lunch was going. Its a very very good place to have lunch dinner or whatever (by Andr√©s Canto (KireiT)) [a month ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Food was beautiful - very fresh and tasted amazing. We had seafood chowder which was delightful. Fish of the day was cooked beautifully, very flakey and light batter. Very good specials board with daily options. Service was very quick, staff extremely friendly and attentive. Kenny's also had a very welcoming and warm atmosphere (by Matt Overs) [7 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Currently sitting down on the bar and had to write this review. All around great. Guinness tastes great. We had their burger and chicken curry and both were fantastic. The chowder and wings were amazing also. Cool atmosphere and they were playing 80‚Äôs music!!! (by Vip Garg) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Visiting from Australia.  The service is bloody good. The foods even better. Seafood chowder was the best I've had.  Cajun chicken salad was again one of the best I've tasted.

Awesome job üëè üëç (by Corey Rayner) [a week ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Really nice pub, food was delicious, staff were very friendly and helpful. They have a great special‚Äôs menu to go with the already good regular menu. I had the pot of mussels and my husband had the spicy chipotle chicken sandwich, both were really good. Nice atmosphere in the bar, it did get really busy so it might be difficult to get a table at times but worth the wait. (by Clare Mercer) [2 weeks ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - We are finishing up a week in Lahinch and we ate here with our two young kids three times, it was so good! We loved everything about it, the atmosphere, the service and the food! They were super great with our kids, bringing coloring, bringing their food at first. And the food was just so good. It kept us coming back! We highly recommend checking it out if you‚Äôre in Lahinch! (by Sarah B) [a month ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Great pub!  Friendly staff and patrons.  Food is good- chowder was outstanding! (by John Lazzara) [2 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Lovely spot. Myself and partner visited yesterday and had dinner with drinks. The staff were extremely efficient and very friendly. A lovely atmosphere also, very friendly. I had the catch of the day for dinner and it was so fresh, very tasty. Will definitely be visiting this little gem again üòä! (by Susan Ryan) [4 months ago]

name: Oile√°n
address: 26 Henry St, Kilrush, Co. Clare, V15 VA47, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - I had a great experience at this restaurant! The food was tasty and full of flavor. The chowder was the best I've ever had‚Äîrich, creamy, and perfectly seasoned. You can really tell the chef knows what they're doing; everything was cooked to perfection. Highly recommend if you're looking for delicious food and great quality! (by –Ø–Ω–∞ –ü–æ–ª–∏—â—É–∫) [2 weeks ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Loved it! I had the pork chop - wow! But my wife had fish & chips - Probably the best fish & chips I've ever tasted!! Beautiful wine and great service! This is the only reason to visit Kilrush!! üòâ (by Frank Holden) [4 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Was in on Sunday for a family meal, I was over from England visiting family. We decided to go somewhere nice for my last day. I had one of the days Chef Specials the Hake and Chips (how very English of me I know), it was amazing the fish was perfectly done, perfectly flaky with the batter being crispy but not overdone. The triple cooked chips are an absolute joy. The rest of the party had the monkfish curry or the pasta dishes and there were clean plates all round. I might have sampled a fair few items from the cocktail menu too all of which were very tasty and more than reasonably priced. Hope to return again soon! (by Connor Clancy) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - I rolled into Kilrush a bit late (2000 hr) and didn't get to finding a place to eat until 2030 -- Oilean was nearby and the menu looked great (and was still serving food until 2100).

It did not disappoint -- I had the mussels as a starter, the chicken dish as a main, and 2 pints of Guinness for just over 50 EUR but the best parts, as usual were the people here Ireland.  I spoke with a kind, charming gentleman, Robert, who happened to be sitting with his family next to me.  The staff (family owned and operated) who were so kind, friendly, and helpful.  I highly recommend you visit if you are in Kilrush! (by David Choi) [3 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - I recently visited Oilean in Clare with my girlfriend, and I have to say, it was an amazing experience! The service was excellent; our waiter really nailed my drink, preparing it exactly how I ordered it. Everything we tried was delicious and incredibly fresh. I would definitely rate this place 5 stars! If you're thinking about what to order, I highly recommend the steak. It was absolutely fantastic. Thanks for a great meal! (by josh1239063) [6 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Local whiskey and great menu! This is the best place I‚Äôve visited in Kilrush! The food is amazing. I had the chicken wings, curried monkfish, apple and brandy tart with tons of whiskey and Guinness!! Please stop by and enjoy! (by S) [a week ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Lovely evening from starter to dessert, everything was delicious. Friendly staff and beautiful decor! Will be back (by Aoibhe O Connell) [a month ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - You HAVE to experience dining in this gem Haven‚Äôt had a meal like this for years!
Generous helpings, great , original flavours.
Mussels‚Ä¶ lots and lots‚Ä¶ in a really tasty sauce.
John Dory exquisite.
Battered hake gorgeous‚Ä¶ unusually light batter with very original flavour.
Definitely travel to come again.
Staff so friendly, great atmosphere.
Well done to the owners, chef and staff.
100% best I‚Äôve had for years. (by Noelline Connell) [2 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - One of the best restaurants I've been to in a long time! The food was absolutely fantastic and made me want to cook the same at home. The staff was very friendly and the atmosphere was very welcoming with a nice interior and good music. Can definitely recommend! (by Jan Goetschi) [2 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - We came in the tail end of the night they found space for us with grace, we were delighted to find the veggie options were not just an afterthought - I also asked if the chef would be able to adjust the food! We didn‚Äôt need to as we found enough for us! Delicious, well presented. Friendly staff. (by Karen Leech) [7 months ago]

name: The Lodge Restaurant Lahinch
address: Ennistymon Rd, Dough, Lahinch, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - I can't recommend this place enough. The food was gorgeous we had the Caesar salad and the burger which were both delicious. The service was great we had Emma and Daniel. We met the family who ran the place and it made our night special. Definitely check this place out we will be back!! (by Canion Summers) [3 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - An amazing evening with delicious food, super friendly staff and a cozy atmosphere! We had the plaice fish, it was cooked to perfection and the roasted cauliflower was also amazing. Delightful, family run business, will be back!! (by CÔøΩline Gally) [3 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - We travelled arround in Ireland.  The Lodge is one of the best restaurants we had dinner. Excellent food,  fresh, tasty  high quality.
All the staff is very friendly and make you feel welcome.. (by Cl Kr) [3 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Daniel the waiter was fantastic & food was delicious ü§§ (by ciara marron) [3 months ago]

name: Antidote Kitchen
address: 308b Main N Rd, Clare SA 5453, Australia
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Great little place for an excellent breakfast in the Clare Valley region. Perfect stop before driving back to Adelaide. Parking in the front or at the back. The service was excellent.  The food was impeccable, and the coffee was great, too. Magical experience to end our weekend in Clare. (by Rodger van den Berg) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Absolutely loved our visit to Antidote Clare Valley!
The drinks were some of the best we‚Äôve ever had.

The chicken tikka‚Äîperfectly cooked, full of smoky spice, and absolutely delicious. The atmosphere is relaxed yet stylish, and the service was warm and welcoming. Highly recommended for a great meal and drinks in the valley! (by Ashok Baghel) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Amazing food, we came back twice on our trip to clare because it was so yummy. the butter chicken and the fried chicken burger are both delicious, and hot chocolate is to die for. All of the workers are friendly too. Will be coming backüòä (by Ashley Tran) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Great interior design of the cosy restaurant.
Owner was so attentive, exceptional services!

Coffee was on point! The owner made us a new one with precise measurements, it was the best coffee I‚Äôve ever had. It was only because I asked about the sourness of coffee taste. He had great knowledge of the coffee.

Tried the Indian styled omelette w/sourdough, tasted so good!
Ordered Delhi burger, best burger we‚Äôve ever tried, the thick cut hot chips were so fresh and nice!

I will definitely visit Clare valley again and try more dishes in Antidote!

Thanks so much for brilliant food and services.  I would give 7/5. (by Rosaline H) [5 months ago] | Review 5: 3 stars - Lovely Cafe / Restaurant. The food was brilliant fresh and tasty. The staff couldn't do enough for you. Worth a try if you are in Clare.
We had Bacon & Eggs and Chilli Scramble Eggs. Delicious (by jenni willson) [2 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Simply the best Indian food
I‚Äôve had in recent memory - and I‚Äôve been to India about 5 times!  Superbly presented, fresh and with lovely texture.  The chef was very accommodating of my request for some vegan options, which shows their desire to look after their clientele.  I will be here for dinner every time I come to Clare now.  In the interim, I‚Äôll be envious of the locals.  Lucky buggers. (by Paul Bowyer) [5 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Such a great spot to start the day!
Absolutely loved it. We had breakfast outside in the sun. Generous portions, super chill vibes and friendly staff. You can feel the local love for this place. Highly recommended. Would definitely come back. (by Constanza Banchero) [5 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Everything we ordered was aesthetically pleasing to the eye and the physical senses, even the environment! We were blown away from the beauty and flavours of each dish, and how each drink was served and tasted. The best curry, the best coffee, and the best cocktails I have ever tasted!

Service was impeccable and professional. My family thank you all for making the experience memorable.

We wish this business longevity, success, and hope to visit again soon. (by Christine Liau) [8 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - What a pleasant environment! The food and coffee were excellent, and the portions were a good size. The chef is very artistic‚ÄîI could tell by the presentation of the dish. I fell in love with the painting on the wall. ü•π (by Cici) [7 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - What a genuine delight Lunch was today. The location, on the edge of town was part of our larger explore of the area via the bike trail. Its popularity belies the strength of the flavours and quality on the plate. Prices are great. (by Paul Horton) [4 days ago]

name: Passatempo
address: Barrack St, Clonroad Beg, Ennis, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Food was delicious, pasta perfectly cooked, good quality wine. All for a decent price. My only suggestion would be offering the burrata salad in two options, starter or as a platter. The portion was very, very generous (not a complain üòÅ), the size was ideal for sharing. (by Vanessa Luvezuti) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - The pasta here was excellent. It was a nice change of pace from the standard Irish cuisine. The staff was friendly and got to talk to them a bit. A hidden gem and afterward took a nice stroll through town. (by Nicholas Rosen) [a year ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Amazing Italian food!  I come from a city with varying incredible Italian food from different regions in Italy.  When I came to Ireland people said ‚Äúdon‚Äôt eat the Italian - you‚Äôll be disappointed!‚Äù  This place is the exception.  It is run by Italian people who know their food.

We had the crostini (chefs choice) as our starter - terrific and distinct flavor combinations.  Highly recommend.  What‚Äôs better than the chef sharing what‚Äôs fresh and what‚Äôs best.  It allows for creativity.  We were well rewarded.  The simplest crostini was a fresh cherry tomato perfectly seasoned with salt and pepper on a fresh toasted crostini.  It was fresh, crisp, and lovely.  The most complex was a caramelized onion with cheese (Brie?).  Sweet, savory, perfect.  Everything in between was equally delightful.

Next we had the puttanesca.  It was amazing!  A perfect combination of flavorings with just the right amount of spice - and the anchovy did its job adding saltiness without fishy-ness.

We also had a special: the porcini ravioli with truffle cream sauce. If you love mushrooms, this dish is utter perfection.  Not too heavy.  Flavors that compliment each other.  I could eat this for days.

The dishes come with fresh bread and a nice little dish of fresh Parmesan.  So.  Good.  Just enough to make this a perfect Italian food adventure.

We ended with the homemade pastries with Nutella.  So tasty and a wonderful finish to dinner.  The staff did a great job recommending a dry wine for my wife that she loved and the one Italian beer on the menu was wonderful!

If you want a true Italian meal with a thoughtful and attentive crew, this is the place to eat. (by Roc Restaurant Roulette) [2 years ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - I arrived in this place by chance. Curiosity made me enter, I had a lovely bruschetta and a wonderful carbonara. My congratulations (by Tommaso Forin passeggiando_it) [Edited a month ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Delicious - great pasta and fresh ingredients.  Helpful and Friendly staff.  Neighbor hood feel with global flavor! (by Rod Scholl) [3 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Lovely place, amazing food and very fun and friendly service. The nice lady recommended me her favourite dish (the green bean-pesto lasagna) which is not something I would have ordered by myself but it was the tastiest thing I‚Äôve had in Ireland yet (apologies to Irish fare!) It‚Äôs a small space with a couple of tables outside as well so I recommend reservations if you want to dine at a popular time. Passatempo is down a narrow alley in a quieter part of this very charming town. If they opened a location where I live, I think I‚Äôd live there :-) (by J Flo) [6 years ago] | Review 7: 4 stars - Freshly prepared, delicious Italian food. (by Brian Malone) [9 months ago] | Review 8: 4 stars - The food was great. Really nice. Service could be slightly improved, but overall really nice. (by Grainne Conneely) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - My favourite Italian restaurant.
Owned by an Italian couple.
Beautiful food and wine, very efficient, professional, and friendly staff.

Tables are limited, so you are best to book in advance.

Highly recommend. You won't be disappointed. (by Ger Cosgrove) [9 months ago] | Review 10: 2 stars - Pasta wasn't great. It was a bit expensive for the pasta I got. The smoked salmon tagliatelle I ordered in 5 min got cold.... also the taste wasn't fabulous. I do not recommend this place to eat a nicely cooked pasta. (by Andrei Jatariu) [7 years ago]

name: The Ivy Cottage
address: Fisher St, Doonmacfelim, Doolin, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews: Review 1: 5 stars - It was so delicious with surprising flavors. We took some fish and ships, the batter was crispy, there was a little spicy and sweet salad of mangoes that was delicious and the shrimps were so tasty. We also took the fish of the day, and the fish was very good and well seasoned. The desserts were delicious too. The waiter was very nice and funny, his pronunciation of the fresh word Fl√©tan was very funny, we had a good laugh. (It was perfect don't worry, it was cute.) We'll surely come back ! (by Chlo√© Morineau) [2 weeks ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - This little gem of a place had some of the best seafood we‚Äôve had in a very long time. For reference, we‚Äôre from the east coast of the US and love good seafood. We got the daily fish, the mushroom truffle soup (not pictured) and the desert platter. It was all outstanding and the staff were all amazing. Thank you all for an amazing dinner. Highly recommend ! (by Natasha Chokshi) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Simply a gem of a restaurant.  The staff was attentive, helpful, and set us on the right path for some Irish Whiskey as well.  The food was excellent.  Seafood Chowder, specifically.  And the bread that accompanied it - so good.  Love the change of pace tall (soda) cans, too - w/ different graphic elements. (by Mo) [3 weeks ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - We had a fabulous meal here. We were staying nearby and it was very busy the evening we went but we got a table outside to have drink while we waited for a table to be ready. We didn't wait too long. Great menu, the food was so nice. Everyone was very friendly and helpful and there was a lovely atmosphere! Highly recommend (by Tee MacPherson) [5 days ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - We loved this place so much, we came back three times. The food is amazing, the staff is kind and it‚Äôs adorable inside. Thank you for the wonderful food and fun memories (and the amazing carrot cake!) (by P .hill) [2 weeks ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Every time in Doolin this wonderful gem of a restaurant serves the best gluten free rich and chips, probably in Ireland. Superb and warm, friendly and fun staff team make the meal all the more memorable. The fish chowder also yesterday was one of the most delicious I have tasted in Ireland. Bravo to Ivy Cottage Chefs and TeamüíØ (by James Lowry) [a month ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Lovely french-inspired restaurant. The food is very delicious and looks very great when served. The price of the food is a little higher than elsewhere. The service was very friendly and efficient. We were pleased to be seated outside on the terrace 'cause of the dog, because there was a strong fish smell in the restaurant. (by Victor Drieskens) [2 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - We ate the Atlantic Chowder, a lovely hot and creamy fish  soup served with two slices of delicious dark break and butter. Along we had a big lager beer. Absolutely delicious ‚ù£Ô∏è (by auli guillandparsy) [a month ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Possibly one of the best meals we had in our two weeks.  Fish and scampi & chips was lovely.  My steak was great.  Of particular note was the griddled onion which I have never had an onion so nice.  Who would think I would be saying that!  The sharing platter for pudding was also lovely.  I am not nor ally a desert person, but each of the small portions was lovely.   Also the most important thing was that it was dog friendly inside and out.  Not like the pub along the road!!  100% recommend.   You do pay a little more than down the road, but it is worth it (by Andy Meighen) [4 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Absolutely perfect. The best mid-day meal I‚Äôve ever had. I was not going to order the Atlantic Chowder but was convinced by the staff. It was the absolute best chowder and soda bread I‚Äôve tasted. And everyone is so friendly and the outside seating was beautiful. (by Nikoli Falenschek) [3 months ago]

name: The Swan
address: 4 High St, Clare, Sudbury CO10 8NY, United Kingdom
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Amazing pub with a great atmosphere about it. Nick is a wonderful landlord and the employees are all great!

I visited Clare for 2 weeks and had the pleasure of eating here twice with family members and it was incredible for everyone both times.

I will absolutely be visiting again! Thank you for being such a positive part of my holiday üëçüòÅ (by jack mchale) [3 weeks ago] | Review 2: 2 stars - Traditional pub with very large beer garden.  Popped in for a pint early on a Thursday evening.  Actually had to go back to the bar to check they had not mistakenly charged us for 4 pints instead of 3.  Nope!  Criminally charging nearly 50% more for a pint than other pubs nearby.
Didn't try the food, so review is based on experience of very average condition over-priced ale. (by Phil Goddard) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - A big thank you to Nik for providing and running  the bar with Lou for my son Tom's wedding at Suffolk Retreats. The guests welcome Prosecco drink was the best one I've ever had.!! Plenty of variety of beer/lager and other spirits. It was a great day and all the extra help you both gave was greatly appreciated. Thank you so much!!! (by christine smith) [a month ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Our first time in Clare and at The Swan. Beautiful sunny 22c day. We sat outside and relaxed and enjoyed drinks and chips and loaded nachos. Staff friendly and helpful and very clean. So much history. (by Lisa Chandler) [5 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - First time coming here with family and we were all very very impressed. Fantastic range of vegan options, we all struggled to choose a dish. Food was absolutely delicious and service was perfect. We would all love to come back and try more options! (by Skye T) [a year ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Great Sunday lunch
Perfect potatoes
Vegetables plenty hot gravy and huge Yorkshire pudding - will be returning for sure (by Rebecca Hall) [7 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Our first visit and we were very impressed, warm and welcoming atmosphere, lovely friendly staff. The food was amazing and all at a good price. A really lovely night out, will definitely come back. (by Debbie COOKE) [6 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Food was absolutely gorgeous. Very generous portions. Staff very attentive and friendly. Felt very safe too. Highly recommend. (by Sian Brown) [4 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Great food at reasonable prices, good service and friendly atmosphere would definitely recommend a nice pub. (by Ron Cowcher) [5 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Thank you ever so much Nick & Tors, you changed our night after such a heart felt day with the kids, they really enjoyed themselves & your food is on point! (by Jason Curran) [5 months ago]

name: Cafe Aroma
address: Bank Pl, Clonroad Beg, Ennis, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Great atmosphere, Very hospitable staff, Delicious breakfast and lunch. Suitable for all ages with plenty of options of freshly cooked food. Looks smaller from outside but inside there is plenty of seating area. (by Jawad Zaman) [5 months ago] | Review 2: 3 stars - Have been going here regularly for years and have never had a problem until recently.
In the last couple of months, there's been a very steep decline in the quality of the food & ingredients unfortunately.

The potatoes have been rotten multiple times,
The gravy had an extremely weird taste,
The vegetables have been completely unseasoned every time we have ordered.

This has been the number one caf√© in town for multiple years but this decline in quality hasn't gone unnoticed. Please sort it out! We miss Caf√© Aroma. (by Anonymous Reviewer) [a week ago] | Review 3: 3 stars - I love the place it's very beautiful. But the Italian omelet missed the spot. The Italian sausage wasn't even mixed into the omelet it was just a couple of slices lol. The coffee was great. (by AEGV V) [5 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - A lovely cafe, spread out over three floors.
Staff were friendly and professional.
Plenty of seating, not too crushed.
We had the mini-breakfast. It was delicious, so good I forgot to take a photo.
If you don't like your beans touching the rest of your food, you will have to let them know.

The bathroom is on the top floor. Lots of steps, I did see a few people with crutches going up the stairs.
The place was clean. (by Kerry Butcher) [a year ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Great caf√©. Staff are friendly, tend to your needs while also giving you space to enjoy your food and company. Vegetarian breakfast was delicious, perfect portion size, and excellent value. Will definitely visit next time we're in Ennis! (by Alex Hayden) [2 weeks ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Friendly service, great food, busy, nice atmosphere and lots of choices (by marty farren) [a month ago] | Review 7: 4 stars - Had a lovely mini breakfast this morning.  Would definitely recommend this place. While we were here, it did get very busy. We returned on Saturday for our second breakfast.  We enjoyed it as much as the first day. (by Steve Butcher) [a year ago] | Review 8: 3 stars - Sort of a mixed experience. I ordered the eggs Benedict. The eggs were overcooked. The hollandaise sauce had way too much lemon in it and lack character. There were 5 potatoes edges in the plate (are you saving money on potatoes?) which made the dish look a little less enthusiastic. Coffee was really, really, but really horrible. Poor coffee machine maintenance or poor quality coffee? Here is a tip, coffee shop MUST at least serve good coffees, don't you agree? On the other hand, the apple pie was one of the best I ever had. Service was nice. Price really adequate. All in all, I might come back and try something else but it is not a place I would recommend right out of the bat. (by Samuel ‚Äúthe reviewer‚Äù Paulino) [Edited 2 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Quality Irish breakfast, every part was perfectly cooked. Coffee tasted even better than it looked. Super friendly and attentive staff. Cannot fault a thing. (by Thomas Reilly) [a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Such a cute cafe with delicious food, desserts, and drinks. The pancakes were delicious, the turkey special was basically an American Thanksgiving meal, and the orange cheesecake tasted like a creamsickle. Such a lovely little spot - with excellent prices. Very glad we stopped in.

Street parking. (by Courtney) [a year ago]

name: The Old Bakehouse Restaurant
address: Main St, Leagard South, Miltown Malbay, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Absolutely phenomenal food credits to tje team behind all this well deserved credits for the outstanding food and service I'll highly recommend it for those out there travelling through the village üòáüôåüôåü´∂ü´∂ (by Calvin Mulcahy) [4 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - During our stay near Milltown we had dinner in the Old Bakehouse twice. We loved our food on both nights. Their monkfish special was delicious and their steaks were simply to die for. Staff very helpful and friendly. I'd highly recommend this restaurant if you are looking for delicious food and great service. (by camilla galbiati) [5 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Visiting from out of town and this place was SO GOOD. I had the chicken tikka masala and it was unbelievable. My boyfriend had the chicken Kiev. Great portion size. Service was also lovely and the atmosphere was perfect. (by Bailey Cormier) [2 weeks ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Excellent food and fast + great service and fantastic customer care. (by TonyTom J9J6) [a month ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Sublime! The salmon was cooked to perfection. Simple ingredients cooked with care and attention. The whole experience was unforgettable. The beef and turkey was perfect . Fish pie and chicken with rosemary was also delicious. The cheesecake melts in your mouth so heavenly good, the strawberry roulade, brownie, berry and apple crumble with custard were all excellent!  Definitely will recommend to family and friends. (by Sally Ortiz) [a month ago] | Review 6: 4 stars - Fantastic food. A little bit too expensive for a family but fab food (by jenny gaffney) [a month ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Wonderful Cod well bread fresh chips, staff very friendly, cold beer üçª highly recommend (by Erika Cristina Santos) [4 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - We had a great dinner!
Our server war super friendly and helpful!
We shared the mussels as a starter - just delicious! As a main we had the fish pie and the grilled salmon, both very good!

Recommend going there! (by steffi lang) [3 months ago] | Review 9: 4 stars - The roasted nut rissoles were a fantastic combination of nut patties, creamy leeks and flavorful ratatouille. The goat cheese salad with pear was a good combination of flavors as well. The beef bourguignon was a little dry and lacking garlic and other spices. I think it was more like an Irish stew. I‚Äôd recommend going with the fish option which I suspect they do exceptionally well. (by Steven Fuller) [a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Some of the best salmon we‚Äôve ever had, and great service to boot. Would highly recommend. And we‚Äôre italian, so we‚Äôre very picky! (by Matteo Susino) [a year ago]

name: Tulsi
address: Carmody St, Clonroad Beg, Ennis, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Delicious food, lovely service, and such a wonderful time with family (by AM Thai Ennis) [a month ago] | Review 2: 1 star - I got a takeaway from here tonight, and I can only describe it as the worst Indian food I have ever tasted. The pilau rice wasn‚Äôt even pilau rice it was boiled rice. The chicken korma was absolutely inedible, the sauce was so thin and just tasted like cream not to mention the state of the chicken, the same with the chicken tikka masala just tasting of cream. The nan bread tasted stale. I would not recommend at all. Expensive and bad quality food. (by Daisy C) [9 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Got a takeaway from Tulsi this evening, second time recently. We had samosas and a balti. Delicious, so flavoursome. Got free popadoms with a lovely homemade mint sauce and onion. Service was great. Had to change the time of our order when plans changed and this was no problem. (by Tina Lenihan) [a month ago] | Review 4: 1 star - This restaurant is not INDIAN, the food is by far the worst I‚Äôve had. It should not be categorized as Indian by any means, so I‚Äôm compelled to put this review here for my fellow Indians who are looking for Indian options around here. If you really want that experience head to Silver Oak (their food is ‚ÄúIndian‚Äù and yum). I actually feel bad for others who enjoy food there thinking that‚Äôs the epitome of our cuisine. (Wish I could tell them it‚Äôs not).

The dal - Channa dal (no tadka just boiled lentil)
Gobhi - boiled and swimming in turmeric water with
Roti - I don‚Äôt think these ppl really know what roti it!! So I leave it there. (by Being Soham) [a month ago] | Review 5: 1 star - This was possibly the worst Indian I‚Äôve ever had. Chicken korma was bland, the chicken was dry and looked like it had sat out all day, the sauce itself was watery with no flavour, the Pilaou rice was not Pilaou Rice, looked like basmati, onion bhaji was burnt and dry. Avoid at all costs, do not waste your money, silver oak in town is a much better option. (by Alexandra Potter) [2 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - We arrived very close to closing time on a Wednesday evening.  We received a wonderful welcome.  The food was absolutely delicious. (by Dorothy Rennison) [3 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - This was my first time being here and eating food but I really liked how it looked inside very fancy and clean and I got take away and it was very fast took like 15 mins to get done and I got butter chicken with boiled rice and honestly 10/10 food and alot of chicken but it's in the sauce so alot of taste (by Phil Ryan) [2 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Ordered from here after a long time at weekend and it was fantastic! It was delivered super fast and everything tasted amazing :) (by Sonia Russell) [3 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - This restaurant is consistently good. Great tasting food in a well kept dining room, clean toilets and of course very polite and helpful staff. (by Stephen Hunter) [4 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Excellent food and wonderful service. Beautiful starter and main with a complimentary after meal drink. Clean and welcoming.  Well done. (by Jackie Scanlan) [8 months ago]

name: Knappogue Castle Medieval Banquet
address: Knappogue Castle and Walled Garden, Quin, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - A fantastic evening for three generations of my family. My elderly father has had three strokes and has extremely limited mobility, this event was perfect for him as well as hugely amusing our 12 and 14 year old daughters. Una and her team took wonderful care of my father, finding him seats, giving him a hand walking into dinner, seating him with easy access to the bathrooms and some support for his back, they were so thoughtful and kind, he had an absolute blast.

The setting is a dramatic 500 year old castle with lovely grounds, arrive around 15 minutes early to collect your tickets from the box office (you MUST pre-book), welcome drinks of mead or fruit juice are served in pottery cups in the ancient hall to violin and celtic harp music and you are welcomed to the evening by your host, the high king's butler, Tom. There is some fun with four couples being appointed king and queen of each of Ireland's ancient kingdoms and this adds a bit of drama to the evening and lifts the atmosphere.
