There were three big coach groups the night we visited but it is also great for family bookings like us who aren't in a group.

Guests then proceed into the banquet hall and sit on benches at long tables with a high table and a stage visible to all. Each course is served with entertainment and some fun role play, there is music, Irish dancing and traditional songs. There are large jugs of wine, water and juice on each table as well as platters of wheaten bread. The menu was local smoked salmon, a soup course, chicken with vegetables, fruit crumble and tea or coffee. The musicians and players in full costume serve the meal and it is lots of fun with plenty of audience participation. A great evening of Irish fun in a unique setting. Much more accessible than Bunratty as a venue. Not cheap but we felt it was very good value for the four course meal with unlimited drink and several hours of non-stop entertainment. The team clearly care about their guests and want to give everyone a memorable evening, highly recommended. (by Catherine Woods) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 2 stars - The ten staff members served as both servers and performers. They all sang very well, but the food was disappointing. They served a welcome drink, soup, ribs, chicken with vegetables, and cheesecake for dessert. The performers served the food, then performed songs in between courses. The food was tasteless; the best-tasting item was the cheesecake. We walked up 32 steps to a very small room, which was jam-packed with over 80 people. While we were walking up, we needed to hold on to the railing, and yet during dinner, they did not provide utensils, and was told that we had to eat with our hands, which were full of germs. I was expecting a grand castle to enjoy our dinner and a real show, but instead, we were jammed in like sardines. I wouldn‚Äôt call that a castle but more like a water tower.  I enjoyed the singing, but not the environment or the food. (by S L) [3 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Amazing experience! Nice dinner and great show (by Yunona Greiz) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Great time and good food. Nice variety in the entertainment.  A little bigger than Bunratty and definitely easier to get in to the banquet hall. If you drive either early or late season, make sure your phone has a good flashlight - the only light in the car park is from the stars‚Ä¶if it isn‚Äôt cloudy‚Ä¶which it always is‚Ä¶it‚Äôs dark, cave dark (by David Goforth) [a year ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - I highly recommend this experience! The food was amazing. The staff was very friendly and personable! The show/entertainment was so fun. Overall a great experience! Would recommend to anyone! (by Paige Holloway) [4 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - As part of our vacation in Ireland, we decided to visit the Medieval Banquet at Knappogue Castle. It was an amazing experience and well worth the journey! The staff was so pleasent right from the beginning, the food was really good (especially considering the number of guests and the setting) and the performances of the artists were really entertaining and created a lovely atmosphere. So thank you once again for the wonderful time, would highly recommend :-) (by Nico Neumann) [4 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - The food was great and the entertainment was wonderful! So much fun (by Jessica Volkman) [2 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - The food was delicious and hot, the entertainment was top notch and the venue was unique.

There was entertainment followed by 4 courses of tasty food and all the bread you could eat.

The actors and actresses were very talented and interacted with the audience well.

We enjoyed our visit and would recommend that it be checked out if you get the chance. (by Raeann Kinch) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Our Brendan Travels stopped for dinner, wine and entertainment. What a fantastic evening. I would highly suggest others to go. (by Jeri Dettmann) [6 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - We had a most amazing night at the banquet in Knappogue Castle tonight. It was such fun. The butler and  entertainers were outstanding. They are so professional and are such a talented bunch of people. They went all out to give the crowd a night to remember! Thank you all for the singing , stories ,dancing, harp , fiddle, fun, beautiful food and most of all top class entertainment all night long. Unforgettable! Well done to all involved! (by Carmel Humphreys) [2 years ago]

name: Armada Hotel
reviews:
Review 1: None - The hotel is great. The views are stunning. We called on the day and were able to get a deal for a family room. We were informed there was a wedding on and it would be noisy as our room is next to us but it was fine. As they knew we had ‚Ä¶ (by michellefP134GH) | Review 2: None - Stayed with my husband and two young kids. Our room was ideal for the family and while the hotel was really set up for kids the experience was so high quality for myself and my husband too. |The hotel is beautiful inside to match the ‚Ä¶ (by Y3286NEsimonem) | Review 3: None - The Armada was really excellent. The staff were absolutely top notch. Unfortunately the restaurant and bar were both booked out so we ordered room service. The food was excellent though as was breakfast the next morning and the staff member who showed us to our table explained everything very clearly.  we had a family room with 2 interconnecting rooms and a bathroom with a spacious shower and a bath. We were just lacking a lovely view. (by Eve O'Callaghan) | Review 4: None - We stayed here with a tour group, the hotel was booked by the tour operator.  We absolutely loved our stay here, it was comfortable, clean, beautifully appointed rooms with everything you might need, wonderful staff.  The only downside was having to ring for fresh milk as they do not provide this in the room due to not wanting to use plastics, it was tough for them as on arrival we all wanted milk for our drinks!, but it would have been nice to have some available in the room's fridge.  But otherwise it was a perfect stay and a beautiful hotel. There was a wedding going on at the time but you wouldn't have known as it was quiet in the rooms and staff were all fully available.  Loved our stay! (by Abi Rickards) | Review 5: None - Really beautiful food and a stunning location to sit and enjoy the ocean views.

The staff were absolutely lovely and went above and beyond for us they couldn‚Äôt have done more to make our experience special.

The bar had a really nice vibe and atmosphere.

The only small downside was that the music was a little too loud, but overall it was a fantastic experience. (by Geoff Hassett) | Review 6: None - We stopped at Armada today for lunch.  The restaurant was pretty full and very busy and buzzy and my daughter wanted to eat outside as she prefers open, quieter spaces.  The waitress was very friendly and advised us that restaurant menu ‚Ä¶ (by jeanhG4563GA) | Review 7: None - Lovely hotel in fantastic location! Plenty of food options from main restaurant to bar menu and also outdoors food options in adjacent "Reef "outdoor area.
Restaurant food lovely and a comfortable dining area.
Front snug bar just beautiful with music for a short while when we were there.
Only criticism was the size of the cocktails..very small glasses for the prices!  Otherwise loved it here! (by Pauline Butler) | Review 8: None - Beautiful location. Delicious and gorgeous food - beyond expectations. The bartender made great cocktails - perfectly balanced. Wonderful staff...will definitely return! (by Kim Coughlin-Lamphear) | Review 9: None - I stay every year at the hotel , did notice that the price this year went up considerably. I‚Äôm a father with 2 boys aged 8 and 14 and the only option they give me is a family room costing ‚Ç¨400 a night.|Got to the room and to my surprise ‚Ä¶ (by PeterMcGra) | Review 10: None - We brought two kids two and four. They had a ball, the staff are so friendly and helpful. They loved the kids disco. Food is delicious with so many options. Looking forward to our next trip. Top class (by RichieR136)

name: Sa Domu
address: Leitrim, Clonwhite, Co. Clare, V15 CH05, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - This pizza is unbelievably good!!   If you love true Italian pizza this is where you need to go.   Don‚Äôt let the location keep you from going.  It is a bit out there‚Ä¶. But well worth the trip.  The garlic bread was amazing too.  You may want to bring your own beverages as they are more of a take away place.  Outdoor dining on picnic tables with a beautiful Irish countryside view! (by Bill ~) [5 days ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - So I‚Äôve been in Ireland for 10 years - I come from an Italian family- and it‚Äôs hard to find a good pizza in Ireland - well low and behold I came across this - hands down the best to date - it felt like home - made by an Italian, tastes like an Italian pizza - exceptional service and the bonus ? Stunning views of the Irish countryside - so whether you‚Äôre local or just visiting the region - do not let this one pass you out! (by isabelle urso) [3 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - This pizza almost made me cry, that‚Äôs how good it is. The dough is chewy and light like every incredible pizza I‚Äôve ever had in Italy. The sauce is fresh and bright and doesn‚Äôt overwhelm the other ingredients. And as all the other reviews have mentioned, the location is so beautiful looking out at the countryside. What an incredible find. Now I need all ya‚Äôll to stay away from it so I don‚Äôt have to share! (by Dana Feehan) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Love Love Love this place. Just when you think where in the heavens are we going you will arrive. Pizza oven shipped from Italy so that tells you your going to Love the food. We enjoyed chatting with the owners just as much as eating the delicious pizzas and garlic bread. Do not hesitate to go eat here you will absolutely love it. (by GHB) [5 days ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - I've been on a quest for truly great Italian pizza in Ireland, and I can confidently say I've found it here! The pizza is simply out of this world ‚Äì each one is a masterpiece of deliciousness with that ideal crispy-chewy crust and top-notch ingredients. Seriously, it's pure pizza perfection. Beyond the incredible food, the owners are absolute gems. They're so incredibly kind, friendly, and genuinely care about their customers. You feel instantly at home. This place isn't just about incredible food; it's about the wonderful people who run it. Highly, highly recommend! (by Max Marchenko) [4 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - It's most probably delicious, but make sure to reserve ahead! They have limited pizzas and they might all be sold out (reserved) before the place opens. So make sure to call in advance. Best a day before! (by Benjamin) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Finding Sa Domu has been a recent discovery nothing less than extraordinary. For us, it has truly become THE hidden gem of Ireland, not only for the food (which is absolutely divine), but also for the magical location, nestled among the gentle hills of Clare, and above all for the owners, (the beautiful Una and Giovannino) who are two of the most exquisite persons we have ever met.

The pizzas baked by Giovannino are simply a masterpiece: with a gorgeous cornicione (raised crust), perfectly baked, with the authentic taste of Italy in every single bite. Eating them outside while admiring the breathtaking view over the valley is an experience that goes far beyond just having dinner... it feels like being on holiday even if you're not.

And then, the pastries‚Ä¶ oh wowr, the pastries! The ciavattoni are unique, and the cannoli are something out of this world: hands down, the best Sicilian cannoli in Ireland (and I'm not saying this lightly, as we're really keen on cannoli!). So exceptional that, even after four days, they remain fragrant, crisp and delicious as if just made.
What makes Sa Domu so special is also the choice of real Italian ingredients, the impeccable cleanliness and hygiene of the place where Giovannino cooks, and the sense that eating here is nourishing not only your body, but also your mind and your soul.

We are grateful to have found this place, and it is now our absolute point of reference whenever we want to feel the beauty and the taste of true Italy in Ireland, with some chat with some of the loveliest people in this island. (by Paola) [a month ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Absolutely amazing pizza; easily missed as you drive by, but it‚Äôs just fantastic pizza. (by Luke) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Didn't really expect this to live up to its 5* rating, but holy jaysus this is the best pizza I've ever had in Ireland, and it's even better than a lot of the pizza I had in Italy. Top marks, would travel back across the country again for it. (by Kevin Curran) [2 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Got a most fabulous fresh pizza last evening‚Ä¶ simply delicious. Real Italian quality ingredients. Rang in my order and collected 10 mins later. (by Pat Kelly) [11 months ago]

name: The Ennis Food Emporium Ltd
address: Abbeyfield Centre, Francis St, 8/9, Clonroad Beg, Ennis, Co. Clare, V95 AK23, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Excellent restaurant with tasty food  either to eat in or take away and very pleasant staff. Their catering service - of which we availed of recently -is second to none with a great variety of menu selections. Well done to Fionn and staff (by L& M Hally) [4 weeks ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Best. Breakfast. Ever!
The first thing we noticed was the positive attitude of the staff. They seemed to have their best time serving their customers. Not only just friendly, but happy to work there, their smiles genuine.
We spoke to the owner when we told him the food was exceptional, every omelette, or scone, or toast. Everything prepared to the wishes of us, every ingredient could be picked to our individual likings.
The taste was outstanding! Very delicious, along with the great coffee choices and teas a culinary feast!
The simple explanation by Fionn: "Nothing beats fresh ingredients". I'd like to add: Only if prepared with love for food, joy and customer dedication, then you can experience what we did: Exceptional taste with grand service. Our best breakfast so far, thank you guys üëçüèªüí™üèªüòé (by Dierk Hilger) [2 years ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Had the food emporium do home catering for us for a family party and couldn't fault them, great to deal with and very friendly, food was absolutely amazing and got nothing but compliments from everyone at the party. Delivered on time with complimentary dessert thrown in. Highly recommend for quality, value and excellent service. 5star (by Paul Tierney) [2 weeks ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Absolutely loved this place. Friendly and enthusiastic staff. The selection of food was amazing. Coffee really good. Definitely be back. And the live music on Saturday afternoon really added to the vibe. (by Darragh Jones) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - The acai bowl is delicious and so is the coffee. Definitely worth a visit. The staff are also lovely and very helpful.
It would be good if they could get a highchair for the little one. Overall, great place üëç (by Mairead) [a year ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - I can't believe I have never been in here ...I popped in as I was passing and really wanted an acai bowl then I saw the rest of the food and wanted it all.. even though they were super busy they were really nice and the guy (who was cute) gave me free cake ... ll definitely be back (by Aoife Gleeson) [a year ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - We didn't find this place until the day we were leaving Ennis.  That was our loss.  This place has BEST COFFEE and the nicest people in Ireland .  The staff was so helpful.. they made the coffee custom to our taste.. They have full breakfast but we had scones and coffee and it was great.. They even had cream for your coffee.. how great is that..

The staff are incredibly nice.. they went out of their way to help us.  If you are in Ennis or within 50 km.. eat here.. you will be blessed. (by Edward Rutherford) [3 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - I just had breakfast and by far it was the nicest cooked breakfast i have ever eaten, along with a really really good coffee.
Excellent value for money, friendly staff and great atmosphere! (by Darragh) [8 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - My favourite restaurant in Clare! I have been coming to the food emporium since I was 6 years old, it‚Äôs still a family run and owned independent business, the food is incredible- Breakfast, lunch, dinners ( and pre made take away dinners) are top notch. The service is incredible, even when they are busy with queues out the door there‚Äôll always be a smile on their faces. Can‚Äôt recommend it enough. If you‚Äôre in Ennis - you have to go here! ‚ù§Ô∏è (by Tara Howley) [9 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Top class food and even better service. A credit to the owners (by Daniel Ryan) [3 months ago]

name: Lemongrass Restaurant
address: Clare Road, Ennis, Co. Clare, Ireland

name: Keanes Oyster Bar
address: Kilrush Rd, Garraun, Kilkee, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - I would highly recommend staying here. Just spent 3 nights there and I want to go back again soon. Apartment spotless, everything you need is there but it's the Keane family themselves who are brilliant, so welcoming and friendly, can't do enough for you. Hope to see you all again soon. (by Sheila Harrold) [3 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Beautiful little old Irish pub/restaurant and accommodation in West Clare.
My husband and I with a group stayed for a wedding the night before and two nights after the wedding. The small cottage accommodation beside the pub was lovely, perfect for a group as each room had its own bathroom. Comfortable, clean and cosy. The welcome and service from Aisling and her team/family throughout was second to none. We had dinner in the pub the night before the wedding and breakfast the morning of. The food was hot, plentiful and tasty. The team couldn't do enough to make our stay as comfortable as possible. Great pints of guinness.
Great spot if you need a place to stay or good food and a pint of Guinness in a lovely part of the country.
Huge thanks to Aisling for looking after us so well and being so welcoming. (by Cora Lacey) [3 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Traditional family owned pub with great food, great beer and great conversation. This is the real Ireland. We stayed there too on our way to Loop Head. Breakfast was great too.
So grateful to the Keanes for their care and hospitality. Stop a while and enjoy the company if you want to experience the real Irish countryside. (by Luke Murphy) [2 years ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Oh my gosh! This place was incredible! Our server was amazing...the ribs were great and the oysters...oh the oysters were truly outstanding! This was an amazing dining experience. (by Katherine Murphy) [a month ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - The best seafood we had in Ireland! Super fresh and delicious. Amelda, our waitress, was so sweet and caring and made us Germans feel right at home. (by RickTheRigged) [2 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Came here in March. Very understated. I had prawns to start and John Dory for main. Food was delicious, freshly cooked and piping hot. Good sized portion and you leave well fed. Lovely fire on and the pints looked good. Nothing fancy just straight up good food. (by Stephen Murray) [6 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Fantastic local bar just outside of kilkee - it‚Äôs cosy, local and very friendly- pints are also perfect - if you enjoy an authentic place, add this place to your list (by isabelle urso) [3 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Fresh local produce
Best fresh vegetables and fish I‚Äôve had in a while. 5*
Can‚Äôt fault. Excellent üòÅ (by Paul gandy) [3 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Best oysters ü¶™ what I eat, big size and very lovely personal or owners, thanks so much ‚ù§Ô∏è

I recommend this please and recommend try oysters and prawns ü¶ê and Guinness

Thanks üôè

Also can take away if you want. (by Alex Darmohrai) [3 years ago] | Review 10: 1 star - Oh dear such a shame I am very surprised this place seems to reviewed so well. The restaurant was dirty, windows filthy. Even our server who seemed pleasant enough, had stained and dirty clothes on. Roast beef looked like it was one of those ready meals you buy the roast potatos were frozen roast potatoes. The prawns were swimming in a pool of butter. Bathrooms were dirty and untidy. Definitely do not recommend (by Susie Hickman) [a year ago]

name: The French Table Restaurant Limerick
address: 1 Steamboat Quay, Dock Rd, Mountkennet, Limerick, V94 RW84, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Brought partner for birthday dinner. From the moment we walked in the two waiters made us feel welcome relaxed and were so professional - they explained things on the menu so well and are a credit to the restaurant. The bread and salted crisps were divine. I had a non alcoholic cocktail and was the nicest na cocktail I have ever had. The food was amazing. So many subtle delicate flavours, unique dishes and care for presentation. The oxtail special started was a highlight - rich in flavour and just right in portion size. The venison stew - mmm tender , flavourful and rich. It was a lovely experience and again the waiters were so professional friendly and made our meal very special. Cannot recommend enough and will return. (by gia t) [7 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - I really enjoyed my dinner at The French Table. The food was delicious and very well thought out and presented. The service was quick and very friendly, we were made to feel very welcome. The wine list had a great choice for good value. The location is close to everything with handy parking nearby. I really recommend a visit. Thanks to all the staff for a great evening (by Andrew Connell) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Stunning three course meal, here to celebrate a birthday , first time eating here but we will be back, it is one of the best meals I‚Äôve had! (by carey) [6 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Easily the best restaurant in Limerick. Very nuanced and imaginative menu that was executed magnificently. Impeccable service too.

It‚Äôs in a nicely subdued location right along the river that belies the complicated culinary landscape within. Every course I had was delightful in a new way.

This is a spot that deserves savor and repetition. Do yourself a favor and try it once, after that you‚Äôll be back of your own accord. (by Sam E) [5 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - I went here for a date night, requested a romantic table and got a perfect corner table with views of the city lights along the river. My partner and I shared two starters, a main and two desserts. The food was beautiful, the service was friendly and prompt and the atmosphere was relaxed, private and very romantic. The prices are high, yet appropriate for the quality of food and service. I would highly recommend going here for a special treat. (by Chloe Walsh) [a year ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Had a wonderful ladies lunch recently at The French Table. The food was authentic French, with very fresh ingredients and perfectly prepared. The portions were also very generous. Highly recommend Le Civet de biche (venison stew), which was particularly tasty with very tender meat. Thomas runs a wonderful restaurant, highly recommend for any special occasion or even any ordinary occasion. A repeat visit is definitely on the cards. (by Patricia Hurley) [11 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - It was the most excellent food I have ever had in Ireland. Very friendly restaurant staff and cozy atmosphere. Delicious dishes, I highly recommend 7 hour lamb, tender lamb in excellent sauce. Excellent ros√© wine. Special thanks to the chef on. (by Ilia Kuzmin) [2 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - A lovely meal, good food and nice service (by BridgetB Welsh) [3 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Had booked the private room last night for a family birthday and we had a fantastic night.  The food was absolutely amazing, and all of the staff were so nice.  Really helpful and informative and went out of their way to made sure that we had a great night.  Thanks you all. Will definitely be back again. (by Karen) [5 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Was here a few months ago, absolutely stunning. Been a few times have to say every time it has been impressive and the staff are amazing. My absolute favourite time was at Christmas though. I‚Äôm sorry I don‚Äôt have photos though, but I will remember that the next time ü•∞ because we will be back! Thank you so much x (by Lisa McConville) [4 months ago]

name: Cliffs face beef/Seafood/lobster and pizza's
address: O' Riains bar, Main St, Laghtagoona, Corofin, Co. Clare, V95 RD25, Ireland
service_options: The Malak's Takeaway ¬∑ 4.2 stars ¬∑ 18 reviews ¬∑ Pizza Takeout
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Lobster and pizza? Weird combo, so we weren't sure. Let me tell you, everything here is amazing! üòç The lobster was fresh and delicious, the pizza was bubbly and warm, and the chips (fries) were the best that we have had on our trip so far! Do not skip this amazing spot! Also, grab a pint from the bar to enjoy with your meal üòÅ (by Mandy Brock) [4 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Is this a unique combination, great food, outdoor benches for eating and/or a lively pub to get whatever you need to wash down the magnificent fish and chips?  Been there twice in recent times, once with a large group who all enjoyed it too. (by John Smith) [5 days ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Absolutely lovely fish van opposite the campsite. Got a beautiful grilled haddock, could not have asked for more. Highly highly recommend (by Pierce Lowe) [5 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - A fabulous find just behind O'Riains Pub. A newly opened pop-up fast food van. We had excellent fish & chips and specials of lobster and chips and 6 fresh oysters.
Highly recommended if you're in the area! (by Adam Henderson) [a year ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Always a delight to collect our fish ‚Äòn‚Äô chips from the Cliff Face food truck in Corofin. It was particularly welcome when we had no electricity for 7 days after storm √âowyn.
Also love to go after a lake swim and sit outside grabbing a drink from the local bar. (Rians)
Staff are always friendly and the food is delicious. Highly recommend. (by Joanne Burke) [8 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - After a long drive to Corofin it was a nice surprise to find this Little gem situated in the pub outdoor area, plenty of seating for the good food   We had the fish and chips but people were enjoying Oysters, lobster and other fish dinners. 2 fish dinners 35‚Ç¨ (by Melvin Hill) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - This was the perfect place to eat in this town!  I had amazing lobster and my wife had terrific pizza. (by Andrea Olsen) [4 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - A streetfood bar with very tasty seafood and Chips. Fresh green side salad if wanted. Drinks can be ordererd in the Sports Bar next to it. Sitting at  Beer Garden Tables or in the bar. (by M. Rapp) [Edited 2 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Wonderful Staff and delicious food, we had the pizzas one evening, sea bass another evening, on of our group had the burgers! Everyone loved it!

And its open later so it a great spot of a late meal!! (by Nicholas Livingston) [6 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Highly recommend the grilled sea bass. Fresh and cooked to perfection üòã (by Aoife Murphy) [a month ago]

name: Oh La La
address: Parliament St, Ennistimon, Ennistymon, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - We visited this lovely place with the kids from our school camp, and it was a wonderful experience! Everyone enjoyed the delicious Nutella crepes ‚Äî they were fresh, warm, and absolutely delicious. The atmosphere was cozy and welcoming, perfect for a fun and relaxing break. The staff was friendly and helpful, making sure all the children were happy and comfortable. Thank you for a great time ‚Äî we‚Äôll definitely be back! (by Halyna Kushcheva) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Lovely.  I was very impressed and really enjoyed my goats cheese, spinach and honey although my husband wasn't too impressed with his ham egg and emmenthal. (by Liz) [3 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Really enjoyed a late lunch here. I‚Äôve never had buckwheat crepes before but I really enjoyed them. The goats cheese and honey was a lovely addiction. The French onion soup was divine, I had food envy and I‚Äôd definitely order this if I return. The coffee was very tasty and reasonably priced. The only downside was that the service wasn‚Äôt the best. I‚Äôm not sure if they were short staffed but it wasn‚Äôt very attentive. (by JenCarew) [2 years ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Best crepes ever and atmosphere was relaxing for a morning breakfast. (by Jeff and Kim) [4 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Really nice place to eat. Staff are very welcoming and willing to adapt the menu to cater to vegans. Really enjoyed the crepes and highly recommended:) (by Olivia Loughnane) [2 weeks ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - A great variety of savoury and sweet cr√™pes, in a cosy and friendly atmosphere created by a professional and welcoming team.
We went for Tina's and Irish savoury options followed by maple syrup and lemon&sugar sweets. All are highly recommended. (by Roman Jouravlev) [2 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Had a very tasty experience at Oh La La. It had a kind of bohemian warmth complete with art on the walls and an area with books and toys for kids. I have to eat gluten free but they make gluten free crepes. We loved our crepes. They have shared equipment so they cannot assure me there won‚Äôt be some cross contamination for celiac but I took a risk. I will update again if I get sick. All in all we had a great experience and enjoyed ourself after a fun day of surfing in Lahinch. (by Dale Huntington) [3 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - We really enjoyed brunch in this beautiful eclectic caf√©. The Old Goat cheese and spinach galette was delicious as were all the galettes we ate. Service was excellent and the place has a lovely friendly atmosphere. Definitely a place to return to. (by Pauline Costello) [a year ago] | Review 9: 4 stars - One of the best savoury crepes I ever have. The food is good because the chefs make it with a wide smiley faces. Its cute! ‚ù§Ô∏è (by amit sharma) [2 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Went for lunch here on the recommendation of the lovely ladies in Salmon Bookshop. Food was terrific, staff were lovely. Nice atmosphere and reasonable prices too. (by Joanne Hunter) [3 months ago]

name: Abbey Bar and Restaurant
address: Abbey Street Car Park, 42 Abbey St, Clonroad Beg, Ennis, Co. Clare, V95 CV04, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Extensive menu with plenty of roast options that are on permanently like Rib of Roast Beef which was excellent. They have wings, vol au vants and plenty of other starters which are also available for main courses. Really enjoyed the food here and the staff are very friendly and the service/drinks orders were out very quickly despite the premises being very busy which was also a good sign. Portions of food were very good and would definitely recommend. (by Sean Kelly) [3 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Lovely staff!! Definitely recommend bringing your dog to the outdoor patio area. My dog Luna was immediately served with a tasty treat by a staff member and given a bowl of water on a hot day üòÅ Thank you to all the staff for a wonderful memory and delicious food. All very reasonably priced (Everything on the menu was between ‚Ç¨10- 17) and great portions üòã (by Tiernan Brennan) [3 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Wow, this was a gem. The food was so delicious. Atmosphere was genuinely Irish. Great location and easy parking after 1730. (by joey joey) [a month ago] | Review 4: 1 star - I am so disappointed because I was looking for food on the 17 of May it was two entrances so I was waiting to be seated and there was about five waiters that were free and none of them acknowledged my existence and other Irish came in . They serviced them i watched the guy taking them to the table. Give them the menu, order and literally just passed by me, part of this is the worst customer service ever you guys need to get your shit togetherüöÆüöÆüöÆ (by Amu) [Edited 3 months ago] | Review 5: 4 stars - We were driving through and decided to stop for a drink‚Ä¶.we were easily persuaded to get a snack too! We got a steak sandwich (very tasty) and some chicken tenders in no time . Loved the food. The genuine service is so typical of Irish catering establishments. Well done guys - keep it up (by David Fenech) [a year ago] | Review 6: 1 star - Absolutely disgusting service, A Disappointing and Unacceptable Dining Experience.
My party of four recently visited your establishment hoping to enjoy a roast dinner. Unfortunately, what began as a simple meal turned into an incredibly frustrating and disappointing experience due to a complete lack of customer service.
After we ordered our meals, I inquired if roast potatoes were included with the roast. I was informed by our server that you had run out. While this was disappointing, what was truly shocking was the server's sarcastic response when I pointed out that it wasn't our fault. They said, "Do you want to ask the chef?" This sarcastic and unhelpful attitude was the first sign of a breakdown in communication.
When I requested to speak with a manager, a gentleman came over. I calmly explained the situation, and he said he would speak with the chef. However, before a resolution could be reached, a second manager (a woman) came to our table and immediately asked, "What is the issue with us?" I calmly explained the situation again, only for her to begin taking away our menus and telling us that if we didn't like it, we didn't have to eat there. She then accused us of being rude to her staff and "causing a scene."
I immediately pointed out that it was she who was causing a scene, as I had been speaking in a respectful and low tone. Her demeanor was hostile and confrontational, and it was clear from her voice that she was very angry. In an attempt to find a compromise, I suggested a complimentary plate of sweet potatoes. She completely ignored my reasonable request and simply walked away with our menus.
This entire interaction was handled with a shocking lack of professionalism and basic courtesy. The behavior of both the server and the second manager was completely unacceptable. The female manager, in particular, displayed no customer service or management skills whatsoever. Instead of trying to find a solution, she escalated the situation, made false accusations, and chose to be combative rather than helpful. She single-handedly turned a minor inconvenience into a situation that made us feel unwelcome and disrespected. We left your establishment feeling appalled by the behavior of your staff. We will not be returning and will be sharing our experience with others. (by Gurdev Singh) [a month ago] | Review 7: 1 star - Absolutely dead on a Friday night which is a pity as it's a great looking bar. Polite staff but terrible service. Seemed like they forgot we were there. Waited ages for drinks then food order.

Food was awful. Burger was dry and bland. Had to send steak back as it was just swimming in oil. Ended up not eating most of it. To be fair, manager took the steak off the bill which was the right thing to do.

Plenty of other places in Ennis with an atmosphere and better food and service (by Simon Moore (SkylineSi)) [a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Amazing food, beautiful service and incredible full of sunshine terrace (by Diana Hordiienko) [5 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Great food & drink, amazing service and really reasonably priced. (by Pearse Mccurdy) [2 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - We had a delicious roast beef!!
With potatoes and cabbage. Gravy was wonderful.
The price was very very reasonable!
Going back tonight :) (by Anne Marie Ryan) [a week ago]

name: Henry's Bistro & Wine Bar
address: Market Street, Clonroad Beg, Ennis, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - After landing in Shannon, we had our first evening meal at Henry's Bistro & Wine Bar.  We were served two kinds of bread while we ordered our starters.

Thr Seafood Chowder as a big hit!  Others in our group enjoyed the Slow Cooked Pork Belly. The Tiger Prawns were also delicious!

Our entrees included the Pan Roasted Salmon and the Surf-n-turf.  The Free Range Chicken was also very good.

Try Henry's Bistro &Wine Bar.   You will not be disappointed! (by Dennis Smith) [3 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Loved it here! The food was delicious, prices very reasonable, and the service was attentive without being pushy. Definitely coming bac (by –ê–Ω–Ω–∞ –ö–æ—Å—Ç–µ–≤–∞) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Doesn't look like much from the outside but a very warm welcome greats you. Lovely glass of white wine with Mt sea bass special. Husband had salmon off the menu and said it was delish. He had Eton mess and I had the cheese board. Service was impeccable. Had a lovely chat before we left. Defo give it a go (by Fi) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Particularly friendly staff and very yummy soups. Surely recommended. Also if you are into tea, make sure to get the safran tea, amazing! (by Johannes Langer) [a month ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Highly recommended restaurant, great food, not expensive, comfortable atmosphere and most importantly very friendly people who make you feel at home. (by Alicia Pergo) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Came over for my birthday and wasn't disappointed! Staff were friendly and helpful.  Food was served fast. The medium well rib eye steak was on point, and it went well with red wine! Would come back. (by AEGV V) [8 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Decided to come here on Sunday while on route to Limerick for a concert. So worth coming off the motorway for. Food was gorgeous, price was so reasonable and staff were so helpful and friendly. We shared a starter and the chef even sent out an extra plate with salad to us. That kind of thing never happens, we were so grateful. Would highly recommend and will definitely come again. (by Laura O) [2 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Really good food and menu choice. Staff were really attentive. Even though we turned up on a Friday with no reservation we were given a table very quickly. Would definitely go back.
(Very loud comment was purely down to a large, noisy table.) (by Colin Glen) [4 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - We were part of a group of about 30 and the food and service exceeded our expectations!!!  We will definitly go back there individually or with a group on our next trip to Ennis.  Our meals and desserts were delicious! (by Darwin & Leslie Hoffman) [2 weeks ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Stopped by Henry‚Äôs for an evening meal after a walkabout around town-so glad we did!  The chowder was delicious and we enjoyed the ribeye immensely, cooked perfectly to medium rare. Manuel had great recommendations and made our night fantastic. Would definitely visit again! (by Robert Taylor) [5 months ago]

name: Homestead Cottage
address: R 478, Luogh North, Doolin, Co. Clare, V95 KH30, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - The food and service was 100% worth the white knuckle drive in a campervan down the narrow Irish roads. We had a wonderful time and would love to visit again in the future. The food was incredible and we saw the staff gathering ingredients for the meal while we got ready for our meal in our camper van. Being tourists we were not comfortable driving at night so it was a wonderful surprise they allowed us to overnight in their lot and head out the next morning. (by Sue Ann) [3 days ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Homestead Cottage is a little gem hidden by the cliffs close to Doolin, Co. Clare. There is a beautiful garden right in front where they grow their own vegetables.

From the second we walked in, we were taken care of by the staff. They were very attentive, friendly and extremely professional. The decor is really beautiful. It does reflect the nature that surrounds the cottage.

We had a couple of cocktails and they were all really flavorful, both the alcoholic and non alcoholic ones.

The summer lunch tasting menu was delicious! Beautifully presented and colorful dishes. Every detail was thought through. The flavors blended so nicely together. You could taste the freshness in every dish. The kitchen was able to swap the ingredients according to our food preferences and allergies which we really appreciated.

We will come back to savour the dishes in other seasons too! (by Magda Chelstowska) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - We had an exceptional dining experience at Homestead Cottage. There were five of us. Two of our family have experience in food service and fine dining and we all agreed it was one of the best meals of our lives. The space is charming, there was a fire in the stove when we arrived, it feels like a home with warm wood, the stone fireplace wall, cookbooks lining the mantle. The service was excellent and attentive. The courses were well-paced and everything from placement and type of utensil (sometimes a small wooden spoon for example, sometimes a fine knife) were well paired with the food. The food itself was delightful and full of beauty and surprises, delicate but deep flavors and interesting textures. Gorgeous presentation. We loved our experience and would definitely come again! I enjoyed every bite! Favorites included the beef tartare, tender and flavorful oysters, scallop, the lamb (oh the lamb) and turbot and the peach and raspberry with Clare cream had such heightened fruit flavors it was incredible and the Valrhona Chocolate with shortbread was out of this world. The bite of the fruit square was perfect paired with an espresso to finish the meal. As you can see the presentation was a work of art but each piece contributed to the taste, the most important part of all. I wish I had saved the menu! (by Dominique Rychlik) [a month ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - There are certain dining experiences that will become memories to savour for a lifetime. Delightedly, Homestead Cottage provided this for us last night.

The experience began from the moment we drove onto the property. The austere landscape enfolded us as we tucked into the cozy of the 200 yr old cottage for our unhurried and blissful evening.

The serving team each present a beautiful energy and glow as they describe each course. Their joy and passion is evident. And they hustle, while maintaining a calm that sets an atmosphere for guests.

This is an experience to be enjoyed slowly. 3 hrs is the right amount of time for 8+courses. Savour each moment.

The courses themselves‚Äî no words can capture the flavours. It‚Äôs a journey that provides guests with a sampling of this coast‚Äôs best and finest bounty of the land and sea.

It was beauty displayed in countless intentional ways‚Äî from the petite dried floral arrangements on each table, to the musical selections (thank you for Norah Jones and Dolly Parton), to the hot towels to rinse off some of the rugged outdoor world we had just come from.

You will find yourself losing track of time (tuck your phone away as much as you can) and settle into Homestead Cottage to be a part of some of the magic of the Irish countryside. (by Sj Anderson) [a month ago] | Review 5: 3 stars - High expectations when booking the restaurant for birthday dinner. Little card message was cute and surprising as well. Enjoyed dining here but overall underwhelming and disappointed a little.

Booked whole trip to come and dine in the restaurant also visiting Aran islands was a plus. As it‚Äôs special occasion, wanted to add some drinks preferably pairing option so booked the separate taxi going and back from accommodation as well because it‚Äôs nowhere near town or walkable. However, it wasn‚Äôt worth that much in my opinion.

Usually staffs ask what we would like to drink and offer at the beginning but we felt left out, didn‚Äôt get asked and staffs all seem very busy. When they brought amuse bouche, managed to order wine pairings.

Maybe ordering drinks mixed up everything because we ended up waiting long to get the next dish and wines after.

Also, people came later than us getting food and drinks before us and our service got delayed more and more.

I understand that fine dining restaurant takes some time to get served and there was no hurry at all for us so didn‚Äôt make any complaints but it was noticeable getting slower for our table whole night. We were one of last tables leaving the restaurant after 3 hour dining. At that point, we rushed to get up.

Foods were nice - very fresh ingredients and seasonal. Highlights were main lamb dish but nothing else was memorably stood out.

Happy we tried but I don‚Äôt think I would recommend rather than amazing & affordable options in the area. (by Eunju) [2 months ago] | Review 6: 3 stars - We loved the cottage feel of this place.
The service was ok, it took till the middle of my second course to order and get my wine though. I didn‚Äôt always understand what the dish was because the server spoke very quickly.
Apart from the dessert, the bread course was our favourite.
Didn‚Äôt know what the menu would be and my hubby is not a seafood lover and didn‚Äôt eat the oysters which I ended up having both but were delicious. Second and third courses were also seafood but weren‚Äôt particularly great. The cod was steamed but could‚Äôve done with a little more cooking time for our tastes and contained bones which nearly pierced my throat. The crab was nice but lacked flavour.
The lamb dish was tasty but had too much fat for my taste.
The best bit about the meal was the dessert and the wine I had was very good.
All in all we paid over ‚Ç¨210, which we had driven 2 hours to get to for a meal that was really just ok. I would not go again. I just didn‚Äôt think it was that special.
We did love the fact the produce was locally sourced and that was remarkable.
We‚Äôve experienced Michelin accredited food before, however, this didn‚Äôt hit the mark for us.
Sorry. (by Anjli Wouhra-Cummings) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 3 stars - First off, food was incredible. Quality, variety, use of Irish ingredients, all well worthy of the star.

Sadly the service was really quite poor though. It took almost four hours to get through an eight course tasting menu (‚Ç¨125pp). Great welcome initially, but after that we spent about 90% of our time sitting in front of empty plates or an empty table. They would benefit from a more speedy service (I get 4h for a 15+ course menu, not for 8 though).

Also the setup of the cottage is quite interesting. We were in a room to the left when you enter (I'd avoid this one if you can, seems the other areas are better). There are three tables of two there, so super intimate. It also though feels like you're forgotten about by the staff, maybe because they can't actually see you. One time I went to try find a staff member to ask if it could go a bit quicker, I walked through all the rooms, and there wasn't one staff member outside the kitchen in any of the dining rooms. So no one keeping an eye on things. Also, could rarely understand their descriptions of plates (mainly starters and desserts), where it felt like they were trying to urgently get out the details before sprinting back to the kitchen. Maybe under-staffed?

Altogether, great food, huge amount to work on for service of a Michelin star though, so depending how much this matters to you should influence your decision to go. (by Graham Mills) [2 months ago] | Review 8: 2 stars - The food overall was very good ‚Äî beautiful use of high-quality Irish produce, clearly sourced with care. The atmosphere was lovely: warm, rustic, and inviting.

However, we were really let down by one dish in particular ‚Äî a crab course that contained several sharp pieces of shell. My partner had to remove 6 or 7 fragments from her mouth after biting down on them, which is not only unpleasant but quite dangerous. We showed the pieces to the waitress, who acknowledged the issue and said she‚Äôd inform the kitchen, but that was the last we heard of it. No apology, no follow-up, no gesture whatsoever.

For a restaurant of this reputation and price point (we paid over ‚Ç¨300 for the meal), we expected a far higher level of care and service. A shame, because it otherwise could have been a standout experience. (by Jonathan Kennedy) [3 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Homestead Cottage is a Michelin-starred restaurant for good reason‚Äîbut beyond the accolades, what truly sets it apart is the unhurried, welcoming dining experience they create.

The team, led by Sophie, made us feel right at home‚Äîeven with our 4-year-old dining alongside us. The staff was warm and attentive without ever making the meal feel rushed. And the food? Absolutely exceptional. They blend flavors with a level of finesse and creativity that few restaurants can match.

Plan ahead, make the reservation, and go. You will not be sorry. (by Brett Williamson) [3 months ago] | Review 10: 3 stars - We've thought long and hard about this review. We looked forward to our visit for so long. But we left disappointed and probably won't return. The food is excellent,  the room  quirky but it works. Some of tge tables are too tight, but when we moved one of our chairs, it was better. The problem was with the service and pricing. We didn't get the wine we ordered. Not a big deal. The replacement was fine but we were assured again and again it was the right one (it wasn't). When the bill cane it seemed high but we added a tip. Then after paying we discovered a service charge was already added. When we pointed this out and asked for one of the tips to be refunded there began a week long drama... eventually we got one of tge tips back but it left a sour taste after such delicious food. Chef needs to sort front of house. (by Francis Nesbitt) [4 months ago]

name: The Pantry Shannon
address: Unit A16, Shannon Town Centre, Tullyvarraga, Shannon, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Went to the Pantry today for the first time and i got strawberry nutella pancakes, my boyfriend got kinder beuno pancakes and they were amazing. The service is amazing everyone is lovely here. Best pancakes i ate definitely recommend getting them. (by Olivia Ludwisiak) [7 months ago] | Review 2: 3 stars - The shop was very quaint and the food was good. My biggest qualm was the iced mango matcha I ordered.  The drink I received was basically just milk and mango puree. The thing was whiter than my ginger cousin in winter. To give them some credit there was approx 3 poppy seed sized clumps of match floating at the top, but for almost 5 quid wtfff.... (by Ben Switzer) [4 months ago] | Review 3: 4 stars - Food: chips were poor no color on them and a bit soggy.  The chicken burger was really good, the batter. The little side salad was a side salad nothing much to rave about here.
Service: bit awkward setup. Go in and get the menu yourself, order at the counter, find your own seat site down and wait for food. When I got in I didn't know if it was a wait be seated or what sort of job until I saw sign on table. Don't care what ever way you guys do it but at least make it clear.
Atmosphere: it's a cafe shop in a shopping center (by Forward Slash) [5 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - i‚Äôm a regular at the pantry i‚Äôm always down here for my coffee and it‚Äôs always very good quality with some of the nicest service. they really do look after their customers and it‚Äôs such an easy environment to be in! (by Amanda Madden) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Nice food, big portions. (by Keith C) [3 weeks ago] | Review 6: 4 stars - Food was delicious, but rather greasy and was falling apart due to that (got a chicken burger and a Caesar chicken wrap). Staff were friendly, and the dining area was clean and prettily decorated. (by Elizabeth Lian) [4 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Service are brilliant and food was so delicious, The pantry Curry is one of my Fav meal for lunch. (by Binay Pokharel) [2 months ago] | Review 8: 3 stars - In summary, average but overpriced with comparable restaurants.

First thing that was said to us by service was "One minute". No "welcome in, just give me a moment and I'll be with you". Not quite the welcome you want.

Had the soup, burger, and pepperoni pizza. The soup was excellent, but the pizza and burger were let downs. Pizza was overloaded with cheese and very little base sauce, the pepperoni also didnt taste great. Burger was very dry, but chips were good. Not worth the price for the quality we received.

Visited on a quiet Sunday during lunch. (by Noah McGovern) [a year ago] | Review 9: 4 stars - Food was great, service was fast and efficient (if a little self-service). The food is pricey, but there's not a lot in the way of choice in Shannon Town Centre. The place is a bit open and unwelcoming (and cold). (by Don O'Sullivan) [7 months ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - Im not usually fussy with food or feel the need to complain.
Normally I enjoy the food here but got a small shock when I ordered poached eggs and avocado (10.95‚Ç¨) or there abouts.

One slice of toast with 2 poached eggs, the white of the eggs was not cooked properly and the avocado was quite brown. Wasn't happy paying 11‚Ç¨ for a slice of toast and 2 eggs. (by Amy Conway) [10 months ago]

name: Vaughan Lodge Hotel
reviews:
Review 1: None - Enjoyed the stay here. Clean and great location. Hotel is most suited to local golfers, we were a family with small children. Restaurants staff were nice but service could be slow. Top marks for hospitality/cleaning staff they were really on the ball. Staff at reception were nice also. The free lollies and gold tees were nice touch. (by Shauna Davis) | Review 2: None - This family-owned Lahinch hotel is a gem! The warm, welcoming staff made us feel right at home. The breakfasts and dinners were outstanding‚Äîfresh, local ingredients crafted into delicious, regional and coastal-inspired dishes that left us ‚Ä¶ (by dinaaW7811HB) | Review 3: None - My husband and I visited this hotel for a brief one night day and were once again blown away by the friendly service, great food and relaxed comfortable nature of this little gem of a hotel.  We had dinner in the restaurant and my ‚Ä¶ (by Oakkea) | Review 4: None - I stayed with my sister recently and it was perfect.
The staff are incredibly helpful and it's a lovely homely atmosphere.
It's a quiet hotel with no large parties which we really appreciated, saying that there was no issue staying up late at the bar!
The manager also kindly offered to take us to the bus stop on leaving.
I would highly recommend and it would be my choice when I return. (by Irene Robinson) | Review 5: None - My daughter and I had the immense pleasure of an all too brief overnight stay in this gem of a true family run business. From the warmth of Eimear‚Äôs welcome to the courtesy, good humour and professionalism of Michael ( the owner) and his ‚Ä¶ (by marynS1022WA) | Review 6: None - This hotel will not disappoint, the breakfast was the best I‚Äôve ever had on the island of Ireland. The hotel itself is spotless & the staff are so friendly & efficient. It is a credit to the owner, Michael, who is ever present on the establishment. Dinner is a must have also. (by Brian Rohan) | Review 7: None - Had a night's stay at Vaughan Lodge and it was a wonderful night.  The hotel is absolutely lovely and the staff are very welcoming and friendly. The room was very comfortable and the restaurant served up a wonderful selection and our dinner was excellent. Michael is a wonderful host and I hope we can visit again soon. (by A4089JZmartinad) | Review 8: None - It was the first night of our trip going through southwest Ireland. Had stayed before on a golf trip. Accommodations very good. Hot night but there were fans in the room, so comfortable. Staff was great and arranged transportation to/from a restaurant. Bar was very nice for a before dinner drink. (by Osterville) | Review 9: None - We only stayed for one night but wish we could have stayed longer. We felt so welcome from the moment we walked in. Our room was large, clean and comfortable and provided the perfect base from which to walk into Lahinch. Breakfast was ‚Ä¶ (by GrandTour65264715842) | Review 10: None - Extremely impressed with all aspects of our stay in this hotel. Breakfast was outstanding; wide array of gluten-free options available. Highly recommend. (by Feargal √ì Laighin)

name: Adriano's Pizza & Pasta
address: Elm Park, Gort Rd, Lifford, Ennis, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Absolutely fantastic, authentic Italian food. Plenty of vegetarian options e.g. pizza, pasta, suppli (rice balls with cheese). The pizza dough is perfect and fresh and plenty of mozzarella on top. I had spaghetti puttanesca without anchovies and it was delicious! Honestly, do not waste your money going to chain "Italian" restaurants, go here if you're in the area.

They provide full waiter service.
There's plenty of free parking outside. (by Deb M) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Fantastic true Italian cuisine! The quality is good enough for a formal restaurant setting with cloth tablecloths. The pasta was true el dente, the sauces homemade, the flavors exquisite. Purchased a pizza for take away also. I fully recommend this restaurant. (by Jerome) [a week ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - If you're in Ennis and craving fresh pizza or pasta, Adriano's is the place to go! The food is super tasty, made with fresh ingredients, and the staff is really friendly. Plus, it's fast and affordable. Definitely worth a visit if you‚Äôre in the mood for some great Italian food! (by Ammy C Warny) [6 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - While touring across Ireland we fell behind our schedule a little so we stopped in here unexpectedly for dinner, since we wanted something fairly quick and easy. What started as a spontaneous dinner stop turned into one of the best pizza experiences of our lives. I saw a plaque on the wall that they placed second in all of Ireland for a pizza competition and I‚Äôd venture to say that‚Äôs an understatement. Absolutely delicious pizza, great service, and very fair prices. Our server gave us some great local travel tips too and she was a pleasure to deal with. Next time I‚Äôm in Ireland I‚Äôm going to make sure to stop here for food again. (by Jay Mac) [4 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Food was great. Coca Cola was ice cold.  City Center was dead and restaurants there didn't look great so we drove to Adriano's from Temple Gate hotel. It was really good. We had a salad and pepperoni pizza and were very happy with the food. (by Karen Houston) [4 months ago] | Review 6: 4 stars - We recently visited this place - Wood fired pizza was delicious. We also bought spaghetti which was a bit more salty - couldn‚Äôt eat it and returned - they were graciously agreed to take it back and didn‚Äôt charge. Offered me alternate but I refused to take. Friendly staffs and will visit there again to try other food. (by Picturesque Travel) [Edited 5 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - One of the best pizza üçï in Ireland. I go all over Ireland with my work and Adrianos is one of the best pizza you will get anywhere üòã üëè . My kids love ‚ù§Ô∏è it (by John Keniry) [4 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Great Pizza! Just what we wanted. We were stuffed coming out. Staff were very friendly. Sorry pics aren‚Äôt great we were so hungry forgot to take pics first. (by Grainne Doherty) [6 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Mama M√≠a! This was our second food outing on our holiday! Great place. Loved it. I‚Äôm usually a fan of Italian food so this was lovely for me. Please check this place out üáÆüáπ (by Freddie Llekrjr) [6 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - A group of 24 of us were here over the weekend for dinner, it was unreal. Everyone raved about the meals. Special mention to the vodka pasta, mushroom tagliatelle, bunga bunga pizza and the chicken cooked in lemon and wine was unreal. We were all trying eachothers! Excited to go back to try more. (by Tara Mc Padden) [7 months ago]

name: Freddy‚Äôs Restaurant Limerick
address: Theatre Ln, Lower Glentworth St, Prior's-Land, Limerick, V94 T3K1, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - We went there based on the google reviews and here we are leaving one because not enough of them do this place justice. 2 dinners were had and between the 8 dishes tried I can confidently give them each a 10 out of 10.
Superb atmosphere. Excellent service. Don‚Äôt hesitate! (by Linguaviva Centre) [a month ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - We had a great last meal in limerick at this restaurant! The place inside is very cozy, too bad it was almost 80 degrees outside. Anyway, we ordered a bottle of prosecco and got the sour dough bread and bread which was amazing. I ordered the lamb shank with roasted potatoes. It was delicious with the meat falling off the bone. My daughter got the prawn linguini which was very good. My husband got the chicken which was delicious as well. We ended with the creme brulee which was yum. Overall it was a very nice experience! (by Monica Puri Bangia) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - My partner and I have been here many times. Firstly the staff are fantastic, very attentive and friendly. Divine was absolutely amazing and always is. The food is top class. Everything is cooked to order and so fresh. There are many ceoliac options even multiple desserts ! The sticky toffee pudding is to die for. Finally the owner is the kindest person and you can tell she really cares about good customer service and good food. Will be back soon and highly recommend! (by laura harney) [2 weeks ago] | Review 4: 4 stars - My friends & I have been talking about going to Freddys for years - Time just got away from us & we finally had the chance to go last night and it did not disappoint! The atmosphere was fabulous, the staff were warm and welcoming and the food was exceptional. As a vegetarian, I struggle to get anything that isn't a standard curry or thrown together stir fry, but the options at Freddys were amazing and the nut roast was by far the best veggie food I've ever eaten in Ireland. My friends, all non veggies, said their food was divine too. Would absolutely recommend to anybody and everybody. (by Samantha Sparrow) [a week ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - We had a fantastic meal last weekend for a birthday celebration. There were 6 people in our party. Everyone ordered something different and everything was absolutely perfect. Hot food delicious and all served at the same time. Staff were very good just the right amount of attentiveness and not a bit intrusive. The only thing I can mention is that on the website you can only book a maximum of 4 people. I had to text to book the additional 2 people. This maybe something to look at. But we have zero complaints about the food restaurant or service. Keep up the good work and the staff are brilliant. (by charlotte kiely) [3 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Sublime! We ate twice the lamb shank and mussels it was amazing. The pork belly, goat cheese salad, duck salad and fish were so yummy. Everything was unforgettable the ambience, staff, desserts. We recommended to family and friends. (by Sally Ortiz) [2 weeks ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Amazing meal with delicious vegan options which are are to come by in Limerick. Top class restaurant with great service. I‚Äôll definitely return to try more vegan options! (by Marie) [9 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Friendly service in comfortable rooms and delicious,  generous food. Perfectly pitched neighbourhood restaurant and a great place to meet friends. (by Francis Nesbitt) [4 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Class food and great service made for a lovely night. The menu is relatively small but the quality of the food was amazing. (by Conor O'Reilly) [a week ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Great intimate restaurant with incredible food and attentive staff (by Rebecca Cleary) [a week ago]

name: The Monks Pantry
address: Main Street, Quingardens, Quin, Co. Clare, V95 PT63, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - We stopped in to try out the new breakfast menu today- food was absolutely delicious! Everything was really fresh, the eggs were perfectly cooked and service was very quick. They are always so accommodating to me and my toddler and baby. Lovely atmosphere, very welcoming, cosy lighting and a good buzz, the other tables were full. I normally would head into Ennis for food but I'm thrilled to come here instead, you honestly couldn't get a better brunch in town! (by Dominique Twomey-Purcell) [3 weeks ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Stopped for a visit to Quin Abbey and came to the pantry for a bite to eat after. Food was phenomenal and service was quick, perfect find for lunch! Thanks so much! (by Alyssa Valerio) [3 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Scrambled eggs close to perfection. Highly recommend üëå (by Sue Richards) [a week ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Popped in for a coffee and treat. It is a lovely cafe. Great coffee and food ! (by Eimear Mithen) [6 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - First time in this really lovely place, it‚Äôs spotless, lovely food, very friendly staff and great coffee!!
A place to visit and will definitely be going back to visit again and next time will be dining in there relaxing and not rushing off ! (by Darragh) [6 months ago]

name: Jilly & Joe's Restaurant & Courtyard
address: Meadows & Byrne Courtyard, Old Bunratty Rd, Bunratty East, Bunratty, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 4 stars - Over all a good experience the lce cream was good and the heated up cookie was so good. (SOS cookies).

The price was ok not so cheap but was worth the money.

The staff were lovely, and very friendly, offered loads of options.

Loads of seats available and other options available in the court yard. (by Geoff Hassett) [5 months ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - Very good variety of foods, good value and tasty food except for their toasted sandwiches. The carvery dinners are huge, the fish and chips, burger, chicken goujons and chips and pizza are all tasty and good value. The BLT was the worst sandwich I've ever paid money for: 2 thin slices of tomato, 2 small lettuce leaves and 2 really thin slices of bacon for the whole sandwich, the small portion of soup for an additional ‚Ç¨2.50 had more substance. (by Taz C) [a week ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - We had a corporate lunch for 30 people last week delivered to our office. The only thing we can say is WOW, the friendliness and professionalism of the staff is beyond measure from ordering the food to the delivery. We ordered the office lunch box with salads and treats... Everyone said the food was amazing and it was a great selection to suit everyone's taste. Highly recommend as an Office catering provider. Thank you for a great service and we will certainly order from Jilly & Joe's very soon (by Audrey Boulot) [4 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Great food (and drinks), amazing staff and excellent service. Jilly and Joes is a welcoming and inclusive environment for all. (I stress this, as plenty of businesses claim inclusiveness, but it takes a exceptional staff to make a place actually feel inclusive. It takes patience, compassion and open-mindedness, which the staff at Jilly and Joes have in droves.) Highly recommend stopping in. (by Taylor J) [a week ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Absolutely fantastic experience at Jilly & Joe‚Äôs Ice Cream Parlour! The service was top-notch. The ice cream was delicious and such a great price! A special shoutout to Raj who was absolutely amazing. He was extremely kind and helpful. Made our visit extra special. Highly recommend! (by Kailey) [a week ago] | Review 6: 2 stars - The icecream parlour is located on the back side of the complex. It's pity that they have only 1 type of sorbet (vegan). The mango sorbet was very sugary. We felt it was crushed ice mixed with syrup. And hence 2 stars. (by Dr. Faisal) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 4 stars - This is a cute little walk up and order, with plenty of outdoor tables to sit at (many covered under a tent, many outside the tent). Our group ordered fish n chips, which was large in size. And hamburgers, also large! But I ordered the children size chicken strips and chips- it was plenty. The food was good, in a way you would expect from a walk up counter. (by Stacy WB) [a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Good and tasty food. Spicy boxes can be more spicy or to have the hot sauce or flakes to add if you want. The chicken burger looks like a kid's meal, but it's tasty. On the other hand the fish and chips are so big ü§§ Still give 5 stars for the amazing chips - new potatoes. (by Virgil Emil Costea) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Beer is cold and the entertainment (someone singing) was great! Nice service. The area has heaters and is covered in case of rain. (by kim stiefel) [5 months ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - Cute ice cream shop with lots of options for ice creams and coffee. Tried the pistachio icecream but it wasn't that great. I'd still recommend stopping by just to enjoy and appreciate the beauty in this place. (by Kshitija Kulkarni) [11 months ago]

name: McDermott's Pub
address: Toomullin, Doolin, Co. Clare, V95 P285, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - A lovely pub with nice traditional music. The portion is good and the price is more than reasonable. The pub was very crowded and popular yet the servers were very attentive and provided great service. Recommend and will go back! (by Yongmei Zhang) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Authentic pub with a full menu. Great service and tasty food. My husband enjoyed his fish and chips and I enjoyed a delicious chicken club sandwich.  Of course paired with pints! (by Virginia Huffman) [a week ago] | Review 3: 4 stars - Came in on a Saturday for lunch - wasn‚Äôt too busy so we got a table straight away.

We ordered the beef burger and fish and chips- both were good.

The let down was that the Coca Cola was flat even it came in bottles.

There is plenty of parking making it easy for those driving. I would recommend but just skip the coke. (by Jason Jong) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Great good and service here, stopped along the way after touring Cliffs of Moher and was not disappointed. The chowder, nachos, and Irish stew were hearty and delicious. We also ordered some homemade bread to dip the sauces. Lots of parking on the side and on the premise. I recommend this place if you are stopping by Doolin. (by Edmund) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - What an amazing pub!! Great service and hearty Irish food. This pub went above and beyond our expectations and hit the spot two nights in a row after hiking. From the fish and chips to the bangers and mash. Everything is wonderful. Would recommend anyone in Doolin stops in for a pint and a great meal. (by Naomi Rynne) [6 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - An extremely busy pub but staff are very welcoming and helpful. We arrived after 8pm to a packed pub, with no seating available. However we managed to get a seat at the bar and a member of staff found us a table within 20 minutes of arrival. Service was excellent and we were able to order our food quite quickly and it arrived without much of a wait.
Food was outstanding! There were 3 of us in our party and we all ordered something different - bangers and mash, Irish beef stew and vegetarian fajitas. The food was well presented, delicious and very reasonably priced.
If you are visiting Doolin I high recommend this pub. You will not be disappointed! (by Nicki Bond) [3 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - We had the McDermott's 9 Ounce Irish Beef Burger at McDermott‚Äôs Pub and it was really tasty. It was juicy, well prepared and served with care. The cozy atmosphere and friendly staff made it a great stop in Doolin. (by kamilo) [3 weeks ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - We had the pleasure of dinner and drinks here during our brief visit to the beautiful Doolin. The fish and chips more than stood up to their reputation, the pea and tarter sauces were unanimously loved. The staff were attentive and very welcoming (especially Caleb and the other two barkeeps whom we unfortunately didn‚Äôt catch the names of)Thank you for a wonderful evening! (by Kasey Adamo) [4 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - One of the best pubs we visited in Ireland. Super friendly staff, great live Irish music, great pints of Guinness and tons of new friends. (by Rusty Mabry) [a month ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - Stopped in here before heading to Cliffs of Moher. We ordered the special toasted, club toasted, and kids fish and chips. My son did not like his fish and chips because he didn‚Äôt like the breading. My toasted was fine. The chips are nice and thin, not thick and chunky. (by Nichelle S) [2 months ago]

name: Pancho's Pizza & Pasta
address: 210 Main N Rd, Clare SA 5453, Australia
reviews:
Review 1: 3 stars - That was a good experience. Pizza was great. Filled with toppings of choice. Medium pizza good enough for 2. Was a pretty good place bang on the road except for a few noisy elements.. üòÖ
On the whole it's a good place for a meal while traveling. Must try. Lots on the Menu. Ice cream üçß too for the ones who love it.. üòã‚ù§Ô∏èüçîü•ìü´îüßÄüßáü´ïüçúüç§ (by Prude 's world) [6 months ago] | Review 2: 1 star - Took an hour to make our food, pics attached speak for themselves ü§£ $70 for this mess! Could hammer nails with the "cheesecake" which actually tasted of nothing! I'm not sure how that's even possible! Don't go here (by Matty Quackster) [7 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - I absolutely love Panchos! The food is always fresh, flavorful, and made with care ‚Äî you can tell they take pride in what they do. The atmosphere is welcoming and relaxed, making it a perfect spot for both quick bites and sit-down meals. What really sets Ponchos apart, though, is the boss. Super friendly, down-to-earth, and genuinely cares about the customers. Every time I visit, I feel like more than just another order ‚Äî I feel valued. Highly recommend this place to anyone looking for great food and even better service! (by cod cod) [5 months ago] | Review 4: 3 stars - The place is busy, lots of takeaway orders waiting upon entry. Dine in section is clean and comfy. The outdoor seating is nice and leafy for the warmer days, no heater for the cooler nights though. The pizza‚Äôs are pretty good and tasty. Food to table wasn‚Äôt too long of a wait even though they are busy for a mid week.
Offer gelato cake, chicken & chips, burgers etc for a quick to go order as well.
Service staff could smile a little more. (by Janet‚Äôs Journey) [4 years ago] | Review 5: 1 star - Ordered the bao buns. Got them home and they were black in colour and very hard. Chicken was covered in dry flour and still had blood in them. If I lived closer I would have taken them back but they went in the bin. Will definitely not be back (by It's Me) [3 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Such good food at a very reasonable price. We visited and dined in, not expecting much. What we received were pub+ quality meals served on plates with garnish. We had pasta (tasted incredible), pizzas (delicious), a schnitzel with gravy (fantastic taste, unfortunately the chips were old tasting), wedges and possibly the best garlic bread I've ever had. 4 meals plus sides came to just over $50. The staff clearly try hard to please although perhaps a little out of their depth. Only thing that would make it better is some wine but I don't reckon they have a liquor licence. Pretty stoked to go back next time we're in Clare. (by Adam P) [a year ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Amazing Food and Service
I highly recommend Pancho's Pizza & Pasta. Their zinger burgers are crispy and flavourful, and the pizzas are exceptional. The staff are welcoming and provide top-notch service. Highly recommend.
Would definitely go there again (by Damo) [4 months ago] | Review 8: 3 stars - Great size pizza for value. Unfortunately, a LOT of pizza sauce which was thick to the point of not being heated through. Wondering if we received the wrong order, as the base was meant to be bbq, but it was definitely tomato, and we couldn't identify any meat other than the ham and a couple of bits of mettwurst. There also wasn't much cheese. I won't be eating the leftovers. (The erratic variation between reviews seems to indicate there are two or more very different classed chefs/cooks preparing the food.) (by Jacqui Maynard) [5 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Friday evening; evidently their pizza is popular, so without ringing ahead, it was 20 mins for this delicious feast. Meat lovers and margarita pizzas, chicken parmi hot pack and chicken risotto. The chips were perfect. Parked right out front! (by Adam Davey) [2 years ago] | Review 10: 2 stars - I was the only customer in the place.  It was mid afternoon on Friday.  It is a small pizza from the menu with no complications.  It was burnt!  How do you burn a pizza unless you really can't be bothered? This is the worst pizza I have EVER eaten (I ate it only cos I was hungry).  Note - I am over seventy and have eaten pizzas all over the world. (by HH Reid) [2 months ago]

name: Serafina's Restaurant & Take Away
address: Kilmaley Lodge, Culleen, Kilmaley, Co. Clare, V95 NV0T, Ireland
service_options: The Village Takeaway ¬∑ 5.0 stars ¬∑ 1 review ¬∑ Fast Food
reviews:
Review 1: 3 stars - From.the outside it is difficult to know if this  place is open or not. However it is open from Wed to Sunday & the food is very good & wholesome. Just one tip would be the plates need to be hotter & a coffee machine would be beneficial (by Elizabeth Mc Donnell) [3 weeks ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Very kind staff and fast service. The food was delicious. Highly recommended! (by Dorota Kmiec) [5 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Choose takeway option and we had an excellent Lamb stew - I couldn't finish it all!
Herself had the peppered chicken and loved it too.
Homemade chips were really tasty.
Definitely will be regulars! (by Billy Bob) [a year ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - A hidden gem.   We had Irish lamb stew, and roast beef, and the boys  burgers that they loved.  Everything was really tasty and fresh. (by John W) [a year ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Great chipper that also offers main meals and gluten/Dairy free options. The chips are great and the portions large!  Great friendly staff and can highly recommend! (by Dach101) [a year ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Great find. Lovely kebab (by Nyle Wolfe) [5 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Very nice food and good service at a reasonable price, I will be back again.
Se√°n (by Sean Ryan) [a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Excellent food and lovely staff (by Aileen Griffin) [11 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Lovely homemade Chips! (by Dylan Rice) [a year ago]

name: Roma Take Away
address: Market Square, Kilrush, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 3 stars - It was ok, on the google images it shows pizza with a nice char on the crust but mine was a bit limp and underdone. I asked for Salami but they put ham and when challenged they said ham is what they call Salami, so that‚Äôs a bit random. I wasn‚Äôt offered a replacement, which would be the appropriate customer service response, so they lost a star there.
