The toppings were kinda just dumped in the middle too, instead of evenly spread around and that‚Äôs a bit lazy. It‚Äôs a big place but no tables or chairs are offered. I had to return for napkins as they weren‚Äôt provided. They do not have shakers on the counter for chilli flakes, oregano, salt or pepper. They only accept cash and that is obviously inappropriate for a business and an inconvenience for the customer so that took another star. The pizza tasted ok apart from that ultra processed ham which I removed. I would probably go back but ask for the pizza to be well done and replace the salami (ham) with pepperoni. Overall I was disappointed but with just a little effort this could really be a great Pizza restaurant. Everyone working there was Eastern European and it somehow felt like it may have changed hands recently. They were fast to serve the food, the ingredients seemed fresh, they were friendly and the kitchen looked clean.  A bit of customer service training would help them to better understand the expectations customers have after handing over their hard earned money. To end, they offer good value for the overall quality of the food and the pizza dough itself is very good. (by Brian Heagney) [3 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - How can pizza be this good and so reasonably priced. Top marks (by John O'Neill) [4 months ago] | Review 3: 4 stars - Very nice food staff are very friendly, (by Aidan Barry) [4 months ago] | Review 4: 3 stars - Fresh cod and chips were good but the place is dirty. Tables and floor greasy to point you would have to wonder when they were cleaned last. This begs the question how clean is it behind the counter and in food preparation areas. (by Thomas Maher) [3 years ago] | Review 5: 3 stars - Good chips. But Pizza only had a light sprinkling of toppings and the cheese was partially burnt.
Two to three times the amount of toppings would be normal - just because it's a small pizza doesn't mean that the customer wants an empty pizza. Taste ok, otherwise. (by Eddy Tuite) [6 years ago] | Review 6: 1 star - Very bad experience yesterday 2th may 2022.
Couldn't get true by phone, so we ordered when we were there . Its a 20 minute drive to get there !
When we were there, no donner kebab, no philly steak sandwich !
So it was fish ,garlic chips and pizza !
Never had a bad experience but this day it was !
Garlic chip was garlic cheese ( not ordered)
Fish was fried to lo g and dry !
And the pizza for the children was totally burnt, black on the bottom  !

They couldn't eat it so made sandwich for them. It was the last day they were  here  before flying back home, and never been so disappointed! Ofcourse no reply when I tried to call them !
Were they so busy, overwhelmed?
No idea but to screw up such a big order is very bad !
They really need to take a look, lately it's going down hill, to bad because we loved to go there as a take away ! (by cisca Bos) [Edited 3 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Nice food, great service, friendly staff, and good prices. Recommend a visit (by John Devereux) [9 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - In house cut home style French fries are excellent. Pizza's are good and hold their own against the best. Pizza generally cooked in the authentic Italian thin base style. (by John Kiely) [4 years ago] | Review 9: 3 stars - Food ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
Service ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
Value ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
Location ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
Appearance ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Nice people in a good location with fair prices.  Food was generally okay, esp chips.  Chicken burger poor though, overdone processed meat with soggy toppings.

Giving 3 stars mainly due to lack of card machine.  We spent ‚Ç¨24 on a meal which we dialled in to collect as running late.  Not being able to take card had us scrambling around for an ATM. (by Karl McCann) [3 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Lovely fish and chips. The battered sausages are the big ones. They still do the ‚Ç¨3 deal. Small chip curry sauce and a battered sausage in a tub. Great value and plenty of food. (by FRAN GRAN) [Edited 3 years ago]

name: Clare Bake house
address: 269 Main N Rd, Clare SA 5453, Australia
service_options: Just Julies Cafe Takeaway ¬∑ 4.4 stars ¬∑ 117 reviews ¬∑ Cafe
reviews:
Review 1: 3 stars - I have a feeling this place is frequented by travellers more than locals.  I certainly wouldn't be a repeat customer.
There wasn't a huge choice of sweets or savoury items that one could expect in a busy town. The coffee is average, and the spinach and fetta roll I had was OK, but nothing special.
The staff try their best, but they don't seem to cope well when a lot of people walk in at the same time. Tables aren't wiped regularly either. (by Emmy Silvius) [a year ago] | Review 2: 1 star - We used to visit this bakery once a year in September during canola blossom season. This year it was a big disappointment because of the service. Spending around $50, we didn't feel welcomed and didn't see any smile on the female staff member. She looked unhappy and cold to sell food to us. Never come back again. (by Tim) [2 weeks ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Came in for a late-ish breakfast, I ordered an egg and bacon sandwich, and a hot chocolate. The sandwich was good, but the young man who made my hot chocolate did an exceptional job. I couldn't have made it better if I tried. Very impressed, and will definitely be stopping by again next time I'm in town. (by Rhianna Fairburn) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 2 stars - Ordered 2 X pies and 2 X coffees. Coffee was good. Curry pie was good. The second pie was labled Lamb Shank. There were plenty of vegetables in it. Couldn't find anything resembling meat in it. I pointed this out to the young bloke that works there. He looked, and said that he'd change it.  He brought me another of the same labling that he had opened for inspection. It was very similar to the first one, except that between us we did find a couple of tiny meat like pieces. I believe that it should be relabeled as " vegetables with a touch of lamb" ....but the wife did like the curry pie and the coffee. (by Glen Croaker) [a month ago] | Review 5: 1 star - For a country town bakery we were very very disappointed. Staff were so miserable.. not welcoming at all. Our coffees were so weak‚Ä¶ like drinking dish water and having bought a pasty and pie for our lunch they were dry, small and totally tasteless. The table was dirty from previous customers. We took one bite each from our food and a sip of coffee to wash it down and got up and left 3/4 of what we paid for on the table. We then ventured to the local for a cheap tasty meal. (by ingrid santucci) [5 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Have just re-discovered this wonderful bakery/cafe. Although now locals, we have avoided The Clare Bakehouse as it had been poorly run in the past. All that changed for us this afternoon.....We had the best oat-milk banana milkshake, carrot cake and hand- made iced coffee ever. The food and drinks were absolutely excellent. The very best thing about our visit today though, would have to be the staff! Tom and Tash are absolute treasures and these two people alone, will be the reason we intend to keep coming back. Wonderful manners and first class customer service. A real pleasure to meet such lovely people behind the counter. Keep up the good work you guys. Your kindness and your great personalities are very much loved and appreciated. (by Andy Applebee) [7 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Friendly bakery with plenty of choice to eatin or take away. (by Dieter Morre) [a month ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Very friendly staff one girl i think her name is tayla
She's fantastic lovely lady and so helpful (by Bill Bedford) [a month ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Just going to say this is hands down best cafe and bakery in Clare. The staff is always friendly and the vibes are positive. Coffee is top notch and the food is amazing. Never had a carrot cake that tasted so good before, could eat it everyday! (by myles bunce) [9 months ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - we had taken a travel Auction to stay in the C/ van pk from th we got a discount voucher for the bakery so i thought we would take this up well i wish i hadn't the young girl who served me was so rude i even said to her to smile i had a cafe myself if she worked for me she would not have been pn the till/counter she was an absolute turnoff made me feel guilty for coming into the shop she needs to realise it's us the customers thst's paying her wage the day b4 we went to the Clare bakery we went to the Blyth Bakery they r both owned by the same people well the sevice @ Clare is nothing like Blythevery disappointed (by Stephen Partridge) [5 months ago]

name: Tuscany Bistro Ballina/Killaloe
address: Main St, Ballina, Co. Tipperary, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Highly recommend. The waiter was so friendly and very helpful. I said after ordering that I was vegetarian and he let me know that all the dishes could be adapted for vegetarian, I didn‚Äôt have to stick to the vegetarian ‚Äòoption‚Äô on the menu. This never happens in restaurants. Normally told no, that that is how the chef does it.
The food we ordered was delicious and presented so well. Thoroughly enjoyed. (by Jess McC) [4 months ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - I went for the Tuscan fish stew but the cream killed the flavour of fish, will chose something different next time. My wife had the Giovanni fish dish which was tasty. Great staff and good service. (by Bill Paterson) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - We love this restaurant, the food is fantastic. I would highly recommend. Lovely staff and lovely location. (by Sharon Leahy) [a month ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Best food in this part of Ireland. Great service and quality at a great presentation. Well priced too! (by Pierre Melhado) [a month ago] | Review 5: 3 stars - The service was kind and the food is decent. I was sorely disappointed in the focaccia bread. It was very thin and not fluffy. Olive oil flavor was lacking. However don‚Äôt let this one dish hold you back. The others were well presented and provided good sustenance. (by Peggy M) [2 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Great Italian food. Very friendly helpful staff. We had a lovely evening here. The Cannoli were fabulous. (by Eoin Lennon) [a month ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Authentic Italian restaurant. The Pasta - Carbonara classic or with egg yolk - delicious! Best Caesar salad - the blue cheese sauce is amazing. Chicken breast, croutons, bacon and ingredients created an outstanding salad. Chicken Cacciatore - unspeakable! For sure we will come back. Pizza Speziata with Chilly Oil is amazing. (by Virgil Emil Costea) [Edited a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - We came for our Christmas party.. only a party of 4 this year given restraints.
The only thing better than the food was she friendly services.
We really felt the holiday atmosphere even amid social distancing and servers wearing masks.
The wine menu is excellent and we had to take a bottle home.
Thank you Tuscany 5* (by Corina Hanrahan) [Edited 4 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Excellent restaurant with great staff, great food & great cocktails. A must see if you're in that part of the world. (by Kenneth Michael Crotty) [a month ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Got seated pretty quickly, despite having no reservation on a Friday night. The chicken parmigiana was really good, and the goats cheese bruschetta was one of the best I've had. (by Thomas Lassanske) [5 months ago]

name: Milano
address: 11 O'Connell Street, Clonroad Beg, Ennis, Co. Clare, V95 WFD3, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Great tasty food. A lovely place for a date or a meal with friends and family. (by Brian Malone) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Above my expectations the pizza was super I really enjoyed it. I highly recommend it probably the best pizza in Ennis. (by Paloxo Paloxo) [2 weeks ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - EVERYTHING 10/10 !!! Absolute great service from whole entire staff. Extremely accommodating and delicious, fresh, piping hot food!! Andy was so lovely, kind and funny. I recommend anyone and everyone to come here at least once for a once in lifetime experience. Honestly the best restaurant in Ennis. Love it here!! Keep it up Milanos !!!! (by Amara B) [7 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Very good food and service, we definitively will be back !
Part of the positive experience comes by the fact that our daughter is coeliac and that there is plenty of gluten free options for her : dough pizza balls with garlic butter, all the pizza‚Äôs & all pasta. Also brownie & ice cream ‚Ä¶ our daughter had a blast, and for us parents, it was really reassuring! (by C√©cile de Puydt) [a month ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - I recently celebrated my birthday with friends at Milano, and it was a fantastic experience! The atmosphere was warm and lively, perfect for a special occasion. The staff were friendly and attentive, making sure we had everything we needed throughout the evening. Definitely recommend! (by Temi A) [7 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - The most wonderful mocha and pizza I‚Äôve ever tasted. The customer service was very welcoming and the food was spectacular. (by Aniela) [4 months ago] | Review 7: 1 star - Firstly, the restaurant was near empty on arrival, but we were  told they only had "tables for two people!" which seemed very strange in a near empty restaurant! 6 people ahead of us were also refused a table in the empty restaurant and left ahead of us. Confused, at the "Two People Only " Policy,  I suggested to the waitress that we were prepared to wait for a table, there was myself and two kids. The only reason I can see for the ridiculous policy is that clearly they did not want to serve us the Cheaper Special Kids Menu, ironically we did not.want it either! Finally after waiting 15 Minutes outside on the Street in the rain,  we were offered a table inside in the near empty restaurant. The Food, medicore at best. The Goats cheese Salad was tasty but tiny. The Spicy Chicken Wings  were uncomfortably hot, to the extent they burnt your lips off. The piizza was a tad miserable and soggy. Our table next to the Toilet Entrance proved to be uncomfortable and dismal. .. We had to listen to a clearly incompetent manager continually barking at his staff who were doing their best while the manager himself done basically nothing. One poor girl was almost in tears because the manager in question wanted to send her home just after two hours work, and quite rightly, she refused to leave! Lowsey ... and probably illegal too!!  You could sense the stress and unease everywhere in the restaurant. Usually Milano's looks somewhat "Classy " and has a bit of "Finesse" But this Joker of a Manager is running it into the ground like some sort of Inner City Chipper! Messy piles of empty Pizza boxes stacked cahaottically  everywhere and more managers sitting on there butts next to us than customers, made for a "Staff Canteen" feel while  "General Chow" (Manager) continued to run around like a headless chicken and bark at his staff. The place was dis-organised, cluttered with empty pizza boxes, and crowded with waiting "delivery boys" waiting for their takeaways in the noisy canteen! It had no resemblance of the relaxing restaurant Milano's usually is. Case in point, Milano's at the Crescent Limerick- Excellent.  The Toilets were filthy and smelly too. Seeing hardworking lovely waiting staff treated so badly by their Manager really did leave a bitter taste in our mouths.... Awful shocking sh@#. (by True Review) [5 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - I was there with my family for a quick lunch on a Friday afternoon. The restaurant was nice and clean. We got a nice table in a corner as my son didn't want to sit in a centre of the restaurant. Staff was very nice and attentive. We got our drinks and starters fast and the pizza arrived very quickly too. Everything was nicely baked and served and super delicious. Special thanks to Ciara ( I hope I got the name right - blonde hair with glasses) that was serving us and also the other waitress that was on a shift (long black hair) for putting a super huge smile on my son's face with the desert. Thank you! (by Daniel Marchewka (Spreddo)) [2 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Super service, Thibaut took care of us the most amazing way, he advised us well on the menu, including plentiful vegan options, was dynamic and smiley, he did the job 100%.
And the kitchen: really fresh and really good! Very large menu, everything we ordered was delicious. (by Thibaud Leboucq) [3 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - We are just after having a wonderful dinner at Milanos today.
I have to say it was a remarkable evening . My boyfriend (now fianc√©) proposed to me in there. The reason why he chose this restaurant was because it was the place where we had our first date, so it is a really special spot to us. From starters to dessert the food was amazing, one of the mains we had ordered was the smoky bbq chicken pizza and it was the highlight. Well done chef Jelchor. I would also like to leave here my high praises to the staff who was so helpful, we were just speechless‚Ä¶ Thanks to the Manager, Hemilea and the lovely waitress, Natalie, we had a great time.
Then at the end, when we went to pay the bill, we were shocked when they said it was on the house.
We are very thankful!!!

Really recommend Milano in Ennis as a place to go for a dinner and have a nice time. (by Yasmin Costa) [a year ago]

name: Russell's Fishshop
address: Teergonean, Doolin, Co. Clare, V95 XR0K, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 2 stars - I am a frequent visitor to Doolin and I first ordered food from Russell‚Äôs in May 2025 after seeing some positive reviews on social media. I ordered their Fried Atlantic Prawn Scampi for take-out and selected a pickup time online through their website. My order was ready when I arrived to collect it and I went along my merry way back to where I was staying.
I was not disappointed by the quality of the food (which was good), but I was very disappointed with the quantity, there was just 6 pieces of Fried Atlantic Prawn Scampi in the box, 2 of which were extra small and a box full of chips. It felt like it was a very expensive box of chips.
I did provide Russell‚Äôs with this feedback online hoping for a response but I got no response from them - I prefer to offer negative feedback to business directly rather than having to submit public reviews. (by Fergus O'Shea) [3 weeks ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - An interesting place; we ate in the outside wooden pods as we had two dogs with us and interestingly each pod had a heating lamp above the table should you need it, which was considerate of the owners. The take-away menu was somewhat limited with only one type of fish (cod), a Berger, Sausage etc and one vegetarian dish based upon sweet potato.

The chips were crisp and were cooked in beef dripping but fortunately the effect was not overpowering as it can be with such cooking methods. The fish had a thin crisp batter and was not in any way oily which was good but the fish didn‚Äôt have the density of a typical freshly caught cod which was curious.

The dine in menu seemed much more developed so as a take-away experience I wouldn‚Äôt rush to return if I were in the area. (by Mal Jones) [3 months ago] | Review 3: 4 stars - Always love the food in Russell's Fish shop. Decided to be adventurous & try something new so went for the chargrilled sweet potato. The dish was lovely but felt ‚Ç¨16 was very steep for 3 pieces of sweet potato ü´§ it's a side dish not a main, price should reflect that. (by Melanie O'Donoghue) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Absolutely excellent. Great service,  excellent food. Brilliant prices. Highly recommend the fish and chips, and the onion rings. Indoor seating and outdoor seating with shelter and even heaters, and a lovely view of the Aran Islands too. Been there twice now and the food portions are massive, excellent value for money. Tends to be nice and quiet too. Yes. Thank you. (by David Bennett) [a week ago] | Review 5: 3 stars - I was here in 2022 and I thought I already gave this place a review which was a good review in 2022 food was brilliant, well I came back again in 2025 and the food wasn't as good,  I'll put both of the pictures up and judge for yourself,  service was ok wasn't a local , unimpressed this year with everything and it not cheaper either,
I'll try again next time I'm in Doolin and hopefully it will get back to the 2022 standard which was perfection fish and chips with a few bits on the side (by paul) [Edited 3 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Stopped in her for a quick lunch while my friends and I were in Doolin. Was very impressed by the fish and chips we ordered and the quick service! There were seating options both inside and outside but since it was a cooler day we chose to sit indoors.

The man who served us was so funny and had a great sense of humour! We enjoyed listening to his banter with guests as they stopped in to order.

Would definitely recommend! (by Pippa Girling) [a year ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Amazing food, atmosphere and live music. We enjoyed two lovely evenings during our stay in Doolin. (by Philip D.) [a month ago] | Review 8: 4 stars - The food is perfect: good fish and rustic chips. The portions are generous ‚Äî even the children's portion is enough to fill someone up. We just could have done with more tartar sauce, but that's a minor detail. Overall, it's a nice place, with tasteful outdoor seating in a wooden style. The toilets, tucked away in the backyard, are a bit of a contrast and not nearly as nice. (by Ond≈ôej P≈Øbal) [2 months ago] | Review 9: 4 stars - Good fish and chips. Everything comes out "to-go" but there is limited seating inside and a large outdoor seating area. You order, get a buzzer and then have to come back and get your food. Very minimal service model. Finding the bathrooms was an adventure. (by Trypp Adams) [a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - We ate at the cafe and this was the best fish and chips we had in Ireland. We also ordered the prawn scampi with chips and the fried chicken burger. The chips were fresh cut. Everyone should come here after the cliffs of Moher! There is ample seating outside and around the back. (by Laci Gettings) [a month ago]

name: Pepper's Bar & Restaurant
address: Feakle, Feakle East, Co. Clare, V94 DV26, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - A lovely traditional pub in Co Clare with the best roast beef ever and good value for money.

My son and I felt like we were sitting in someone's kitchen it was so homely and welcoming.

The gentleman behind the bar came down to take our drinks order. They even have Guinness 0% on tap. Great taste üëå we will be back. (by Terry Byrne) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Stopped in for food and was not disappointed. Good hearty tasty food. Would 100% recommend. (by Phil Mc Grath) [5 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Traditional Irish pub. Warm and welcoming. On Wednesday evening they  have an amazing  traditional music session (by Jon Druce) [4 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Neat old world pub, good food, good value. Refreshing, takes you back to another time legitimately. Good service. Worth a visit. (by Ailish Keating) [a year ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Classic Irish pub with great food and relaxed environment. Definitely worth a visit if you‚Äôre in town. Highly recommend. (by Erin London) [2 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Wonderful place where the tradition is still very much alive. Great music, and the pub owner is very welcoming and knows everyone in town (by Pieter Wattel) [a month ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Great food at very reasonable prices. Had the duck and it was perfect. (by Joseph McClash) [a month ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - We stopped here for a bite to eat late afternoon. It was a week day, very quiet. The food blew all expectations away. It was hearty, well seasoned and all in all delicious. I got the Sheppard's pie and it was bursting with flavour. The pavlova (my favourite) was a generous serving and delicious. As I said it was quiet, therefore I can't rate the atmosphere, other than pleasant. Doesn't get more traditional than this pub for those seeking a bit of culture immersion. Whatever you're doing, you're doing very well. I only recommend perhaps hiring another waiter and front of house.
The pub is located on a large road junction so for those with children and/or mobility restriction, be mindful of fast moving traffic.

There's a playground near the restaurant in the local village and also a convenience shop. (by Marta Guerra) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Another sneaky dinner when passing. Roast beef dinner was delicious. Generous Children's portions.   Excellent service on a busy Sunday afternoon. (by Claire Cassidy Moroney) [6 months ago] | Review 10: 1 star - Hate to downvote without visiting, but come on‚Äîit‚Äôs 2025 and my dog in the bag is smaller than a fiddle case. Still not allowed in for the trad session? Bit medieval, isn‚Äôt it? (by Maria Castell√†) [4 months ago]

name: Gregans Castle Hotel in the Burren
reviews:
Review 1: None - An absolutely beautiful and harmonic place! The interior of the rooms and the hotel is gorgeous with a mix of antique furniture and classic elements which make every corner of the house so cosy that you don't want to leave. It's a boutique hotel surrounded by lovely gardens and Burren landscape providing spectacular views. A perfect place to unwind. We loved their super comfy bed and pillows. Food was outstanding. Best of all, the service was very welcoming. High standards. Unforgettable experience! We look forward to our return visit. Thank you. P.S. A tea tray can be brought to your room on request, free of charge. (by Tatiana Tierney) | Review 2: None - Recommend 10-10! Ideal location for seeing the area (must secure transportation and have an idea of other dining options). A real country house experience with all the expected services of a small luxe hotel. The farm-to-table cuisine, cozy ‚Ä¶ (by seaschel3) | Review 3: None - OMG I couldn't have loved it more! This place is absolutely darling! It has a prized view of the burren that leads down to the sea. The grounds are gorgeous and there are several nice nature walks you can go on. I loved the rescue pony and ‚Ä¶ (by lmarks617) | Review 4: None - What a find‚Ä¶.|Absolutely idyllic. On arrival you are met by very personable staff of all nationalities. Beautiful, cosy hotel with lots of areas where you can just sit and soak up the atmosphere with a drink and a book.|Food is really ‚Ä¶ (by happyhols42uk) | Review 5: None - From the moment we arrived, we felt so welcomed. Walking the grounds and simply sitting in the garden was a beautiful way to spend the day‚Äîpeaceful, serene, and truly restorative. The afternoon tea is an absolute must-do; it was the ‚Ä¶ (by aprilleb2024) | Review 6: None - Can't even begin to describe how much we loved our stay at Gregans Castle. Beautiful, tranquil, and homey. The perfect place to stow away for a few days. We actually wanted to stay longer but the rooms were already booked up! The best part though were the staff. Everyone was absolutely wonderful, kind and attentive. We look forward to coming back! (by Brandon Warman) | Review 7: None - We visited Gregans Castle for afternoon tea to celebrate my mother‚Äôs birthday, and it was a truly special experience from start to finish.

The food was incredible ‚Äî everything tasted so fresh, beautifully presented, and carefully prepared. You could really tell the chef puts a lot of care and attention into every detail.

Our lovely waitress and charming French server looked after us so well, who was full of chat.  He even surprised my mom with a small pastry topped with a candle ‚Äî such a sweet and personal touch that made the day even more memorable.

We‚Äôll definitely be back again ‚Äî perhaps next time for dinner! Highly recommend Gregans Castle for anyone looking for a beautiful and heartfelt dining experience in a stunning setting. (by Niamh Mchugh) | Review 8: None - Loved it!  Quiet, relaxing, beautiful.  The staff was remarkable at meeting our needs.  Kieran, the bartender was adept at mixing concoctions that were tasty and beautiful.   The dining room was wonderful, everyone was welcoming and helpful, the food delicious.  Close to the cliffs,  the perfumery and BallyVaugn, in one word it was üëå perfect.  No TV, instead one can sit outside and literally count sheep (by Noanie) | Review 9: None - This place is magic.  The eye for design & space is flawless.  The elegance paired with complete comfort.  The service it perfection.  The property has beautiful views & surprisingly good short walk from premise.  ||The food!!!!  For this alone you should stay here! (by VirginiaHundleys) | Review 10: None - A fantastic getaway location in the Burren with stunning views, relaxed atmosphere and amazing food in the restaurant. The night's accommodation is worth it alone, if just to have the fantastic breakfast the next morning with a wide range of home made jams and preserves along with one of the best full Irish breakfasts we've ever had. Already looking forward to our next trip to the hotel. (by John Reilly)

name: Mancino's of Clare
address: 10348 S Clare Ave, Clare, MI 48617, United States
service_options: Hungry Howie's Pizza ¬∑ 4.2 stars ¬∑ 283 reviews ¬∑ Pizza Delivery
reviews:
Review 1: 3 stars - Just a sad sandwich kind of night. I paid $20 for this. This is my fav sandwich! Normally it‚Äôs overflowing with meat and cheese and mayo and this was over baked, very limited meat (the roast beef that was on it was over baked and burnt), and very VERY dry. Hardly any mayo or cheese in sight. Idk what happened. Still my fav I‚Äôll give this location another chance‚Ä¶bc when they get this one right, it‚Äôs AMAZING!! (by Anna Tank) [11 months ago] | Review 2: 3 stars - Sunday, August 3rd we called and asked about special, which we then ordered. Our Large 3 topping with ‚ÄúFred Bread‚Äù for $25 was running a little late when we arrived. The dining room was empty and there were three other parties waiting. The cashier wasn‚Äôt rude, but she absolutely wasn‚Äôt friendly at all. There was no music, they weren‚Äôt greeting people as they entered, weren‚Äôt thanking anyone, and the silence exuded ‚Äúelephant in the room‚Äù energy. Is it always funeral parlor energy here? Experience like this is a strong reminder that Little Caesar‚Äôs is cheap,friendly, and makes their dough from scratch. (by Jack Shields) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 2 stars - I heard the food was worth the wait..

I stay at hotel next door usually with 4 to 6 coworkers and every time I call to order  they don't answer the phone  and when they  answered they say we're closed early.   I guess I'm not important enough to be  there  customer (by rob cortis) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - I ordered carryout tonight, because we hadn't been here in forever. It was so good! It always has been. I really don't know why we don't eat here more often. The Grinders are fantastic and the pasta is total comfort food. We ordered the Beef & Cheddar Grinder that was on special, and the cheese sauce was perfect. I seriously think someone made that with love- definitely did not taste pre-made. (by Stephanie Haggart) [4 years ago] | Review 5: 1 star - Wont be getting my service as a person who works in the food world ive never felt this disrespect im sorry but when someone calls to ask for food and asks questions regardless if they have a menu in front of them or not some people cant seen or use the Internet my mother was told very rudely that she could look at the menus online or Facebook she is old she can barely use a phone (by LuxBasileus Gameing) [a month ago] | Review 6: 2 stars - They seemed to be short-staffed, which is why I suspect we had such a poor experience.
The salad bar tasted (without exaggeration) like foot. The pasta had a soapy taste. The cookies and cream fluff had a ton of garlic??
They were kind enough to refund that part of our meal.
While I personally enjoyed my food, noone else at my table did.
The cheese bread was slightly undercooked, but not inedible.
All in all, I would like to believe this was simply a bad day for them, though this was a very poor first impression. (by Austin Doyle) [7 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Pizzas absolutely slapped and the nice lady there drew a smiley face on the box. Fantastic. (by Savannah Smith) [10 months ago] | Review 8: 1 star - We just brought home a steak grinder. Picked up a piece of meat to take a bite and it was not edible. I didn‚Äôt even get to chew. So we call in and you tasted it and tell us it‚Äôs fine. No this is not fine. This is our favorite treat to get ourselves when in town. For us to refuse to eat it says a lot. I will be there shortly you can eat the dang thing! You didn‚Äôt even try to solve the problem and we wasted money. So dinner is on us. See you shortly. Hope you enjoy your rotten grinder. üò°ü§¨üò°ü§¨ So Cheryl maybe someone needs to teach you what a manger‚Äôs job is. It‚Äôs not to be condescending towards my husband and tell him he‚Äôs wrong. You didn‚Äôt even offer to make another sub!  you basically just took the money and ran. I expect you now to refund the money back. Smh‚Ä¶ridiculous. We won‚Äôt be back. Thank you for doing your job. As, a former owner of my own establishment. This wouldn‚Äôt fly at all. (by Nana Mckim) [a year ago] | Review 9: 2 stars - Didn't get the order right. 2 guys working, one having a meltdown.  What did they expect on Super Bowl Sunday afternoon.  Almost $40 for 2 subs! (by Michael evitts) [7 months ago] | Review 10: 1 star - Our pizza way overcooked. Very lite toppings little cheese, just an overall poor product. We didn't even finish it it went in the trash.
Also (I wasn't too impressed with the owner)
They have Styrofoam cups sitting out on the counter. I explained to her my husband and my elderly dad are broke down (which they were it's 80¬∞ in the shade), I'd like to get them a couple cups of ice for water. The owner told me that there would be a $2 charge for the cups. Empty. (by Tammy McCarty) [a year ago]

name: The Coast Lodge, Restaurant and Bed & Breakfast
reviews:
Review 1: None - What an absolute gem on the coast üòä The pizza üçï was simply amazing‚Äîone of the best I have ever had, made with so much care and flavor ü•∞The place is run by a wonderful young couple who manage everything themselves. They are not only talented but also incredibly kind and welcoming, which made the experience even more special ü§©You can really feel their passion in both the food and the atmosphere. Wishing them all the success in the world‚Äîthey truly deserve it! (by Dzheylyan Ayhan) | Review 2: None - We stayed two nights at the Coast Lodge. The room was very clean, spacious and nicely decorated, and we were even lucky enough to get a room with a view on to the ocean. Beds are super comfy, and the rooms are equipped with everything you ‚Ä¶ (by alioca) | Review 3: None - We stayed here for two nights and had a room with seaview. View is great and the room is nice (could use some work, especially the bathroom), its clean and the bed is good. From here you can make your trip to the Cliffs of Moher.

The restaurant, which is below the room, can be crowdy, and you smell the backing in the room and the hallway.
The breakfast was good and has a variaty of choices.

Tips: a cooling unit in the room and a locker. (by Willem van Ginkel) | Review 4: None - Great ocean view room with good amenities such as hand lotion. Window opened to bring in fresh cool ocean breeze. Bed was very comfortable, with neat animal photo above. Breakfast was included, and was very good. Not far from the Cliffs of Moher. The worst thing: the shower. Some box mounted on the wall heats the water I guess, but this did not work unless you flip the switch on the outside of the bathroom. Controls were a bit odd. (by Derek) | Review 5: None - We stayed 3 nights in the suites behind the main building.  The rooms were very large with a sitting area, kitchen and one had a had washer/dryer.  Spanish Point is beautiful and you have incredible views from breakfast and the the restaurant.  The staff are very friendly. (by Brendan C. Wackenreuter) | Review 6: None - After a lovely walk around Spanish point we needed a good meal and The coast lodge didn‚Äôt disappoint.
The service was efficient and friendly and the pepperoni pizza I had was the best I have ever tasted,light and full of flavour.
It was not overpriced to eat in with a great view over the bay.
You see a takeaway menu as you walk in which is of course cheaper but having the takeaway option means the staff don‚Äôt have to serve you,provide plates etc or wash up,so the a higher price for a pleasant experience such as we had seems fair to me. (by beverly Shaw) | Review 7: None - A beautiful place right by the sea. The staff is very kind and attentive. We had dinner there and the pizzas were excellent. Breakfast was perfect, and the rooms are spacious, clean, and cozy. (by Marli) | Review 8: None - We love this cafe for it's lovely takeaway food. Pizza is top notch - hence the awards - they even do gluten free. Glorious views from the front garden which is spacious with lots of picnic tables. Staff are friendly and attentive. (by Gareth Major) | Review 9: None - I stopped by for lunch after a surf at Spanish Point. The staff were lovely ‚Äì especially the girl who took our order ‚Äì friendly and helpful throughout. Unfortunately, the overall experience didn‚Äôt live up to expectations.

As you walk in, the bright yellow pricing on the wall catches your eye, but what‚Äôs not obvious is the added charge for eating in ‚Äì even if you're just sitting outside on a picnic bench. For example, fish and chips is advertised at ‚Ç¨14.50 for takeaway, but it jumps to ‚Ç¨21.50 to dine in. When I asked about the difference, I was told it's for "table service." Oddly, chicken tenders and chips only had a ‚Ç¨2 surcharge for the same service, which makes the pricing feel inconsistent and a bit unfair. It seems fish and chips ‚Äì possibly their bestseller ‚Äì gets the steepest mark-up.

We weren‚Äôt the only ones confused or disappointed, and it was disheartening to see that the owner showed no interest in addressing customers‚Äô concerns.

While I appreciate the kind staff, we won‚Äôt be recommending or returning. The hotel just up the road may be a little pricier, but it offers much better value for money and a more transparent dining experience. (by Padraic Reilly) | Review 10: None - We stayed for a wedding, room was nice and great location. The breakfast was shocking as there was a green oil all over the plate. Looked like everything was deep fried. The scrambled egg and salmon looked unpleasant. Toast barely toasted. No pastries out.
Some the staff can‚Äôt even say good morning. (by darragh mc)

name: Subway
address: 205/227 Main N Rd, Clare SA 5453, Australia
service_options: Just Julies Cafe Takeaway ¬∑ 4.4 stars ¬∑ 117 reviews ¬∑ Cafe
reviews:
Review 1: 1 star - Stood at the front of the line for 10 minutes and didn‚Äôt even get served‚Ä¶ didn't even get recognised by the staff that I was waiting so long. A lady was waiting for online pick up because they didn‚Äôt make the sandwiches in time. Two people behind me ended up leaving. I looked in front of me to see 5 soggy sandwiches that the people in front had been waiting to be finished. Saw my fate and left too.
10/10 would recommend if your NOT hungry. (by Leah) [a week ago] | Review 2: 1 star - Stood in line for half an hr watching people leave the store. 1 young guy was flatout trying to keep up with orders whilst a young girl kept running away because her phone was more important. She would come out for a minute and run back to her phone. Not happy with the experience at all. (by Boris) [a month ago] | Review 3: 1 star - The cleanliness is horrible and they are very sloppy with making the food. Nothing ever looks washed and they dont clean utensils between orders. The hygiene of this store is very disgusting. (by Dean Hofmeier) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 1 star - How many today thought (as advertised) in store at Clare SA you were paying $6 for 2 drinks as advertised in-store at least in 3 places? When I questioned it and insisted they honour it I was told No the till has been reset they cannot do anything about it. Just wrong, take the false advertising down then. (by Merilyn Haydon) [3 years ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - I am so thankful that the subway was open. OTR had great coffee but had no where to sit and have breakfast. We have come down to Clare for their Easter Sunday Service at Clare Influencers Church. Praise the Lord Jesus! He is Risen Indeed! üôã ‚Ä¶ (by Bruce Wayne Birch) [7 years ago] | Review 6: 1 star - Was looking forward to having the only thing I could have in Clare being gluten free. Walked in and just the state of the sandwich boards gave me bad anxiety about my allergies flaring up. I understand that their gluten free options are always a risk with them not being a certified gluten free place. But if they offer it they should make sure the store looks clean and inviting. Very dirty and very disappointing.
Maybe more training is needed! (by Krystle Brown) [a year ago] | Review 7: 2 stars - Looked like only staff member was on, but she went on break and after a minute a young boy came out to serve. While we waited, noticed how untidy the entire salad bar was and some of ingredients looking rather old. The young boy started to make our order when another staff member came out. We had seen 3 staff members now, didn't get any kind of greeting from any of them. Girl returns to shop, only to make her own lunch and chat with other boy who wasn't doing anything. Couldn't get drink I wanted as fridge was not stocked but could see slabs of drinks in back. Serviette dispenser was practically empty.
Wanted to dine in but every single table was dirty. Told staff when we were leaving that every table was dirty. Again, not one response from either three staff members. (by Deb Hawke) [a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Staff are friendly and helpful. Food is always good. Toilets located near by. Plenty of seating. Highly recommended. (by Mollie Johnson) [6 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - We usually stop at this subway every time we drive through Clare ... The location is great and the quality of food is consistently good too. There are public toilets just opposite this which can be fairly important if you are on a long trip with young kids. (by Mansoor Janjua) [a year ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - Had a Chicken Wrap and a 6-inch Italian Herb. It was tasty and good. Fairly quick service. We enjoyed the food. (by Yogendra SHRESTHA) [a year ago]

name: Mount Callan House & Restaurant
reviews:
Review 1: None - My experience at this place was a disastrous one. Within the first few weeks of opening I've ordered the two beef and Guinness stew from their takeaway menu and the beef and the vegetables weren't cooked well. I contacted Richard the manager and I said since you're a new place it'll be better to share my bad experience with you in person than a review online. He apologized for the poor experience and promised me two desserts.
Time flies as life's busy and then yesterday I've ordered the chicken burger and chips from their takeaway menu, I then reminded them about the desserts but unfortunately they had no desserts left. Brought the burger and chips home, the chicken in the burger felt undercooked as it like chewing rubber, too chewy. The chips weren't satisfactory too. Two of my housemates also ordered from the takeaway menu and was totally unsatisfied with their meal.

One might say that the initial experience might have created a perception for the second experience, but I know my chicken meal better than beef meals.

I've heard many people like their sit in menu. But from my experience, the takeaway menu is horrendously poor and there's a great potential for them to improve. Wishing them the very best.

It would have been better to drive to Ennis town and order from reliable restaurants in there.

The old management had
awesome homemade chips.

And now the place has closed (by Finney Pandicheril) | Review 2: None - We had breakfast in the Mount Callan yesterday, it was superb, great food, large portions, and very reasonably priced!!
We were made feel so welcome, the service was outstanding, they couldn't do enough for us.
And to add to the positive experience, there is ample free parking right outside its door.
I would highly recommend this restaurant for breakfast, lunch and dinner. (by Sally Hughes) | Review 3: None - Had lunch today and was greeted by the wonderful Sarah who recommended the burger. Wow was I happy with the recommendation. Was so tasty and the chef checked-in with us to make sure we were happy with our choice. Would highly recommend for quality food and service. Onion rings were to die for!!! 5* for me. (by Michele Fitzgerald) | Review 4: None - Cut your portions in half and double your price!
Superb dinner. We‚Äôve been at a lot of places. But nowhere the food was prepared with do much feel for a price so low.
I really hope you will correct that.
I know: new ownership always is a challenge.
You will do fine!!! (by Eric Lammertsma) | Review 5: None - My wife and I stayed here recently and were very surprised at the level service and quality. Current photos on trip adviser does not do this place justice.||The food can only be described as Michelin star, actually the chef is Michelin ‚Ä¶ (by RayD35) | Review 6: None - Five stars is not enough for the stay we had at the Mount Callan House! The rooms were lovely, the meals delicious, and the service genuine. Would definitely recommend staying here on a trip and dining here while in town. (by Patrick Hehir) | Review 7: None - I have got breakfast  here a few times and was happy with it.The takeaway meals are over priced for what you get compared to other takeaways.  I have got the fish and chips here which the fish was not edible and chips overdone a few weeks ‚Ä¶ (by brendano896) | Review 8: None - We are repeat visitors to Culleen Lodge because of the quality of the accommodation and food and the warm welcome from Carmel and Pat.  The rooms are spacious, stylishly decorated and very comfortable.  Carmel‚Äôs breakfast is a joy: all ‚Ä¶ (by 334gillb) | Review 9: None - Very welcoming clean restaurant/ cafe. The food was tasty and very reasonably priced and the coffee was exceptional! The staff were also very friendly and couldn‚Äôt have done more for us. (by Stephen Ryan) | Review 10: None - I have to say the service and quality I recieved was great. This is a small local business with lovely friendly staff. The food is very good, the meals remind me of my mums home cooking! This seems to be a busy little spot which i can see why. This will be my stop off spot when passing that way again which i look forward too. (by frankp235)

name: Just Julies Cafe Takeaway
address: 288 Main N Rd, Clare SA 5453, Australia
service_options: Just Julies Cafe Takeaway, Actions for Just Julies Cafe Takeaway, About Just Julies Cafe Takeaway, Information for Just Julies Cafe Takeaway, Popular times at Just Julies Cafe Takeaway, Photos of Just Julies Cafe Takeaway
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Love this place, will come back and always do, when I am back in Clare. I always look forward to having ‚Äúthe best egg & bacon roll‚Äù in SA. Keep up the great work! (by Mary-Ann Koerner) [2 weeks ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - I wanted to take the time to put in a positive review about this cafe! I stopped in to get a take away coffee and a bacon, egg and hash brown wrap. I asked for the hash brown to be excluded at first, but after I ordered a lovely lady came out and asked if I wanted anything else on the wrap. We then decided to put them on the side instead of in the wrap.
What lovely considerate service to take the time to come out to your customer and ask. Thank you! (by SRQ) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 1 star - Ordered scones. The young lady asked if I'd like them here or takeaway. I asked here. She bought them out in a take away container. I had to ask for a knife and eat them like that. They were the most driestscones I'd ever had. Fell apart as soon as I broke them open. The young lady that served me was so lovely. (by Tracy Sparks) [4 days ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - This place is amazing! We still can't believe how great and well priced the food was. A great mixture of seating options and a kids play nook in the corner. Certainly a hidden gem, we can't wait to come back üôå (by Alexandra Walker) [8 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Walked into this cute lil caf√© thinking I was gonna get an oat milk flat white and cry about life in peace. Instead...
BAM.
The caf√© floor turned into water tiles.
A siren went off.
Peso popped out from behind the espresso machine like ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a krill emergency!‚Äù while handing me a croissant.

I looked around‚Äî
Kwazii was mixing matcha with one paw and yelling about sea spiders.
Shellington was explaining the flavor profile of seaweed brownies to an old man who was definitely not okay.
I asked for a table and Dashi scanned me with a tablet and said,
‚ÄúVitals are stable. You may sit.‚Äù

I sat.
My chair squelched.
There was a jellyfish in my iced mocha. It blinked.

Barnacles came over, looked me dead in the eyes, and said
‚ÄúYou‚Äôve been chosen for a deep sea latte rescue.‚Äù
I accepted. Why not.

10/10 caf√©.
Did I get caffeine? Unsure.
Did I join a submarine squad and emotionally bond with a shrimp? Absolutely. (by little sigma) [2 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Thoroughly enjoyed my custom breakfast this morning - fresh food, perfectly cooked, plenty of it and the coffee + chai latte were delicious.
Just passing through but will come back if we're in town again. (by Tracey Finocchio) [5 months ago] | Review 7: 1 star - 24 dollers for a steak sandwich is a rort, 10 dollers cheaper at most places and they come with pineapple and beetroot, Australia has really gone to shit (by Hi Hhihi) [a month ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Great brunch and able to accomodate our bigger group.
all meals very good (by lyndad68) [4 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Beautiful coffee and food
lovely staff very enjoyable
Thankyou (by Chelsea S) [a month ago] | Review 10: 1 star - Very expensive for the little you get.
Put aside a lot of time as it took over 30 minutes to get a salad roll and toastie. (by jason clegg) [4 months ago]

name: Clare trading post
address: 5a Market Hill, Clare, Sudbury CO10 8NN, United Kingdom
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Nice atmosphere with very good cups , and different decoration (by Ezgi Kaya) [4 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - A delightful venue, with friendly chatty staff (should you want to be sociable) as well as good value food. The English breakfast was fab!
The Trading Post itself offers a quirky range of memorabilia and collectables. (by Geoff Battle) [5 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - One of, if not the bast cooked breakfasts I have ever had. Warm and friendly with great food. Dogs are welcome which helped us a lot! (by Kevin Morton) [a year ago] | Review 4: 1 star - 2 bacon sandwiches = ¬£8. Value bread, microwaved bacon, dog turned his nose up to it (by Jay Waddams) [a month ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - We discovered this wonderful cafe on a trip to Clare today. What a gem for the village. They serve the nicest coffee and the food was of great quality and delicious.
The mismatched crockery and cutlery added such charm, in fact my son especially loved his little knife.
Friendly service from two very happy ladies. Highly recommend. (by Louise Cross) [2 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - A wonderful find in the depths of the Suffolk countryside; akin to visiting a friends house, the feeling of ease & comfort is unique and most welcome.

Witnessed a couple of ladies (they may identify as goats, I didn‚Äôt ask) not wanting to pay their full bill, arguing about half a tomato or beans and some such trivialities and how they should have a substantial discount for that‚Ä¶they choose not to have tomatoes and wanted ¬£‚Äôs off the bill.

The grace & poise of the proprietor was like a Jesus soothing angry Romans who knew not what they were bothered about, seeking someone to blame for both their bad moods, and somewhat obvious poor life choices.

Can not recommend this place highly enough.

A joy. (by Gareth Holmes) [a year ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Absolutely fantastic little tea room. We always make a point of stopping if we are anywhere in the vicinity. Always made to feel welcome and never disappointed with the food and service. Added bonus if you like antiques. (by Lauren Chittock) [a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - I‚Äôve been coming for breakfast on Saturdays for over a year now -  it‚Äôs become a second home! I always receive the most welcoming and friendly service and the Full English breakfast goes down a treat after a park run in country park! I bring friends in whenever they visit and they always enjoy it. (by James Baker) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Wow, just had full English breakfast and it is by far the best I've had. (by Peter Roche) [3 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - In Clare, a quaint Suffolk town,
There's a cafe and antique shop renowned.
Run by Liza, with a heart so kind,
Her best friend Jaq, always on her mind.

A haven for locals and travelers alike,
Where stories are shared over a cup of Pike.
Liza, the culinary queen of the place,
Crafts a Brie and Bacon sandwich with grace.

The aroma fills the air, oh so divine,
A symphony of flavors that intertwine.
Jaq, the mischievous one, full of cheer,
Spreading laughter and mischief, year after year.

Warm and friendly, their spirits shine bright,
Welcoming patrons from morning till night.
With a twinkle in their eyes and a playful tease,
They create an atmosphere that's sure to please.

Amidst the quaint antiques, treasures of old,
Conversations and laughter effortlessly unfold.
Liza, Jaq, and Katie, a trio so tight,
Their bond brings warmth to every sight.

In the heart of Clare, where memories are made,
This cafe and antique shop will never fade.
A place where naughtiness and joy collide,
Leaving visitors with memories to confide.

So come to this haven, where laughter's abound,
Where Liza, Joe, Jaq, and Katie can always be found.
Indulge in their creations, delicious and true,
And experience the magic they bring to you. (by Gee Aitch) [a year ago]

name: Moran's Oyster Cottage
address: The Weir House, Rahaneena, Kilcolgan, Co. Galway, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - What a fantastic meal. We called to book a table for 12.30 but were told there wasn‚Äôt any availability u til 3 pm however they did say that we could sit outside weather permitting which is what we did do and it was fab. We met the owner who gave us a bit of history around the place. The food was fab. Oysters, prawns, salmon‚Ä¶. Would highly recommend! (by Lisa Wraight) [2 weeks ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - Beautiful scenery. Good oysters, fish and chips, and bread and butter pudding for dessert. Service was OK - difficult to get water and took about an hour to get our entrees. It's a bit of a hassle to get here if you are staying in Galway and don't have a car. (by Vivian Anne) [3 days ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - This is my seventh day in Ireland on this trip and this is the best (eat out) meal so far! Fresh WILD and natural oysters are so sweet that‚Äôs out of this world. But it‚Äôs not all about the oysters. Must also have the chowder, brown bread and clams (from the special menu). Bread was soft with crunchy crusts and cut in perfect thinness. Clams were cooked in perfection to conserve its natural sweetness and well balanced with white wine and butter sauce. Seafood chowder contained all the goodness from the sea in a just right not too light or too thick creamy broth that is utterly gorgeous. And of course, all the great good must be accompanied by a pint of Guinness or a local G&T for good measures. For Gin, Gunpowder was my choice of the day. Good atmosphere, great music, booking is recommended even in the so called ‚Äúquieter period‚Äù today. All in all, a good crack! Highly recommended. (by Joyce Wong) [a month ago] | Review 4: 4 stars - Moran‚Äôs has a wonderful, casually upscale, cheerful, and comfortable atmosphere.  The staff are exceptional, anticipating our wishes, needs and questions, and meeting them with a friendly demeanor.  Though the menu provided a smaller selection, the food was delicious.  I had the tiger prawn salad, and my husband enjoyed oysters and cod.  It was all excellent and ample!  Prices are what you might expect for this kind of experience.  I absolutely recommend this restaurant for a special lunch or dinner out.  Cheers! (by Amy Gustafson) [3 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - A hidden little gem but renowned for it's kitchen. The food is excellent,  the service spotless. I had the best oysters (naturell) of my life. (by Werner Schauer) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Excellent oysters!  Some of the best I've ever had!  The seafood chowder and the pan seared Cod sprecial were also excellent!  After a long day on the road, it was so nice to sit outside, eat some delicious food, and toss back a couple of pints!  There's a reason this place has been in business for centuries! (by Matthew DeSantis) [3 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Thoroughly enjoyed our wonderful lunch here, and the setting overlooking the river is fab. Everything we had was fresh and delicious - the oysters were great and the batter of the fish was crispy and light, though the chips were slightly disappointing compared to the fish. The restaurant was quite busy when we were there, so I hope this place will continue to thrive for many more generations to come. (by Rebecca L) [2 months ago] | Review 8: 3 stars - It's fine but not great value. The oysters were tasty but lots of shell and grit in them. The staff were variable in knowledge about the menu and produce which was a bit disappointing given its made out to be very produce driven.
Chowder was average to my taste. The fish and chips(hake) today was cooked well but the fish had an odd bitterness to it and I suspect was not very fresh. The duck was a very generous portion. Tender, bit under seasoned. The braised red cabbage was nice (by Jason Lam) [2 weeks ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - They serve the biggest oysters I‚Äôve ever seen. The 7 generations chowder is pretty spectacular. I think it was in the top three dishes I had during our tour. The chips were the crispiest, fluffiest fat cut fries and were so good. They serve, hands down, the best pint of Guinness in Ireland, I‚Äôm convinced. The birding is most excellent as well. I think we spotted at least 7 species in a few minutes after dinner. I would cross the Atlantic to have the chowder and pint while gazing at the birds in the river, even if I did nothing else in Ireland. (by Michael Gentry) [4 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Absolutely incredible food and service. Fish & chips were elite, as was the special of lemon diver sole with broccoli rabe - which perhaps was my favorite meal I‚Äôve ever had on vacation - and to top it all off the brown bread was incredible. I bought two loafs to go home with. Lovely family, lovely place. (by Bernadette Hogan) [4 months ago]

name: The Arches Restaurant - Claregalway
address: The Arches Restaurant, Cahergowan Or Summerfield, Co. Galway, H91 WP38, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Very lovely curries served with rice and chips. Tortellini with vegetable sauce was also quite tasty. Lovely staff, very friendly and family oriented place. Not sure if booking is required. We turned upon a Sunday afternoon and managed to find a table, however, place was buzzing with customers. Highly recommended (by Aldo Schembri) [a week ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Fast, friendly, and attentive service. The d√©cor is pleasant, with beautiful paintings that add charm to the space. The meal was delicious and thoughtfully presented. A highly recommended place. (by Magali) [3 weeks ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Fantastic place e environment with nice people working in. We went for dinner and the food was delicious. Beef burger and pasta were really good. The restaurant is beautiful, clean, spacious with an amazing family atmosphere. Great parking area behind the building. Just in the heart of Cleargalway village.
Recommended! (by Fabr√≠cio Souza) [8 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Friendly staff , delicious food , child friendly and good location .. I had beautiful started , (Brie Cheese ) very refreshing light pre a Roast Beef dinner & Child had cheese pizza .. See attached photos .. Good value for price .. (by Bernadette Garvin) [a year ago] | Review 5: 2 stars - Unfortunately, I had a very disappointing experience. The chicken wings were almost raw, which completely ruined the dish. The sauces provided (Harrison‚Äôs mayonnaise and ketchup) were of very poor quality, especially considering the high prices. I also noticed some tables had Heinz ketchup, but when I requested it, the staff told me it wasn‚Äôt available, which left a poor impression of the service. For the price charged, I expected much better quality and care. (by Rafael Lauer de Lima) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Amazing staff and food
We had no booking popped in after a rainy day at the Galway races
From being greeted at the door to Agnes service to our table so attentive and professional A Gem of a place will will be back üëå (by sharon hanley) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 4 stars - Nice location across the arches bridge in the centre of Claregalway. Good big enough parking at the front area plus back. Staff was extremely nice and attentive. Restaurant is nice and big and the menu has a good variety of choices from mainly traditional irish dishes to some other different dishes so you have a choice at least.
Price is within the today's range. Not cheap not the dearest. Dinner dishes start from ‚Ç¨17.
Overall good restaurant to go! (by Eric Llaurad√≥) [7 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - If your ever in that area, the best roast I have had anywhere. Excellent food, really good prices. (by Trevor Daley) [2 years ago] | Review 9: 4 stars - Have a good invite in , good service,  food was lovely (by Joseph gilabert) [a year ago] | Review 10: 3 stars - Have been here a few times and always loved the food selection etc and the quality.   However we came here today and found that the choice of food has completely changed.   There was a very limited selection and very little that I could actually order.   In the end I went for a Pizza.   The pizza was beautiful but in honesty Its not my choice of food when I go out for a meal  The only other food I could have ordered from the daily fare would have been cabbage and bacon.   again Not my first choice when out for a meal.   I would have liked to have seen a choice of beef lamb or pork or something else on here.   The staff were friendly and we were happy overall.   PLEASE do add one or 2 more choices of meal.   Price wise this was also a lot more expensive than I expected (compared to previous visits)    Other restaurants that would be in the 15km radius would be better priced (by Vincent Conway) [2 years ago]

name: Hurst Botanicals
address: Barrack St, Clare Commons, Clarecastle, Co. Clare, V95 DW92, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - I really like this place, the kombucha is really very delicious and has different flavours for different tastes. I particularly enjoyed the ginger one they had on tap once. (by Ben Anderson) [Edited 2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Chill vibes and best place to grab a tea, coffee or Local Kombucha!

Friendly staff and welcoming !!!

This is my new local fav place to meet up with friends for a chat!

üó∫Ô∏èüí¨üòÄ (by Tiff FlynnLocke) [a year ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Lovely spot. Friendly and relaxed. Great coffee, superb kombucha! I would be a regular if I lived here :) (by Michael Mc) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Such kind staff! Chatted for ages even after closing time, so lovely. Coffee was perfect very smooth and full of flavour. Milk substitutes available. 10/10 new favourite coffee shop! ‚òïÔ∏è ‚ù§Ô∏è (by Ellen Mc Mahon) [a year ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Love your kombucha range. Only thing is your 330 ml bottles are impossible to open by hand, 90% of time I have to use a grips to open. Maybe look to eliminate this .But once opened and tasted this is forgotten. Gorgeous quality kombucha. (by Gerard Allen) [7 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Great place for Clarecastle to have. The kombucha is delicious. Coffee very good. The staff are great. (by Barry Murray) [9 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - I recently went on a Stag in Ireland and our taxi driver picked us up with these Hurst Botanical drinks as complimentary. Loved them! Some of my friends were not sure how they felt about Kombucha originally but after these, I believe they may now be Kombucha fans. Unfortunately I can‚Äôt seem to purchase them currently back in England but I‚Äôm hoping they branch out as soon as possible! (by Paul Barnes) [3 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - I had not known much about kombucha before trying Hurst and I am hooked. Great selection of flavours, I especially love the Plum & Pear. Easy to use website and delivery is super quick. (by Aisling Corbett) [3 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - A friendly to have a good free trade coffe. It is becoming one of my favorite place to relax. (by Guy Urbin) [a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Such a cool place, great addition to Clarecastle. (by Garrett Quinn) [7 months ago]

name: Cogans Bar & Restaurant
address: Main St, Leagard North, Miltown Malbay, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - What a delicious and hearty meal at Cogans Bar & Restaurant! We were famished from a long day of travel and thoroughly enjoyed our dinner. The mussels, seafood chowder and fish and chips dishes were lovely. Highly recommend for a quality meal while you‚Äôre in town! Very nice ambience at Cogans for a family dinner.

Thank you to Garrett for the exceptional service and conversation. We learned so much about local culture from him! (by Ashley Sundquist) [3 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Great service, friendly, and the food was fantastic.  Had the mussels, then fish and chips.  Both were excellent!  The homemade soda bread and tartar sauce were so good. (by Jeff Ward) [2 weeks ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Stumbled in because a recommended bar was packed full, best mistake ever! Staff was amazing, so friendly and kind, and the food was AMAZING!
My dad and I both got the mussels as a starter and fish and chips for main and it was incredible, so flaky and a huge portion! Beer and cider selection was awesome too :) (by Ariani Ward) [2 weeks ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Absolutely incredible meal, the portions were enormous as well. The staff were so friendly and kind. The whole place had a homey feel, the fireplace was top notch! (by Connie Brown) [2 weeks ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Everything was perfect! We had FISH AND chips, Chicken wings and Prawns. Very nice staff. Made us feel welcome and at home. (by Isabel Guerra) [a year ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Great food.. great atmosphere.. really good menu for kids.. can't say enough about Cogans..
Favourite dish is prawns or fish and chips.. pepper chicken surf n turf are saaaavage too.. actually it's too tough to choose a favourite !!! (by Simon and Jenny Maguire) [2 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - If you're looking for THE BEST food in Milltown Malbay, this is the place to go. Their seafood platter is amazing and the hake is delicious. The atmosphere and staff are both excellent, and Tony, the owner and host, adds to the atmosphere with his charm and good humour. . A really good night for anyone who enjoys good food, a nice drink and a bit of craic with very nice welcoming people, without having to manage a temperamental manager, as occurs in another leading establishment in the town. Including drinks and two pots of good tea, ‚Ç¨73.00. Excellent value for a top quality meal and a super evening. (by CH) [Edited 2 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Tony & staff accommodated myself and my family (6) Saturday night 26th September on our staycation in Milltown Malbay. Lovely bar/restaurant with a very warm welcoming and relaxing environment. The service and food was excellent, it's relaxing atmosphere is somewhere you're able to forget about the present times for a short while. Looking forward to coming back!! The Meath Gang! (by sinead delea) [5 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Great on allergens, chef came out to check as well. (by A Connell) [a month ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - We had the dog with us so we got a take away and brought it back to our AirB&B. It was delicious. So fresh and tasty. Very accommodating and friendly staff. (by Lynda Mc Donald) [5 years ago]

name: Spice Temple
address: 29 Upper Market St, Clonroad Beg, Ennis, Co. Clare, V95 XW66, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 1 star - Just ordered Lassuni Tikka, tastes like rubbish!
Meat is not cooked at all, hard to chewing
Very disappointed
Such a wasting of 20e ! (by Khokha CHAIB AINOU) [4 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Delicious food. Sit in or takeaway.
The place was clean. The restaurant was on the first floor. There is lift platform for wheelchair users .
Staff were polite and friendly.
Pretty much in centre of Ennis there is various different parking options, which are free past 6pm (18:00) (by Kerry Butcher) [a year ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Excellent food, great quality for the price. Staff also very helpful and accommodating. No faults at all. Best Indian food I ever had. I cannot praise enough (by Jack Heslin) [3 years ago] | Review 4: 1 star - Absolutely horrendous curries, they are clearly just blended up veg. It was much more like a veg soup than a curry. They also don't seem to use ghee (which is pricey) in their cooking. The least authentic Indian I've ever had, it went in the bin. This place show be rated 2 stars. Nan was wet too. (by Colm Martin) [a year ago] | Review 5: 1 star - Not good at all. Got the chefs Goan special curry. Tasted like blended up vegetable soup. It had no flavour and was really watery. Paneer curry tasted the exact same too, similar watery consistency and tastless. Naan was soggy and again very little taste. Chicken used was good quality and nicely cooked but the taste and flavour just isn't there. First time trying it out, super disappointed (by Ali Doran) [a year ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Fantastic from start to finish! Every dish was excellent and the portions were very generous. The restaurant is really beautiful and the waiter was very friendly. (by Mirjam G√§chter) [3 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Really nice place the food is always really good and the staff are very friendly. The butter chicken is fantastic! (by Tony O'Brien) [4 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Delicious food...  Had a sweet and sour chicken dish and a malai chicken, both very tasty.  Great pilau rice and nan bread, too much food took a doggy bag home...  Shame they don't have more business, as it was the best meal we had in Ennis !  And best value... (by Michael Wicked) [4 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - We regularly order takeaways from Spice Temple and have been doing so for 3 years now. They are simply amazing. We love the chicken sag and lamb jalfrezi! Never a problem - if I could I would give them more stars! (by Rachael White) [Edited a year ago] | Review 10: 1 star - I want to express my disappointment with Spice Temple in Ennis. About a month ago, I ordered a lamb dish and was very happy with it. The food was beautiful, delicious, and came with a nice garlic naan bread along with a sizable lamb portion.

However, my experience took a turn when I ordered again recently. I asked the lady at reception for another lamb dish recommendation. The dish she recommended was very small, almost like a child's portion, which was not at all like the previous portions. The flavor was delicious, but the size was disappointing, especially as a repeat customer.

When I spoke to the manager about this, he was rude. He called me "man" dismissively, saying, "Listen, man." I replied, "Excuse me, I'm not your man. My name is Philip, and I'm a customer. I'm not looking for anything free; I paid a substantial amount for my meal and expected the same service as before." Despite this, the manager kept arguing, insisting this was the normal portion.

Today, I decided to give it another try. I called and spoke to a very nice lady, asking if I could pay extra for more lamb. She said, "No problem, we'll give you a bigger portion." However, the manager took over the call and again was dismissive, trying to make me spend more money unfriendly.

I said, "I'm only bringing this up to ensure the portions aren't small like my last, disappointing experience." He assured me they were standard pieces and offered an extra $6.99 for four pieces. I explained that I just wanted decent portions, not to spend more. It went on and on, a disgraceful experience.

Paying customers should be treated with respect, not as if they are begging. For a takeaway to cost around ‚Ç¨20 is a sizable amount. For a working man or woman, or anyone ordering food because they're hungry, this treatment is unacceptable. The service was disgraceful, though the food remained delicious.
Very poor customer care and rude management
Philip.B (by Bernard Al) [a year ago]

name: Woodcross Bar
address: Ballymorris, Cratloe, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Great place for a camper van stop over. If you eat or drink stay for free. Pizza's are unreal. Eoin and Audrey lovely people. We stayed here when we went to the Wolfe Tones in Thomand  parküòäüòä (by Martina Prendergast) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - So glad this place is back up and running. Excellent local bar and they have now gotten in Citrus - an Asian fusion restaurant. Have been twice so far and the food is amazing. Have been all over Asia and this place has the most delicious Pad Thai!!!! My dad had the crispy duck this evening and loved it too. Could not recommend enough. Great addition to an already lovely bar. So glad you guys are back. (by Cat Corcoran) [5 years ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Very good! We saw the rugby final yesterday and the fish and ship and hamburguers was very good!! (by Italo P√©rez) [2 years ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Super, friendly service everytime we visit - either to dine in or takeaway!!
Food is amazing!!!
Spice bag, the best we have tasted!!
Apple Pie - amazing!!
The biggest bonus is that it's only minutes from where we live!!
HIGHLY RECOMMEND!! (by nica williams) [2 years ago] | Review 5: 3 stars - Nice little local pub. Not to many people. (by NeD ‚ÄúNeven‚Äù) [6 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Really really good food! Love that they have tofu and vegetarian options. Great service. Highly recommend. (by Jessy Fijak) [2 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Really friendly atmosphere, great service, excellent food at a good price. Be careful as food is only served Thursday - Sunday (by Ray Castell) [2 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Superb venue. Great atmosphere,  all sports on TV.  Fantastic service and outstanding  food. Staff excellent also. Highly recommend a visit (by Rob Keogh) [4 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Great staff great food nd beer shame I live so fat away would love it as my local (by Peter King) [2 years ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - Very pleasant place food excellent staff really nice and re√°so√±abily priced.8 out of 10. (by Kieran O dwyer) [Edited 4 years ago]

name: Monks Ballyvaughan
reviews:
Review 1: None - We had a lovely dinner in a warm, cozy atmosphere. The soup of the day (butternut and sweet potato) was delicious, and the pan-fried salmon‚Äîone of the best I‚Äôve had so far‚Äîwas cooked to perfection. Highly recommended! (by Barƒ±≈ü Alp Berksu) | Review 2: None - Lovely small boutique hotel. Very comfortable room with great views over the sea. Great location, quiet but lots to do in the area. Wonderfully charming and efficient staff.|We ate at the restaurant twice in the evenings, good menu with ‚Ä¶ (by C_and_RLondonUK) | Review 3: None - We had an amazing experience at Monks in Ballyvaughan! The food was absolutely delicious ‚Äì fresh seafood, perfectly cooked and full of flavor. The service was outstanding; the staff were warm, welcoming, and very attentive without being intrusive. The location is just beautiful, right by the water with stunning views that make the whole experience even more special. A perfect spot for a relaxed meal in a scenic setting. Highly recommended! (by sadeq Alsudani) | Review 4: None - The restaurant food, and staff, were incredible. Absolutely top notch. Would definitely come back again, about the only place in Clare to go for food. Came here 30 years ago, still the same. But bigger now (by Greg Cashman) | Review 5: None - Simply superb three night stay. Very comfortable room overlooking the sea, modern, well equipped and comfortable. Great breakfast, cooked fresh to order. Excellent food each night in the restaurant. Staff friendly and very accommodating. ‚Ä¶ (by MaxwellStone) | Review 6: None - A wonderful boutique hotel with the nicest staff I have ever met anywhere in the world. The rooms are so comfortable and the attention to detail in the layout is second to none. For instance.....a great hairdryer with the socket and mirror ‚Ä¶ (by annebS7461MF) | Review 7: None - We were staying in our camper nearby and went here to get takeaway food to bring back.
We had a mighty good pint of Guinness while we waited....seated outside with the beautiful view of the bay.
10 minutes later our food was brought out to us and we went on our way.
Fantastic experience...amazing staff and yes, the food was as good as we were led to believe.
Ballyvaughan is Beautiful üòç (by Steve Hoey) | Review 8: None - The Monks is in a fabulous location, beside the sea in North Clare. Friendly greeting and brought to our table within minutes.  Four of our group had the chowder, it was absolutely delicious and served with lovely brown bread. The mains were a bit disappointing. Two of us ordered the halibut but we were informed it was no longer available.  I had pan-fried salmon instead, and I wouldn't have it again. It came on a bed of green! Peas, beans, broccoli accompanied with mashed potatoes. Not at all nice. The other members of the group agreed that the main courses need to step up.  We didn't have dessert. As I said the location and chowder fabulous. (by Bernie Malone) | Review 9: None - Been coming to Monks for 20 years and its always a great stop.  Only been for proper dinner once and that was at the 20 years ago mark, but my folks still rave about the mussels they had there (and they are mussel enthusiasts!)  Been stopping for an annual chowder, chips and an afternoon pint while on holidays with a big group for the last 10 years and the service, food, view, atmosphere and pints are always top notch.  Highly recommended! (by derek moutpiece) | Review 10: None - We visited Monks restaurant en route back from the Cliffs of Moher. Wow! This was the best fish and chips we have ever had. The fish batter was perfectly crispy and the right amount of batter. The fries were triple cooked to perfection as well.
