We enjoyed the special starter - crab claws --- perfectly cooked with a delicious garlic butter.  We also got the fish pie- again a great ratio of topping to delicious, plentiful fish. Thanks for a delightful lunch and hope to one day pass through again! (by Bianca D.)

name: Fanny O Dea's
address: Lissycasey, Ennis, Co. Clare, V95 DX08 GPS 52.738998 - 9, Lissycasey, V95 DX08, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - We have been there twice and we will be back! The food is excellent, the prices are good, the atmosphere is great! The staff and the chef are the best! ü§åüíö This place has become a favorite for us! (by Anna Nikitina) [5 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Lovely quaint thatched pub/restaurant with plenty of parking. Good food well presented. Friendly staff. Good portions, you won't leave hungry. (by Marian Daniels) [9 months ago] | Review 3: 4 stars - We called in Fanny O Deas for Sunday lunch. It is a beautiful looking place on the outside and you can see why it attracts tourists.
We ordered our Sunday lunch, which looked and tasted very nice but then realised that they missed off our roast potatoes only after noticing other diners had them. The service from the girls serving us was good and they were very polite.
What was disappointing was that the men's toilet was not good at all. The toilet seat was covered in unpleasantries, and the ceilings patched up with paper and paint pealing off.
I only mentioned this comment as many tourists would be put off by the state of the toilets and would not return. This could easily be rectified by the owners. (by jesset) [11 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - We stopped here on the way to Shannon Airport. The food was absolutely delicious, My mum had the Chowder and I had some beef ciabatta and they were both tasty and delicious. Staff were all so professional and lovely relaxing atmosphere aswell!! Might stop again in the future. (by Elizabeth Young) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Fantastic place for food or a drink. Great service  quality food at a reasonable price. (by Gavin Plunkett) [3 weeks ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - I am not a fan of Irish food, but this restaurant changed my opinion. The flavor of the food is amazing‚Äîone of the best I have ever had in Ireland. Congratulations to the team; the staff were great and attentive. I highly recommend it.‚Äù (by Leandro Cesar Mudrai Costa) [5 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Historic pub. Great atmosphere, service and food. (by Will Rasely) [4 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Highly recommended for accomodation and food. We stayed at the small houses at the back for two nights and had dinner and breakfast in the pub. The food was fresh, tasty and good portions. The pub vibe was amazing and the service was 10 out of 10. The accommodation was comfortable, it has a hot bath tub and perfect. (by Monica G. C Sierra) [2 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - A gem of a pub. Lovely traditional Irish Bar with a genuine welcome and charm. Visit it before our nanny state government closes them all down.. Beautiful open  turf burning fires, cosy  intimate, and friendly. They have added a Beer Garden and Glamping Site out the back too which is definitely worth checking out. Note to owner - Do advertise your Food Menu in the Bar! and have the Food Menu displayed in  / at  the Entrance to the pub, preferably in a light box. This will hugely increase your food turnover, if monkey can't see... monkey no buy!! (by True Review) [2 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - From the moment we arrived we had a great experience and 10 out of 10 for thinking outside of the box for out door dining. A table in what looks like a beech hut that is heated if you require.  The food was brilliant so much so we booked in for the next night, we were on holidays in co.clare for a few days. The only negative I have wS the toilets needed attention because of how busy the place was just not enough staff to keep these updated.  But would recommend to any traveller to the are. (by Martina O' Donnell) [4 years ago]

name: Indii Clare
address: 201 Main N Rd, Clare SA 5453, Australia
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Amazing food and great service. We had a huge number of entrees, mains, and breads. Perfect. Chicken Tikka entree was amazing as was the garlic prawns, scallops and the mains of prawn curry, butter chicken, mild and medium, and the lamb korma were amazing. The sides of rice, rotti, and naan were perfect. Highly recommend. Just as good or better than the indii adelaide. (by Timothy Chapman) [6 days ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - We‚Äôve visited Indi at Clare on several occasions and I‚Äôve never done a review so thought it time, the food has always been amazing every time we‚Äôve eaten here, it‚Äôs full of flavour, vibrant and packs a punch in the dishes with just the right level of heat
(curry wise) Starters ordered were delicious, the hubbies main hit the spot, my Chicken tikka masala was different this time and a tad on the spicy side even though it was mild on the scale it was a tad to spicy for me.
All in all the food here is amazing, staff are knowledgeable and super friendly giving a relaxed vibe and an awesome experience
Well worth a visit (by lisa stephenson) [6 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Nice flavoured Indian food, order all vegetarian items, very tasty, great service, lovely vibes. (by Hardik Patel) [4 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Delicious Indian food and great service. We asked for it extra hot and it was perfect, nice and spicy.

We had
LAAL MAANS  Rajasthan‚Äôs famous spicy lamb dish cooked in chilli
MALABAR JHINGA Local prawns cooked in coconut sauce with tamarind, curry leaves and mustard

They have a spin the wheel comp too and we won a dessert. OMG the Kulfi was amazing. (by Richard Jagger) [7 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - What can I say, we have been to many Indian restaurants throughout Australia and overseas.  However this one is definitely the best we have experienced. Service staff were impeccable, food presentation very pleasing to the eye and taste. Thus ensuring a dining experience that finished the weekend. So if you are travelling through Clare S.A  drop in, you won't regret it. Thanks all Lyn and Michael. (by Michael-lyn Monks) [a year ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Really tasty Indian food! We really enjoyed our meal here because it was presented very beautifully. Ashame to do takeaway when it's so good looking being served in the restaurant. Very full as you'd expect from Indian. The lassi was ok, not the most amazing we've ever had. But over all we enjoyed our time and the meal here. (by Lina T) [a year ago] | Review 7: 3 stars - I dined in for lunch at this restaurant while visiting clare. To start with, the service was awful. As we entered the restaurant, the lady at the counter came out with no greeting, but saying we only have time till 2.15pm to order while it was barely 1 o'clock at the time.

The food was average, it was nothing special. I ordered a virgin mojito which was good for the time and for the mains, we ordered a garlic naan and a lemon mustard rice that was served in a good portion, but the chicken madras was pretty much different to what we have had from other Indian restaurants.

Then coming back to the service, the same lady at the counter didn't bother to ask us how the food was, but she was keen to ask the local people who were in the restaurant at the time.
It is also best to have cash if you want to avoid their card surcharge. Overall, it wasn't a good experience! (by Charitha Epa) [a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - We shared a Butter Chicken, Lamb Rogan Josh and Nann bread for a quick mid week meal - all very tasty. The young lady that served us was very professional and a delight. For a quiet week night this restaurant was such a great find. Would definitely visit again! (by K B) [a month ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - 100% the best Indian food I've had since being in Adelaide. The flavours are authentic, they are able to modify dishes to your taste and the curries and breads are authentically made. It was bustling when we went on the weekend so recommend booking. Cannot wait to go back again and try more of the menu, we loved it! (by Dominique Barretto) [2 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Delicious food, one of the best Indian restaurant around!
The staff were friendly and helpful.
The atmosphere was okay but it could have been much better with less bright light and a bit of music in the background (by Fabio Gesmundo) [a year ago]

name: Elm Caf√©

Only had the breakfast but very good and alway hot. Comfortable seating. Great parking and the staff are lovely. CLARE .üëçüëçüëçüëçüëçüëçüçÄüçÄüçÄüçÄüçÄüçÄüïäÔ∏èüïäÔ∏èüïäÔ∏èüïäÔ∏èüïäÔ∏èüíê (by Carolann Coughlan) [5 days ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Amazing atmosphere very kind staff and delicious food. Highly recommended üëåwill be back ü§© ‚Ä¶ (by Rea) [Edited 3 years ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Great service. Delicious breakfast..great coffee..had a second one! Relaxed atmosphere. (by Lisa Nolan) [3 months ago] | Review 6: 1 star - Not a good experience, I ordered a salad, made sure to just ask for lettuce and veg, dry with no dressing or anything else, when it arrived at the table it had dressing seeds and avocado(I did not ask for avocado) . I returned it and again asked for my original order, it came out covered in dressing when I asked for what I ordered was told if I returned it I would have to pay for two salads. They can't even get a basic salad right. I've eaten here before and never had this problem. Don't know if I'll go back again. (by Miriam) [Edited 3 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - The staff is very friendly and  cafe is always very clean, I think their coffee is the best in town.  The price quality performance is very good. (by Semosh) [5 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Excellent service and food really lovely atmosphere (by Catherine Hughes) [2 months ago] | Review 9: 2 stars - Brought my daughters for breakfast this morning and ordered a portion of pancakes for 1 and 2 potato chorizo hash for myself and my daughter. We asked for ONE extra sausage for the two hash breakfast.
Our total came to ‚Ç¨46.50 which seemed quite high so I asked for my receipt and seen that the two extra sausages had cost ‚Ç¨ 6. Absolute rip off. (by Adrian Shannon) [2 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Lovely place,staff are so friendly.The full Irish breakfast is delicious....nom...nom (by slickdeville) [2 years ago]

name: Clare Rise Bakery
address: 12 Main N Rd, Clare SA 5453, Australia
service_options: Just Julies Cafe Takeaway ¬∑ 4.4 stars ¬∑ 117 reviews ¬∑ Cafe
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - After seeing the prices of some of the town cafes, we decided to venture out to the bakery. We only purchased takeaway, but the staff were only young, but very friendly and efficient. We shared a pastie, a spinach and feta sausage pastry, a chicken and leek pie (could have been a little bit warmer),  and a blueberry danish. All delicious! Thanks (by Julie Hall) [3 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Amazing service! We were served by a lovely young man.  We had the Parmesan pepper cheese stick, Vanilla slice, vegetable pasty and a chocolate donut.

Everything was delicious, fresh. Pastry was flaky, the donut was fluffy and had a thick chocolate layer.

Definitely a must go bakery. (by Ben Nash) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 1 star - Visited here on the weekend & was greatly disappointed. We ordered two pies, a lamb shank & chicken riesling @ $7.50 each. What we got was a pie filled with gravy!! I found one small piece of lamb in my pie & my partner had no chicken at all in his. Will not be going back!! (by marita anderson) [a month ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Wow - what a vanilla slice! Two inches of thick and delicious custard sandwiched between two flaky wafers of paradise!
The pie was also great stuffed with cheese and bacon / drools / a great stop if you‚Äôre in the area (by David Maddison) [Edited 3 years ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Never stopped here before, but definitely will again in the not too distant future.
Great food, lots to choose from, so much  bread whatever is your desire I‚Äôm sure they have it, friendly service, clean. Sat out on the verandah, enjoyed the food and the sunshine!! (by Debi Reed) [2 years ago] | Review 6: 2 stars - I live locally and used to buy bread and pies here often. Since the new owners have taken over sometime ago, it has gone downhill in quality. Most noticeably are the meat pies. They are 95% pastry and gravy and probably even less than 5% meat. If you love a gravy pie, then this is the place for you. At $7:50 each, no thanks !! (by Peter Colenso) [4 months ago] | Review 7: 4 stars - Great little bakery on the outskirts of Clare. There is plenty of selection with great products. Their ciabatta bread is fantastic. Baked treats for anyone! Definitely recommend checking out. (by Jordan Sweet) [3 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Delishious pepper beef pie.
Really packed a punch and the pastry was nice and thin and held together beautifully.
Twice the depth of most meat pies as well.
10/10 (by Errol Maric) [a month ago] | Review 9: 2 stars - Had coffee and small brekky before going on the Riesling Trail. Nice seating area but the parmesan bread was hard. Would have been nice when it was just freshly baked & hot. (by Choc Pudding) [3 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Had the beef, cheese, bacon and onion pie. Very tasty. One of the nicest I've had in a fair while. Good coffee as well. Was just in and out grabb brekky for the family but looked like a nice spot overall. (by Brad Mills) [5 months ago]

name: Poet's Corner Bar
address: 58-60 O'Connell Street, Clonroad Beg, Ennis, Co. Clare, V95 H590, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Amazing, delicious dinner!!! Chicken Curry was spectacular and full of flavor. The salmon was perfectly cooked and the vegetables with it were spectacular! If you‚Äôre in the area, I highly recommend Dining here!!! (by Jacy Birtolo) [4 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Next to last evening in Ireland on our honeymoon.   Tasted fantastic and rare Whiskeys you can't find in the states. Damian and Staff are top quality.  Wonderful spot for a pint or a bite. (by Robert Lemieux) [3 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - The food was absolutely amazing! We had the salmon, fish & chips, and the soup of the day ‚Äì everything was fresh, perfectly delicious, and the portions were generous. Our server Olga was super friendly, helpful, and just fantastic overall. Thank you for a great experience ‚Äì we‚Äôll definitely be back! (by Neringa Navickaite) [3 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Very lovely.
Had a family member bring us in as it‚Äôs one of their go tos - they treated us kindly , the food was super good ! Prices are great and the actual place itself is stunning . No fake feel - very authentic (by B W) [a year ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Absolutely amazing starting with friendly service following delicious food.
Me and my partner had turkey and ham wich was cooked to perfection! Compliments to the chef (by Kinga-Maria Mat) [3 months ago] | Review 6: 3 stars - Service a bit slow.  Food excellent. Need to be quicker off the mark taking your order. Once ordered, food came quickly and was quite good. Wasn‚Äôt overly busy. (by Billy Hamel) [4 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Food was absolutely amazing.  The seafood chowder was the best of our whole trip. Fun and cozy atmosphere and staff was wonderful.  It‚Äôs a must if you are in Ennis! (by Lena Veldhouse) [a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Excellent food and friendly service. The vibe is classy with wood paneling, and it‚Äôs also very welcoming. It‚Äôs definitely worth a stop. (by Jacqueline Schillinger) [3 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - I have been coming here for 25 years. I love it so much, I bought a house around the corner bye bye London. (by Peter Forsyth) [6 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Been twice recently, during the day for food with my Mum and at night for drinks with friends.

Fantastic service on both occasions and relaxing atmosphere. (by Louise Brigid O Brien) [a month ago]

name: New Dynasty
address: Main St, Clarehill, Clarecastle, Co. Clare, V95 NY9F, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 3 stars - We got a take away before during the week that was delicious but this last one was on a busy saturday night and fell short of nice the duck with the pancakes were over cooked and hard to chew , disappointing. (by Karen Griffey) [4 months ago] | Review 2: 1 star - Came over from England and was told this was the best chinese in the area, me and My partner really enjoy a Chinese so was really looking  forward to this. We got the beef in black bean sauce, spring rolls, chips, chilli garlic prawn with veg and wontons. Unfortunately it was not up to par, the beef was way to strong and the other bits just didn't have enough flavour very average takeaway. Considering we payed ‚Ç¨28 we weren't impressed! (by Chloe Brett) [Edited 4 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - The best Chinese takeaway in the area.
Vicki and her husband have created a wonderful distinctive taste in their food. Vicki is also great in that she gets to know your tastes, what you like and in turn creates a dish individually just for you.  This is a great family business in Clarecastle. They are so good they get orders from as far as Ennis and even further. (by Martin Tully) [4 years ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - The best Chinese in Clare! Food is delicious every single time I order from here. Always hot and cooked fresh. Portions are good. Crispy shredded chicken is not to be missed out on here üêî ‚Ä¶ (by David Hegarty) [4 years ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Wow absolutely amazing food was so tasty had king prawn and cashews nuts / chicken curry / and satay beef / spring rolls / chilly chicken / and prawn toast üòãüòã everything was üíØ lovely Chinese and great helpful staff xx definitely worth trying out every meal we got was so tastey 10/10üíû ‚Ä¶ (by Noreen Moloney) [3 years ago] | Review 6: 4 stars - Do a right tasty curry here. Nice food usually fast service. Can see food being cooked behind counter. Staff friendly, if would take card be better especially now with covid. (by Richard O'Brien) [Edited 3 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Mainly Take-away food are served here friendly atmosphere friendly staff.
Perhaps the only active restaurant in Clarecastle Ennis that serves up evening meals other than chips and Pizzas
I ordered for their chicken fried-rice,  Nice (by Abi Ohiku) [6 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - I'm new in town and I was like I want a take out so I ask Google what is the best place to eat take out and there place was the first photo I looked at so all thanks to vickie and her husband and her worker for helping making this world taste the best food ever I love your food so please never close this restaurant  #thebestfood#iloveyeguys#‚ù§‚ù§‚ù§‚ù§‚ù§‚ù§‚ù§‚ù§‚ù§‚ù§‚ù§‚ù§‚ù§‚ù§‚ù§‚ù§‚ù§‚ù§‚ù§ (by Lizzie Sweeney) [3 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Love this place. Cheap and cheerfull. Just what you need in a take-away. (by Kevin B Doherty) [a year ago] | Review 10: 1 star - 40 mins delay over the 30 mins stated. They only take cash  so had to drive off to find a cash machine and they missed 1 food order so 1 hungry family member not too happy and we were charged for it. Poor experience. (by Mike McMahon) [5 years ago]

name: Fiddle + Bow Hotel
reviews:
Review 1: None - Nice hotel and food was good when delivered as ordered. First breakfast was a fail. The omelet ordered with zero tomatoes was riddled with tomatoes. Next day the veggie breakfast which had two eggs previous day only came with one. Very inconsistent.

Be aware the King bed is not a US King but a US Queen. I did know that bed sizes were named differently in some hotels but reached out via email prior to all booked hotels. This was the only stay out of seven that must not have understood my question about bed size.

We stayed in a room with a rain shower head with no shower  door. Looked cool and conceptually would work in a bigger space. However in the space made the bath a dysfunctional wet mess after a shower.

Hotel was a good location and the staff was pleasant. (by D JK) | Review 2: None - This hotel is beautiful! After a long travel day, I was so happy to have stayed here for the evening.

I was warmly welcomed and quickly checked in. The room was beautiful - It was crafted to feel ‚Äúwoodsy/farm-style,‚Äù but felt modern. Once in my room, I found delicious brownies and a handwritten note welcoming me to the hotel. The room was extremely well-kept, the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was large.

For dinner I ate at the restaurant downstairs (Russel‚Äôs) and the food was amazing!

Breakfast was beautifully laid out. I had a salmon omelette and was able to choose from a variety of juices and other self-serve breakfast options (yogurt, pastries, fruit, etc.).

I highly recommend staying here! (by Alek T. Michali) | Review 3: None - We stayed on a recent visit to Doolin. Amazing property. Close to the cliffs, walking distance to Doolin town. The restaurant is incredible. Wine list lovely and food menu was one of the best we saw in Ireland. The front desk was friendly and welcoming. We highly recommend this property. (by Betty Be Good) | Review 4: None - A fine hotel with friendly front desk staff in a good location for visiting Doolin, the Aran islands or the cliffs of Mohr. They were a little disorganized and the noise level in the hallways to the bedroom was somewhat high. Comfortable ‚Ä¶ (by lmarks617) | Review 5: None - Loved this super cute little place!!  We rolled into Doolin and it‚Äôs like a one street town in the middle of nowhere. The whole town seems like it could fit in the Cliffs of Moher parking lot ‚ò∫Ô∏è. This hotel was perfectly styled. Loved the character. Russell‚Äôs was hoping for dinner, the breakfast that came with our stay was very tasty as well. I highly recommend making the stay for the night at this little place (by Melissa Hayes) | Review 6: None - Overall a great hotel, nice decor and lovely location, very peaceful . My only critique comes with the smell from the AC, a bit moldy. Otherwise we loved our stay here and the staff was very friendly. I also loved their local products in the hotel lobby and the coffee pressing pot and teas to promote sleep. (by Mario A) | Review 7: None - We had a lovely stay in The Loft at the Fiddle and Bow. The room is well designed and appointed with everything we needed for a comfortable stay. The designers have put great thought and style into the hotel details. The public areas are also beautiful. (by jmjess2022) | Review 8: None - Rooms were nice, clean, calming/peaceful and everything was tastefully decorated. The staff was courteous and Russell's seafood bar was fantastic.  Was great experience,  but it was expensive as well. (by bjanik2002) | Review 9: None - Hi, Last night, we dined at your restaurant and ordered the seafood platter. We were quite disappointed to find it consisted mainly of mussels, lobster, crab claws, and just two pieces of chewy calamari. To our surprise, there were no oysters, scallops, prawns, or fish included. This hardly seems like a true seafood platter. It was a letdown, especially considering it was the only negative dining experience we've had during our time in Ireland.. (by Chris Jensen) | Review 10: None - Very cute and quiet hotel, mattress was very comfortable. The staff and overall attitude towards service is where the problems start. The lady who works the days is abrupt and nearly rude in how she addressed us. Both mornings for breakfast we made simple requests that at other fine hotels would have been honored (not wanting to order a large breakfast, only requesting 2 scrambled eggs - this request was denied as ‚Äúthey‚Äôve gone strict‚Äù although we watched another guest have their request honored the morning prior). The gentleman working evenings was always very accommodating and polite. Overall I‚Äôd look to stay somewhere else next time in Doolin. Not impressed with their level of service at all. (by Jordan King)

name: Smoke House Deli Lower Parel
address: Phoenix Malll, 462, Senapati Bapat Marg, Lower Parel, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400013
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - I recently visited Smoke House Deli in Phoenix Mall and had a fantastic experience. From the moment I walked in, the aroma of smoked meats and fresh-baked bread was irresistible. (by Khushbu Patel) [3 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - The regular smoke house deli experience. Great food, great service and a chilled atmosphere. We have never been disappointed at any outlet. Happy to report that the Palladium outlet is similar - prompt service, great food. We ordered the Avaccado on sour dough (must try), eggs Florentine(if you like sour butter sauce), peri peri chicken (all time favourite) and pesto pizza (very good!), ham and cheese sandwich(finger licking good). Try what you want, my guess is everything is made well! (by Amrita Purkayastha) [a year ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Surprisingly for a chain, and a place that's been open for so long, I really enjoyed my visit to Smoke House Deli.

At the Phoenix outlet, we were able to sit outside and enjoy the brief Bombay winter, which was a perfect backdrop to our hot drinks.

We got an Irish Coffee and Adult Hot Chocolate, and loved both. We also ordered Naga Paneer Skewers which were good, as well as the cauliflower from their Christmas menu. Finished off with a dark chocolate gelato, which was good again. (by Utkarsh Dalal) [8 months ago] | Review 4: 3 stars - Visited this place 2 weeks ago. The Nachos for starters was really yummy. Tomato and Mascarpone risotto is a must must have. Fennel and Rosemary chicken frank was okay. The garlic break was nice decent size portion. Mac and cheese was really good too.  Had the smoked chicken and Oregano burger the bread felt a bit stale and the patty was okay it was just breaking apart.

Overall the service was a bit slow. Ambience was decent. (by Rosemary Pattem) [3 years ago] | Review 5: 4 stars - Been here on multiple occasions and I love it always. The vast menu spoils you for choice. I haven‚Äôt been able to try everything yet.
The vibe is great, the servers are well versed with the menu and give good recommendations, though the food takes a little longer to arrive.
The food tastes amazing and has good proportions.
Recommendations:
Boss Style Aglio Olio Peperoncino Spaghetti
BBQ Chicken and Cheddar Melt Croissant Sandwich
Grilled Prawns In Cilantro Garlic Chilli Butter (by Suchita) [a year ago] | Review 6: 4 stars - This is a good place to hangout. The ambience is pretty good with good wall art, lighting and seating arrangement.  The staff is very friendly, prompt and helpful.
There is a site on which you have the menu and food can be ordered on the site itself. Good feature. They still have some issues with the payment on the site but should be resolved.
It has a full functional bar and food is delicious. Plating and presentation is good.
We had ordered 2 Kalledevarapura Estate Coffees (Dark Roast) given in a French press along with milk on the side. Spaghetti arrabiata was a balanced taste and not too tangy. Fennel and rosmary chicken hot dog was good.
Apple crumble tart was not bad but pie could be better, cinnamon flavour was overpowering. It was served with an ice cream which had a smoky flavour maybe for the name of the Deli. Hazelnut mousse flan was very smooth for the mousse part and had a layer of oats/cornflakes base which also gave it a crunchy side.
All in all a good experience. (by saket sagdeo) [2 years ago] | Review 7: 4 stars - The steak sandwich was the star, followed by the hazelnut mousse flan. Highly recommended. Service is slow so if you are hungry and can't wait, then this isn't the best place. Sausage charcuterie was kind of a stew affair. Nice but a little unexpected. (by Pulastya Dave) [3 years ago] | Review 8: 2 stars - It took us 10mins to decide on menu as they have nothing specifically special but too many common dishes. We ordered smoke house deli special pasta and hot chocolate. Pasta was loaded with oil, and less vegetables. And hot chocolate with lot of water. We spotted small cockroach on our table.
Price - very high, expensive for the taste
Ambiance- cool! (by sayali pawar) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Can never go wrong with whatever you eat here. Tried the Greek Salad with Feta, Slow cooked Lamb Shanks, Pesto Spaghetti, Christmas pudding and Tiramisu. Absolutely loved it. The lamb was surprisingly cold when served however it was re heated immediately. (by kamlesh kotenkar) [3 years ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - Smoke House Deli has been a well known name for quite a while now, but somehow had escaped my radar, until last night, when I met up with a group of friends for dinner. Being a Friday night I had anticipated a lot of rush so booked a table in advance and that turned out to be a good call, as none of the tables were free when we got there. The decor is pleasing to the eye, seats are reasonably comfy, though the AC could've been a bit stronger, but maybe that's just me. We started off with their offer on Bacardi and Antiquity, though they have offers on sangria, LIIT, wine as well. For appetizers we ordered the Grilled Chermoula Rubbed Chicken Skewers, while the vegetarians in our group had the Curried Cottage Cheese Skewers, and for a change I liked the vegetarian variant more, thanks to its delicious sauce. Our third and final appetizer was the Slow Roasted Plum Tomato with Basil Soup, which was the right amount of tangy, the way I like it. Being a group of 6 people, our focus was on the mains. First up we had Spaghetti in Spicy Arrabbiata and Fusili in Cheesy Alfredo. Both were very good, for me the spaghetti was the winner between the two. Up next was Peri Peri Rubbed Grilled Chicken, a very impressive dish, not only was the chicken great but also the accompanying rice. This was followed by the Peppercorn Crusted Steak, cooked medium-rare, which was quite decent, not too chewy. The last for the mains was Chilli Crusted John Dory, and that was the highlight of our meal.  It was so good we ordered it twice! The fish, john dory, was brilliant, and I enjoyed the accompanying risotto as well, inspite of not being much of a risotto person. We rounded off the meal with New York Cheesecake for dessert. It was standard fare, tasty as usually cheesecakes are. So to sum up then, excellent food, plenty of variety, very courteous and well informed staff, and though by no means easy on the pocket, I strongly recommend Smoke House Deli, a restaurant I'll be visiting again for sure. (by Rohan Bidi) [7 years ago]

name: Durty Nelly's
address: Bunratty, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Very good food and very good service. It's a busy place so you'll need to book a table. We were seare drift by the accessible entrance, which was ideal as a member of our party is a wheelchair user. We didn't have to wait long to order and receive our food and the staff were very friendly. If I'm ever local again I will return. (by Paul Rogers) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Durty Nelly's is perfect in every way! We thought it might be touristy but we were so pleasantly surprised! Local talented traditional music was a real treat! Staff was super friendly and the decor is top notch! The food was excellent!!!Best fish and chips, seafood chowder and roast lamb shank all excellent!!! A MUST do whilst in Bunratty!!!!!!‚òòÔ∏è You'll get lots of fun photos too!!! (by Grisan Stevenson) [5 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - This was our third visit to Durty Nelly's and everything was perfect as usual. The food and presentation is great and it's nice to walk across the street after visiting Bunratty Castle without moving your car from parking. Will definitely be back again! (by Sandra Hornak) [4 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - We stopped here for lunch while visiting Buratty Castle. It was not an issue to tour the castle, take a break for lunch, and reenter the grounds to tour some more. Ordered the Irish lasagna and the ham/cheese toastie sandwich (you can add chips for ‚Ç¨3 and soup for another ‚Ç¨3). Food was excellent. There's a little bit of a wait at peak times, especially in larger groups. (by Clare Ng) [3 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - We had our final meal in Ireland here and it was definitely the best for last. My steak was cooked perfectly and seasoned just right.  It was cool checking out all the things hanging on the walls. (by Linda Koeller) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Great traditional Irish which was very quirky. Great atmosphere and I would highly recommend the Irish stew. Well worth a visit (by Iain McMillan) [3 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Been coming to Durty Nellys since I was a kid. We fly over a few times a year and always visit. However this was the first time ordering food.

The food was delicious, I had the steak sandwiches and it was huge. The portion was definitely worth the money. They have a good size menu and can't fault any of it.

The pub itself is beautiful, very traditional with lots to look at. It is very enticing from the outside too.

It has loads of little nook and crannys to sit too. (by Abbie Treacy) [2 months ago] | Review 8: 4 stars - We stopped in for some appetizers. Food was okay. Service was alright. The place appears to work off of tourist, so I'm not sure they worry to much about return guests. Great history on the walls and ceiling. (by Steve Holmes) [6 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - If you're in County Claire, this pub is NOT to be missed. It's been around since 1620 (by Robert Matthews) [2 weeks ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Great atmosphere, delicious food (I had the Traditional Beef & Guinnes Stew - recommend!) and friendly staff - what more could you want? ;-) (by Kay) [a month ago]

name: The Wild Atlantic Lodge
reviews: Review 1: None - Clean and comfortable room. We ate in the bar both nights and the food was fine. Tasty curry!|There is parking, tight entrance so beware!|Unfortunately the water pump broke on our second night so no water for a while in the morning. All was ‚Ä¶ (by Navigate53683988337) | Review 2: None - Totally cute lodge right on the way from the cliffs of Moher. We stopped here early on a Sunday evening for a wonderful dinner and everything we had was fantastic. The fish and chips  were excellent breakfast  and our beef hamburger with coleslaw and French fries were awesome. We also had a few drinks. Our server was friendly and accommodating. The girl at the front desk of the Lodge was so friendly and helpful. (by Mary Biancalana) | Review 3: None - Seafood restaurant was outstanding. All of our party had the fish and chips which was wonderful. The fish was one large piece of crispy fish placed over the bed of peas with the fries on the side. Apple cobbler with ice cream for dessert ‚Ä¶ (by margarethZ5740DH) | Review 4: None - We stayed there the second day they re-opened and I would have never guessed! The hospitality and service was INCREDIBLE! Everything was ran just perfectly asks Shauna is a GEM‚ù§Ô∏è We would have stayed another night if we could have! Highly recommended!!! We will be back next time we are fortunate to visit beautiful Ireland! ‚ù§Ô∏è (by Catrina Kennedy) | Review 5: None - Just had a lovely stay. Rooms are beautifully decorated and the bed was just perfect for a great night's sleep. Shauna and her staff are very friendly. We had our dinner and the steak was amazing. If I could u would give them 6 stars ü§©ü§©ü§© (by Elaine Smallwoods) | Review 6: None - Fantastic to see this place back open and even better that it exceeded all my hopes. Delicious food, friendly staff, comfy bed. Excellent. (by Ronan M) | Review 7: None - Great little Ireland hotel! Friendliest staff, cold beer, good food and a pleasure to stay at! Will be staying here when I come back to Ireland! (by Bryan Stevens) | Review 8: None - Wonderful spot for a meal and a drink. The service was great and the food exquisite (by Paul Lear) | Review 9: None - Great to see this place reopening again.  Had a high quality  meal in comfortable surrounding served by friendly, engaging staff. (by Carl Fahy) | Review 10: None - Highly recommend! Amazing location, lovely people, comfortable and clean rooms, great service and a fantastic breakfast!! (by Andrew Beirne)

name: Vaughans on the Prom
address: The Prom, Dough, Lahinch, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Nice food, friendly staff, fantastic ocean view. Would like a bigger selection of seafood on the menu but it‚Äôs still a nice place to go for dinner, we will happily go back. (by Clare Mercer) [2 weeks ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Lovely place near by sea. Fresh tasty sea food, also when we asked for vegetarian option, they offered us amazing mashroom pasta. ( There are not many places to park infront of restaurant, but right next to the restaurant is parking lot after 19:00 free) Recommend to visit. (by Sofi) [3 weeks ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Nice restaurant with beautiful views of the bay. It's not very large inside but has a beautiful patio to sit on for nice days. The food was excellent. (by Randy Dana) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Maybe the best fish & chips we‚Äôve ever had. Crab claws and seafood chowder were fabulous. Service was quick and Sean was so helpful and cheerful.  View is outstanding. This is our new favorite spot. (by Karen Kinsey) [a month ago] | Review 5: 4 stars - Great service and setting. The food was well priced and very tasty but could have done with more vegetables with the steak considering the price. All in a great dining experience in Lahinch (by Paul Daly) [a week ago] | Review 6: 3 stars - Had lunch with our family after a morning of exploring the wild Atlantic way. The fish and chips were delicious. All of the other things we ordered (chowder, crab claws, mussels, lobster rolls) were decent but not as good as other seafood we‚Äôve had recently.

The service was not great. The whole restaurant seemed to be staffed by young kids and it felt like you needed to beg to order, etc.

It is a nice space and has a lovely view. Wish the service would have matched. (by liz m) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Amazing! We got the last table with no reservation on Saturday night. Very friendly service, various menu, delicious! Huge fish&chipas!
It was very hot inside (August) even outside it was +10. Beautiful sunset view from the restaurant. Free parking on premises. Kid friendly (by Julia Alex) [2 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Top quality food. The fish and chips was the best I‚Äôve had in years. Great views of the waves rolling into the beach. (by Gary Power) [8 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Best Fish & Chips we‚Äòve ever had! The oysters and scampi‚Äôs were as amazing as the monkfish! Would absolutely recommend and the view is just incredible! Perfect restaurant for dinner! (by Heidi (Zissapino)) [a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Lovely restaurant right on the beachfront. Great tasting food and friendly service. Herself said it was the best steak she has ever had. My fish was delicious. Highly recommend. (by John Blain) [2 years ago]

name: Dromoland Castle Hotel
reviews:
Review 1: None - My partners parents worked at this beautiful venue over 40 years ago‚Ä¶ They took us on a trip down memory lane on a recent visit.

You know this place is top notch when you pass the gate house, glide up the drive past the fishing lake and golf course to the front doors‚Ä¶ There was also a falconry lesson on the lawn as we arrived just to add to the splendid first impressions.

In reception the flowers are fresh and abundant, every surface sparkles with the super friendly sartorial team awaiting your arrival.

Wonderful historical interior with the walls festooned with portraits, paintings, taxidermy and trinkets. The main staircase sweeps down into a long hall reminiscent of a glamorous Hollywood thriller.

Whilst our hosts reminisced about bygone halcyon days of presidential visits, old staff members, cantankerous guests and beautiful chandeliers we made our way to the stunning cocktail bar overlooking the lake.

Our ‚Äògo to‚Äô tipple is a Negroni which were as expected first rate, others enjoyed Irish coffees and beers chosen from an extensive list of beverages.

Sadly we had dinner reservations elsewhere, however, the dining room is equally stunning with a well rounded menu with mains being served under cloches - don‚Äôt you love a little dining drama!

The team were attentive and friendly with the edge that a five star hotel brings‚Ä¶ We will be back hopefully to stay sometime soon.

Lovely (by fredrick Hambleton) | Review 2: None - My husband and I just spent three idealic days at this magical castle. The staff is beyond comprehension!! They are attentive, caring and kind. Enjoy meeting Erik, the sommelier,  and Nial the head of the restaurant. Everyone made it a once ‚Ä¶ (by E6317AAjudyr) | Review 3: None - Where to begin with this magical destination. As soon as you exit the highway and turn through their gates you instantly realize this place is special. Sitting on 500 acres this property is one of the most stunning we have ever had the ‚Ä¶ (by cmangum) | Review 4: None - Service was fabulous.  The lady that managed quality control of rooms. We were in room 121.  She was awesome and very friendly. We had a door to the courtyard since we had a service dog. The court yard was so convenient.
Dave the archery and clay shooting dude was a very calm,  knowledgeable and fun. Great experience.
We were less impressed with the food and drinks staff, kinda slugish. Food wasn't so good, especially for the price. (by Nancy Ricany) | Review 5: None - Stopped into Dromoland Castle for drinks as a non-resident and it was an incredible experience from start to finish. The welcome was warm and genuine, the service seamless, and the atmosphere simply stunning. Drinks were of the highest ‚Ä¶ (by honestreviewsireland) | Review 6: None - This is the second best place I've ever stayed in the world. Service was superb, food was great, facility was well kept. Enjoyed the hawk walk, the rental of the golf cart and the entire facility.
Too many amenities to list. Come and enjoy the stay. (by MrCopper King) | Review 7: None - As we celebrated our milestone anniversary traveling across Ireland, we stayed for two nights at Dromoland Castle, an experience that we will always treasure!  When we arrived in our rental car, we were met by very friendly and helpful ‚Ä¶ (by anitasb26) | Review 8: None - Our group of 8 stayed here for a night. We were absolutely blown away by the atmosphere and the staff‚Äôs dedication to service. We had a younger member of our party interested in archery but we were told it was full for the day. When a spot opened up, a staff member came and found us to offer the spot to her. The signature dining was amazing. We had a wonderful meal while listening to a harp. We were even talked into ordering the souffl√© from one of the incredible staff members (I wish I could remember his name). We had great service for after dinner drinks while we listened to traditional music. (by Kylie) | Review 9: None - Words can't express about the experience of staying in a castle. Once in a lifetime. If you have the chance, take it. Stunning grounds, rooms,  lobby... everything. Loved our stay! (by Dina Mercaldo) | Review 10: None - Dromoland is one of the most beautiful and serene places I‚Äôve been.  Our room was amazing, the staff were warm and welcoming.  We only stayed one night, but the walk through the walled garden, and around the grounds was amazing.  Dinner we went to the Fig Tree, great atmosphere, little more relaxed.  The gym was well appointed, and the indoor pool / spa looked great. If we return to Ireland, we will stay again. (by Anthony McCormack)

name: Lil Gamby Pizza Shop
address: Shop No. 5, Ground, Chhadva Residency, CHS. LTD, Sion - Trombay Rd, opp. Diamond Garden, Borla, Union Park, Chembur, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400071
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - We tried Lil Gamby's various pizzas, The revolver was the best and it was absolutely amazing! The crust was perfectly baked - crisp yet soft inside - and the toppings were fresh and flavorful. The balance of cheese, sauce, and seasoning was spot on, making every bite delicious. Definitely a must-try if you love good quality pizzas and garlic breads. Highly recommended! Also good ambience.

- The Foodie Buddys (by The Foodie Buddys) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - This pizza shop is an absolute gem! The ambience is stylish yet cozy, making it a great spot for friends and casual dates. The staff are super friendly, welcoming, and always attentive, which really adds to the experience.

The food is the real highlight ‚Äì the pizzas, both veg and non-veg, are loaded with fresh toppings, baked with just the right crust, and bursting with flavor. They also serve pasta and sandwiches. The beverages are refreshing and complement the food perfectly.

Overall, it‚Äôs a place that delivers on taste, service, and atmosphere. Highly recommended for anyone looking to enjoy great pizzas, sandwiches, and a wonderful dining experience! üçï (by Daksh parekh) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - One of the best pizza I had, loved the welcoming and friendly staffs. Def recommend it !!! (by arbaaz ali) [a month ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Had an incredible experience at Lil Gamby Chembur! We enjoyed a variety of veg and non-veg pizzas, wings, fries, and iced tea, and everything was totally awesome. The pizzas were perfectly baked with fresh, flavorful toppings that satisfied both veggie and meat lovers. The wings were juicy and packed with taste, the fries were crispy perfection, and the iced tea was super refreshing. What stood out just as much was the very friendly staff, who made us feel so welcome with their warm and attentive service. The outlet‚Äôs vibe was fantastic, making it a great spot for a fun meal with friends or family. Highly recommend Lil Gamby Chembur! Can‚Äôt wait to visit again. (by Bhavesh Choudhary) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 3 stars - pizza was ok it was in offer so the price and taste was nice but without offer the taste don‚Äôt justify price ambience is quite rusty feel like a hippy van for me it was not that good you might like it rest was fine do give it a try if you need a new taste near the place hope they do well as if they are new (by john ali) [6 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Amazing pizza, best fries( truffle fries)and do try their nut cracker in terms of deserts. Special thanks to chef Anirudh to cater as per my taste buds. And Rishikesh for  the amazing hospitality. Try their pesto zesty pizza if u like sweet pizzas or something not spicy. (by Sanjana Prabhu) [10 months ago] | Review 7: 1 star - I had ordered one veg (paneer) and one non-veg (chicken) pizza. Whoever ate the paneer pizza fell terribly ill with food poisoning symptoms. I would request the restaurant to do better quality checks on the products used. This is totally unexpectable. (by anuja nagpure) [4 days ago] | Review 8: 4 stars - Nice food. We had the pesto zesto pizza and the farzi texan pizza. The bread was fresh and crispy. Pesto zesto pizza was tasty. (by Shreya Gokarn) [6 months ago] | Review 9: 4 stars - The space is super cute! It has an outdoor and indoor seating. The food was delicious!! It's known for Pizzas and they know their Pizzas well! Veg and non veg both varieties are amazing. (by Anushka Agrawal) [a month ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - The pizzas are fresh out of oven and tastes good.. the service is quick
Rishikesh does his job very well!
Super courteous n polite (by RAMYA SHETTY) [a month ago]

name: Sheedy's Boutique Hotel & Restaurant
reviews: Review 1: None - Absolutely, unquestionably my favorite place we stayed at on our 3 week trip. Marion and Frank are some of the most hard working, detail oriented and thoughtful owners Ive encountered in my travels over the years. From the fresh water jugs ‚Ä¶ (by Maryveazey1) | Review 2: None - Gem of B&B. Martina and her husband have everything top notch. We stayed with my grown up kids as part of our road-trip to Ireland and the overnight stay was terrific. Booked 2 rooms and both rooms were very comfortable and roomy. The ‚Ä¶ (by Curiosity586292) | Review 3: None - Martina and John have created a truly beautiful home away from home. Martina was incredibly attentive ‚Äî morning, noon, and night ‚Äî taking care of us and making sure every detail was perfect. The grounds, lobby, cozy seating areas, ‚Ä¶ (by oneriver0925) | Review 4: None - My husband and I were part of a cycling trip in west Ireland and we were lucky to have stayed 2 nights at Sheedy's.  Martina was a fabulous, attentive hostess and John provided us with fantastic meals.  Arriving at the hotel after a day of ‚Ä¶ (by 472ginnyw) | Review 5: None - I was in Sheedys last night for my biannual dinner. Martina as always was very welcoming and friendly. I had a delicious starter of goats cheese, it was amazing. The lamb I had for my main was fantastic and the chocolate dessert was to die for. Looking forward to my next visit. I would highly recommend it to everyone. Mary Jo Duffy. (by 963amieer) | Review 6: None - From the moment you walk in you are treated like family.  Such a cozy inn and you are cared for by the 7th generation owners, Martina and John.  The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are generously sized.  The location is within ‚Ä¶ (by denisesH7057NH) | Review 7: None - Extremely accommodating couple when we had to arrive a bit late!  Room was large, clean and beds were comfortable.  The breakfast was incredible! Treated  like a queen and ate like a king!! I would definitely stay here again !! (by 426carols) | Review 8: None - We loved all of Ireland but staying with Marion, Frank and Bertie at Sheedys was definitely one of the highlights of our trip! Their attention to detail, helpful advice, WONDERFUL food and warm hospitality left us only wanting one for one thing: MORE TIME! We will definitely make more time next trip! (by 51 Bravo Knives) | Review 9: None - I had the most delicious dinner in  Sheedy's on Saturday night. The host Martina was so welcoming.  I am really looking forward to my next visit.  Kay L. (by 640KayL) | Review 10: None - Lisdoonvarna is the perfect base for your Clare holiday with so many great places such as Doolin, the ferry to the islands, Kilfenora, Lahinch, Liscannor and the Burren only a short drive away. The hotel is cosy luxury with lots of little treats to discover. With locally supplied produce, the evening meals are fine dining standard and the breakfast feast is not to be missed. The Sheedy team are unsurpassed for hospitality and kindness so if you really want to treat yourself to a lovely break you couldn't choose better than to stay with them (by Tara C)

name: Slate Restaurant
address: Pikes Wines, 233 Polish Hill Rd, Sevenhill SA 5453, Australia
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Went to slate to celebrate a couple of birthdays. The food was absolutely delicious and dietaries easily accommodated. The service was brilliant, up there with the best we‚Äôve had. Special shout out to Haylie who provided such warm hospitality and nothing was too much trouble. Thank you so very much Haylie. The brillant Chef also came out to meet us at the end of service and was so kind. The whole experience was excellent. I would recommend Slate to everyone. (by S F) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 3 stars - ‚∏ª

The food was very average.
Since we weren‚Äôt that hungry, we ordered two entr√©es and one main.
‚Ä¢ The kingfish sashimi was disappointing, it lacked seasoning and flavour.
‚Ä¢ The prawns themselves were delicious, but the cream underneath tasted off and a bit sour, not how it should.
‚Ä¢ The whiting was good, but again, the base (cream/hummus) had an odd taste that didn‚Äôt seem right.

On a positive note, the service was great.
Overall, I feel the place is overpriced for what they offer. (by Fernanda Lucena) [2 weeks ago] | Review 3: 4 stars - Great vibes in the beautiful region of Clare valley

Clare valley, wine country and home to some of the world's best Riesling. Amongst all this wine comes one of the better breweries I've been to, with some great tasting food
Pikes' restaurant "Slate" brings together great tasting food surrounded by a beautiful view

Come here for the beer, stay for a great meal and good time (by AP MD) [a year ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - A very special experience to celebrate a milestone birthday. The food was outstanding, the service from Hayley was friendly, attentive and warm. Outstanding dining in a relaxed atmosphere. (by Belinda Wellings) [2 weeks ago] | Review 5: 1 star - Very unimpressed. We ordered the lamb, the garfish and the chicken. We were delivered beef, which the waitress took back and replaced with the lamb after about 15 minutes, which was what we had ordered. The chicken was served, medium rare, which was bloody around the bone. The lamb was very tough and gristly. For what we paid, $46, we expected much better. They did drop a complimentary salad to the table to make up for the incorrect mains being served, however, this was bland and tasteless.  When the bill came, they had comped the 2 hassleback potato sides we had ordered.  Which to be honest were the best parts of the meal. We had a really nice Pyke and Joyce Pinot Noir. I‚Äôll be honest the staff seemed ambivalent to the fact, they made a mistake with the order. There was no apology offered with the delivery of the food or even when we paid the bill.  We won‚Äôt be coming back. (by mattrobx) [5 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Came in December '22 with a different chef....went again tonight. I wouldn't say it's a significant change because the first time was so lovely. We were greeted by a very friendly wait staff and taken to our table with glee even though we were running late (give them a heads up).
Instead of going to the feed me menu we decided to go our own way and select √Ä la carte.
I personally had the oysters (absolute blast of flavours), the Carpaccio I shared with my partner (which I'd order again....and again) and then the duck for dinner (beautifully cooked - although could have fallen off the bone better).
Anytime we come up to Clare this will be a must. Looking forward to visiting Pikes tomorrow (by Tim Summers) [2 years ago] | Review 7: 2 stars - Great setting and some lovely food but also some genuine misses as well the cremeux dessert was sloppy and deflated, the lettuce salad on the menus was coleslaw (they did advise this) but the main issue was the service.
It felt like cleaning tables was not a priority, our mains came without a chance to order wine with the main course after trying to get some attention & our purchase of dessert wine came with some ‚Äòinteresting‚Äô pours & upon questioning we were told some on the table were lucky to receive a generous pour - we were not tasting but purchasing a glass and the difference was noticeable. this left a sour note to our visit and also meant we didn‚Äôt make some costly purchases.
A shame as if the one percenters were done well the experience could have been five stars. (by Nicky Pearce) [4 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Known predominantly for its amazing wines, Pikes restaurant Slate fits like a glove into their portfolio of excellence.

From the moment you arrive you are met with the perfect balance between opulence and country charm.

Our table on the timber decking blended effortlessly into its surrounds as our uninterrupted view of the vineyards was a constant reminder of why we drove to Clare in the first place.

The menu options were plentiful, so our only choice was to order many and attempt to share hahaha

Zucchini Flowers w/ Prawn Mousse, Braised Octopus w/ Squid Ink, Pan Seard Mulloway, Pork Jowl and Duck Fat Potatoes were just some of the plates we thoroughly enjoyed.

One thing that stood out for us, was the attention given to Gluten Free options.
As a Coeliac my wife quite often misses out on simple pleasures like bread but not at Slate. The house made GF bread was incredible, so much so we asked if they would sell a loaf.

Special shout out to our waitress Monique. Her bubbly personality, infectious laugh and passion for people only added to what was already a wonderful day.

Can't wait to retun. (by DJ & LILS) [3 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Awesome from start to finish. Beautifully designed building and striking art work to boot. The degustation was fantastic and the views from the terrace just mesmerising. To top it off the service from the girl who served us was amazing. I can't remember her name but she is studying to be a vet üòä great work Pikes team üëè ‚Ä¶ (by Waks) [5 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - I enjoyed a delightful slow lunch over 2 hours with my partner. We thoroughly enjoyed the atmosphere, service and high quality food on offer. Of particular enjoyment was the use of native ingredients. Pairings such as saltbush with Kangaroo were simply divine.  Make sure you take the time to enjoy your experience and savour some excellent wine before and during your meal. (by Timothy Ganguly) [5 years ago]

name: Tea and Tones Shannon
address: Tullyvarraga, Shannon, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - We called after getting off a flight and were surprised at finding a restaurant at a gaa club, the young ladies serving were so friendly and the breakfast we were served promptly was amazing , the quality of the breakfast was second to none and plenty of good strong tea and toast would recommend it to anyone passing. (by jim slattery) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Great cafe for breakfast/ lunch. The interior is nice and comfortable and it feels wholesome.
I got the avocado&eggs, which came with black pudding on top, and was delicious. My friend got the full Irish & loved it too. The portion sizes are generous & the staff are very friendly & efficient. (by Aoife Wilson) [4 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Lovely cafe. Inside the decorations are really nice and the food was good quality, and the service was excellent. Would definitely recommend for a brunch (by Justine Hammond) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Great atmosphere, delicious food and very friendly staff. (by Bob Lannoy) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Really good food, great service. Staff was really nice and friendly. They don‚Äôt have vegan options for breakfast but the vegetarian one can easily made vegan. I was offered to add anything else instead of the eggs, free of charge, and this was absolutely a plus (by Michela Pacchione) [2 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - I could not recommend Tea and tones highly enough.
From the moment you step inside, the cosy atmosphere and friendly staff make you feel right at home. And the FOOD is to die for.What really sets it apart, is how welcoming they are to families, taking my 2 young girls there has never been of any problem. The staff always welcome you with a smile. If you're in the area, Tea and Tones is an absolute must, you won't be disappointed. (by saoirse odonnell) [3 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Feels like an irish home. Great breakfast! (by Veselin Kolev) [a month ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Visiting Ireland was a treat to begin with but having breakfast at Tea & Tones on our last day was a real treat! The staff is friendly and attentive, the food is delicious and well priced, the atmosphere is so cute and relaxing! A fantastic place to have a meal! (by Zachary Berry (Guyinabubbleman)) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Such a fabulous, authentic restaurant with delicious food and incredible service! Elaine and her beautiful crew treated us like family and even brought out the tastiest apple-berry crumble that was the best dessert we had in Ireland. I was especially delighted to find that they even served gluten free bread so I could enjoy the ham and cheese toastie! This is a must-visit if you're in Shannon or flying out of this town. Thank you!!! (by Sally Vander Veer) [a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Very cute and small cafe! went there straight out of Shannon airport. Lovely food! Incredible service! absolutely no complaints (by Katey Burgess) [2 months ago]

name: The Harbour Restaurant
address: Creek Marina, Cappagh, Kilrush, Co. Clare, V15 PN27, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 4 stars - First time visiting the harbour tonight. Really beautiful restaurant decor modern and chic. Staff were very warm and attentive never too long waiting for a drink. I ordered the duck breast which is how it's described on the menu I have to say it tasted exquisite and came with sweet potatoe puree, steamed veggies and some mash however as it was described on the menu as 'breast of duck' I expected that it would infact be a full duck breast. Unfortunately it was as if a duck breast was sliced into 5/6 pieces and I was served 2 slices of it on the plate rather than whole breast. This was disappointing as it is priced at 28 euro. Despite this I cannot fault the flavours or how it was cooked. If the kitchen was maybe running low on duck perhaps I would have rather been told as I could have ordered something else or at least been discounted for the much smaller portion as it definitely was not a full duck breast. Attached picture for reference. (by karen williams) [a week ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - The food was amazing. Try the arincini. Well worth it! I had steak and my friend had duck. Service was fantastic. Staff was very attentive and friendly. (by Amber Dunmire) [2 weeks ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - My first meal in Ireland did not disappoint, DELISH! If you are around the area, The Harbour restaurant is a stop that can‚Äôt be missed. You can enjoy a sophisticated yet chilled atmosphere, mouthwatering dishes and friendly hospitable staff. I wouldn‚Äôt know if there is a way of saying in Irish but "La cr√®me de la cr√®me"! YOU MUST TRY IT üòâ (by Giorgia Paturzo) [3 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Have eaten here many times and each time was hugely enjoyable. The chicken burger, goats cheese bon bons and creme brulee are definite highlights. Decor and views of the water are brilliant too. Would highly recommend! (by James Harding) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - I had food here recently. We called ahead of time to book a spot and there was no issue with getting a table on a Saturday evening. We arrived and we're seated immediately. The main dining area was not too busy but it was also a little earlier in the evening.

There was a lot to choose from on the menu. I opted for the chicken burger which was delicious. The mango sauce was sweet and creamy.  I was stuffed after this meal.

Staff were friendly and attentive. It was very busy by the time we left here. There was a private party and many other tables. The staff did an amazing job at juggling it all. (by Orlaith McInerney) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Delicious food, kind and attentive servers and dessert to die for! Went here this evening on the last night of our holiday for something to eat and initially we were a little apprehensive having read some of the other reviews which weren't so positive but we took a risk and I'm so glad we did!! The only thing I will say is that there's not much choice for vegans (so I settled on the risotto) but the food is so good, the atmosphere was wonderful and the staff were so kind and attentive! We would definitely be back, 10/10‚ù§Ô∏è‚ú®‚ú®‚ú® (by Crystal Campbell) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - We had a lovely meal here the food was delicious I had the crab claw starter the sauce was so nice.followed by hake in a lovely white wine sauce and a lovely creme brulee my favourite dessert. If I could give some advice it would be the service. I felt the experience is lacking here and so many businesses get this wrong your front of house staff can make or break your business so it's very important to get it right. It's the attention to detail was lacking quite a few times I tried to get their attention and was ignored. I'll put it down to finding their feet and hope when I visit again soon
( as I really enjoyed the food) I can write a review to include exceptional service. (by Rose Lane) [2 months ago] | Review 8: 1 star - Don't be dazzled by the bright lights and nice exterior. We looked up the menu online before driving across from the marina  to the restaurant, we were excited because it looked super especially as they had fillet steak! We had to ask to be seated at a very wobbly table after 3 servers passed us by without acknowledgement. All there was to drink was water, when we asked what was on offer with no alcohol the waitress laughed at us and said you have to wait for the bar to open because there's no drinks menu,  we just wanted a soft drink or zero that wasn't water and we had no idea what time the bar opened - we were there at 5.30pm. One of us is Gluten Free so adding everything up in our heads we didn't really want to chance it. There seemed to be no manager just very young shy staff that hadn't been trained. We left very disappointed and headed for another establishment in Spanish Point for an amazing Steak dinner, we won't bother chancing it in Kilrush again. (by Lily Joyce) [2 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - I'm Coeliac and the team could not do enough for me, the choice range for gluten free is very good. Have been many times since it opened, it's that good.Special mention to the wonderful waitress who made her first ever hot chocolate for me! As locals,(blow ins but locals) this is the best place to eat in Kilrush. I'm delighted for the whole team üòÉ (by Maria Melrose) [3 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Top Class Lunch.Delicious meal,loved the Salmon,Slow cooked lamb,Pork Belly and scrumptious desserts.Friendly staff.
Cosy atmosphere.Family really enjoyed the experience and wonderful cuisine.
Thank you John and your wonderful team. (by geraldine mchugh) [2 months ago]

name: Big Boy
address: 10240 S Clare Ave, Clare, MI 48617, United States
reviews: Review 1: 3 stars - I grew up on Bob's Big Boy in the 70s  and it was awesome but Bob's Big Boy's are few and far between so while traveling through Michigan we were excited to find this gem. Inside was a bit old and ran down, floors and walls were stained and dirty making us rethink our decision to stop but the need to eat at Bob's once again was stronger so we ordered. Menu isn't the same, there's many many new foods which would be expected over time but they do still have a few classics. The Bob's classic burger combo plate with burger, fries and salad is gone and the original relish on the burger is also gone, now replaced with thousand Island dressing making this burger just a burger and not a "BBB" burger so it was disappointing but still tasty. Everyone's food was tasty don't get me wrong, and the highlight of our meal was the chocolate hot fudge cake that was and still is in the menu, yay! It arrived at our table in all it's beautiful glory this classic deserves and was very but as delicious as I remembered! Without this classic dessert this lunch would have been a bust. So for me the things we first noticed weren't enough to overcome the negatives I'm afraid.  It's just not the original BBB anymore and unfortunately, it's just a restaurant called BBB. If you're like me who grew up on BBB the only plus here was the dessert I'm afraid. HOWEVER...I did come across several BBB in my travels through Michigan that were definitely newer and most inviting and would have tried one of these for sure but my husband who wasn't a fan and certainly not after our last visit so I didn't try any of them but would definitely one of them so don't misunderstand me, I'm almost certain the newer restaurants ARE going to be more like the BBB I remember so maybe pass on this particular BBB... (by Patricia Grogg) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - I don‚Äôt know who was our server here, but she was AWESOME. She was on top of everything she got us our refills, she checked on us pretty more then any other restaurant would or server would. She was good at her job. She deserves a raise, also prompts to the cook the food was good as well. You guys did a good job. (by Courtney Scruggs) [2 weeks ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - We went during Easter. Not to busy. Very clean. Good buffet. The kids had so much fun when the Easter Bunny came and sat by the table. Great place . (by Shannel Mann) [4 months ago] | Review 4: 1 star - Was not bad, but now all the good staff not there anymore, there might be one or two great waitress left. Out of items with no note saying which items are out of only tell you if you try to order something they will tell you there out. I got chicken parmesan recently and the chicken was still rare not fully cooked and I got sick off of it. The loaded Mac and cheese was missing toppings. We can't get ahold of anyone at corporate and no one will return our phone calls to make it right. Slow service many times. (by James Liabenow) [a week ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Best Bob's sampler I've ever had. My Cousin ordered the Dolly Sliders but they didn't have the slider buns so they gave her the Dolly Meal for the price of the sliders. Best costumer service ever. The girls are amazing and nice. (by Howard RunningWolf Cherry) [6 days ago] | Review 6: 2 stars - Waitress warned us they were in a managerial crisis and we should have listened!!  Hash browns cold and chewy, eggs half cooked, chicken fried steak like leather. We may give them another shot in 6 months or so just because our Waitress was amazing and the free desert delicious. (by Rich Carmody) [4 weeks ago] | Review 7: 1 star - A Thursday night 630 pm. NOT busy. Had the soup and salad bar. Only 1 scorched pot of nasty looking soup. Salad bar was 90% empty. When asked server he stared we close (2 1/2 hoirs) shortly not refilling anything. Place was filthy. Servers were NOT friendly. Atmosphere was very unprofessional or comfortable. Would recommend to NOT eat here. Very POOR service and food quality was GROSS (by Scott Johnson) [a month ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - We had the breakfast buffet. Food was hot and freshly stocked. One of my favorite breakfast buffets around. (by SantaWilly) [4 months ago] | Review 9: 2 stars - Very dirty and run down inside! You can tell right away this facility is not cleaned and maintained properly! 20 minute or more wait for a slim Jim and Philly steak sandwich at a slow time of day. Fries came out cold. Bathroom was VERY dirty and needed to be cleaned. Several tables were covered with dirty dishes (needed to be bussed) the entire time we were there. The breakfast bar had been broken down but there was old food laying all over the bar and the steam tables were left on, and uncovered.  The smell and sight of the dirty steam water was AWEFULL! The casing around the exit door is rotting and full of cob webbs. The landscape area out front is full of weeds! I dont expect a Big Boy to be a 5 star place but cmon.... take some pride in your restaurant! I will say, our server was very nice, and kind. (by Jason Gee) [2 weeks ago] | Review 10: 1 star - My son ordered a lumberjack potato cake with no sour cream on it.. food FINALLY comes, it has sour cream.. send it back, can hear the kitchen talking smack "are you serious!" Making wise cracks.. then she comes right back out with it ü§î Flip it over, and sure enough.. they made weak attempt at wiping off sour cream, and flipped it over and reserved it to us!! My wife showed it to them, asked for manager.. Girl comes from the cooks line says oh noo we will make a fresh one! So by time his food comes were done eating.. I spot a mushroom poking out of potato cake, so I grabbed it with my fork.. (he HATES mushrooms) flip it open and it's wrong potato cake! Has mushroom, green pepper & onion.. (supposed be bacon, sausage, & ham) waitress offers to have it made AGAIN, at this point he says just bring me a plain cheeseburger please.. nothing on it but cheese.. (can't mess that up right?) She brings him a kids jr big boy..(he's 25) lettuce, sauce.. definitely not plain. He took 2 bites. Not going for 4th attemp to get food right so we asked for the bill. Gave us an 85$ bill! My wife said no way! Told them needed speak to manager.. and they bring this completely different woman from the back.. claiming she was the manager.. and had no idea. I guarantee this big boy will be closed soon like the rest. These people are incompetent. When ordering my son asked the waitress difference between strawberry shake and strawberry shortcake shake, she looked at him baffled and replied "I have no idea." And then just stared at him. Sure miss big boy.. but there's no way I'd eat there. Just wanted have family night, dinner n movies.. üòí (by Chris Lake) [Edited 3 months ago]

name: McNamara's Bar & Bistro
address: Main St, Ballyminoge, Scarriff, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Great owner...Evan is amazing. Food is outstanding and large portions. Wonderful Guiness. (by Katherine Murphy) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Fantastic place to eat in the middle of Scarriff.  The staff were very friendly and helpful, letting us take our time on a Saturday evening.
The food was glorious.  There were plenty of "specials" to choose from as well as a large a la carte menu.
Definitely worth a visit and I will be back. (by Mike McInerney) [3 years ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Evan helped to make our family‚Äôs stay in Scarriff a trip we will never forget. He welcomed us on our first night in town when we walked in not knowing they were due to close shortly. Evan went out of his way to make us feel welcome and not rushed, and spoke with us about our plans. He offered honest and great advice and also was great company. We visited restaurants all around Ireland during our trip, and McNamara‚Äôs stands out as our favorite. Thank you for making us feel at home, and we look forward to visiting again! (by Matt Spaeth) [2 years ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Now here is a pub full of the Irish Craic. Fantastic bar staff full of laughing and joking. You are definitely made to feel welcome.
The food well bring your appetite as it‚Äôs good wholesome and plentiful.
So if you‚Äôre in near or just passing by make time for this place you will not be disappointed. (by Duncan Young) [Edited 6 months ago] | Review 5: 4 stars - Nice and cozy traditional Irish pub with great food (by Ivan Jakubs) [a year ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - The dinner I had from here today was absolutely delicious. Honestly it was the best beef dinner I've had in a very long time. The desert was also amazing...
Would 100% recommend.
Cash only on the day I visited (by Graham Boyle) [8 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Great selection on the menu.
Always fresh and tasty.
Lovely staff (by Kathleen Collins) [6 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - We are frequent visitors to the area and always make a point if visiting Macs. They never disappoint. Thank you. (by Richard Justice) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Absolutely fantastic Haddock chips and salad, lovely chef/proprietor Darren. Very knowledgeable and helpful, all local fresh produce cooked to order, lots of choice and varied seasonal menu. Highly recommended, not to be missed if your within 10 miles, He even offered to do mushy peas for a Yorkshire man 5*+ (by alf praulins) [Edited 3 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Nice pub with good food and friendly staff (by Gavin Ward) [2 years ago]

name: Hylands Burren Hotel
reviews:
Review 1: None - Room was fine, comfortable sleeps. Food was extremely good at breakfast & evening. They have a superb Brazilian chef who is passionate about food quality & preparation. His fish chowder is absolutely the BEST we have tasted ANYWHERE. Evening dining was also of the highest quality. The chef is also a fantastic drummer on his Peruvian drum & joins in the evening entertainment. Service is quick & attentive. Great car parking, though would like to see a few EV chargers. (by David Kelly) | Review 2: None - A great wee find! We have stopped off here for food when travelling on numerous occasions over last 10 years it's consistently excellent. The burgers are our favourite now! And if your lucky you might just catch a beautiful trad session in the evening with amazing voices as well as tunes!. (by Mary Rooney) | Review 3: None - Great hotel for the price and location, we had a very comfortable beds. The rooms in general were clean and the staff were lovely.
The hotel is more dated than other photos suggests though, the carpets were old, shower curtain had mildew, shower was clogged, windows were old, lots of spiders and general corners and windowsills of the hotel weren't cleaned with lots of dead flies on them. The cooked breakfast was lovely but the fruit and juice tasted old as it has that fizzy quality. (by Beth) | Review 4: None - Good hotel, needs a bit of a refurb in places. Room was comfortable & tidy, bed was nice & firm, slept well, which I don‚Äôt in hotels. Breakfast was fine, service quick & attentive, also the evening meal. The Brazilian chest is an absolute ‚Ä¶ (by C3748NBdavidk) | Review 5: None - Went there for dinner. Menu very limited. Waited for ages for order to be taken and then only after my wife asked the passing waiter if he would like to take our order, he muttered something under his breath but took the order. It was close ‚Ä¶ (by C6988HLwilliamk) | Review 6: None - Such a weird experience staying at this hotel this weekend.

The location was great for what we wanted and we enjoyed visiting the pubs of Ballyvaughan and relaxing for the evening. When we got into the room, there was something in the toilet that I couldn't identify and it was gross, but went away with a flush so happy out. We decided to try the hotel for food since we had been to the other restaurants in Ballyvaughan.  When we ordered our food, I tried to switch baby potatoes for creamed.  Literally told no... so odd when it's such a small thing.  When the food came out, they brought my partner the wrong dish and it had to be sent back.  I was starving and so my meal was completely done by the time he got his.  We left for a bit and ended up back in the hotel hours later for final drinks.  My gin and tonic was delivered as pure ice- there was no gin in it, the bartender had forgotten to put it in.  Okay cool.  Next morning, we ordered breakfast and once again they messed up our food order.  I ordered eggs benedict with bacon and they delivered it with salmon, which makes me gag.  I immediately flagged it and sent it back to get the right order.  When it came back (after my partner had finished his breakfast), it was absolutely DOUSED in hollandaise which was also disgusting.  I tried to push it to the side and as I did I saw there was still salmon on the dish, hiding underneath the bacon.  If I had a fish allergy I'd probably be dead but luckily not.  It was stomach-turning and I let the waiter know and asked if I could just have two sausage links so that I wasn't starving on our drive back to Galway.  He said they were "out of sausages", then saw some get delivered to another table a bit later.

All in all, nice people but horrible service.  Not sure if the issue was the chef or the people taking our orders or the combination of both, but probably would not return. (by Alanna Scully) | Review 7: None - The 4 is because of the location, the hotel is small dated and no A/C. Lots of street noise with the windows open. Was happy to only stay a night.
