Wouldn‚Äôt have checked out early if we had more days planned in the area. Affordable but not very comfortable. (by Inspire587501) | Review 8: None - Pros: people were nice, restaurant was decent and they had live music on occasion; beds were comfy and rooms were clean.
Cons: This is a much older hotel than the pictures convey‚Äîstained and worn carpets, cracks in the bathroom tiles/grout, and the walls are thin ‚Äî we could hear our neighbors urinate regularly. Be aware that Balleyvaughan is in the middle of nowhere with very little public transport available. But there are some good restaurants: Monks and The Soda Shop in particular. (by Kelly LeVoyer) | Review 9: None - Nice, long suffering staff, I honestly feel sorry for them.  We moved from our extremely grotty room, think black damp, stained surfaces, stained carpets, unstraighened lampshades, loud road noise, tired bathroom to a move to a room at the ‚Ä¶ (by finchingfieldvineyar) | Review 10: None - Very cosy hotel in a beautiful setting in the village center. We had a clean, spacious and comfortable room. The staff in the bar/restaurant is friendly and very helpfull. We enjoyed the coffee/tea, and dinner. The continental breakfast facilities are ok. There is a good choice of warm breakfast items. The hotel parking lot is accessible via the right side of the hotel. We enjoyed our stay at Hylands ! (by Ger Raymakers)

name: The Coast Lodge, Restaurant and Bed & Breakfast
reviews:
Review 1: None - What an absolute gem on the coast üòä The pizza üçï was simply amazing‚Äîone of the best I have ever had, made with so much care and flavor ü•∞The place is run by a wonderful young couple who manage everything themselves. They are not only talented but also incredibly kind and welcoming, which made the experience even more special ü§©You can really feel their passion in both the food and the atmosphere. Wishing them all the success in the world‚Äîthey truly deserve it! (by Dzheylyan Ayhan) | Review 2: None - We stayed two nights at the Coast Lodge. The room was very clean, spacious and nicely decorated, and we were even lucky enough to get a room with a view on to the ocean. Beds are super comfy, and the rooms are equipped with everything you ‚Ä¶ (by alioca) | Review 3: None - We stayed here for two nights and had a room with seaview. View is great and the room is nice (could use some work, especially the bathroom), its clean and the bed is good. From here you can make your trip to the Cliffs of Moher.

The restaurant, which is below the room, can be crowdy, and you smell the backing in the room and the hallway.
The breakfast was good and has a variaty of choices.

Tips: a cooling unit in the room and a locker. (by Willem van Ginkel) | Review 4: None - Great ocean view room with good amenities such as hand lotion. Window opened to bring in fresh cool ocean breeze. Bed was very comfortable, with neat animal photo above. Breakfast was included, and was very good. Not far from the Cliffs of Moher. The worst thing: the shower. Some box mounted on the wall heats the water I guess, but this did not work unless you flip the switch on the outside of the bathroom. Controls were a bit odd. (by Derek) | Review 5: None - We stayed 3 nights in the suites behind the main building.  The rooms were very large with a sitting area, kitchen and one had a had washer/dryer.  Spanish Point is beautiful and you have incredible views from breakfast and the the restaurant.  The staff are very friendly. (by Brendan C. Wackenreuter) | Review 6: None - After a lovely walk around Spanish point we needed a good meal and The coast lodge didn‚Äôt disappoint.
The service was efficient and friendly and the pepperoni pizza I had was the best I have ever tasted,light and full of flavour.
It was not overpriced to eat in with a great view over the bay.
You see a takeaway menu as you walk in which is of course cheaper but having the takeaway option means the staff don‚Äôt have to serve you,provide plates etc or wash up,so the a higher price for a pleasant experience such as we had seems fair to me. (by beverly Shaw) | Review 7: None - A beautiful place right by the sea. The staff is very kind and attentive. We had dinner there and the pizzas were excellent. Breakfast was perfect, and the rooms are spacious, clean, and cozy. (by Marli) | Review 8: None - We love this cafe for it's lovely takeaway food. Pizza is top notch - hence the awards - they even do gluten free. Glorious views from the front garden which is spacious with lots of picnic tables. Staff are friendly and attentive. (by Gareth Major) | Review 9: None - I stopped by for lunch after a surf at Spanish Point. The staff were lovely ‚Äì especially the girl who took our order ‚Äì friendly and helpful throughout. Unfortunately, the overall experience didn‚Äôt live up to expectations.

As you walk in, the bright yellow pricing on the wall catches your eye, but what‚Äôs not obvious is the added charge for eating in ‚Äì even if you're just sitting outside on a picnic bench. For example, fish and chips is advertised at ‚Ç¨14.50 for takeaway, but it jumps to ‚Ç¨21.50 to dine in. When I asked about the difference, I was told it's for "table service." Oddly, chicken tenders and chips only had a ‚Ç¨2 surcharge for the same service, which makes the pricing feel inconsistent and a bit unfair. It seems fish and chips ‚Äì possibly their bestseller ‚Äì gets the steepest mark-up.

We weren‚Äôt the only ones confused or disappointed, and it was disheartening to see that the owner showed no interest in addressing customers‚Äô concerns.

While I appreciate the kind staff, we won‚Äôt be recommending or returning. The hotel just up the road may be a little pricier, but it offers much better value for money and a more transparent dining experience. (by Padraic Reilly) | Review 10: None - We stayed for a wedding, room was nice and great location. The breakfast was shocking as there was a green oil all over the plate. Looked like everything was deep fried. The scrambled egg and salmon looked unpleasant. Toast barely toasted. No pastries out.
Some the staff can‚Äôt even say good morning. (by darragh mc)

name: Fitz's Pub
address: Hotel Doolin, Rivervale, Doolin, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 3 stars - We stopped in the pub on September 10 for a late lunch.  I'd read an article about great restaurants in Doolin.  When we got to Doolin, there was only one place open.  So, we went to Fitz's Pub.  We walked in and there were many open tables but they all had dirty dishes on them.  I asked if we could get a table for two and the young girl told me that it would be about ten minutes.  So, we literally just stood around and tried to stay out of people's way.  Then some time later another employee asked me what I needed, I told her a table for two.  I asked if we could have the cute little table nestled in the corner.   She told me that she was seating someone else there (someone who just walked in).  So, I asked if we could have the table closest to the bar as there was only a small amount of dirty dishes on it.  She allowed us to take that table and someone came and cleaned it.  All in, we probably stood around awkwardly for 20 minutes.  We sat down and the server seemed irritated.  We had already ordered our drinks at the bar so we just ordered two seafood chowders.  The chowders were not bad, not great.  Mine had a mussel with a broken shell and a mussel with a clamped closed shell.  Couldn't eat those.  The pints were good.
I'm giving three stars, that being said, it wasn't a good experience (by Tia Pirkl) [a week ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - If you are here, you should try the red ale and the lager beer made in Doolin. I drank it and liked it. The bar has a nice interior but it was noisy. It is generally a very touristy place and there are a lot of tourists. (by Alexander SpecLED) [4 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - The monkfish dish was so fresh and delicious, I am going to spend the rest of my life thinking about this meal! Heavenly! I do wish the portions were a bit bigger but the quality of the meal made up for it!
Worth noting that some items on the menu were mistakenly missing certain allergen labels (ie. gluten). Fortunately, our waitress double-checked our order was gluten free with the kitchen before submitting it! (by Lauren Uhl) [3 weeks ago] | Review 4: 3 stars - The food was edible but nothing special. Prices were steep: 3 meatballs for ‚Ç¨12, both the burger and the beer-battered fish were ‚Ç¨21 each. The burger patty was thick and tasty, but it lacked sauce. The fish came with caper aioli, which was good but barely a tablespoon spread thinly on the plate. Two out of three fish pieces were clearly overcooked and too dark, which affected the taste (the on pice that wasn't over cooked was actually good and crispy). The potatoes (served with both dishes) were bland and overly greasy. The sauce served with them resembled cold, watery tomato pur√©e. Food took about 25 minutes to arrive, service was average.
I gave 3/5 because overpriced for what you get. (by Liisa Helena Rei) [3 months ago] | Review 5: 4 stars - Was brought here by the tour guide during my cliff of mother tour. I got the potato and leek soup. The soup was alright but the bread that came with it was yummy. My friends got the smoked salmon/creme fraiche/dill/bread thing and they liked it. There was indoor and outdoor seating space (by L Pb) [4 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Stopped in as part of our bus tour and got to crab and haddock croquettes as well as the charcuterie plate. The food was very good. Loved the atmosphere ! (by Mikaela) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Our dinner was very good, appreciated the vegan options for soup, main, and dessert. Live music was awesome in the bar after dinner! (by Jenny Brown) [3 weeks ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - What a great place!!  The staff is great, the food is so good we had dinner there 3 nights in row.  Started working our way through the menu.  Music was fantastic.   Very enjoyable place  don't  miss it!! (by Katja Hennessey) [2 weeks ago] | Review 9: 4 stars - We were taken here via a bus tour.  Nice place country feel to it.  Staff was extremely busy shuffling one bus after the next but kept their smile going.  The chowder was decent and the fish fry was also good.  The open faced sandwiches were less than satisfying.  The chicken was a cold curry based chicken chunk.  The menu didn't mention such a strong spice, and should.  The crab sandwich was little to be desired. In our opinion this is a tourist trap restaurant and prices reflected that too. (by Andrea Bartels) [a year ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - Very nice waiters but when we asked for a kids menu they took 10 minutes and we had to ask for it 3 times, and we had to ask 4 times for water when other people got it straight away. When we ordered it took an extremely long time for are food to come (over half an hour). After 20 mins we asked them when our food was ready and they said ‚ÄúI‚Äôll ask the kitchen‚Äù and they asked 10 minutes later.

The atmosphere was nice and calm. The music was nice but they didn‚Äôt play for long. Eventually when our food came, it was very delicious (highly recommend the fish chowder). It‚Äôs a good place to take a big family. (by Alexandra Weldon) [a month ago]

name: Little Caesars Pizza
address: 716 N McEwan St, Clare, MI 48617, United States
service_options: Hungry Howie's Pizza ¬∑ 4.2 stars ¬∑ 283 reviews ¬∑ Pizza Delivery
reviews:
Review 1: 1 star - So this is a 14" stuffed pretzel pizza they are pushing. We asked for a remake or refund and we were told that there's nothing wrong with it. And that's after it was handed by bare hands of your employee. This isn't right and I would urge anyone to just go to hungry howies they got us a pizza in about 10 min same size and cheaper by 3 dollars (by Patrick Lowerre) [4 months ago] | Review 2: 1 star - We got the stuff crust pretzel crust to do a fun mixed pizza night.
I went back and got another pizza from Hungry Howies! It doesn't look like I pretzel  crust  at all, and I would NOT feed it to my kids! Check the picture.
Took it back, and the guy insisted it was an "just light on the solution." So, no money back either! (by Amy Thrush) [4 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - I was having a day‚Ä¶. We all do. Craved Little Caesar‚Äôs so I called in an order. Traveled 25 min to get it after my phone order. I didn‚Äôt care about the pizza. Just wanted to meet Juan Davis who took my call. He is INFECTIOUS. Amazing young man who obviously enjoys his job. Everyone in the back also was just‚Ä¶. HAPPY.!‚Äô I might just come in and sit to listen to their teamwork. Great job!! I swear I don‚Äôt know any of them. They just genuinely turned my mood around!!! Thanks Juan

Ohhh, and the pizza was amazing too. My heart has always been Little Caesar‚Äôs. I‚Äôm 54 and it was my first job in Owosso Mi (by Renee Szakacs) [3 weeks ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - my order got mixed up with someone else‚Äôs. i called up for a replacement They were very happy to do it! very kind. genuinely one of the nicest Little Caesars i‚Äôve ever been to! (by baylee earley) [7 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - The food was better than expected. The staff was nice. And it was not hot nor cold. I got a large Pepperoni pizza. Was not to greasy. Me and my family enjoyed. Then told me to write a review. (by Mittens Fishy) [5 months ago] | Review 6: 1 star - Don't waste your time or MONEY.. the staff here are horrible n mean.. serve me raw food n nasty food looks like they shot on it!! I can't believe they are still in business.. I will be calling corporate on this matter.. I've been dealing with your BS for too long now.. GARBAGE FOOD GARAGE MANAGERS.. SAVE YOUR MONEY AND GO ELSE WHERE!!!! (by Cerynna Athena Tanzy) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 1 star - If I could give  the girls that open the store today  February 28th 2025 @1030am a review it would be generous of me to give her a 1 star. She absolutely had a terrible attitude, not answering the door for the fed ex worker. Shaking her head she wasn't answering the door!  Shaking her head no to a paying customer whom gets a big order at the end of every month for their business. The doors was locked during business hours.  The workers rolled their eyes and said no, not answering the door. Rude. So that big account will take their business elsewhere. (by Christine Moore) [7 months ago] | Review 8: 1 star - Ordered through app. Went to pick up only one order of wings was prepared said it would be another 6 minutes for our second order. Took another 15-20 minutes. Meanwhile our pizza, one wing and crazy bread are getting cold. The employee at the counter was very nice apologetic for order being delayed. Manager on site was rude. Asked for sauce for crazy bread said it would cost more. Asked for my money back she denied a refund. Said I‚Äôd have to deal with the general manager who would be in on Sunday. Seriously food cold and management horrible. I‚Äôll take my business elsewhere. Sad when management is abhorrently rude and unprofessional. (by Jamie Russo) [8 months ago] | Review 9: 1 star - Ashley and Jenna can't do there job right if you can make a simple pizza ask for help to learn how to make a pizza it's not hard to do that.., my pizza tasted like shit it definitely wasn't what I ordered I wanted a pretzel pizza not a regular pizza with cheese sauce and salt (by Austin Gillespie) [2 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - So I went in this Labor Day weekend (Saturday night, about 9:00pm on 8/31/24) and picked up a pizza I had ordered online.  I get Little Caesars quite a bit  from several locations and I'll tell you what: this was honest to goodness, the absolute BEST pizza that I have been served from ANY Little Caesars that I have EVER been to.  The guy behind the counter was super friendly, welcoming, and the service was great.
I assume that the other guy and the lovely young lady in the back prepared my pizza, and it was absolutely perfect.  I wish I would have gotten their names because they all will be getting at least a five dollar tip from me the  next time I see that they are working.  I even called just to brag up how delicious their pizza was in the hopes that they feel my appreciation.  That was probably (no joke!) the best pizza I've ever had.  Freakin' fantastic job you three.  To nail it like that on a super crazy busy weekend like Labor Day is awesome.  I'd be thrilled if y'all made my pizzas every time.  Cheers. (by Erick Brake) [Edited a year ago]

name: The Creamery Bar & Restaurant
address: Old Bunratty Rd, Bunratty East, Bunratty, Co. Clare, V95 CC85, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Got the beef stew, Irish coffee, bacon cabbage with sauce and the apple pie. Very nice place with good music. Service was super fast and food was absolutely fantastic. One less star for atmosphere because people were smoking right on the entrance and the smell was getting in the restaurant. I did not enjoy that part‚Ä¶ besides that, I spilled basically the entire coffee on the table and no kidding, the manager came to clean the table 3 seconds later. She was so fast and kind. Very nice people and good live music. (by Gabriela Martin) [a month ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - A busy, noisy gastro pub where the food is very good quality and tasty, but nothing special.  The atmosphere is fun, especially if you get live music. I found the lighting very dark, which was fine in the evening but a bit grim feeling during the day. The service was excellent. (by Suellen K) [4 days ago] | Review 3: 3 stars - Stayed in a nearby AirBnB and was suggested this was the best meal in town. We visited on the busiest day of the week but managed to get a table upstairs. Service was slow, there were three staff huddled around the upstairs till point gossiping while tables around us also sat round unattended. Bright point was the bar attendant from the busy downstairs bar who took our drink  order but personally brought it up to us. Menu was standard stodgy fare with no vegetarian options and only salad option being a Caesar. We opted for the spicy chicken wing platter which was tasty. (by Kylie Connell) [3 weeks ago] | Review 4: 4 stars - Popped in for breakfast after very early airport drop off so we were first customers. Tasty breakfast & plenty of it. Couple of very loud & sweary fellas came after us & somehow two of their (many) drinks ended up on our bill so check yours before paying! (by Lorraine) [2 weeks ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - We stumbled upon The Creamery in Bunratty on a whim while driving to Limerick‚Äîspotted the castle from the highway and couldn‚Äôt resist pulling off to explore. Though it was late and the castle had closed for the day, we found something even better: a cozy, welcoming bite at The Creamery.

The atmosphere was absolutely charming, with live traditional Irish music setting the tone for a relaxed and authentic experience. Not sure what to order, I asked our server for a recommendation and was pointed toward the bacon and cabbage. Let me just say‚Äîwow. It was hearty, flavorful, and gluten-free. Comfort food at its finest. (by Luanne Pettit) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - What an excellent stop
Food is excellent
Staff is excellent as they really do help in every way to make your experience perfect.
Lots of Parking
Really lovely bar and restaurant
Definitely worth the stop (by Padraig McGuire (BusManPaddy)) [3 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Fantastic find! We stopped here for drinks before we went to the bunratty castle banquet. Jay was the bartender, and he was fantastic! He introduced us to several new Irish whiskys and was so hospitable and friendly. The prices for good and we are very happy we stopped their. Highly recommend! (by Ainsley Freshour) [3 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - The Creamery Bar & Restaurant in Ireland is a wonderful spot that I wholeheartedly recommend! The dish I chose was absolutely delicious ‚Äì full of flavor and beautifully presented. The service was equally impressive: warm, friendly, and attentive throughout. It‚Äôs the kind of place where you instantly feel welcome, and where great food is paired with genuine hospitality. I‚Äôm already looking forward to my next visit! (by L√°szl√≥ T√°rk√°nyi) [6 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Great food. Chicken wings and buffalo chicken burger are my go to. If you like your wings crispy make sure to ask when ordering because sometimes they come out a bit soggy. Good selection of drinks and cocktails. Staff are so friendly and accommodating aswell. (by Alan Kennedy) [5 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Very lovely cosy restaurant.  The good is amazing and the quality is consistent.  I went there two times over Christmas and never disappointed.  I highly recommend this place. The staff are lovely and the place is so clean.  I got a chicken dish and a non alcoholic drink.. really enjoyed it. (by Guitar Lady) [9 months ago]

name: Vaughan Lodge Hotel
reviews:
Review 1: None - Enjoyed the stay here. Clean and great location. Hotel is most suited to local golfers, we were a family with small children. Restaurants staff were nice but service could be slow. Top marks for hospitality/cleaning staff they were really on the ball. Staff at reception were nice also. The free lollies and gold tees were nice touch. (by Shauna Davis) | Review 2: None - This family-owned Lahinch hotel is a gem! The warm, welcoming staff made us feel right at home. The breakfasts and dinners were outstanding‚Äîfresh, local ingredients crafted into delicious, regional and coastal-inspired dishes that left us ‚Ä¶ (by dinaaW7811HB) | Review 3: None - My husband and I visited this hotel for a brief one night day and were once again blown away by the friendly service, great food and relaxed comfortable nature of this little gem of a hotel.  We had dinner in the restaurant and my ‚Ä¶ (by Oakkea) | Review 4: None - I stayed with my sister recently and it was perfect.
The staff are incredibly helpful and it's a lovely homely atmosphere.
It's a quiet hotel with no large parties which we really appreciated, saying that there was no issue staying up late at the bar!
The manager also kindly offered to take us to the bus stop on leaving.
I would highly recommend and it would be my choice when I return. (by Irene Robinson) | Review 5: None - My daughter and I had the immense pleasure of an all too brief overnight stay in this gem of a true family run business. From the warmth of Eimear‚Äôs welcome to the courtesy, good humour and professionalism of Michael ( the owner) and his ‚Ä¶ (by marynS1022WA) | Review 6: None - This hotel will not disappoint, the breakfast was the best I‚Äôve ever had on the island of Ireland. The hotel itself is spotless & the staff are so friendly & efficient. It is a credit to the owner, Michael, who is ever present on the establishment. Dinner is a must have also. (by Brian Rohan) | Review 7: None - Had a night's stay at Vaughan Lodge and it was a wonderful night.  The hotel is absolutely lovely and the staff are very welcoming and friendly. The room was very comfortable and the restaurant served up a wonderful selection and our dinner was excellent. Michael is a wonderful host and I hope we can visit again soon. (by A4089JZmartinad) | Review 8: None - It was the first night of our trip going through southwest Ireland. Had stayed before on a golf trip. Accommodations very good. Hot night but there were fans in the room, so comfortable. Staff was great and arranged transportation to/from a restaurant. Bar was very nice for a before dinner drink. (by Osterville) | Review 9: None - We only stayed for one night but wish we could have stayed longer. We felt so welcome from the moment we walked in. Our room was large, clean and comfortable and provided the perfect base from which to walk into Lahinch. Breakfast was ‚Ä¶ (by GrandTour65264715842) | Review 10: None - Extremely impressed with all aspects of our stay in this hotel. Breakfast was outstanding; wide array of gluten-free options available. Highly recommend. (by Feargal √ì Laighin)

name: The Long Dock Pub and Restaurant
address: West St, Rahona East, Carrigaholt, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - We loved every bit of our experience at The Long Dock Pub, from the lovely and accommodating staff to the meatiest, freshest, and most delicate oysters we‚Äôve ever tried!

The seafood chowder was absolutely amazing, and the main dish was just as impressive. Another honorable mention goes to the Ros Cider from Cork ‚Äî this apple‚Äìrhubarb cider was perfectly balanced, not too sweet and not too dry, wonderfully refreshing and delicious.

All and all, I‚Äôd love to come back one day for more oysters and drink! Thanks for having us (by NotYourTypicalReviewer) [a week ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Seafood heaven at The Long Dock! ü¶êü¶™
Fresh oysters, juicy garlic prawns, and crispy bread, absolutely delicious.
We enjoyed the outdoor seating with our dog and a glass of ros√©.
Great food, lovely atmosphere, perfect for seafood lovers! (by Ammy C Warny) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - A serious foodie experience was served up at The Long Dock in Carrigaholt. Everything from the oysters to the seafood chowder and the main courses of freshly battered fish and chips as well as the beef stew were absolutely superb. Such a lovely warm and inviting pub restaurant with exceptional staff made this dining experience one to remember. Highly recommend a stop off here if you are visiting the area. They also have the best pint of the black stuff ! (by Daniel Gallagher) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - We had our wedding dinner at the Long Dock in September, after getting married at the lighthouse. It was such an absolutely fantastic experience thanks to Imelda and the rest of the team!

Imelda and Tony made the entire wedding dinner process so easy from our initial meeting, and on our wedding the day, the food was absolutely wonderful, and the service was flawless. The place also has such a warm and welcoming atmosphere, and every one of our guests had an amazing time and an fantastic dinner. We can't recommend The Long Dock highly enough! (by Adam Fredriksson) [2 weeks ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - What a hoot this place is. Fantastic!  A foodies dream. We walked in just after opening for lunch. Absolutely fantastic and the atmosphere and ambiance are no less. Just great. (by Darrell Hornick) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - A really good place to eat. TASTY ! Value on offer too.
Extensive menu which is all done very well üëå Great desserts and ice cream.
This is one to make a detour for. (by Aodhagan Fitzsimons) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 4 stars - I'd call it a fish place, but they have other things on the menu. We had lunch and dinner here today and enjoyed both. It's like an old world cottage. I generally don't eat fish, but had the Hake and it was nice. (by Chris Fitzpatrick) [2 weeks ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Everything we wanted from a small town visit. Great, I mean outstanding service, humble and perfect. The seafood chowder was absolutely scrumptious. We shared a bowl and then ordered another. It was that kind of good. Fish and chips and the surf and turf were also perfectly on point. Cheers to the staff and owners, you have a gem. 10 stars! (by Ben Montgomery) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - I spotted this place on a drive years ago when I lived in Kerry, but it was winter and they were closed. Fast forward to today, home from Australia and all I can say is, Long Dock you were worth the wait! Sheena was an absolute delight, and a must have employee! The food was amazing. I am home (in Kerry) for three weeks and I'm trying to work out how many more visits I can pack in before I leave. Carrigaholt, you have a gem right here! (by Peter Holmwood) [4 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - We nearly didn‚Äôt come here because of some of the reviews, however we‚Äôre so glad we ignored them. I stopped off here with my family of 11 people and we had a lovely time. The food was really nice and the staff friendly and attentive. They even opened the food store just for us to have a look. We would come back here in a heart beat. (by Polly Browne) [a year ago]

name: Kilshanny House
address: Kilshanny House, Caherlooskaun, Kilshanny, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - All the dishes we ordered were lovely and the staff were very helpful. However, I expect they should have a better kid menu with more interesting food for kids. (by Dani Ta) [3 years ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - Great food. Big servings. Very good staff. Do book beforehand otherwise you might miss out. (by Ana Marques) [3 years ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - As a party of 6 each and every one of us thought it was the best meal we have had in a long long time. The ambiance, the staff and the food absolutely fantastic. Mussels were beautifully cooked and in a light sauce, lamb beautifully cooked and packed with flavour and georgous cheese board that had lovely elements of surprises on the taste buds. We all highly recommend it and only 27minute drive from Ballyvaughan village. (by Sarah O Reilly) [3 years ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - There are not  enough stars here for this place, it is just perfect, best steak I have ever had , (and I worked  as a chef for 18 years !!), we have never felt so happy and content after a meal . A true gem , go there , you won't be disappointed. Online booking necessary , also the covid safety protocols are the best I've encountered yet . All round excellence üëèüëèüëè
1 year later and still as good !!! (by emmet gibson) [Edited 3 years ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Probably my favorite place to eat in North Clare. Lots of traditional meals cooked to perfection. Big portions and a fine dining experience. I've really enjoyed the muscles and roast chicken. The menu tends to change quite a bit but always something for everyone. It's best to book in advance on their website to avoid disappointment. (by Liam Grant) [2 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Legitimately the best meal we had in this country as of yet. The staff were so helpful with suggesting the most well-known menu items and flying us into some specials, while also having a great conversation and throwing a bit of sass our way. Make a reservation and don‚Äôt miss this place! The mussels were to die for and the sticky toffee pudding was better than I could have imagined! (by Steven Munnelly) [2 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - What a lovely experience. We were served by Louise who was so accommodating and friendly. Helped us navigate the menu because choosing what to have was difficult. The Sunday lunch menu has a variety of options all of which sounded delicious. 2 courses are around ‚Ç¨27.50 and 3 for ‚Ç¨35. The roast dinner portion is for someone with a big appetite so go hungry! I opted for the cauliflower soup and salmon for mains. The taste factor was 10/10. I can't wait to return for the evening service! (by Michelle Guthrie) [4 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - This is a good, cozy place to get a pint. A little bit off the beaten path, we hit it up after checking out the Cliffs of Moher. No food when we we there. But if you're feeling social you could probably buy a round for the locals and make some new friends. (by Maia Rodriguez) [6 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Mary was very welcoming to us when we showed up, famished, after surfing all afternoon. She kindly whipped us up some delicious seafood chowder and homemade brown bread despite lunch being over. Really, the chowder was the best we had on our trip. We couldn't resist the blackberry and apple crumble with custard, and thankfully we didn't, it was fantastic! There was also a lovely friendly dog, Coco who greeted us in the car park (by Clare Smith) [7 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Very nice food and pleasant service. Nice atmosphere, inventive dishes and cocktails. (by Michael Martin) [3 years ago]

name: Pinto Clare Valley
address: Unit 2/47 Old N Rd, Clare SA 5453, Australia
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - The food here is always outstanding. We recently tried the grilled lamb ribs with black vinegar honey sauce and the braised beef short ribs with red wine sauce, both dishes were full of rich flavours and cooked to perfection. The lamb ribs were tender with a perfect balance of sweet and tangy. Highly recommend this place if you‚Äôre after quality food and a lovely atmosphere in the Clare Valley! (by Minh Le) [3 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Pinto Clare Valley is an absolute gem. We‚Äôve been here for both brunch and dinner, and every dish has been flavourful and beautifully presented. The brunch options are perfect to start your day. The staff are always welcoming and attentive. Highly recommended if you‚Äôre in the area! (by Nhu Le) [4 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - My wife and I have been ordering from this restaurant at least once a month for the past year. The restaurant has a nice, warm, cozy and modern atmosphere. The food has always been consistent and we have our favourites here. We have plenty of delicious entrees when dining in and I particularly recommend the beef tataki.

On nights we are too lazy to cook we would always order takeaway from here. Nice portion sizes and always quality food!
The owners are also lovely people. I‚Äôd highly recommend. (by Minh Le) [6 months ago] | Review 4: 4 stars - First time visiting Pinto restaurant, we‚Äôve  been in Clare for a few nights and wanted to try somewhere different and this place hit the spot. Took us a few minutes to get here as Apple hasn‚Äôt updated the new location which by the way is situated in the Woolies complex but once we finally found this place it didn‚Äôt disappoint. Staff were super friendly, the food was to die for very flavoursome, fresh and vibrant
The only downside for me was there were no bathroom amenities in the restaurant, you had to walk to the end of the shopping complex (At the side of Woolies) which was probably half a minute walk but apart from this minor sett back the food is amazing well worth a visit (by lisa stephenson) [6 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Absolutely delicious food. Wish I lived closer as I would eat here all the time. Will definitely return if I'm in or near the area.

Only negative was that it was inside the pub and the atmosphere wasn't great. There was music playing over the pub speakers as well as the restaurants own speaker and listening to 2 songs at the same time was strange.

Saw that they are only at this location until end of April and will announce details soon. Hoping they are moving to their own restaurant ü§ûüèª (by Melanie Pascoe) [a year ago] | Review 6: 1 star - Honestly, pretty terrible. After spending $115 on a takeaway treat for my parents who live locally, we were all disappointed. For $115, we got Pad Thai, Basil Chicken, Satay, Dumplings and Kingfish Crudo - a good price if it had tasted good.

The Kingfish Krudo was very average and had a fishy taste that made me unsure of its freshness - this is something I'd order a lot when eating out and something I‚Äôve made at home myself. I‚Äôve had better elsewhere, but it was probably one of the better dishes.

The dumplings had a distinctly weird taste, to the extent that 2 out of 3 of us spat ours out into the bin - no one ate more than one each, and 5 out of 8 were wasted. This isn‚Äôt even about them being frozen. As a fan of dumplings, I often eat frozen at home - these had a weird ‚Äòoff taste‚Äô.

The satay was thin and bland - the sauce that accompanied it was not the peanutty satay sauce you might expect, but a red curry sauce.

The Basil Chicken was so overpoweringly garlicky that the car smelled of it when we came home, and it overpowered any other flavours in the dish. The basil was almost indistinguishable, and it was really very little - a thin layer across some rice. My mum couldn‚Äôt eat it at all, it was so strong.

The Pad Thai was gloopy and had an artificial lemon flavour - no need for the lemon segment on the side. The prawns in this dish were good, but overall, it was a real letdown. That said, it‚Äôs the best of a bad bunch.

It‚Äôs really disappointing. We‚Äôve been meaning to try Pinto for ages - we usually end up getting the amazing curries from the Ampol - but we will never come back and won‚Äôt recommend it to anyone in the Clare Valley.

EDIT after Pinto‚Äôs reply: I appreciate the response, but it feels more like deflection than genuine engagement. I‚Äôve travelled extensively in Thailand and eat Thai food often ‚Äî this wasn‚Äôt a case of ‚Äúnot understanding authentic flavours,‚Äù it just wasn‚Äôt good.
We ate the crudo first, as advised, and it still tasted strange. I‚Äôm aware satay isn‚Äôt made with peanut butter, but your satay sauce resembled red curry more than anything satay-style. The dumplings had an unpleasant flavour ‚Äî not a matter of personal preference, but quality. The basil chicken was overwhelmingly garlicky - I expect garlic, but I also expect to taste the other flavours too, and the Pad Thai was reheated properly but still gloopy and artificial tasting.
I don‚Äôt leave negative reviews lightly. You‚Äôre entitled to defend your food, but dismissing customer experience as ignorance isn‚Äôt the way to do it. (by Shelley Travers) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - We were both craving something made from start with fresh vegetables, a bit of spice and just the right size after a few days up north of Clare in the dessert. Out of the blue our wishes were granted when we wandered in early evening to the Pinto. The dishes being prepared wafting from the kitchen had us hooked. An amazing vegetable stir fry from local seasonal vegetables with some chillies and saffron rice had us in heaven.
Great presentation,  wonderful atmosphere and top class friendly service is not something you come across often enough anymore.
Will be back here on our next trip and wrote this so others can stop and take advantage as well. (by Paul Howells) [2 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Awesome place to dine in. We having been told about how amazing the food was, and we were not disappointed.

We stopped here for lunch. The food was delicious. The staff were very friendly. We all left very happy.

We definitely come back and suggest our friends to come Pinto. Thank you for an amazing meal! (by Bombay Sawang) [2 months ago] | Review 9: 1 star - Do yourself a favor and don't set foot anywhere near this place!
Booked in for a 65th birthday celebration, so had high hopes the place would be at least half decent.
Ordered spring rolls for three as a starter plus a main each. Two of us ordered a pad Thai as a main, only to be told they only had one left. Alarm bells straight away........Are their meals pre prepared to have run out of this simple noodle dish! I changed my first choice and went for a simple veg stir fry for $20.00 as well as a garlic roti.
50 minutes later still no spring rolls despite only one other table of four in the restaurant.
My stir fry finally arrived on a small side plate, being a single layer of luke-warm vegetables that became instantly cold. No rice or noodles in site.
My roti was limp and dripping with oil that ran off my fingers when I picked it up.  I left it uneaten on the plate.
The unlucky guest who did receive the last pad Thai, had a bowl of cold, gluggy noodles that couldn't be separated and rubber prawns.
The birthday boy's pork dish wasn't much better, was also tiny, luke-warm and with the pieces of pork unevenly cooked. This was actually a very expensive dish on the menu. Apparently the jasmine rice was very nice!
The lovely young waitress asked how our meals were... I decided to be honest and told her the food was a huge disappointment. No apologies or offer of a refund.
On leaving and preparing to pay the bill I enquired about the spring rolls for three that never arrived. Of course they were clearly there on the bill. These were taken off but we still paid $140.00 for the three of us. We had a guest from Queensland with us, and had hoped for a nice memory of his brother's 65th birthday. We now wish we hadn't bothered with this place and just went to Subway or one of the local pubs instead.
Despite being locals, we will not be having anything to do with this place again and cannot recommend it to others. (by Andy Applebee) [5 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - What a find!  This cosy restaurant was close to the hotel we stayed in, on a recent visit to Clare from Adelaide.  Both my husband and I ordered special fried rice (beef for my husband and crispy chicken for me).  So delicious, I couldn‚Äôt stop thinking about it afterwards.  Immediately booked to come back two nights later.
The staff and service were delightful, and we were not rushed.  Very reasonable prices. (by rujisaya bunluewong) [5 months ago]

name: The Bentleys Hotel
reviews:
Review 1: None - Fantastic food and service. My wife and I had 3 meals there on our stay in clare, baby barramundi was amazing , hot rock steak was amazing i had that twice, always cooked perfectly if cooking yourself, great chips, salad, and vegetables.  The pizzas were amazing 1 was in calzone form. Scallops amazing and cauliflower steak was perfect. Will return and highly reccomend (by Timothy Chapman) | Review 2: None - I had an absolutely wonderful stay at Bentley‚Äôs Hotel Motel in Clare! The room was immaculate, with a lovely layout and a super comfortable bed. The cleanliness was top-notch, and I felt right at home. The service was impeccable, especially from Nicole, who greeted me warmly at check-in and later took care of me at the bar during dinner. Speaking of dinner, the meal was fantastic! Overall, it was a truly great experience, and I highly recommend it! (by Nick Crowe) | Review 3: None - Bentleys is an ‚Äòacceptable‚Äô choice in Clare if you need a single night‚Äôs accommodation on a Saturday night (so hard to find given the two night minimum curse!!) but, other than that advantage, there is not too much else to say that is ‚Ä¶ (by LisaMDL) | Review 4: None - Went here for a Sunday lunch to meet my mum... the service was great.
The meals were really good, the slow cooked bourbon ribs were fantastic, meat fell off the bone and full of taste, mum had the pork roast of the day and enjoyed it.
My partner had a chicken parmi and it was huge, took half of it home when a doggy bag was offered.
We enjoyed our visit and will return again.
Thank you! (by Amanda Auty) | Review 5: None - Been to Clare a few times but, never to this pub. Thought we‚Äôd give it a try for dinner. Walked in not many people in the pub at the time. We ordered a pint of beer and a sprite. The sprite turned out to be soda water but, we didn‚Äôt take it back. Partner walked up to the bar to order another beer, stood at the bar for a long time whilst the barman kept talking to other people sitting at the bar and the other lady serving kept putting menus on vacant tables. Didn‚Äôt look like they were going to serve him any time soon so we walked out of the pub and went to the Clare Hotel where we got served drinks quickly and correctly. üòÇ (by A L) | Review 6: None - Spent a week in Clare for work, and was my go to dinner location every night. Great pub food, menu, service and warm cosy dining area. Staff were awesome, wood fire and great wine selection. Get on the steak selections or BBQ ribs.... recommended (by Peter Dedrick) | Review 7: None - Chose Bentley's for our dinner and glad we did. Even came back the next night aswell!
Had pizzas the 1st night which were fresh & great. Chicken schnitzel & a vegan schnitzel the 2nd night, with chips & salad. Also great.
But what made it a great experience was the wonderful atmosphere & awesome staff.
A very friendly welcome from the lovely lady Cherry where we ordered our meals. The young people that brought our meals were professional & lovely.
We would definitely recommend Bentley's and next time in Clare we will be back. (by Catherine Sherrah) | Review 8: None - Staff on arrival made me feel a nuisance. Room was basic, clean touch surfaces but walls were very unattractive - old paint, old glue and maybe mould?!? Lighting ordinary. Bed was terrific, big n comfy. Bathroom clean but maybe 60s school ablution block? Concrete slabs with big cracks in walls n floor, and short curtain on shower. Location good for cafes in walking distance, but soooo noisy - traffic constant, other guests inconsiderate at 0500,0600, and staff emptying bottles/glass at 0700 into bins? Housekeeping ladies lovely! Pub smelt of deep fryers,  but local takeaway cafes were good (by Elizabeth English) | Review 9: None - Nice meal and great service by Jodie and another lady (Sorry, forgot her name) . Thank you to both ladies for being so obliging.
And thank you for your patience with our group of Residents.
Nadine (by Paul Hodgson) | Review 10: None - A great spot to catch up with friends, have a few drinks and a bite to eat. Super dog friendly in the beer garden outside under cover
. (by Belinda Wellings)

name: Seed Clare Valley
address: 268 Main N Rd, Clare SA 5453, Australia
reviews:
Review 1: 4 stars - Good food overall!
Brest tuna entree, so fresh and tasty

Ordered
Lamb patty, it was way too dry and very hard to chew and swallow it. Not recommended.
slow cooked lamb shank, very refreshing, not heavy and it didn‚Äôt have any gamy taste.
Beef schnitzel went well with the gravy $3. It was a bit hard and dry, but overall was very good!

15% surcharge on public holiday. (by Rosaline H) [5 months ago] | Review 2: 2 stars - Well, whatever you do don't order the prosciutto pizza. A big lump of cold meat with too much rocket it falls to bits in your hand. It didn't taste good either. Too much topping, simplicity is the secret.
I had a glass of wine which was nice.
Enjoyed the free iced water the most.
Atmospheric, a bad mix of soft R&B, not my thing, but yeah if you like it, run with it.
As I went to pay the waiter asked if I wanted a box for the pizza, I said no thanks that was gross. She asked me if I liked Prosciutto, I answered yes but not this style.
She asked again if I was sure I didn't want to take it. ü§Ø
I paid and left.
Very disappointed in my dining experience tbh.
Meh! (by Nicci Riley) [5 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Everytime i visit South Australia it's a must for me to visit Claire and have lunch at this gorgeous little restraunt.
I always get the prosciutto pizza it's divine and super filling. My friend had the chicken parmigiana, which was loaded she really enjoyed it, the only thing I would say is that is because there was so much ham, it needed to be left in the oven a little bit longer as some of the ham was cold.
The staff were really lovely and when I enquired about the glass of wine I had, they let me know that they had a bottle I could purchase.
I will be back and maybe I'll try something different next time. (by Rebecca Kucler) [5 months ago] | Review 4: 3 stars - Friendly service over the phone and at the front counter when ordering 2 pizzas for takeaway.
We chose BBQ Chicken and Meat lovers, the pizzas were well loaded with toppings and at $16 each to takeaway the value is amazing.
Sadly the Meat Lovers was very watery. Not sure if this came from the cheese or the tomato sauce, but it soaked through the crust and into the box below. This meant that no toppings stayed on the pizza because it was so limp. It did taste good though.
The BBQ Chicken wasn't quite as wet as the Meat lovers.
Both crusts (round the outside) were fantastic though! If the pizzas weren't as watery, this would be 6 stars. (by Dan M) [9 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Dinner for two tonight and we weren't disappointed,  lovely casual atmosphere and friendly helpful staff. The Oysters Kilpatrick for starters were delicious and the spaghetti carbonara and lamb shank for mains was cooked to perfection! The cocktails went down very nicely aswell and the desserts were so good, highly recommended! (by kirsty garnaut) [5 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Ask about the half price special on special drinks. Take away pizzas are cheaper than dine in pizza. Great food at reasonable prices. They also have an upstairs area you can book PLUS they have an Elevator to check it out. God Bless You guys. ü§© #BrucesPlanet (by Bruce Wayne Birch) [a year ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - A very nice restaurant and very nice pizza. I asked for extra chilli üå∂ and they included heaps of fresh chilli and brought me chilli oil to add too, perfect! (by Richard Jagger) [7 months ago] | Review 8: 4 stars - Stopped for lunch on the way to the mid North.
First time at the new location...great atmosphere and decor
Great service with friendly attentive staff
Shared a gluten free pizza which was a bit soft and dough like. I know it's not easy getting a good gluten free base but this one was not to my liking.  Topping of duck and fresh rocket with crushed walnuts and pear was superb.
The chips were amazing...crisp ,salty goodness.
Would be 5 star if not for that gluten free base.
Highly recommended (by Andrew Czuchwicki) [4 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Went in for lunch today & left wanting more. Hubby & I ordered the margarita pizzaüçï & the beef wagyu burgerüçî even the chips were fabulous. Seriously, the best we've had in a very long time. Also, the decor is stunning with black painted walls & exposed brick throughout. Even their toilets were stunning (see pic). We will be back! ‚Ä¶ (by Missy A Eby) [2 years ago] | Review 10: 3 stars - Went there for mothers day lunch. The meal was amazing but that's where it definitely ends. Service was disappointing, the young girl reached over another family member to take finished plates, bumping them as they were putting food in there mouth. We ordered 2 glasses of wine, the glass came out with lipstick marks around the rims. We were then served dessert and a family member was given a very dirty spoon.
Unfortunately they need to train their staff customer service skills and how to wash (by It's Me) [3 months ago]

name: Clare Island Community Centre Anchor Bar& Bistro
address: Clare Island, Capnagower, Westport, Co. Mayo, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 4 stars - We were camping on the island. The rain was pretty relentless so we headed to the community centre bar and restaurant. Spent a very pleasant evening having dinner & drinks. The band came on around 10pm and the place was hopping til 0200h. Good food & nice pints! (by Donnchadh Kilgallon) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Great food! Also, the view sitting outside isnt so bad either. If you visit Clare Island, get past the little bistro right off the pier, and head to The Anchor Bar located at the community center. (by Casey Pierce) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 4 stars - This a great spot. Lovely bar and the food was good. We hit a busy time during the holidays and the place was packed. The kitchen was suffering with demand, and orders were mixed up and quite delayed. However the girls were doing their best and on another day it would have been great. Clean toilets and enough seating inside and out. (by Phil OShea) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Great food, limited but nice, very friendly staff and service, very attentive. Would definitely visit again. Planning on coming back to stay the night.  Child friendly. (by Debbie Pennill) [3 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Only bar on the Island. Didn't eat but the food looked very tasty. Guinness was excellent and not overly expensive (by Aidan Markey) [a year ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Excellent
Group of 10 of us enjoyed our time in your centre as we spent few hours in the bar yesterday Thank you (by Caitriona Tiernan) [2 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - First class service serve with a smile traditional ales beautiful scenery. The perfect afternoon on a sunny day (by Andrew Hall) [4 months ago] | Review 8: 4 stars - The main place on the island and this t8me I was very impressed.
Staff numbers have improved and the fish and chips were excellent.
The Tuesday night music was very good as were the p8nts. (by Derry Hallinan) [Edited a month ago] | Review 9: 4 stars - On my visit to the Island called in for a bite to eat.  Tasty and reasonable priced (by ian draper) [3 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - We have had many a fine afternoon of food and a few drinks here over the last few summers. Always very welcoming and really friendly service and no problem for them to deal with big family orders. Great location just up from the beach. The food is always good quality pub food and never had a long wait for it. Maureen and Sharon and the team there do a great job of creating a relaxed friendly atmosphere and will always do as much as they can to help you enjoy your time there. (by Neil O'Shea) [2 years ago]

name: SOUL - French Fine Dine
reviews:
Review 1: 1 star - Horrible food, they don't even have a clear menu. Their prices were exorbitant.
They gave an anniversary discount which was ridiculously lower than the easy diner one, and really wonder why the so called chef has an attitude

Edit: was interesting to see the generic reply saying that they couldn't find my name in records and my review might not have been genuine. Later they had to edit their reply after uploading pictures.
I have been to Europe a couple of times and I know what European flavors are like, FYI, forget discount, would not dine at your place even for free.
I wish negative feedback can be accepted in a better way rather than trying to be assertive. Even Michelin rated
restaurants accept criticism at the end of the day. (by Preeti) [Edited a year ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Great authentic french food experience. Be aware that you get a fine dining experience. not for people who are looking for a quick bite or take out.
Food: It is authentic, so don‚Äôt expect garam masala or red mirchi or biryani. if you have ever tried food in europe, you will recognise the taste and you will love it.
Service: Fresh food takes time to make and it‚Äôs more like a personal service experience. Don‚Äôt expect waiters running around all the time. but when you need them they are right there.
Ambience: Hyderabad is used to much more rich interiors than this restaurant. I wish it was in a more earthly interior experience but none the less you will love the food.

Price: Don‚Äôt expect Paradise biryani prices here. it would cost you $$$$, but you will enjoy your meal.

I strongly recommend taking your spouse/girl friend/boyfriend or friends who would enjoy a multi course meal and take their time to enjoy their dinner.

I will definitely go back for my next dinner out. (by Sukesh Reddy) [a year ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - SOUL Fine Dine by The Butler is a (European restaurant) sets a high standard for its food quality and ensures that guests receive the same quality with every meal.

We had a four course meal and Mr.Chandan the owner of the restaurant is a absolutely amazing person how was with us and made sure we had each and everything accordingly our taste.

I have to say, I enjoyed every single bite of the meal.

I would personally like to appreciate the staff and the chef who was very friendly and made sure we were comfortable environmentally and taste wise.

Do yourself a favor and visit this lovely restaurant which has a authentic European taste in each and every bite of its dish in the menu. (by Sheema Siddique) [2 years ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Soul fine fine has got a great vibe and it has great ambience and food is very specified and authentic proper European food..!!! I have tasted many items for the first time and literally enjoyed the taste..!! If someone looking for premium places in and around Gachibowli this is the perfect go to..!!! Great place to take your US and European leads too when they are in India..!! Note : Reserve a table before the visit is always recommended..!!!! I loved their carrot soup and sweetcorn soup including desserts‚Ä¶!!! (by sannithi sukavya) [2 years ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Recently got a chance to dine in here and taste the authentic european cuisine ever in Hyderabad. This place has a royal fine dine setup which is simply rich and classy. I was highly impressed with the interiors and the luminosity of this place. A perfect place for dinner dates. Mr. Chandan, the owner of this place was a perfect host and guided us through all our dishes. üòä

We started off with the delicious soup called Creme of Asparagus which was simply rich, creamy and had a blast full of perfect flavours. Highly impressed with this one. Must try for sure. ü§©

For salad we had Poached apple with blue goat cheese which was no doubt very delectable with the finest of ingredients. The sharp flavours of the goat cheese were simply on point. It really went well with the apple slices.

For the antipasto we did have two very great dishes. The Quiche de poulet being my favorite one. This was the finest and most yummiest quiche I ever had. The perfect tart with the right amount of crumble outside and cheesiest inside. Had it warm to feel the best savoury flavours of chicken with cheese and seasonings. A must try for sure. ü§© The second appetizer Prawn in jalape√±o drip was quite decent. It could have had the right amount of seasonings added, but otherwise it was surely a great starter.

For the main course I had Greek Yamista - Chicken. This dish is generally made with tomatoes or bell peppers stuffed with minced meat, veggies, cheese etc. and then baked well. I had the bell peppers one which was quite an experience. This was very fulfilling dish which lifted my mood for sure. The flavours were great and I could smell the finest quality ingredients.üòç

All the ingredients used in their kitchen are outsourced and are imported premium in quality. Also a special mention to the very patient staff, they were very well behaved and courteous. üòä

We ended our day with two of the finest desserts. Surprisingly desserts were too good. The first dessert Coffee cake was an experience in itself.  You would definitely love the dark flavours if you are a coffee lover. A very balanced dessert. üòç Colors of nature was my persp favourite dessert. Trust me it was extraordinary. Highly recommend it to everyone. A very subtle and mild one, perfect for people who are not having a sweet tooth.

I had an overall amazing experience. A must visit and worth every penny spent with your loved ones. This place will definitely make you feel special and give you the best fine dining experience. Make your reservation now and do satisfy your soul. üòä (by Ritwika Nandini Dash) [2 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - If you are someone who wants to experience authentic western culinary then you definitely must visit Soul Fine Dine.

It‚Äôs a unique place which requires pre booking and each dish is prepared fresh after the order and customised as per one‚Äôs taste. The interior is quite classy and elegant and you get to spend quality time with your family/loved one over food.

We enjoyed their Carrot Celery Soup and Shitcan MushroomSoup which is absolutely creamy and thick. In appetizers we went with veg and chicken Quiche. It‚Äôs completely soft, buttery with a pastry crust. Do try if you love French dishes. Then came crispy chicken in Jalape√±o Dip absolutely crunchy and soft in the inside.

In main course we went ahead with Gratin Chicken, Chicken with mushroom, St Peter‚Äôs Fish in Cayenne and lastly Roasted Chicken in Cayenne. Gratin Chicken is a must try!

Colors of nature is out of the world. Along with other desserts like Soul‚Äôs chocolate Medley and Italian Coffee Cake had strong flavours of cocoa and coffee.

Overall a best experience to spend with loved ones and feel special. (by Leher Sadhnani) [Edited 2 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - The place is Well maintained with beautiful ambience. A rooftop dining experience with pleasant music makes your soul peaceful.
The food was amazing, great hospitality. An impressive four-course menu, that comprises of International cuisine. I strongly recommend to try their amazing desserts. (by Thindam daa) [2 years ago] | Review 8: 4 stars - Customer Service is Exceppppptional!

Food is great.

Had cream of mushroom soup and Mediterranean salad.
Staff were too good and made sure to take feedback of food and also helped us in zeroing on items based on our preferences. (by Lalita Tims) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Went for dinner for my husband‚Äôs birthday. The ambience is top notch. The decoration of flowers, candles, balloons is great and it felt so special. The food was also very good and the service was amazing. One female waitress was too good. She took pics of us whenever we asked with a smile on her face. The receiving is very good. Prawns in jalape√±o, Sea bass in lemon herb sauce, Chicken pasta alfredo, chocolate meltdown were the dishes and they were great. This place is great for someone celebrating an occasion or want to surprise loved ones. There is also menu printed to the occasion. All of this was possible as Chandan ji coordinated with me in selecting the dishes and arranging all of these things. Overall it‚Äôs a great experience. (by Tejaswini Uttarkar) [2 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - I recently had the pleasure of dining at a beautiful fine dining at the SOUL fine dine.

The soup was a highlight for me, as it was rich and flavorful, with a depth of taste that left me wanting more. The main course was equally impressive, with perfectly cooked meat that were prepared to perfection.

But the real star of the show was the dessert. It was a work of art, both in terms of presentation and flavor. The flavors were perfectly balanced, and the texture was divine.

Overall, it was an amazing dining experience. The ambiance was impeccable. I highly recommend this beautiful fine dining to anyone looking for a special evening out. (by Ajith Gonamanda) [2 years ago]

name: Tubridy's Bar & Restaurant
address: Main St, Doonbeg, Co. Clare, V15 T273, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - The Hake dish with the accompanying items was one of the best and most flavorful dishes I have ever had.  My wife had the chicken dish which was amazing also! The servers were all very pleasant! Much more than we expected! The desserts were off the charts fresh and tasty! For sure recommend! (by Shannon Nordstrom) [a week ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Best meal we have had in a long time. Food was cooked to perfection and the presentation along with the service was top notch.
Special of the day, sole with scallops and prawn accompanied by beurre blanc sauce was so good. Partner had steak requested rare and it was served just so. Faultless! (by Eileen Fitzgerald) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Food was really tasty and well worth the visit. A nice touch was a vegetable soup try it and post your comments on it.
The children‚Äôs menu has fish fingers and chips BUT it is fresh white fish that I would have loved to eat.
Menu is really tasteful and well worth a visit. (by Ronan Murphy) [4 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Heard so much about this place that I booked it with work colleagues and I‚Äôm so glad I did. It is 100% worth the drive and the Hype! The food was out of this world, everyone of us said Oh my God atleast twice I cannot recommend them enough and I will definitely return. My only regret is not coming here sooner! (by Lynda Clancy) [6 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Really great place, fantastic food and friendly staff. Can't recommend it enough. It's top class. We had a three course meal and each course was incredible. (by John) [2 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - We'd been talking about visiting Tubridy's for some time now, and it did not disappoint.
Fabulous meals, and a fabulous evening had by us all.
Thanks. (by Kevin O'Malley) [4 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Lively bar and elegant restaurant.
The staff are exceptionally friendly and accommodating.
The cuisine is exquisite.
I have a gluten intolerance and 90% of the menu could be modified to accommodate my dietary restriction.
For the starter, I had crab claws in a delectable sauce.
The main course was the special, which was wild halibut with a divine sauce and perfectly creamed potatoes.
For dessert, I enjoyed a green apple mousse that was as visually stunning as it was delicious.
I will definitely return. (by Michael Webb) [a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Just had maybe the best meal ever. The pan fried hake is gorgeous. The different tastes were outstanding. Well done to the chef. (by Helen Livingstone) [3 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Went out here for dinner. .5 in our group. It‚Äôs the first time ever I heard everyone at the table including myself say OMG at least 20 times throughout the meal. Best meal we‚Äôve had in years. And the Guinness was top notch also. (by Oisin O) [9 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Add to your list of 5 star eateries in Ireland. Amazing fish n chips. All the condiments and break baskets.  Lovely service. (by Corey Rayner) [5 days ago]

name: JJ Ruddles Bar & Restaurant
address: Shannon Airport, Rineanna South, Shannon, Co. Clare, V14 EE06, Ireland
reviews: Review 1: 3 stars - The pizza menu is really good, very tasty pizzas. However, there's zero gluten free options so for that, you're getting crisps from the newsagents next door instead. If you're getting a later flight don't count on the airport for food unless you can have pizza! (by Eamon Brett) [a month ago] | Review 2: 3 stars - We only ordered a hot chocolate and a latte, but both were not good. Nice presentation of the establishment, but drinks lacked flavor. (by Janet Saucedo) [6 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Beautiful airport restaurant ! Staff is very efficient. We only had coffee and it was great (by Galina Zhivkova) [4 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Lovely place for food after you've landed or before security when taking off. Also available if you're not flying if you are waiting to pick up someone. We came before dinner starts but we asked if we could order off the dinner menu and there was no question asked! I had a delicious pizza while my companion had a burger and chips! Very speedy service with a delicious taste of home before we took off. Highly recommended! (by Cian O'Connell (Cian O)) [Edited 2 years ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - The service was timely. I ordered fish and chips and it was excellent and quite a large serving. No complaints. (by Conor O'Donoghue) [a year ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - A hidden diamond üíé of a restaurant in Shannon. Food was amazing, freshly made in front of you. Great service and friendly staff. If you have extra time before your flight, this restaurant is a must visit. (by Avni Sondagar) [2 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - THE BEST ITALIAN PIZZA EVER! I am Italian and when I eat pizza here I feel home! DEBBY is the best, very polite, kind and helpful person! Her pizza is supreme, 5 stars üåüüåüüåüüåüüåü (by Cristian Pedroni) [a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Considering the quality of food and drinks, the price is reasonable. There was also have indoor and outdoor seating, suitable for groups, families and children. Servers are also great and always efficient, happy and polite. (by toft A) [Edited 2 years ago] | Review 9: 1 star - With only here to come to before bag drop we sat down asked for menus, looking for drinks but given food menus. One decided to order food, went to bar to order 4 drinks & a hotdog charged nearly 50 euros on card then someone came to tell us kitchen closed refunded in euros (considering we here leaving) & nothing said when menus given or while ordering & paying. Take away bit was open so ordered a toasted sandwich & a panini charged 18 euros for it, stone cold & full of grease, a stale sandwich from whsmiths is better value (by Clare Nugent) [4 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - The fish and chips here are a catch üêü  The prosciutto pizza is with sticking aRound for! üòã And they've lovely pints too üê¶‚Äç‚¨õ (by Danny Finn) [a week ago]

name: Danny Mac's
address: Main St, Dough, Lahinch, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - We had such a great meal at Danny Mac‚Äôs! The lamb shank was tender and full of flavor, the grilled fish was fresh and perfectly cooked, and we finished with an apple crumble that was warm, comforting, and absolutely delicious. To top it all off, the Irish coffee was one of the best we‚Äôve ever had: rich, smooth, and the perfect ending to the meal. The service was friendly and welcoming, and the atmosphere had that cozy, authentic Irish charm. Highly recommend stopping here if you‚Äôre in the area! (by Dayane L.) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - We stopped in for breakfast this morning after checking out of our accommodations. We were told to stop at Danny Mac‚Äôs for a traditional breakfast. We were not disappointed. We ordered two of the Surfers Breakfasts and added bacon. The plate was delicious and the perfect portion. Great friendly service. Great atmosphere. The servers one names of so many people stopping in. This is the perfect place to grab a bite! (by Patrick Flood) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 4 stars - Great little spot for breakfast , lunch or dinner. Unfussy casual atmosphere with filling food and full bar.
Enjoyed the chicken curry and on another occasion had breakfast.
Kids have their own menu and loved the fish!
Well worth a visit. (by Loyes Diamonds) [3 months ago] | Review 4: 4 stars - For a quick dinner this is a very nice place. The food is good and fast prepared and served. We really enjoyed the chicken curry, chicken satay and beefburger.
The Chicken Goujons was tasting if fried in the oil for the fish and not as expected.
The chicken curry is served with rice and over de top also with Fries, who will end up cold when I have finished the curry with rice. Only rice will do. (by Marco Vronik) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Delicious food ‚Äì especially the seafood and the huge portion of fish & chips. The baked potatoes were amazing! Friendly staff. Highly recommended! (by Emi 1111111) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Came by for a quick lunch. Seated rightaway. Service and food was served promptly. Chicken kiev was really good. Not much for the ribs. To drenched in the sweet sauce to my liking. Would prefer the classic ribs sauce or to separate the sauce. Overall an okay experience (by niken ariani) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - After the visit of the cliff of moher during the afternoon, we was looking for a bar/restaurant in the little town near to the cliff.
We found this amazing place, good atmosphere, professional service, the food was plentiful, we took the traditional fish and chips and the beef burger absolutely gorgeous !

I recommend this place for everyone wanna have a break after the walk around the cliff. (by Stocker Thomas) [5 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - This place is amazing.  The food is so DELICIOUS, and the picture of the empty plate is the evidence that it was all eaten. I loved the food, and the portion was so generous.  We went in, and all the tables were seated, but the kind owner invited us to eat at the bar section. He refused to let us go away hungry. The lovely waitress brought water immediately and she was so kind and friendly.  Lovely lady. We had  a lovely chat with the owner, who was so friendly and welcoming.  The food came in a good time.  The chicken dish was amazing, and it came with three sides (salad, chips, and coleslaw). We had lovely zero alcohol beer and Coke. My sister ordered Caesar salad, and it was so nice and fresh.  The prices were very reasonable and the food quality was really high. The place is so clean.  I highly recommend this place.  After we had our food, we enjoyed a lovely walk by the sea. (by Guitar Lady) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Food was quite good (my only note was that there were very few mushrooms in the chicken and mushroom vol au vents). The chowder was fantastic. There‚Äôs not a ton of sitting though, so be prepared to wait 20-30 min during busy hours. The servers were great and helped speed along the process as we waited for a table to open up. (by Rachel Bacon) [a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Extremly cozy little place, fast and kind service. We were here before noon and only had a coffe and scone which was still warm when they brought it out. The breakfast menu is short but has everything you would want, although i didnt try them they looked delicious and very irish (by Panni P√°link√°s) [a week ago]

name: LANA Ennis (O'Connell Street) Asian Street Food
address: 16 O'Connell Street, Clonroad Beg, Ennis, Co. Clare, V95 NX32, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 4 stars - Street Asian food with base quality and teens environment. 2 course deal of 23‚Ç¨ is reasonable and fair considering the big portions which are served.
I liked a lot the chicken curry with cashews, the sweet & sour chicken and satay skewers. Didn‚Äôt like the fried calamari or the duck rolls..
I recommend for value for money purposes the visit and try it ! (by Vas Vas) [a year ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Happened upon this place as we were driving from Dingle to Lahinch. We were pleasantly surprised by the delicious food and great prices. After eating lots of pub food throughout our trip in Ireland, it was refreshing to have some different flavours. (by Gabrielle Tayag) [a year ago] | Review 3: 2 stars - The rumors are true I guess.

Generally poor experience from whenever I have gone here.
Compared to the location on the Gort road there is a huge decline in food consistency and service.
Both times I've been forgotten at the table for ordering and had poorly made Green Tea served shockingly late at the end of my meal when I can't really drink it.

I would highly recommend the location on the gort road over this, both times I've had a poor experience which has left me miffed to say the least having to pay. (by Noah Clare) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Excellent street food!
In our travels through Ireland, we‚Äôve often found it hard to experience gluten free food with spice. Not spicy, but full of spices. Our experience at LANA was quite the opposite. My daughter and I had Pad Thai with prawns and chicken as well as a crispy chicken with chili. They had gluten free soy sauce and an array of dishes for those with celiac. It was a bit of a bus ride but well worth it. And there was gluten free Italian food across the street as well. Such a find. (by Dale Huntington) [3 years ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - I saw someone walk out with a spicy box and I told my wife I need to get one because I was craving fries.  My wife looked at me and thought I was crazy because she thought I would be disappointed especially when most of their clients on a Friday afternoon is a bunch of teeny boppers.  i went in to order one among a throng (at least 50) of screaming 12-16 year olds.  It was maddening and chaotic.  The inside was very well decorated especially a wall art with expertly arranged bowls.  I appreciate the staff getting me food in under 10 minutes and handled all these loud young adults with expertise and professionalism.  It was admirable.  I appreciate the spicy box for what it is.  A perfect execution of a fast food dish with fries, fried chicken, and some vegetable garnishes slathered in a soy/thai chili sauce (wife thinks it was light Sichuan).  It was decent.  Appreciate you brightening our day. (by Chino Leong) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Got into this place randomly. Ordered chicken tom yum soup, chicken chow mein and fried dumplings. Enjoyed each of them. Excellent taste, hot food, great portion sizes, great service. Great find I Ennis, also Lana as a restaurant is a great find. (by Arjun Pakrashi) [2 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Like all the lana restaurants I've visited all very good and all do exactly the same. The staff was very nice in this one too as the lad that was serving us was so polite and friendly. He was saying he does security in the town so I want to say a special well done to him, he made a quite Monday night a bit more enjoyable with his good polite manner (by Padraig McGuire (BusManPaddy)) [2 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Authentic taste .. good behaviour staffs.. luv the spice bag üòã (by Anand Nair) [11 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Excellent thai fusion place! Lovely decor and the food was fantastic. Make sure to leave with your free ice cream. (by Melissa L) [6 years ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - Lanas was very nice went on a staurday and wad very quote food gooand staff were so nice only thing is it was a bit dark in there but 10/10 would go again (by Jasmine Turner) [4 months ago]

name: Goosers Bar & Eating House
address: Ballina, Co. Tipperary, V94 R678, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - We stopped here for a late lunch after hiking in the area. It quickly turned into an early dinner because the menu was quite appetising.
We ordered chicken wings to share for a starter. For main I had the day's special mussels and prawns in a tomato creamy sauce and my husband had the traditional fish and chips. And for dessert we had pear and almond tart and brownie.
While all of the dishes were tasty, the star of the meal was my main. The seafood was cooked in the most amazing sauce, it tasted very homemade. And all the food had an impeccable presentation.
The service was second to none, all the staff was friendly and polite without being too intrusive. They brought out 2 natural treats for our dog and filled the water bowl for her too. We dined outside on the terrace, but I asked and they dogs are welcome inside too. They have a dedicated dining room where people can dine with their pets.
We will definitely be stopping there again when in the area. (by Elena Tozlovanu) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - Tasty food, beautiful setting, great staff.  Highly recommend.  Only gave 4 out of 5 stars as there was a mistake with my gluten free dish, but the staff were very good overall, the food was excellent and we‚Äôd happily return here again. We‚Äôd particularly recommend the duck and the fillet steak (by Denise Boland) [5 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - What a great find! Everything was perfect after a long day exploring, hiking. To fall upon this place, was the perfect end to a perfect day! Food very varied,  great choice, and very reasonably priced. Staff very helpful and attentive. A must visit for everyone, anyone passing through this beautiful place! (by Gary Peiper) [6 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Really good food, bit on the pricey side but when it's good you don't mind and this was excellent.
Perfect end to a day installing stretch tents for Stretch Tents Ireland (by Jack Smiles) [a month ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - three years ago I had lunch in this restaurant and it was very tasty, now I'm back and I can definitely say that it's very tasty here) (by irina koval) [2 months ago] | Review 6: 4 stars - The food was great. It‚Äôs recommended to book your table in advance. (by Sibeesh Venu) [3 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Food was amazing, definitely one of the best chowders we ever had. We had the seafood hotpot, p√¢t√© and the chowder. What drove me to write a review however was the amazing staff today on Sunday night. The service was impeccable and the girls were extremely kind and helpful. Definitely recommend and will for sure be coming back! (by Klara Poliakova) [a month ago] | Review 8: 4 stars - A lot of effort has been put into the new Goosers , portion size has improved from when they opened first. Food has got a lot better. The house specials are really nice. (by John Griffin) [Edited 6 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - ABSOLUTELY STUNNING!! Staff and front house went out of their way to seat and serve us!
