Such lovely lovely people!! Food was slow but they were busy and they are not magicians! But was absolutely stunning!! Nearly open 4 weeks and they are all doing their best to provide a fantastic service in their new surrounding! Probably the nicest meal I have ever had! Will 1 million percent be dining here again! Front of house so lovely and a girl with red hair was serving us and she was brilliant! A blessing to Killaloe! Cannot fault a single thing! Nicest mash spud I ever hadüòç (by Sophie Green) [a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Managed to get a walk in on a very busy BH weekend. Staff are great, service good but not rushed. Food was excellent and well priced. Tried to get in again ( we were there unexpectedly) but it was too busy, so book ahead. Good vibes there too! (by Barry Ryan) [a month ago]

name: Zest Cafe
address: 260 Main N Rd, Clare SA 5453, Australia
service_options: Just Julies Cafe Takeaway ¬∑ 4.4 stars ¬∑ 117 reviews ¬∑ Cafe
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Fantastic cafe, the food is perfect, friendly staff and great coffee, we had take away coffee, and breakfast/ brunch there. Best in Clare. The staff remembered our orders after our first visit. Perfection.  We will definitely return and highly recommend to anyone (by Timothy Chapman) [a week ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Great food, big breakfast is huge and mushroom üçÑ great.
I had  eggs, Benedict, which is good.
The wife had pancakes ü•û with Nutella and strawberries üçì üòã yum yum.
And friend had quiche with salad, said it was lovely üòç.
Always good food. (by dh716574) [6 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Nice family run cafe. Very accommodating. Good food, reasonable prices.
Welcoming. (by Tullamore Wolf) [a month ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Some breakfast choices with a twist! We haven‚Äôt been here for a while. It was fine before, but we think it‚Äôs even better now with traditional breakfast and lunch choices, but we tried a breakfast with an Indian twist and only $23. It was awesome! Thanks Zest! (by Stephen Brenecki) [3 weeks ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - This place was so good for breakfast, that we came 2 mornings in a row here. The staff were super friendly, even though they were busy. We sat inside both mornings due to the cold Clare weather, but outside looked nice to sit at also. All orders were spot on both mornings. Will come again when in the area. (by Rob) [3 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - We stopped in for brunch two days in a row because we were so impressed with the food! The big breakfast is delicious and a generous serve, the Brekkie Crumble special was incredible, and their smoothies are fresh and full of flavour! The staff were lovely and we are looking forward to coming back the next time we're in Clare. (by Jess & Matthew) [10 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Extensive menu options with an impressive puppa-chino (whipped cream and doggie biscuit). Generous food portions and tasty meals.
Lovely outdoor dining options.
Great find in Clare- we definitely will be back! (by M K) [a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Had the biggest all day breakfast...sausage, bacon, mushrooms, eggs, fried tomatoes,  beautiful crusty bread. And I had the pancakes as well. Meals were massive and delicious and service was quick and polite. Thank you. (by helen rudiger) [4 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Delicious coffee and eggs florentine was amazing. Beautiful presentation carrot cake was moist and generous portion - lovely staff - 5 out of 5 üòä (by Karen White) [a month ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Best coffee in ages, poached eggs perfect, bacon yummy. One slight error and they apologised and corrected immediately without fuss. Great service!
Definitely worth stopping here. (by Andrew Macquart) [11 months ago]

name: Top of the hill Restaurant
address: 5 Guilford St, Clare SA 5453, Australia

name: Falls Hotel & Spa
reviews: Review 1: None - We stayed for three nights at this lovely hotel whilst on an 'Ireland's Coast to Coast' holiday. Great spacious bedroom, a little chilly at night as we could not work the heating! The beds were really comfortable and rooms were clean. The ‚Ä¶ (by Wendz11) | Review 2: None - Just back from a superb few days at this hotel. It's located in beautiful grounds off Ennistymon's Main Street and has commanding views over the town. The staff are friendly and helpful and there is a lovely vibe about the place, typified ‚Ä¶ (by Lesfingal) | Review 3: None - Having stayed here many times, we returned for a short break.  The place is absolutely wonderful.  The setting close to the falls is so good, plenty of lovely walks alongside the river and falls.  The town of Ennistymon is lovely to walk ‚Ä¶ (by janiceamurray01) | Review 4: None - My husband and I just had a 3 night break in this large, friendly staffed, hotel in the interesting Clare town of Ennistymon. We really enjoyed our time there.  The staff were all so friendly and helpful; the food in both the bar and ‚Ä¶ (by 955maryo) | Review 5: None - We enjoyed an excellent two night stay at The Falls Hotel and Spa and received a very warm and friendly welcome from Amanda at reception. Our cozy bedroom was modern, with new furnishings and nice bedding. The only thing missing was a box ‚Ä¶ (by DeltaGirl88) | Review 6: None - Really lovely hotel, in a great location on the wild Atlantic way. If you want a boring shiney characterless Hilton then this might not be for you. It's been around for 500 years and extended/modernised over the years. Beautiful setting and you immediately feel so relaxed on arrival . Will definitely return. (by Ronan Trainor) | Review 7: None - Had an amazing Spa service while staying in a neighboring town. Spent an hour enjoying the outdoor jacuzzi, sauna and relaxation room before a seaweed soak and massage. Super professional and lovely spaces. Cannot wait to return! Shout out to Daisy for a fantastic massage. My back feels 100 times better. (by calla fogarty) | Review 8: None - Went to Ennistymon with my spicy wife for our anniversary. Fantastic staff, food was excellent,  room was clean and the grounds were picturesque. But the best thing was the massages we got in the spa. I got mine from Luba, and she mashed me into a pulp. It was amazing, I was laughing for a finish. It was so relaxing. Really good üëç ‚Ä¶ (by doublem380) | Review 9: None - We had booked a couple of stops in west of Ireland and when we arrived at hotel  early afternoon the room was ready. Very spacious with great views over river the large bathroom was a nice bonus. We had food in bar on both nights and second ‚Ä¶ (by JimmyPDublin16) | Review 10: None - Excellent food, really well furnished bedrooms which were very spacious, very comfortable beds, great showers ,lovely spa area,  fantastic staff who were warm, friendly and most helpful. This was my second time to stay in this hotel this ‚Ä¶ (by gormlaighg)

name: The Old Lodge Gastro Pub
address: Ballycasey, Ballycasey More, Shannon, Co. Clare, V14 A336, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Today, we enjoyed a wonderful lunch at this restaurant! I'd like to express a huge thank you to the chef for the excellent dishes, especially the beef, which was simply amazing! And the presentation of each dish was also top-notch. We'll definitely be back again! (by –ê–Ω–Ω–∞ –°–∫–∞—á–µ–∫) [4 months ago] | Review 2: 2 stars - We booked a table for 4 people at this restaurant. Our friends were here before and said that it was good.
Our orders were taken after a short length of time, we were told that the chicken would take 20 minutes, so we thought that was okay, we were served drinks while we waited for our meal,
When our meal came I was very disappointed with the small amount of food that was put before me, even though the food was lovely I was still hungry after I finished, one waitress asked if we would lick to see the desert menu and we said yes, she didn‚Äôt come back with it, we weren‚Äôt asked if we wanted more drinks or tea, we got tired of waiting and decided to leave, we found that the staff were not attentive and not friendly, it was just a job to them. (by Noel Chandler) [3 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Very impressed with the vegan menu at the Old Lodge Gastro Pub! We had the nachos (to start), the vegan burger, the vegan pasta salad and the orange pudding for dessert. Everything was great, we were especially excited to have options especially in a small place like Shannon. Definitely recommend to other vegans passing through.
The service was amazing as well, staff were very polite and happy to help. (by Lauryn Denby) [6 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Old Lodge Gastric Pub is a simple looking pub with a deception gastric element that is... very  good. The simply "Duck" starter on the menu is not only pretty in its presentation but very tasty and light. Duck on a bed of greens layered with firm pliable lentils and a creamy curry sauce, not over much, not over powering and the portion size was satisfying. *****
Chicken wings lightly battered, tossed in a tangy spicy, not to hot bbq sauce with a house made aoli garlic sauce. Just yummy.
The mains came  and the fish and chips, gluten-free batter was light buttery and a perfect match to the haddock. The dill sauce wS light had some vinegar, and lemon was the perfect company I on to the fish. I was a little confused by the other sauce, having tried it.
The tapas plate was sausages, chicken spicy wings, and fresh with dill and aoli sauce. All excellent. This is a gem in Shannon.
The service was excellent, and all servers were polite and attentive. Very helpful with the menu as I am gluten free all allergens were listed next to the dishes.
The atmosphere is relaxed with 80s- 90s music playing.  The decore is modern and goes well, not overpowering. Children are welcome here as well.

All excellent. This is a gem in Shannon. I am visiting and will return on my next visit. (by Pat Semi) [a year ago] | Review 5: 3 stars - Had a seperate vegan menu,  with 3 options for each course. Very unique to have that th is side of the country.

Got the nacho starter which was delicious but did not come with melted cheese. Servers didn't even tell us it was missing cheese nor tried to offer a substitution.

Got the burger.. which is a potato spinach burger, nice to have something different to plant meats so was happy with that. bun was subbed for another bun, again, without talking to us about it.

The orange chocolate cake was absolutely delicious! (by Arie A) [a year ago] | Review 6: 4 stars - The food was decent, worthy of a 3-star rating, but I couldn‚Äôt justify giving it a 4. I ordered the house special‚Äîlamb shank with mashed potatoes, gravy, and a side of carrots and turnips. The food arrived on time, which was a plus. However, the lamb was a bit tough, and while the shank looked substantial, there wasn‚Äôt as much meat as I‚Äôd expected. The portion size was reasonable, but the flavor could‚Äôve been more refined. Also got a Pino Grigio for 27‚Ç¨ have had better at much cheaper price.

For dessert, I had the apple crumble with custard and an apple tart. The portion sizes felt small for the price. The apple crumble, in particular, was disappointing‚Äîit was steaming hot in the middle and cold on the outside, clearly microwaved, and almost burnt my mouth.

Later, I ordered room service, which I‚Äôd rate around 6.5/10‚Äîconsistent with the restaurant experience.

Would I return to the restaurant if I weren‚Äôt staying at the hotel? Honestly, probably not. (by indraneel kotoki) [8 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - While on the way to west coast of Ireland we decided to stop at this place ... but it was a good decision... we had an awesome dinner and lovely ambience... the tiredness of driving was gone with the food... the staff was very helpful, smiling and cute... food was yummy... there's is big bar inside which we couldn't use because of the driving but lokks awesome and multiple choices for wines as well... will definitely go again (by Prajakta Todankar) [a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - I had the ravioli with basil sauce.  It was fabulous. My sister had the beef short ribs and she was delighted.  Delicious food and wonderful service.  Thank you Old Lodge. (by D D) [2 years ago] | Review 9: 2 stars - Ordered a veg stir fry with half & half and was served a chicken stir fry with rice. They were quick to fix it but what I got as veg stir fry was simply chicken pieces removed from earlier dish and added loads of sauce/oil. See the image, a small number of veggie are swimming in the pool of oil (or something similar) (by Mitul Chokshi) [3 years ago] | Review 10: 2 stars - Service / waitresses were quick and friendly but the food was really poor. For the price of 18‚Ç¨ for a burger: the bun was cheap and dry, the patty was a brick, that poor animal died twice.
Chicken tasted like frozen, heated in a microwave. (by CX GX) [5 months ago]

name: The Pantry Cafe/Bakery/
address: 39 O'Curry St, Dough, Kilkee, Co. Clare, V15 NH60, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Staff are so lovely, we got pancakes, coffee, juice and croissants.
Visited this cafe with my 6 year old niece, she was given a colouring page with crayons she could bring home!
Bathroom available. (by Niamh Keane) [5 months ago] | Review 2: 3 stars - Service was very mixed, not clear if I had to wait or sit and they would bring it down. We got the chicken sandwich, the goat cheese with added chicken, the OG and one of us made our own. The goats cheese was very sparse on the cheese and the OG was very skimpy on the meat. Food was brought out and the waiters didn‚Äôt know what the orders were. Overall overpriced including the coffee. I gave it 4 as there was a busker there who was quite good. (by Aisling Burke) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 2 stars - Disappointing
The slices of bread were too thick on the BLT and OG ( ham, cheese, tomato and onion). As a result the sandwiches did not melt well and were only lukewarm , with the " Considiine's" bread overpowering the contents, which was a shame as the ham was nice.  Even the bread lover left a third of his bread. It was nice and healthy that there was salad on the side but with no dressing the onions and green peppers were too sharp to finish  eating
The young staff were pleasant and working hard but overall a bit disorganised with lack of clear directions as another reviewer mentioned.
This was supposed to be brunch but will now actuallyhave to get lunch in some other town as we travel the beautiful west Clare coast. (by Siobhan O'Sullivan - Feeney) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - What can I say about The Pantry.  It has to be tried to be believed. Their food is out of this world. I have been ordering and eating from The Pantry since I was a kid. A little pricey, but in today's economy,  its to be expected. Please don't leave without trying The Carrot Cake. I've never eaten anything like it !! (by Fiona OShaughnessy) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Gorgeous food, self service, lovely coffee, very busy and good atmosphere (by Caroline Dullea) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Lovely cafe for fresh baked cakes and buns  a good selection of sandwiches and salad bowls. (by Mary Schmid) [a month ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Good breakfast, tasty and fast cooked, as we were in a bit of hurry. (by Sims S) [a month ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Best dessert in Ireland. Great service and worth to stop by. Order the Pavlova & fresh strawberries, you will not be disappointed. ‚Äò our family ordered 5 in a row‚Äô. Just delicious (by Jan von Yurt) [6 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Very recommended place. Strong and tasty doppio and cappuccino! (by Lemele) [2 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - A++.Very friendly staff. Delicious carrot cake, high quality coffee. Everything fresh and homemade. I highly recommend. (by Ewa) [2 years ago]

name: The Market Bar & Restaurant
address: Merchant's Square, Clonroad Beg, Ennis, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - This restaurant was fantastic! We stopped here on a tour and only had a short time to eat, but they had us in and out quickly without ever feeling rushed. They were amazing with food allergies‚Äîthere was even a designated gluten-free and dairy-free menu that could be customized. The staff were so friendly and helpful, and the food was outstanding. Highly recommend! (by R L) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - On a late trip from Dublin to Liscannor was looking for food. This little gem of a restaurant was getting ready to close but kindly offered to stay open and serve our family.  Food was really good, upscale pub fare. Clean, neat, restaurant with outdoor seating. (by Steve Fisher) [3 months ago] | Review 3: 4 stars - I went there with my mum for late lunch, it was very goof and the food came in a good time speed. We ordered carbonara and one portion of chips. It was good but the only thing I didn't like that one plate was full and the other wasn't,  there is no consistency in portion sizes. Also,  the chips portion was a bit smaller than usual,  but it was crispy and delicious.  The waitress was good and served us two large glasses of water with loads of ice. It was so refreshing for a hot day.  My overall experience is good and I will ho again. The carbonara was so good and we ordered one to take away. Also the garlic bread was good, it was on the perfect side, the size was good, and flavoured well. I would like to ho again and try more, the prices were also reasonable. (by Guitar Lady) [a year ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - We were on our way from the cliffs of Moher to Sligo on a Wednesday night when we found this little gem of a restaurant on the way. When we walked in there was only 2 other couples there and it remained that way for the entirety of our meal. The restuarant was nicely decorated and roomy. We were told by the kind server we can sit wherever. For drinks we ordered an Orchard Thieves and my partner ordered the special drink which was a Strawberry Gin Fizz. The speciality drink was delicious and an okay deal at 10 euros. Since being an Ireland, we have been trying all the fish and chips along our route. So of course we tried the fish and chips here. The food came out quickly and was hot. The fish and chips definitely were the best we have come across thus far since visiting Kilkenny, Limerick, and Mayo. The star of the meal was the lamb loin which was on dinner special that night at what we thought was 15.5 euros. The dish is one I would eat again and again if I could. It had cut crispy onions on top of lamb loin which was on top of a bed of mashed potatoes. On the side there were peas, stuffing, and pureed squash. It was all so delicious and we finished every last bite since we hadn't eaten since the morning. If I was staying in Ennis and not just passing through I would have gone back the next day for lunch. If you are in Ennis or passing through take time to stop here it is worth the time. (by Karina Pacchioni) [8 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - ü´ïü•£üçßüç∞   I love this restaurant and bar, it's just extraordinary... I think this is the best place in Ennis!
True, I underestimated its modest facade and often passed by it in the center of Ennis... But after I visited here for the first time  , this is my love forever. ü•∞
You can sit inside or outside, I love outside, with a cozy fence you are separated from the bustle of the city and at the same time you are in the very center.
Unlike huge portions in other restaurants, which I do not eat myself,  here the serving is very refined and at the same time everything is very tasty, beautiful, satisfying and appetizing!
Vegan and vegetarian menus are also available here. Dairy-free mango ice cream with warm apple crumble and a light cream sauce won my heart.  ‚ù§ I didn't even notice that the ice cream is dairy-free. An excellent combination of cold and warm may not appeal to your teeth, but the taste is excellent.
Served piping hot. Friendly staff, very pleasant place, I recommend!ü•Çüçæ (by Iryna Z) [2 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - I can‚Äôt say enough.  It‚Äôs a wonderful place.  Great food, great value, and great service.

The owner is very engaged, very personable, and just provides awesome service.

We ate here three times in 5 days.  Snack, breakfast, and late dinner. With the number of great options in the area, that says a lot!!! (by Judd Maroney) [3 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Had a tasty gluten free burger with rashers on it. The chips were also very good. My gluten free beer was awful but that‚Äôs par for the course and nobody‚Äôs fault. Very nice waitress. I would definitely go back. (by Dale Huntington) [3 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Had to leave a review for the level of quality service and food here. Myself and my partner went out for a meal and everything from start to finish went well. Credit to the servers there, so mannerly and friendly, and the food was excellent, with multiple veggie options. We each had cocktails, wine and 3 courses, all very satisfying and good value. Can't wait to go back :) (by Catherine Campion) [8 months ago] | Review 9: 4 stars - Very pleasant for lunch or dinner. Go hungry as the portions are HUGE! Staff polite & attentive without hovering over you. (by Iseult ‚ÄúIzzy‚Äù N√≠ Choitir) [Edited 3 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Amazing food, we loved the ribs,mussels and fish and chips. Friendly staff, nice atmosphere. (by Anita Horvath-Jakowicz) [2 years ago]

name: Bollywood Temple Indian Restaurant
address: Above Paddy Powers, Skycourt Shopping Centre, Tullyvarraga, Shannon, Co. Clare, V14 X433, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - I ordered delivery and the service was outstanding! There was a small issue with my order, but the restaurant handled it so quickly and professionally. They were polite, attentive, and went above and beyond to make sure everything was sorted. Truly amazing customer service
I‚Äôll definitely be ordering again! (by Christina) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - The food was good when compared to many other Indian restaurants in Ireland. The quantity is also decent enough. Easy to locate and have enough parking space. (by Shaadhanaa) [a year ago] | Review 3: 1 star - I had the worst experience at this restaurant, despite going there based on recommendations.
I ordered the Kolhapuri, but it was extremely spicy. I approached the manager and told him I wouldn‚Äôt be able to eat it due to the spice level. Instead of addressing the issue himself, he sent a staff member who told me, ‚ÄúIf you can‚Äôt eat that, you can order something else.‚Äù I asked for a replacement, but they refused to do so.
I also ordered Gulab Jamun and waited for 15 minutes. When I went to ask about my order, they told me the kitchen was closed.

I would not recommend this restaurant at all especially if you're Indian. It was the worst experience.

To make things worse, they still charged me the full amount for the dish, even though it wasn‚Äôt my fault. Honestly, if I were white, I believe they would have handled the situation differently. While I was told the kitchen was closed, they continued to serve another customer sitting at a nearby table.

Extremely disappointing service. (by Apurva Daphale) [a month ago] | Review 4: 1 star - Worst restaurant experience ever.
Zero stars.
Ordered a meal where we asked for no onions, low and behold there was half a bag of onions in it when we got it.
Rang and explained the issue, took 45 mins before they delivered another meal. Yet again, it arrived with a load of onions.
Naan breads were burnt and half cold.
Save yourself the hassle and avoid. (by Frank Nixon) [a month ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Highly recommend this restaurant. By far the best restaurant to get Indian food in the area. All of the parts of the dishes were excellent - I ordered the Egg Fried Rice, Garlic/Onion/Coriander Naan and Lamb Phall. All elements of the dishes were excellent with exceptional flavour. The spices of all dishes can be customised to order and the staff are very friendly.  The restaurant itself is a nice space and a luxury experience with a great selection of dishes and sides - would definitely recommend if in the area. (by Sean Kelly) [3 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Having grown up around the Balti houses in Birmingham, I can sometimes be a bit fussy about Indian food.
Any time spent walking near the restaurant in Shannon, you will be welcomed by faint smells of delicious Indian cuisine that will only make the mouth water... The House Balti dish was stunning! Full of flavour, texture and fabulous aroma.
Cannot recommend highly enough! (by Brock Lagan) [6 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Excellent customer service and super delicious authentic Indian Food. Love the ambience, food  and the service provided by the staff. We had come from India for a month and we ate everyday at Bollywood temple. Whether you are from India or not and loveto enjoy good food you must visit Bollywood Temple. Thank you for the great food.üôÇ (by Vimis Pagare) [3 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - The taste and quality of food is the best so far in Clare. We have been to Indian restaurants in Ennis and Limerick but still we find this place better than all of the other places. Taste is consistent most of the times but may vary a bit sometimes. Garlic naan is the most recommended. If you love spiciness, then Paneer kolhapuri is good choice, for mid spice, Paneer karahi and Methi chaman (even less spicer). I gave all the options in Paneer since I am vegetarian but you can get non-veg option as well. I hope this helps you make a choice. Thanks. (by Purvesh Gajjar) [3 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - I can rate this place as the best Indian restaurant in Clare. Both vegetarian and non vegetarian menu is awesome. I always go for the chicken kalimirich tandoori dish and methi chaman as a side. Good and ambience are really good and staff is very friendly. Must visit place of you are in Shannon. (by Abhijit Sinha) [7 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - My favourite Indian restaurant. Been going there for more than 10 years and always had a great service and top-class food. (by Amit) [Edited 3 months ago]

name: The Olive Tree Restaurant
address: 8 George's Quay, Englishtown, Limerick, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Wow, Wow, Wow!!!
Last night we had the tasting menu for the Flavours of Limerick culinary event, and it was just fantastic.

Each course was designed to have a Limerick Latin twist which was the theme of the night. The wines were expertly paired with each course and there was and explanation of this as you recorded each glass. The chef also came to explain the components of each dish which was a highlight of the evening.

Our favourite dish was the first course. Every element of the taco was bursting with flavour. But there has to be a mention for the ribeye which was cooked (medium rare) to perfection. We forgot to take a picture of desert as we dived in once it was explained to us.

The atmosphere was buzzing with all tables full and the DJ setting the scene. The music was never too loud but was a great addition.

The whole experience was excellent value at ‚Ç¨60 pp. If this was on every month I would come. (by Aine Smith) [2 weeks ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - No doubt the best restaurant in Limerick. We had an amazing anniversary here. I highly recommend the sea bass and the wild mushroom risotto. Staff is lovely and very helpful. My hubby had the Ratatouille moment (if you know you know!) when he tasted the fish. 10 out of 10! (by KP GuesWhoo) [5 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - We made reservations for an anniversary dinner and had a lovely, quiet table in a corner by the window. We loved the decor, it seems higher end aesthetic wise. The service was great. We had 3 different servers who were all attentive and friendly and professional. Food was great, somewhat Greek or middle eastern ish. A nice appetizer of hummus , baba ganoush with freshly made pitas. Wine was lovely as were the stemware, it makes a big difference. Dinner was pork belly and seafood risotto, both excellent üëå They even offered us a little treat of corn on a stick with a nice spice on them. A+++ 5 star. Oh yes and the restrooms were very clean, always a good sign. Loved it. (by Elk Hunter) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - First time at Olive tree this evening Amazimg atmosphere, food and cocktails. Gary and the rest of the staff were superb. Make sure you book a table at this place. You will not be disappointed. ps. The corn bread is unreal (by Paul MacDarby) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 4 stars - Small menu with limited options to choose from, I had the croquettes to start and the lasagne. My colleague had the pulled chicken and chips.
Food was very good and quite tasty.
Restaurant was busy but service was frequent and timely. (by MrDavid Kelleher) [7 months ago] | Review 6: 3 stars - The food was decent, though I expected a bit more seasoning and stronger flavors. We were seated very close to other couples even though the place was mostly empty, which took away from the atmosphere. Also, ‚Ç¨4.90 for a 1L bottle of water felt a little steep. Overall, an okay experience but not outstanding. (by Luis Teixeira) [4 weeks ago] | Review 7: 2 stars - The food is covered in sauces. The big disappointment was the pavlova that had frozen berries when is the season for fresh one? Never went to a place to get frozen berries in a desert. (by Andrei Vezniuc) [a month ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - We had a date night at Olive Tree and I wish we dined there sooner! Highly recommended! Great ambience and amazing service, the staff was very friendly and jovial.
The food and drinks were delicious. We started off with a lovely Reisling which I'd highly recommend if you are looking for a delicate and fresh wine. I got the Mushroom Risotto and my husband got the Carbonara, we also got a starter plate of fish and chips to share. For dessert, we got the Flan and the Tiramisu Martini. (by Shreya Salehittal) [9 months ago] | Review 9: 3 stars - Food was okay.

Even though restaurant was fairly empty our server was in a hurry to get our main courser orders. (by citycentertravel) [a month ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - 4 of us had an early dinner here Saturday evening. From the time we arrived nothing was too much trouble for the very friendly staff. The cocktails were excellent. Special mention for the Bramble. We selected tapas and our server gave excellent advice on how many dishes to order and helped us choose wine. All of the dishes were delicious. The apple crumble for dessert was also a winner. We are already looking forward to a return visit! (by Aine) [2 months ago]

name: Il Porcetto
address: 36 Main St, Loughrea, Co. Galway, H62 W283, Ireland
service_options: Sizzlers Loughrea Takeaway ¬∑ 4.5 stars ¬∑ 15 reviews ¬∑ Restaurant
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - The staff were very pleasant, the food was delicious, the interior is a little dark but the food more than makes up for that. (by Imelda Monahan) [a month ago] | Review 2: 3 stars - My pasta was good but my wife's pork balsamico was tough and dried. Not a good dish, in my opinion.  Clumsy favors; protein was low quality.

Nice folks. (by David Bantly) [5 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Food was great and staff were very nice. Portion was also good size. (by Shane Cullinane) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 4 stars - Food is very good and the atmosphere is pleasant. My only issue I would have is they do not take card payments & they have no online menu for ordering takeaway. The staff are always very nice (by Lorraine Reilly) [6 months ago] | Review 5: 2 stars - Service was shocking, waiting to order meals more than 30min. No kids menu.
Food was dry, not tasty.
Bad evening expierence. (by Laura Poci≈´tƒó) [3 weeks ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Beautiful food. Had a lovely family evening. Would recommend. (by Anna Doporto) [4 months ago] | Review 7: 4 stars - Nice outdoor seating with plenty of space! üîÜ We had the Carbonara and the Lasagne, both were nice but could have done with a bit more seasoning.ü•ó Staff were pleasant. üëè ‚Ä¶ (by Barry Caulfield) [4 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - 4.5 stars ‚≠ê. Lovely food, four very tasty meals. Dropped a star on service due to an error with one order but it was rectified satisfactorily. Pricing was reasonable (less than ‚Ç¨40 per person Inc drinks and tip) but it should be noted that payment is by cash only. (by Martin Dervan) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Great food and portions, decent service, and the owner's incredibly welcoming. The only downside is that you can only pay with cash. I always come here for special occasions. I recommend always booking ahead and opting for a space in the back. But the front of the restaurant is still enjoyable, thanks to the quality of the food and service. There are also a lot of cool souvenirs that add a unique atmosphere to the restaurant. (by Daniel Kotsulyak) [a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - The freshest pizza I have ever eaten! Highly recommend. (by Michael) [3 months ago]

name: The Ritz
reviews:
Review 1: None - We only had dinner there. Food was " okay" we ordered sausages and mash ( they were nice) and a stew ( meat was bad quality and hard, it lacked flavour).
Customer service was second to none . Young lady ( I think she was Polish) was absolutely amazing. She made everyone feel welcome and looked after. Thank you for making our visit pleasant experience. (by Karolina Cichosz) | Review 2: None - Excellent sea food chowder. I had garlic bread pretty good
. My partner had burger and chips. Very good burger. Staff were lovely. The Pint of Guinness was very good. I recommend. I proy will book in here on my next visit. The music is good .we only ate here..lovely atmosphere.. (by Karen Colgan) | Review 3: None - This is the 3rd hotel of our trip, 4 to go, and it is my favorite so far!  The room was SPOTLESS!  The whole place was SPOTLESS!  Older hotel, but so well kept. The bathroom has recently been remodeled and was lovely, plus they had ‚Ä¶ (by M7608OGdenisek) | Review 4: None - We only stopped to eat at their restaurant. We walked in at 7 pm and there were a few people there. The restaurant was nice, but the food was not all that great. We had the seafood showder, they should call it fish showder, nothing but fish in that soup, not that good either. Then we had the fish and fries. The fried fish had no taste whatsoever, a little salt goes a long way. Also, it was very expensive for what they are serving. I would not bother to stop there again. (by Ivette Ruelle) | Review 5: None - Nice place with good food and excellent service. The restaurant offers a good quality with reasonable prices. ‚Ç¨18 average. Water station for free use (with ice). (by Carles P) | Review 6: None - We visited this restaurant and ordered two Beef Burgers and one Salmon dish. While the burgers were okay in taste, the portions were surprisingly small. Unfortunately, the vegetables served with the salmon were overcooked and lacked flavor.

Additionally, we were surprised to find that a pint of water cost the same as a pint of cider or beer, which felt unreasonable. Overall, the experience was underwhelming, and we expected better value for the price. (by Kantiran) | Review 7: None - This hotel was perfect for our 1 night stay. It was perfectly positioned to visit the Cliffs of Moher. The hotel itself was nice for the price.  The hotel staff was super friendly and very accommodating.  Would definitely recommend. (by Nick Zuck) | Review 8: None - We arrived to the Ritz at 9pm on Sat night a group of 15 people from Limerick. We all ordered a  drink a round of 150‚Ç¨ upwards and sat with our drinks sat talking to 2 local couples the bar was relatively quiet the bar STAFF were lovely , ‚Ä¶ (by kellygav3) | Review 9: None - We arrived Saturday evening, bar was fairly empty so would think having 15 people arrive they would welcome us! We ordered our drinks and sat down.||A glass did break, but it was an accident. It was tipped and then smashed! Glass was very ‚Ä¶ (by Newport1981) | Review 10: None - We had a really upsetting experience at The Ritz in Lisdoonvarna. After paying ‚Ç¨150 for our very first round of drinks, we were suddenly asked to leave ‚Äî without any explanation. The bar was practically empty (maybe 5 people in total), and ‚Ä¶ (by J8533WTcaitlinh)

name: Sadak Chaap
address: XRWG+4GR, Lower Parel, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400013
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Good taste. Must try chaap tikka of different varieties. So good so yummy. One of the best vegan taste. (by Amol Kadam) [3 weeks ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - The food is delicious. Extremely surprised by how nice this place is. A great place to hang out with friends. Definitely recommend it it. A must visit. (by Devika k.) [a week ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Food  is so much delicious, staff is also polite.
Highly recommend!!!! (by Siddhi Kokate) [a week ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Vegan soya chap was very yumm. Highly recommended to vegetarian and vegan people. (by aishwarya rege) [3 weeks ago] | Review 5: 1 star - I chose this place because it‚Äôs advertised as vegetarian. However, they offered a separate non-veg menu and actually serve non-veg food. When I asked, the staff didn‚Äôt clarify or correct the misleading ‚Äúpure veg‚Äù claim. This is completely misleading and unfair to vegetarian customers who rely on accurate labeling. (by hardik jain) [2 days ago]

name: An Teach Bia
address: Main St, Ennistimon, Ennistymon, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 1 star - My wife and myself ordered 2 salads for our lunch .
The food was very good. However the waitress that served us asked if we would like brown bread with our food. When my wife was paying the bill she was charged 3 euros extra for the 2 very small portions of brown bread. They did not tell us that the bread was extra.
We were disappointed about this.
In future it should made clear the bread comes with an extra charge. (by Wayne Fennell) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Cute little cafe in a cute little town. The servers were so friendly and helpful. We got fish and chips, roasted chicken and a ham and cheese toasty. The food was amazing. Don't forget to wall down behind to see the cascade waterfall at the river. (by Susan Daye) [a year ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Great little place for lunch. You know you‚Äôre in a good place when two older patrons bump into each other and start up a conversation in Gaeilge. Plus there‚Äôs a tractor parked out front with the cars. (by Trace Palmer) [a year ago] | Review 4: 1 star - We were completely ignored as customers. We came in and waited at bar to order as I wasnt sure if they offer table service. The young lady at counter ignored as completely, she was picking up food to serve but she didnt even acknowledge us at all. Finally, someone from kitchen came out and asked us "what do we want". So I said we were looking for table for two. We were put in corner, she gave us menu and again we were completely ignored. We walked out as we were passing through the town on the way ring of Kerry and had no time to hang around in this unfriendly place. Total lack of customer service. (by Kinga Cholewa) [3 weeks ago] | Review 5: 4 stars - We tried this little boutique restaurant in Ennistymon on the way to cliff of Moher,
We ordered a roast chicken, ceasar salad, Tandori gouygon and steak sandwich.
Parking is difficult around the restaurant,
Food was good, limited food options though.
Roast chicken was a bit dry. (by Alban Jose) [Edited 2 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Nice friendly atmosphere with quality food and personal service.
Had the mussels and they were great.
Scampi was decent portion.
Kids meal was good value too (by Andrew Neylon) [a year ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Nice little cafe for some food. Portions  were decent, service was great and it was reasonably priced. (by mark scottt) [a month ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - After visiting Cliffs of Moher I thank google maps for advising me this place to eat. I loved the atmosphere and the food was very nice. Our family loved it. (by Elmira Petrovska) [3 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - We just happened upon this place looking for lunch. The Guinness & Beef stew was one of the very best I've ever had, and the chicken Kiev was outstanding too! Well be back another time. (by Mary-Alice Wildasin) [3 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Great staff, great food. Really accommodating and lovely atmosphere. (by Ronan McDonnell) [3 months ago]

name: Nuala's Bar & Restaurant
address: Tomgraney, Tuamgraney, Co. Clare, V94 YT96, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - A sneaky dinner whilst waiting for the St Patrick's day parade to begin.. very pleasantly surprised. Food was delicious (by Claire Cassidy Moroney) [6 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - The bar and restaurant are very good. The waitresses are friendly and dynamic. I really liked the fish dish with lemon cream. The burger is good and hearty. The Irish coffee is very good. Thank you for the service. (by FLAM HEAGH) [a year ago] | Review 3: 4 stars - Pleasantly surprised to find really nice food in Tuamgraney. Very nice sunday roast , reasonably priced and fast service better than any takeaway from very nice and helpful staff. Nice cheesecake too, my only criticism was I had a wobbley table, which was annoying. Definately a destination if out for a drive and I'll return to try the all day breakfast someday. (by Martin) [4 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - A lovely traditional place. Everything was fresh and delicious and there was something for everyone on the menu. Not a huge variety if you are vegetarian but the tagliatelle for my mother was very tasty. (by Eva Muhlhause) [2 years ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Food was gorgeous,  such a huge portion and staff very friendly (by Suzanne Kelly) [3 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Lovely place, atmosphere and the food is absolutely delicious. (by Oriana Pace) [5 months ago] | Review 7: 2 stars - Nice staff but food wasn't great. Mash potatoes tasted weird. The whole meal felt like it came straight out of the microwave, could've been better. (by Ellen) [5 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Busy on the day we call but got served quickly by friendly staff. The food was good and reasonable priced. Handy car park at the rear (by Declan Walsh) [7 years ago] | Review 9: 4 stars - Good food, pleasant surroundings,
I had the 6oz burger it was really tasty. And the right size.not too big.not too small. (by Aidan C) [Edited 10 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Called at a quiet time so can't really judge atmosphere. But staff were exceptional. Food was very good. Exactly what we needed. Decent portions. Friendly locals. (by adrienne magliocco) [10 months ago]

name: McGann's Pub
address: Main St, Teergonean, Doolin, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - If you get the chance, don‚Äôt miss eating at this place. Every dish we tried was delicious, especially the onion soup. Congratulations to the chef!
The service was excellent, and the live music made the experience even more enjoyable (by Brenda M√©ndez) [2 weeks ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - I absolutely loved the Irish-style fish and chips ‚Äî so fresh and full of flavour! The food overall was amazing, and the cozy atmosphere made the experience even better. A perfect spot for a delicious meal in true Irish style! üëå‚ú® (by Thenucha Sivakumar) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Food is amazing, Service is great. Desert is fabulous. I would give 10 star if I could. We got the lamb shank and their Special salmon and both were great! (by Fatima Sorabi) [2 weeks ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - We stopped here as a part of a Galway Tour Company tour, and it was excellent. Their Irish stew was the best I've had yet. The seafood chowder was also very good. (by Lisa McAfee) [2 weeks ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Atmosphere:
Local pub. Lively in the front of the pub. We were well greeted when we walked in. It was cool to see the law enforcement patches from around the world (mostly US).

Staff:
We received very warm welcome at the door. We were asked by 2 different people if we needed to take our order. After finishing our food, it did take a while to get our check. The pub did start getting a bit more busy.

Burger:
The bread was toasted to perfection with light butter and crispy edges. The bread was soft on the inside. The burger itself was okay. They do have regular mustard (American Mustard) if you ask. The French fries were amazing! This was the first place I had fries that were shaped like potatoes chips but airy and cooked like French fries.

Beef Stew:
The stew was very good. The beef was tender and very flavorful. It came with two hearty scoops of mashed potatoes. It came with soda bread that was great also. (by Jon Jong) [5 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - The tour company stops here for lunch. I must say it's a very good experience. Quick service. Amazing food and friendly staff. It's on the way to Cliffs of Moher. (by Ratna Kumar Nadarajan) [3 weeks ago] | Review 7: 4 stars - Food was nice. We tried sea food chowder, beef stew, fish and chips. All were nice. Really enjoyed the beef stew. Portion size was generous. Defenitly recommend. (by Steve J) [2 months ago] | Review 8: 4 stars - Nice pub in Doolin, gets pretty busy so get there early. I had the pot of mussels for dinner, they were ok, the flavour was good but they were on the small side compared to what other local restaurants were serving. My husband had the roast beef dinner which he didn‚Äôt enjoy at all.
Besides that, the staff are really nice and friendly, so welcoming and accommodating and the atmosphere is great so definitely stop in for a drink.
They also have a really cool beer garden area outback that backs onto a little river, it‚Äôs really pretty. (by Clare Mercer) [2 weeks ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Great local pub with all the flair you expect of an Irish Pub! We visited on St. Patrick's  Day! The place was super busy, but everyone worked hard to make sure people were taken care of at the bar and tables. we did the Beef Stew and the Fish and Chips and weren't disappointed. If you are in Doolin, or in the area for the Aran Islands or Cliffs of Moher, then stop in to this pub for a pint and a great food and service. (by Steve Holmes) [6 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - I cannot recommend McGann‚Äôs enough! Our group was staying in the area and heard about this pub. We stopped for dinner and a pint. The beef stew was delicious! The pub was very busy, however, the staff were friendly and were working hard to accommodate every group. Because of how crowded it was, we were seated with another couple and became friends with them throughout dinner. They also have live music every night at 9. Definitely stop by if you are in Doolin!! (by Kylie) [3 months ago]

name: Riverside Bistro Doolin
address: road Riverside bistro, Teergonean, Roadford, Co. Clare, V95 P603, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Fantastic spot for a well-priced upscale meal. We were seated quickly even though we stopped in late.

We started with the local oysters which were delicious. I got the seafood pasta and my husband enjoyed the lamb. Absolutely delicious, romantic, and good house wine too :) (by Sonja Midtune) [4 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Very nice and cosy place. I ordered BBQ ribs and chips with glass of Merlot wine. Ribs were amazing: well marinated, soft and sweet.
Banoffi desert was not too sweet and good. It was very delicious. (by Natalia Novotna) [2 weeks ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - We ordered starters, main course and dessert,  everything we ate there was fantastic!  Highly recommended. (by caio fernandes) [a month ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Charming place with delicious meals and super friendly staff. We had some refreshing oysters, the lamb and the duck, which were really tasty. The little chimney fire made it all the more cozier, thanks again! (by Egeljin Munkhzul) [5 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Thoughtful vegetarian options seem rare in this part of town, but Riverside Bistro Doolin delivered. The Vegetarian Val Au Vent‚Äîa flaky, buttery pastry with a creamy mushroom filling‚Äîwas thoughtfully made for those who aren‚Äôt after a plant-based meat imitation. The staff were kind and offered spot-on recommendations. (by Cait Rich) [3 months ago] | Review 6: 4 stars - Good food with reasonable price, hot and fresh. Conveniently located in the village of Doolin. (by Yongmei Zhang) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 2 stars - We came across this last night in Doolin on 23/08/25
We ordered 5 pizzas, which weren't great at all.. They used cheap bases, and all 5 people thought they weren't great.  That was a mixture of children and adults.
I had ordered the Riverside chicken..
Which was the last to come out by about 10 minutes +++
The dinner was presented well, but when I cut into it.. the chicken was raw..
I called the waitress over, and she said I'll bring it to the kitchen, and they'll sort it out.
I said no thanks üòí I don't want it now.
I spoke to the manager..
Who said they were trying to get all the food out together, and they were doing their best. But I said the chicken was completely raw in the middle, and I could I have gotten very sick . Not once did the manager or waitress apologise. They said I was very aggressive.. which is not through .
I never complain üòå but I obviously had to on this occasion.
I would not recommend this restaurant ever..in fact ..I'm surprised it's still opened
.please don't eat here. (by Margaret Jeffers) [a month ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - This restaurant is a gem!  Our food was delicious and the atmosphere quaint. We had the seafood trio, pizza, lamb, and ribs and everyone loved their food. We wish we were staying longer so we could eat here again. (by Whitney McKinstry) [a month ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - We stumbled upon this place by accident on our trip in May, and it turned out to be the best meal in our entire two week trip to Ireland. Delicious food, gorgeous plating, and great value for the price. Ireland as a whole is not cheap, but this place truly felt like a bargain compared to most of the other meals we had on the island. We tend to go for a little more "upscale," having lived in a "foodie" town for the last few years, and this fit the bill for us.

The atmosphere was so cozy, and the husband and wife team were excellent. The husband was in the back cooking all the food, and the wife was up front serving with the most genuine smile you've ever seen. Would recommend this place to anyone. (by Rebecca Donohue) [2 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - The food was fantastic! The presentation was great. The service was awesome. It was a little restaurant but was worth every euro spent! It was a little pricey but for the quality and quantity of food it was money well spent! I will definitely dine there again in the future. (by Mike Carberry) [a year ago]

name: Daily Grind coffee on main
address: 232 Horrocks Hwy, Clare SA 5453, Australia
service_options: Just Julies Cafe Takeaway ¬∑ 4.4 stars ¬∑ 117 reviews ¬∑ Cafe
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Early opening coffee shop.  Bacon and egg muffin was tasty and welcome.  Staff are friendly and efficient.   Would stop there next time we are passing through Clare (by Ivan Heron) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Great mild coffee with excellent gooey GF brownie. Other tasty looking options too! (by Dawn Hendrick) [4 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Excellent coffee, raisin toast was perfect and staff very friendly. A great place to enjoy a break. (by Grahame Campbell) [6 days ago] | Review 4: 3 stars - Good spot on the main street and a well presented Cafe. Comfortable vibe with surfing videos playing on the big screen tv. Coffee was ok, without being outstanding. The muffin I had was fluffy, fresh and delicious. The banana bread my partner had was truly awful, very doughy, oily and minimal banana flavour - yuck! (by Tim Schroeder) [3 years ago] | Review 5: 3 stars - Opens nice and early if you are on the road early as not many places are open in Clare for coffee at that time. Decent coffee and bagel and the brownie was ok. (by Black Jack) [2 years ago] | Review 6: 4 stars - Enjoyed my coffee as I watched the world go by on Main St. Also grabbed a salmon bagel, which was very good. Friendly and efficient service here as well. (by Carlito) [2 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Randomly found treasure! We had beef bagels, coffee, healthy dessert and a very tasty Allie's green juice!! Everything was of the highest quality!!! We would definitely recommend this to those that appreciate good food and want to support local business. (by Aggie Mc) [4 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Great little cafe located on the Clare Main Street. This is my new Go-To when in Clare. The setting is beautifully thought out, service is excellent and the coffee is üëå

Highly recommended! (by Alex Ditton) [3 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - I love there Haloumi bagels and they just know how I like my coffee (by Ellie Harris) [3 months ago] | Review 10: 3 stars - Friendly staff and good bagel, very milky flat white took it down for us (by Alasdair Mclean) [3 months ago]

name: Platform One Cafe
address: Maltings Lane, Clare Castle Country Park, Sudbury CO10 8NW, United Kingdom
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Visited Platform 1 Cafe for one of their summer food truck evenings and had a fantastic time. Tonight‚Äôs guest was My Thai Chef ‚Äì absolutely delicious (I‚Äôve reviewed them separately!).

The location is stunning ‚Äì you sit overlooking the old castle, which makes for a great atmosphere. There‚Äôs a solid choice of drinks, from local beers and wine to soft options. The owners were super friendly and clearly care about creating something special.

Perfect spot for a relaxed evening with great food, drinks, and views. Highly recommend supporting this lovely little place. (by Jeff Turnbull) [4 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Perfect cafe, we found a cool spot on a hot day. Waitress delivered our order outside and was happy to chat before having to rush off and serve more customers!

Coffee was good and an excellent cheese scone hit the spot. Cafe atmosphere and location is perfect. Very enjoyable.

Water bowls out for dogs, of which there are many. (by Paul Godden) [a year ago] | Review 3: 1 star - Absolutely shocking experience. Two young girls were sold raw sausage rolls and when they asked for help, they were told they ‚Äúshouldn‚Äôt have bought them‚Äù and refused a refund. Other customers even checked the rolls, agreed they were raw, and kindly gave the girls money to buy food elsewhere. When I went back in as an adult, the man working there called the girls liars, argued, and even tried to pass off a fresh sausage roll as theirs. He laughed when I said the girls felt intimidated. Extremely unprofessional and intimidating behaviour. Only 1 star because he eventually gave me the refund. (by Tina Woodstock) [a month ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Lovely food and drinks in a lovely setting at a reasonable price. Staff were extremely helpful with accommodating kids and supplying ice water in our flasks on such a hot day. Play area train for kids to climb on right there by the cafe too. (by Daniel McCabe) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 1 star - Waited in the queue for ages to be dished up a ham and cheese panini the presentation of it was appalling which for ¬£8.00 I was expecting much better won‚Äôt be returning (by Katie Field) [a month ago] | Review 6: 4 stars - Lovely cafe in the Clare park by the old railway line and station. Nice stop for simple good food (jackets, baps, sandwiches etc.) Or take aways for walks around the park, village or alone the disused railway line. (by Richard Twydell) [2 years ago] | Review 7: 2 stars - A gorgious place with a terrible organization and staff. Shame for a beautifull site in a stunning environment! Who runs this anyway? I give 5 stars for the atmosphere outside...but not for the rudness or lazyness of the staff. (by ronald raes) [4 weeks ago] | Review 8: 2 stars - Quaint place but expensive food. Unfortunately I overheard chef being rather unpleasant to young staff. I won‚Äôt be returning. (by Stuart Wilson) [2 weeks ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Lovely little cafe in Clare castle park. Had delicious coffee and bacon roll. Sat outside. Delightful. (by Susan Healey) [a month ago] | Review 10: 1 star - Bring a packed lunch.

¬£6 gets you a toasted sandwich that is burnt, tasteless and tiny. You get 4 crisps and a few leaves with it.

One bite and I sent it back for a refund.

The pesto was an untastable scraping, the tomatoes were few, pale and tasteless slices, not actually sun dried, the mozzarella was the only real ingredient and there was very little.

No one else in the party enjoyed their food, tho mine was the only one that was inedible.

The wait staff seemed frustrated and disinterested.

If I could give less than 1 stars, this would be the place to get it. Avoid. (by Cris Rose) [3 years ago]

name: Legends Restaurant
address: The Square, Clonroad Beg, Ennis, Co. Clare, V95 HOXK, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Excellent Atlantic chowder!
Service was great and staff are friendly! (by B M) [5 years ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Beautiful food very good service at a reasonable price in the bar & restaurant (by Joe Gleeson) [6 years ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Legends Restaurant is a beautiful place to dine with a lovely relaxing atmosphere, superb food, attentive staff and reasonably priced. Looking forward to my next visit :) (by Evelyn Powell Corry) [6 years ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - I would highly recomend this Restaurant, the food is excellent, friendly and helpful staff and free car parking. I will  surely visit it again. (by Karen Serrano) [6 years ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Always fabulous food , great staff and the dining room is gorgeous . (by Siobhan Moloney) [6 years ago] | Review 6: 3 stars - Food was OK, very average, service was good, but very expensive for what it is. (by Aoife Flood) [Edited 2 years ago]

name: Fig Tree Restaurant at Dromoland Castle
address: Dromoland Castle, Dromoland, Newmarket on Fergus, Co. Clare, V95 ATD3, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 2 stars - Disappointing service - we were sat between the door and the bathroom despite the rest of the tables being free - golfers take priority it seems. The food itself was nice however the staff waited until the final minute to bring out a birthday ice cream (we didn‚Äôt ask for this) and then proceeded to add this to the bill? Very poor form. (by ajakhusky) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Gorgeous breakfast and service was wonderful. Greeted by two young ladies who were welcoming, friendly and so professional... Always a great experience. Thank you ü•∞ (by Geraldine Lyons) [4 weeks ago] | Review 3: 1 star - Service was very poor here by management - we had an issue with our meal -  a fly crawled out of the salad and onto the fish. We reported it to the trainee waitress who took it away back to the kitchen and did not return to our table once to apologise or anything and completly ignored us after.

They must have sprayed fly spray as there was another dead fly on the table. When we requested the bill from another waitress the fish was still on it and I explained the situation again and she said she would let a manager know. The fish was removed from the bill but we felt they didnt believe that the fly was in the food even though the trainee waitress saw it and carried it still on the plate crawling back to the kitchen!!!
Management should have came and apologised and we tried to get their attention times but were ignored - very poor service for the price. Will not be returning. (by Aine Hurley) [4 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Magnificent hidden garden full of colour and variety- the photos don‚Äôt do it justice! Enjoyed tea and scones in the outdoor seating of the fig Tree restaurant- prices similar to high street ( lunch menu looks about 25% higher) (by L S) [3 years ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Highly recommend.  Was with a party of 10 people.  The staff were excellent and attended to us with great care. Food was amazing!  Cocktails are really good. 5 stars.  ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è (by Catherine McMahon) [a year ago] | Review 6: 3 stars - Saddens me to say this a bit because I have always loved coming to the Fig Tree at Dromoland, but the food has taken a step back over the last couple of years in my opinion. We visit every now and again, but considering the prices, the food no longer meets expectations.

Staff are always magnificent, but if you're going to charge ‚Ç¨100 for 2 mains and 2 deserts, it needs to be better than it is. (by Raymond O Connell) [a year ago] | Review 7: 4 stars - Overall, it's very good! But it would want to be for the prices!
The Belgian Waffle desert was a bit disappointing! Shop bought and tasteless, but everything else we had was quite good! We sat in the Walled Garden which was absolutely beautiful! (by True Review) [a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - A lovely location with excellent food at a reasonable price (by Chris Exton) [2 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Excellent food, service and atmosphere. (by Clm Dly) [a month ago] | Review 10: 2 stars - We was in three. We had burger was good, the sup leek and potato no salt, chowder few fish but completely insipid, sourdough with pork pulled completely dry no test and the portion was for starter and salad no dressing and also suppose with chips but never arrived. I told to the waiter but I think never report to the chef or manager and nobody give interest to us (by Joseph Masciarelli) [3 years ago]

name: Vesuvio
address: 5 Patrick St, Clarehill, Ennis, Co. Clare, V95 RH27, Ireland
service_options: Remix pizza and kebab ¬∑ 4.1 stars ¬∑ 54 reviews ¬∑ Pizza Delivery, Four Star Pizza Ennis ¬∑ 4.3 stars ¬∑ 69 reviews ¬∑ Pizza Delivery, Yvonnes Takeaway ¬∑ 4.3 stars ¬∑ 265 reviews ¬∑ Takeout restaurant
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - I had the most beautiful, delicious fish and chips here! The couple who run it are so kind and friendly. I‚Äôll definitely be back! Thank you! (by Andrea Carruthers) [5 days ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Without a doubt, this is the best chip shop I‚Äôve ever tried. The food is outstanding, and the customer service is equally amazing. (by David Carruthers) [5 days ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - You can‚Äôt get better fish and chips in the Ennis area than Vesuvios. Really fresh and so tasty.

It‚Äôs the best I‚Äôve ever had! (by Conor Meyler) [2 weeks ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Excellent food, very nice staff (by Eoin Ferguson) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Best chipper in area. Proper real potato chips. Not greasy. Lamb, chicken & vege kebabs really good. 'Homemade' beef burgers lovely. (by Jess DW) [4 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - The comments and reviews don't do this place justice. FANTASTIC!!!! üòç

Fresh Cod and chips, with tartar sauce was one of the best iv ever had. Everything made fresh, tartar sauce homemade, service top class. Well worth the visit, off the beaten track but a hidden gem. Will definitely be back for a Kebab!!! (by Kevin buston (Kev)) [2 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Prefect fish & chips. Homemade large chips! (by Pawel Masel) [a month ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - I have had food here a few times. The owners are really really nice people. The food is amazing, the curry sauce is out of this world. Done kebabs are good,very tasty meat but comes in a pitta bread instead of a flatbread wrap and way way way too much salad. Well I cant complain about getting too much, especially in this day and age. 10 out of 10 for service and customer appreciation. (by Living the Life Dreaming the Dream) [3 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - What can I say what a fantastic establishment.  The owners are very friendly and the food is better then others much  better than others . The service seems like you are all that matters in the moment . They cannot do more to make you welcome . Would I use Vesuvio again yes in a heartbeat . The personal service , the quality of the food , the cleanliness of the establishment and the good conversation . I cannot rate them high enough . I wish all were like this (by Chris) [a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Was just passing through Clarecastle on holiday. A great find here! Possibly the best fish and chips I've ever had. Quality of the food and cooking was excellent. The owners were friendly and even had homemade tartare sauce, which was great! Highly recommended. (by Koichi Samuels) [3 years ago]

name: Byrne's Ennistymon
reviews:
Review 1: None - I visited Byrne's as a tour guide with a group of 60+ people. Their service was exceptional. Quick, friendly and although me and another tour guide were not booked in, they still served us a delicious dish. So if you are looking for delicious food as well as outstanding customer service, in a warm, atmospheric restaurant with character and a superb view, Byrne's is your spot! (by Karin Janssen) | Review 2: None - Beautiful restaurant, would highly recommend. Breads served were unusual and very delicious, an amazingly talented harpist playing was unexpected touch. Lovely terrace, no room for us on this occasion. Gorgeous stepped walkway down to the falls right outside the door in the wall. Just beautiful (by Eimear McDonagh) | Review 3: None - Very cozy cafe with a terrace. From the terrace there is a view right on the thresholds. It is advisable to visit in good weather. Under the cafe there is an antique shop, large, with a good selection. Very friendly staff. I recommend this place if you are in Ennistymon.

The coffee is delicious, the service is excellent. (by Alexander SpecLED) | Review 4: None - We stopped to have lunch after an outing to Cliffs of Moher. What a wonderful warm and cosy restaurant to come into and be welcomed with genuine warmth.

The staff are as very friendly and knowledgeable of the food choices available. Being informed that we are gluten intolerant, the waitress immediately gave us the best options to choose from and each option was perfectly prepared and beautifully tasteful - and more than enough. Being wet and cold from the outing to the Cliffs, the generous portions were just what we needed to end a perfect outing.

The Vanilla and Rhubarb pudding was THE absolute best -although my daughter‚Äôs Gluten-free Brownie gave it a proper run for 1st place. Both were perfectly accompanied by their delicious coffee.

All and all a wonderful stop - one of our best in Ireland. (by Sunette Goosen) | Review 5: None - Gem of a restaurant, delicious food , the "fancy" bacon and cabbage was amazing as was the sea bass, the breads and the coconut prawns. Class guitarist playing the perfect level of background music . Id highly recommend when in ennistymon, Lehinch area. (by Ronan Trainor) | Review 6: None - Excellent service, great food, cool atmosphere. Nice decor. The backyard water fall is amazing to sit and enjoy and the antique store downstairs is a nice authentic treat after you eat üôÇ. Would definitely go again if I'm in town (by Sam Rosewall) | Review 7: None - This is a hidden gem. Excellent food, great service and not too expensive - especially if you get in for the early bird special. Highly recommend checking it out if you're passing by.

The wine menu is exceptional and there's seating outside with a view of the waterfall. Perfect for a lazy evening sipping wine in the sunshine. (by Oisin Cullen) | Review 8: None - We had the beef stew at Byrne‚Äôs and it was really delicious. Tender meat, rich flavor and very comforting. The cozy atmosphere and friendly service made it a lovely stop. Definitely recommend when in Ennistymon. (by kamilo) | Review 9: None - We had dinner here June 25th, the night before my daughters wedding. There was 10 of us. The friendly staff accommodated us quickly and efficiently. The food was spectacular. I had the special Duck Confit. The staff was more than friendly, it felt like going to Mom's house for dinner. They even gave me some history to my T-Shirt from Biddy Early's in Boston, MA.

Go there, eat, and enjoy yourself. You will have a great time. (by Joe Boyd) | Review 10: None - We has two meals plus a lunch in Byrnes last week the food was fantastic the staff really lovely and the restaurant itself is beautiful outside the waterfall was really great to look at the waterfall comes from the local Falls Hotel which is beside Byrnes well done guys we will be back for sure (by mar6161)

name: Coco Ennis Restaurant
address: Barrack St, Clonroad Beg, Ennis, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 1 star - Worst dining experience in Ireland so far.
Completely fooled by online recommendations. Look at the state of the starter, an absolute joke for the price they charge. Noodles drenched in oil (we only managed one spoon) and the ‚ÄúSzechuan beef‚Äù was the worst I‚Äôve ever had. ‚Ç¨5 for the cheapest store-bought ice cream is just insulting.

It‚Äôs frustrating how some places think charging ‚Ç¨65 for two adults means customers shouldn‚Äôt expect quality. Staff made minimal effort. First and last visit. Should have gone to Henry‚Äôs instead. (by Jee Dunne) [a month ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - We were treated to a beautiful evening here over 30 of us  , and  the service was very good , considering so many along with there regular customers and take aways , the food was delicious, (by Esther Upritchard) [a year ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Was here recently for a party, would definitely recommend it (by Patrick Malone) [a week ago] | Review 4: 1 star - The food was very tasty, but the service, as always, let it down. I was given an incorrect check for payment, this happened not the first time, so I concluded that I will not return to this restaurant again. (by Iryna Hab) [a year ago] | Review 5: 4 stars - We ordered a large variety of food the best being General tso‚Äôs chicken delicious (by Sonia S√°nchez) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - An excellent establishment, very friendly, efficient service. Extensive menu, best Chinese in town, and very quick if you just want a takeaway. (by Ger Cosgrove) [5 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Amazing food and a very friendly manager and staff 10/10 would recommend üëç (by Phil Ryan) [2 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - The best Asian restaurant, not just in Ennis, but anyplace I have visited.

Highly recommended. (by Ger Cosgrove) [3 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Very good food. Very nice manager. (by Kitthi Naganidhi) [6 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Fantastic food, lovely decor, what a location! (by John McFarlane) [a month ago]

name: The Dolphin
address: Ennistymon Rd, Breaffy North, Miltown Malbay, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews: Review 1: 5 stars - Fantastic little spot for breakfast, stayed in Milltown for 3 nights and ate here each morning. Our son can be a fussy eater but really enjoyed his breakfast too. Would definitely eat here again and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it (by Greg Carolan) [5 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Breakfast was absolutely gorgeous and the ladies working there were extremely friendly and helpful, definitely recommend if you need a proper full Irish in the Clare coast area (by Ruairi Madden) [4 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Visited this gem of a cafe for the first time today, and we will definitely be back. The staff were lovely, and really accommodating, moving tables so that our family group could sit together and interacting brilliantly with the children. Food was reasonably priced and absolutely delicious, with generous portions. Two people had 'The Whole Hog' breakfast, which was ENORMOUS and cooked to perfection. The rest of us had gorgeous bagels, and a special plate of toast appeared to keep the toddler happy. Locally sourced bacon and puddings were excellent. We left full and happy, and hope to be back soon! (by Lily de Sylva (Granny in a Van)) [7 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Best breakfast on the west of Ireland. Everything was cooked to perfection. Really good coffee as well. (by Jonathan Smith) [6 years ago] | Review 5: 1 star - I dont like leaving bad reviews but i got a take away from here . Fresh cod and garlic  chips ...cant really go wrong with that ...or can you , the fish was fried in the same basket as the southern fried chicken the garlic cheese chip was done 5 minutes before the cod there was no batter left on the cod when cooked and it tasted as you can imagine like southern fried chicken. I wont be going back anytime soon. (by Dave Mullins) [3 years ago] | Review 6: 4 stars - Grabbed some take-away during our holidays. Food wasn't exceptional but not the worst either. Prices are actually quite reasonable but unfortunately the chips came from a frozen bag. If you don't care about fine dining and just want some burgers and chips because you are hungry it's not a bad choice but they won't win the best chipper award either. (by Marco Bohm) [4 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Good food, and service. (by Popolupo 1020) [5 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Great food at the Dolphin. Caragh and team always make sure you are taken care of . Look forward to my next meal in the cafe there. (by Neil Hynes) [2 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Best chicken breast in west Clare cooked to what ever way you like it. Well done for me . Get food great chat altogether. (by Thomas Fitzgerald) [4 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Fantastic family run restaurant. Tasty food very reasonably priced. Strongly recommended fresh firlsh when available or quarter pounder with all the trimmings (by ben daly) [5 years ago]

name: 505 Cafe
address: 505 N McEwan St, Clare, MI 48617, United States
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Love this little coffee shop! Great atmosphere, awesome service, tasty food and a nice variety. Only disappointment is that they close at 3 & I wish they were open in the late afternoons as well.
Would recommend and will be back! (by JustaRichgirl ‚ÄúRichgirl‚Äù) [6 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Stopped by 505 Caf√© in Clare with my team for a mid-day latte boost and it was exactly what we needed! The lattes were smooth and perfectly balanced!! The caf√©‚Äôs modern yet cozy vibe made it a great quick stop before heading back to work. Plus, the staff was genuinely friendly. We‚Äôll definitely be back for another round (maybe try a flatbread or their house specialty next time)! Thank you, 505!! (by Madison Hubbell) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Super cute shop! Drinks were amazing! Highly recommend if you‚Äôre in the area! (by Paulina Hoffman) [4 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - I had the best mango smoothie and the best waitress! The food was great also, very fresh üòã üëå (by T Wilde) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - This was simply amazing! Service was great! The mimosas was amazing! We got bottomless and my favorite was the strawberry lemon! Food was hot and came out in big portions ! I will be getting the cinnamon roll waffle next time! The whip cream taste homemade!  I live an hour away and will be making that drive! (by Shateonna Mclemore) [2 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Awesome experience. I was a little worried at first seeing how young the staff is but they were awesome!! Super nice and knew how to make the drinks well.  Loved it. The food is awesome and the drinks were delicious. I couldn't get enough of the raspberry bliss! (by Kayla w) [5 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Still has great food, at a great price. Plus come see the new money tree out front. This weeks special is corn beef. (by Ray McCall) [4 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Really nice downtown cafe.  Had the Dubai Chocolate Latte.  Very good. (by JK John) [2 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - I've been here once before and the good experience we had the first time brought us back! First off let me say Clare is one of the most charming small towns I've been too, it's worth a stop even if you're just passing by... STOP! You won't be disapointed. So since you've stopped have a meal at the 505... Great service, (our server Liz was beyond great!) with that being said the food service was a little slow but not due to the service staff or kitchen... they were slammed, working hard and not stopping! The staffs friendliness never wavered despite the rush and we appreciated it! Great food and a bright airy historic atmosphere. Check out the 505 Cafe and the rest of Clare. Thank you Liz... we'll be back. (by Michael Conser) [3 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - This is my favorite caf√® in Michigan. Amazing food, amazing drinks, and always great service. The outdoor seating looks amazing and the inside of the cafe is so cute. Love it here (by SnowAngelGaming) [2 months ago]

name: Old Ground Hotel Ennis
reviews:
Review 1: None - Once again, I brought my bus tour consisting of 59 people  to the fabulous Old Ground Hotel for the last night of our musical tour around Ireland.  If you don't know, the Old Ground is THE place to stay in Ennis and one of the finest ‚Ä¶ (by pearllodea) | Review 2: None - I was here as part of a tour group. So glad our tour started at The Old Ground hotel as it set the tone for a beautiful start to our tour. The hotel is beautiful. The location is great and the rooms very  clean comfortable. The hotel and ‚Ä¶ (by beach_7864) | Review 3: None - Lovely hotel - very "old world" style.  The staff are super friendly and helpful.  I had a very nice quiet room on the 4th floor and was provided with a small fridge.  Very nice view of the garden in the back and the church across the ‚Ä¶ (by 191marthes) | Review 4: None - Great hotel. Main elevators were not operating due to a part. The hotel allowed the service elevator to be used which was a big help. Food is amazing.  The lamb chops were one of the best I have ever had. Tender, lots of flavor and paired with mashed potatoes. The Poets Corner offers Pub food and has trad sessions. We enjoyed our stay and hope to return. (by Joseph McClash) | Review 5: None - This afternoon checked into this beautiful establishment and as in all of Ireland we were warmly greeted. But, the Old Ground went 2 step above! At check in I was told that I was upgraded to a Jr suite...what a beautiful pleasant surprise. The room was beautifully decorated with fine linens and tapestry..the bathroom ...well beyond expectations. Centrally located with a charming dynamic pub...make this place your home away from home when in Ireland. (by patricia delorey) | Review 6: None - We spent a week in Ennis earlier this month and stayed at the Old Ground.
Its location is perfect in town centre. Walkable distance from most attractions, including a lovely beauty salon just cross the road (Beautique).
The service is professional and friendly, at the reception and in the restaurant/bar. The poet's corner is great to relax after an excursion, to meet friend or to enjoy quality time with family. The food is good and good value.
My partner forgot a hanger with a jacket. We called the hotel reception, they took our details and a few days later, the jacket was home. The address tags on the packaging had been typed on a computer in big letters, telling a lot about their attention to detail.
The rooms are nice, very clean however, in our room the bathroom just had a big bathtub with a shower inside (working perfectly). We didn't mind but someone with limited mobility could find it hard to access the shower.
We were in the 229, room on O'Connell street. The night is calm but in the morning on week days a council cleaning car is beeping shortly after 8.
Last but not least, the staff includes a lovely cat very friendly with guests.
