Enjoy! (by Agn√®s Verrelle) | Review 7: None - If you're in search of exceptional luxury accommodations in Ennis, Ireland, look no further than the Old Ground Hotel. Our arrival coincided with a grand wedding, but the staff went above and beyond, ensuring our room was ready well before ‚Ä¶ (by davecookthetravelguy) | Review 8: None - We stay here last week on holiday for a wonderful three nights!!!!
The location of the hotel is perfect to explore the sights and shops in Ennis---and is great to use as a base to see the Cliffs of Mohr, Doolin and to the south--Limerick and Bunratty.
The rooms were very very nice---and the service was fantastic!!
One of the highlights was our dining experienca at the hotel...The The Town Hall Restaurant was better than Fantastic---the food was delicious and the service was professional and very SPECIAL ( please pass on our SINCERE thanks to both Natalia--she was TERRIFIC --- and also to Grace who was very accommadating).
ALL AROUND-----A real 5 star experience!!! (by Michael Brennan) | Review 9: None - 3rd time here,  gets booked out very quickly so take your chance when you can. Lovely hotel in the centre of Ennis town, rooms large, clean and very comfortable. Kettle and coffee machine,  safe and plenty of storage. Bathroom with bath and shower in. Staff always very friendly and helpful. Had dinner outside I the garden as the weather was lovely. (by Peter Burns) | Review 10: None - We recently celebrated my grandmother‚Äôs 90th birthday at the Old Ground Hotel and were blown away by the exceptional service. The private function room was perfect, and the staff went above and beyond to make the night special.||A special ‚Ä¶ (by MeadhbhSlattery)

name: Rathbaun Restaurant & Hotel
reviews: Review 1: None - Myself and my two friends came for the weekend from Dublin and all three of us would highly recommend this hotel. Call greeted us on arrival and was so helpful and friendly. The rooms were clean, had fresh towels and nice and warm room. The breakfast and food was outstanding. The service we received in the restaurant was excellent. The girls were so friendly and i would highly recommend this hotel. Beautiful little town with the nicest people in it. The cleaners also refilled the little kitkats every morning in our coffee station which was such a lovely touch. We will defiantly be back. Thank you for a lovely stay. (by keli ann lees) | Review 2: None - This is a good value hotel. It's a good base for exploring this beautiful part of Ireland. The staff at check-in and breakfast were very friendly and helpful. First impressions entering the bedroom weren't good because the decor and colour ‚Ä¶ (by touristi123) | Review 3: None - We just stopped at the hotel for a coffee while exploring the local area by bike. Of all the friendly people we met on our Ireland trip these were the most welcoming and helpful.  There is a surprisingly large restaurant and bar area where there happened to be some beautiful live music for a lunch party.  This was an unexpected little highlight of our trip (by Hugo Maule) | Review 4: None - We were very unprofessionally treated by hotel owner Lynn. Lynn came banging on our door, shouting accusations that we had left the room in a mess and stained the carpet with lipstick ‚Äì none of which was true. Lynn went off to check with ‚Ä¶ (by hannahmG5275DN) | Review 5: None - We are just back from a 2 night stay with our dog and we thoroughly enjoyed it! Our dog Bella was welcomed so much and totally fussed over. Amazing friendly staff especially Tara and the breakfast team. One of the most comfy beds I‚Äôve slept in also. We will definitely be returning ‚ò∫Ô∏è‚ò∫Ô∏è (by jabberKerryIreland) | Review 6: None - The service and breakfasts at this hotel were exceptional! The staff did everything they could to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable. All the rooms are upstairs and there is no lift, so it was somewhat difficult for some members of our party with limited mobility, but the staff made sure their rooms were the most accessible. The rooms were somewhat small, as the building is an older one, but they were well appointed and had all the modern conveniences. The bar and dining rooms were roomy and beautiful and the food was excellent, (by David Bean) | Review 7: None - Just about the most friendly inn I‚Äôve ever stayed in. Comfortable and quiet rooms located right in the center of town. Charming restaurant with homemade dinner. Breakfast was lovely. Beds were very comfortable. Staff were so eager to be please. Highly recommend !  Free parking one half block away. Close to cliffs of Moher and Doolin. (by Go799473) | Review 8: None - We didn't stay there but just went to the restaurant for dinner. Fast service but the food was not very good. Had the Chicken and Broccoli and it looked and tasted like it came from a microwave, and the price was ‚Ç¨24.00!!! definitely not ‚Ä¶ (by 437wilfrieds) | Review 9: None - As part of our trip down the west coast of Ireland we stopped here for a couple of nights as it is a great location to use as a base for travelling round the county.|The welcome we received from the staff was fantastic. |Part of the reason ‚Ä¶ (by 01SIDS123) | Review 10: None - OUr family stayed in three rooms at the Rathbaun recently and really liked our stay. At check in Lynn helped us with an excellent restaurant suggestion and voluntarily made a reservation. ( The Roadside restaurant is quite good and only 100 ‚Ä¶ (by 819sandym)

name: Vaughan's Pub Kilfenora
address: Main Street, Kilcarragh, Kilfenora, Co. Clare, V95 DT8K, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Absolutely incredible!
I found Vaughan's online and booked the venue before we even saw it due to living in the states. When we were able to go over, a year before our wedding date, they happily organized our tasting. As time grew closer to our date, they were easy to communicate with and so very flexible!
The day of our wedding- it was evident how much Vaughan's cared about making our big day feel special. They managed moving the ceremony inside seamlessly (since it was raining, of course lol), and our food was absolutely delicious! We still are receiving compliments from guests about how great the food was.
Every step of the way Vaughan's staff was kind, enthusiastic, and easy to work with. I cannot recommend hosting your wedding here enough. (by Bri & Nick Knaperek) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - We had our wedding in Vaughan‚Äôs last month and it was incredible. The team are fantastic, especially Triona, who handled all communications and requests, nothing was an issue, and she was just so helpful. The food is amazing, we were blown away at the food tasting, which they kindly didn‚Äôt mind my parents attending also, and again at the wedding all the guests were raving about how good the food was! Everything went very smoothly and that is down to how organised the team is. The barn is such a gorgeous, intimate place and the perfect place for a smaller wedding (we had around 90 guests.) We gave the white table plan easel pictured to Vaughan‚Äôs as a token of our thanks, so it‚Äôs there for other couples to use. The accommodation provided is also excellent, very clean and comfortable. Overall would highly recommend Vaughan‚Äôs for a wedding. (by Sinead Morrissey) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - A traditional Irish pub with a cosy atmosphere, located in the centre of Kilfenora - the gateway to the Burren and the picturesque Wild Atlantic Way.

Nice cozy place. Tasty food, beer selection.

This establishment also has a banquet hall for various events.

Excellent large parking lot right behind the bar. Very convenient. (by Alexander SpecLED) [a month ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Vaughans Pub helped give us a wedding reception we will never forget - and in short time, too! We looked everywhere for a place that would host a small wedding reception (12 people), but still have a private place to offer for sitting. Not only did Vaughans deliver a room, they went above and beyond - from the decorations they provided, customized menus with our names, holding our wedding cake and then displaying it beautifully - we are so incredibly appreciative. The food was good (recommend their hot wings in particular, and the fish and chips meals were enjoyed by all who got them, with big fish portions and crunchy breading), but the highlight for us was the space. A private room with candles all around, decorative fairy lights, bubbly laid out on a table for us for toasting - we can't say enough about the work they put in to give us a magical and memorable reception. Thank you! (by Kathryn Lucy (Katie)) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 4 stars - Loved the warm ambiance inside.  The food was good and we stopped here at the recommendation of our hotel.  I wanted to love this place but the service was lacking.  Several people received their drinks ahead of us and we were disappointed üòû (by Noanie) [Edited 4 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Our tour bus was dropped off here for lunch. They have us a limited menu which included a good variety of choices including restricted diets. They handled the rush well and the food was fine. Good job under trying circumstances. Easily the best tour bus lunch stop this trip. (by Dave Brand) [3 weeks ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - We had our wedding at Vaughan‚Äôs last Saturday and we honestly couldn‚Äôt speak more highly of the whole experience. From start to finish, the team was incredibly helpful‚Äînothing was ever too much trouble and every request was accommodated with ease.

Our guests were full of praise for the food, and the barn setup for the dinner was absolutely perfect. One of the many highlights of the day was having our first dance outside‚Äîit was such a special moment and beautifully done.

Huge thanks to all the staff who worked so hard on the day and night. Special shoutout to Luke and Caitlin who were everywhere over the few days, and their care and attention to detail made us feel completely at ease that everything was taken care of.

If you‚Äôre thinking about having your wedding at Vaughan‚Äôs, we couldn‚Äôt recommend them more highly.

‚Äì Maggie & James (by James Dillon) [3 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - We happened on this place on a long drive from the Cliffs of Moher to Navan. It was a stroke of good luck. The seafood chowder is heavenly. The service is friendly. The atmosphere is real. Loved it. (by Paul Larsen) [a week ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Fantastic burger from irish beef and one of the most original toilets I've ever seen. (by Bernard Van√≠ƒçek) [2 weeks ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - I recently had my elopement reception at Vaughan‚Äôs this past December and it was so lovely! The staff were so friendly and accommodating and always checking in to see if we needed anything! They were also so responsive and helpful arranging everything leading up to the event day (we came from Canada). The barn was done up so beautifully for our arrival and I loved the added touches of a Christmas tree and garland since it December. All the guest raved about the food both in the pub and at the reception dinner! It was the perfect vibe for a small and cozy reception. Myself and the groom stayed at the Stone house was very nice, clean and spacious. (by Krista Purcell) [a year ago]

name: Mr. Mick Cellar Door and Kitchen
address: 7 Dominic St, Clare SA 5453, Australia
reviews:
Review 1: 4 stars - Well the weekend was freezing but all the more reason to head out and enjoy wineries üç∑.
We booked to go to Mr Mick. I am glad we did, it was busy.

It's a lovely place to sit, cold but it smelt good in there. So if you weren't hungry,  you would be once you had smelt the food.
We ordered lots of plates. I hate tapas. This is obviously not really tapas food.
We decided to have our bread and arancini first. The arancini was good. Bread is so small. Onto the chicken, which was average- not exciting. My husband said the lamb was good. The carrots were ok but mash looked like it had come from a packet.
Chips ok. Salad very good, dressing was very good.
We choose the special for dessert. It was the highlight.
The food was good. But not fabulous.
Wine was ok. Again nothing to get excited about.
The service was average!
Three people working,  well only one person really working on the floor. The amazing Miss V.
The other two were hopeless.
While Miss V spun around a million times, the other two were clumsy and inefficient.
Total bill $177-
Wine included.
Would I go again.
No.
Thank you for the experience üç∑ (by Kate Stewart) [Edited a month ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - Enjoyed the wine tasting, friendly and welcoming. Had the chef‚Äôs selection for lunch, loved the pork belly and chicken. Felt a little overloaded with carb dishes though, focaccia followed by deep fried calamari (very filling), followed by arancini (filling) with veges on a bed of chick peas (omg full), then chicken on a bed of couscous with bowl of baked potatoes, then came the pork belly which was great but we were so full by then. Biggest disappointment aside from the carb overload was the aioli with the potato, was wishing this was sour cream. (by Simon & Julie Hanau) [4 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Lovely space and excellent food. The wines are concistently good and there's something to suit everyone. (by James Rowe) [a week ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Great spot on a sunny day with outdoor space and lawn games for the kids. The tapas were excellent (especially the raw tuna) and the portion sizes were very reasonable - the kids schnitzel and chips were huge too (and they loved them). If you're in a rush, you might be better off somewhere else, but for a leisurely lunch don't miss it. (by Jonathan Allen) [5 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Loved our meals today. Both lamb and chicken dishes were amazing. We also had the dips and pita which were very flavoursome.  Service was also very good and timely as well with lovely staff. Thank you for a great lunch. Cellar door was also great and after a tasting paddle we chose a Riesling. (by R) [2 months ago] | Review 6: 1 star - Today was my daughter‚Äôs 30th birthday celebration. Eight of us came with great expectations to Mr Micks, with Sophie having always wanted to eat here.
I‚Äôm afraid all eight of us were very surprised at how disappointing our experience was.
1. Sophie had asked for a paired chefs choice and only received one glass of wine.
2. The food was at best reasonable pub food, served mildly warm with the majority of it being fried. Having said that the seared tuna was fresh and the most enjoyed by all.
3. When enquiring if Sophie would receive a dairy free option when the remaining guests had deep fried halloumi we were told ‚Äúno‚Äù as the capsicum dish would be too filling for her and the previous dish was the equivalent of two. That being a mushroom with couscous on it and a handful of salad greens and not at all appetising. Then we were curtly told they‚Äôd bring something out‚Ä¶a bowl of more salad greens with lukewarm bok choy served with canned coconut cream which was vile.
4. The pork belly was very tough and not crunchy and left by most. Most of the food was barely seasoned.
5. The staff were not attentive. When asked if we could please have another high chair on arrival, we were told I have one for you. I don‚Äôt know if we can do something with the pram though, we weren‚Äôt expecting that.
There was barely a smile and plates were not cleared. We honestly felt as though we were an inconvenience.
We were asked once if we‚Äôd like more water with one bottle given for 8. Not asked if we‚Äôd like dessert or any other wine.
6. There was no explanation of the dishes we were being served. Certainly not what we have experienced with past ‚Äúchef choice dining ‚Äú.  And we‚Äôre not a bunch of ‚ÄúKaren‚Äôs‚Äù. We are a very easy going bunch and love to be with each other.
7. $63. We should have left when we first arrived and discerned it was not a welcoming place. This was something we had all saved for and really wanted it to be memorable for Soph. We‚Äôre having a bit of laugh now because it really was memorable but for all the wrong reasons.
8. When paying for the bill they tried to charge us for the pairing and then didn‚Äôt quite believe us when we said she had only received one glass.

So sad I can‚Äôt be more positive with this review.

As an addition to our review I would like to thank the manager and staff for their quick response and kindness  they showed to us today when I came to meet them. They were very apologetic, listened intently and  were very generous in making up for our experience yesterday.  Sincerely‚Ä¶thank you. (by Sarah Chalmers) [Edited 2 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - We had a car rental for the day and our travel agent had listed this winery in our suggestions to visit for the day. So glad we did. We stopped in the cellar before the restaurant opened and got to sample a few wines. Staff was super nice and friendly. We had the chef's selection for lunch. Seriously one of the best meals we had on our entire trip! We thoroughly enjoyed the experience and I highly recommend visiting! (by Courtney Ward) [2 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Came for lunch and ordered the squid, arancini, duck and soft shell crab (not pictured). I highly recommend the squid, it is just the right balance between crispy on the outside and soft on the inside! Food was served at a decent pace and service staff were very friendly. Would come back again :-) (by Steffany XY) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Me & the hubby decided to grab a late lunch after hitting the Riesling Trail and this spot was perfect. What can I say the Tapas were to die for. The young lass that served us recommended how many dishes she thought we might like to order depending on how hungry we were so we opted for 5 but I think we had eyes bigger than our belly‚Äôs as the portion sizes were surprisingly big and jam packed full of flavour. The hubby found the perfect wine, Mr Mick Shiraz so much so he decided to buy an extra couple of bottles to bring home.
The staff were really nice and very friendly who all seem to make it run like clockwork our tapas dishes came out at a steady rate and we didn‚Äôt feel rushed, it was a really relaxing dining experience thank you üòä this place is a hidden gem & I would definitely recommend it (by lisa stephenson) [a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Another fantastic meal. Very friendly helpful staff. Excellent food. Excellent wine. You can‚Äôt come here without also trying and buying some really great wine. Lee (by Lee Biglow) [7 months ago]

name: Linnane's Lobster Bar
address: Ballyvelaghan, New Quay, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - This restaurant was a random find. We just wanted to catch the sunset and we found this restaurant down the same road we happened to turn down. The oysters were absolutely memorable. Wow-just wow. The mignonette was so flavorful and was a great pairing. The chowder with the loaf/bread was incredible. Chock full of different seafood and so delicious. The restaurant was in a picturesque location. The restaurant was really too warm but I suppose if that‚Äôs the worst thing-it‚Äôs really not worth a mention. (by Bethany Etheridge) [a week ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - An unforgettable seafood experience at Linnane‚Äôs!

Stopped in to Linnane‚Äôs Lobster Bar in New Quay around midday and was lucky to be seated without a booking ‚Äî though I‚Äôd absolutely recommend calling ahead during busy times, as this place is deservedly popular.

The seafood was nothing short of spectacular. You can taste the freshness in every bite. I had lobster that had been caught the very same morning ‚Äî sweet, tender, and perfectly cooked. The shellfish platter was equally impressive: oysters, mussels, and crab, all fresh from the sea and beautifully prepared.

Of course, everything goes down best with a creamy pint of Guinness, and Linnane‚Äôs pours a perfect one. I also have to shout out the brown bread ‚Äî hands down the best I‚Äôve ever tasted. Dense, nutty, and still warm from the oven, it was the perfect companion to the shellfish and chowder.

The setting only adds to the magic ‚Äî stunning views over the water and the surrounding countryside make it a joy to sit and linger. Whether you‚Äôre a local or just passing through, this place is a gem not to be missed. Can‚Äôt wait to return! (by Loyes Diamonds) [3 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Some of the best oysters I‚Äôve ever had. Grilled lobster was delicious. To top it off they pour a fantastic and creamy pint of Guinness. Only thing missing was maybe some proper napkins‚Ä¶lobster got a bit messy üòÖ (by Rebecca G) [a week ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - I love a good seafood chowder and was on something of a mission to try as many as I could in Ireland on this trip.  Linnane‚Äôs Lobster Bar served up the absolute best of all: smoked salmon, hake, haddock, cod, carrots, celery, rich creamy base.
Brown bread (Irish soda bread) that came with the chowder was excellent. (by Conor O'Mahony) [a month ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Such a great mix in this seafood platter; fresh, juicy, and full of flavour! ü¶ûü¶êü¶™
The crispy potatoes were so tasty too. A perfect meal for a seafood lover like me. Beautiful location, just right by the sea... Highly recommend! (by Ammy C Warny) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - We shared the lobster, giant prawns, calamari and some bread. Honestly wish we had ordered more. The potatoes that came with the lobster were so crispy. The prawns were a little on the spicy side. My son ate all the calamari so I assume it was delicious. It does get messy so they do offer you a finger bowl to clean off your hands. (by Nichelle S) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Fantastic food - some of the best we've every tasted. The fish and chips was some of the best fish ever, oysters were fantastic, lobster delicious. The staff were wonderful, the view was great, restaurant well decorated - highly recommend (by Beth) [a month ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - The view was great and the food was fabulous. Our group had the steak, lobster, and seafood platter for two. Steak and lobster meals were perfect, the seafood platter had clams, mussel's, shrimp, and lobster. I have had mussels and clams before and was not the biggest fan but these clams and mussels were out of this world. Changed my whole perspective on both. Don‚Äôt know if I‚Äôll ever have as tasty or fresh (the were bringing them in from the ocean as we ate) clams or mussels again but wow!!! (by Jeff and Kim) [4 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - The perfect stop during our trip around the island!

Walked in & was fretted by Rufus who was polite & very professional & knowledgable about the menu (including nut allergies)

We had a few rounds of oysters & loved them, the buttermilk granita was a nice touch & so were the garlic!

Mussels were tasty with a great brother & the soda bread dipped was perfect

Fish and chips was good! Mushy peas needed some seasoning

The view is spectacular & all in all it was a wonderful visit & stop (by Brian Duffy) [3 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Holy COW!!! Linnane‚Äôs was amazing!! We were craving a nice local and fresh seafood spot on our way back to Dublin. We looked up some things on the map and this came up! We parked our car across from a field of cows and walked in. There were no tables available really, but they accommodated us in a little counter space against a window which worked out fine!

Were started with some special blood orange Oysters, which were local Flaggy Shore and SO fresh and tasty. We also did the seafood chowder and garlic crab claws. They use a Brown Crab I believe, which is kind of like a stone crab that we have in Florida, but served hot. DELICIOUS!!

Main course was a seafood pasta and grilled Hake. Both amazing. I can‚Äôt say enough great things about Linnane‚Äôs! I would come back here in a heart beat. This was some of the freshest seafood I‚Äôve had in a long time. They literally have the oysters coming in right there! Highly recommend. (by Dj Lorence) [3 months ago]

name: The Cock Inn
address: 3 Callis St, Clare, Sudbury CO10 8PX, United Kingdom
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Myself and my partner came for the steak night and were not disappointed! Everything cooked and served to perfection!
Wonderful atmosphere, fabulous decor, great drinks range and a lovely menu.
All round 5 stars!! Would highly recommend and we will be repeat customers. (by Rebecca Fisher) [6 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Great Sunday roast in a friendly pub  Good service, tasty and well presented food. (by Lauraine Portwood) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Second visit to The Clumsy Cock, although this was the first time for food. Went with family on a table of four.
Food was amazing, staff looked after us very well. After food we moved up to the bar for some more drinks. Great atmosphere.

The food was amazing - even took some photos. Definitely try the Blooming Onion !! (by Darren Theobald) [10 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Had a lovely Sunday lunch here. The staff were really friendly and on the ball and the food and drinks were all great. I can highly recommend if you‚Äôre in the area. Thank you. (by Tom Weller) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Food was really good.

Had, home made Scotch egg starter, the steak, ale and blue cheese pie served with seasonal veg, roast potatoes and Yorkshire pudding (part of Sunday menu) and the Creme Brulee.

Highlights were the pie itself lots of steak and a lovely rich flavour and the roast potatoes were excellent, crispy, well seasoned and fluffy inside.

2 local guest cask ales were on from Pumphouse community brewery in nearby Toppesfield (oktoberfest style ale) and from Nethergate brewery in Long Melford ( a red ale for Halloween)

Food again is great and worth the price. Staff were friendly. The atmosphere was relaxed and cozy.

Nice to see the pub back open.  Will return. (by Tom C) [2 years ago] | Review 6: 4 stars - We had the most enjoyable  Sunday roast... The service was superb and great family atmosphere, the attention  on the decor made us smile... it was a joy to stop and just enjoy it all... Thank you. (by Maheag) [3 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - We really enjoyed the steak night and the Sunday lunch sharer was amazing. The staff are friendly and welcoming, providing a brilliant service. The pub has a really lovely atmosphere too. We can't wait to go again and try some more delicious cocktails. Our new favourite place to visit üòç (by Wendy Bowman) [10 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Absolutely amazing Sunday lunch. Beautifully cooked and presented, the gravy was immense. (by Kim Wilsmore) [2 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - A pleasant experience, I have known the team for some time now and expected nothing less that what we received.  Beautiful Sunday roast cooked to perfection.  Staff friendly and always a pleasure to see at least one of the duo :) (by Andy Wood) [10 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - We had a really lovely meal there on Friday evening. Pleasing the fussy eaters we were with isn‚Äôt easy, but you really nailed it (and I wouldn‚Äôt just say that). Great service, great drinks, great food - just wished we lived slightly closer! (by Patsy Fuller) [10 months ago]

name: The Pipers Inn Bar & Restaurant
address: Ballyheefy, Ogonnelloe, Killaloe, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - What a hidden gem.  Best food I‚Äôve had in Ireland by far.  Lamb and Fish and chips were incredible.  Beautiful inside and out and amazing service.  Make a day out of it and going on the Shannon river cruise 15 minute drive from restaurant. (by Louis A) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - The online reviews were a bit older but I can report that as of August 2025 Pipers is excellent. Between the 5 of us we had mushroom starter (amazing), soup, duck, salmon, and lamb and it was all perfect, couldn't ask for better. Great service, and the back of house is doing great work. Best meal we've had in County Clare in a long time.
Giving 4 stars instead of 5 for atmosphere because security cameras feel a little under the eye of big brother but it's standard practice everywhere these days.
Definitely worth the trip and thanks to the staff for a great evening! (by Jeffrey Knight) [a month ago] | Review 3: 4 stars - Absolutely surprisingly flavorful foods! In the midst of what seems to be a bit of a sleepy town, we rolled into the Peppermill after 8 on a Friday night to find ourselves among three birthday celebrations clearly enjoying both friendly environment and delicious meals.

We didn‚Äôt drink, so our bill reflects just 2 mains and a pavlova dessert (interestingly sort of stuffed with a cream) and totaled ‚Ç¨65. We had two dinners featuring fish fillets. Both were layered with nuanced flavor and were presented beautifully. The bake was especially interesting and prepared perfectly. We considered going back the next night.

Like all the places we ate in Ireland, once you‚Äôve got your food, the staff forgets you, even to the point of having to chase someone down to pay. This adds a bit of downtime to one‚Äôs meal, even if it is them trying not to rush you. (by c hart) [a month ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Best restaurant we've been to on our trip to Ireland so far. Friendly staff, big portions and delicious food. The seafood chowder especially is not only the best seafood chowder we've had in Ireland (every place makes it a bit different) but it's one of the tastiest meals I've ever eaten. It's considered an appetizer but definitely big enough as a main course. Highly recommend! (by Alex Joseph) [3 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Food i would highly rate here ! -  ' a step above!!  '     üôÇ    my second time here and with talking to other diners also , very nice  level of cuisine all round !  ,'  I love the food in this place!  ,  friendly  welcoming staff ( not overbearing !-  )  relaxed atmosphere!    ( im fussy about food quality/ taste and presentation!  " highly recommend the experience !! "   - and  dreamy surroundings- (by William Purcell) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - My wife and I enjoyed a wonderful early dinner here last Thursday. The service and ambiance were matched by the high quality food at very reasonable prices. (by Michael Dawson) [a week ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Hidden gem outside of killaloe. Inside lovely decoration and attentive staff. And the food is exceptional. Really good price / performance ratio.

Have been there on our first night in Ireland and will happily return as regulars. (by Peter K. Schmidt) [2 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Enjoyed delicious starters and main courses on Brian Buro Sunday lunch. Delightful staff and very attentive.  All meals and drinks were served in good time and serving staff were very efficient (by Dianne Bourke) [2 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Off the beaten track and still very busy! With no reservations, we sat at the bar- food fresh, tasty, plentiful, with good service- roast beef with added steamed veg for ‚Ç¨16 lunch menu! Nice outdoor space also (by L S) [3 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Outside photos taken on a wet day but with the fantastic outdoor area now in place I needed to book an outside seat to ensure I wouldn't be inside on a close day.  Staff wonderful.  Fish amazing and others had meat which was of equal high standards (by Suzanne Hayes) [4 years ago]

name: Rag√π & Co - Italian Restaurant in SA
address: 308C Main N Rd, Clare SA 5453, Australia
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Dinner was absolutely delicious. The staff were lovely.

The mushroom and truffle arrinchini was delicious and the veal was amazing.

The kids meal was very large but also yummy my son enjoyed it.

Margeretta pizza was divine. Had the good cheese not just shredded cheese and also had basil on the pizza.

My partner had the linguine seafood pasta dish he said that he couldn't taste the seafood and there wasn't many prawns or crab meat but was still lovely.

I had the risotto with sausage and pumpkin. It was lovely and the texture for me was perfect it wasn't gluggy.

Thankyou for a lovely dinner. (by Courtney Bren) [2 weeks ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Oh wow! What wonderful food. The beef and pork rags was outstanding, the smoked chicken‚Ä¶well I actually didn‚Äôt know chicken could be that tender and moist and actually be cooked! The flavours were stunning, service fantastic and the owner came around to check on things and answer any questions. Cannot recommend more highly. (by Grant Grosser) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - I'm sooo glad 3 of us shared 3 different dishes, so that I got to try them all! I can't pick a favourite. And all of what we chose could be made Gluten free, including the garlic bread pizza! Friendly staff, warm fire, great atmosphere. Can recommend!! (by Natasha Kent) [4 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - It was an amazing d√Æner. It‚Äôs notnthat easy to find fine italian restaurant.  This one is definitly one of them. Cocktails, pizzas and desert were on the spot. And service was great ! (by Guillaume Thebaud) [4 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Wonderful dinner tonight at Ragu in the Clare valley. Two lovely glasses of Italian wine, one a lovely Prosecco and then a rose with our mains. We started with burratta with prosciutto which we shared.  It was beautifully creamy and had a lovely caramelised balsamic dressing and basil leaves. Then two delicious mains, Ragu with pasta and polenta with prawns, fish and calamari in a tomato sauce. Both were excellent. A tiramisu to finish was lovely.
Another excellent meal at Ragu, and we would highly recommend this restaurant. (by wendy adams) [6 months ago] | Review 6: 1 star - The mushroom truffle gnocchi was absolutely flavourless.  I‚Äôve had better gnocchi from a frozen meal.   Food was returned and we left due to having no confidence that any of their food would be worth trying.
- An addition to this review.   The owner claims the meal was packed with umami - I have eaten at many Italian restaurants around the world and have never had a gnocchi that was so tasteless and watery.   He even agreed that there was something wrong with the dish when he tried it after taking it back. (by Kym Hobbs) [Edited 2 weeks ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Authentic Italian Restaurant and Pizzeria. A warm and inviting ambience inside. Upon arrival, we were escorted to our Table, close to the slow combustion fire. Just perfect ! The Menu selection has authentic Italian cuisine but also various other Dishes and Pizza as well. Prices are average and fair ( mid $30's on average for Mains)  You can find their Menu online. Wine and Spirit selection is good. We had the Shiraz and the Italian Prosecco which was beautifully light on the palette and bursting with plenty of bubbles.  On my shopping list for sure !
We ordered the "Maccheroni AL Rag√π Napoletano" (slow cooked chunky beef and pork ragu in a rich tomato sauce) which had a generous amount of chunky meat I must say which impressed us both and the "Ravioli di Granchio"  (house made Ravioli with fresh SA blue swimmer Crab, confit cherry Tomato and fresh dill)  ... they were
both authentic Italian and absolutely delicious !
The Service was friendly and very attentive both evenings we dined.  On the first evening before leaving, a friendly gentleman by the name of Salvatore that we had seen many times busily attending to Patrons during the evening, genuinely asked us if we were happy with everything and our reply... 10/10.  We look forward to returning to Clare soon and Ragu Restaurant will be the first place we will be sure to re-book.  A credit to everyone from the bottom to the top, including young Rory who was our Waiter both evenings we visited. His cheerful banter was lovely, along with his sharp, attentive Service.  Well done all, including the talented Chefs and others in the background that synergistically make this place great !  üëèüëèüëè (by Michele Miers) [Edited a year ago] | Review 8: 4 stars - Very nice authentic Italian restaurant in Clare valley.
The food was very nice but not amazing but probably the best around the area.
The sommelier Salvatore helped us a lot in choosing the best wines to go with our food.
The location is perfect and the atmosphere inside is very warm and welcoming.
If you're in Clare valley this is probably one of the best restaurants that you can find. (by Fabio Gesmundo) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Stopped at Ragu&Co in Clare for lunch on a Saturday afternoon and had a great experience. Was warmly welcomed by Romolo the owner and his staff.
The menu was a great selection of antipastas, entrees, mains and desserts. They even had a selection of pizzas. We ordered 2 entrees, 2 mains and 2 desserts and both of us were very happy with our orders. They were promptly brought to our table. They were very well presented. They were generous portions and most importantly, they were delicious.
If you're in the region and looking for a lovely spot to have lunch or dinner, I definitely recommend Ragu&Co. (by Muay Thai Old Guy) [Edited a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Great Italian spot in Clare.
Had great service from when we walked in. Leah our server was fantastic with banter as well when pouring drinks.

All staff were attentive and friendly, if you not head to Ragu and Co when you‚Äôre in the area, you‚Äôre wasting your life. (by Martin Rochester) [a month ago]

name: Conners Restaurant & Bar
address: White Hut Rd, Clare SA 5453, Australia
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Wonderful food and service. Had the pork belly and the cherry pie, and both were incredible.
The staff were also very friendly and attentive
I will be eating here again and thoroughly recommend it. (by Jordan K) [2 years ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - The breakfast buffet was a beautiful addition to our stay! Linda and Jasmin had wonderful and friendly service! A special mention to Linda who was really bubbly and welcoming üòÅ (by Sarah Griffin) [7 months ago] | Review 3: 1 star - Currently staying in room 36 and the guest instructions say "use the room phone" to call for room service on a Saturday night at 950pm.

There is no phone.

Call the number for the hotel.

Get an after hours service. He insists we use the room phone.

There isn't one.

Have turned the room upside down looking for a room phone. Nothing.

After hours service says he cannot contact anyone to help.

Phone number for the restaurant is the same as the hotel.

Pitiful service by all involved - we won't be back. (by Ivan) [a year ago] | Review 4: 1 star - Shocking over priced from starters to main course - 30 minutes. Don‚Äôt buy the steak totally overpriced for stuff all (by Brenton Hooper) [2 years ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Had a  lovely dinner at Connors Restaurant.
The service given by Connor and Wil was excellent. (by Heather) [a year ago] | Review 6: 4 stars - Good little bar. Definitely worthwhile a drink by the fire if you are staying there. (by Chris Parsons) [2 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Try the prawns and other dishes .
Tasty food. (by P K Singh) [2 years ago]

name: Food cottage
address: 3 The Green, Sixmilebridge, Co. Clare, Ireland
service_options: Tasty bite Indian Takeaway ¬∑ 4.0 stars ¬∑ 81 reviews ¬∑ Indian Takeout
reviews: Review 1: 5 stars - Chicken kebab is huge and you have all in one i will say is the best one on Village not just kebab but as well burgers and IT is worth to buy IT thx (by Anita A) [3 years ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Great value for money. Excellent pizza & chips. Staff behind counter very professional, courteous & helpful. Outside of building could do with a uplift. Does not do the business justice. Maybe a new paint job & some plants outside & clean up. Just a suggestion (by june danaher) [a year ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - chicken wrap meal outstanding very very nice couldnt ask for better fast delivery and very nice staff i would really recommend best food in sixmilebridge (by mikayla mcnamara) [a year ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - very polite staff very easy to phone order and collect all cooked fresh great value chips nice and dry chicken lovely and moist pizzas kebabs all top class cooking area looks spotless we keep going back 10/10 (by Conor Mc Namara) [2 years ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - You two, blow me (by Fire Crystals) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Food was amazing specially pizza was best in the area very reasonable prices for food quality‚Ä¶smiley jolly guy was serving on the tills‚Ä¶üòÇ ‚Ä¶ (by Saad Hassan) [4 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Best pizza üçï in the town very fast delivery amazing ü§©‚Ä¶. (by David David) [a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Very good pizza and chips and staff is very nice would definitely recommend (by Neil √≥g Mac giolla cearra) [3 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Great guys and good food . Great take away option for kids parties ü•≥ ‚Ä¶ (by Declan O'Reilly) [2 years ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - Decent food, reasonable portions, good service. (by Stewart Worth) [3 years ago]

name: RAW Interiors & Cafe/Pizzeria
address: Church St, Shantraud, Killaloe, Co. Clare, V94 RX5D, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - The food was so fresh and authentic with stone-bakes bread. Staff were so welcoming and friendly. Loved the design and the interior furniture. Nice cozy spot for coffee/wine or dine (by Darrell Mc Dermott) [5 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - We enjoyed two delicious pizzas at RAW ‚Äî thin crust, fresh ingredients, just the way we like them. Service was friendly and our food arrived quickly. The atmosphere is relaxed and welcoming. We‚Äôll definitely be back to try the breakfast menu! (by James McGrath) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - We'd been recommended this by a friend and it didn't disappoint. Not only was the food and service lovely, but to our lovely surprise, there was a live jazz group playing and a few customers up dancing.
So, apparently, this is an ongoing event here every Sunday evening. We will definitely come again. Such a great atmosphere and experience. (by Dave Mullen) [a year ago] | Review 4: 4 stars - A cozy cafe with picnic style tables on one side and smaller seating on the other. We were seated at a 2 top and the only ones sitting in that area. The lunch menu is just the right mix with pizza, pasta, salads, and sandwiches. We ordered Panuzzi's that are similar to a calzone except a tortilla style crust folded in half. The crust was crunchy with just the right amount of filling and cheese. It was served on a cutting board with a small mixed greens salad. The atmosphere was like being in someone's crowded basement. Though it was a clever idea selling decorative items such as lighting. The parking can be a little challenging with the small narrow roads. (by Robert Schuppert-McDonald) [6 months ago] | Review 5: 3 stars - Went for mother's day lunch. Lovley interior and atmosphere, nice art pieces for sale. Food was average. Too much stuff on the pizza so the base was soggy.. the place could really.improve on cleanliness.Table was wiped but was still was  sticky in places with some stuff even my napkin got stuck on it. Water jug had a drop of some yellow stuff on the top and something was floating in the water. Of course it was changed no problem after we asked. I wouldn't go back there for food. (by Auksita Jaro) [a year ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - I was in Killaloe for a 3 day break and went here for a meal second evening was fab so went back again third night Pizza beautiful and anti pasta sharing platters are fab also good value (by Myles Meagher) [a month ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Most amazing find on our short break in the area. Stunning food. Very authentic. Easy vibe. (by Lorraine Grace) [3 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - I recently visited RAW with a group of friends while in Killaloe for a stag. We were looking for some food and didn't feel like filling up on chipper food and so as we walked down Church Street we stumbled upon RAW!
What a little gem in Clare!

Staff:
The staff were great. They are very friendly, attentive and they were good humoured and had the craic with us.
Our server's name was Amelia and she was a delight!

Food:
They offer a variety of delicious freshly hand made pizzas and I chose the "RAW's Luxury Pizza". It was absolutely fantastic!
lt was full of flavour between the crispy base, Burrata cheese and the spicey Salami. The Burrata was in the centre on a bed of rocket!
I also ordered a side of the "Hand Cut Oven Baked Spicy Wedges" and I have to say they were amazing!

Drinks:
I ordered a cocktail with my meal and I have to say that they make lovely drinks here!
I also added the "Dirty" option to the cocktail which was an extra shot of rum to the best of my memory.

Decor:
The restaurant is located in what I believe was once an interiors shop. The dining area is decorated with all sorts of items giving the place a unique feel.

Wheelchair Accessibility:
The premises is on a hill but there is a flat level floor leading in from the street. The first floor is a decent size for maneuvering around the tables.
However, there is a step down to where the kitchen is and I am not sure if there are further tables down there.
I also think the toilets are down at this lower step, I am not sure if there is a wheel chair accessible toilet on the first floor that is lever with the street.

Overall:
I have to say that it was a really enjoyable experience dining at RAW for the first time!
The food is presented really well and tastes delicious. The staff were excellent and had a laugh with us.
I will definitely be back in the not too distant future! (by Thomas Thornton) [2 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - EDIT: as of writing this, this locale no longer serves food. Bummer :(

Genuinely the best pizza I've ever eaten, I believe they have a genuine pizza firing oven, conventional ovens simply can't beat that. The serving staff are all very kind and efficient as well. Whenever I have an excuse to go there for a Pizza and coffee, I gladly do. Highly recommended, 11/10. (by Kacper) [Edited a month ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - This may sound dramatic, but this was the best meal I‚Äôve had in Ireland. I‚Äôm in town from Michigan and haven‚Äôt been able to find a good vegetable meal. The veggie pizza and veggie sub were AMAZING. Compliments to the chef, and we will remember our time in Killaloe because of the coconut cake we had for dessertü´† (by Nicholas Kristock) [3 months ago]

name: The Holly Tree
address: Main St, Tulla, Co. Clare, V95 WA4Y, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Thanks so much to Kate and the Holly Tree team for the fantastic catering they provided for a recent family event in Tulla. Kate's suggestions were perfect. The food was just delicious and complimented by all. I have no hestation in recommending The Holly Tree. (by Anna-Marie Dreyfus) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Great little bakery, they make absolutely everything from scratch, even custard and the dough for the croissants. Definitely worth a visit, I would personally recommend the cinnamon rolls and vegetarian sausage roll. Staff are friendly and helpful too, and the place accommodates for different dietary restrictions. (by Aoife Gately) [a year ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - we are sooo lucky to have such a gem just around the corner! It's a little heaven filled with the most delicious homemade treats. My list of the favorites never ends, cinnamon buns, amazing eclairs, chocolate brownies, yummy cakes. Very tasty lunch meals, try the chicken wrap or veggie rolls and you will surely be back for more pretty soon :) (by K P) [11 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - On a road trip from Galway we ended up in Tula and called to The Holly Tree by chance. And glad we did. A lovely place with a great range of sweet and savoury treats. Coffee was great, black pudding sausage roll amazing. Chicken and stuffing sambo super tasty. My personal favourite was the maple and pecan cinnamon swirl. Staff were lovely to deal with and the number of customers says it all. A great experience and looking forward to going back. (by stephen foley) [a year ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - The coffee is fantastic, got a very tasty double espresso yesterday and the flavour was beautiful. All the food is excellent, from sausage rolls, to soups and amazing desserts, everything I've tried so far is delicious (by deeduck48) [a year ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - the food in the HOLLY TREE  is remarkable , i hear so many people complementing it ,,, and they are right ,,, (by john hunt) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - All food is made in house amazing value for amazing food Staff are extremely helpful, coffee is great. Definitely recommend the dessert options (by Faustina Mc Eniry) [10 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - The Holly Tree is one of them hidden gems!
Fresh and tasty food all made in house.

Very reasonably priced, the staff are really friendly and after a visit you will want to come back for more.

Cannot recommend this place enough! (by Conor Meyler) [2 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Visited here today - a limited variety of to- go meals, sausage rolls, quiche ‚Ä¶ and delicious bakery goods - so enamoured with the cream doughnut/ lemon meringue pie with coffees that we enjoyed in a local park- I forgot to photograph!!! Delicious - reminded me of the goods from the Bakers Cafe in Miltown Malbay that has long since closed down üò´ What a treat- will definitely return!! (by L S) [3 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Great friendly staff. Super tasty food that's made fresh every day. Large choice of baked goods. All for very reasonable prices. (by Kristine P) [3 years ago]

name: Clare Restaurant
address: 7WX2+PJW, Sanciangko St, Cebu City, 6000 Cebu, Philippines
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - I liked this restaurant. The serving portions were big, and the prices were affordable. The food also tasted good. The place was spacious and clean. The staff was also great.

As you can see, the porkchop-to-rice ratio in the picture was generous (by Delfin, Khey) [6 months ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - Good Philippino restaurant. Prices are pretty good, but portions are aligned with prices (sisig was very small and not much meat, more fat than anything). The Pork Sinigang was large and the broth was very tasty. They also have a grill outside, so you can order BBQ items. (by Olivier Guillard) [8 months ago] | Review 3: 4 stars - My first meal in Philippines.  Very helpful staff.  Food was a right portion and very cheap.  As no greens on a dish, you may want to order some vegetable dishes. Cash only. (by N W7) [a year ago] | Review 4: 4 stars - We have a Lechon Kiwali with Rice for 219 and a Lomi a 99 pesos.

The Lechon Kiwali is a bit dry, relatively oily, but the taste is okay and the portion given is quite substantial. It can be quite dry with just the Lechon and white rice, so I used some chili sauce with it.

The Lomi is similar to the Malaysian dish, Lor Mee Âç§Èù¢ (Braised Noodles), famous from Hulu Yam, with its distinct white thick soup containing egg whites. The difference is that Lomi here added some black peppers. The taste is good on its own. As it is not common to add black vinegar to this dish here, there are no suitable vinegar to add to the Lomi.

The staffs are friendly and the environment is relatively comfortable, despite not being air-conditioned. Note that the place is indoor with fans, it might be stuffy at times.

Overall, a good place for an affordable meal. (by Chee Hwa Tang) [a year ago] | Review 5: 4 stars - Clare Restaurant is one of my go-to spots when I want affordable, delicious Filipino food. Their Lechon Kawali and Lomi are the best ‚Äî super flavorful and worth the price (by Annalyn Pasulojan) [3 months ago] | Review 6: 1 star - Nice staffs. Good food. Bangus was not boneless and served without the vegetables as seen on the picture. The chairs need to be clean. Nice ambiance, high ceiling and no music. A.C. is ok. You have to ask for tissue/napkins. They can speak english. The restaurant is about 10 years. Good location. (by leo mendoza) [5 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Super affordable and delicious food! I tried the carbonara many times and was never disappointed! The food comes out relatively quick, and they have cold water machines for 1 peso if needed. I always had so many delicious meals for super cheap here and recommend you to try them! They also have a hand wash and bathroom easily accessible at the entrance. Recommend 5/5 üëç (by Jovan Zuniga) [11 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - I had a cheap, clean, quality and delicious meal with drinks for only 135 pesos, I was very pleased, thank you. (by Yunus emre ≈ûahinduran) [6 months ago] | Review 9: 2 stars - Not recommended.  The portion was way to small, which was a good thing in this case, because the food was not very appealing. Mangoshake was okay. (by MrMattss) [2 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Best sisig and garlic rice ive had during my month here in the Philippines. Highly recommend for quality food. Prices very reasonable as well.
Came at lunchtime and was very busy, lucky to find a seat (by Alexander Kalinin) [a year ago]

name: Magpie & Stump Hotel
reviews:
Review 1: None - Great meal, had the cheeseburger which came with chips and onion rings ü§§ü§§ was absolutely delicious and worth every cent. The fun thing about the cheeseburger for me was the seeded mustard, that gave it a nice kick to it. Should‚Äôve taken a photo at the time but didn‚Äôt. (by Claire Woods) | Review 2: None - Great classic pub menu, specials and typical quality Clare Valley wine list plus good array of local brews on tap. Matt very helpful. (by Jeff Duell) | Review 3: None - Lesson learnt: dont judge a book by the cover. When we 1st drove past i wasn‚Äôt that impressed, but the guy at Reillys cellar door explained it was the best food around. What a surprise, the interior is fantastic. Stacked stone, great artwork and the food is fantastic. Will definitely be back. Cheers (by Darren Jourdain) | Review 4: None - Took the advice of locals and friends and had dinner at the Magpie & Stump. Lovely place for dinner with the most delicious food. The potato and leek soup was divine!!! Very cosy near the fire. Great service and extremely welcoming. Amanda and Paul were the consummate hosts. Definitely recommend popping in for a meal. (by Sherina Wurst) | Review 5: None - Gorgeous old school country pub in a stunning historic town. Nice to wander around and take in the area. The food was pretty good, quite small portions compared to some pics online that we've seen so maybe a little inconsistent. The service however, from the young French guy (sorry we didn't catch your name) quite seriously made the experience for every single lunch diner today. He was bubbly and friendly, has a real presence about him, despite being busy, nothing was a trouble. He acknowledged the kids too. What a champion, I hope you pass on the positive feedback to him directly and know how valuable he was to your business today.  We would return and try another meal again. (by Kaitlyn McMahon) | Review 6: None - Best country pub in SA.
The draft kolsch is nothing short of sensational.
Food is outstanding
And service is Aussie country style.
Stayed here 3 times and accomm is fantastic.
Nothing not to love.
Enjoy!!! (by David Kite) | Review 7: None - This is a busy place so don‚Äôt expect super quick service but they do a great job all the same. It‚Äôs in a quaint old town with history screaming from every street. Located in the heart of wine country. (by Julie Sleeman) | Review 8: None - Amazing dinner place !
Service is very nice and the food‚Ä¶ awesome ! We had quite different meals and everything was delicious ! Charming restaurant with a lot of choice.

Would recommend 100% to visit and eat here ! (by Granier Nell) | Review 9: None - We had a great night at the Magpie and Stump.
Settled in front of the cozy fire with great meals, fine local wines and beer and friendly people. Loved it. (by Anne Hannon) | Review 10: None - I honestly did not expect to be this impressed. As someone who dines out regularly for most meals, I‚Äôve come to expect a certain standard ‚Äî and The Magpie and Stump exceeded expectations. The food here isn‚Äôt just ‚Äúgreat for a country pub‚Äù ‚Äî it‚Äôs genuinely exceptional, full stop. Every dish was so well presented, and DELICIOUS. This place is a hidden gem, and worth the drive just for the meal alone. I‚Äôll absolutely be back (just for the Pie of the day tbh)! (by Nathaniel Stephen)

name: Eva's
address: 10 Merchants Square, Clonroad Beg, Ennis, Co. Clare, V95 WRX0, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Greatest soups ever, and amazing sandwiches!
The food tastes delicious and super fresh. The service is quick and the staff are very friendly!
Highly suggest this place, especially if you're a tourist as this will be the one spot I'd say to not overlook! (by V A) [4 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Super tasty! Recommend soup and sandwich special! Cajun chicken ciabatta was especially tasty. The staff are so friendly, smiling and super accommodating! There is an outdoor area too. (by Magda Chelstowska) [a year ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - We were on our way to Galway and dropped in at Ennis for Break and lunch.
Thankfully we found Eva's. We had great soups and fantastic soda bread. Staff was friendly and helpful.
We highly recommend Eva's for a great healthy meal. (by Stephen Kelly) [3 weeks ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Lovely meal! Fresh and quick!! Cappuccino was delicious. I got the soup and sandwich special which was generous and very reasonably priced.  ‚ô•Ô∏è (by beenzotarmie) [11 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Very nice soup and sandwiches.  The coffee is good and good value for money.  The service can be a bit slow but it's worth the wait.  The staff are very nice and the place is so clean. (by Guitar Lady) [Edited a year ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - A must is in Enis! Homey, quiet and just lovely! We had the soup sandwhich special! Everything is home made! The best chicken club sandwhich I have had! My kids even loved it the soup and asked for seconds! Thank you so much Eva's!! Service and so friendly! (by TALIN Mirzayan) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Probably the best cafe in Ennis. Always consistent with the quality of food and good service. Tita is very friendly and checks to ensure everything is ok. The Hungarian goulash is so good and the Veggie Hero sandwich. It never disappoints! (by Shane Grehan) [2 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Really nice staff and drinks ‚ô•Ô∏è (by Aisha Jedir) [4 days ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Wow best seafood chowder I have ever tasted - you must go ! We both had the soup and a sandwich deal and everything was delicious! Would recommend Eva‚Äôs ! (by fiona bailey) [3 months ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - I had the sweet potato soup along with cheese cake, and it was very nice. I didn‚Äôt use the restroom, but the dining area was clean. I dined indoors, but the outdoor seating seemed inviting, as well. (by Keith Tynan) [6 months ago]

name: Cozy Cottage Cafe
address: Main St, Sixmilebridge, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Nice place by the river.
Staff was friendly and food was very good.
The terrace is ideal when the weather is nice...
Highly recommended (by steve nenagh) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Delicious food and really enjoyable experience. Service was friendly and welcoming. We enjoyed the chicken & bacon salad, and the sweet-chilli chicken wrap. Food was tasty and portions were generous. The coffee was good and the home-baked options were very tempting. The outdoor seating was comfortable with views of the O'Garney river. Highly recommended and will return again. (by Ain View Studio Dubai) [a year ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - A lovely cosy cafe with nice atmosphere.  Breakfast was delicious & lovely homemade fresh brown bread & toast. Staff very friendly. (by mary dempsey) [a year ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Had breakfast on the way from Shannon Airport. Excellent food. The omelette was very filling and soft. Pleasant service. Great location, just by the river. (by Joseph Fernandez) [2 weeks ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Very friendly cafe with excellent food and a nice atmosphere. Dog friendly area outside with a shelter and nice view of the river. I had the steak baguette and it was delicious, would recommend to all! (by Teo Ryan-Castillo) [3 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Friendly staff. Good place for quick bites. Looks like family running business, homemade food. Nice surroundings, river is just besides the cafe. Recommended for good food and nice view. (by Picturesque Travel) [5 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Top class place for breakfast and lunch. Very friendly staff. Highly recommended. (by Patrick J. Keating) [a month ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - The food is a very high standard.  Absolutely delicious and very friendly staff (by Sylvia Johnston) [a month ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Great food, very friendly staff and best of all was very welcome of our dog in an outside undercover seating area (by Carolyn Fletcher) [3 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Good value, and the desserts especially the cheese cake are amazing! (by True Review) [2 weeks ago]

name: Hotel Doolin
reviews: Review 1: None - The suite was more than enough room. Bedding and bathroom were Better than our expectations. Great deck and view. I enjoyed a morning walk to the coast and pier which was an added bonus. Fitz Pub provided and authentic and traditional Irish experience with the live music and Irish Stew. Breakfast was delicious. Highly recommend (by F1146NOjenniferk) | Review 2: None - A wonderful family wedding and holiday all rolled into one. Hotel staff couldn't be more helpful, probably the best wedding event we have ever attended. Been able to walk to the cliffs every morning with our dogs, and enjoy a coffee and pastry on the way back in Sean N√≥s was an experience not to be forgotten. (by X3263XAseanh) | Review 3: None - We stayed at the Guesthouses at Hotel Doolin- what a wonderful experience.||The staff was very friendly and helpful. They greet you will home made bread and say good bye with bread to go! The guesthouse was clean and roomy with a washer/dryer. We will stay here again! (by michelew60) | Review 4: None - What a great day we had celebrating Niamh and Sam‚Äôs wedding at Doolin. Everything was perfect the wedding, the guests, the food, the drink, the band, the dancing and absolutely the Craic! A big shout out to all the staff in hotel and the ‚Ä¶ (by S4784ILdaved) | Review 5: None - Hotel is great.  Very clean and quiet.  Spent time in the pub, had both dinner and breakfast in the restaurant.  All great.   Highly recommend and we will tell everyone going to Doolin to stay there. (by TomO033) | Review 6: None - My husband and I stopped in for a cocktail and a snack at the bar in the afternoon, and bartender Tomas made an incredible Irish coffee. It was the best I've had in a very long time and his service was over the top!   Thank you Tom'as !! (by Teresa Anderson) | Review 7: None - This is an extremely cozy and friendly hotel near the Cliffs of Moher. The town of Doolin itself is inviting and charming, with some great restaurants and pubs to choose from. The staff at Hotel Doolin were attentive, friendly and very ‚Ä¶ (by S6214DCjoshuar) | Review 8: None - A piece of heaven! We really enjoyed our stay there and look forward to returning. Very friendly staff, superb food and overall a great experience. The attached pub was a lively and friendly spot. (by barnman2016) | Review 9: None - Hotel Doolin is a touch of class. It has everything...lovely rooms, ideal location, great staff. There are so many little nooks and crannies to sit in if you want to get away from the crowds. A great place to be based if you are looking to explore Co Clare. (by Trip00567288691) | Review 10: None - Attending a wedding here, staff were so friendly despite the number of guests, always referred to by name. Stayed in Suites, so roomy, but cozy, had all the amenities. Will definitely be back (by tog1504)

name: Vaughans Anchor Inn
reviews:
Review 1: None - I dined here at the weekend and had the best experience. The staff are fantastic; very, very professional and welcoming. The decor is nice and modern, and the food is without a doubt Michelin star worthy, more than worthy, as you can see from the pictures.
Well worth a visit here.

My only gripe was the cocktails, they were not traditionally made.. for example the whiskey sour was missing bitters and the old fashioned was fizzy. I have never had a fizzy old fashioned, and I would not have ordered it had I known it would be carbonated. The drinks menu should reflect what cocktails you have on offer, in addition to your own spin on drinks. However, still 5 stars, I had a lovely time here. (by Teresa) | Review 2: None - We are still staying at this wonderful hotel, and we just want to say a heartfelt thank you for an amazing experience! Everything here is at the highest level ‚Äî the cleanliness is impeccable, and the staff are incredibly kind, attentive, and professional.

The food in the hotel‚Äôs restaurant is something truly special ‚Äî a unique fine dining experience, especially the seafood dishes, which were absolutely exquisite. Even the breakfast stands out, with high-quality ingredients and a wide variety of delicious options.

In our room, we found complimentary water, coffee, tea, chips, and ‚Äî most impressively ‚Äî homemade cookies, which we assume were made by the hotel‚Äôs own team. Such a thoughtful touch!

It was my wife‚Äôs birthday during our stay, and thanks to this hotel, we had a perfect day. We couldn‚Äôt have asked for more.

We wholeheartedly recommend this hotel and would return without hesitation. Thank you once again! (by Tudor Madan) | Review 3: None - We were staying next door and this restaurant was recommended to us. The decor is lovely. The staff are very friendly. They do need to be a little more attentive as on a few occasions we had to ask again for something as they had forgotten it. All in all a great meal (by Lisa Wraight) | Review 4: None - Arrived in West Clare to spend a few nights just for a little rewind, recharge, rest and relaxation. A friend had recommended Vaughan's to eat, so we booked in for 2 nights B&B for handiness. The room was perfect for us - the bed was ‚Ä¶ (by V1801GBannec) | Review 5: None - We dined and stayed at Vaughans Anchor Inn. Five stars all round. Lovely room with good attention to detail. Loved the Taytos and cookies. Food faultless - lunch, dinner and breakfast. Excellent service - my husband forgot his phone charger and the young man behind the bar charged it for him.
Thank you for a happy experience. (by Marie Ryan) | Review 6: None - This is our 2nd visit to Vaughans Anchor Inn.|We really enjoyed it on both occasions. We had 2 delicious evening meals there as well as breakfast on 3 mornings.|The accommodation is comfortable and great to just head upstairs after dinner ‚Ä¶ (by DrumCree2019) | Review 7: None - Had another great meal here today. I make a point of swinging by any time I‚Äôm in West Clare.

We had a few pieces from their starter menu for lunch, all were excellent. The Vietnamese dressing on the oysters was sensational.

The chips are done in beef dripping and are incredible, the best in Ireland. (by David S) | Review 8: None - Anyone who leaves less than 5 stars must be very unlucky or dead inside! The friendliest staff, delicious food, comfortable rooms and a wonderful atmosphere. Did I mention how brilliant the staff are? Go for the Tattinger Champagne experience.  Great value. (by Francis Nesbitt) | Review 9: None - Gorgeous dining experience! Waiters were so attentive and each course came out at a timely manner and each one as beautiful as the next. Oysters were fab and monkfish was lovely. Lovely and classy vibe to the restaurant. Highly recommend. (by Emma Downes) | Review 10: None - Hotel room had roaches. We informed the manager and she didn‚Äôt seem concerned or offer a resolution. Beds are uncomfortable and rooms were hot and stuffy, no air flow. We had dinner in their restaurant before our stay and the lobster was so overcooked we had to cut it with a steak knife. Very disappointing all around, would not recommend. Seems like it‚Äôs run by teenagers mostly. (by Katherine Roberts)

name: H√¥ NAI Vietnamese Kitchen
address: 228 Main N Rd, Clare SA 5453, Australia
reviews:
Review 1: 4 stars - Tucked away from the hustle and bustle (because, let‚Äôs be honest, Clare‚Äôs "bustle" is about three tractors and a ute), there's a little treasure known only to the locals‚ÄîHo NAI Vietnamese Kitchen. It‚Äôs the kind of place where everyone walks in to a chorus of first-name greetings, except, of course, for you, the obvious outsider.

Naturally, we went straight for the Banh Mi, because why pretend to be adventurous? The staff, with a knowing grin, decided we weren‚Äôt built for the chilli. "No chilli, too hot for you." Wow. Read me like a book, didn‚Äôt they? Maybe it was the Melbourne glare in my eyes, or perhaps they just didn‚Äôt feel like calling an ambulance. Either way, we survived‚Äîalbeit mildly under-spiced.

But honestly, between the country-style hospitality (charmingly blunt) and the Vietnamese warmth (literal and figurative), the place is worth a stop‚Äîespecially if you‚Äôre just passing through and need to be gently reminded that you're not quite as tough as you think you are. (by Rob) [5 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Great place for a decent Banh Mi. Don't pay attention to the few bad reviews on here, they are just complaining needy city people. This would have to be the best Vietnamese food outside of Adelaide for sure. (by Josh Adams) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - The food is wonderful.  I had the Lemongrass Chicken Salad with coriander & chilli. Sublime!
Lovely and fresh.
The Cafe is small, neat and clean. The staff are friendly and efficient. (by Sandra Fawbert) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 1 star - we stopped here for lunch on our way south to Adelaide and wanted to try this.
We ordered tofu noodle bowl and spring roll noodle bowl but after ordering the woman at the cashier (can't call her waitress as she did not wait on us) told us they were out of rice noodles....(ie the type of thin rice noodle you buy at Foodland next door and cook up in 2 min).ummm?

So I changed mine to a tofu salad and my husband had springroll on fried rice.

This place was one of the poorer food experience in South Australia for the following reasons:

A) food was not authentic. No herbs not even coriander added to the salad
The fried rice was abysmal and not too different  from what you get from heating uncle Ben's. Dry, flavourless and dotted with frozen vegetables that were hard to chew
B) my meagre tofu salad was still $16 which was extremely overpriced even when it was supposed to have noodles in it.
C) everything served in takeaway containers even when eating in.

Really really ordinary  food and my only  recommendations for this place is not to waste your time or money there. Its not real Vietnamese food because it's so far from it. (by Amy K) [2 years ago] | Review 5: 2 stars - We love our Vietnamese and this wasn‚Äôt it üò¢. Both the stir-fry chicken noodles and the pork Com bowl were very overpriced for such a small bowl serving- we are still hungry. Noodles were cold. Both lacked flavour and meat/veg substance. (by Laura Conley) [2 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - To have somewhere In Clare and be able to say that the food is absolutely phenomenal, is genuinely exciting!! Thanks guys- not only are you super friendly, your b√°nh m√¨ was absolutely beautiful. Coming from Melbourne, my standards for Vietnamese food are high- you didn't disappoint. Legends.... (by K WH) [5 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Passing through Clare and I was a bit peckish for brunch. Stumbled across Ho Nai and did not regret it! Friendly service, fresh ingredients, tasty banh mi and the baguette was super light, crispy and with a cloud like centre - too yum (by David Maddison) [4 years ago] | Review 8: 3 stars - Roll was good. Pork was good.
Not nearly enough salads.
Pictured is Bah mi no mayo all the salads.
Okay for a country town. (by Greg Anastasi) [11 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Love this place.  Well priced.  Very tasty and quick service.  Bonus that you get huge serving. I'll definitely come back! (by Mika Maxine Valentino) [11 months ago] | Review 10: 3 stars - 1pm - we went a Vietnamese roll. We got the very last of the Roast Pork. The roll itself was pretty average the toppings were okay. It certainly wasn't bad, but there was room to improve.
When we were dining in, we noticed just about everyone had different noodle bowls - next time I'd give that a go over the roll (by Vanessa Phillips) [2 years ago]

name: Annie's Caf√©
address: Kildysart Post Office, Main Street, Killadysert, Kildysart, Co. Clare, Ireland
service_options: The Village Takeaway ¬∑ 5.0 stars ¬∑ 1 review ¬∑ Fast Food
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - My husband and I go there for our coffee which is great.  I love my cuppachino. He also rates there Breakfast. We went on Sunday to have lunch. Got to meet the lovely owners Charmain and Emmet. Lovely people. Our lunch was great...Lamb cutlets with vegetables fresh...chips or mash. All the staff that work there are friendly and very nice. (by Angeline Burton) [3 days ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - An absolutely fabulous cafe in Kildysart. A real little gem. We went for a late lunch, my wife had the club sandwich and I had a burrito. Both were excellent, from a quality and portion perspective, we just couldn‚Äôt fault it in anyway.
It had the hum of being the village hotspot, with folks coming in for full dinners, to teenagers having coffee and cake. The complete cross section of the local community with the decor also giving the Clare vibe.
Seemly the breakfasts are to die for, looking forward to trying them the next time.
Long may this restaurant/cafe continue. (by Gerard Nagle) [11 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - We 3 had breakfast here - I've breakfasted in Claridge's and the London Savoy, but this place has them beat. Freshly cooked and plentiful, but most importantly the staff were a delight - very friendly but unobtrusive, and thoroughly genuine; the almost imperceptible care matters in this greedy world. I'll be back one day. (by Jack B) [2 years ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Lovely old style cafe. Perfectly clean, food was delicious and reasonably priced. Took some time for food to arrive but when it did it was obvious it had been all freshly cooked and was worth the wait. Will call again if back down this way. (by Frank Dowd) [3 years ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Great service and excellent food, lovely, quaint cafe with a lovely ambiance (by Paul Heneghan) [4 months ago] | Review 6: 1 star - It is under a new management for couple of months now and be prepared to be disappointed. The food is far from good. Forget getting beans with your breakfast. Forget seeing any greens and/or salads with your omelette or avocado eggs. Everything comes with a few very sad looking potatoes. The presentation of food is basically non existence.
Don't know who the chef is but the skills are below avarage. (by Sajla M) [Edited 2 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Great little gem in village
Annie‚Äôs cafe has been an excellent addition to Kildysart. We always make sure we visit Annie‚Äôs every time we come back to the village. Staff are extremely friendly; brilliant service and excellent food. Highly recommended. (by Chee Liew) [a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - We came all the way from NY and had the best latte and scone I ever tasted.  Adorable town and staff was extremely friendly.  Loved supporting this small cafe. (by Anne Horan) [11 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Great to see something new in the village & a place to go for a chat and a coffee. Extensive menu on offer from brekafast to dinners to sandwiches & desserts. They have an outdoor area aswell! (by Claire B) [6 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Had the best bacon and cabbage at Annie‚Äôs recently. Good portion and the sauce was superb! Glad to have Annie‚Äôs in our village of Kildysart. Highly recommended! (by James Truett) [a year ago]

name: Pot Duggans
address: New Rd, Ennistimon, Ennistymon, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Absolutely loved this place! So relaxing, staff were friendly, the session was epic. I wish I could remember the name of the guy singing, he was so good! I had the pot of mussels for dinner which were great and my husband had the pizza with prosciutto, pear & blue cheese, it was delicious. Really is a cool place. (by Clare Mercer) [2 weeks ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Definitely book before coming here! We were very lucky to get a table after waiting 25 minutes, but we went to a lovely local pub and glad we did.
Great service, good vegan options and piping hot fresh food and games to play whilst you wait, what more could you ask for? (by Vegan_OMAD _no1) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Such a hidden Jem.  Food was to die for. Got the pear and blue cheese pizza Amazing and well loaded. They had so many good food choices and flavours and executed them all really well. Also got the kofkas were soooo god and it‚Äôs not easy to get them in most places but such a good food item. Really fresh. For desert got the chocolate mousse with raspberry and pistachios a really generous amount of pistachios and the raspberry was so fresh and wasnt sweetened so it pared so well with the the flavours of the rich chocolate so well. Flavours are so well balanced. Absolutely unreal food. Wish I could order the entire menu. Too bad I live so faraway. Amazing view of the waters and there was a little swing looking out at the river very nice touch. (by Sarah Jennings) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - This bar has delicious pizza and beer. Very good coffee. They have a wonderful outdoor area by the river but unfortunately it is only open in the evening and only in good weather. It took me a while for everything to coincide and I was able to visit their area by the river. Everything was great (by Alexander SpecLED) [4 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Gem of a place. Pizza and kebab were so so good.

Beautiful setting, lovely staff‚Äî one of the best pubs I‚Äôve been to, EVER!!!! (by Tom McHugh) [3 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Great Food,Great music,Great atmosphere üëå Loved it and dog Friendly üêï üëçüèª (by Bailers Wall) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Gorgeous pizza,  best I've had in  a long time. Lovely location. Will definitely be back when back in Lahinch (by Anne Moore) [4 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - You must book ahead.

The excellent: üëå
The pizzas.
The BBQ corn ribs.
The dog.

The bad:
There's a lot of cheese sauce on almost every dish.

It's definitely worth a visit.  Just make sure you book ahead or the staff will be really surly. (by David Woods) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Pitas were amazing. Awesome vibes, we came for dinner at 8:30pm on a Monday night. Lots of tap beers and one ciderüëå (by Stephanie Graskoski) [2 months ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - Reservation recommended for weekends
Food was very good! (by Daniel O Connor) [5 months ago]

name: Shannigans Gastro Pub
address: The Inn at, Dromoland, Newmarket on Fergus, Co. Clare, V95 EPF5, Ireland
reviews:
