Review 1: 4 stars - Good service. The food was overall tasty. We had the Angus double cheese burger, which suffered shrinkflation (the ketchup container is almost half the size of the burger). Same for soft drinks. For dessert we got the apple/berries crumble and the chocolate brownie, which were delicious. Apart from cost benefit, the atmosphere is good, family friendly. (by Bruna La√≠s Longo) [4 months ago] | Review 2: 3 stars - Okayish. The young man who served our table was very friendly and helpful, no complaints there. But the ma√Ætre d' didn't fill me with joy. After nearly knocking my wife off her feet on the way in (no apology) he was even less helpful than the bar staff who made me feel nearly as welcome as an injection of Ebola virus.

Would have given a two but that would do a disservice to the waiter at our table who was exemplary.

Unlikely to go back to eat there despite it being fairly close to home. There are better and cheaper options fairly nearby (by Edward W) [Edited 7 months ago] | Review 3: 1 star - Don‚Äôt bother driving or stopping here for food; signs on the doors say ‚ÄúFor Hotel Guests Only‚Äù!

How stupid to advertise a restaurant that can‚Äôt be visited unless you stay at the hotel!

Why put your business name on the exterior and also advertise if HOTEL GUESTS are only invited? Dumb, must get too much business!! (by Heath Roody) [6 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Yes, it's in the middle of nowhere, but it was seriously one of the best meals we had in Ireland.

Service was amazing, and the food portions were generous. Little bit on the pricey side, but well worth it!

My family ordered steaks and soup of the day - all tasty and nothing left on our plates. We also had room for dessert! (by Natasha Cooper) [a year ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - We had dinner at the pub while staying at the inn. It was the highlight of our stay! Our server was very friendly and took excellent care of us. The food was absolutely delicious! Would definitely return! (by Gabriela Justice) [2 years ago] | Review 6: 2 stars - Was here today 24/04/2025 at 1.45 with my husband. We ordered Club sandwich and the Caesar salad. I was asked did I want chicken with the salad and I said yes thinking I was getting strips of chicken on the salad. Unfortunately when the salad arrived there were only microscopic pieces through the salad!! No bacon pieces either which is part of a Caesar salad!! We paid the bill as we felt the staff were young and there was no point in complaining! Having said that my husband brought it to the attention of a supervisor on the way out and was told ‚Äúthis is how we serve our Caesar salads‚Äù rather dismissively.  We left disillusioned üòè (by Mary Horan) [5 months ago] | Review 7: 4 stars - Very reasonable prices for the size of the portions. Staff were polite & accommodating, meeting us at the entrance & seated us straight away.  The decor looks like it's been updated very recently & is comfortable. I will 100% be coming back here again. ‚ù§Ô∏è ‚ù§Ô∏è ‚ù§Ô∏è (by Iseult ‚ÄúIzzy‚Äù N√≠ Choitir) [3 years ago] | Review 8: 3 stars - The staff were friendly, professional and excellent at their jobs.

Stayed here for a few days and ate multiple times in the pub.

The food was ok, very plain and unoriginal. I've never been inspired by vegetables, they were just bland, the chicken was tasteless. I would expect the price point of the food to mean the flavour would match the presentation. It's edible, but it needs work.

The burger was the best of them all (by Frank Dermody) [7 months ago] | Review 9: 3 stars - We were staying in the hotel and were tired from travel and touring so we ended up eating here 2 nights. First night we had the Wild Atlantic Way seafood sharing Board since we werent totally hungry after a late lunch. Everything on the platter was done well. My favorite was definitely the seafood risotto with the greens. The second night we had an order of the fish and chips, and the sausage plate (which is not on the on-line menu). The fish and chips were good, a good size meal, the pea mush was inedible. The sausage plate was a bit disappointing as the description said it same with several (3 or 4) kinds of sausage, yet when it arrived it had 3 links of all the same sausage. (by Eric Bassett) [6 years ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - Great spot to pop in and have lunch, coffee, dinner, friendly welcome and service, good menu, good potions and value and very tasty (by Darragh Miller) [Edited 2 years ago]

name: Sevenhill Hotel
address: Main N Rd, Sevenhill SA 5453, Australia
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - It's a cosy vintage like restaurent with a super elegant cellar! The staff are very friendly and cool. The Plates are generous and the food is delicious (we had salmon and Gnochi with prawns). The wine is something else (we had the Rose and Shiraz). Great experience! (by Salwa Wardeh) [7 months ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - As far as Pubs go this one has atmosphere and a difference.
Ate in the cellar which was a nice change to the standard meal area.
Meals were nice and fresh, staff very helpful and only willing to help.
Drinks were cold as you like them.
Will be back again, thanks everyone. (by Craig Ough) [a year ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Great food and great service. My pork schnitty was yum and the chilli prawn pasta was spicy yaay.
We sat outside on a lovely day, but make sure you have a look in the cellar! (by Richard Jagger) [7 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Very good experience there.
The food was nice presented and very delicious.
A real good value for the money.
The staff was very friendly and conscientious
After guests left they cleaned not only the table also all chairs where cleaned .
I really enjoyed that they have a wide range of Clare Valley wines.
We really enjoyed the good service,food and wine. (by Dieter Albrecht) [8 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - We had a ripper time at Seven Hill Pub, kicking off with a very helpful trip from James in the courtesy bus. We were lucky to dine in the cage in the cellar and loved grabbing whatever bottles took our fancy straight off the shelf to rip open at our table. Food was delicious and affordable, highly recommend (by Rebecca Alexander) [3 weeks ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - My wife and I are travelling around SA with the caravan in tow. The caravan park we are staying in Clare, informed us that Sevenhill Hotel do a courtesy bus. So we arranged this service by a simple phone call and we were picked up on the evening of our choice by Paul. The hotel is a lovely well looked after building with lots of history and charm. The service by the staff was excellent. The food was awesome. My wife had the chicken schnitzel which was cooked perfectly, I had the rump steak which was cooked exactly how I like it. The sticky date pudding is definitely home made it's very yum. Then when we were ready to return to the caravan park Paul drove us back to the door of our caravan. I highly recommend Sevenhill Hotel. Thankyou Paul and your staff for an awesome evening we thoroughly enjoyed our evening. üëå (by Peter Moore) [a year ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Highly recommend this hotel restaurant which was recommended to us. Great food, lovely atmosphere and great service. We had the salmon and the kangaroo and they were delicious and a good size. Staff were very friendly and it all made for a great night. (by Kim Archibald) [3 weeks ago] | Review 8: 4 stars - This is a great pub for travellers with furry companions. The wine room 'selection spot' was amazing and would be amazing in a hot summer.  Food was ok but could be better. (by Lisa Howe) [2 weeks ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Fantastic pub. Paul picked us up and dropped us off in the courtesy bus from the caravan park. Great service. We had dinner in the cellar. Steaks were beautiful and we could pick our own wine from the cellar.  Amazing experience.  Friendly staff. We will be back. (by Wendy thatcher) [4 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Love the Toast Spinach Toasties, and such clean dishes made our dining experience amazing. Such a great hidden gem in the fantastic Clare Valley and will definitely come again. (by Derek Creger) [a month ago]

name: Joseph McHugh
address: Main St, Liscannor, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Excellent spot for a meal. The chowder was delicious with huge chunks of salmon, and our 5 year old daughter ordered the soup of the day and ate most, it was very tasty. Brown bread was a nice accoutrement to both soups. Bacon and Cabbage dish was very hearty and warming. Highly recommend this place - staff is friendly and food is excellent, many friendly locals to chat with as well! (by Leslie Kemecsei) [3 months ago] | Review 2: 3 stars - I was expecting something really special here, it had all the charm, and I‚Äôd heard some good reviews. We were greeted by friendly staff and shown to our table. It was a bit of a squeeze, despite the restaurant being nearly empty as it was at the beginning of lunch service. They put us at a small table at the back of the restaurant, two of which had been added when they shouldn‚Äôt have been as there wasn‚Äôt room for them. The menu was quite good and prices reasonable, so we were pleasantly surprised, but when the food came, the chowder was only okay, but the disappointment came with the chips/fries my husband had with his chicken Kiev. They were poor quality, but the oil obviously had to be changed. Overall, I probably set my expectations too high for this place. (by Emma Heuston) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Lovely pub a short walk from the Cliffs of Moher Hotel. At the time I went in, it was pretty full with locals listening to the live music, drinking and enjoying the company. It felt very authentic Irish and even though we weren‚Äôt part of the community we felt very welcomed. The food was amazing! Fresh ingredients and good portions. I had the fish and chips and the fish melted in your mouth. They had a good selections of beer and drinks. The Guinness was very delicious and reasonably priced. The staff was also very accommodating and kind. We hand a wonderful time and would love to come back and enjoy the food and the ambiance again. (by Alicia Ochoa) [11 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - We ate here twice during our 9 day adventure and all 4 of us Ireland Travelers agreed that the food at Joseph McHugh's was the best. Best chowder, best bacon and cabbage. I especially enjoyed the smoked salmon appetizer. (by Lori Eldred) [5 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - A shout out to Hilary and the staff. The food was excellent and the staff were even better. We had fish and chips, bacon and cabbage (with great Irish mashed potatoes) and vegetable curry.  All of us would recommend what we ordered. A lovely place to go with beautiful framed photos and art work. If you like Irish heroes and/or Greyhounds then this is the place for you. A great traditional pub. Thank you, Hilary, for making me feel at home. You are the best and I will come see you again. (by Kevin Doyle) [2 months ago] | Review 6: 3 stars - Tough review of a pub we‚Äôve been visiting for over 20 years - albeit a change of ownership, our recent visit to McHugh‚Äôs was very poor. Sat outselves to a table when restaurant staff weren‚Äôt attentive, had to ask for menus and then had to go to the bar to order after waiting 20 mins when a staff member cleaned a table beside us and didn‚Äôt ask to take our order - all at the start of dinner time @ 5pm. Food came by 5:40pm but small portions for both adults and kids. Kids burgers were cooked from frozen to burnt and bundys were stale. Curry was very nice but tiny portion. Guinness was decent and staff later on in the evening were more attentive, but it would be a tough ask to return after having to get our own menus and have to go to the bar to ask to order our own food during a time where the hospitality sector is struggling. Unfortunately I can‚Äôt say I‚Äôll return despite staying 100m away‚Ä¶ (by MH) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Absolutely amazing experience! ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
The food was delicious and truly exceeded expectations ‚Äî fresh, hearty, and full of flavor. The atmosphere was everything you hope for in an Irish countryside pub: cozy, welcoming, and full of character. But what impressed us the most was the kindness and genuine warmth of the staff ‚Äî the level of hospitality was simply outstanding.

Highly recommend to anyone visiting the area ‚Äî a true gem! (by ALEXANDRA TZORTZATOU) [3 weeks ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Cozy little pub, perfect for lunch after visiting the Cliffs. We were on a tight schedule and they were very quick to deliver our food, which was delicious! ü•∞ (by Isabela Vicare) [5 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - We recently went here 2 nights for our dinner and guys amazing!!! The food was amazing the portions are big üòã the staff are so so welcoming and friendly! Fantastic spot!!! Highly recommend!! (by Amanda Smiddy) [2 weeks ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Lovely lunch for 4 adults and 2 children. With great food, warm and attentive service and a cosy and lively atmosphere, we are very glad we stopped. Fish & chips and the chowder were delicious, as was that chocolate cake... ‚ò∫Ô∏è (by Alison Molloy) [a month ago]

name: Stonewall
address: Hotel, Doolin, Co. Clare, V95 DE2X, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 4 stars - We had pizza Margherita, Stracciatella, Boscaiola and garlic bread. Everything was flavorful, tasty and nicely served. Cozy atmosphere and very friendly staff. A perfect place to relax and enjoy delicious pizza and a perfect stop, if you want pizza in Doolin. (by kamilo) [3 weeks ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - We were visiting the clips of more and decided to grab lunch nearby. We arrived a little before lunch service started, but the staff was so gracious about letting us sit and ordering drinks while we waited. The atmosphere is cozy and friendly. We thoroughly enjoyed the pizza while gazing out the windows at the landscape. (by Kim Dawson) [3 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - We had a really lovely leisurely lunch after a long walk. Great service, everyone is so helpful and friendly. The food was yummy. Particularly the pizza. Great spot! (by Tee MacPherson) [5 days ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - I came here with my son and it was magnificent, we walked in and they welcome us and try and find a set for us there were a few kids but it wasn‚Äôt busy.

Are food came quickly and it was very good they had very good pizza dough.
(recommend the boscaiola)

When we asked for water they gave it to us immediately there were two waiters there they were very friendly and nice.

The music was nice and the lighting was good.üòä (by Alexandra Weldon) [a month ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Nice cozy place! The staff was very nice, the food is delicious. I've visited the place several times and tried various pizzas and all of them were amazing. (by Nikolay Atanasov) [2 weeks ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - We had a great dining experience: the pizza was delicious, with an outstanding crust, and the Caesar salad was both generous and tasty. They also offer a great selection of wines. Would definitely go back! (by Tina Fecteau) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Food was so lovely! We loved celebrating my friends birthday here. Thanks guys ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è (by Roseanne N√≠ Cheallaigh) [4 weeks ago] | Review 8: 3 stars - Food was decent, they ran out of vegan cheese so it was just a flatbread with tomato sauce and some vegetables. Dough was tasty tho. Salad provided was wilted and brown so I didn‚Äôt eat it. Friends had the Irish breakfast flatbread and said it was delicious. (by Hannah Finlan) [4 weeks ago] | Review 9: 1 star - Tried to eat here on a Thursday evening at about 8:30pm. We were told they couldn‚Äôt serve any more food as they only had a small oven and couldn‚Äôt cope with any more orders. The family leaving said they had to wait over an hour for their pizzas. Suggestion: get a larger oven perhaps? Probably best to go somewhere else if you‚Äôre hungry. (by Steve Cox) [2 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Stopped in for dinner while in Doolin. The place was busy and we had a little bit of a wait, but it was worth it. Our waitress, Ash, was amazing. She was very helpful and was working hard to make sure everyone was taken care of. The wood fired pizza was delicious. We ended up coming back the next morning to get Chai Latte and coffee. Ended up trying a  sausage roll with my coffee, and it was awesome too. The servers were amazing and gave us insight into what we could expect for the St. Patrick's Day celebrations in Doolin. Sorry I didn't get the 2nd waitresses name. Both were present on the evening and next morning shift. I only regret I didn't get pictures of my food and drinks for this post! (by Steve Holmes) [6 months ago]

name: Everest Kitchen
address: Clonroad Beg, Ennis, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - A lovely Nepalese restaurant ruled by Nepalese citizens. The food was well prepared and tasty. We had the opportunity to listen Nepalese live music. If you like new experiences and try different food is a must go. If you are expecting a fancy, luxury restaurant this is not the place for you. The room could be more aerated to improve comfort. (by Ricardo Moura) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Got to experience this hidden gem! Food was very authentic and staff were straight out of Nepal. Their etiquette was very different than a typical Irish restaurant, but that only added to the experience. The owner came out and played some traditional music for us, he even sat with us and chatted.
Would highly recommend for anyone looking for a truly authentic experience and flavour. (by Craig Dymock) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - The Everest Kitchen was one of the highlights of my week-long trip to Ireland. Owned by two brothers from Nepal, it was hands-down the best meal I had during my trip. The lamb curry is something I will dream about. It was saucier than an Indian curry, and not as intensely spiced, but the flavors were perfect. I wish I had the recipe, I would cook it for dinner tonight. The rest of the dishes were fantastic as well, but the lamb curry stole the show for me.

During dinner, the two brothers broke out musical instruments and begin performing, one on drums, the other on a unique Nepali fiddle-like stringed instrument. A cook and a musician, I have not seen that combo before, but it worked.

They told me they work with orphanages in Nepal helping orphans. They travel and volunteer, as well provide school supplies. They have some T-shirts printed up that you can purchase to help support their work.

I was blown away by their generosity, joy, and kindness, not to mention the food. If you have not been to the Everest Kitchen, put it on your list! I drove an hour round trip, and I don‚Äôt regret a moment of it. (by Mark Mahan) [4 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - We had an absolutely amazing experience at Everest Kitchen. Hira treated us as if we were guests in his home. The dishes we ordered were well spiced and full of flavor. He played beautiful music for us on his sarangi too! All in all just a wonderful experience that made us feel like we had traveled to Nepal! (by Kieran Burton) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - We stumbled on this place during a weekend in Ennis, and I'm so glad we did!  The food was absolutely delicious, real home cooking with lots of flavour, big portion sizes, and very reasonably priced.  We brought our own bottle of wine and paid a small corking fee.  The owners are so warm and friendly, we had a wonderful evening chatting with them and with some of the other patrons.  We were treated to some beautiful sarangi playing as well, which was very special.  I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for good food and good company!  Thank you for everything, Hiralal, we will see you again someday! (by Bay Baxter) [2 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - An excellent little restaurant in Ennis.  The hosts (Ramji and Hirala) were friendly, gracious, and attentive.  They even played some Nepalese traditional music live for us.  The food was fresh and delicious, the portions generous and well presented.  Definitely would go back again. (by Daniel McHugh) [4 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - We came to Ireland on a trip for the Willie Clancy festival, this place had the best food with the best music on the whole trip. The owners are great people and the food was amazing. We had a personal Sarangi performance and learned about some of the lovely history about Nepal. I would come back to Ireland just for this restaurant (plus the great Irish people). (by Josh B-W) [3 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Everest Kitchen in Ennis offers an unforgettable dining experience. The food is truly authentic and bursting with rich, flavoursome spices that transport you straight to the heart of Nepalese cuisine. Every dish is carefully prepared, showcasing a perfect blend of tradition and taste. The samosas and Nepalese chicken curry were delicious!

The hosts are incredibly welcoming and go above and beyond to ensure every guest feels at home. Their warmth and genuine hospitality made us feel really special.

Adding to the ambiance is the wonderful live music, which creates a relaxed yet vibrant atmosphere. It‚Äôs the perfect backdrop for enjoying the fantastic food and excellent company.

If you‚Äôre in Ennis, Everest Kitchen is not to be missed ‚Äì a true treasure for food lovers and those seeking a memorable night out! (by L F) [9 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Just had a very tasty meal at Everest in Ennis.
We needed a light meal after a long day of travel and the owner recommended that we share the Nepali Thali. For a starter we ordered the Vegetable Samosa. The samosa was served with a salad and had just the right amount of spice to get us ready for the main course. It included a large bowl of chicken curry, daal, spinach, steamed basmati rice, and a naan. We left happily satisfied with our dinner, leaving only our cleaned plates on the table. It was also very affordable. (by Marc Albrecht) [3 weeks ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Such a lovely restaurant, first time trying Nepalese food and it was absolutely delicious, very kind and attentive staff, will come again, I recommend the lamb curry üíó, Chloe from Galway (by Chloe Gueta) [a month ago]

name: The Curragower Bar and Kitchen
address: Clancy's Strand, Deanery Land, Limerick, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 1 star - We booked a team dinner here based on strong recommendations and had colleagues visiting from the U.S., so expectations were high.

Unfortunately, the experience didn‚Äôt quite live up to the hype. The room we were seated in was extremely warm‚Äîso much so that we ended up using our dessert menus as fans just to stay comfortable. At this price point (we spent nearly ‚Ç¨400), I would have expected a better dining environment.

On the food side, it was a bit of a mixed bag. Most dishes were good‚Äîthe fish, in particular, was excellent and I‚Äôd recommend it. However, the burger was disappointing. When I went to take a bite, something (possibly the bacon) didn‚Äôt sit right. Thankfully, our server was very professional and helpful‚Äîshe provided great service and kindly removed the burger from the bill without hesitation.

Overall, the experience was just okay. Given the price, I‚Äôd be hesitant to return, but credit where it‚Äôs due: the service was warm and attentive, and the fish was a standout.

****update**** 27th Of August

We went back again and the experience was different.

Staff were nice and the food was good. (by Geoff Hassett) [Edited a month ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - It's a fabulous place to sure outside and enjoy and great view. Make sure you make reservations as they do book up very quickly. We had great seats outdoors and ordered wine and beer. We ordered their fish and chips, seabreem and mackerel. We got a side order of salad as well. The food was very good. The chips with the fried fish were especially good! We ended with their sticky toffee pudding which was good but I think the pecans took away from the traditional flavor but I did enjoy the crunch. Overall it was a very good experience. (by Monica Puri Bangia) [a month ago] | Review 3: 4 stars - The plus side of Curragower: it has a wonderful view of the Shannon and King John's Castle across the river, especially if you choose outside seating. The place was so buy when we ate there that we didn't have that option.

The down side: it's a bit touristy and the quality of its food is uneven. My seafood chowder was okay, but just yesterday in Limerick, I had a bowl of seafood chowder that was superior to what Curragower offers. Its bowl is generous with seafood, but the sauce is thick as if flour has been added to it.

My dining companion was disappointed that his seafood pie was far more potato than seafood. The food is well-plated and attractive, however. Service is quick and efficient, and the surroundings are very pleasant. So take your pick, plus or minus: nice surroundings, good service, great view, but food that can vary in quality. (by William Lindsey) [2 weeks ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Must go! We had the chicken waffles, seafood chowder, and seafood pie. All were chock-full of flavor. The seafood chowder came with brown bread and was stuffed with various fish. The seafood pie was topped with delicious savory mashed potatoes and was piping hot. Chicken and waffles with salsa had just a little heat and was sweet, perfect! Servers were friendly and worked quickly. The covered patio with glass windows is beautiful on a clear or rainy day and offers gorgeous views of the water. They carry lots of zero-zero options. Can't wait to go again! (by Adelina Mart) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Grabbed a quick meal here. The food was tasty and the staff was very friendly. Highly recommend the seating on the upper level, which was a glass enclosure, with lots of plants, and great views of the castle and river. (by Jason Yeager) [2 weeks ago] | Review 6: 4 stars - Lovely atmosphere. Reservations required and we got the glass house. Hostess wasn‚Äôt there when we arrived but seated us once she got there. Food was alright. Fish was bug portion but soggy in middle (frozen / not cooked long enough?) ‚Äî pity as the parts not soggy were lovely. Prawns were a little rubbery yet shell not crispy (grill not hot enough?) & the 3 sauces lacked flavour. Chips were delicious (both thin & double cooked). (by Saba L.) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Nice cozy bar with terrace view to river Shannon. Food is very good, stuff is very helpful and nice. If you wish to dine on the terrace you will been to book a table, but there is plenty space inside for walk ins guests. (by Galina Nikolayenko) [3 weeks ago] | Review 8: 4 stars - We stumbled upon this place after walking from King John‚Äôs castle. We wanted seafood and they delivered. We ordered the mussels, calamari, seabream and a side of Caesar. The seabream was nicely seasoned with a crispy edge and it came with risotto, a giant prawn and caviar. My son ate most of the mussels and calamari so I think that means it was great. We finished with Eton Mess ‚Äî a meringue dessert. (by Nichelle S) [2 months ago] | Review 9: 4 stars - Had an amazing meal at The Curragower Bar and Kitchen ‚Äî this place seriously hits the spot. It's right by the river with views of King John's Castle (major bonus), and the vibe is just chill and welcoming.

The food? Unreal.
Tried a few vegetarian options and was genuinely impressed. The Eden Burger is packed with flavour, the risotto is creamy and comforting, and the summer salad is super fresh and zingy ‚Äî perfect on a warm day. And don‚Äôt even get me started on the sticky toffee pudding... rich, gooey, and absolutely lip-smacking. You need to save room for it.

Parking can be a little hit or miss since it‚Äôs close to the city centre ‚Äî give yourself a few extra minutes to find a spot, especially during busy times.

All in all, great food, lovely staff, and one of the nicest spots in Limerick to kick back with a pint or a proper meal. Highly recommend! (by Karthik Radhakrishna) [3 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Busy spot, especially on a Friday night, but we had a reservation and I‚Äôm glad I got to go!!

They‚Äôre known for their chicken wings, which really were delicious, and I also tried their fish taco which was gigantic.

Generous portion size, great interior decor and atmosphere with really friendly service!

I recommend if you‚Äôre ever in Limerick. (by Jon W) [5 months ago]

name: O'Loughlins Bar & Restaurant
reviews:
Review 1: None - We stopped in for a bite to eat while we were driving through town. What a great experience! The locals were welcoming and friendly.   The owner was delightful and makes a great ham and cheese sandwich. BTW, the music I was telling you about was ‚Äúred dirt music‚Äù. Thanks for a fun afternoon. (by Jodi Butler) | Review 2: None - O‚ÄôLoughlins bar/restaurant serves one of the best breakfasts around. The food is top quality and full of flavour and value.I would highly recommend eating there. Serving breakfast late till 12:30. Excellent staff and very efficient and polite. (by Stuartfrontline) | Review 3: None - Ideal location. Staff very friendly, warm, welcoming and helpful.
Rooms are spotless and has everything you would need (by S Ni Caomh√°nach) | Review 4: None - The owner is a very nice lad, solid breakfast (by Marco Rosa) | Review 5: None - Stopped here for a quick pint on our way from dingle to Lahinch and ended up staying longer because Cathal‚Äôs hospitality. He takes a lot of pride in his pub and it shows. Great conversations, great people, and an awesome pint. Definitely stop by (by Shane Tibiletti) | Review 6: None - Stayed here for a local wedding. Such a lovely welcome from Ann. Rooms are good sized and immaculately clean. Excellent customer service, homely bar atmosphere too. Didn't get to try the food. Will be back. (by Maura O'Connor) | Review 7: None - Great hosts, very accommodating for guests. I dealt with Anne arranging accommodation for employees working in the area. Brilliant at communicating with guests with a language barrier and cannot do enough to ensure that they have what they need. We will indeed be returning to O'Louglins, thank you Anne & team. (by Laura Nolan) | Review 8: None - We had a lovely stay at a fantastic place.
The house was warm and cosy. It is great value for money. We highly recommend staying here again! (by Thomas Burke) | Review 9: None - Perfect old Irish pub. The owner was a wealth of information and had great stories. He was born and lived in the area for 76 years and hearing the history from him was a lot of fun. We weren't able to eat, but absolutely would go back. (by Holly Davis) | Review 10: None - One of the best pubs... great service and a great owner... we had a blast. (by Ale≈° Lazar)

name: Mughal Knight Restaurant
address: 28-29 High St, Clare, Sudbury CO10 8NY, United Kingdom
reviews:
Review 1: 1 star - UPDATE: Updating the rating to 1 star from 3 stars because the restaurant is lying. I made the order and my partner did not speak even a single word about the things we ordered. Upon asking why it was added the server did specifically mention that we add chutney tray automatically if a papadom is ordered. We both had the same experience and my partner had her own views. It is sad that we are being accused of lying instead of restaurant taking the constructive feedback and fixing things in it's establishment. We are all for supporting small businesses but if you lie to your customers on a public platform then it doesn't make you look nice.
As far as reservations are concerned, we were not asked if we had a reservation. If the restaurant did not have space then you could've just said to us and we would've walked.
And people reading the reviews can see our profile to check how many reviews we have written and if they really are fake. :)
------------------------------
We were 2 and we ordered 2 papadoms, chicken tikka, chicken shashlik bhuna, tarka daal, garlic naan, cheese naan and a couple of soft drinks. Total bill: ¬£42.95

The good:
Chicken pieces were tender, naan was really soft and the tarka daal was really nice with garlic flavour. The ambiance of the restaurant is nice and cosy with bollywood songs playing in the background. The restaurant is BYOB so that is good as well.

The bad:
We did not order chutney tray which was added to our order by the restaurant staff and served to us, initially we thought the chutneys were complimentary but they were not. Upon asking why it was added, the answer we got was the tray always comes if you order papadoms. Then why is it on the menu if it is "automatically" served with each papadom? Doesn't make sense at all. It should be the other way around if it has to be this way. This should be clearly written on the menu or the staff should tell the customer when taking the order instead of just adding it in the bill. This is not about the ¬£2.95 being added to your bill, it is about the clarity for the customer.

The coke and sprite we ordered were not served out of cans they were just filled in a glass from either the bar or the kitchen, the menu showed cans but there was no fizz in drinks and were either watered down or served from a bigger bottle which was flat.

The chicken tikka was not authentic, it did not look like it was charred in the clay oven like it should be. (by Devansh Gilani) [Edited 4 months ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - Great food in here the other night. The ‚Äúbring your own alcohol‚Äù is great as it does really save on the bill. But the staff can be a little slow sometimes, we had to ask for a beer glass 3 times and chase them for wine cooler etc. despite it not being very busy.

The food is always expcetional, fresh tasting and a great selection to chose from. One of the best Indians around the area. (by Charlie Newcombe) [4 months ago] | Review 3: 3 stars - Was looking forward to this meal as we‚Äôve heard good things . Shame really because it was average at best , food presentation was poor and most of the dishes tasted very similar . The service was really good tho . (by Saul Ellis) [6 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Amazing food and amazing service. Staff were all very friendly and excellent manor and me and my family were really happy. We will come back anytime without hesitation and would recommend this restaurant.

Thank you all. üòä (by Arosh Ali) [a year ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Bought a takeaway for 3 people, was ready within the advised time.  Food was some of the tastiest and best Indian we'd had.  Would knock off ¬Ω star for the chicken, which was actually a but dry and overdone, but the lamb more than made up for it - cooked to perfection.
Highly recommended. (by Phil Goddard) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - This was a birthday celebration and was treated by my partner to go to this lovely restaurant for a Indian meal, they had a fantastic menu to choose from dinning was excellent there, the staff on duty at the time were very helpful friendly and cheerful.
Booking can be done in advance can also be very busy in the evenings, there is a good atmosphere in the restaurant with very nice lighting, the chairs are very comfortable and the place is very clean to. Parking is available on street free of charge in designated spaces, try visiting Clare Village Suffolk during the day very historic with its castle mound, parks, antique shops, boutique shops, three village pubs, and a railway platform with a caf√©. But the Indian Mughal Knight restaurant highly recommended, you can also bring your own wine corkage free they supply the wine cooling bucket and glasses, enjoy your meal and pay them a visit if your in the area. (by Ale Johnson) [11 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - My 1st review of this restaurant having tried it for the first time tonight. Staff on the telephone and the delivery driver were so friendly and helpful. Always worry about trying a new takeaway but this was amazing. Food arrived piping hot and early and the taste of all the dishes was delicious. Lamb was falling apart as it was cooked so well and everything was just wonderful. Wish I could give it 10 stars üåü.  Will definitely be ordering again. (by Alison Benge) [Edited a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - First night out with the hubby in ages and we wasn't disappointed. The decor was beautiful and the atmosphere perfect.
The staff were all friendly and the food was amazing.  Best Indian meal we have had and would definitely recommend. (by Debbie Cooke) [2 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - If I could give more than 5 stars we would. First time out in quite awhile and it was perfect. Staff are all lovely, and the food was the best we have ever had. Large spacious interior with a relaxing feel, our bill was ¬£51 which for two people with a starter I think is really good. Will definitely be our number one place to go again. (by Debbie COOKE) [3 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Got recommended from someone at work. Was fantastic curry and served and price. Can't complain about anything. Will definitely be returning (by Steven Lee) [2 months ago]

name: The Alley Asia
address: Upper Market St, Clonroad Beg, Ennis, Co. Clare, V95 F348, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Here in Ennis on a work trip for a couple weeks, wanted something different apart from the usual food here, especially as I‚Äôm from LA. Noticed this place had Oyakodon so had to give it a shot. Was greeted and seated promptly. Ordered the Oyakodon and calamari. Food came out incredibly fresh and was just as delicious. I‚Äôd definitely like to highlight the chicken in the Oyakodon as it was cooked perfectly, juicy and slightly crispy. The two staff member‚Äôs were incredibly polite and comforting as well. Would definitely recommend if you want something different when in Ennis or just craving good food! (by chris daniluk) [6 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Absolutely love this place! It is great to dine in - very clean, pleasant and relaxing atmosphere. The food is always fresh and delicious! The fried rice dishes with vegetables are the best in Clare and Limerick! Miso soup is fantastic! The best I ever tried! Also love the takeaway option. The portions are huge and same delicious! This place is always my first choice for eating out and takeaways. We are clients for over 4 years now. The food and service remained at the same high level during all these years! Well done guys! Keep it up! (by Svetlana M) [3 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Excellent quality, perfect flavour and vegan options - I only ordered the sweet and sour with tofu and I can confidently call it the best one I‚Äôve had. And I‚Äôve had a few! The veg was fresh and perfectly cooked to bring out the best flavour and retain the right level of fresh crunch. Pitch perfect umami. And the other vegans in our group loved the satay and fried rice too. (by The Busy V) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 4 stars - The food was nice and the service was good. We ordered various dish and one ofem was Thai Red Curry while the curry tasted good I would have preferred a bit more curry in it as it was filled with meat and veggies. Chips was excellent as it was cooked well with the right amount of salt in it. (by Pramod MalikArjuna) [2 years ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Food was delicious, red curry had so much flavour and the squishiest juise filled tofu. It was really clean and the staff were very pleasant. Good value too. I left very full. (by Sparkles Blood) [4 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Absolutely class.
Very quiet when we went in.
Calamari is exceptional.
Roast Duck Don is very good.
Portions are generous.
Prices are very reasonable.
Food quality is high.
Asian food done to a high standard. (by MrCstack) [Edited 2 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - I love going to" The Alley" restaurant because the food is incredibly delicious and it's freshly made everyday, The food is amazing and the price is great for it's quantity and to mention the staff members are very friendly and hospitable. The restaurant is neat and clean as well as the atmosphere being relaxing and calm, I truly do recommend people to come here to experience "The Alley" because you  won't be disappointed with the service and the food quality. It's a great place for family dinners or just to dine out and you can request for any additional change to your food.
Recommendations
I also recommend the "Chicken Katsu"
The Chicken Katsu is the chicken being breaded in panko breadcrumbs and in the dish it consists of fresh vegetables,curry sauce and steamed rice all separate so you can mix them yourself.
I will definitely be coming back again for sure üòä (by Phil Ryan) [Edited 2 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Sorry for the pictures with half food but it was too delicious to wait for a photo. The duck is very well made and the rice that comes with it is the best ever. I definitely try all their food as everything we got so far was very tasty and great value. (by Laura Alexandra) [3 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Super friendly staff who allowed me to customize the meal to my liking. The other Chinese restaurant nearby was not as accommodating. The food was excellent! (by Brian Pontious) [a month ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - It‚Äôs amazing! The best place in Ireland. I really enjoyed the atmosphere and delicious food. I had number 29 (Singapore rice noodle) and number 34 (Roast Duck Don). Both are amazing. (by Yuliia Kosenko) [3 years ago]

name: Morrissey's of Doonbeg
address: Main St, Doonbeg, Co. Clare, V15 W674, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Unbelievable dinner experience.

Seven of us went to Morrissey's for dinner. One of the best nights of my life.

The staff are the unsung heroes of the restaurant, always smiling and quick to ask if you want another drink, or just checking that your food is ok.

The food was amazing. When you're traveling around Ireland, you do sometimes lower expectations as you
never know what you're going to get....but Morrissey's exceeded our expectations.

The food was delicious and the service was amazing. We will definitely be back üëç (by Kevin Muldoon) [3 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Amazing food, fabulous service. We will definitely be back.
Generous sized portions, beautiful location and decor, relaxed ambience made for a perfect meal out. Huge thanks to Shane for looking after us and making us feel welcome. My dad rates it number 1 on his Seafood chowder chart and that is very high praise indeed!! Would highly recommend üëå (by Hannah O'Brien) [2 years ago] | Review 3: 1 star - Avoid if You Have Children ‚Äì Terrible Experience

We had a truly disappointing experience at Morrissey‚Äôs Restaurant and would strongly advise families‚Äîespecially those with young children‚Äîto steer clear. From the moment we walked in, it was clear we were unwelcome. Our children were in good spirits‚Äîgiddy, yes‚Äîbut by no means disruptive or loud. Still, the
Male manager looked visibly displeased at our presence and pointedly ignored us throughout the meal.

While he made rounds to check in on every other table, he never once acknowledged us or asked if we needed anything. When my 4 year-old daughter accidentally spilled her drink (nothing broke), we quickly cleaned it up ourselves, yet the staff response was cold and dismissive. One staff member eventually came over to take the remaining napkins but barely said a word and couldn‚Äôt look at us when we apologised.

We ordered soups, chowder, and fries, but only one portion of skinny fries arrived initially. When we pointed this out, they didn‚Äôt bother to bring the remaining fries until we had already finished the soup. No apology, no urgency‚Äîjust more indifference.

We had to ask for bread with our soups/chowder yet every other table seemed to be greeted with bread on arrival.

Overall, we felt mistreated and unwelcome. It‚Äôs clear this restaurant does not cater to or care for families with children, and that‚Äôs a shame. We won‚Äôt be returning.

Just to note there was one darker haired girl possibly not Irish, who made an effort to be pleasant to us, thank you. (by C Crowe) [3 months ago] | Review 4: 4 stars - Gentleman waiting on us was very nice and efficient. Lady who brought out main courses and took payment was very unfriendly and made no effort to engage. Food was very nice but some dishes could do with more flavouring. Location is lovely. (by Tonja Farkas) [3 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Spacious restaurant, nice interior, separate sections for bar area, eating area, outdoors ones. Service s good same to the atmosphere. (by Nalinee Yeung) [10 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - My husband and I were in Clare for two nights and ate here both evenings. On the first evening we had no reservation but the man kindly fit us in. I had the steak and my husband had the chowder and both were 10/10. I am gluten free so after taking my order the waiter came back out to tell me I couldn't have the onion rings but that they could give me saut√©ed mushrooms instead and so I got a huge portion of these. Instead of being made to feel like an inconvenience the staff could not have been more accommodating or helpful. On the second night my husband got fish and chips and I got the seabass. Again my meal had to be altered because of food allergies and this was no problem for the staff. Each staff member we met was so helpful and kind. My husband had Guinness both nights with his meal and said it was lovely. Would highly recommend to anyone visiting Doonbeg or the surrounding area. We would recommend booking ahead as it is very popular. Thanks you Morrissey's we will be back! (by Edwina Cooney) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - We are staying nearby at the Trump Doonbeg resort. We wanted to see the cute town of Doonbeg. We made reservations and I‚Äôm surprised this place does not have a Michelin star. I know they are rated as a Michelin Bibb restaurant. The starters were incredible - the crab legs, wings, crab tostada. The various cocktails we ordered were a great bonus. And the four different mains we tried were all fantastic. The soup to the burger to the catch of the day and the fish and chips. They were all fantastic. (by Sarah Beth Felix) [2 years ago] | Review 8: 1 star - Terrible experience manager was rude and made no effort to offer any kind of customer service. We ordered soup and fries we had to persistently ask for bread However, this was given out freely to every other table our fries then came out 15 minutes later.
We had two small children and it was clear they were not welcome when my four-year-old spilled a drink this was met with distain and horror. The Manager on duty at the time was particularly rude and could not even bring himself to look at our table

My wife has already left a review which has been conveniently taken down for stating the truth. No doubt you‚Äôll do the same with this to try and hide your flaws and terrible service.

Avoid at all costs (by Ashley Crowe) [3 months ago] | Review 9: 1 star - Legal robbery!! üò°
We came back to Morrisseys as we had been here before for a birthday celebration and had a delightful time.
This was NOT that time.
First impressions count, and the bar and atmosphere did not disappoint. However the lack of a themed attire for the staff was a bit disconcerting. Although I suppose jeans and runners are a theme!
Drinks were brought to us swiftly, by an experienced waiter, who placed them on the table by gripping the rim with his fingers!!! Why didn't he just take a sip! ü§¢
Then cleaned an adjacent table with MR SHEEN!!
When the starters came out, we were left hunting for the crab claws. Tiny!! These obviously didn't pass any sizing gauge. As for flavour, what flavour?! Only thing you could taste was the oil they were served in.
As for my tostada's, OMG. I thought the inclusion of guacamole and sriracha mayo would be interesting, however once again the only thing you could taste was the sauces.
Our mains arrived approximately 10 minutes apart, chunky chips raw, and my steak was cooked to perfection. However it was very lonely on such a large plate, a side plate would have done.
When finally my wifes linguine arrived I could literally see her heart breaking. She lovvvves prawns, and would probably have ordered a side order of them had she known how few she was getting. Bland pasta and tasteless prawns. Needless to say that dish went back.
Dessert was not much better, my sticky toffee pudding was no longer caramelized but burnt and my wife's brownie was as dry as a desert!
To say we were disappointed is putting it mildly, this was a complete disaster from start to finish. Thankfully I didn't have to pay for the returned main, burnt dessert or our drinks. But when I mentioned to the waiter the manner in which he delivered our drinks, the lack of apologies for the delayed, raw, and burnt food, his reaction was as if he was saying "so??"
Service was amateur at best, food dire and prices astronomical.
Just as a side note, we are also in the hospitality industry, but to a much lesser level. When we are asked for places to eat in the evening, we often recommend local restaurants close to where the customer is staying, and often Morrisseys is our go to place. Not any more.
Without the customer you have no business. If Morrisseys fail to remember this they will not be there for much longer. (by Kevyn Murphy) [2 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Fantastic meal, has to be one of the best seafood places around and has a fantastic view of the waterfront. If you‚Äôre there in a warmer month get a place on the covered patio to really take in the scenery over the River Doonbeg. Incredibly friendly staff and service and if you‚Äôre staying at the nearby Trump property the hotel will drop you down and bring you back allowing everyone to have a pint. The service was tremendous and they fit us in on an a very busy night. (by Brendan Pidgeon) [5 years ago]

name: The Edge
address: Promenade, Dough, Lahinch, Co. Clare, V95 FE4W, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 3 stars - Staff were nice & helpful.
The Scampi was a bit greasy & we expected with linguini but it more was battered deep fried prawns; Mussels was good in taste & portion size; Thai curry was ok, more localized than having the Thai touch in it. The rice was not flavorful either.
Cocktails were average too. (by Sajedeh Naghavi) [a week ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - The location is great. Basically right on the Prom. Walking distance to everything. Parking at the car park not a problem. Nice pub. Staff were warm and welcoming. Atmosphere is great. Was a little loud at first when we went. Got quiet and more reasonable later. Food is good and a good portion.  They do have specials that looked really good. I got the seafood chowder. Great as usual. Burger was really good also. (by James High) [3 weeks ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Had a lovely family dinner at the Edge! Buffalo wings were great to start followed by delicious burgers x2, very good helping of pork belly and sesame tofu with sticky rice. Desserts were really great as well with panacotta, apple crumble, and coconut sorbet.

All very tasty, staff lovely and would definitely return! Check it out if you're in Lahinch! üòé (by Sarah-Anne Tierney) [a month ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Really good place.
Called in with no reservation and they did fit us in but I would reserve in advance as it was super busy and I can see why, Food and staff were excellent, it was warm and cozy with a lovely atmosphere.
We all had the fish and chips which were excellent
Highly recommend (by Padraig McGuire (BusManPaddy)) [a month ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - We arrived and everything was booked but the waitress was on the lookout and managed to get us a table after 15min. This was by far the best chicken burger (hot honey butter) that I've had, would come back just for that! The fish and chips were delicious and the cocktails tasty. Highly recommend! *Didn't get a better picture, hope it still helps! (by Puffin364) [2 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - I can't recommend this restaurant enough.  The food was top quality üëå and the portion size was big üëå  the staff were super friendly and so helpful.  I highly appreciated my time and meal there. I ordered chicken fried burger and it was super crispy.  The chips were homemade and fantastic.  The side salad was unreal üëå
Also, the location of the restaurant is great as we enjoyed a lovely walk by the beach afterwards.  ‚õ±Ô∏è (by Guitar Lady) [4 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - The food is outstanding. The service is superb. The atmosphere is arguably the best part. The dimmed lights and music are perfect. I‚Äôm so glad we found this dinner spot! (by Kristin Tiffany) [4 days ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - i ordered fish and chips and thai chicken curry. it was so delicious and tasteful that i would remember for long time.... even the fries were tastiest ever tried. i strongly recommend to give it a try. yum yum üòã (by zeeshan butt) [a week ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Firstly the staff are amazing, the decor is amazing.. very modern. The food was gorgeous, as you can see from the pictures. Very good selection also. Cocktails and drinks were good too. Highly recommend. (by Teresa) [5 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Really nice food, I had the Thai curry with Chicken. The seafood was really fresh. Lovely big seating booths, perfect for family gatherings. (by Rosie) [4 months ago]

name: Bowman Lane
address: 39 Frances St, Kilrush, Co. Clare, V15 PV27, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Absolutely delicious breaded chicken breast (one was curry and one was parmigiana) with cooked cabbage, carrots and a huge portion of Irish mashed potatoes!!
Okay so the chairs on the patio were a bit warn but if you want some delicious home cooked food at a reasonable price..this is your place. We found our servers to very pleasant and friendly although we only saw them to order and when we got our food. (by Bill ~) [3 weeks ago] | Review 2: 1 star - We had our meal in covered outdoor space, tables  and floor were dirty,  not cleaned prior to service.
Teapot , sugar bowl and cups were badly stained with residue.
The sirloin steak was inedible (see photo).The waitress noticed I hadn't eaten it and asked how had I asked for it to be cooked,  when I said 'medium', she offered to cook it some more.  Unfortunately the steak was so tough and full of gristle it was inedible.
I didn't ask for a discount, but really, it didn't feel right paying for this accompanied by overcooked chips. (by Mair√©ad Donnellan) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 3 stars - My mother and I were passing through town and stopped here for lunch. It was definitely a local joint which I was glad about, but it was busy. Every interaction made you feel like you were bothering the staff. I can understand being busy, but it made for a negative experience. The food was ok. (by Taylor Childers) [4 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Wonderful cafe/restaurant near the marina! Very friendly staff, good menu too. We enjoyed the bacon and cabbage (lots of succulent bacon) and a very large plate of scrumptious battered fish, chips and gorgeous pur√©ed peas.
Excellent value for money! We will be back for sure!
Thank you ‚ò∫Ô∏è (by Maj Mac) [6 months ago] | Review 5: 3 stars - Lovely middle aged waitress, younger one had no interest, place a bit grubby, starters wings horrible, mains steak were delicious and so was the mash and vegetables.. could do with a good cleaning and update (by Caroline Dullea) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - My parents just had breakfast here and wanted me to put up a review as they had an amazing time.. The place was so busy. The minute a table was empty it was cleared and more people were seated. There server the had name was  bridie and they couldn't compliment her enough.. 5 star service and will recommend the place to everyone. Thanks again for a great breakfast.
Tipperary couple . (by natasha Redmond) [5 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - The food was fresh and amazing. There is always fresh baked goods...excellent scones. A great place to stop in for a tea or coffee (by Katherine Murphy) [a month ago] | Review 8: 4 stars - In the town from Dublin and had some lunch here on Saturday. Really lovely mixed grill. Nice and welcoming atmosphere (by Anthony McCluskey) [a month ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - This is such a nice place. It feels really authentic with lots of local customers. I absolutely recommend this place for all tourists who'd like to take the less trodded path. (by Tessa Schmidt) [a month ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Exceptional! Dog friendly. Awesome food. (I had lamb cutlets & they were excellent). Lovely staff, and amazing value. Highly recommend. (by Darren Ferguson) [5 months ago]

name: Zeytoon Grill House
address: Ballycasey Grill House craft and design centre, Ballycasey More, Shannon, Co. Clare, V14 AW71, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 3 stars - The food is fairly good and tasty at the Zeytoon grill house (formerly known as Ballycasey grill house). However, they must work on the cleanliness. There were food particles on the table and fries near the large window (photo attached). The staff are friendly but again not attentive of the customers. Overall, I will give them a 3 stars üåü primarily due to their tasty food. (by Dr. Faisal) [3 months ago] | Review 2: 3 stars - First time visiting, ordered butter chicken , 2 garlic naan breads ,mix grill special, chicken wrap and kids burger meal.

üìç Location : hidden deep in Shannon, out of town .

üü¢Positivs :affordable and nice decor (but require good cleaning as a lot dust,dead bugs and dirty tables,mirrors) , got one plain rice portion given as a compliment

üî¥Negatives: Got typical chicken curry (spicy and not sweet or creamy as butter chicken should be) Got 2 plain naan breads instead garlic ones that ordered. Cutlery was given for 1 person of 4 at the table .mix grill not looked like grill at all barely cooked half raw beef and chicken in onion stew, had to ask get it cooked more (was expecting to be more cooked and grilled brown but got only more heated up I suppose) (by Viktorija Jakusenoka) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 2 stars - Management has changed and so has the standard of food. I was invited with my family to thisnplace before as well but today when we went in for breakfast, 1. Shortage of food, 2. Found the channa to be very salty. 3. Purri was ok but halwa was very oily. 4. Staff was friendly but they must pay attention to detail. 5. Charging even for water, which was not the case before.
Would never visit again. (by Muhammad Bin Nasser) [a week ago] | Review 4: 4 stars - I recently visited this place during my stay in Ireland with my brother and family. I was thoroughly impressed! The Smash Burger was absolutely delicious, with a double patty that was incredibly juicy and flavorful. The portion was generous, with lots of crispy fries and a fresh salad.As soon as we entered, we were warmly welcomed with papad as a complimentary treat. The naan was excellent‚Äîsoft and perfectly baked. The grilled chicken was another highlight, cooked to perfection and very tender, making it a delight for the palate.The ambiance of the restaurant was great, creating a pleasant dining atmosphere. Overall, a fantastic experience that I would highly recommend! (by Ashmin Khan) [a year ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Nice location with plenty of parking.

Good portions and the food was really nice.

It's a beautiful clean restaurant with a warm and inviting atmosphere. The best part is the delicious Halal food they serve. The owner is incredibly friendly and the service  provided by the staff was top-notch. Highly recommend üëå (by Maryam Mekanik) [2 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - food was very delicious esp sirloin steak and taco fries were more than 100% delicious in taste. lamb karahi was very tasty. service was bit slow . all other things were 10/10 (by Zainab Zaib) [a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Today, was our first time trying Zeytoon Grill. The chips were freshly made, light, crunching, and super tasty! The kabab is really good, while for bread, it's another story,  simply delish... (by Enas Alwohoush) [Edited a year ago] | Review 10: 1 star - To be honest didn't even take photos just spat it out and threw in the bin. Ordered mixed grill and chicken tikka kebab and what came was a box with chips on bottom with lamb donar meat on top and some mayonnaise based sause all over it with a soggy piece of lettuce. The (tikka kabab) we ordered was awfully cooked greasy chicken with that same rotten mayo sauce all over it. Not what we ordered and Discusting tbh. Starving and raging now. name: JP Clarke's
address: Bunratty West, Bunratty, Co. Clare, V95 K727, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 4 stars - Great setting. Had dinner party of eight. Food was very good. The bbq wings were very tasty and anyone who had prawns for starters and mains said it was excellent. The pulled pork was also very tasty. For mains the burgers were very good one said the burgers were bit thick and bit round but onion rings were really good. Goats cheese for mains was very tasty   2 balls of goats cheese were rolled in walnuts and this really added to the dish. There was too much goats cheese and needed some more onion. Side of potato gratin was a little undercooked for my liking and quite stiff but that's personal choice! Staff were brilliant and on hand without being in your face. Toilets also spotless which is always a plus. Great evening and tasty food what more could you want. (by Ann) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - The services, ambience, and food are amazing! The prawns are really impressive, and the sea bass is fantastic. I highly recommend visiting this place. The waiters are really good! (by Riu Navarro) [2 weeks ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - JP Clarke‚Äôs is a fantastic gastro pub that strikes the perfect balance between cosy charm and spacious comfort. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, making it a great spot for both casual dinners and special occasions.

The staff are incredibly professional and helpful. Attentive without being intrusive. For dinner, the fish special was fresh and flavourful, but the real standout was the fish and chips: perfectly crisp light batter and thick-cut chips that hit the mark.

Desserts felt like an elevated nod to homely classics, with creative modern twists that ended the meal on a high note. Add to that a solid drinks selection and a lovely outdoor garden space ideal for relaxed after-dinner drinks, and you‚Äôve got a place well worth returning to.

Highly recommended. (by Ain View Studio Dubai) [a month ago] | Review 4: 4 stars - After our adventure to the foreboding Bunratty castle we called in at JP Clarkes Irish pub. It‚Äôs a large sprawling venue with indoor and outdoor space. Clearly it‚Äôs grown over the years due to its popularity and reputation.

Our host had made a reservation and we were quickly shown to our spacious booth, the interior is a mix of country pub and American dining, with plenty of booths, tables and small intimate spots if you‚Äôre looking for a little romantic spot..

The waiter was chatty and charming, cajoling us to order drinks and food quickly as it‚Äôs apparent this is a busy place, there were also some specials inc salmon with a chorizo crust but we all found dishes from the main menu.

Fish and chips, BBQ pulled pork tostadas, cheesy potatoes, salad and the chicken supreme was ordered. Being honest the fish possibly could have done with a little longer in the fryer and the mushy peas would have been heaps better home made, although top marks for serving Heinz ketchup ! The side salad was a little tired, however, my chums all remarked how yummy thier food was and their empty plates proved it.

It was my partners birthday, we were delighted (he was scarlet with embarrassment) as the team sung happy birthday whilst presenting a complimentary birthday plate complete with his name and birthday candle. Thank you very very much.

As we were leaving gentle live music was beginning in the bar which created a very nice ambiance- this place evidently runs like clockwork and they definitely know what they‚Äôre doing.

You could celebrate many occasions here and I‚Äôm sure JP Clarkes have many regulars to prove it.

Thank you (by fredrick Hambleton) [3 weeks ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - I have never thought I would have one of the best culinary experiences of my life in the small town of Bunratty, but I absolutely did. My dish was impeccable and flavourful. The restaurant has a traditional welcoming Irish atmosphere, I would reccomend it to everyone. (by Z√©t√©ny) [a month ago] | Review 6: 4 stars - We happened upon this place while looking for somewhere (away from the congested Bunratty Castle establishments) to have a drink. Unfortunately the rain stopped use from enjoying their substantial patio, so we headed inside. We were greeted by may amazing aromas, that made me kind of wish the we did not have reservations that night for dinner @ the castle. The bar area is nice, stocked with MANY different scotches & liquors. The staff were extremely welcoming. Mrs. A & I HOPE to be back in the area next week & fully intend to TRY & make time to dine here - SPA007 (by SPA 007) [3 weeks ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Excellent mussels! The main dining room was very busy and full so we sat in a quieter area which we actually preferred. (by Suellen K) [4 days ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - We LOVED having lunch here on our tour! All the group loved our meals here! Thank you for the hospitality üíï (by Fan Girl) [5 months ago] | Review 9: 4 stars - A touristy spot, but so is everywhere in Bunratty. The food coming out of the kitchen is fantastic, good temperature and full of flavour. The kids loved the seafood and fish dishes. A bit pricey but the staff are attentive and food is too notch. (by moses camara) [a month ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Love this pub, amazing food, service and ambience. Would highly recommend for something a bit more upmarket than your normal pub grub. (by Laura O donnell) [5 months ago]

name: Preachers Pub
address: Temple Gate Hotel The Square Ennis V95 HOXK, Ennis, Co. Clare, V95 PX64, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Fabulous atmosphere and food with excellent service. Good portions. Nice pint of Guinness as well. (by Elk Hunter) [10 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Was staying at the adjoining Temple Gate Hotel. So decided to eat here. Glad I did it! Beautiful interior. Food was delicious (Large Caesar Salad!) and the staff were very friendly and attentive despite it being a very busy Friday night.
Look forward to my return when I visit Ennis again. (by Paul Kimber) [3 years ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Top class service. Well trained staff. Top class food. Great location. Was not overly busy, so the atmosphere was a little subdued, but this suited me perfectly. Highly recommend. (by Jim Casey) [5 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - We were late to eat but everyone was super nice, we didn't feel rushed. Food was amazing, and it looks so nice in there. Absolutely recommend (by letser 1207) [a month ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - This will probably be my one and only visit, since I live in America, but it was one of the best meals I had in Ireland. The Traditional Irish Stew was excellent. The lamb was very tender and it was overall a very flavorful dish. (by LaVaniel) [7 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Excellent place. Lovely theme and period style architecture. Food was amazing and fast service. Staff were friendly and chatty. (by Christopher Fowler-Curley) [6 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - We stopped in after a brief online search for food near Ennis.  The atmosphere, service, and value were excellent as was the meal.  Declan was our server for a very fine repast. (by Randy Dees (Talorgen Hersir)) [a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Fast and professional service. Very nice atmosphere. Lamb stew and apple pie 10/10. I definitely recommend. (by Taavi Paju) [3 years ago] | Review 9: 3 stars - A nice cosy little pub attached to the temple gate Hotel. A little expensive to be used by the local population much but OK if your at the hotel already. (by Joe Reynolds) [7 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - authentic church atmosphere and good food (by g√∂rkem bakƒ±r) [a month ago]

name: Timeout Tavern
address: 601 N McEwan St, Clare, MI 48617, United States
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Went for lunch with five other friends while they were having clear music fest with live musics in many of the bars/restaurants.  It was pretty busy, but the whole town was busy because of the fast. Service was excellent in fact better than excellent. Lisa was astounding. She was personable and was very helpful with any questions you may have had.  The prices were competitive, but the food was excellent. I got the dill pickle fries, which are not dill pickle spears. They are much thinner than that and actually the breading stayed very crispy (served with ranch).  Two of the other people had the berry salad which they both said was delicious. I ordered a chef salad, which was really good but needed to be served in a bowl. I think it would‚Äôve been a lot easier to eat from a bowl since you couldn‚Äôt really toss it up on a plate once you put the salad dressing on and there was more lettuce than was needed. One guest had the chili and Caesar salad and enjoyed. My husband had two orders of the Mexican street corn dip and liked it. After living in Mount Pleasant for years, and the food quality going way down with prices going way up in that city this was so refreshing!  I may have to choose to drive to Clare from now on. üòÅ (by Connie Bills) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - The burger was cooked perfectly.  That can't be understated.  I asked for medium and it was just right and the beef flavor is amazing.  The chicken and waffles was awesome too.  The flavors were great, the waffle homemade. (by Phillip Sprague) [3 months ago] | Review 3: 2 stars - $47 for what you see in the pictures plus two pops. This includes tips. Value seems low for the price.

8‚Äù pizzas weren‚Äôt good, soggy bread, taste was decent but small and not as good as I would expect for the premium price as compared to Beaverton Tavern pizza or Riverwalk Places new appetizer flatbread that is amazing for $16 and 2x the size.

Pasta tasted bland and was very small for the price $16 when I‚Äôve had Honey Stung Mac n Cheese at Riverwalk Place that was 2x bigger for $20. And just tasted like something worth going out to eat.

Went there trying to find and support local businesses on a date and heard it was good place but maybe we hit them on a bad Saturday at 6pm. It was all decent but they need to raise the bar a little bit because I think this place could be awesome. Great location, great interior and exterior seating and if they step up the food it would be awesome. (by Tyler Plude) [a month ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Great small town restaurant. Amazing food, awesome service and delicious food at an affordable price. The staff were all great. This place is doing something great highly recommend. (by Mark Zilska) [6 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - came in on a Sunday afternoon with the wife & kids, we had an unforgettable FEAST!! Our waitress was Abby and she was so kind to my little gremlins!! she'll be a great mother one day! she was so experienced for such a young lady, will be asking for her everytime we come in! I had the famous tavern burger and let me tell you it knocked my socks off, it should really be famous in my opinion, so juicy. I been going to Applebee's since I was a youngin and I always got their bacon burger but this tavern burger is FAR better and that's coming from a former fat boy who knows his burgers. Loved the staff, loved the atmosphere, let's just say you got yurself a new regular! (by quaty broichtis) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - So happy the owners were here tonight!  When they are not the wait staff fights over costumers.  We sit at the bar to avoid the drama. The food is great!  The owners are very personable and always greet us with a smile and a welcoming conversation.  I often want to tell the owners about the waitresses. But just smile and talk. I'm happy they are doing well! (by Kay Hauck-steinkamp) [3 months ago] | Review 7: 4 stars - Nice little local spot!  Large beer selection.  Burger was good but I saw a table nearby get the wings and a Mac bowl and those both looked delicious! (by Tessa) [4 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - This place was great!  We stopped in for lunch a dessert and we loved it!  The servers were very prompt and professional and the food was great!  Definitely try dessert too!  The braided pretzel was a great addition to the meal as well!  The cheese had good spice but not overpowering.  If you‚Äôre downtown stop in. You won‚Äôt be disappointed. (by The Dunk Tank Company) [2 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Great looking place. Clean. Waitress was very friendly and attentive. Food was delicious. I had the tavern burger and it was cooked just right. The pretzel bun was awesome. The coleslaw was really good too. Great place. I'll be back for sure to try their fish or shrimp tacos.
Edit ..I went back for the fish tacos. They were pretty good just wish there was more fish in them, otherwise another pleasant visit. (by giff8510) [Edited 2 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Needed lunch on our way up north. Myself, husband, and 2 young kids. So glad we stopped. Great food for great prices. Service was phenomenal, place was clean and well decorated. Overall, if we are ever in the area we will be stopping again. (by Jordynn Greeson) [2 months ago]

name: Russells Seafood Bar
address: Fiddle + Bow Hotel, Teergonean, Doolin, Co. Clare, V95 XR0K, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Amazing seafood restaurant in Doolin! It‚Äôs extremely popular, so reservations are highly recommended ‚Äì though we were lucky to get a table after waiting at the bar for 15 minutes, thanks to the kind manager‚Äôs advice. The service was warm and welcoming, and the food was outstanding.

We started with whipped goat cheese with dates, almonds, and hot honey ‚Äì an incredible mix of flavors. For mains, we had the fish of the day (seabass) and lamb. Both were perfectly cooked: the fish was unbelievably fresh, and the lamb tender and flavorful. Even though we were nearly full, we couldn‚Äôt resist dessert ‚Äì sticky toffee pudding and Eton mess ‚Äì and both were absolutely delicious.

And the cherry on top ‚Äì they have live music every day, which makes the atmosphere even more special. Truly one of the best meals we‚Äôve had in Ireland! (by Anastasiia Bozhyk) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - It‚Äôs a lovely place. Food is amazing, especially that fish and chips, best one in Ireland!
The portion of starters is quite huge. I ordered mussels and it came with a big bowl. I couldn‚Äôt finish my main at the timeü§£ Bring some home and after reheating, it is still delicious!!!

There is a group playing music as well, very chill! Their tent area also accommodates pets, would like to bring out lab next time ‚ù§Ô∏è (by Ya-Jhen Ciou) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - What a fab place for dinner. The mussels are really good in a very unique broth. Just lovely. Fish and chips is huge, and the sauces are delicious. Sea bream was cooked perfectly and was really fresh. Brilliant staff, great drinks, super meal. (by Seamus McEvoy) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Really recommend this restaurant! We were really lucky to beat the dinner crowd and seated right way without a reservation. Tuesday night and they were pack. We really enjoyed the coconut lemongrass soup, perfect for Ireland‚Äôs rainy day. All food was served piping hot and in a big portion.
They have irish traditional live music every night too (by niken ariani) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - One of the best meals we have had in Ireland. Gorgeous rustic decor, relaxed vibe, good service and great food.
We enjoyed the whole fish of the day and fish and chips. Loved the porn star martinis and the fish soup was amazing. (by Claire Hornsby) [3 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - We had a few drinks as well as the Wagu beef, mussels appetizer, sides of potato salad and the colcannon mashed potatoes.  Wrapping the evening with Black Forest cheesecake.  Today was my husbands birthday and the brought dessert with a candle and sang happy birthday‚Ä¶ I merely mentioned in convo with the waitress it was his birthday did not ask for anything special.  Drinks and food were great,  service outstanding.  All in all an excellent meal and service. (by lisa mccormick) [4 weeks ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Atmosphere:
Very clean, upscale, and earthy vibe. Dark gray walls contrasted well natural wood accents, furniture, and greenery.

Staff:
Very friendly and attentive. Throughout our entire experience multiple people checked in on us.

Wagyu Beef Shin:
Also known as Beef Shank for those of us from the US. This was slow roasted and hands down, the best Beef Shin/Shank I have ever had. The mashed potatoes were very smooth and had lots of garlic flavor. It came with a side of vegetables. The parsnip was my favorite. It was well cooked and seasoned and had a good amount of sweetness.

Sea Bream (Special of the Day):
The fish was a whole fish. You were able to choose two sides, we chose the salad and vegetables. The fish was extremely good, very well cooked, and very flavorful. The side salad had a great homemade dressing.

Lemon Meringue Pie:
The lemon was a perfect balance between sweet and tart. The meringue was fluffy with a perfect char on top. The crust was fresh and not soggy.

Overall, the entire experience was truly exceptional. From the staff, atmosphere, and world class cuisine, this was easily one of our favorite restaurants we have ever experienced. (by Jon Jong) [5 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - What a meal. Had the oysters, mussels, and fish & chips. All were absolutely delicious. The old fashioned was excellent too. Service was 10/10. I‚Äôd go back in a heartbeat! (by Audrey Shaw) [2 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Dined here twice during our trip. Darren was always cheerful and welcoming. Our waitstaff both evenings were great and very personable, even striking up nice conversations when prompted. The atmosphere is cozy chic, not stuffy at all. A singer performed trad tunes a cappella the second night, which was great. The food is very fresh and delicious.  I started with the oysters, husband the Brie.  Very tasty.  I ordered different specials both nights and husband enjoyed the fish and chips one night and lamb the second night.  Rounded out one evening with the sticky toffee pudding and the other with a mango and lime posset. Everything tasted as great as it looks. Stop in if you‚Äôre in Doolin- you won‚Äôt be disappointed!

Edited Sept 2025: Returned to Russells for our second trip this year to the area‚Ä¶ again, outstanding service and food our two additional visits. Darren is such a great person. Trad on Friday evening was wonderful. See ya again soon! (by Charles ‚ÄúReggie‚Äù Elam) [Edited 2 weeks ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - The food was incredible! There were times when the restaurant was super busy, and it took awhile for us to order another drink/receive our entree/refill out waters. I will say all the staff was very very nice, and incredibly hospitable! (by Cristina Martija-Harris) [4 months ago]

name: Raviolo Verde
address: 1 Main St, Dough, Lahinch, Co. Clare, V95 AW8C, Ireland
reviews:
