Review 1: 5 stars - This was some of the best Italian pasta dishes we have ever eaten, I had the spaghetti bolognese and my partner has the seafood linguine. The meals were so delicious that we asked for extra bread to mop up the sauce afterwards. The portions are generous that you will be more than satisfied and are very reasonably priced. Truly impressed by this place, the staff were welcoming and friendly. Would recommend to anyone. (by Ross Lewis) [3 years ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - The restaurant is well located in the centre of town and a popular spot with locals and tourists alike. The menu offers a good selection of dishes with about 6 pasta dishes, 5 fish dishes, non Italian dishes (burgers) and a very wide selection of pizzas.

Our waiter was very friendly and service was excellent. We all opted for pasta dishes and all were excellent. We found all the dishes pretty expensive for pasta with most of them costing around ‚Ç¨18.

I had the spaghetti pollo and it was a little heavy on cream and light on the pollo. It would also have been nice to have some bread before or with our meal.

Overall it was an enjoyable experience and we will probably return for pizza before we leave Lahinch. (by Niall Larkin) [3 years ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - We came on a weeknight, no wait. Pizza was perfectly cooked (thin and light crust) with lots of cheese. The homemade pasta was excellent (not dense like store bought pasta). Service was very good. Not sure why there are so many negative reviews! (by Kenny) [6 years ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Warm welcoming restaurant with a great selection on both adult and children menu.  Interior is charming and the staff are friendly and warm.  Service is excellent and very attentive without feeling rushed.  Can wait for another visit.  Loved the pasta with clams mussels and tiger prawn very generous with the shellfish (by Sabrina Vaughan) [2 years ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - The food was really really good. Loved the pizza even the coffee was fantastic. Keep it up guys. (by ‚Ä´ŸÖÿ≠ŸÖÿØ ‚Äù‚Ä™M.I.K‚Ä¨‚Äú ÿπÿ®ÿßÿØ‚Ä¨) [a year ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Stopping over Lahinch for a quick bite and was pleasantly surprised here! I ordered a tagliatelle bolognese and it was exceptional!  The pasta was hand made and it was light and not starchy. It was easy to go down.  The bolognese sauce was good and wholesome.  If there was more shaved parmesan that would have been even better.  My partner ordered a margherita pizza and again i was surprised - the dough was light and almost fluffy... the crust was crispy but not hard and there was ample cheese on it.  Fair prices as well! Would def recommend! (by Gloria Lau) [6 years ago] | Review 7: 1 star - Total ripoff takeaway.
Ordered the wonderful sounding vegetarian pizza,,16 euro..hello.
Asked for extra time to go have a pint.
I'm thinking, they taking advantage of customer having too much drink on board. Which I didn't.
I expected a reasonable good Vegetarian pizza, basically got a Margarita, ie, belly full of cheese
Check out the pic posted.
Really tired of pizza outlets selling rubbish at ridiculous prices. (by Damien Cashin) [2 years ago] | Review 8: 4 stars - Had a nice dinner here one weekday evening. The food was very good and reasonably priced. We all enjoyed our pasta dishes.

Service was good as well. There are around 8 tables on the ground floor and we didn't have to wait for one to be free. (by Adam Sewell) [a year ago] | Review 9: 4 stars - Brilliant and authentic Italian restaurant. The pizzas are sublime, especially the House Special Pizza, delish! Great for the kids too and very helpful staff (by Cillian O Riordain) [Edited a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - A lovely restaurant with great food and staff. We eat there the last 2 evenings and the staff were excellent. Especially the guy from Romania, I didn't get his name but a great worker and sound guy. Food was excellent, so good we went back a secone night in a row. We didn't realise the restaurant closed at 9pm until we were leaving at 9.45pm and we were eating upstairs and not once did the staff ever try to rush us or make any mention of closing, they were very relaxed and professional and I would highly recommend. A lot of places would start turning off the music or lights to give you the hint but not here. Real pro's (by Martin Houlihan) [a year ago]

name: Knox's Pub & The Storehouse Restaurant
address: 18 Abbey St, Clonroad Beg, Ennis, Co. Clare, V95 AX83, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 4 stars - Staff and ambiance was great! Super cute place. The spicy buffalo chicken burger was great. Nachos were okay. Beef burger and curry were really good too. We liked it so much the first time we went twice! (by Sophie) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Knox's Pub in Ennis is an absolute gem! The service is top notch staff are friendly, attentive, and make you feel right at home. The atmosphere is fantastic, buzzing with energy and that authentic Irish pub charm, complete with exposed stone and wooden beams. The Guinness is poured to perfection, creamy and smooth, easily one of the best pints in town. As a GAA fan, I loved catching the Tyrone game (We lost üò¢). Perfect for soaking up the excitement with locals and visitors alike. The traditional Irish music sessions are a highlight, with talented musicians creating a lively vibe that gets everyone tapping their feet. And the food? Delicious! From hearty beef and Guinness stew to fresh seafood chowder, every dish was packed with flavor and made with local ingredients. Whether you're here for a pint, a meal, or the craic, Knox's delivers an unforgettable experience. Can‚Äôt wait to return (by RandJ WorldAdventures) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - We went to this pub with a wonderful atmosphere, great food (including vegetarian options), and live Irish music. A must-stop if you‚Äôre passing through Ennis! (by Gloria Wardlow) [a month ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Called in on a Sunday night before flying to Spain. Good Irish Traditional music session playing in the corner. Was busy, plenty of staff. No waiting for service. Got a cocktail but was lacklustre. Guinness was excellent. I'll definitely be back in again. Plenty of happy North Americans in the house üè† (by Donnchadh Kilgallon) [a week ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - ‚ÄúStopped in for a bowl of chowder along with a Murphy‚Äôs and a Guinness. The food was tasty, the staff was attentive, and the atmosphere had a great vibe‚Äîwarm, welcoming, and just what you‚Äôd hope for. A solid spot all around.‚Äù (by Russell Elsevier) [5 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Just a little fish and chips snack. Good, but to be honest, we have had better fish and chips elsewhere. The bar was set really high as Ireland pubs have great fish and chips. (by Jeff and Kim) [4 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Excellent food and drink, and the staff could not be more kind and helpful. It's the type of place that instantly feels like home. Do yourself a favor and try the Guinness stew and fish and chips. Impeccable! (by sasha gewehr) [2 months ago] | Review 8: 4 stars - Visually stunning pub! Live music all throughout our meal... our service was terrible but the food was great !! I'd gladly visit again!!
We had a fabulous apple crumble to end the eveing! (by KB Carmel) [11 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - This place is great! The food is really good, too. Kayte was so nice and was a lovely hostess tonight. The music was a great addition to the evening, too. (by Mike Fuquay) [a year ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - The chicken sandwich was absolutely amazing!!! The chicken bacon carbonara was really not good, don‚Äôt recommend. The wait staff was very pleasant and Sam was very nice! We had a reservation for 9 and sadly got seated upstairs and couldn‚Äôt be moved to see the live music. So if you‚Äôd like a spot downstairs I recommend asking when you place your reservation, as it takes a lot longer to get your stuff because they don‚Äôt open the upstairs bar (poor wait staff) Half of the cocktails we got were good, other half were not. Taco fries are pretty good! (by Dee Willis) [2 months ago]

name: Sherwood Inn
address: Unit 6-8, Francis St, Clonroad Beg, Ennis, Co. Clare, V95 FNR2, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 3 stars - Very nice place. Great atmosphere. Friendly staff.  The food could have more taste. (by AEGV V) [2 years ago] | Review 2: 2 stars - Went from having the best veg in town to the worst.
Before the current owners got here, they had fresh veg, mash, cabbages, carrot and swede etc. Always great.

Now they have unseasoned frozen veg that is barely edible.

We understand that inflation exists but vegetables? Really? (by Cordell) [6 months ago] | Review 3: 1 star - some jerry served us a scuttery pizza and it took 62 and a half years to come out, it was covered in bubbly scutter (by Daighre Clarke) [a month ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Food  good friendly staff....service good (by Noreen Nilan) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Had a beautiful meal here today.. Lovely lady serves us and my god did she know how do her profession.. Highly recommend this place and we should have got the Ladies name. Toilets were clean which is always a good sign.. (by Dave Duggan) [11 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - We had a hectic day, needed a lovely, welcoming without booking for a hot meal for adult and child, an accommodating restaurant that further had gluten free/celiac menu that was more than generous with their portions with a fair price in todays economy. Sherwood Inn couldn't have done better if they tried! Thank you to all the staff & management!! ‚ù§Ô∏èü´∏üèº (by Liunheart) [10 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Love this restaurant, i go there for breakfast every Sunday i can , its open from 9am
The selection of breakfast options is fantastic something for everyone, personally i get the omelette and its cooked to your liking whatever you request and with chips or potato cakes which i adore.
Wow guys this place is a thumbs up all the way for me... Enjoyüëç (by C.A.L.) [a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Great place to,very reasonable  prices and friendly staff. (by slickdeville) [2 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Staff are very friendly
Lovely food (by trish tubridy) [a month ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Brilliant food, very helpful/friendly staff, great service, very relaxed and friendly atmosphere, prices are very reasonable. A must visit restaurant if visiting Ennis. (by Sean Costello) [6 months ago]

name: Reillys Wines Cellar Door & Restaurant
address: Leasingham Road, Mintaro SA 5415, Australia
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - You can try any of the wines on the list for free. I think I tried around 10-12 wines. Most of the wines were good and it was more on which wine suit your tastebuds.

Great experience and would highly recommend the wine tasting! (by Bianca Tan) [4 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - We spent 3 wonderful nights at Reilly‚Äôs Pay Office Cottage which is a historic & charming stone & slate cottage in the beautiful village of Mintaro. The cottage was beautifully presented and very cosy when enjoying a local red by the fire. It was very easy walk to Reillys cellar door and an amazing pub The Magpie & Stump which has great beer and delicious food. It‚Äôs an easy & picturesque drive to Clare & surrounding wineries. It‚Äôs a very special place to visit & we thoroughly enjoyed spending time in Clare Valley. (by John Thomas Bartlett) [a year ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Reilly‚Äôs always delivers! For all  you people that live in SA, get here :) (by Michael Kohn) [a month ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - WOW!!! What an amazing and relaxing experience! Definitely recommend going here. My husband and I are both amazed at the quality of wine and customer service. Our host had such a relaxing personality we could have stayed much longer tasting. We will definitely be back and do lunch next time we visit. The quality of the wine is beautiful. (by Sarah Steinert) [4 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Had a fantastic meal and tasting at Reilly's cellar door with my family. Generous with premium wines and given a discount for those we purchased as we were eating in the restaurant. There we had a selection of wonderful house made treats for lunch. First class.
This was all topped off with a lovely stay in one of the heritage cottages right next door - super comfortable and cosy with the fireplace and AC during the cold nights.
Highly recommended. (by Matthew Massy-westropp) [4 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Fantastic wine and food. A hidden gem just before Clare, this place is a must-visit. This was our second visit and they have updated the menu from our first visit and it just got better and better. Wasabi tentacles were fresh, lamb and steak were cooked to perfection, divine chocolate tart and cheesecake for dessert. Also ordered a bottle of Seignee for lunch and brought home another bottle of their signature red. Will definitely visit again to try their new menu! (by Lolo) [3 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Such a beautiful building. Great wines and a lovely lady giving us tips.for our visit, thank you. (by Richard Jagger) [7 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - 10 out of 10 . From the moment we arrived we fell in love with the charm of this stunning restaurant winery ...we we were attended to by two friendly ladies . We ordered an entry and main each. each dish was full of flavour and beautifully presented. . We will definitely visit again with friends and family. (by Rosey Connolly) [2 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - We called in late in the afternoon and did a fabulous tasting of some excellent wines.

I even got to try a couple of very good fortifieds.

Great work, thank you (by Fran Cormack) [8 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - We recently visited Reilly's to celebrate 30 years of business.
Julie and Kane were very attentive and nothing was too difficult.
Food and wine was sensational.
Thanks again,
Chris., Janet, Michael and Michelle. (by Christopher Whittaker) [3 months ago]

name: Bay View Hotel
reviews:
Review 1: None - Have stayed previously here and was very good. From a lovely warm Irish welcome from John, I had a lovely appointed room. Slept so well , so comfortable and also nicely decorated.  Breakfast is amazing, An abundance of Irish fare, Keeps you full all day. Lovely service by Zoe and the girls. This really was a home from home for me. Also dinner and drinks second to none and again , brilliant service and also food. Would recommend Seafood Chowder. Packed full of Fish,  really tasty. Thanks so much guys. Hope to see you soon. (by Hilda Hirst) | Review 2: None - After extensive research on published reviews of hotels and b&b's in Kilkee, Ireland üáÆüá™ we selected the Bay View Hotel, centrally located in Kilkee.  From the moment we arrived, we were welcomed by the smiling front desk administrator. ‚Ä¶ (by Q809UJedr) | Review 3: None - Our stay had many highlights, room 118 was beautifully decorated, the beds were very comfortable, and the hotel is in a fantastic location. Breakfast was excellent and the staff were always very attentive and friendly.
The only issue we experienced was a strong petrol/kerosene smell in the room. It was quite intense the first night, much less noticeable the next day, but unfortunately returned again on the second night. In addition, there was a generator-type humming noise that turned on and off, which was more noticeable during the night.
Overall, we really enjoyed the hotel and, once these issues are addressed, it would make for a perfect stay. (by Virginia Lapierre) | Review 4: None - Stayed here for one night and could not fault it. The welcome, the bedroom, the meal at night, everything was spot on. The two girls who served in the restaurant were superb. The dark haired girl (sorry I can‚Äôt remember her name) also ‚Ä¶ (by joans384) | Review 5: None - I was very happy with this hotel. It was in a great location in the centre of town with a view of the sea. I had a nice room with large windows and a comfortable bed. A quaint busy large dinner restaurant and bar, a great breakfast included. Parking is free on the streets. There is a wonderful large beach, a few steps from the hotel. A great place to stay if you‚Äôre visiting loop head lighthouse. (by Don B Leask) | Review 6: None - What an amazing experience! Owner/operator John treated us like family the entire time. Food was great, rooms were newly remodeled and spotless. Can‚Äôt say enough about John, his staff, their hospitality, friendliness and service. The ‚Ä¶ (by 880samanthad) | Review 7: None - Gorgeous, spacious family room. Fantastic view as we were on the top floor. Restaurant on site, the small plates of sea food / other were excellent... crab claws, prawns, veg tempura, scampi and melted Brie. Centrally located ...Can walk to the beach, brilliant deli opposite selling freshly made sandwiches at reasonable prices. (by Donna Passey) | Review 8: None - My husband and I are on a three week trip driving through Ireland. We‚Äôre staying at all sorts of lodging. We read good reviews on this place. Then we arrived. The room was not as expected. The bedding is the biggest complaint as it was made ‚Ä¶ (by Passport36356528153) | Review 9: None - I‚Äôve been to Bay View Hotel in Kilkee a few times. I enjoyed their rooms with a perfect view on the beach, it was amazing to watch sunsets from my room. Hotel is located one minute away from the beach.
The food was okay, to be honest it wasn‚Äôt as good as i expected. The personal was polite and nice, but it took them much time  to cook food for me and my family. (by Varia) | Review 10: None - We only had lunch at the Pub Restaurant of the Bayview Hotel. We both ordered Curry dishes: my wife the Vegan Curry and I had the Thai Chicken Curry. Both dishes were tasty but the Chicken one had nothing to do with Thai. It was more of an Indian Curry served with Naan (or an attempt to), chutney and rice. The dish was oddly also accompanied with french fries. The Cheesecake of the day was, as expected, Baileys but the taste was really subtle. Overall a good lunch. (by Thierry Douin)

name: Forty One Bar & Restaurant
address: 41 Abbey St, Clonroad Beg, Ennis, Co. Clare, V95 XFX4, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Hadn't been here in years and saw a few social media posts lately of the food and said I'd try again. Went in for lunch and the food was lovely! Had the avocado BLT and the broccoli soup - was so tasty üòã price was spot on. Will definitely be back to check out the rest of lunch menu. (by Lauren King) [7 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Delicious breakfast, very generous servings, very fast service, and lovely staff. Highly recommended for a good hearty start to the day. (by Matthew Bean) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Excellent food, flipping fantastic staff ( shout out to  Oona, best cocktail maker), and absolute vibes
Edit: revisited 6 months later, still that place ‚ô•Ô∏è to all the waitresses (by Mx Ruwa) [Edited 5 years ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Thank you Paulina Smulhyte for your excellent service in looking after us at Breakfast. We stayed in the Queens Hotel and Paulina looked after us beautifully. (by Adam Smith) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 3 stars - I mean the food wad nice the service not so great, lots of people working but no direction, we ordered breakfast, I had full but didn't get a full as some ingredients were missing, in fairness they only charged for a mini, they could add a couple more beans also, we had to ask multiple times for tea and toast I mean what a struggle toast brought no butter, tea brought no milk I  mean three breakfast ordered only two teas brought, if someone orders breakfast bring the tea while they wait and some toast, food was nice but service was very poor atleast 5 waiters walking around with no direction and an obvious sign that they need a leader to guide them, would not return with that service hopefully was just once off, kids had there food eaten by time we got ours, anyhow (by Jason D) [2 years ago] | Review 6: 4 stars - Very nice setting. Good choice on the menu. I had the burger which was massive and delicious. Had some nice wine and cocktails too. Overall good value. Waiting staff were very friendly. (by Brian Callinan) [5 years ago] | Review 7: 4 stars - Quiet and serene lunch spot for hungry Americans! Best food we had in Ireland! (by Dani S) [a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Very nice Irish Breakfast early morning on the way to the Cliffs of Moher, even on early Sunday. (by Alberto Duarte de Oliveira) [3 weeks ago] | Review 9: 3 stars - It was okay and I'm sure this isn't everyone's usual experience but they lost our order and lunch took 2 hours. Glad we weren't in a rush. (by Shaun Marsden) [3 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Lovely atmospheric place - restaurant "41" in Ennis, is located in the very center, on the corner of two streets, in a very crowded place, although when I visited it, the bar was not crowded during the day, and the restaurant too . Ordered a salad  with tuna and avocado and latte, to be honest, I expected more, judging by the interior, it should be a decent place, but it didn‚Äôt please me ... I waited a very long time. An abundance of mayonnaise and very little tuna, it all looked unappetizing. Although the latte was  not bad.The pina colada cocktail was delicious, nicely presented. (by Iryna Z) [2 years ago]

name: Bunratty Manor Restaurant
address: 707, 984 Old Bunratty Rd, Bunratty West, +353 61, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Just finished dinner in Bunratty Manor. The restraunt is lovely and the staff very friendly and personable. Noel waited on us today, he was attentive and funny but gave us our space. We'll be back for sure based on his service.
The food was delicious, although we were stuffed we cleared every plate. (by Sean Mangan) [4 months ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - This is a restaurant that I loved coming to, but this time will probably be my last, the food was good the portions were very small, last Christmas I ordered the black sole ‚Ç¨32 and it filled my plate, last week I ordered the John Dory ‚Ç¨36 and it was the size of a sardine, to say I was disappointed is an understatement.
I can't understand restaurants serving small portions of food at and very high cost and think its okay, (by Noel Chandler) [Edited 10 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Very good, waiter was fair sound. Price reasonable for what you get and where you are can't fault it at all lads (by John) [a month ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Very tasty, the staff is excellent (by Oleg Ivashenco) [6 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - The food is wonderful, the service as well. We recommend it! (by Noam Feldman) [2 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Went for a super lovely birthday meal this evening.
The starters & mains were all outstanding, along with the service. Would really recommend. We will be back. (by conor mcinerney) [8 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Noel's restaurant was recommended by our B&B host as an ideal place in Bunratty to celebrate a loved one's birthday and she was right ! It's a dinner we will remember. The owner and the staff are really kind and welcoming, both the food and wine are delicious and visually pleasing. (by Julie Sahakian) [Edited 5 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Wonderful! The food. The staff. Everything. Better than the Michelin star restaurant we dined in last night in Dingle. A must. (by Ann Spoor) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - It's just a great place for something special, beautiful seafood and Noel is the perfect host. A little bit pricey but so worth it for a treat. (by Sid Howes) [a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Nicest dinner I‚Äôve ever had. Staff are excellent and great selection of wine.
Celebrated my mothers birthday and we had the best night. (by Niamh) [2 years ago]

name: Osaka Ramen & Bento
address: Cornmarket St, Clonroad Beg, Ennis, Co. Clare, V95 DW74, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Really glad we found this place. It had been "under our nose" for a while but had never been. They have a large selection of vegetarian / vegan options on most items on the menu.
The food was amazing and the staff were very helpful and friendly.
We will definitely be back. (by Gurmukh Neote) [a year ago] | Review 2: 2 stars - I think they should probably not serve ramen because it was so far from an authentic bowl of ramen that I was pretty disappointed. Especially at a ‚Ç¨17 price point. I would challenge whether the chef has actually tried a real bowl of ramen or just read a list of ingredients and filled in the gaps themselves.
The chicken was just dry chunks of chopped up breast meat (no fat or skin), the egg was hard boiled and not marinated and then just loads of chunky chopped mushrooms. No pickled ginger, none of the condiments that you might expect. I probably won't return. (by Liam Murphy) [3 months ago] | Review 3: 1 star - I'm sorry, but I didn't like it at all. The sushi was just a huge, inedible rice paste, and the duck came in a watery sauce with damp, wilted lettuce (it shouldn't come with lettuce because it gets soggy in liquid‚Äîbetter to choose other veggies), and with a box with more rice paste... 33‚Ç¨ for nothing I could enjoy. (by Teresa Pezzi) [6 months ago] | Review 4: 3 stars - Ordered the futomaki spider rolls, and one tempura asparagus and prawn roll, both completely covered in mayonnaise, woman I rang was extremely helpful, lovely as could be, and was told to tell me 'that's how they come', despite there being two options on their site, one with avocado,  (which i ordered,) or one with spicy mayo, the helpful woman on the phone was told to say, 'it's how it's served', digestive tract in the prawns and not deveined,and offered a free desert or drink as compensation when I've been there often, and never ordered either yet. They know me by name and my orders. they aren't cheap, so avoid unless this is your 3 in the morning chipper covered in mayo kind of thing, and don't know what you've spent your money on until the morning. (by Simon Smith) [7 months ago] | Review 5: 4 stars - Wonderful place to eat! The restaurant has a good choice of food (also for vegetarians, people who doesnt like sea food and those who cant eat gluten). The food is very good freshly made, full of taste and well served (only 1 of 4 meals was "just OK").The service is very friendly and know exactly what they do. The menu is well described, but unfortunately for the dessert there were only only 2 options. However the dessert I was served, it was above average. The prices are good and portion sizes excellent for what you paying for. If you are around you really should try it. I recommend this place! (by David (Davk)) [5 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Brilliant place to eat. The food is always great . I recommend their Bento boxes. Staff are very attentive and the decor is perfect. Ennis is lucky to have it. Well done ! (by Neil Hynes) [a month ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - it's a small restaurant with the friendliest owners and very delicious food. the presentations of the dishes are amazing and service was very quick. if i wasn't just visiting, this place would easily be one i eat at often! (by morty) [3 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Had a family lunch here. Staff were professional and very nice. The menu was very nice with a good range of items. Service was fast and the food was excellent. Both flavour and presentation was great. We had a very interesting tempura ice cream to finish. Price was reasonable and would be very happy to return here again. (by Keith Dowling) [4 years ago] | Review 9: 4 stars - Amazing food. The staff been so helpful for a family of 5 because the menu is gigantic. There is for everyone something and the portions been big...I mean we couldn't managed  üòçü•∞ we had no clue before but one is for sure we will be back....
I didn't gave the 5 stars to the atmosphere because the smell out of the toilet was to dominate in a small place like that which is thutch a pity because it's really really really nice....and the prices are moderate. (by Nicole Zimmermann) [2 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Sat in for the first time tonight after multiple great takeaways. Possibly one of the best dine-in sushi experiences we've had, and we've had a lot. All the sushi came out at the same time and was expertly prepared (although the sashimi was very thickly sliced but that's a good problem to have!). We were waited on very quickly and our glasses were never empty.  Our food was served pretty quickly and the desserts were incredible. I've never had Ice Cream Tempura before but it has ruined normal ice cream for me now üòÇ The owner was very friendly and gave lots of great tips on how to enjoy the sushi the traditional way.

If I could eat here every day I would. (by J Hunter) [5 years ago]

name: Earl of Thomond Restaurant
address: Castle Hotel, Dromoland, Newmarket on Fergus, Co. Clare, V95 ATD3, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Dining at The Earl of Thomond Restaurant is nothing short of a magical experience. Nestled within a castle, the setting alone transports you to a world of elegance and charm. From the moment you step through the door, the staff's attentiveness is remarkable, making you feel like royalty.

The food is nothing less than perfect‚Äîeach dish thoughtfully prepared and beautifully presented, with flavors that tantalize the palate. The ambiance enhances the meal, blending the historic charm of the castle with a warm and inviting atmosphere.

Whether you're celebrating a special occasion or simply looking for an unforgettable dining experience, The Earl of Thomond exceeds expectations on every level. Highly recommended! (by Babette Friedman) [10 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Absolutely beautiful Valentine‚Äôs Day dinner here ‚ô•Ô∏è I got the oysters, chicken and strawberry dessert. My partner loved his crab gnocchi, venison and pecan dessert ‚ú®

Amuse bouche and complimentary sweet treats to top it all off! On top of a lovely rose and chocolates as a Valentine‚Äôs Day treat üíò

Thanks so much to Ian, Eric, Lily and the whole team for taking care of us from start to finish!

Also absolutely beautiful harp playing üéº I loved it and highly recommend for your special occasions (by Aisha Jedir) [7 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Today,  I went with my mum and sister. The first person to greet us was Aidan, he treated us like queens. He is indeed the King of Dromoland Castle. After his warm welcome,  he guided us to our lovely afternoon  tea  in the Earl of Thomand restaurant. All staff were so friendly and professional.  The waitresses were so good and looking after us in a very nice way. The food was incredible and we got a complimentary starter from the chef and it was yummy.  The finger sandwiches were carefully made with nice selection of flavours.  The cakes and pastries were so decorated and full of fresh flavours and at the end we got hot scones which was a nice ending. I recommend the single tower plates as they have more selections than the twin towers.
We got a table with a window view of the castle with lake which was fascinating.  We also got the castle blend tea and it was the right cup of tea. We went  for a walk afterwards, and one gentleman of the staff helped us to take a family photo and the whole place was like a story in a fairytale book. The place is super clean,  spotless.  We were greeted by King Aidan before leaving.
What a day, a wonderful Irish experience with the lovely Irish staff. It's the Irish dream indeed‚òòüçÄ‚òò will go back soonü§ó (by Guitar Lady) [Edited a year ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Well done job!!! Everything was magnificent.
Excellent performance by sommelier Eric!! (by Bennet Gaming) [Edited a month ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Spent the weekend at Dromoland Castle and enjoyed most of our meals here. Amazing food with top notch staff and extensive wine list.  ‚ÄúBest of Ireland‚Äù without a doubt!  We will be back. (by Ken Faulkner) [a year ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Kudos for catering well to vegetarians and vegans (3.5 / 5 Green Stars)
Having just come from Ashford Castle (long story!) the atmosphere at Dromoland was more relaxing and less formal. The service, however, was just as good, if not better, because the staff were more themselves. We ate at the Earl of Thomond twice for breakfast and once for dinner and were very happy with all the meals and service.

For dinner, we went crazy and had the full tasting menu ‚Äì one vegetarian (‚Ç¨95) and one ‚Äúregular‚Äù (‚Ç¨105). Our dinner seating was towards the end of the evening so our server may have been horrified that we ordered this (we were there until almost 11 pm!) but he was cheerful throughout the service. We actually joked half-way though the dinner because when ordering I‚Äôd said ‚Äúthis is simple ‚Äì one regular and one vegetarian tasting menu.‚Äù With nine courses, the dinner is anything but simple ‚Äì I had only meant that ordering it was simple!

Overall, the omnivore was probably more impressed with her food than I was with my vegetarian offerings. For breakfasts, my shakshuka was nicely done while the ‚Äúvegetarian breakfast‚Äù was good in parts (amazing spinach) but also had a few weak points (potato cake). For dinner, the vegetarian tasting menu also had a weak point or two ‚Äì the risotto was a little too al dente for me, for example. But that‚Äôs not bad for a nine-course meal.

Some of the smaller items were the most impressive:

The Cashel Blue Cheese Panna Cotta with walnut and pickled blackberries: this was my first time having panna cotta as it‚Äôs not normally vegetarian. Great start to the dinner.
Cratloe Hills Sheep‚Äôs Cheese Ravioli in rooster potato broth: The potato broth was the star of this dish.
Blood Orange & Green Peppercorn Sorbet in Campari jus: we both had this as it‚Äôs on the omnivore tasting menu too. Amazing!
For breakfast there were many highlights but the scones and pain aux raisins were my favorites. Don‚Äôt forget to ask for clotted cream for the scones! Thank you to all the staff at Dromoland! Keep up the vegetarian and vegan food!

I‚Äôm giving the Earl of Thomond 3.5 out of 5 Green Stars for social and environmental impact, for these reasons:

‚Ä¢ The Earl of Thomond has gone all out to cater to vegetarians, with a full vegetarian tasting menu and a vegetarian √† la carte menu that includes three vegan items. There‚Äôs also a nice vegetarian breakfast menu.
‚Ä¢ Their main √† la carte menu is pretty much all meat- or fish-based, except for a goat cheese starter. It kind of makes sense to separate vegetarian from non-vegetarian onto two menus but it‚Äôs a bit sad because it implies that the ‚Äúnormal‚Äù diet is almost completely animal-based. Duplicating some of the vegetarian menu items on the main menu could encourage some ‚Äúnormal‚Äù people to mix in some veggies, now that the planet is on the brink of a climate disaster!
‚Ä¢ Sources of most meat, fish and cheeses are named. Some of the meat is wild-caught (rabbit, pheasant, venison).
‚Ä¢ Foie gras is on the menu ‚Äì I‚Äôve read up on more-ethical foie gras, but it‚Äôs still not great.
‚Ä¢ Most of their ingredients are sourced in Ireland and almost everything is made in-house. (by James K) [2 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Very nice dinner in a well appointed castle. The harp player was a nice touch. (by Brian Leung) [a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Our family of three spent our last Ireland vacation day at Dromoland Castle and had dinner in the Earl Of Thomond restaurant. What a fantastic dining experience; we were treated like royalty. The food and service were impeccable. The harp music was a lovely accompaniment to dinner. Shout out to Eric whose drink recommendations complemented our meal choices perfectly. (by A Maroney) [11 months ago] | Review 9: 3 stars - To start, I must say that Ricardo the Sommelier was the savior of the evening. I appreciate how much he ran around trying to cover for many inadequacies of the evening.
On entry, the hostess was lovely but also thought we were other people entirely (which was honestly more amusing than anything else).
For the meal we were quickly greeted by Ricardo for drink discussion and he was extremely knowledgeable and thorough and our order was taken by what appeared to be the manager of the restaurant. We ordered the tasting menu with sommelier accompaniment. Our first and second course were quickly brought to us and often the staff were trying to take plates away quickly and presenting them without a break. On the second course we delayed starting to eat it by at least 5-10 minutes wondering where the paired wine was, and eventually continued on as multiple staff looked at our table and no one came out to bring anything. Shortly after we noticed another table getting the same course and quickly receiving the appropriate pairing. At that time, there was still no one acknowledging our table and the second sommelier brought out an entirely unrelated wine (which was not served at any point during the pairing) and quickly left again bringing us nothing. We did note that Ricardo had a side discussion with our servers and took over bringing us appropriate wines and apologizing for the mishap. Our servers continued to bring things too quickly and one kept attempting to take away our plates before we were close to finished with the drink or the course. At the end, our server didn't know to ask us for our tea or coffee preference and tried to leave us without explaining the course or giving any information. Thankfully we had noted the drink pairing on review of the menu initially and called her back to request the appropriate items.

In general, it appeared that we were present for the large group of new summer hires. Most of our servers did not appear to understand appropriate serving etiquette. While we initially were trying to be understanding and patient (having noted at prior establishments that summer hiring was in full swing) it did become increasingly frustrating. Had the meal not cost what it did, our expectation standard would not have been remotely the same. As the evening progressed the hostess and manager stepped in to take over helping tables requiring them to sacrifice their own post.

Overall, I have never felt quite so rushed and ignored at the same time while eating a meal. Especially when paying more than $250 a person. While the experience was pleasant, I would recommend another location if your desire is for an optimal fine dining experience. If your desire is to eat at the Dromoland castle specifically, I would recommend ordering something other than the tasting menu so the cost to service ratio is more appropriate. (by Bethanny Glahn) [a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - What a great place for a meal while staying at Dromoland Castle. Everything here from starters to mains to dessserts were top notch. Service is awesome and leaves you wanting for nothing. (by Von Collins) [2 years ago]

name: The Flying Enterprise Lounge
address: Barrack St, S Gate Bridge, Cork, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Absolutely amazing place, the staff are so friendly and accommodating, the owner came over to welcome us and ask if everything was to our liking,
The food is so tasty too and very reasonable (by lrrnmagee) [Edited a month ago] | Review 2: 1 star - I went to order pizza here tonight after work. I was basically ignored and went to the service area (the pass) to get something to eat. I was told by a waitress that she would come to my table and that the waiting time for food was 40 minutes. She either forgot or didn't want to take my order and never took my order after waiting another 45 minutes. I have a background in the service industry and this is a really bad way to treat a customer. If you want really bad service and leave hungry, this place is your best bet. (by Emmet Murray) [4 months ago] | Review 3: 1 star - Disgrace of a shop, I‚Äôm 21 years of age I went into the shop for fags showed the foreign woman behind the til  my passport and she tried to tell me my passport photo isn‚Äôt me it‚Äôs not my passport, she had the most disgusting manner she shouldn‚Äôt be working there.  id stay well away from this shop anyway my first and last time stepping foot in there (by Ciara Corcoran Crowley) [3 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Absolutely love this place. The food the drink the atmosphere all around this place is incredible and I can‚Äôt wait to see it again. (by Total Trees) [5 months ago] | Review 5: 1 star - too expensive,
the quality of the food is average and the portions are small.
not recommended! (by Assunta D) [3 years ago] | Review 6: 3 stars - Fabulous place let down by poor service, dirty glasses, and reasonable food.  The enterprise complex is a great venue with some issues. (by Declan Duggan) [3 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Top notch Breakfast. Went for Full Irish for ‚Ç¨9.95 and it didn't disappoint! Would highly recommend and would definitely return. Greeted the second I waked in the door and the place was just nice and relaxing too! (by Colin O' Brien) [8 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Finbarr is a super host, the Francis Brennan of Cork, really, and the breakfast is delicious! (by Michael O'Sullivan) [4 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Excellent food and helpful staff. (by akis nikiforakis) [6 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Lovely spot great outdoor beer garden and big screen for any sports food was good staff was very friendly and helpful but can get very busy so get in early (by anthony lowry) [7 years ago]

name: Ramen Anglesea Street
address: 21 Anglesea St, Ballintemple, Cork, T12 V329, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - 4 weeks ago we had a fantastic experience here. Food incredible and very reasonable price..
Vegan gf options too. Staff super kind and very attentive.
We went back again this evening and like before it was a great experience. Food, staff, all super good and very reasonable price. Best in Cork. (by Kevin Hannigan) [Edited a week ago] | Review 2: 1 star - I ordered Singapore noodles with Tofu as a takeaway. The menu says it's vegan however there were eggs in it.
Disappointed with this. Would never recommend as I had requested while placing the order to avoid it.

Edit - I had requested a Vegan option mentioning while adding Tofu with it and specifically requested to avoid any contamination and was assured the same. (by Shridhyey Gupta) [9 months ago] | Review 3: 3 stars - Atmosphere is nice, staff pleasant, toilets clean and ice cream is lovely. Food is a disappointment. Far too much sauce, flavorings and salt. Completely overwhelms the taste of the ingredients (by Pat Moriarty) [a month ago] | Review 4: 2 stars - The worst asian food I've ever had. I ordered veggie wok + chicken. It was like a soup but full of soy sauce. Also, chicken was absolutely dehydrated and the rice!!!! Microwave rice with terrible taste. Absolutely, don't go here. Also had to wait for takeout for 25 min for this food really ridiculous. (by H. Sipahi) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 3 stars - This place was quite empty when I went and filled up a bit by the time I left. The service was good, someone took my order quickly and the food was delivered to my table in about 3 or 4 minutes. I also like that you pay when you order.
The food itself was not nice at all. The portion size was big but the dish tasted kind of sweet and was unbelievably oily. The tofu was very nice. (by Ciara S) [3 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Lovely gluten free vegan options.
The vegan spice box is a must try! Love how there‚Äôs tofu in it ü§ó
Love their sweet n sour, not too heavy ‚Ä¶ (by H (H)) [3 years ago] | Review 7: 4 stars - We're fancy trying Asian street food and this place was suggested. Ordered Pad Thai and Veg Curry. Pad Thai was absolutely a delight and definitely recommend this to anyone looking for veg options. They added Tofu instead of chicken which was brilliant. Veg curry was a bit blunt and not what we expected it to taste based on our previous experience with same curry in Thailand. Rice needs a special attention as it wasnt cooked properly. Not the best ambience, but perhaps is sufficient as the dine in space is really tight. 10/10 to the staff! (by uday kalyani) [2 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - There is a lot that goes into the dining experience at Ramen. The staff here is friendly and warm, and are extremely pleasant to talk to. The food here is amazing, the best Asian food I've had in Ireland so far. And the quantity is great too, which is quite rare for most restaurants. Other than that, we get complimentary fortune cookies and ice creams with our meal. Absolutely love this place! (by Aditeya) [5 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - The food is amazing, fair price. Lovely atmosphere, music background very relaxing. The staffs are friendly and polite.
As a plus the you can get juice free and ice cream. So, nothing to complain and for sure I would recommend this place. (by Stefanny Torres) [Edited 10 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - This is first time to try them out, i had beef sweet and saure wok. It was nice. I will come over again for sure to have asian meal once a week. There is only street parking so its hit or miss situation. Free icecream cone for the end is nice touch. It felt nice cooling down in warm sunny day. (by Marko Rogulja) [7 years ago]

name: Gallagher's Cork
address: 32 MacCurtain Street, Victorian Quarter, Cork, T23 Y07X, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Excellent place to stop by for lunch!

The pie was well made - very hot but letting it crack open and mixing the ingredients helped bring it to an eating temperature. The meat was slow cooked and tender and flavored well.

The cocktails were impressive, the fries were good, we liked the burgers too. The fish and chips look well portioned.

Solid pub experience. (by Sameet Sapra) [4 months ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - Beautiful meal. It's been a while since I've been in there. I got thr cauliflower steak..it was divine and presented so well. The only negative is I think it should come with mash/chips. It wouldn't fill me on its own so I ordered chips separately. The dessert was unreal..i got a peanut butter jelly amd honeycomb parfait type. Would recommend. (by Stephanie o connor) [4 months ago] | Review 3: 4 stars - We stumbled upon this place while looking for somewhere to eat one evening. The vegetable pakoras we had to start were nice. The vegan burger (which was ordered without hummus) was very dry and the bun had an odd texture. This might have been because it was a vegan brioche bun. The cauliflower steak was delicious and is definitely the best veggie/vegan option to go for.

The service was impeccable and the staff were very accommodating, despite our lack of a reservation. Our meal (with two pints) came to ‚Ç¨65. (by Daniel Farrelly) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - I am gluten free and came because I saw the menu online and wanted to try the fish pie. Unfortunately, the menu had changed, but they still had plenty of gluten free options. I got the Ruben and it was delicious (and they didn‚Äôt upcharge for the bread or swap of salad instead of fries!) (by Alecia Paddock) [2 weeks ago] | Review 5: 3 stars - I was in a large group. We got there at six and got served at eight. I was so hungry. I ended up getting fish and chips. They were good but WAY over-salted. The atmosphere was great and the servers were very kind. (by Melody P) [4 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Good food. Extensive cocktail menu. Gluten-free options. Nice staff. Good atmosphere. A little pricier than some other local options, but very nice. (by Lucy B.) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - This spot is AMAZING and has the BEST staff, especially this young lady!!! She specifically made sure my group and I had a great table on a very busy afternoon. The staff here were all wonderful, but she made our experience truly the best! I would recommend anyone stops by here for a drink or bite to eat. (by Delaney Marwood) [a week ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Went three times to eat on our mini break to Cork. First rate.
I met Rory Gallagher 55 years ago when he played in London Marquee club with Taste. Ireland‚Äôs first Rock-blues hero. Shame they didn‚Äôt play his music. (by David Blake) [4 weeks ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Incredible meal in Cork. Me and my wife got the soup of the day, the signature pie, and the gnocchi, and all were delicious. Beers were great too. Highly recommend this place. (by Jon Russ) [4 months ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - Busy bar restaurant, advise to book in season.
Food was excellent, I had the fish pie and the little lady gad the day special a prawn risotto which is her go to meal. She said it was one of the nicest ones she's had. My pie was delicious with a parmesan crust.
A shared dessert and couple of drinks saw the bill at ¬£65.
Not cheap but tasty.
A couple of drinks an (by Barry MacDonald) [a month ago]

name: Da Mirco Osteria Italian Restaurant
address: 4 Bridge St, Victorian Quarter, Cork, T23 H10E, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Lovely italian restaurant in Cork city(michelin guide). I booked tasting experience(min 2 people required). It was scrumptious! Very different from what i ususally get. I had dietary restrictions- they were very good & accomodating. Seatings are quite close-only drawback. Do reserve as it‚Äôs booked out mostly. St Patrick‚Äôs quay car park(paid) is so close to this place (by shalu kumaravel) [5 days ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Best italian in Cork!
Always consistently great italian food and wine. Mirco and his Team deliver excellency every time I visit. The menu changes regularly which makes it a great place to visit often. So if you‚Äòre looking for great italian food for a good price and amazing wine pairings - Da Mirco Osteria is the place to be! (by Christopher Thwaites) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - We were in Italy for 5 weeks this spring and had very very good food.  But nothing compared to the taste of the food here!  I was Shocked how tasty it was.  Even the said we had was over the top.  It‚Äôs a very small place so get Reservations!  There isn‚Äôt an a la carte menu here.  So understand that.  You will not be disappointed with the food.  The only thing I missed was the main pasta dish didn‚Äôt come with bread to sop up the delicious sauce!  But bread did come with the salad and it was something special. (by Bill Connell) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Very nice italian service. Not a bright menu but they serve big protions.
Love the focaccia and the drinks.
It‚Äôs a tiny nice place! (by Silvia Canevelli) [3 weeks ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Best TIRAMISU in Ireland! (Didn‚Äôt have time to take a picture hahah)
As Starter we got the charcuterie board and Halibut salad which was delicious and it is now my favourite salad in cork.
I got the pasta w/ zucchini and mint, and it was a great surprise. Success.
The other dessert, Pain Perdu, w a sorbet was delicious.
Can‚Äôt wait to be back.
Troppo bono.
Grazie. (by carolina martinelli gadotti) [4 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Loved Da Mirco, went for a special occasion and it was the perfect spot!
It was ‚Ç¨39 p.p. for our starter and main, I got grilled squid to start, and couldn't resist trying the lasagne for my main course - both were outstanding!
Great ambience and very attentive staff, looking forward to a future visit already! (by Sophie Buckley) [9 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Me and my boyfriend booked into Da Mirco for his birthday and couldn‚Äôt have had a better experience!

We rang ahead to ask about vegan options and they said they would be able to make something vegan if we mentioned it in the notes of our online booking üå±

The service was amazing, checking in just the right amount. They made me a vegan starter of foccaccia with pickled and roast veg on top - delicious! Vegan main they offered a few pasta dishes or risotto, I went for mint pesto pasta with crispy fried courgette on top. They also have vegan lemon sorbet for dessert. ü§© (by Isabel Bourke) [a year ago] | Review 8: 4 stars - Great spot for authentic Italian cuisine. Service is exceptional. We had a couple specials - octopus starter and halibut main - both excellent. Also the lamb pasta was delicious. The real standout for us was the dessert, a flourless chocolate cake with almond and caramel. Has to be one of the best desserts I‚Äôve ever had. (by Craig Villamor) [Edited a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Stellar service. Spectacular little spot. Small, friendly, attentive. Delicious food. Very tasty. Seafood special yummy. Very small mussels and langoustines. but great fun if you like that. All round fabulous! (by Hannah Willcox) [6 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Me and my wife ate here today and had the Chefs Tasting Menu with wine pairings. While the service started off a bit slow, eventually things seemed to get into a better pace. The two servers working were very professional and friendly.

The food itself was excellent. We had 4 courses plus a dessert. We also had focaccia  made in-house with some great olive oil. All very fresh, high quality ingredients, made in-house, authentic Italian dishes that weren‚Äôt just pasta and pizza. The lamb ragu was a particular standout for both of us! Much of the food was sourced from the nearby English Market they informed us.

The wine pairings were quite good; I particularly enjoyed the reds we were served along the two main courses (a lamb ragu pasta, and a pork chop with mushrooms).

I‚Äôd definitely eat here again. (by Alexander Jennings) [a year ago]

name: The Woodford
address: 20-21 Paul St, Centre, Cork, T12 EK53, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - The food we ordered was full of flavour - some real comfort food. It had the feeling of a traditional Irish bar but with a more modern twist; I can imagine the high ceilings lend it well to the live music (unfortunately we were not around to hear any at the time).

The service was faultless; super quick but we didn‚Äôt feel rushed. We therefore had plenty of time to finish our meal and our Beamish before heading to the airport to fly home! (by Emily Elizabeth) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - The Host was very welcoming and full of charm. The Irish stew and fish and chips were flavorful. Murphy and Beeamish Beer fresh and delicious. The pub was nicely appointed. Thank you Ireland!üáÆüá™ (by lisA fRosT) [3 weeks ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - This place is so cool. We are from the States and spent a week in Ireland, second time there. I had the steak. Honestly it was very tough, but great flavor. Everything else I ate was delicious. The place is so cool inside. Definitely check it out. (by Josh & Shelly Keller) [6 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Lovely food and service! Delicious, quality and copious. There was a very minor issue and they comped my dish. Totally unexpected and I protested but they insisted. Rare to see that level of professionalism nowadays.
My son‚Äôs steak was perfect, my lamb shank also. The friendly owner came to our table and gave us some sightseeing recommendations. (by K. Paul Petersen) [5 days ago] | Review 5: 3 stars - Woodford is a Cork Pub, Restaurant, and Live Music Venue including a Jazz night. I went there with my friends and had drinks and dinner. The food was above average for "pub grub,"  but one thing we didn't like was the music (not live) blasting in the venue. My friends were visiting from America and unfortunately we weren't able to have much of a conversation. We had to yell to hear one another cutting out earlier than planned. I would not go back with a group of people for dinner. It would only be for drinks and to see a live performance. (by Robert Schuppert-McDonald) [5 months ago] | Review 6: 1 star - Just went for lunch with my mom and sister ordered the n‚Äôduja mussels absolutely disgusted no sauce mussels overcooked chips weren‚Äôt cooked right or seasoned it was slightly rectified by the lovely waitress but with a fish taco that was missing the mango salsa also chips again we‚Äôll undercooked not sure what‚Äôs happening in what‚Äôs supposed to be such a well established business I‚Äôll never go back waste of 90 the total price of the meal. Would have enjoyed fast food better for half the price. So disappointing get real chefs and pay the right staff it‚Äôs basic business. (by Richard oconnor) [a week ago] | Review 7: 1 star - Just, don't. We had to Google if we had accidentally walked into a Wetherspoons. We bailed and paid the full check vs the battle of us complaining about the lack of quality throughout 90% of all ingredients. Look at that sausage üòû. Zoom in. Do it. Btw. The drinks were nice üôÇ (by Ben S) [2 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Cool place! Good music, great decorations, nice vibe overall. Beamish was perfect! (by A J (Lexi)) [a month ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Great food, nice pints, good staff (by Laura Leedy) [2 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - We really liked this place. We visited it a Thursday evening for dinner (party of 3).
The food was unexpectedly good! Everything we ordered was tasty, well cooked and the portions were generous! Cocktails were also nice!
As for the staff, all of them were fantastic, very pleasant, polite and with a nice sense of humour!
Great atmosphere as well! (by Athina Lymperi) [a year ago]

name: O'Flynns Gourmet Sausage Co.
address: 14 Winthrop St, Centre, Cork, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - We had some O‚ÄôFlynns sausages in the English market - very tasty. I had the original one - pictured. I‚Äôd highly recommend getting one, you can them in a few places around the city. (by Sarah O‚ÄôReilly) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Great sausage sandwich and sausage box. Great flavor. Side baked potato wedges were the best I've ever had. (by Mike Devlin) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Stumbled upon this place after arriving in Cork and wanting a late lunch. The two young women working were so friendly and helpful. They served me up a delicious meal and gave me a few tips on places to checkout while in town. Couldn't beat service like that, very good! (by Avrom Wolf) [a month ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Called in this evening ( Sunday 6th ) was greated by a gentleman and a lovly lady who couldn't of been nicer

Since this was my first time here I was unsure on what to order as I had seen videos of here on social media

Myself and friend went for the Dinner box with normal sausage and spuds with cheese and mayo and ohhh my God I was not disappointed

Would Highly recommend and staff are 5 STAR

Thanks again (by Wayne Crawford) [5 months ago] | Review 5: 4 stars - Flaky crust on all of the rolls, some of the sausage flavours are pretty mild and could use more flavour.  The potato side dish was fresh and hot. Fast service and reasonable prices. Indoor and outdoor  seating. (by C Yager) [a year ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Awesome value especially for the location in the heart of Cork. Great tasting well portioned food. Super friendly staff. Great menu choice. Great music choice. I enjoyed the Dawg monthly special which is great for something new and unique. I'll grab a quick good value bite here anytime I'm in Cork again. (by Samuel Gavin) [a year ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - These guys came to my work place. Staff running the place are good craic and so nice. To say that the hot dog was savage is an understatement. By far the best one I have ever have. If you are ever in the English Market in Cork, please do not miss these guys. Top notch stuff (by Gear√≥id) [3 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Fantastic food and what a great selection. Starting at ‚Ç¨7 euros. Call it what you want O' Flynns gourmet Sausage cafe is such a busy little hot dog sausage roll restaurant, how the staff get this food to you in such a fast way without losing the quality of the food served is what keeps people satisfied. Great to see how they work, with obvious pride to the core of the business. The end result is top quality food served to top quality standards. Fast service fresh tasty and filling. Check out the set menu or select your own ingredients. With dine in and take away options this is definitely worth a visit. Great Value. (by Mr Walsh) [Edited a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - We arrived as a group of 5, 4 of us from Canada. It was our first time here, the service was way above excellent! They explained the menu, and gave us suggestions on what was best to order. The 2 behind the grill/counter made this experience over the top!  Can not recommend enough! (by Mike Kimball) [4 months ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - I have had this place a few time I don't like their house potatoes personally. Each to their own. I like some of the options  more than others but it is quick and decent food (by Reviewer-Elisabeth) [a month ago]

name: My Goodness
address: Unit 1 & 2, English Market, Princes St, Centre, Cork, T12 W9XP, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Gorgeous freshly cooked Vegan food. All also Gluten free. I had the Kimchi Mac and Cheeze. It was fantastic. They also sell Kombucha and Kefir plus other vegan foods (by Paul Hill) [3 weeks ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - This cute booth at the market was a delicious pay off after wandering through the Cork food marketplace. I‚Äôm sucker for a kombucha on tap. Their seasonal flavor was ‚Äúbeetsy boy‚Äù & complimented the food nicely. The staff was exceptional offering samples and they were very knowledgeable/passionate about the vegan food scene. The quality and quantity of the food was a bargain. We got a unique assortment of dishes: home fried potatoes with kimcheeze (kimchi cheese) salad items and barbecue sauce along with Kimchi Mac N Cheeze complete with an oyster mushroom drumstick. I also got 2 vegan raw tarts. I wish I could eat this food every day; it was a treat! (by Kiara Durbin) [3 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Vegan Mac and cheese!! üå±üßÄüòã It‚Äôs a takeaway spot so I took my food to a bar close by and had a local beer with this amazing meal. (by Krystal Washington) [a week ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - The staff - amazing people, food- I've tried Kimchi Mac n Chezze with Mushroom Drumstick-delicious.

Perfect place for vegans and those with celiac disease. (by Klaudia) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Wonderful take away / shop focused on delicious ethical food. They have a real passion for fresh food and sustainability. You will not be disappointed. (by Richard Scriven) [2 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Hands down the best vegan nachos I‚Äôve ever had‚Äîand that‚Äôs saying a lot coming from a Texan! üíö The flavors were bold, the toppings generous, and the whole dish was so satisfying. A must-try stop in the English Market, even if you‚Äôre not vegan.  And such friendly staff, thank you! (by Neelam Damani) [3 weeks ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Delicious vegan food, beautiful locally grown vegetables, very friendly and helpful staff. Highly recommend. :) (by S√≠ofra Collins) [Edited a month ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - We had a very delicious wrap! All is gluten free and vegan, and super tasty! One of us has been vegan for many years and was super enthusiastic about the food combination and the nutritional value of our wraps!!!! A must go to even if you don‚Äôt eat vegan!!! The dessert was okay but the wraps were truly amazing!!! (by Inanna Riccardi) [2 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Near one exit of the English market, don't miss this gem ! Went for one sweet treat, ended with way too many. The vegan snickers bar is the best I have tasted so far, very peanuty, chocolate just cracking under your teeth. The mint and chocolate truffle is just perfect. Wild life was immediately attracted to all this delicousness ! Sorry could not wait, pictures have been taken after first bites. Chocolate corn crakle chewy in a good way, not too sweet ! So good. (by LV) [a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - An absolute vegan gem! Delicious food and we will definitely return. (by Niamh Walsh) [3 weeks ago]

name: Ristorante Rossini
address: 33 Princes St, Centre, Cork, T12 V12V, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - There‚Äôs a genuine reason this place is always packed. Salvetori looked after us brilliantly, and the manager on the night (from Croatia) couldn‚Äôt have been friendlier ‚Äî the service was faultless. The food was bloody delicious, every dish full of flavour and perfectly cooked. If you‚Äôre looking for a proper Italian, this is the one ‚Äî thank me later. A fantastic spot, well done lads! (by Jonathan Graham) [a week ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Me and my boyfriend went to Rossini‚Äôs for my birthday. We had no big expectations when arriving but proceeded to be blown away by this amazing restaurant. Alex and his team cultivated a phenomenal dining experience in this amazing and frankly underrated establishment. From the service, to the delicious food, to the warmth of the servers personality, this place is a cork gem. From the minute we walked in they proceeded to create an unforgettable atmosphere around us, from their singing and dancing we laughed and rejoiced as a group. Although it was just myself and my boyfriend at the table, it was the whole staff who curated an astounding experience for us. Thank you to Alex and his team, we will be returning due to your hard work and amazing dancing. (by Soph) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - This is a lovely Italian restaurant in a bustling part of Cork City. We shared a bruschetta to start which was absolutely delicious with plenty of flavour from the garlic and herbs. We both had margarita pizzas for mains, which were also really good. (by Daniel Farrelly) [3 months ago] | Review 4: 4 stars - Delicious food, large portions beautifully served. Truly Italian atmosphere of the restaurant. Beautiful Italian music but too loud combined with the noise of many guests makes it impossible to have a quiet conversation and destroys the pleasant atmosphere of this beautiful place a bit too loud. Place, food and incredibly professional and friendly service worth recommending. (by Monika Lorkowska) [4 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - I had an amazing dinner here last night! The pasta tasted fresh and homemade, and the sauce had that perfect balance of flavor without being too heavy. I ordered the seafood pasta, and the shrimp and clams were cooked perfectly. My partner had the wood-fired pizza, which came out hot with a crispy crust and just the right amount of char.

The staff was warm and attentive without being overbearing, and the atmosphere felt cozy but lively. We also shared a tiramisu for dessert ‚Äî honestly one of the best I‚Äôve ever had. Definitely recommend this place if you‚Äôre looking for authentic Italian food and a welcoming vibe. Can‚Äôt wait to come back!‚Äù (by MAY GC) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Had fetucinni bolognese and nduja pasta special. Both excellent. Food was great. Had the dog and was happy for us to sit outside. So can't say much for atmosphere or service. Staff knowledgeable, friendly and atmosphere inside seems buzzing on a Saturday. (by April Welsh) [5 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Got carbonara, pizza, chips, garlic dough balls & fettuccine salmon. Absolutely great staff, great atmosphere, great food. Not one complaint from any one at our table. Definitely worth a visit. (by Serena Pyke) [5 months ago] | Review 8: 3 stars - This is a tourist factory.  Move them in, move them out.

They stuff the restaurant with too many tables, you cannot hear your dinner companions.  We were rushed to order before we had even taken off our coats.  Then a different waiter came to take our dinner order, before we had even gotten some water or looked at the wine list.

I am sure there are better restaurants in Cork that have decent food and a more pleasant atmosphere. (by John Hosterman) [2 weeks ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - I had the pleasure of dining at Ristorante Rossini yesterday with my family, and it was an outstanding experience from start to finish. The atmosphere was warm and welcoming, perfect for a family gathering. The service was exceptional attentive, every staff member we interacted with was professional, kind, and committed to making our evening enjoyable. The food was absolutely excellent. Each dish was beautifully presented, full of flavor, and prepared with great attention to detail. From appetizers to dessert, everything exceeded our expectations.
Ristorante Rossini is truly a gem. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for authentic cuisine, impeccable service, and a memorable dining experience. We will definitely be returning.
Cobian Family! (by Mayomy Hernandez) [a month ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - My favourite place in Cork.

I‚Äôve been going to Rossini‚Äôs for years - celebrated loads of birthdays and special occasions here. I‚Äôve tried loads of different dishes but always end up back to the spaghetti carbonara, it‚Äôs my fav. Their cocktails are amazing too, especially the Cosmos!

The owner and staff are always so lovely and genuinely would go out of their way for you. Over the years I‚Äôve brought loads of friends who had never been before - and now they love Rossini‚Äôs as much as I do üòÖ No complaints keep doing what you are doing!! (by Saoirse O‚ÄôSullivan) [3 months ago]

name: Isaac's Restaurant
address: 48 MacCurtain Street, Victorian Quarter, Cork, T23 F6EK, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 4 stars - This place was almost perfect. To start with, they have a great wine selection, with many different options for you to choose from. My husband and I both got the 10oz Sirloins, my steak was cooked a perfect med rare. However, my husband ordered his medium and it came out well done. They were super busy that night, so he powered through it and finished his meal. We were starving and didn't want to wait for another steak to come out. Other than that, the sides were all perfectly seasoned and the desserts were to die for. I definitely suggest getting the chocolate St. Emilion. (by Dustin Hughes) [a year ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - Great restaurant yhat we have visited a few times. The staff are great  the place is clean and the food is always good. The building is unique. Always worth a visit. (by BANANA BADGER) [a year ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - My wife and I enjoyed a fabulous anniversary dinner here. Although it was extremely busy, the hostess seated us at a nice table. We hade the steak It was incredibly fresh and tasty. The Tunisian server was super nice and friendly the service was amazing ü•∞ü•∞ü•∞
Definitely recommend and will be back (by Food Lover) [Edited 2 years ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Superb dining experience from start to finish.

The restaurant itself is quite understated, but very elegant. Staff were all welcoming, friendly and attentive - without being overbearing.

But the food was the real star of the show; I had the Vegetable Curry - which was excellent. My son and daughter-in-law thoroughly enjoyed their choices too.

The soda bread (which I believe they make themselves) was by far the best we‚Äôve had during our entire trip to Ireland. And trust me when I say that we ate a lot of soda bread!

Highly recommended, and I‚Äôd advise you book in advance, as this place is always busy! (by Caroline Findlay) [2 years ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Celebrated birthday lunch with my sister's here & it couldn't have been better. Beautiful place. Food was INCREDIBLE. And the service was absolutely impeccable. I cannot rate or recommend this place any higher.

Thank you so much for a wonderful afternoon (by Paula Kenneally) [2 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - We'd only just arrived in Cork when we decided to have dinner here; however we hand't made a reservation so we were prepared to go elsewhere if necessary. The woman who greeted us said she'd check if we could have a table, as they had several reservations and they were preparing for a massive group of teachers to arrive (celebrating the end of the school year). She walked around the entire restaurant with her seating chart, counting and calculating. We were thrilled she was able to seat us, and even with such a huge group coming, our service wasn't affected in the least. We felt very taken care of and our meal was delicious. Once those teachers did arrive, though, the decibel level rose incredibly. With brick walls, high ceilings and open areas, there's nothing to really absorb the sound. So when it's packed with an enthusiastic very large group, it can get loud. But overall I'd say it was a very pleasant dining experience, we truly appreciated getting seated without a reservation, and our meal was great. I'd go again in a heartbeat. (by Julie Schmidt) [7 years ago] | Review 7: 4 stars - Fantastic steak. The meat was cooked to perfection, one of the best I ever had. Just a bit bland without any herbs or spice. Great wine available. This is one of the better restaurants in Cork, definitely. If only parking would be possible! (by Sascha Giese) [5 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - We had a wonderful meal last night. Very professional and warm service. The menu had a great selection to choose from, and all four of us enjoyed our food. Highly recommend this restaurant. (by Sonia Cribbin) [3 months ago] | Review 9: 3 stars - Was there as part of a work do.  20 plus people so hat tip for accommodating us.  Service was fast and responsive. Ordered the black pudding salad starter which was nice but the pudding a little undercooked (not crispy). Acknowledge this might be a personal preference but still.  Ordered fish cakes as a main and they were not great.  Dry and lacking seasoning. My co workers seemed happy with their mains. It's a good location but wasn't blown away with the food. (by Lugh O Morain) [6 months ago] | Review 10: 1 star - The manager (a red haired woman) was very rude! She believed we didn‚Äôt understand English, she was impolite and hasty.
Very bad customer experience!
The food was good and the turkish waiter who served us was friendly and professional. (by Assunta D) [7 years ago]

name: Il Padrino Restaurant
address: 21 Cook St, Centre, Cork, T12 K3KA, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Amazing family meal here today. Great atmosphere and attentive staff.  Great range of dishes on the menu.  Food was amazing especially the pasta dishes we ordered.  Would 100% recommend to anyone looking for a great Italian meal out in Cork. (by Mike Briggs) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Loved this place! We got this on a local recomendation and it was a good one. Food was equal to Rome but the hostess and service made the experience great! Highly recomend (by Kevin Lee) [a week ago] | Review 3: 4 stars - I ordered a vegetarian pizza and a hot chocolate.

The vegetarian pizza didn‚Äôt feel like a true, authentic pizza. It was heavily loaded with mozzarella cheese, which completely overpowered the other flavors. While there was a reasonable amount of vegetables, the combination didn‚Äôt come together well. The overall taste was dominated by the excessive cheese, making the dish feel unbalanced and quite heavy.

The hot chocolate was also disappointing. It is advertised as an ‚ÄúItalian chocolate,‚Äù but the flavor resembled something closer to a basic dairy milk hot chocolate. It lacked the richness, texture, and depth typically associated with Italian-style hot chocolate.

Overall, while the presentation was decent, the taste and authenticity of both dishes left much to be desired. (by Shridhyey Gupta) [4 months ago] | Review 4: 4 stars - I visited Il Padrino for dinner as a group of four people.

I would recommend reserving a table. The restaurant fills up with diners very quickly after 6pm.

There is a great variety of dishes to choose from. We ordered Arancini, or deep fried rice balls, and garlic bread for starters. Both were delicious, though we would have welcomed more than two rice balls on the plate.

For the main course, everybody ordered something different: risotto, tagliatelle, chips. We all enjoyed our meals. I had tagliatelle with chicken and mushroom sauce, "Tagliatelle al Pollo", which was exceptional and the garlic bread accompanying the dish was nice.

The staff were all friendly and very quick to fulfill our requests for extra water and sharing plates.

One nice improvement to the menu would be the addition of photos of most or all dishes on the menu. It makes it easier for people unfamiliar with Italian dishes to understand what is on offer.

I would recommend Il Padrino to anyone looking to eat out at an Italian restaurant in the heart of Cork City. (by Arash) [a month ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Second time here to this authentic Italian restaurant and it was just as delicious as the first! Everything on the menu that we have tried has been top notch and plentiful.

The only negative I have is the price of minerals at ‚Ç¨3.90 each.

Don‚Äôt let this put you off though. The homely atmosphere makes you feel as though you are in the heart of Italy.

Service was swift and attentive. We will be back no doubt! üáÆüáπ

Don‚Äôt let this put you off however. The service was swift and attentive. (by Eoghan O‚ÄôConnor) [a year ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - The carbonara is to die for. I'm not kidding. It's the best Carbonara I've ever had, and I've had a few. Pizza was really good, too, and Tiramisu was just amazing. Service is exceptional. We were seated right at the pass where the food came out of the kitchen, and it was so nice to see the whole process (I watched my Carbonara being made and plated just for me). Wine was delicious. The only beer they have is Peroni, but sure, that's not the end of the world. Loved everything about it, the atmosphere, food, service, all 10 out of 10. (by Ieva Loca) [5 months ago] | Review 7: 4 stars - I love this restaurant and have been going here on and  off here for probably 15 years.  Anything I say here is in the context of me liking the restaurant and is meant in a constructive way. The best thing about this place is undoubtedly the staff. They're always friendly and kind, particularly when there are kids involved. I ordered a pizza margherita. The base wasn't "right". It didn't have the elasticity and lightness found in a good base. The base reminded me of a sort of crusty bread in texture. Previous pizzas in Il Padrino haven't always been like this, although the last few times they have been. The tomato sauce wasn't pletniful on the pizza and didn't have any tang or basil flavour. The pizza was laden with a salty mozzarella and cheddar. The experience at the restaurant was lovely.  The atmosphere was lovely. The lighting and setting also really pleasing.  I'll always turn here as I've always liked these factors but please give us the pizzas like ye used to make - light, full of flavour, and not too cheesy. I hope ye don't mind the feedback. (by Kevin Byrne) [Edited 2 months ago] | Review 8: 4 stars - The food is enjoyable, I love the risotto here! It‚Äôs always been very busy when I‚Äôve visited but the staff deal with it well and around tables impressively quickly! Have always had friendly and pleasant service too. It is a bit crowded in there with tables being quite close to each other,  but in a way it does add to the character of the place. If you‚Äôre in Cork and like Italian food, it‚Äôs definitely a great place to try. One of my favourite Italian restaurants in Cork. (by K 99) [3 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - First class all round. Stephen was fantastic..Has to be a visit while in Cork (by Martin Connelly) [3 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Dropped in for early evening dinner for four, before a show at the Marquee, on Jul 3.
