Thaks for doing a vegan menu üíö  Casual sit-in area facing the [bars on the] window, which makes for a good people-watching spot (by Dani Green) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - I tried Mi Goreng for the first time in Malaysia and honestly, my first impression wasn‚Äôt great. But at this restaurant, it was so delicious! I found this place randomly on Google maps and it didn‚Äôt disappoint. The noodles were so flavorful and will definitely come back again! (by Kwang Sujinno) [9 months ago] | Review 4: 4 stars - Best food! I had their pad Thai. It was phenomenal. And everything on the menu is halal which is a plus!! (by Sabrina Mohammed) [a month ago] | Review 5: 4 stars - Have fond memories of Malay kitchen so was delighted to be back as the opening times aren't great when we're around in Cork city.

Got the pad Thai and garlic & fried rice for lunch and it was delightful. Gutted that they no longer offer their Khao Pad but delighted to still see Malay Kitchen in Cork city. Do miss their lunch specials which was rampant around Cork before, understandable given the cost of living crisis but visit was bittersweet.

Dining/sit down area is smaller (bar seating) and they don't have 'free water' station anymore.
Great if you're into spicy food.
Staff was lovely and thorough, hard to understand sometimes but it's all good. Would visit again if we find ourselves in the city and if they're open. (by Gniddew Liame) [9 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Amazing little gem in Cork üíé so many vegan options! I tried the Satay Noodles with Seitan. It was delicious! My friend had the crispy beef dish and he loved it. They were generous with the seitan and beef too. Lovely, friendly staff that happily greeted and recommended what to try. Would happily return to this place! (by Yvonne Alonso) [3 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - If you‚Äôre ever in cork this is where to go. Unreal flavours and reasonable price we got two recommended noodles dishes. So so good (by Gina Ramsden) [a week ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Had a little Google search for Asian food in Cork and this place came up. Did not disappoint at all. Smiling service and very quickly put together fresh in front of me. Definitely worth a try folks (by Mark Hinchliffe) [9 months ago] | Review 9: 4 stars - Small hole in the wall restaurant. The food was good, but a bit sweet, and rather it have a bit more heat than sweetness. Overall was good and a nice break from the standard Irish pub food. Seating is very limited. (by Zach Terzic) [2 months ago] | Review 10: 2 stars - Always like the mee goreng here and its always good. Recently had ordered the famous chilli crispy beef, and it tasted overly sweet fried meat and barely edible. Feedback given to staff but no reponse. (by fatin salwani) [7 months ago]

name: CoqBull
address: 18 Academy St, Centre, Cork, T12 KWX7, Ireland
reviews: Review 1: 5 stars - Stopped in for lunch and to be honest it was purely based on the name of the restaurant. The food was great. The wings fell off the bone and had a great flavor. My wife's chicken sandwich was great and the garlic cheese fries were weirdly great! Service was also on point. Only gripe would be the smoothie we ordered was more of a banana milkshake than a smoothie, but still tasted great. (by mark watanabe) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Couldn‚Äôt fault this restaurant. Food and drinks were delicious. Homemade lemonade was particularly nice, as were the chicken wings !! Staff were very friendly and decor was very modern and spacious. (by Sarah O‚ÄôReilly) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 4 stars - Had a fantastic experience at Coqbull Cork! The food was absolutely delicious, especially the chicken wings and cauliflower wings ‚Äì both were packed with flavor. But what really stood out was the service ‚Äì friendly, attentive, and made the whole meal even more enjoyable. (by Nikitha Nair) [4 months ago] | Review 4: 4 stars - Just came for a quick visit to cork city and have some brunch, food was okay. Over priced as the potion size are small but nice. Staff were friendly and accommodating. (by Chirantha Lokugamage) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 3 stars - I entered the place excited to try the rotisserie chicken they proudly advertise. So, I ordered the CoqClub, only to be met with an unpleasant surprise at the first bite. It felt like biting into an air sandwich. The dish contained barely three shreds of chicken per half. Even the fries were extra. The taste and ambiance were good, but I left hungry after receiving such an insultingly low amount of protein. (by Franco) [2 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - 5 of us visited here on Sunday evening the food was delicious. 2 of us had bacon burgers 2 had salads and 1 veggie burger. Their fries are amazing followed by dessert. Staff were very friendly and attentive great atmosphere too. Well worth a visit. (by N D) [9 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Exceeded expectations in food and service, delightful cocktails, big flavours from every dish. Gabriel was super cool. Thanks for a great valentines night (by Eoghan Hennessy) [7 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Great food, friendly staff, amazing decor. Definitely recommend. (by Diarmuid Barry) [Edited 6 days ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Had a wonderful dinner with our party of 6. Very accommodating with great food. The steak sandwich had a portobello mushroom that made the sandwich. Loaded fries were outstanding. (by Trace Palmer) [a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - It was delicious enough to eat 2 hamburgers each and thank you Diego for the nice, fast and friendly service. (by Tuba Yenice) [2 months ago]

name: Paper Boys
address: Tobin St, Centre, Cork, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - This place was AMAZING. The food was sooo good, we got the fried buttermilk chicken with fries and the French toast. It was savory, crunchy and was seasoned perfectly. I ate in the little garden there is behind, it was a lovely place with a great atmosphere. The service was really nice, the food took a little long to come out, but it‚Äôs understandable since they were packed. I will be definitely coming back! (by Mar√≠a) [6 days ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Truly the best breakfast I‚Äôve had in Ireland - honestly maybe ever? At first I was bummed because I wanted the chicken & waffle I saw on the menu pictured here (it was dated, though). I thought about skipping to eat somewhere else but one of the staff said they instead do fried chicken & French toast so I had to try it.

It‚Äôs absolutely INCREDIBLE. The French toast is almost like a kouign-amann or croissant bun and the fried chicken is the absolute best I‚Äôve ever had. Wild that that‚Äôs true of Ireland :)

The chicken was perfectly spicy, perfectly cooked, and stayed crunchy but juicy the entire meal. Blown away. I also got an iced dirty chia and it was really good. I find the seating a bit uncomfortable but manageable (even as a large person).

Highly recommend - must try. (by keithlee spangler) [4 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Five stars across the board for food, value and service at this gorgeous spot. Thank to our host Zelen for his warmth and friendliness. I highly recommend the French toast with fried chicken - you can tell everything is prepared with love in here! Service was quick and great value for money. A must visit when in the city. ü•∞ (by Helen L) [4 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - The food we ordered was really nice. We liked ham hock. Couldn‚Äôt stay for tea and coffee after our breakfast because we felt cold. It wasn‚Äôt warm comfortable temperature inside for us. (by Naneh Hovhannisyan) [5 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Brilliant.

Staff friendly and attentive without being pushy.

We sat in the garden which is an odd but nice spot to sit out in.

We both ate ‚ÄúThe Morning Issue‚Äù and they were both delicious. (by Richard Capes) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Really high quality food with a distinctive menu. I had the Benny Boru which was excellent. Lovely ham hock along with eggs and boxty. I‚Äôd also say the coffee is the best I‚Äôve had in Ireland. Australian level of quality (by Stephen O) [3 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Believe the reviews, seriously the best food I‚Äôve had so far in Ireland, which I‚Äôm sure could be controversial. Amazing food, describing wouldn‚Äôt do justice. Drinks were also perfect! (by Kayla Kelly) [6 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Great place for a brunch! Didn't know what to expect since the inside looked smaller and more quaint, but then a back outside area was just around the other side of the cashier space. Great food, good portions, friendly staff, reasonably priced and good atmosphere / music. Well deserved 5 stars rating. (by Kat M) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - A good choice of items on the menu and really friendly and accommodating staff. The space is small and cosy. This Turkish eggs dish is incredible, I loved every single mouthful; a great serving of bread with it to mop up that flavourful yoghurt. So good, will be back to eat it again!!! (by Orla) [10 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Great spot for brunch! We ordered The Day Tripper and Benny Boru.  Both really good (by So Fi) [2 months ago]

name: Dock 84 Donegal
address: Main St, Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 1 star - My worst experience ever. We seen Dock 84 on Sunday the 28th of September and decided we would try it for breakfast as we were hungry. We came in and got seated straight away and it didn‚Äôt take long for someone to take our order. We ordered a full fry and breakfast bap with chips on the side tea and a jug of water. The waitress told us they could only do bottled water which was ok, she brought sparking water instead of still which we could deal with. Then our breakfast came out and they forgot the chips which again we could deal with not that big of an issue‚Ä¶ however I started to eat my fry and noticed a hair on my egg after further inspection we had noticed the fry was full of hair ! We were disgusted by this and just wanted to leave we went up to let our waitress know of the issue and she said ‚Äúcan I see it‚Äù the evidence was left on a tissue and there was still more on the breakfast itself. She took the fry off the bill but still charged for the rest. Personally from working as a waitress myself I believe we shouldn‚Äôt have been charged at all the breakfast bap was barely ate as-well the entire experience was just horrible and I felt sick all day. I would not recommend this establishment to anyone and I certainly won‚Äôt be back myself! (by Anastasija O Reilly) [6 days ago] | Review 2: 3 stars - Had vegetarian breakfast here. It was delicious. Coffees had free refills.

We were 13 and less than 10 minutes after ordering, we received the food. The service was top notch!

They really live by their motto ‚Äúwe don‚Äôt serve fast food but we serve food fast‚Äù.

Definitely recommend this place! (by Chaimae Kadmiri) [Edited 2 years ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - We just had lunch, it was excellent !!!
Highly recommend !
Tasty fresh food, excellent service, most friendly staff
üëåüëç (by JP) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 4 stars - A fine restaurant conveniently located close to the Donegal Town Car Park. The food is good and the cost is effective. Good food and nice service. Reducing one star as we were not informed of a missing item in our breakfast until asked and also the check took and eternity to arrive. (by ARUN Thundyill Saseendran) [3 years ago] | Review 5: 4 stars - My husband and I stopped here for a bite to eat with our two kids aged 5 and under. We had to wait by the door for about 5 minutes for a table. When seated, we ordered the Chicken Curry served with half rice and half chips at ‚Ç¨13.95 and the fresh battered Haddock with tartar sauce, peas and chips at ‚Ç¨15.50. We shared all between us and all the food was very good. We also ordered an Americano at ‚Ç¨3 and Cappuccino for ‚Ç¨3.50 and Miwadi for the children. Very decent portions, tasty and solid fare. We were pleased with the food. Service was okay: I asked for another glass of Miwadi for myself but the busy waitress forgot otherwise efficient service. (by Emily O'Connor) [a year ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - This review was for Furey‚Äôs Diner

Plenty of normal food options and then pasta that's a hidden gem, big portions as well

Super friendly staff who are quick to serve and help, plus quick to have a chat

It's nice to see the sponsorship of a family member rally team and then loads of other rally and motorbike posters etc

The music was almost as good as the music (one of the girls playlists)

Highly recommend (by Jeffrey King) [Edited a year ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - We stumbled across this place by accident, the place we were going to eat at stopped serving a 15:00, our second choice was shut for January. So we had a little walk and then sat a sign for here and we‚Äôre glad we did.

We walked from the diamond down an alley but you can access it from the car park opposite Aldi.

The first thing I noticed as we walked in was how clean it was.

We ordered the classic steak burger with chips.

It was a really tasty burger, very flavoursome.

The staff are friendly and the food came out in a timely manner.

When I‚Äôm in Donegal town again I would eat here. (by 6373nerd) [a year ago] | Review 8: 4 stars - Delicious food, nice atmosphere, friendly staff.
Amazing value.

Soup, sandwich (fillings of your choice), and coffee/tea (free refills!) for only ‚Ç¨7.95. Great value! (by Ciar√°n Dunne) [6 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Breakfast was perfect  - everything served at the right temperatures - service was great  - my 7th day in Ireland and best Breakky so far - enjoy üòÅ (by Mark O‚ÄôKeeffe) [3 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Friendly place with good food. Pastries are delicious. Service with a smile. (by Shawn Bevins) [5 months ago]

name: The Fleet Inn Guesthouse & Restaurant
reviews:
Review 1: None - We stayed one night in The Fleet. Great location in the heart of Killybegs.  The room was clean and a good size. Up some steep stairs but we had been told that in advance so was fine. Staff checking us in were very friendly. When we asked ‚Ä¶ (by Frances122014) | Review 2: None - I recently stayed at The Fleet Inn and was thoroughly impressed from start to finish. The staff couldn‚Äôt have been more welcoming or helpful. The rooms were very nicely finished, spotlessly clean, and extremely comfortable. The food was exceptional and truly exceeded expectations!

On top of that, the location is perfect for exploring nearby walks and attractions. I wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to recommend The Fleet Inn to anyone visiting the area, a real gem! (by Aaron Eivers) | Review 3: None - The service at the restaurant was fantastic and the location is hard to beat. The portions of food were large and good value for money. The food itself was quality. The reason I‚Äôm not giving it 5 star is because of the cocktails. They are cheap but they taste syrupy. The expresso martini was like a milkshake, the bramble was pure sugar, and the margarita came out with no salt rim.
Overall a great place to eat and drink, highly recommend. (by Cameron Brown) | Review 4: None - This is the best bar we visited when we stayed in Killybegs.  The atmosphere was great, the staff were very friendly and quick to serve, and the Guinness was great.  The food was disappointing.  We didn't stay in the accommodation so cannot provide feedback on that.  Overall a great bar, and one I recommend visiting and one i will definitely go back to. (by J D) | Review 5: None - The fleet is a great spot! Delicious food, lots to choose from on the menu. Good kids menu also. Staff are super friendly, service is prompt, professional and knowledgeable. The bar is extremely clean and the pints of Guinness are top notch!! (by Sheena McAvinney) | Review 6: None - Great location, friendly staff. Clean reasonably sized room, just like the photos.  Atmospheric bar.
Closed for dinner the night we were there but staff directed us to a good alternative.  Great place to stay. (by Simon K) | Review 7: None - Very friendly staff and they got us a meal even though we were late arriving. Recommended. The Fleet Inn is easy to find and there is plenty of parking nearby at the harbour. The Guinness is good and we were brought a whole jug of iced water free of charge when one of our party asked for a glass. (by nardo2015) | Review 8: None - Great ,friendly service even though understaffed.  Beautiful fish n chips with the best herby peas &homemade Tangy tartare sauce.. Will definitely be back. You should check it out! 5stars! (by she was) | Review 9: None - Awesome place! Irish hospitality at its best. Great fish & chips and amazing team. Was here last September, and Gavin, the owner, remembered me! Slaint√© (by PlanetPhips) | Review 10: None - Came for dinner, food was hearty and the ambiance of the pub was lovely.  There was live music after 9pm on Friday evenings but we just missed it. (by Amanda Leighton)

name: Burrito Loco
address: 41 Port Rd, Letterkenny, Co. Donegal, F92 AYN6, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Great food, great service, authentic and comfy indoor area. Unbelievable value for money ! Their food is not only tasty but also a high quality one. Whatever you order you will enjoy it for sure.
We ordered one chicken burrito, chicken wings, toasted potato waffles and a pulled pork burrito, plus three diff drinks from the famous local Football Special brand. All of the meals were finger licking!
Highly recommended, definitely one of the must-visits of Letterkenny restaurants! (by A.) [2 years ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Good value , atmosphere, friendly staff. Comfortable seating
Good amount of complimentary fries and seasoned nicely.
I got the nashville chicken burger which was very nice
One feedback i found the crust on the fried chicken in the burger slightly hard but still tastyüòã (by B Play) [a year ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Food is amazing! Love the service! Must try single smash single cheese burger üçî (by Rutu Patel) [4 months ago] | Review 4: 2 stars - been going here for almost a decade but recently they've been constantly increasing their prices to the point it feels like a scam, they have just recently not only increased the price of the burrito by over ten percent but have also introduced an extra charge if your burrito has meat in it (please note it is not advertised as a veggie burrito) they charge you extra for damn near everything beside the rice and beans. on top of that their just eat menu prices are completely different than the instore prices. until they fix their prices i shall not be returning despite being loyal customer of theirs since the beginning (by Dr. Phil) [4 months ago] | Review 5: 1 star - Been here a few times,been disappointed. Chips over seasoned, fish tacos dry and salty. Better options elsewhere. Should do better for the price they charge. (by Anthony D) [3 weeks ago] | Review 6: 1 star - I agree with many other reviews here, terrible food. So much wrong with this ‚Äúburrito‚Äù.

The rice was not cooked properly and was hard. The beans were not cooked properly and were really hard. The sour cream was as thick as Greek yogurt. The cheese was either frozen or some bizarre rock hard variety that doesn‚Äôt melt. The whole thing was not very hot despite being eaten immediately.  The server tried to put lettuce on before cheese (what on earth?) meaning the cheese didn‚Äôt even soften in the slightly. Every component was basically undercooked and cold.

I see some reviews saying this is ‚Äòexcellent‚Äô like chipotle or tortilla, have those people ever eaten at those brands? This is nothing like those brands, they serve actual burritos; this place does not serve burritos or Mexican food. It is wrong to call this a burrito. It would be insulting and even borderline cultural appropriation to call these products burritos. Have the owners or the people leaving five star reviews ever eaten an actual burrito before? It doesn‚Äôt seem like it. This place serves horrible undercooked Irish wraps.

Avoid. (by Jake H) [a year ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Fantastic experience as always. Friendly and helpful staff. Great food and great atmosphere.  üëå (by natasha crossan) [6 days ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Great food, very large portion. Only issue with the place is that  the menu boards showing the 4 stages of selection.....type of wrap, main filling, sauce etc are placed in the wrong order so stages are 4,3,2,1. This will make it awkward when it is busy (by Gary Spencer) [2 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Splendid Mexican food location. Similar to Chipotle‚Äôs or Fuzzy Tacos in US, Burrito Loco has the most authentic Tex-Mex food we‚Äôve found in all of Donegal, Northern Ireland, and UK.   We definitely know authentic as we‚Äôve been all over Mexico and many parts of Texas.  Burrito Loco has delicious food that‚Äôs definitely worth going ‚Äôloco‚Äô over. (by Saoirse N√≠ Cheandaill) [2 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Very tasty burrito bowl. Decent prices. Nice restaurant. Lovely staff. (by Gareth Maybury) [a month ago]

name: Friel Restaurant
address: The Diamond, Raphoe Townparks, Lifford, Co. Donegal, Ireland
service_options: Johnston's Fresh Food Takeaway ¬∑ 5.0 stars ¬∑ 2 reviews ¬∑ Restaurant
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - A true gem in the town. A family run establishment for generations, that hasn't lost its charm. The same friendly staff, the same cosy decor and the same delicious comfort food, which brought back great memories. Excellent value for money and generous portions. Highly recommend you try it out if you're in the area! Special thanks to Sarah and Lauren for their fantastic service! (by Tara McGlynn) [a month ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - Super friendly staff providing great service.
Food is hearty and great value.
Definitely worth stopping by (by Kenny Smith) [a year ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Took our son to friels today for a birthday lunch.The food was amazing the service was excellent..We were made feel so welcome..A big Thankyou to Rose and the young lad that served us .Also a big Thankyou to the chef and rest of staff we will definitely be back üòäüëåü§© (by Donna Campbell) [a year ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - We were on visit to stone circle,,so we went in ,I think it was just ten minutes before closing,,not a problem for them,, lovely turkey dinner,and partner had soup and sandwiches and tea...service from young fella was great...very very reasonable price.We will call again. (by Ray Forbes) [2 years ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Great food - Very good value - so friendly. LOVE this place. (by Ed Murphy) [7 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Great food. You won‚Äôt leave hungry. Excellent value. (by Michael Kelly) [7 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Had a lovely meal it was just like we were never away.couldnt fault the whole experience.John and the staff couldn't do enough for us.Hopefully friels hotel will go from strength to strength (by Sadie Mccrossan) [5 years ago] | Review 8: 4 stars - Great food. Authentic atmosphere,  Good place to grab a bite and a drink (by jacqueline brennan) [6 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Friendly staff great food excellent value and service (by Anthony Laird) [7 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - In over 50 years Friels Hotel never disappoints The Fish was so good  üëèüëè (by Mary McIntyre) [a year ago]

name: The Oak Lounge
address: 38G9+JQ, Loughnakey, The Lagg, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 3 stars - Food was lukewarm at best. It was tasty enough I suppose, but nothing you couldn't make yourself. The staff were friendly and efficient. The prices were probably on a par with most of Donegal. Quantity was good but not sure about today quality. Most restaurants in Letterkenny already better. The problem is in Milford there is no other competition, so if you have to eat in Milford fine. If not head to Leterkenny. (by Sean Curran) [4 weeks ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - Very welcoming.
Staff are very helpful.
We were there abit earlie, a bit quite but music üé∂  was enjoying.
And they have a free taxi if you are local . (by Joe Otoole) [Edited a year ago] | Review 3: 4 stars - Very friendly staff and helpful food lovely. (by karen connolly) [2 years ago] | Review 4: 4 stars - Very nice and warm welcome (by Donnelly Eugene Parnell) [2 years ago]

name: Oasis Bar
address: Unit 12A-B Letterkenny Shopping Centre, Port Rd, Letterkenny, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Honestly one of the nicest places I‚Äôve ever been! I just came off the bus from Omagh and  as soon as I entered a lovely waitress was right over to get me to a table. Although it was very busy the food was out extremely fast! The food itself was exquisite. Highly recommend! üëèüèº (by Megan Pritchard) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Great ambiance and delicious food. Good Vegetarian options and the Cajun Chicken pasta was top notch.
Mango mocktail which is not on the menu but is very nice and is a must try.. If you want you can choose to get the alcoholic version as well.
On request they were also able to add Happy Birthday and put a sparkle ‚ú® to our dessert to make it special.
Just one feedback there was some bits of food underneath our table and that must be cleaned along with the table top after every service from a hygiene perspective. (by Nishant Singh) [2 years ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Very cozy and wonderful place. Friendly staff and very tasty cuisine. (by –ê–Ω–∞—Å—Ç–∞—Å–∏—è –ë–æ–≥–æ–º–æ–ª) [6 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - My favorite place. I recommend everyone to visit here at least once. Wonderful atmosphere, beautiful design, good prices and large portions. The dishes taste great. (by –°–∫—É–π–±–µ–¥–∞ –ê–Ω–Ω–∞) [a year ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Nice place. Food is top class. I've been here a lot and the food has been top class. (by Paul Ward) [3 months ago] | Review 6: 3 stars - Had the 10oz Steak, 3oz still on the plate in the shape of fat. Very very chewy cut of meat, although seasoned and cooked correctly, just a poor quality. Rest of the dish was tasty, just disappointed overall. (by Darron Mark (DigitalNomadNI)) [a year ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - What a lovely bar/restaurant!! The staff here were just so so lovely, good fun. The service was great and very prompt. Great atmosphere and very comfortable. The food was nice battered fish a little crispier than I would prefer but still lovely! Would definitely recommend and I will return again when I‚Äôm back! ü•∞ (by Caitriona) [6 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Great food, friendly staff. (by Neil Gallagher) [a month ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - If you want to stop off at a place for great Food and Drinks, Oasis Bar and Grill is the place to go in Letterkenny, Co.Donegal...The Staff are great, brilliant service. They make the best Pasta Carbonara that I ever tried... Possibly the best in Ireland.. Highly recommended üëçüèª‚ò∫Ô∏è ‚Ä¶ (by Mr.B) [4 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - The food here is always phenomenal, waitressing staff are always so polite and helpful, all of the staff should be commended on their clear hard work and dedication. (by L√∫cas Meehan) [4 months ago]

name: Benny & Co coffee bar & restaurant
address: Main St, Ballybofey, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - We had a lovely time in Benny & Co. Fantastic service, amazing food, and great coffee, too. Some of my friends had mentioned the lovely soup you get there.  So, of course, I  had to try.  It was a butternut squash soup served with sourdough bread.  It was yummy. (by Marie G.) [a year ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Second time we've been here, what a lovely place! Great atmosphere, we had lunch and despiste being super busy, our food came out quickly and was really tasty and well presented - compliments to the chef! The staff were friendly and helpful. Totally recommended, we will be back on our next visit to Ballybofey. (by Laura Rivero de Aguilar Gonz√°lez) [a year ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Legitimately good food! Highly recommend‚Äî good mix of locals and tourists- coffee, desserts, food, treats, and wine! (by A. Eberlein) [Edited a month ago] | Review 4: 3 stars - Coffee was very nice sausages rolls were very meaty and a nice flavour. We were in between breakfast and lunch so options were limited. (by Sean Curran) [7 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Lovely little caf√© on the main street not far from the main shopping area of McElhinneys. Staff were very friendly and helpful. We only had sandwiches with tea and coffee but it was delicious. I will happily visit again. Clean and pleasant place. (by Colin Green) [3 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - One of the best places we are in all of Ireland! Super fresh- unique menu- and flavorful meals.  Our group of 5 loved all our meals. Highly recommend!! (by Brett Cleveland) [4 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Arancini was beautifully flavoured. The fish dish & sauce was also really good. Service was excellent. Wish they did cookery lessons Definitely be back (by Eileen Mc Gonigle) [6 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Just passing through and definitely worth the visit.
Delicious soup and sandwich,
Service was really quick.
Very friendly staff and great coffee too.

Can't wait for our next trip to stop here again. (by Paul Mc Daid) [4 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Really good food and super nice stuff. Thanks for having us! (by Maria Biochantal) [a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - A lovely restaurant serving  beautiful food locally sourced and  elegantly presented with  lovely staff (by Susan McFeely) [7 years ago]

name: Riverside Diner
address: The Termon Complex Station Street, Pettigo, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews: Review 1: 5 stars - Stopped here today on our way back from (the one day) Lough Derg for main course, dessert and coffee! Was really impressed with the food quality and service especially the apple crumble with custard and vanilla ice cream... yum! Loads of parking and the seating was very good. Toilets were spotless. All in all we were very happy that we had stopped! Would definitely recommend! (by Jane 13) [3 years ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Delicious food on a slate! Couldn‚Äôt ask for better! Excellent facilities! (by Frankie Gallagher) [6 years ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - first class local experience (by stephen moss) [6 years ago] | Review 4: 1 star - toast had mold. (by Teruu) [3 years ago]

name: The Salmon Inn
address: Mullanasole, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Went with family for Sunday lunch. We were all very happy with our meals and price was reasonable.
Service was very good and staff very friendly and helpful.
Decent variety of food including seafood.
Very nice setting right on seashore.
Would definitely recommend. (by Michael Monaghan) [7 years ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - No food only pizza,they needto update Google or website to state this.
Otherwise great spot for a pint, lovely people (by Enda) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - A lovely bar, traditional, run lovingly by a family who've run it for decades. Right in front of a sea inlet , the owner was exceptionally kind & friendly to me & my learning disabled sister. Highly recommended. Pizza on sale but no actual restaurant open that day ( not sure of other days.) It wasn't "buzzing" but to escape from the stresses of modern day life, thus is your place. Picnic tables in front of sea. Ideal. (by Jojo Denver) [a year ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - A wonderful view with very friendly staff. The food is mostly fresh sea food with a few concessions for this odd people that don't eat sea food when in a place beside the sea.

At the end of the evening the owner came over to check how everything was.

5 stars, sets the standard. (by Aidan Feehan) [7 years ago] | Review 5: 4 stars - Great wee place right by the water. Fresh beautiful fish dishes. Large size portions. Friendly staff. Great service. (by jen bawtree) [5 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - I recently celebrated my birthday here in their function room. It is a perfect location for a special event. Would comfortably cater for 80. Unreal view of the ocean. The owners made a super effort getting the place ready. Brilliant staff....We went to the front bar for afters. Thanks so much for making it a fantastic evening. Strongly recommend a visit here. I hope to be back! (by Enda Ferriter) [2 years ago] | Review 7: 1 star - Bar only.  NO FOOD but pizza.  Wasted drive!!! (by Scott Neumann) [2 months ago] | Review 8: 4 stars - If you love fish stop here. It is off the track on the water side. All of us had fish and chips and so very glad we did. My 4 year old son said that they make the best food. The fish was fresh and the best I have had in a very long time. Service was excellent and food was served quickly. The desert was also good but the fish was the star of the show! (by Carel van Niekerk) [6 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Growing up in the area I never ate at the Salmon Inn unless it was part of our football team after a match for soup and sandwiches or maybe a burger but nothing special. As an adult gone from the area for over 20 years I decided to bring my parents there for dinner. Working in the hospitality industry myself and having gone to college for it I can be very critical if things aren't acceptable. Now I wasn't expecting anything 5 üåü from this place regardless of what reviews say but boy was I surprised. The fish cakes were awesome to start with. They were breaded on the outside but full of seafood inside not breading and other stuffing and a good size. The Lamb chops were a decent size also and more than I've seen my old father eat in years but he polished his plate. The stuffed sole I had myself was better than any I've had anywhere across the globe. Our waitress Denise was awesome also. Yes the Salmon Inn deserves a 5Star rating. Only downside is the kitchen is only open on the weekends in winter and still closed on Mondays and Tuesdays in summer. Only thing could have made my experience a little better would have been better weather. Spectacular view on a nice day. (by Jimmy Cox) [8 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Amazing food and entirely brilliant and unfaultable service.

The staff were extremely accommodating of one of our child diners who has autism and adhd, gave us the option of choosing a quieter section of the restaurant to dine in.

They were really polite and friendly each time we spoke to them and the food was top notch!

Will definitely be visiting here again. (by James M) [5 years ago]

name: Batch Donegal
address: Main St, Ballyconnell, Falcarragh, Co. Donegal, Ireland
service_options: Tasty Macs Indian & Fast Food Takeaway ¬∑ 4.1 stars ¬∑ 58 reviews ¬∑ Restaurant
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Batch in Donegal is a must-visit! We were so impressed with the delicious food and fantastic coffee. Their brunch menu has something for everyone, and we couldn't get enough of their famous seafood chowder. It was easily the best I've had in a long time. The warm, cosy interior makes you feel right at home. I highly recommend it! (by Pavlo Bogachenko) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Batch is an incredibly cozy spot.
Their seafood chowder is hands down the best in Ireland, and I‚Äôve tried plenty across the country. Rich, creamy, and perfectly balanced with fresh seafood ‚Äî absolutely outstanding! (by Anna Krys) [a month ago] | Review 3: 1 star - Extremely disappointing experience from arrival. We stood at the door for a minute or two and we were not acknowledged so we approached the seating area to the rear. We were then seated. We waited another few minutes and decided to find the menu ourselves. We placed our orders but had to change midway through due to the unavailable items. No soft drinks of any kind in stock. When food did arrive it looked appealing. A few minutes later we asked for brown bread to accompany the open seafood sandwich; no bread available so we were offered sour dough. It was then we noticed the blue mould on the crust. Upon inspection our child‚Äôs toastie also had mould. Staff poorly trained to deal with the issue. (by Triona Ui Ainle) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Such an amazing brunch spot!! I had their full Irish breakfast and I honestly wasn‚Äôt hungry again til 4pm, it set me up well for a day of adventuring around Donegal üòÅ the staff were so lovely and the place is gorgeous, we sat outside in the sun. The food was absolutely delicious, I got one of their raspberry scones to go and it was absolutely incredible! (by Cat Gundry-Beck) [4 months ago] | Review 5: 4 stars - Batch serves good coffee and the sausage rolls are good. No gluten free cakes though and they were running low on stock at 3pm.
Quirky building and decor and good atmosphere. (by Geraldine Boland) [a week ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - One of the best Full Irish breakfasts I have ever had. And the cappuccino was excellent too. (by Justin Emery) [5 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Great spot just popped in for breakfast while working in the area. Was open at 08:30 porridge and coffee were great! Bit of Irish band Amble playing in the background, perfect! (by Stiof√°n Mac Sheoin) [11 months ago] | Review 8: 1 star - We came here for breakfast after reading reviews and having a browse at their social media and menu it sounded amazing. Sadly the food was a huge disappointment, I ordered a hash brown dish which sounded a lot more appetising than what I received which was frozen hash browns and frozen goujons NOT fried chicken as was stated on the menu, there is a difference üòÖ my husband‚Äôs pancakes were badly burnt underneath and eggs extremely overcooked. The only nice part of our breakfast was the coffees. (by Lisa O‚ÄôHanlon) [a month ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - We were a party of 7 and a toddler.

Staff were very friendly and made a large table for us.

Menu and food were both great for brunch.

Coffee was lovely. (by Conor T) [4 weeks ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - We did a quick pit stop..and found this delightful and tastfully decorated coffee and wine place with food snack and sweet options. The proprietor took time to chat with us as we enjoyed her excellent warm and well prepared coffees over scrumptious sausage roll and cake. A delightful find. Spotless throughout. Hot the spot. 10/10 (by Digitalartworm 3D) [5 months ago]

name: Casadh an TS√∫gain
address: Loughanure, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - The choice on the menu was excellent.
I had the 8oz steak and my friends had the cod and the salmon after the excellent cabin chicken starters. We were not disappointed in any of the dishes.
The staff were excellent and very friendly.
A first class dining experience and I would highly recommend an TS√∫gain to my friends. GRMA (by Thomas Shannon) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - 7 girls went here tonight for dinner. Food was amazing, the best nachos we ever tasted, lovely prawn cocktail and gorgeous home-made mushrooms. Mains of both fish pie and beef n Guinness pie were delicious and those who ate desserts said they were fab, nicest pavlova they ever tasted. Staff were adorable and fun, princess was a darling üòÇ there was a great ambience overall. We are already planning a return visit. Thanks guys (by jacqui o'hara) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 4 stars - Popped in Great food, had JR burger lovely staff.  Gave two stars for atmosphere as it was early but sure it's great when busy. Will be back. Oh and the homemade Bonoffi pie was to die forüòã (by Tracey Davison) [Edited 3 months ago] | Review 4: 2 stars - I had been given great recommendations to try this place out and had been told the food was delicious so we went on the way back from Dungloe one day !

We were seated on arrival without a booking which was good but unfortunately that was the best bit of our visit.

We had our drinks order taken and waited that long to get it that the ice had melted, the Barman had left them on the counter for the floor staff to take them over while he chatted away and the floor girl was flat out busy serving, this was the theme the whole time we were there!

It took them 40 mins to take our food order and then said we had come in behind a big table (of 7) and that was the delay, but that was just taking our order, then our food arrived about 35 mins later and was very disappointing, 2 of us had ordered the chicken Maryland and neither of us could cut through the chicken and the salad on the plate was not worth mentioning (see the picture, that‚Äôs what actually arrived).

This was a long wait for everything and unfortunately not worth the wait, the Barman needs to help out more and not just ‚Äúlook‚Äù busy, instead of chatting to people at the bar (he wasn‚Äôt serving, just chatting) he could serve drinks to tables etc, I wanted to help that girl on the floor she was so busy and he just watched her !!

Then another waitress arrived and could see quite a number of tables waiting on drinks and dinners, people looking despairingly at when their dinner will arrive, some people who came in after us were served food and drinks before us but they kept blaming this big table before us!!

In a nutshell it is a shame because it is a lovely place, the atmosphere is nice, just an awful shame about the service, we were offered free ice cream with desert but we weren‚Äôt staying any longer so did not have desert !!

Such a shame but we won‚Äôt be going back again ! (by Gillian Weir) [3 years ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Casadh an tS√∫g√°in is 5 star and more! We stopped off on our way back to killybegs. The service was excellent, very friendly. I had a Chicken Stir Fry and my wife had the Beef and Guinness Pie. Both were stunning, simply stunning. Tasty, hot and well presented. We had a side of onion rings and they were freshly made in house which is always sign of a quality restaurant and they were perfection. Definitely a jewel in the heart of Donegal, highly recommended!! (by David Heath Williams) [5 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Very nice place,  food is very good and the staff were very friendly as well. (by Daniel Gallagher) [a month ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - We visited on August 11th 2021. We had not booked, but this was solved straight away. Good and efficient check on COVID-19 (EU certificate and phone number) and hand sanitizers all over the place. Staff was very friendly, the owner kept a good eye on thing and helped the girls to do their job in a collegial manner.
We had a table just under the large roof light which was very pleasant.
The meal was excellent: 10 on steak for myself and a beautifully baked fish and chips for my wife. The batter was crispy but nice and thin. Good portions very nicely presented on large plates. Very tasty.
They have a restricted choice of deserts, all six of them looked very tasty and we choose to have the pavlova and the cheese cake
Including soft drinks each we paid ‚Ç¨52,50 Value for money! (by Jan Bos) [4 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Very nice fresh food. Amazing staff. Highly recommended.  You can sit with your dog with no problem. (by Monica MaYuNa) [4 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Food was lovely and the Guinness was great. Staff were also very friendly and helpful. (by Paschal McCosker) [3 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - We stopped off here on a road trip around donegal. The food was excellent (we had salmon and Guinness and steak pie), the Guinness was amazing as it always is in Donegal.
But the service was exceptional. The staff went above and beyond to accommodate myself, my wife and our dog.
Can‚Äôt recommend enough (by Sean Kearney) [6 years ago]

name: The Napoli Express
address: Sweeneys Spar, R940 Ramelton Rd, Ballyraine, Letterkenny, Co. Donegal, Ireland
service_options: Four Star Pizza Letterkenny ¬∑ 4.2 stars ¬∑ 173 reviews ¬∑ Pizza Delivery, Domino's Pizza - Letterkenny ¬∑ 4.2 stars ¬∑ 382 reviews ¬∑ Pizza Delivery
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Absolutely superb pizza. Really friendly owner who takes real pride in his craft. Great ingredients, tastes amazing & lovely location. (by Fay Bowden) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Absolutely delicious/scrumptious pizza. I had the vegetarian pizza and the fresh rocket on top was an additional treat. The owner went out his way to check if all ingredients are sugar free and they are (I have a sugar allergy, so this one is very important to me).  I have to come back and treat the whole family to an authentic Italian (or better Neapolitan) pizza (by Marie G.) [2 years ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - You won‚Äôt get better than this! 10/10
It looked so good on arrival I forgot to take a picture, so have a half Eaton one before it‚Äôs all gone (by Craig Adam) [3 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Freshly prepared Neapolitan style pizza, best I've had in Ireland. All Italian sourced ingredients. Very good value deals available. The owner is very friendly and knowledgeable. (by Lucy) [a year ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - My daughter said it was the best garlic bread she ever had.Great pizza,nice and light.very surprised to get excellent pizza at the edge of Donegal. (by Peter Duffy) [2 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Literally the best pizza I‚Äôve ever had, even better than Italy! How in this remote part of the world, no clue. Friendliest staff, great beaches close by. Wish it was closer to home! (by Jean Rose) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Really tasty pizza from a van!

There is clearly a lot of pride taken in this setup and if you want a great pizza in the Letterkenny area you have to add this to your list!

Stone fired authentic Neapolitan Pizza and well priced, ‚Ç¨22 for two at the time of writing.

Really tasty. (by TomBoyNI) [Edited 2 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - The perfect pizzas! Really delicious and fresh pizzas, so tasty! The garlic pizza is amazing also! Looking forward to getting their pizzas again soon! (by Aoife) [2 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - I‚Äôve been to both locations of Napoli Express: Letterkenny and Donegal Town. There‚Äôs consistency, taste and quality in delivery across both. Prices are reasonable and pizzas simple and tasty as they should be, the true Napolitan style. If you are a fan of sauces and plenty of stuff on a pizza, this might not be for you.

These are proper Italian style, thin crust pizzas, with just couple quality ingredients, made in 400 Celsius oven similar to wood fired ones, but I believe these are gas powered for technical and safety reasons.

Pizzas cost about ‚Ç¨12-13 and if you take two it is ‚Ç¨22 deal, and if you get three it is ‚Ç¨33 + same size garlic bread which kind of feels like a fourth pizza to some extent.

Lovely guys and amazing street vans with quality of a solid restaurant. Highly recommend! (by Maciej Badowski (bluntforcehealing.com)) [a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - The best pizza I ever had!! It was delicious! All fresh ingredients.
We had the vegetarian and it was scrumptious! We intend to go back and try them all!
Brian is very pleasant and friendly. üòä (by Claudia Boyle) [a year ago]

name: Killybegs seafood shack
address: Main St, Cashelcummin, Killybegs, Co. Donegal, F94 WF5X, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Got the seafood box with chips which had 2 pieces of fried fish, 3 breaded shrimp and some calamari rings. Both the battered and breaded fish were fried perfectly and it's hard to choose which I liked better. The chips were light, crispy and lovely! And can't go wrong with the garlic mayo, nice creamy garlic to contrast the fresh lemon. Weather cooperated and it was a beautiful day to sit in the patio behind the shack. (by Susan Harvey) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - This absolute gem hidden up a side street in Killybegs. We had battered fish and the calamari and scampi both with chips. It was delicious. It was very popular spot with some outdoor shaded seating. Really cute spot with friendly staff and great food. Highly recommended x (by Heather McPhail) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Food is freshly made for each order and staff is super friendly. I'm glad we drove the extra miles to eat here. There is a lovely seating area in the back. The shack is a bit hidden in a small side street. We can absolutely recommend eating here. (by Jas Mine) [3 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Searched it out again (it‚Äôs moved from the pier up a side street) to see if the Calamari was as good as I‚Äôd remembered from last time and it certainly was. On a motorbike trip and dragged Friends of mine on the wettest windiest day to killybegs to try the seafood shack and it did not disappoint. It was even worth eating in the rain. And lovely friendly service. Keep up the great work. God bless the fishermen who bring in the catch too. (by Pauline Fox) [a month ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - This is an absolute gem!
The food here was d e l i c i o u s and super fresh. Loved the seafood as well as fish&chips and it was way cheaper than other places. Highly recommend checking it out üëç (by Aleksandra M.) [2 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Fantastic fish & Chips can I say anymore about it.
1st time back for a visit this year.
And now the topping on the cake they do fabulous onion rings and a curry sauce. (by Alo Toye) [3 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Fish and goujons great portions sizes. Scampi a little small. Amazing chips. Cool spot to stop (by Jessica Gardner) [4 days ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Wonderful food! I got the scampi and Calamari with chips and it was a delight. My parents got a fish n Chips and I tried the fish. It was also fantastic. Outstanding service by the two ladies working the shack and they were playing good music too! (by Patrick G) [2 weeks ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Possibly the best fish and chips I‚Äôve ever had. And I‚Äôve been to a lot of places. Crispy batter full of flavour, and a quality piece of fish too. Big shout out to the sea food chowder, gorgeous. Really friendly staff as well which made the whole thing a 10/10. (by QWERTYUIOP 123) [a month ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - One of my favorite meals in Ireland! To be honest, we weren't too impressed with the fish and chips; but that calamari is one of the best I've ever had! I'd go back again and again. It's a cute, affordable seafood shack that's a perfect stop after enjoy Slieve Leagues. (by Deb L) [Edited a year ago]

name: The Napoli Express Donegal Town
address: The Napoli Express, The Diamond, Glebe, Donegal, F94 P896, Ireland
service_options: Apache Pizza Donegal ¬∑ 3.0 stars ¬∑ 150 reviews ¬∑ Pizza Delivery
reviews: Review 1: 5 stars - The pizzas here are absolutely delicious. Do not miss out on a great pizza and garlic bread pizza and a glass of red. Simply yum. The base is light and tasty and the ingredients are fresh. I took my 4 year old and it was the only time he would eat mushrooms. Brian was kind and friendly, very accommodating. 5 ‚≠êÔ∏è! (by Caroline Hayes) [a year ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - After a long day of walking the Blue Stack Way, Napoli's pizzas were a perfect meal!  We had the Margherita Pizza and Nduja Pizza - both were very delicious and quickly gobbled up!  The Nduja had a little bit of spice but was not overpowering - loved it!  The friendly pizza maker was working on a large order and it was about a 20 minute wait which flew by while we talked about holidays, Guiness and Ireland sights.  Don't miss out on Napoli's while in Donegal Town! (by Eric C.) [a year ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Delicious, fresh pizza. Especially enjoyed the vegetarian pizza and the garlic bread. Great pepperoni too, with a bit of spice to it. Enjoyed speaking with the proprietor. Nice local fellow living out his dream. Well worth a visit - quick, satisfying and very tasty. (by Jem Dillon) [6 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - It‚Äôs like being in Italy üáÆüáπ the pizzas are SO fresh, none of those heavily processed bases. Just good quality ingredients made with love. The service is so quick and friendly. We really really enjoyed our food. Can‚Äôt wait to order again! I would highly recommend The Napoli Express Donegal Town to anyone! Thanks again for great food and service!! (by Ciara Thomas) [a year ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Website is a little confusing as it lists only their Letterkenny location (and they‚Äôre a mobile truck, I could have imagined they don‚Äôt stay in one place!). I was able to find them just fine in Donegal though (by Marisa Gesualdi) [4 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Called in on Saturday evening for a pizza. Five mins and the pizza was ready, top quality pizza! Super friendly team member, look forward to calling again when in Donegal. (by Ali Macaulay) [3 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Ordered a vegetarian and a pepperoni and ham.  Both were delicious. (by Janine Gatheral) [6 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Beautiful pizza and super friendly. Dough and ingredients top notch.  Give this place a shout and guaranteed you will not be disappointed. (by Stevie) [6 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Great find! Touring the wild Atlantic way and was reccomend this place by a local. Really Fresh ingredients! Heading back through donegal town next week so will make sure to be stopping by again (by Rory) [Edited 2 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Epic pies from this gem behind the The Diamond. Top notch Ital-grade pizza‚Äîgreat crust and sauce cooked properly. Lovely truck and excellent friendly chef! (by Richard Duckworth) [9 months ago]

name: Beach Hotel, Bar & Restaurant Downings
reviews: Review 1: None - This is a beautiful family run Hotel which is currently undergoing some refurbishments. is very well located being just a 5 minute stroll down to an amazing beach. The room was very welcoming with the smell of a freshly laid carpet as the ‚Ä¶ (by paudm2018) | Review 2: None - We went for a small light lunch. Toasties, wraps etc. Was beautiful. Very tasty food. Ample parking around the back of the hotel. Quick service. And very very reasnoble prices. Highly recommended. Muscles on the menu were also top class. Nicest lunch we have had in a long time. (by Darragh O'Neill) | Review 3: None - Excellent stay. We were made fell very welcome by Victoria. Newly renovated rooms . Comfortable beds. Really nice walk in shower . Breakfast was excellent the next day and we were accommodated even though we were a bit late getting down for ‚Ä¶ (by peterhP7060BZ) | Review 4: None - We ate as a family here recently. ||Quick service, hot and tasty food.||However, There was no friendly welcome. The chap who brought our drinks said nothing and didn‚Äôt even make eye contact, same with the table water. No one came to check ‚Ä¶ (by Knieval) | Review 5: None - Hadn‚Äôt stayed here in ten years we were delighted to get one of the newly revamped rooms on floor two |Room was fab, bed comfy, food delicious staff fabulous|Bar not very inviting tired and dreary but I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs on the agenda for ‚Ä¶ (by jaclyndubh2) | Review 6: None - Lovely hotel and staff very friendly and very helpful. Very clean and spacious room.|Food was 10 outta 10 and nothing was ever and issue.breakfast the following day was also 10 outta 10.cant wait to book again or even call down for the Sunday dinner üëå ‚Ä¶ (by O5489ODnatalied) | Review 7: None - Wonderful owners and staff, were in the restaurant and ordered a fish dish and dessert and everything was delicious! The view from the room on the ocean is amazing! Thank you! (by Anna Novikova) | Review 8: None - Great  service and friendly staff food was  excellent and we look forward  to returning soon. Rooms where very  cleanEamon and Mary  DERRY (by Go26454532300) | Review 9: None - Great stay at the Beach Hotel, Amy at reception was very helpful sorting out a problem, and everything resolved with no issues. Would highly recommend staying her if visiting The Downings (by Patrick) | Review 10: None - Stayed in the Beach Hotel Downings.  Once Again Very Good Great to be Back  . Breakfast and Bar Food Good As well . Great Weather  too for that Week i Stayed . (by edwardcB4182QU)

name: Biddy's O'Barnes
address: Biddys O'Barnes, Barnesmore Gap Barnesmore, F94 HP22, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - I keep meaning to post a photo of my favourite vegetarian dish in Ireland, but I never seem to get the phone out before I‚Äôve devoured the entire plate. We‚Äôve been coming to Biddy‚Äôs for a while now because they are incredibly dog friendly, and on a rainy day, there aren‚Äôt a lot of indoor options. But once they put the celeriac steak on the menu?‚Ä¶it‚Äôs now my absolute go-to restaurant when I want a ‚Äúproper meal.‚Äù (by M L) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - We enjoyed our meal at Biddy O‚ÄôBarnes.  Good food, cold drinks and friendly service.  The lemon posset (dessert) was a big hit. (by ER Singer) [4 weeks ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Great food and staff. They couldn't have been more helpful and i even left with the recipe for their delicious Dill Mayo üëåüòã Thank you üòä we will definitely visit again when over on holiday. Highly recommended üëå (by Pat Whitman) [4 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Absolutely fantastic fish and chips here. The food and ambience are both excellent here.
The decor is fabulous with more than a hint of real old antique. The arrangement of separate rooms adds an heir of privacy to the whole affair.

The chefs have great hands and, using what is the freshest ingredients available, have put together some super dishes. Seafood chowder definitely deserves a mention.

When you walk to the toilets, which are super clean and nicely appointed, you can see the cleanliness of the back areas.

Super outdoor seating area and a hidden coffee shop that has a decent brew.

This is a ‚Äòworth the detour‚Äô destination. (by The Irish Chef Abroad) [a year ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Joyful atmosphere, fantastic food options for the whole family, quality drinks! Pizzas, seafood chowder, Sunday roasts, and wings were highlights for us. Can‚Äôt wait to be back! (by Lauren Young) [5 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - This is a great place to stop for a meal or just to have a drink. The staff are very friendly and the atmosphere is lovely. Can highly recommend.
If travelling in a motorhome you can stay in the car park overnight. Definitely 5 stars üåü (by sarah cameron) [4 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - We had a lovely meal here! The seafood chowder was rich, creamy, and full of flavour, and the hake with butter beans and mash was perfectly cooked ‚Äì sweet, flaky, and delicious. The service was fantastic and made the whole experience even better. Would definitely recommend! (by Leah) [5 days ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - I stopped by for dinner last week and had the fish & chips, I was very impressed! The portion was generous, and the meal was absolutely delicious, definitely a solid 10/10. The service was exceptional, all the staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming. The atmosphere was warm and inviting, and the Christmas decorations added a lovely touch to the experience. I‚Äôll definitely be back soon! Would highly recommend to everyone! (by Nala Ghantous) [10 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - At last! A bar/restaurant that allowed our ancient Labradoodle into the bar eating area.  A lovely welcome. Cozy chilled vibe.  Can't wait to visit again soon. (by Colette Hill) [a month ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - served VERY quickly by very efficient and friendly staff. Steak just rates as OK but generally good value for money. Fish was excellent and other dishes I saw getting  served certainly looked very good (by dougal dou) [a month ago]

name: The Rusty Oven - Pizzeria
address: Main St, Dunfanaghy, Co. Donegal, Ireland
service_options: Apache Pizza Dunfanaghy ¬∑ 4.6 stars ¬∑ 87 reviews ¬∑ Pizza Delivery
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Super friendly staff! Lovely buzzy place on a Sunday evening. Booking recommended, but we got the last available table at 17:45.

Fantastic vegan pizza with great toppings.

1/2 bottles of wine available. Perfect.

Pros: Clearly marked vegan pizza, atmosphere and proper pizzaiolo (by J B) [3 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Such a lovely place for takeaway or sitting in.

I was able to walk in and get a table for 1. I got the sundance pizza and it was great. You can get bottles of wine from the rusty oven or other drinks from Patsy Dan's since they are connected.

There was a good atmosphere and the staff were brilliant. I really recommend here (by Gary conlon) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Love this place every time we come to Dunfanaghy.  The photographs do not do the food justice as the base and topping are just the best.  Julie and the staff are so helpful and friendly, even the dog is welcome.    Will definitely be back. (by Stephen Greer) [4 weeks ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Easily one of the best pizzerias I‚Äôve been to in Ireland. You‚Äôll have to make a booking if you want a table. (by Akram M) [a month ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Really nice staff! Were there last minute and they still had no problem seating us and put us under no pressure!

The pizza is incredible! Thin crispy sourdough base and somehow still super doughy! Went for the ‚Äúpear and walnut‚Äù
Perfect balanxe of flavour really good quality toppings! üôå would 100% reccomend! (by Peadar O'Callaghan) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Great italian food. Tasty and fresh. One of the best pizza in IRL (by Mateusz Jurkowski) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Best VEGAN pizza in Ireland so far! Highly recommended! Could use more plant-based cheese on it, even if you order double the amount of v-cheese it's still not much. But other than that, it's super delicious, high quality and my husband and all our vegan friends we've introduced to this place absolutely LOVED it!(apart from the smaller amount of cheese lol, but the high quality, overall atmosphere makes up for it!) The photos below show the vegan pizza with double v-cheese: (by Nicole D. Dominikowski) [6 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - This is such a unique dining experience! The food is so amazing having such unique pizza options. The servers care and were so nice. I loved the restaurant having different sections and music playing. I can tell this is the star restaurant of the area because of the many people eating here and the fact there were so many people coming in. I really liked the ambiance a lot! The indoor outdoor idea is so unique, and even in rain, you will be comfortable. Dough Bros in Gallway is voted best pizza in Ireland, but this place is 1000% up there, right with them! I wish I lived here so I could eat here everyday!!! (by Aarush Dhand) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Great experience at the Rusty Oven, I recommend it ! The variety and originality of the pizzas makes it a great place to discover. The setting is quite different and unusual making a good place to bring kids. (by Mathieu Mantrant O'Dowd) [5 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Garlic bread pizza as starters, Hawaiian, margarita and pepperoni pizzas for mains followed by a dessert pizza, strawberries marshmallows and chocolate sauce. (by God Bless The Pope.) [5 months ago]

name: Fisk Seafood Bar Downings
address: The Harbour Bar, Downings, Co. Donegal, F92XR53, F92 XR53, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Fisk is so awesome, has a great sense of food and is connected basically to the pub next door, and the food is great along with the service, go here!! (by Sullivan Cooper) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - gorgeous food and atmosphere, i would rate higher if i had the option ! (by Katherine) [a week ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - I had the pleasure of dining at Fisk in Downings and it was truly a delightful experience from start to finish. Upon our arrival, we were fortunate to secure a table immediately. Our group ordered a variety of dishes including four fish tacos (two with regular sauce and two without sauce), two prawn bao buns, the flavorful Gambas, crispy battered cod pieces with skinny fries for the little one and the prawn dumplings (3 pieces).

The food at Fisk was nothing short of exceptional, with each dish seasoned to perfection and ingredients bursting with flavors. We were thoroughly impressed and couldn't find a single fault in any of our meals. The staff further elevated our dining experience with their warm and friendly service, going above and beyond to recommend their best-selling dishes when we had trouble deciding.

Our memorable meal at Fisk came to around 75 euros, a fair price considering the quality of the food and service we received. Fisk is truly a gem not to be missed in Downings, offering a perfect combination of delectable seafood, impeccable service, and a welcoming atmosphere. This dining experience will stay with us for a long time, and we look forward to returning to Fisk in the future. (by Fatima R. Altaie) [a year ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Chef Tony makes some of the best fish dishes I have ever tasted and Sean was an excellent host. We will definitely be coming back here. Top notch and worth queuing up for. (by John Shanks) [a year ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Tiny little spot attached to The Harbour Bar. Drove out from Letterkenny for lunch & there was already a small queue before they opened. There‚Äôs only five tables inside, but food can be eaten outside, and I also believe it can be brought into the bar.

We ordered three oysters, one fish taco, and the mussels.

Oysters we‚Äôre some of the best I‚Äôve ever had, served with a chili granita. So creamy and no grittiness.
My dad was tempted by the prawn bao, but opted for the fish taco, & said it was a winner. Perfectly cooked battered fish, slaw, spicy mayo & pico de gallo.
Mussels came in a tomatoey sauce, along with a portion of perfect chips.
Unfortunately I was only allowed a small sample before dad reminded me that it was his lunch, not mine.

Only wine is served in Fisk, but soft drinks, beer etc can be bought in the bar and brought in.

One americano to finish, and our bill came to ‚Ç¨28.00.
Staff were all absolutely lovely and despite how busy it was, service was prompt and efficient.

An absolutely fab spot, and one I hope to go back to soon. (by Claire Crilly) [a year ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - This place must have changed! I was there in 2010 and ee were just the 4 of us in October by the fire. Playing music, drinking homebrew and pints... Hmm, I'm wondering what happended since :) (by Viktor Arakchiev) [2 weeks ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - I went for dinner here with my wife and two little ones both under 2, the waitresses where fantastic and the food was unbelievable, would highly recommend to anyone visiting (by Thomas Houghton) [3 weeks ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Another incredible meal in Donegal. Super fresh fish. An amazingly duuuurrty Mac and cheese. Great staff. (by Aidan McGovern) [2 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Food was superb so fresh and tasty. Small but delicious menu and tapas style portions that let you try a few different dishes. Staff were also absolutely excellent. We Will be back üòÅ ‚Ä¶ (by HELLA UK) [5 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Such a gem of a place to find. If your ever in Donegal this is a must on your list. Fish is so fresh. Service is fantastic and the staff are very friendly. 10 out of 10. (by John Donlon) [3 years ago]

name: The Dirty Souls Letterkenny - Smokehouse & BBQ
address: Kinnegar Taproom and brewery, Ballyraine Industrial Estate, Letterkenny, Co. Donegal, F92 R263, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Been meaning to get over to this place for a while!
Landed over a little late, but was still able to get a feed‚Ä¶.and bhoi was it worth it!!

You‚Äôll not find pork ribs and belly anywhere like this‚Ä¶juicey, tender and unbelievable flavour‚Ä¶.

Friendly service
Too notch food
Nothing like it around here..

Two thumbs up (by Gareth Jackson) [3 weeks ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - One of the best food we had. Definitely we'll come back. It's worth it!!!üòäüëç (by Arkadiusz Kocurkiewicz) [4 weeks ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - The food here is absolutely unreal, proper comfort soul food. Beef was done gorgeously, slow cooked- falls right apart and the flavour is so delicious. Chips fresh & crispy too super nice, and the home made sauces included were a game changer, so tasty. This place is definitely underrated and Eoin working there was friendly too and even brought the food to us while we waited in the car. Fantastic food, highly recommend (by Katelyn Fagan) [a year ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Went for the beer and thought I would give the food a go as well. Opted for the ribs and these were exception. Unlike any I have ever had before. Highly recommended (by Steven Corr) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Called in today for a feed and can honestly say the food was amazing, all the meats are cooked to perfection and the chips were so well seasoned! Would highly recommend and will definitely be returning!! (by Mark Larkin) [5 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - 10 stars for the brisket!!! Wow! The most tender meat I've eaten in my life! Really, and I'm not young üôÉ Pulled pork on a donut üç© is also good. Great üçü fries. Recommended. Come. Eat. Now. You won't regret it! (by Brandon Schuster) [a year ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - First time eating here today and all I can say is what a shop, portion size: perfect. Ribs:massive. Chicken: crunchy everything down to the chips is top notch, will be back again (by Daniel Gardiner) [3 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Food just delicious , specially beef ,I've never had such tasty in my life.
The owner such kind person.
Highly recommend. (by Urszula Kocurkiewicz) [4 weeks ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Some how still a lil known secret of Letterkenny, and honestly I don't get it. Found it a few weeks ago and have been back weekly since, can't get enough of it.
Smoked meats cooked on premise and honestly like nothing else I've no has in the northwest.
Heads up for the spice fans out there, when they say its hot or spice they mean it. (by Declan Barrett) [Edited a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Unexpected gem, absolutely stunning food, amazing fried chicken and BBQ, with fantastic service and nicely next to a brewery. Cannot strongly recommend enough! (by Hugh R) [10 months ago]

name: No. 9 Market Square
address: 9 Market Square, Letterkenny, Co. Donegal, F92 D593, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - If you want one of the best meals you will ever  eat then this is your restaurant! The soda bread was the best I have had in Ireland. The salad took a side salad to a new art form. It was full of different vegetables what were a delight to the taste buds. The chips cooked in beef fat maybe the best chips in the world. I had the hake special and it was truly special. Besides being yummy food, the owner was a delight to talk to about the food, wine and many other topics. Do not miss this great dinning experience! (by Tina Byrd) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - My parents generation were always weary of eating in a quiet restaurant. Well we ate here when it was very quiet and had an exceptional meal. All three courses for both of us were well-prepared and delicious. The beef short-rib was a particular highlight. Also atmosphere too, with a very chilled playlist running all evening. Highly recommend. (by Aidan Fitzsimons) [3 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Had one of the most tasty and lovely dinners in Ireland, the atmosphere and service were fantastic. Chef Brian made sure to make us feel welcomed serving the best quality dishes prepared with great care. We were really impressed by the delectable mains and the customised desserts for our birthday making it a wholesome and special evening! (by Iza Bela) [5 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Me and my husband love it! We booked our dinner for after our wedding and everything & bites was so perfect! Came all this way from Chicago to try this amazing food!
Couldn‚Äôt ask for more tasteful and amazing atmosphere
We are coming back for more for sure (by Fabiana Almeida) [4 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - We had an excellent family meal here recently. I had the monkfish which was served in a wonderful sauce and the fondant for dessert which was delicious!! We will definitely be returning here. The only available parking is on the Main Street which is metered during the day. The owner is the chef which makes this place extra special. They use locally sourced produce, meat from convoy and fish from Killybegs. (by Amanda Gallagher) [6 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Food and service was amazing.  I let Brian know in advance it was our anniversary and he made our evening special.  Best food in whole of Donegal and definitely in my top 5 meals that I've ever had. (by Brendan) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Truly a gem of a place in Letterkenny. Food is par excellence. I tried monkfish and falafel, both them were uniquely fresh and delish. Complementary bread with fresh butter with rock salt is a must try. Has an intimate sitting design so will be good for a date night out. (by Megas XLR) [a month ago] | Review 8: 4 stars - I had a lovely meal in No.9. The quality and presentation of the food is top class. There is a nice atmosphere and decor in the restaurant. On our visit the chef made an appearance to check if we were happy with  everything. The only thing to note is that the restaurant is located on the first floor and I didn't see a lift, so anyone with mobility issues might need to enquire about that when booking. (by Fergal O'Mahony) [3 weeks ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - We were a party of 8 and all felt this was an exceptional restaurant.   Brian the chef/owner was so welcoming on arrival and we ate most of the menu across the group with the chowder starter and monkfish main being among the stars. Delightful team serving and good value compared to other dinners on our trip. (by Alex Nixon) [a month ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Fabulous dinner 10 out of 10. The Goat cheese salad was amazing, the monkfish was outstanding and dessert was the perfect end to a wonderful meal. Chief Brian you knocked it out of the park ‚Ä¶.
Gary and Anne, Vancouver Canada
September 2025 (by Anne O'Mahony-May) [a week ago]

name: The Olde Glen Bar, Restaurant & Bia Box
address: Glenmenagh, Carrickart, Co. Donegal, F92 KR23, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Only visited the bar area but that was good enough
Good Irish pubs are like churches old dark atmospheric places with only the pump lights for candles
Meditative places you can reflect
Drink the wine and break the bread have a Guinness and a toastie
You can confess alll to the barman too if you want to
This pub is one of the best (by D Murphy) [Edited 2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - At this restaurant, dining transcends into an art form, where each dish is a masterpiece meticulously crafted to tantalize the senses. The culinary experience here is nothing short of extraordinary, with every bite offering a symphony of flavors that dance harmoniously on the palate. From the freshest ingredients to the perfectly balanced seasoning, the chef‚Äôs expertise shines through in every course, transforming simple ingredients into something profound and unforgettable.

The service matches the exceptional quality of the food. The staff‚Äôs attention to detail, their warmth, and their deep knowledge of the menu create an atmosphere of refinement without pretension. Every need is anticipated, making you feel not just like a guest but like a cherished part of the restaurant‚Äôs story.

The ambiance is warm and inviting, with a relaxed, yet refined atmosphere that makes you feel right at home. Whether you‚Äôre enjoying a casual meal with friends or celebrating a special occasion. Soft lighting and thoughtfully curated d√©cor create a welcoming space where you can unwind and fully savor each moment. It‚Äôs the kind of place where time slows down, allowing you to truly enjoy the experience without any rush, making every visit feel like a mini retreat from the outside world.

In every aspect, this restaurant exemplifies the highest standards of culinary art, service, and atmosphere, leaving you not just satisfied, but truly inspired. (by Wisam Al-Ramli) [11 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Fantastic food, beautifully presented.
The staff are delightful. (by Peter Thornton) [a month ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Finally some good, proper 5* restaurant in co. Donegal. Happy to hear they won another award because they totally deserve it. It's an experience with interesting flavour combinations and beautiful presentation. The kitchen is open and you can see how they prep your food. Staff is really nice and not that pushy nice coming twice each course asking how's your food when your mouth is stuffed üòÇ
Is it pricey? Both yes (for local standards) and no (if you compare same level restaurants). But it's totally worth it and I would be happy to go back in summer when they have different menu.
Only thing: if your main is not hot let them know, mine was at room temperature, still tasty, but sure it would be better hot. Wasn't sure if that was intended or not, but server said all main dishes should have been hot.
And chocolate tart is best I have ever had and it wasn't  even my dessert of choiceüòÇ (by Agness Agnieszka) [a year ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Absolutely phenomenal dining experience. Highly recommended. (by Aaron Doherty) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Very interesting and spacious bar combined with a restaurant. Nice and huge back garden. Polite staff. They have live music on Saturday nights. The food is cold, but very pleasant both to the eye and the tongue. They also have the famous local beer Kinnegar Scraggy Bay on tap.
The restaurant is a story on its own! Polite, friendly and patient staff. Comfortable atmosphere. The meals are unbelievable, bursting with flavors that are combined in different genius ways. They are also a feast for the eyes, a true artistic product. We loved the whole restaurant experience and I do not have enough words to recommend their food ! (by A.) [Edited a year ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Holy cow! Who would think that a bar, a bar way in the hills, would produce such incredibly good food.  I'd give it 6 or 7 stars if I could.  It is worth the drive.  A real destination restaurant.  Compliments to all the staff that made our dinner for 40 so unbelievably good. Two üëç (by Tom Shahriari) [4 weeks ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - A Donegal Gem. Five Star welcome, Five Star service and Five Star food. Nestled in one of the most beautiful corners of Ireland. Attached to a traditional bar is the almost hidden gem of a restaurant which can rival the best. From moment I arrived with a friends a warm welcome. Our servers Ashleen, Maja and Annie not only gave a great welcome but can with great knowledge guide you through the options on a set menu. The starters are all to die for, despite the huge temptation of fresh local fish I took Pork and Pork Belly as main - best I have ever had. Around the table a Black Sole, Lamb and a Curry all got huge thumbs up. Watch your appetite we struggled with a very tasty cheese plate. Top of my agenda for next trip to Donegal. (by Jerry O'Connor) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Fantastic meal at Olde Glen Bar. Couldn‚Äôt fault it. Food and service 100 per cent. (by Nick Rowland) [5 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Lunch outside at the Bia Box. Great food, and good service. Really great amenity. Worth stopping for lunch if in the area. Can sit inside or outside. (by Heikki Vesanto) [4 months ago]

name: Lough Eske Castle
reviews:
Review 1: None - Absolutely magical, like something out of a fairytale.
