Highly recommend getting a room in the original castle if you can - we had the O‚ÄôDonnell suite which looks right out to the front of the castle and fountain and it was absolutely ‚Ä¶ (by Climber61998220000) | Review 2: None - The castle was grand and magical! The rooms were quite spacious and the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, definitely felt like a luxurious experience. The bathrooms very large and lovely with a great towel heater. The robes and ‚Ä¶ (by racheloV3817DZ) | Review 3: None - I had the best experience at Lough Eske Castle Hotel during our one-week road trip around Ireland exploring castles. The views are absolutely stunning, our room was beautiful, and the food was excellent. We were kindly upgraded to the Donegal Suite, which made the stay even more special.

We also had the Relax and Recharge Spa treatment ‚Äî and it was beyond good, such a perfect way to unwind.

For dinner, we went to the Gallery Bar ‚Äî the Apple Virgin Mojito mocktail was refreshing, and the Sirloin steak was delicious.

Special thanks to Concierge Shae (Hope i spelled it right) , who was so welcoming and made us feel right at home. Overall, an unforgettable stay and one of the highlights of our castle road trip in Ireland ‚Äî highly recommend! (by Dita O‚Äôhalloran) | Review 4: None - This review is long overdue but we had such a lovely time here that I had to write one! We stayed here in June for two nights, and our only regret was that we couldn‚Äôt stay longer. The hotel was a stop in the middle of our Ireland road trip ‚Ä¶ (by j0rene0) | Review 5: None - A genuinely elegant experience, a world-away from the rat-race. The rooms are very large and very well appointed. The bar and restaurant areas were welcoming and the food was very excellent.  Walking the grounds is also highly recommended, with many points of interest. (by edspot) | Review 6: None - I stayed here one night as part of the Love Irish tour. This was our last night before going back to Dublin and it was such an amazing and special experience. This hotel is just as beautiful as it looks in the pictures, and it's in the most beautiful location. I especially need to commend the housekeeping staff. I left some personal items and when I called a few days later, they arranged for it to be shipped to my home address and smoothly handled the situation. They were attentive and communicative and really went above and beyond. I definitely recommend a stay here! (by Emi Montenegro) | Review 7: None - It's a pretty castle when you drive up, but most of the hotel building was constructed in the 2000's. They charge a hefty price and are lacking in cleanliness and service. We dined in both restaurants and each evening we felt the food was just ok. We were very disappointed with the crab appetizer which had a cat food like mushed up texture and tasted like canned crab, not fresh. The rooms and hallways needed a bit more dusting, especially around light fixtures, and some hallways and stairwells needed new carpeting. Overall, this was one of the more expensive hotels we stayed in and it was our least enjoyable stay. (by Joseph DeMartin) | Review 8: None - We had our wedding at Lough Eske Castle at the end of July and we truly couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better day.||The castle itself is breathtaking, but what truly made it special was the team behind the scenes. The food and service were ‚Ä¶ (by 429dearbhlam) | Review 9: None - I'd like to give a 5‚≠ê review but cannot for the following reasons:
(1) Our reservation was not found, under a different person's name, caused confusion upon arrival.
(2) Missing TV remote that took 3 hours to replace and 3 trips to the front desk to ask.
(3) Cleanliness: peanuts found on carpet, hairs on shower wall and towels that were "damp".
(4) Hot water is lukewarm at best.

The "Castle" is beautiful from the outside and upon entering.  But rooms are in a different part, very modern and large.  Certainly didn't give the feel of a "castle" stay, just a fancy hotel.

Very isolated with no food options other than hotel within walking distance and very pricey.

Gardens and sculptures are pretty but some were hidden due to overgrowth of plants.

Highlights included:
Solid internet.
Coffee, tea, water & snacks in room.
Large, comfy bed
A/C (by The Wanderers) | Review 10: None - This is by far the nicest place I‚Äôve ever stayed. We had a beautiful suite, the grounds were breath taking and all the food met the same high standards.

Next time i go i just want to allot more time to use the spectacular amenities like the spa and pool. However, we did get to use the gym and the bikes and that was a treat.

Dinner was so fun and Johnny kept us laughing and had great recommendations. Breakfast was probably my favorite of any that we had in Ireland and i was even able to have an oatmilk latte with that. We will be back for sure. (by Macie Hendi)

name: The Chasin‚Äô Bull
address: Main St, Drumacrin, Bundoran, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 3 stars - I had a disappointing visit to this establishment. Myself, my partner & 2 kids visited at 1pm on a Wednesday. I ordered nachos, my partner ordered loaded fries and then we just ordered 2 portion of chips for the kids. It was an hour wait, I completely understand that food is made fresh & takes time but it was just chips & a bowl of nachos? One of my kids actually fell asleep we were waiting so long. When my nachos arrived they were covered in guacamole which wasn‚Äôt stated on the menu, they also came burnt black, they were not edible. When it came to pay, I said to the girl at the til (who also served us) that I was happy to pay for everything except the nachos, she got an attitude and was quite rude, she said I should have it before now but after waiting an hour already I wasn‚Äôt going to ask for them to be changed, I didn‚Äôt eat them and she seen that as she cleared our table. She told me she didn‚Äôt know what to do, I was extremely polite and said I‚Äôd pay for everything else but not the nachos, I wasn‚Äôt paying ‚Ç¨13 for something that was burnt and not as advertised. A manger then came and took the nachos off the bill but she completely ignored me, no apology or anything. Just not good service.
On a positive note their milkshakes were lovely, chips also nice. Just a long wait and poor service Upon paying. (by Chloe Healy) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Great spot for food, beer and sport. Very professional and friendly barmen. Dog friendly. Will stop in again. (by Rory Mannion) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Proper homemade food and excellent service. On holidays in Bundoran and went for dinner one night and ended up going back every night. Delicious food with a different style. Also cater to gluten free. Very good staff, really welcoming and on the ball. (by Lauryn S) [a month ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Amazing food, very good pub and drinks. Best Guinness in town! (by Claudiu Narcis) [3 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Pet friendly! üòç Place is great for food or drinks either. We had brekafast omlete, full Irish, smash burger, chips was amazing üòç staff members are all so friendly and kind, I'll be back here everytime I visit Bundoran. Thanks everyone. Great work! ü§ó (by Agne Budraityte) [2 months ago] | Review 6: 4 stars - Solid bar, didn't try the food but solid options. Busy but not too busy didn't have too much trouble finding a table. Fills up at about 10pm. Live music is great although too loud to the point you can't hear the person beside you. Wouldn't recommend the Guinness but friendly staff, pints not too dear considering the area. All ages inside the bar too. (by Niall McAllister) [3 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - My wife and I have been coming to bundoran 2-3 times a year for going on 15 years....kids come along now too majority of the time....first time popped into this place for food and Boy it was Hella worth it. Met with Richard at the beginning and was welcomed cheerily and politely. Offered us drinks and a seat. Talked about my wife's allergies and he went to the chef. The chef(don't remember his name sorry) and Richard went out of the way to help out and offered a great selection of suitable fantastic tasty foods for my wife.....she's never been so happy eating out as usually a big struggle. The chicken wings I had were superb also. Could recommend Richard, the chef and the restaurant any higher. Can't wait to return. (by Will Hannon) [4 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Great dog friendly, fantastic food, first class service. Highly recommended üòÅ (by michael Lea) [2 weeks ago] | Review 9: 4 stars - I visited this place during the Christmas holidays and to my surprise the place was fully loaded with people and had to wait for a while to get the table. Waiting for the table was not an issue for me as I was there more for the vibe than for drinks. The place had its own vibe as there was screening of a football match on that day. Everybody enjoyed the match and it was full of emotional and exciting rollercoasters as people were cheering for their favorite team and would get angry with every miss of goal. The service here was super quick and staff was very welcoming. They would even ask you if you want to repeat the order if they notice empty glass or empty plates on the table. The food was also quite on time and I didn't have to wait much for it even though the place had so many orders going on continuously. Overall the place was excellent, food was lovely and definitely a place worth visiting. I will definitely visit again soon. (by Devangi Dave) [a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Food was lovely. How the waitress remembered our entire order including drinks for 4 people without writing it down is beyond me. Would go back again. TV screens everywhere. I was able to watch UFC, boxing and football all at the one time. (by Kevin Finegan) [Edited 2 years ago]

name: The Clock Tower
address: Fintra Bay, Fintragh, Fintra, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews: Review 1: 4 stars - It‚Äôs been a few years but we had a lovely meal here. Such a pity it is now closed üë®üèª‚Äçüéìüë©üèª‚Äçüéìüë©üèº‚Äçüåæ ‚Ä¶ (by Valerie Doherty) [4 years ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Best place to eat in local area (by Ian Creighton) [9 years ago]

name: The Central Hotel Donegal
reviews: Review 1: None - We stayed two nights in August '25.  The weather was very warm and our room was on the 3rd floor.  We were so pleased that the window opened wide and even more pleased that the housekeeper had thoughtfully left the window open after preparing the room for our arrival.  Of course, the upshot of the warm weather was NO RAIN, resulting in a fantastic visit to Donegal Town.  The location of the hotel provided us with so many options for dining, sightseeing and shopping.  The bed and pillows were comfortable and the bathroom was spotless.  The front desk staff was so welcoming and helpful.  The breakfast crew were also very nice. (by David Brennan) | Review 2: None - Booked the restaurant but ended up in the day cafe part, maybe as overflow as they were busy?  It was evening and it was too bright and loud and felt a bit run down.  The food was not great, in fact it barely reached average.  I had a stir ‚Ä¶ (by Passport716245) | Review 3: None - Great location!  Located in the heart of town.  The staff were friendly and helpful.  The room was clean and spacious.  My only complaint about the room is the quality of the pillows.  They are extremely firm which prevented a restful ‚Ä¶ (by connorws110) | Review 4: None - We just spent a very relaxing weekend in this wonderful hotel. The hotel, as its name suggests in centrally located and very near all amenities. The food in both the bar and dining room is of a very high quality. We had a very spacious room ‚Ä¶ (by angelesque) | Review 5: None - We have been staying in The Central Hotel Donegal since I was a little girl. We have always loved it but over the last few years it has been particularly great. Since Breda has taken over, everything is immaculate - the decor, the staff, the food. It‚Äôs a real palace and we love it. (by annonymous482) | Review 6: None - The perfect place to share with family and friends! The hotel is right in the heart of town, which made everything so easy. We really enjoyed both breakfast and dinner, and celebrating my daughter‚Äôs birthday in Donegal made it even more special. The staff were absolutely lovely and made us feel so welcome üòç (by Yeymy C. Mora.) | Review 7: None - This hotel is a good one in town! We stayed for one night, and the experience was delightful. The staff was exceptionally friendly and welcoming, making our stay truly enjoyable. The room was spotless, and the breakfast was fantastic, offering a wide variety of delicious options. Highly recommend this place for a comfortable and pleasant stay! (by Taimoor) | Review 8: None - We had a family in the restaurant and kristoph was fantastic, our 9yr old son wanted to give him a 5* review. He was brilliant. Thank you Kristoph for making our evening so special. Highly recommend (by dawnlA4942FC) | Review 9: None - On holiday around Donegal and decided to go for a swim at the Leisure centre in Central hotel. It was just amazing. Spotlessly clean. Leisure staff are so accommodating and professional.  We enjoyed a fantastic hour swim there. (by Fearless46569873583) | Review 10: None - The lunch dining area is down a slope in the hotel near the back. Flight of stairs, but a lift there too.|Affable waiters.|The Donegal Bay chowder was splendid, and the chicken sandwich made to order was great too.|Decent value as well. (by MadDocNI)

name: Charlie's West End Cafe
address: 5 Main St, Drumbaran, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - The fish and chips were excellent!! Very crisp. Great flavor.
Curry cheesy chips were great. Our daughter had the kinder Bueno shake and loved it.
Friendly service and quick. Definitely a repeat! (by SARA WILLIAMS) [a year ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Warm, welcoming and very tasty. Can't go wrong here, good menu, super service. Rule of thumb: go to the busiest place in town. This is it. If you're hungry and want to refuel after being outside in a place with a good vibe, try Charlie's. (by Doug Decker) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Really like this cafe, I always pay a visit when I'm in the area. Full Irsh is a must really tasty.
Very friendly and helpful staff.  Excellent value for the quality of food. 100% recommended. (by integratyper honda) [2 weeks ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - I visited Assaranca Waterfall and had lunch at Charlie's. The staff, especially the guy taking orders, was friendly. I loved the food, especially the chicken curry and southern fried chicken wrap - delicious and affordable. They also have daily specials on the blackboard. Definitely planning to go back! (by Shriyaa) [a year ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Was here on the 14 August 2025 as a group of four the place was so busy but we got a table quick and ordered our food.the service was excellent the food was amazing and quick everyone got their food at the same time which was great I highly recommend this place when visiting Donegal you won't be disappointed. Even the town was beautiful where the cafe is thank you for a pleasant dining experience (by Darren D) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - We had a great breakfast here. Highly recommend stopping in for local food. (by Ben McKenzie) [4 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Lovely and friendly staff.  Very helpful.  You will never leave this place hungry.  Their jacket potatoes are a must.  The fish is always so fresh.  You will not go wrong ordering the fish (pan-fried, steamed, or battered). The home made burgers are delicious.  Steak is good, too.  Have never got anything that was disappointing. (by felix Callan) [7 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Lovely cafe in Ardara. Staff were very friendly and attentive. Chicken bacon club very tasty as was the beef baguette with warm mushroom gravy. Coleslaw was excellent. Good place for lunch and a quick bite. (by Shirle Ternan) [2 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è Our favorite spot in Ardara ‚Äì tested and approved by Polish holidaymakers! üáµüá±‚ù§Ô∏èüáÆüá™

We‚Äôre a Polish family that comes to Ardara every year for our holiday, and let us tell you ‚Äì Charlie's West End Cafe is an essential part of the trip. It‚Äôs not a real vacation unless we‚Äôve had at least one meal (usually several!) at Charlie‚Äôs.

The food? Absolutely delicious ‚Äì fresh, flavorful, and always hits the spot. The portions are generous (no one leaves hungry!), the cakes are homemade and heavenly, and the coffee? Strong and perfect ‚Äì just what you need after a Donegal walk or drive.
The atmosphere is warm and cozy, and the staff makes you feel like family ‚Äì always smiling, helpful, and up for a friendly chat.

Charlie's is more than just a cafe ‚Äì it's a place with heart. Whether you're a local, a tourist from abroad, or a regular like us, you‚Äôll feel right at home. We recommend it 100%! If you're in or near Ardara and you haven't been to Charlie's... you're seriously missing out! (by Dagmara Gornik) [3 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - I've been going to Ardara for 20 years and love this cafe. Great cafe food. Staff are lovely. Plenty of food for the money. Nothing is a problem and are very helpful. Love the breakfast, plenty of tea and toast. üëåüòä (by Ken Gorman) [5 months ago]

name: The Marina Cafe
address: Harbour View Court, Shore Rd, Killybegs, Co. Donegal, F94 Y9TV, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Definitely one of the best fish & chips we had on our trip. The portions here are quite big except for the shrimp and monkfish gratin which only has a few pieces. Every dish is delicious including the summer fruit gateaux We had to queue for 10 mins, as they were full when we arrived. The service is spotless and very fast despite being full house. (by Qwan Sumatepimolchai) [3 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Sat outside and had a nice meal on a glorious sunny day overlooking the marina. Despite great seafood options, I craved a burger and it did not disappoint. Nice soft potato bun and a side of curry chips and the meal was perfected. To finish the staff was very cheerful and prompt! (by Mark McCoy) [3 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Great little cafe, serving freshly cooked fish dishes. Service was great (by Val Walshe_Nippard) [a week ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Seafood chowder was incredible, and the fish was good quality and battered to perfection. Everything tasted amazing and the service was 10/10. Reasonably priced too. Definitely not to be missed! (by Megan Lesser) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - The food was really good and they have a bunch of friendly staff. It has got a decent decor inside. You will also have a excellent view of the sea right opposite to it.
We went in on a Sunday and it still managed to attract a good number of of customers as soon as the restaurant was open.
It has also got a few parking spots available. We loved our overall experience there and we would definitely recommend them. (by kallol sarkar) [9 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Went here with a gang of friends that were visiting the area we decided to stop in for a bite. We were kindly greeted by a member of staff and shown to our table. The menu has a lot to offer and has something for everyone. I had the vegetable soup ,curry chips and onion rings and the rest the gang had seafood dishes.
We could not have been better looked after, the service is great and and the food was stunning.
Well done everyone at the Marina and thanks so much.üôåüèº (by Jayoforshow) [4 weeks ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Talented and experienced Head Chef running excellent service with a delicious menu, it is a must for a food if visiting Killybegs. (by A. Campas) [a month ago] | Review 8: 4 stars - food is good, probably could do with a few more options on the menu, chowder was ok a wee bit on the watery side, coffee is good and the oysters were very nice but expensive probably the nicest ones I've tasted (by paul) [2 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - I was craving a big, juicy, fully-loaded burger after a weekend of camping and hiking and theirs hit the spot, with chips that were hot, fresh and delicious. My partner had the chowder and said it was flavourful and stuffed with seafood. The brown bread is the best I‚Äôve ever tasted (a secret recipe, alas‚ÄîI would love to know how to make brown bread like that). The place is very busy (always a good sign), but the service was attentive and friendly and the food was quick to arrive.  The ice cream cone on our way out the door was the perfect dessert to crown the experience. Mad props to everyone running this place! It will have my recommendation to anyone visiting Killybegs, and I hope we‚Äôre able to get back soon. (by Courtney Knudsen) [2 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Place don't take bookings, so you have to show up at the door, hoping to find small queue. We did and got lucky. The restaurant is very informal. But clean and no smell of fish (even if the fry quite a lot). Service is very friendly but with attention to details and also care for customers. Food &  Portion are good and prices fair. We did enjoy the dinner (by Case in Galway) [a month ago]

name: The Selkie
address: Tullaghan, Co. Leitrim, F91 K38H, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - We had our end of season team dinner here with 42 staff and it was an incredible evening!

The tapas menu was perfect as it created a social evening of great food, chats and relaxing!

The staff were informative, attentive and considerate! Even the kids were exploring ask the new foods!

For veggies and vegans the menu beautifully balanced and encouraged ask the carnivores to expand their palate!

We will be back!! (by Tom - Liquid Therapy) [3 weeks ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Our first time at Selkie bur definitely not last. It's been a while we have been served with such a passion and just genuine approach.  We really appreciated that. As it comes for food, the steak and sea bass - melted in our mouths.  Absolutely gorgeous.  Next time we around will definitely come back. Oh and specials - mushrooms could be as a main dish, delicious.  Thank you again (by Malwina Janik) [2 weeks ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - During our one-week holiday in Leitrim, we had dinner at The Selkie every single evening ‚Äì and that really says it all. The food was consistently delicious and carefully prepared, and the warm welcome made us feel at home right away. The hospitality and relaxed atmosphere truly make this restaurant stand out.
We can wholeheartedly recommend The Selkie to everyone. As soon as we‚Äôre back in Leitrim, it will be the first place we return to! (by Denis Verplanken) [2 weeks ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Some of the best risotto I‚Äôve ever had. Quiet restaurant with amazing locally sourced food. (by Matthijs) [4 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - What a wonderful evening at The Selkies. Really great food and very friendly, customer orientated and courteous service. The duck was to die for and the kalamri starter was incredibly flavoursome and tender. The exceptionally friendly wine advice rounded off the evening perfectly. The ambience can also only be rated positively throughout. You should definitely try it for yourself. (by Sabine K.) [a year ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - First time I‚Äôve experienced exceptionally good food, great service and remarkable drinks in Ireland (usually it‚Äôs 1 of the 3, or none with just good ambiance). This place is CLASS all the way around! Our server was the owner with her fianc√© the chef - so sweet!! (by Sasha Marks) [2 weeks ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - A really nice place. Delighted we went to this place and we will be back again soon. We had starter and mains. The food tasted great. The staff was very friendly and  did everything they could to make our evening enjoyable as possible (by Darragh Connolly) [a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - We had an amazing family dinner here. The Selkie manages to be the perfect nice restaurant for families - the food and ambiance is high quality with something for everyone and our kids were also well catered to with plenty of options and kind attention. The main courses were delicious, especially the cod, and the desserts were out of this world good. (by Jim Pierson) [3 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Visited with our 3 kids and my cousin, the best food we had on our stay in Bundoran by a long margin. All our starters, mains and desserts were fantastic, kids and adult meals alike. The waiting staff were also brilliant, one lady in particular made my visit but I didn't get her name sadly. (by Astra Davidson-Smith) [a month ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - We had a fantastic group gathering at Selkie. Lorraine and her team looked after us so well, the food was delicious and all really good value. Thanks for a fantastic night and I hope to be back. (by Ciara Grace) [3 months ago]

name: The Butterbean Restaurant & Accommodation.
reviews: Review 1: None - Food was ok but for the price I felt there should have been some vegetables. ‚Ç¨24.95 for a slab of meat with mashed potato and sauce was crying out for some nice colourful veg. My wife‚Äôs dish ( veg curry) looked and tasted like the sauce was out of a packet. (by Christopher Blake) | Review 2: None - Very good food. Had the lamb burger (daily special). Also had full irish breafast fry the following morning which was very good. (by Joe Houghton) | Review 3: None - We came here for dinner with our three young kids. They were very accommodating for our family, very kid friendly. Service was fast. (by Thomas & Genevieve Vehige) | Review 4: None - Beautiful food,very friendly staff and excellent service, I would highly recommend the Butterbean.üíØ ‚Ä¶ (by Rhonda Green) | Review 5: None - Stayed in Cardonagh for a night and had lunch and breakfast in butterbean. All food top class and the place is very clean. Would definitely recommend it. Thank you for a lovely service (by Sabina Ruskuliene) | Review 6: None - Every time we have been the service and food have been beautiful - thank you (by √Åine Timoney) | Review 7: None - Our family stayed here over the weekend and everyone had an enjoyable time. Rooms are clean & comfortable. Breakfast is cooked to order & heartily portioned. The coffee quality is really excellent. The evening menu is delicious and of a very good standard. The staff were all very friendly and welcoming. There was an issue with the water supply a couple of times, not the property's fault at all.Thet did say it's an ongoing issue. This sort of property is the lifeblood of rural hospitality, creating valuable employment. The local council would want to get their finger out to alleviate the water issue. (by Damien McDaid) | Review 8: None - Nice lunch and good value for money with great service (by anthony gavaghan) | Review 9: None - Absolutely wonderful experience at our lunchtime meal. We enjoyed the fresh seafood from the specials menu - undoubtedly the best cod I've ever had! Everything on our plates was just perfect. The staff were lovely, many thanks for a great service. (by Kate Popova) | Review 10: None - We went in for a takeaway and stayed in for dinner. all the food was top class and the service was great too. (by Mark Walker)

name: Inish Fusion wine bar and bistro
address: Malin Rd, Ballynally, Moville, Co. Donegal, Ireland
service_options: Beijing House Chinese Takeaway ¬∑ 3.7 stars ¬∑ 27 reviews ¬∑ Chinese Takeout
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Went to Inish fushion this evening with family. 04/06/25. Can't fault anything at all with the place. Very quaint and homely. Food was delicious and served by very friendly staff. Great choices on the menu. Definitely worth trying again to test some more dessertsüòä. Reasonable priced also. (by C) [4 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Inish Fusion has recently revamped their interior & it‚Äôs just lovely.  Great ambience with extremely pleasant staff who are knowledgeable about the dishes on offer . Midweek there‚Äôs an option to BYOB & avail of an early bird menu which makes it exceptional value for money .
Cannot recommend Inish Fusion enough ‚Ä¶the chefs take extreme pride in their work & presentation.  You‚Äôll not be disappointed! (by Heather Norris) [6 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Great visit, and friendly, attentive staff.
Starter was prawns and noodles, which was beautiful
We had the steak special on sat night , which was beautiful well presented and sizzling hot.
Desserts was Berry meringues,  and ice cream.
Thank you for a beautiful meal. (by Edmund McAllister) [4 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - What a gem. My husband and I had a fantastic meal here from starters to cocktails it couldnt be faulted.  If anything the quantity of food was too much without sacrifing the quality.  Thank you so much to the lovely staff. (by Sharon Bingham) [2 years ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Although I have visited before and always found Inish Fusion was good food and good value,  today's visit was EXCELLENT. Chowder was delicious and loaded with a variety of seafood. Main dish of Moville Chicken Fusion was tasty and well presented. The facade of the premises is very unassuming. Service was good and not rushed. There's plenty of room and toilets are very clean. On street parking is limited. Recommended. (by Dave M) [Edited 3 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Awesome, awesome, awesome.
Great service, Delicious food, big portions and reasonable prices...
If you have to go to Moville for this place alone, then go to Moville.
Totally worth it. (by Ibifaa Douglas) [2 years ago] | Review 7: 4 stars - Lovely place for a Celebratory meal, excellent fare, decent prices. (by Patrick OToole) [3 weeks ago] | Review 8: 4 stars - Had a Groupon voucher for a 2 course meal. Did feel ignored and took an awful lot of time to get service, but once the food arrived it made up for the lost time. Very busy and can get congested. Cheesecake was incredible. Delicious chowder. Forgot the name of our kind waitress but she was apologetic for the delay and wonderful to us. (by Neema Yeswant) [7 years ago] | Review 9: 4 stars - Nice bistro style restaurant in Moville. We ordered the fusion chicken and salmon and shared the mussels to start. The food was tasty. Service was attentive. Recommended. (by richard gil) [2 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - My husband and I had a beautiful meal at this restaurant. We both had seafood chowder, which was delicious. My husband had a fresh fish dish. I had pork escalope with white wine and mushroom sauce, new potatoes and salad. It was absolutely delicious. I would give this restaurant 10 out of 10. (by mary doyle) [2 years ago]

name: The Food Hall at The Market House
address: Donegal, F94 AP8W, Ireland
reviews: Review 1: 5 stars - Luxurious as it is cozy, this delicious eatery had lovely service! We went for dinner ‚Äî rich, large portions and pasta to die for. Definitely an upscale spot, but had no trouble treating us bedraggled travelers. Would return. (by Audrey Moss) [6 years ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Impressed with the food. Wasn't expecting it to be so tasty. Very generous portions. Clean location with friendly staff. (by Kyle Fields) [3 years ago] | Review 3: 4 stars - Very nice place with gorgeous food (by Declan Boyce) [5 years ago]

name: Aroma Coffee Shop & Mini Bakery
address: Lurganboy, Donegal Craft Village, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - We stopped in for lunch here with lower expectations after striking out several times in Donegal Town.  We arrived around 1:30pm to a full house except for one table for 2.  Great atmosphere. Lovely welcome/greeting from busy but accommodating staff.  4 lunch specials were offered in addition to the menu in this smallish bistro!  I ordered the carbonara pasta and asked for a side Caesar salad which was no problem even though not available on the menu as a side.  Hubby ordered the special chicken curry.  Both were delicious!  I loved the pasta but was especially impressed with the flavours and fresh ingredients of the Caesar salad. All food is made fresh to order.  My husband commented on how perfectly cooked (ie not overcooked) the vegetables in his curry were.  Looking forward to breakfast there tomorrow ü§ó (by Lesley J) [4 days ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - The food was good here but the service was a bit hit and miss.  We only ordered soup and coffee.  The coffee came quick but there was a mix up with soup order which took ages to arrive.  The cafe is in a modern building at back of craft shops.  The car park is fairly small but plenty of parking on access road through the estate. (by Noel M) [a month ago] | Review 3: 3 stars - Having read excellent reviews this was my most disappointing coffee stop of a month in Ireland.
Very limited selection of cakes - in fact there were no cakes at all, there were a couple of cheesecakes and one cookie.
The coffee was ok but not stunning.
And it was overpriced, over 20 euros for 2 coffees, a cheesecake and a cookie. (by Ruth Addison) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - The best coffee and the fresh ingredients used in all the food always satisfies.  Every visit is well worth the travel from Sligo. (by Irene Tury) [2 weeks ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Food was FANTASTIC!!! Never got the chance to take a picture of the pasta dish I had because it was that GOOD. Dessert and tea were fab and the absolute best garlic bread you ever had!
Now I know where this place is, I intend to become a regular. Great service too. Can't praise it highly enough. (by Abigail Akin-Laguda) [6 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Ate here with family for breakfast. They have limited menu for breakfast.

Ordered full Irish breakfast for ‚Ç¨12.95
And scrambled eggs for kids with toast was given panini toasted as alternative as they didn‚Äôt have the loaf bread.

Overall paid ‚Ç¨50 for 2 adults meal and 2 kids meals with 2 coffees and 2 hot cocoa.

The food came out quickly and was so nice not like the usual breakfast you get some are greasy and hard to eat but their own one was delicious. Specially their homemade brown bread that comes with it.

The location was nice as it‚Äôs beside some shops that do local gift as souvenirs when visiting donegal.

Overall the experience was great! Would highly recommended the place. (by Caroline Kirwan) [2 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Lovely coffee, gorgeous cake and the soup looked amazing. (by Liz Lawrence) [2 weeks ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Delicious lunchtime soups and sandwiches and really tasty cakes. For vegetarians the roasted vegetable ciabatta is really tasty and filling - served with a lovely fresh salad, as all sandwiches are. My husband had the steak panini which he really enjoyed. All cakes are delicious but the Tunisian orange cake is especially good. (by Jacintha McSherry O'Connor) [3 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Worth going out of your way. Excellent lunch and later in the afternoon cakes. (by Simon Dessain) [2 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - I was there twice on very different trips.
Once with my wife during winter on a road trip and again with a large group of cyclists on a charity cycle across the wild atlant way. Both times the food was excellent, service was super nice and quick and I had a great time. Highly recommended. (by Douglas Tosi) [a year ago]

name: Rathmullan House Hotel
reviews: Review 1: None - The hotel/house is perfect for a quiet romantic getaway. The bedroom decor added to a peaceful atmosphere. Spotlessly clean. Very comfortable. The restaurant was old world with two of the best chefs in Ireland by a long mile. The staff were not pretentious and very, very warm and friendly. Highly recommended . (by Derek Leonard) | Review 2: None - Thank you so much to the staff at Rathmullan House for ensuring we had a wonderful time at the hotel. The location , beside the beach! The room was beautiful and the food was exceptional. We had great breakfast 2 mornings and also 2 evening ‚Ä¶ (by brendan833) | Review 3: None - Just back from a fantastic few days in Rathmullan House Hotel, haven't been there in 17 or 18 years as we live abroad now. I was hoping it was still as I remembered it and it hadn't changed, and I was not disappointed its as good as ever ‚Ä¶ (by julieaD2888XA) | Review 4: None - Beautiful old house and location if slightly out of the way. The bedroom we had was large and the bathroom huge with an old-fashioned bathtub with ‚Äòfeet‚Äô. The restaurant staff were absolutely delightful and the 2 or three course meals, even if pricey, were top-notch.  There was an issue with s night-time fire alarm but the hotel rapidly compensated us for the inconvenience. We probably wont be coming back for a couple of years but we will certainly consider returning at some point. (by Daniel Robinson) | Review 5: None - This review is based on 17 night/6 property Irish road trip, so is relatively objective.||I stayed solo for 3 nights in June.||Easily found minutes away from the ferry. Plenty of parking.||Lovely location overlooking the sea in well ‚Ä¶ (by JoeCBansteadUK) | Review 6: None - It's always a joy to dine here. From the moment you walk through the door everything is impeccable. Staff that go above and beyond their duty to make sure you have an enjoyable experience.|The food was second to none, everything was ‚Ä¶ (by DaisyJ928) | Review 7: None - 3rd time here with a big group of family. It was wonderful- the rooms are beautiful, the food was excellent, the location perfect and the staff so kind and patient. Couldn't fault it, loved every minute! (by ElspethJ_12) | Review 8: None - Another incredible night spent in Rathmullan House. The food is totally incredible and the staff are so lovely. A true representation of Irish hospitality. Can‚Äôt wait to come back (by Hannah Pilkie) | Review 9: None - From the moment we entered the hotel we were met by friendly and courteous staff . The room was beautiful and very spacious . Everything was in the room that you would need for a visit . The beach on the loch is sandy and is lovely for a ‚Ä¶ (by Oakey1987) | Review 10: None - This is not 4 Star Hotel. Maybe high 2 or low 3. Here's why, the check-in was very rushed.  Wasn't shown to our room.  The floor was not flat.  Stains on it. Only heat no air conditioning.  The door wasn't locked when we first got to our room. The room had dust and dirty spots. The bathroom had fake marble, and the top of the shower head was dirty. The fine dining experience was not good. From the chairs to the seats to blanket with holes cut in it for lights.  No music, just noise of loud people.  To being told it's all inclusive, but the truth is they nickel and dime you on everything. You will be better off going into town and eating somewhere else.   I have no problem paying for 4 or 5 service and food. But I expect to get it in return. This place is not it. Save your money and time move on. (by Shaun Rudy)

name: The Lemon Tree Restaurant
address: 32-34, Courtyard Shopping Centre, Lower main Street, Letterkenny, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - This was such a great evening out. The service was incredible from when we entered until we left. The staff were friendly and accommodating service was very prompt.
The food was outstanding. They offered some complimentary starters a stunning ratatouille mouse, some fresh bread and the most amazing butter I've ever tried.

Absolutely loved it and would highly recommend it for a lovely evening.
We will definitely be back (by Monica Toland) [a month ago] | Review 2: 2 stars - I came in with very high expectations given the Michelin reccomendation and the glowing reviews from so many people. Unfortunately, the experience fell far short and left us feeling disappointed.

The service was stretched and at times we had to wait 2 to 3 minutes just to get attention for something as basic as cutlery or another drink. Not what you would expect at this level.

For starters we had the scallops and the beetroot salad. Both were nice, with the salad standing out more, but the real disappointment of the evening was the slow cooked beef. My wife and I are big beef lovers and this was almost inedible. It was so gamy and unpleasantly strong in flavor that after our first bite we both had the same reaction. We called the server and politely asked if we could change it for something else, but were refused and told, ‚ÄúThis is how beef cheek is supposed to taste, most people don‚Äôt like it.‚Äù (The chef said the same when two full plates were sent back with a bite taken out of each)

If that is the case, it would have been very helpful if this had been mentioned on the menu or explained by the staff before ordering. At this standard we would have at least expected either an option to change the dish or to have it taken off the bill. Instead we were left with a main course we could not eat and a chef who didnt think that our opinion mattered which really ruined the meal for us

The finer details were also missing such as missing screws on the bathroom door handle, empty hand wash, and single use paper napkins on the tables. Small things, but in a Michelin starred restaurant they really stand out.

We finished with the sticky toffee pudding which was fine, but by that point the whole experience felt underwhelming.

Overall we expected so much more. A Michelin star comes with the promise of exceptional service, food, and attention to detail, and sadly this just did not deliver. (by Huzaifa Saeed) [2 weeks ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Can‚Äôt fault anything. Absolutely stunning!

We wanted to try bit of everything so asked the staff if it‚Äôs ok to order bunch of nibbles and starters instead of having main dish each.
There was no issue at all and staff was happy to accommodate us with this.

Definitely coming back here again.

We made detour to come here but no regrets and happy belly leaving the restaurant. (by Eunju) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - We pre-booked our table for my mother‚Äôs birthday, there were 3 of us. The food was exceptional; delicate, flavoursome and beautifully presented. Service was very good, one young waiter in particular was very friendly and helpful. Linen tablecloth and napkins would have been appreciated, rather than disposable ones but apart from that, we couldn‚Äôt fault it. A fab restaurant! (by Therese Kavanagh) [a month ago] | Review 5: 4 stars - Had a great dining experience at The Lemon Tree in Letterkenny. The food was fresh, well-presented - you can tell real care goes into the menu. The ambience really stood out for me; it‚Äôs warm, stylish, and feels both relaxed and refined. The staff were friendly and attentive. It‚Äôs a perfect spot for a nice evening out or a special meal. Would definitely recommend. (by Nileet Jacob Philip (frozenmomentsbynileet)) [3 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - This is the second time I have been and it did not disappoint!
The service, the food, the little complementary bites sent from the kitchen‚Ä¶.it is so worth going to! The photos don‚Äôt even do the food the full justice it deserves!
Everything is delicious and it is fine dining at a sensible price.
Love it and cannot wait to return! (by Matthew Dowdeswell) [3 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - We ate for 2 people on a weeknight, there were a lot of people so you absolutely have to book, and it's worth it! We feasted, the aperitifs were delicious, enough to make us want to eat! We took the fries with beef fat, a little disappointment on our part because it doesn't really taste like it... (by Manon G) [4 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - A really really good spot, fantastic attentive well mannered team of staff, excellent food, with a great menu, the best meal I have had in a while, an absolute gem in letterkenny. (by Stephen Connolly) [3 weeks ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Absolutely lovely meal.  Lived up to the extraordinarily positive reviews. (by ER Singer) [4 weeks ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Probably the best restaurant I've ever been in and I imagine it'll be hard to top. (by Mark Ball) [2 months ago]

name: McCauley‚Äôs Restaurant
address: Bridge St, Lifford, Co. Donegal, F93 RC93, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Donegal ham might be slightly overpriced for just two slices, but the food itself is very nice, nicely decorated and the atmosphere in restaurant is really like at home. Great service as well. Definitely would visit again! (by Mario M.) [5 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Best gravy. Flavoursome and thick.  Delicious food with a big menu. Some quirky things too like twice battered burgers that look nice. Lovely turkey and ham.  Home made chips, perfectly cooked.  Chicken on the bone. Lots of fresh vegetables too. Sorry forgot to get photos. (by James Coulter) [4 years ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Food an service excellent  as always  well worth a visit though restaurant  could do with refurbishment  old fashioned (by Darren Tracey) [4 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Lovely fresh and home made food.. I've never been disappointed Friendly staff and proud hardworking owners (by Frances Vaccaro) [4 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - The best 12oz and the cheapest I ever had. Go there not doubt. Go. (by Thibaud Allard) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - A homely atmosphere. A good breakfast. A substantial lunch, or just a cuppa & toast. Same friendly faces each time üòç (by Jim Hunter) [4 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Great meal with beautiful prices, staffs are very kind and friendly.
1/2 roasted chicken, potatoes, latte.
Mixed Grill, tea. (by Ming Wei) [Edited 3 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - It's chipper food but it's decent, good portions, lovely staff. (by Fou Tees) [3 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Amazing  food, staff are  very  kind. From Fiadh  age 7.üòòü§©ü§© (by Davin McLoone) [2 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Good food decent portions üëå (by Gary Thomas Friel) [a month ago]

name: The Boathouse Bar/Restaurant
address: Tullynavinn, Redcastle, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Enjoyed a lovely meal here at the Boathouse. Ordered the fish of the day which was cod with some mussels and potatoes as well as an extra side that came with it. Creamy sauce worked very well with the mussels and easily one of the best I've had, cod was cooked beautifully and had a crispy skin but also retained a firm flakiness to the flesh. You are treated to a fantastic view as well while being taken care of by an attentive staff. (by Will Wong) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Amazing place, with breathtaking views and super friendly staff. One small jewel in the WAW with views to the bay and Northern Ireland, great parking space and super nice people serving the 100 of us that came with the bikes and vehicles.

Thanks very much for feeding us during our charity cycle supporting LauraLynn!! (by David Cristobal) [3 weeks ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - We were staying at the hotel next door so ate here for a change. It was fabulous! The waiting staff were so friendly and helpful. The food is excellent, well cooked, interesting flavours and good portions. The view over the Lough was stunning. I would highly recommend this lovely bistro for a relaxed meal in a gorgeous setting. (by Alison Tennant) [a week ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Had a wonderful water view table and a terrific meal including a nice French wine while visiting Donegal on vacation 6/7/25. Everything was fabulous. (by M M) [3 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - We recently dined at The Boathouse Restaurant with my wife and our 2-year-old, and it was an unforgettable experience. From the moment we arrived, the service was impeccable‚Äîwarm, attentive, and incredibly accommodating, even with a little one in tow.

The food was truly exceptional, far surpassing the standard of other restaurants in the area. Every dish was crafted to perfection, with vibrant flavors and top-quality ingredients. It was clear that meticulous attention to detail was placed in both the presentation and taste. A truly memorable dining experience that we can‚Äôt wait to repeat. Highly recommended! (by Stephen McLaughlin) [11 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Been here a few times now and it never disappoints. The location is spot on with great views across the water. Staff are friendly without being over the top, always polite and efficient. The food is excellent, fresh, cooked well, and decent portion sizes. Good variety on the menu so there‚Äôs something for everyone. Solid place to eat or grab a drink, definitely worth a visit if you‚Äôre in the area. (by Daniel M) [a month ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Lovely spot for lunch or dinner, make a reservation.
The pasta was delicious- battered fish, fab!
The dessert was really good too.
Attentive staff, beautiful view, good place to eat. Good value (by Cyril Mcnamara) [a month ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - I have dined here on a few occasions and I have found the staff the be very helpful and courteous. The restaurant itself has a lovely, warm and inviting atmosphere which is topped off with the best food in donegal that I have tried to date. It is not overly expensive and you get a good portion. Overall I will continue to dine here because it sets a very high standard,  one some of the more expensive places close could learn from. (by Liam Mallon) [2 weeks ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Incredible hidden gem in Donegal.  Phenomenal views.  Lovely staff are so friendly and welcomin.  A beautiful wedding took place here for me. (by Leantia Gallagher) [4 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - We stopped in here on the way home from a trip to Buncrana and had a really delicious Sunday lunch. I had the turkey and ham, my husband had the beef, and both were delicious. I got a side of onion rings and they were really good! The onion appeared to be pickled and they were so tasty. I can also recommend the 'Secret Garden' cocktail if you like lemon - beautiful! (by Caroline McAfee) [2 months ago]

name: Ubiquitous Restaurant
address: 47 Upper Main St, Ardaravan, Buncrana, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Had read some really positive reviews so when we visited the area recently we booked in. It didn't disappoint.
Food and service both really good, so good in fact that we visited a second time a couple of days later. Definitely recommend a visit here. (by David Powell) [2 weeks ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Without doubt one of the nicest restaurants in donegal, it was our first time here and wasn't it a surprise, the service was first class from the meet and great at the door until we left.
The restaurant was packed but our food came out so fast we were shocked because we knew it was busy and expected a delay.
The food was as good of food that I've ate in donegal ,credit to the chefs, highly recommended coming here and well done for your good work üëè (by Shaun Boyce) [Edited a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - The girls and I visited The Ubiquitous Restaurant Buncrana on the busy May bank holiday, and it was an absolutely fab experience from start to finish.  Despite being quite busy, the atmosphere was great, had an amazing buzz, and the staff couldn‚Äôt have been better, they were very attentive, friendly, and super welcoming.

The food was to die for, very well done, really good quality, generous portions, plus such good value for money. The cocktails were easily the best I‚Äôve had in town.

Really excited to go back for literally any occasion I can‚Äîhighly recommended! (by Eimear Brennan) [4 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Was visiting Buncrana with family and went here for dinner. Would definitely recommend - they had great options for dietary restrictions (vegan, gluten free) and the food was so tasty. Service was also great and very attentive.  Would definitely recommend the ratatouille! Also very reasonably priced for the size of the portions. (by Rob Harrington) [6 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Myself and my family visit in July.  Food was delicious staff went above and beyond for us. Staff were a great team and all looked like they were enjoying their work together (by Ann Mcnicholl) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - We had the most beautiful meal here this evening. The service was excellent and it was great value for money. The girls serving us were a pleasure. Thanks so much for a wonderful experience. We can't wait to come back! (by Paula Harte) [a month ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - My husband & I were desperately looking for somewhere to eat in Buncrana that allowed dogs in. We had absolutely no luck whatsoever, so my husband decided to go into Ubiquitous & ask the owner if there was any way they would accommodate the 3 of us. We were delighted that he agreed and we had a first class meal. I had a duck dish which was absolutely gorgeous, as were all the trimmings. My husband's sea bream was equally delicious and both meals were beautifully presented.  The service was very good and staff were very friendly and efficient. We would highly recommend this restaurant if you want an excellent meal at a reasonable price.  We will definitely return should we be in Buncrana again. (by G Wilkinson) [4 weeks ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Came in with a very large group with not booking. At the time we were told there was no tables available but if we went to the bar next door for half an hour someone would be in to get us and in fairness they were. Hid loved the waitress taking our order because we were well on at this point but the service was top notch and the food was just as good. Very professional very good food at a reasonable price. Couldn‚Äôt knock it (by O C) [4 weeks ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Went here with the kids yesterday and again today. We had all planned to have exactly what we had the first day as the food was so good(kids had the Ubiquitous Fries and we had the chowder and the smash burger). BUT, when we went back and they had a roast beef dinner on the menu, so we forgot about the burgers and chowder and went for the roast - it was one of the best roast beef‚Äôs we have ever had!!! Genuinely standout food! We are still on holidays in Buncranna and will definitely go again this week‚Ä¶

Update: we went back for our third visit in 5 days! Once again, the food and service were exceptional. This really is a great place for lunch or dinner or cocktails! (by John C) [Edited 2 years ago] | Review 10: 3 stars - Reservation online, they lost it.... waiting 15 min. outside. Good food and drinks, a little bit loud....After 1,5 hours we where ask if we can leave???!!!!
Bad experience here...... (by Thilo Bahlinger) [a month ago]

name: The Restaurant at Harvey's Point
address: Friary, Lough Eske, Co. Donegal, F94 E771, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 4 stars - Lovely staff and wonderful food! They had great options for both vegetarian and vegan on their evening dinner menu. The standard of the food was excellent. I think it'd be even better for lunch when you can enjoy the views. Will definitely be back!

Updated review: Went back for lunch - views were spectacular. Had to drop to a 4 star based on the lunch food. I'm not sure if it was a different chef, the food was still nice, but nothing like the dinner experience. See the added photo of the sea bass from lunch, quite overdone, although the potatos & vegetables were lovely. The stuffed Mediterranean vegetables were nice, but nothing special. We were the first customers from the lunchtime menu, so not really sure what happened. We will definitely go back for dinner, but not for the lunch, unfortunately. Lunchtime staff were as lovely as the evening staff though, but the food let it down. (by Louise Mc) [Edited 2 years ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Absolutely wonderful dinner on Saturday the 15th! All the staff were great and the food was phenomenal. We did the 7-course tasting dinner to celebrate our honeymoon and it was delicious as well as incredibly filling. We would definitely return if we were back in the area. (by Kelly Mackey) [6 years ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Came by for a late lunch on a very quiet Monday. Place did well. The small ceasar salad with chicken and the soup/sandwich were plenty for an afternoon meal. Beautiful place. (by Jay Johnston) [a year ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Our dining experience at the restaurant was delightful. The culinary offerings met our expectations, with each dish bursting with flavour. The team‚Äôs hospitality was exceptional, ensuring a warm and welcoming atmosphere. Overall, our dinner was thoroughly enjoyable, and we highly recommend this establishment for a satisfying meal. (by Rosemary) [a year ago] | Review 5: 4 stars - Sunday lunch was amazing. Food was 10/10 ! Unfortunately, that day there were also 2-3 big birthdays on. Which is fine... but our small table of two did get completely  forgotten about. Only got one drinks order, and that was with  the soup. Had too go to the bar every round, and i got fed up after the 3rd round and didn't buy any more ( I would love to have 3-4 more cocktails each)

Starters weren't cleared either, so we were nearly finished with our mains by the time the starters were cleared. Talking 20 minutes minimum on a crammed tiny table with dishes everywhere.

Not the service, I remember, but we still had a great time, and the food was great, hence the 4 star review.

13euro a cocktail, and I have to get up and go stand at the bar?!

Madness.

Certainly, I shouldn't have tipped, but I did anyway.

I hope that when we return for Christmas dinner, we don't get forgotten about again. We will be very unhappy. (by Robert Clarkson) [2 years ago] | Review 6: 4 stars - Nice place, food was nothing to write home about, steak was overdone (asked for medium rare). Our server Geraldine was amazing though, so friendly, enthusiastic and accommodating. (by Killian Magee) [10 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Had a great meal here with family. Food was great, wine was excellent and service was superb - particularly from Geraldine. (by Cathal Mc Hugh) [11 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Fantastic helpful staff, very warm atmosphere. The food is excellent and well priced. Also the music in the bar is always high quality. Highly recommended! (by Dan Sheerin) [5 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Beautiful restaurant with stunning views exemplary service and exquisite food! Top class all round (by John Cahalin) [4 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Excellent hotel, Excellent staff and excellent food. A first and not last time experience. (by Bernard Melaugh) [5 years ago]

name: Maggies Tavern
address: R265, Carrickmore, St Johnston, Co. Donegal, F93 YY56, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - We had a wonderful celebration for my parents 35 year anniversary. We had booked a big table of 10 adults and 4 children and it was no problem. Alice came out and greeted us and made us all feel very welcome. She even arranged a lovely photo for us. We had booked for the Sunday lunch and the food was spectacular, we are all still raving about it! Thank you to Alice and her wonderful team for making my parents day special :) (by caroline okane) [2 weeks ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Was here for my twin grand nieces christening party, function room was lovely and food was tasty and staff were very friendly and helpful. (by Paddy McGlynn) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Had my sons 18th birthday party and I‚Äôm glad I chose maggies tavern, Alice and her staff couldn‚Äôt do enough for us, from the food to helping set up. The Service was amazing. They go above and beyond and they make everyone feel so welcome. If you‚Äôre looking for the perfect place for your family function then this is the place to go I guarantee you won‚Äôt be disappointed. Thanks again to everyone who helped make my sons party a success. Top place ! (by Shareen Mitchell) [3 weeks ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - We had our daughters communion party here and had a fantastic experience. Great food ,great staff very helpful and kind. The new out door area was fantastic for kids they were safe and secure and able to go in and out by them self's! We had a fantastic experience and would recommend to anybody ! (by Trevor Graham) [4 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - We had an 18th Birthday party at Maggie's last night. It was a great evening. Alice and all the team provided great service, with high attention to detail. The food was delicious and the atmosphere perfect. I would highly recommend Maggie's for a party or family gathering. (by Mary Frances Doherty) [a year ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - We had a christening party in here today and I have to say the food was excellent,  as good as food at any hotel wedding.
The staff are super friendly and Alice the owner made our day really special
She took photographs to send to us and is so good with all of the children.
I highly recommend Maggies Tavern for your special occasion. (by maggie mcclure) [a year ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Had my daughter's first communion celebration here yesterday.  Also had my child's christening 7 months ago. Venue top class for family celebrations, very child friendly.  Very personalised and host makes it very exciting üòÄ  My daughter felt very special on her big day. We had the Carrick suite which is very spacious with lots of room for kids to play around safely wile parents relax and enjoy the day.
The food was fantastic highly recommend the roast beef üëå
Nothing was a trouble for Alice and anything we wanted to do for the day was fully accomodated to make the day perfect us all.
Highly recommend for a personal touch to special occasions ü•∞ (by Karen Porter) [a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Celebrated both my kids conformation day at Maggies, Alice was a fantastic host, so welcoming. Food was amazing, thank you to all at Maggies for everything. (by Linda Kilpatrick) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Fantastic location for a pint and food is great! Service is excellent and quick, staff really friendly and helpful. Would seriously recommend! (by Conor) [a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Maggie's Tavern is some spot! Great atmosphere and very good food. Alice was very nice and friendly too. I love following their social media too! (by Grace Cee) [a year ago]

name: Snugborough
address: Bunnagee, Letterkenny, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - It's my birthday today and we decided to come here for lunch.
really big portions, you won't leave hungry. the food is tasty. I ordered FISH TACO - loved it, lots of fish and vegetables and a banana milkshake - üòã. My husband ordered DIRTY COW - the beef is cooked very professionally.
the servers are friendly, nice music, and stylish design. (by Yuliia Z.) [3 months ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - Overall a really pleasant experience. The food tasted nice and all the service was good. Atmosphere felt good and was the perfect vibe for a Sunday afternoon.

We had a little wait when entering whilst a few staff members walked straight past. Only after the third we were offered a table. Not a problem, just being our first visit we didn't know the protocol...

It's good quality food, cooked well, but boy do you pay for it.

Would recommend (by Aaron Marsh) [3 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - I had the Classic Smash Burger with skinny fries and dip here and wow, it was absolutely delicious! The burger was juicy, flavorful, and perfectly cooked. Everything tasted fresh and satisfying. If you're craving a proper burger. Highly recommend! (by Rutu Patel) [3 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Went for brunch 10 out of 10 very generous  portions. Tasty unique  dishes.
Staff have amazing  attention  to detail.
Bathroom  were immaculate. Which is a massive plus.

Interesting layout  and decor.

Couldn't  recommend  highly enough.
Thanks for the food. (by Conor Fitzpatrick) [9 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - What a fun restaurant!
Having grown up in California during the Hot Rod Culture - approaching the entry , an old Hot Rod perched on the roof was so üòé
Decor - eclectic-
Staff- extremely friendly
Music- great tunes
Food **** so delicious !
I had their Smash Burger with a whisky roasted pineapple - really good.
Husband had a steak sandwich - great !
Many choices to choose from !
We would definitely recommend giving this restaurant a try !! (by Debbie G) [6 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Had breakfast here this morning.  Fabulous food and amazing service from very friendly staff. Would definitely recommend this place.  Have never seen such generous helpings at a reasonable price (by Louise Doherty) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - 5 stars all around. The food, the staff, the place all deserves 5 stars, I got the beef brisket burger and it was the most tender burger I‚Äôve ever had, and I got the patatas bravas along side which were probably the best I‚Äôve ever had
If you‚Äôre close to Snugborough I‚Äôd recommend 100% trying it out üîù (by Ryan Wilson) [3 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Been a while since I've been here. Amazing value for money, you won't leave hungry and the staff were excellent. Thank you. (by Paul Forrestal) [4 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - This place is amazing.  So happy we discovered it as we travel through Letterkenny often & have visited a few times now.  Definitely recommend it! (by Darragh McLaughlin) [a month ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Visited with family as a large party of 8 people. I cannot fault anything, the service and food was honestly the more than 5 stars. Lee, the head chef was incredibly hospitable, serving generous portions of high quality food. We were all very well looked after by Lee and Josh, our server. The food tasted fantastic, you can tell that love and care is put into each dish. We all loved everything that we ate. Portion sizes were huge and we took leftovers home! As someone who loves finding great food places, this was amazing. Would highly recommend and would absolutely visit again. (by Heather Lavery) [a year ago]

name: McCafferty's Bar (Harry‚Äôs) - Pub Letterkenny
address: Mountain Top Roundabout, Ballaghderg, Letterkenny, Co. Donegal, F92 X681, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Lovely place.... Very clam and beautiful pub. Staff's are too cooperative . Place always warm with fire. Best in town. 100% recommended (by Shaiby Thomas) [Edited 2 years ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Absolutely lovely place just outside letterkenny town. Great atmosphere, great location and lovely people. One of fav places for a pint or 2. (by Siobhan Tierney) [7 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Best spot in town for a Guinness. Stopped for one or two after a day out. Staff are great, more than helpful and very pleasant with the kids alsoüëåüèªüëåüèª ‚Ä¶ (by Gary Price) [2 years ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Very welcoming, warm and great ambience. Everything a bar should be down to a tee. (by Pauric Ward) [Edited a year ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - The greatest pub in the county üëå No better place for a pint of the black stuff üñ§ (by Colin Farrell) [a year ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Pet friendly bar... had a lab... asked the bar tender if I could let the dog in... he readily agreed to do so... Best creamy pint of Guinness... Love this place.. cozy and hmm... really cozy!! (by abhinov Bardan) [6 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - The best pint of Guinness you will find, even after being closed for so long - Mary Lee hasn't lost her touch when it comes to pouring!! (by Amy Emery) [Edited 4 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Last min decision to go here this evening.. only 10 min walk from the house. Lovely, quiet pub.. no distractions..just peaceful and quiet. Great bar staff also. Great spot if you want to have a quiet conversation with anybody. Fabulous pints of Guinness and enjoyed the hot whiskeys for the walk home on a stormy night. Will certainly be back again. (by C) [3 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Gorgeous wee pub just outside the Letterkenny town limits. Ideal for a wee pint to wind down and always good craic (by Jens Pleiner) [7 months ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - Stop off here for a few drinks
with friends from Glasgow.  I pass mc claffertys bar every day and always was thinking what it was like inside . it looks great on outside but even better inside. lovely warm cosy bar. very clean.  hand gel on every table. lovely lighting. nice open fire on .  will definitely be stopping off there again. the Guinness supposed to be brilliant. I picked short straw for driving so I'll be having a Guinness on my next visit ‚òòÔ∏èüáÆüá™‚òòÔ∏èüáÆüá™ (by francie vaughan) [2 years ago]

name: Braai Restaurant Creeslough
address: Main St, Creeslough, Co. Donegal, F92 X0CW, Ireland
service_options: Gusto's Takeaway And Pizzeria ¬∑ 4.4 stars ¬∑ 87 reviews ¬∑ Fast Food
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - We‚Äôve never had anything remotely South African before and were surprised by how amazing the food was. What made the experience so great were the unique flavors of each dish and how well it all came together. The prawns were cooked to perfection and actually tasted sweet. The Roosterkoek was very interesting, a bread that‚Äôs cooked by being grilled and tasted smoky. The beef bitterballens were basically pulled beef balls that were deep fried and so delicious and creamy. For mains, we got the short rib and one of the specials for the night, the T-bone steak.  The steak was juicy and the short rib has got to be the best one I‚Äôve ever had from any place. For dessert we got the malva pudding and chocolate brownie. Again, we were very surprised by the pudding and felt that it was the best of the two. We‚Äôll be back again for sure. (by Akram M) [3 weeks ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Great visit to Braai - lovely atmosphere and really good food cooked on an open fire. I‚Äôd recommend a meal here - seemed to be popular with both locals and tourists. The staff were friendly and well informed about their cooking method and menu choices (by Lisa Taylor) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Absolutely love this place. Second time visiting and was even better than the first. Incredible food, value , service and ambience. Couldn‚Äôt fault the place! (by G D) [2 weeks ago] | Review 4: 4 stars - Fantastic ambiance!
Chilled vibes. Loved the atmosphere!
The staff are what made dining there, superb! Friendly, attentive & extremely knowledgeable about their menu, which was so refreshing!!!
Food was delicious, but portions were quite small & quite expensive.
It was a nice treat and would return for a special occasion! (by Carol Mcginley) [a week ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - I can honestly say the food is absolutely delicious. If you're looking for a unique culinary experience, this is definitely the place to go. The atmosphere is lovely, and the staff are incredibly friendly and attentive. The food is just outstanding. Every time we have friends around, we always want to bring them here. It‚Äôs absolutely worth it! (by Giulia Fernandes) [5 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Just go! You don‚Äôt want to miss out on this spot if you are in the area. We are willing to travel back it‚Äôs so delicious. The atmosphere, the food and the service are just top notch. We went twice in 4 days . Even got some busting and merch to go. Great value for money and you won‚Äôt leave hungry. Family friendly too! (by Danielle Heekes) [6 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - A South African restaurant at the top of Donegal was not what I would have expected, but either way, I was blown away by every course. The food was beautifully cooked, flavours delicious, servings generous, and staff lovely. I will definitely be back! (by Chantelle McIntyre) [5 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - A wonderful surprise of a place to find. Flavours that were unusual and exciting. A victory for taste. Reasonably priced and generous portion size. A hidden gem. Worth a visit. (by Jimmy O'Neil) [3 weeks ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - What a fantastic place! The service, the atmosphere, but most of all the food!!! Unbelievably delicious and so different! I wanted a dessert but I had no more space. I don't have any photos because I was eating! Highly recommended. I'll be staying in county Donegal for a couple more days and I'm plotting already how to organise my stay so that I can end up eating there. Thank you! (by Malwina Tritt) [a month ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - I am so happy to have discovered Braai; we live part of the year in Donegal and are always looking for great places to eat in the area. We went last night. My husband eats everything and had an amazing, perfecly-cooked steak. I'm veggie and had a delicious veggie option and our guest, who's allergic to everything, had  monkfish and loved it. What's more, the staff we so warm and friendly and the space is incredibly cozy. We'll be back! (by Johanna Lane) [2 weeks ago]

name: Logues of Cranford
address: Cranford, Co. Donegal, F92 K202, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 1 star - Food was well below par, we were served Roast Beef that was dry and grizzly. Vegetables and Potatoes had zero taste and it was obvious they were sitting out for a long time. Would not return unfortunately. The girls serving did their best. (by Dave Doyle) [a month ago] | Review 2: 2 stars - Unfortunately not a great experience. The roast beef was very dry, tasted like it had been cooked a couple of days before. The sides of vegetables were tasteless.

For some reason, one of the chicken goujons on the kid's wrap was pink inside, but the other two were OK.

And the hake goujons were quite rubbery.

I'll acknowledge that the staff were quite attentive, and we did provide feedback on the beef, which they then comped on the bill. Although typically I would have thought that the chef might have come out to ask about it. (by Gary Dooley) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - First time visiting Logues of Cranford. Was quite old-fashioned on entering, but this added to the feel of the place, very laid back and chilled atmosphere.  The food was cooked to perfection with every request catered for. Every staff member we met was friendly and helpful.  We enjoyed the visit. (by msmrnfrn) [a year ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Food and table service was super and staff were very welcoming and accommodating. Really enjoyed our meal and dessert. (by Tony O'Brien) [3 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Fresh seafood, excellent seared scallops and a good pint of Guinness. There's an old forge you can visit that made tools that build the main road. Great family run venue (by Andrew Metcalfe) [5 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Had food here last Saturday night with all the family and it was fantastic, definitely will be back. Great T Bone steak. (by Martin Doherty) [9 months ago] | Review 7: 4 stars - Tasty
Started with local mussels. They were that nice I forgot to take a pic. (by Cronan O Donnell) [4 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Food excellent,  a very warm welcome and the atmosphere and staff second to none. (by Robert) [9 months ago] | Review 9: 3 stars - Great spot, very close to the b&b we were staying in.
Mussels were so good!
Goujons were amazing!!!!

Steak burger - 2/5 - was basically a minced burger , no sauce , they ask if you want cheese and onion. So maybe request they put the toppings you want. (by Pamela Hermogenes) [2 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Great place! I like the food, especially the garlic skinny fries but the mash potatoes aren't my favourite. Still 10/10 (by Unia 485) [a year ago]

name: BEFORE
address: Before, Finn Valley, Stranorlar, Co. Donegal, F93 R7WT, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 4 stars - Great service and the standard of food is excellent. Really good pizzas, the ingredients were very good quality, and a nice textured pizza base. We had an excellent dessert too. It's obvious someone's heart has gone into the place, and it's not just some corporate roll out. Decor was cool, in a young lad sort of way.  It's a very nice amenity to have locally and fair play to those running it! Definitely would go back! (by Louise Mc) [2 years ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - The food was absolutely amazing! Nicest pizza I‚Äôve ever had! (by Sarah) [2 years ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Fantastic restaurant. Clean, cozy, eclectically decorated and with incredible food.
I ordered the pepperoni pizza, which wasn't amazing, but my partner ordered the steak and the steak was unbelievable. They cook with fire and it gave the steak a wonderful barbeque flavour.
I'll definitely be back. (by C.M.R.) [2 years ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Stunningly delicious. I was not expecting Donegal to have such good quality pizza, to be honest.

Also, the owner is a really hotty. I was not sure if he kept dropping mozzarella on purpose or was he doing that to stimulate the experience of the customer but it sure did spice up our evening. Let‚Äôs just say at he is zealous with the pepperoni. (by Aidan Killian) [3 years ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Fabulous food, lovely staff. Lovely experience overall. I would drive the 1 hour 15 minutes just for the Chicken Wings alone!!! Fantastic early bird menu too.
Can't wait to go back. (by fiona feeney) [2 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Exactly what the twin towns needed! Delicious food (best pizza I‚Äôve had!), extensive menu, well priced, great wine selection, friendly and helpful staff, funky interior and a lovely atmosphere. Will definitely be back! (by Eimear Boyle) [2 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - The food was absolutely mouthwatering; the staff were fantastic and so friendly; and the wine list is perfect. Had such a lovely evening here. Highly recommend. (by Paul Mc Connell) [2 years ago] | Review 8: 1 star - Was there for there 1 year anniversary.  Unfortunately didn't know they were celebrating it before we landed. Food was good. But the wait time to be seated/served and given the food was just horrendous! Waitress didnt submit order, so was taken a second time. Sitting at the end of the table inside, near the toilets. Drafty!!
Took over 2 hours from start to finish just to get 2 main courses for 2 people. Never again! RESPONSE TO OWNER: You never replied to my review....quite strange that you think you did! Lol How about making a response to my review that I put up months ago at your 1 year birthday.....and not a week ago as Google is saying! That's a mistake on Googles part here!  Your 1 year birthday was a shambles.....I saw enough people complaining. Zero stars would be better! It was a woeful experience. Your response is pointless! (by Pixie Dixie) [Edited 2 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Amazing food and service! Staff were all so friendly. The before and hey presto pizzas were 10/10, ice cream was amazing also- would definitely recommend! Be back soon (by Ellen Jones) [3 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Absolutely fantastic restaurant. The food, staff and ambience are excellent. Had my 30th there and they couldn‚Äôt do enough for us. Great addition to the Twin Towns. (by John O‚ÄôHara) [2 years ago]

name: McCafferty's Bar & Restaurant
address: Lower Main St, Meenmore, Dungloe, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 4 stars - Very nice ,local traditional bar, nicely decorated with old pictures of famous irish people. The staff were very welcoming and helpful, and the service was prompt. It was a very busy evening but still got accommodated with a table fairly quickly.  A good bustling atmosphere throughout the pub. Several TVs covered the various sporting events. The food itself was a little underwhelming. I ordered the ceasar salad, which was very nice, but the sauce was not the traditional ceasar sauce,maybe a variant or a 1000 island dressing or something similar. The chicken was nice and the salad fresh and well presented. Can't recall any cheese sprinkled on the salad.
