The children's pasta dish was nice but a bit shy on the pasta sauce, so it was a little dry, nice but a little dry. The chicken curry was very nice with lots of flavour. For desert, I got the Orange cheese cake, again not much flavour to it and very, very soft , almost cream like as it fell apart. Overall a very nice pub/restaurant with very nice staff , a girl named Summer served us and was really nice and helpful. The food was nice, and I'm probably being a bit picky with the sauces . All the other dishes that came out looked lovely. (by Andy) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - My family and I recently had a fantastic meal at McCafferty's in Dungloe, and I have to say, it was a truly memorable experience. From the moment we walked in, the atmosphere was warm and inviting, and the staff were incredibly friendly and attentive.
To start, we decided to share the chilli beef nachos, and what a great decision that was! The portion was generous, piled high with crispy tortilla chips, flavorful chilli beef, and a perfect blend of melted cheese, salsa, and sour cream. It was the ideal dish to kick off our meal, and we all agreed they were some of the best nachos we've had.
For our main courses, we sampled a variety of dishes, and each one was absolutely delicious. The steak sandwich was a standout‚Äîthe steak was cooked to perfection, tender and juicy, nestled in fresh, crusty bread with all the right accompaniments. It was a hearty and incredibly satisfying dish.
The salmon was another highlight, beautifully cooked with a crispy skin and flaky, moist flesh. It was served with a fantastic selection of vegetables that complemented the fish wonderfully. The rest of my family who ordered the chicken gougons were equally impressed. The chicken was tender and coated in a light, crispy batter, making them a delicious and comforting choice.
Honestly, every single dish we ordered was amazing, and to top it all off, we finished the meal with a rich and creamy Oreo milkshake. It was the perfect sweet ending to an already incredible meal. The quality of the food, the generous portions, and the fantastic service made for a perfect evening. McCafferty's is a gem in Dungloe, and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a superb dining experience. (by Stephen Harron) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Highly recommend this place for food had a bit of food yesterday evening and was just beautiful give it a shout and try there food staff very friendly also. (by Living the Dream) [a week ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Great choice of food , I had the sweet chilli chicken wrap and chips from the lunch menu was amazing, great friendly service also, brill great size beer garden out the back too (by The Extension Bar) [4 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Visited during Mary of Dungloe Festival so was busy. Food was fab (had mussels and salmon) and service excellent. (by Ciara Hassan) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Very friendly staff and excellent food. I had the chicken lunch special, which tasted excellent, and it came with a nice Guinness. So, despite the bad weather with rain and wind, the evening was still a good one. I'll be happy to come back next time! (by Christian Thurner (fotografie_chris)) [3 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - I couldn't be more happy with stopping here for food with our new born they were so accommodating and welcoming. Atmosphere was great even for a Tuesday night. Special thanks to "Smiggy" sorry I don't know his real name that went out of his way to make space for us and giving us a quiet area for our sleeping new born. (by Demc 555) [a week ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Popped in here for our evening meal and wasn‚Äôt disappointed. Staff were polite & friendly and the food was tasty. (by 6373nerd) [4 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Awesome traditional food and atmosphere is great. Staff is slow and prices are reasonable. (by Damian Zapart) [5 months ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - The vibe is good.. Ordered Green Thai curry, veggies were good, but curry was very less. Staff is not smiling, too busy running here and there. (by Swati Maheshwari) [3 months ago]

name: Thai Ann
address: 11 Main St, Donegal, F94 KPX6, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Brilliant Thai food! Everything was so fresh and tasted amazing. There was a great choice of dishes at a really reasonable price. And the service was super friendly. Can‚Äôt recommend them enough! üòÅ (by Tansy Roake) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Our favorite food in Donegal! Everything is delicious‚Äîwe loved it so much that we went back to try more items on the menu. The only thing better than the food is the delightfully sweet shop owner. You must go here for takeaway! (by Alyssa Cooper) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Got Thai Ann for the first time tonight. Delicious and good portions. Got vegetable thai green as well as tamarind duck. The chips are proper hand cut with skins on. We were really impressed by the food. (by S A) [Edited a year ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - I love when I take a chance and it works out. The outside of the building is run down and doesnt inspire much confidence and once you step inside the door its not much better looking either... However, the woman behind the counter is very sweet, attentive and respectful. Its a take away but also have a limited number of seats and I chose to sit in. The curry arrived quickly and it was super tasty, a good level of spice and loads of it. In summary, I left a very satisfied punter... Recommended (by Pat O'M) [3 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - We just go through this town and found that most of the restaurants are closed. And then we find this Thai restaurant still open, I would say the lady is very nice and the service is also attractive. Recommend all people who want to try Thai food here üëç (by Alan Lee) [a year ago] | Review 6: 4 stars - First visit this evening. The sweet n sour duck was nice but a bit too much garlic. Needs to be reduced more with more sweetness. I finished the meal happy thou! We also got drunken noodle dish which was nice also. Good to have a Thai in donegal Town, hope to sample more dishes! (by John Cahalin) [4 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - This was the best takeaway I've ever had over my vacation. The lady was very nice and provided suggestions after asking our preferences and spice levels needed. The portion sizes were too huge for two people so we ended up being stuffed but we didn't complain at all since the food was fingerlicking good!!!!
It is the best and must try place if you're in Donegal town for a while. Would definitely be trying it again whenever we go there again. (by Maham Johnson) [8 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - We were in town for 2 nights - we tried this place the first night and loved it so much we cancelled our dinner reservations for the next night. I'd highly recommend the red curry and the pad king. Great portion sizes too! We gorged ourselves. The owner is very sweet as well - she remembered us from the day before when we returned (by Heather P) [3 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Great food and excellent portions. We loved the Massaman Curry! (by Jay M) [3 weeks ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Greeted with a Wai by such a gentle woman. I have not even tasted the food but I can tell this is a business that takes customer service seriously. A few places to sit in culturally appropriate for a Donegal town take away. I chose this place because of the glowing reviews. (by James Morgan) [a year ago]

name: Belles Kitchen Rathmullan
address: Pier Rd, Rathmullan And Ballyboe, Rathmullan, Co. Donegal, F92 C935, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Absolutely delicious food!! So many tasty breakfast / brunch options. Lots of baked goods too. The staff are so friendly and welcoming and really go the extra mile to make the whole experience better. My only criticism is that they mainly stock Coca-Cola products. Would be nice to see other options as most people are boycotting this company. They do have Mc Daid's football special though so it's an overall win in every category. I highly recommend the garlic fries, made with chunks of fresh garlic. (by Bernice Mc Namee) [5 months ago] | Review 2: 3 stars - Quaint establishment, super friendly and helpful staff.  Both the cupcake and coffee cake were moist however the frosting was an incredibly grainy & sweet buttercream;  not palatable and we scraped it all off (by Car Carol) [a year ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Spent an evening here with family. Ordered a delicious seafood chowder, a deceivingly large portion with a healthy amount of fish. Creamy and seasoned to perfection. I highly recommend ordering the chowder.

Hugh‚Äôs service was excellent, friendly and enjoyable banter. (by ayy lmao) [11 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - We had to wait years for our return visit due to Covid. It was well worth the wait.  We travelled across to Rathmullan on the ferry ‚õ¥ from Buncrana. We had to wait for approximately half an hour for a table. This shows how popular this establishment is. When the food arrived on out table all was quite. It was fabulous üëå.  Could not be faulted in any way. Great service (by Seamus Lyons) [3 years ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - The coffee has a roast date, the bread is baked fresh, and the atmosphere is perfect. If you're in Rathmullan and Belles is open definitely visit. (by J Reinmiller) [Edited 5 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - I went here today for lunch with my family. The food was absolutely beautiful and the staff were very friendly & helpful (even had a joke & laugh with the kids)
Beautiful and clean inside and out. We will definitely be back. (by Charlene Cage) [3 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Had the pleasure of having breakfast , yesterday morning.This busy cafe, has a friendly welcoming atmosphere ,
The hardest job is to pick something off the extensive breakfast menu.
I‚Äôm glad I choose Shaksouka , never heard of it or had it before but it was the best breakfast I ever had.
Staff are friendly and attentive,
Will definitely be back (by seamus grant) [3 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Had dinner here on Saturday night. Super menu. Delicious food and plenty of GF choices for me. Friendly, helpful staff. A busy spot üëå (by Wendy Montgomery) [3 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Visited en route from Ballymastocker Bay - four delicious lunches - widely varied appeal (beef short ribs, pasta bolognese, halloumi toastie and BLT) - pleasant and friendly service - lovely atmosphere - and bonus pastries to go - so difficult to choose!) - if ever back this way again will return for sure! (by Manju Monga) [4 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - The best breakfasts we've ever had, EVERY time we go! The Turkish eggs are phenomenal! Staff are friendly and efficient. Portions are excellent. Menu extensive. Absolutely worth a visit. (by Lynn Kyle) [a year ago]

name: Bridge Bar Restaurant
address: Ballyboe, Bridge End, Co. Donegal, F92 E427, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Incredible meal from start to finish. Our waiter Seamus was a remarkable host and did not disappoint with his recommendations. The duck liver parfait was decadent and the fish rillette was refreshing. The pigeon breast was tender and the beef cheek was so rich in flavour. When it came to dessert, we had trouble choosing what to try but through Seamus‚Äôs recommendation, we had gone with the vanilla ice cream with brownie chunks and salted caramel along with the burnt basque cheesecake and were delighted by both. (by Akram M) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - This place is absolutely wonderful! The bar downstairs is perfect for a pre- or post-dinner drink, and the restaurant itself has a fantastic atmosphere. The food is truly exceptional, definitely try the specials. Our server, Seamus, provided incredible and personal service and it's super clear that the team there are passionate about what they do. We will be back. ‚ù§Ô∏è

Tip: take the bus and enjoy your wine without worrying about driving. We took the bus from Rathmullan, and it was a great experience. The return fare is just ‚Ç¨3! You can also catch the bus from Letterkenny, and the driver was super accommodating ‚Äì he even dropped us off right at the top of our road. (by Meabh Dalton) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - This was the best meal we had during our stay in Donegal. It's not your typical pub menu which was a lovely surprise. Absolutely superb experience was had and the owner was lovely and friendly also. Highly recommend!! (by Michelle Cabillic) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Astoundingly good. Superb dining experience, staff are excellent and the food is  exceptional. This is not a place to go for ‚Äòordinary‚Äô food, it is really fine dining done very well. Small wine selection but perfectly chosen to match the food. An unexpected gem of a restaurant which we will return to. Brilliant, well done. (by Kill J) [4 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Stumbled across this beautiful restaurant by happenstance and I'm so glad I did. The service was great, the view over the river was stunning, and the food was remarkable. (Beef bone marrow, confit rabbit ballotine and St-Emilion au chocolat w/ beef fat fudge were the standout dishes). 10/10 would recommend. (by Rory Price) [a year ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Fantastic food, staff were accommodating, friendly, and responsive. They made our family dinner very special.
Location is top notch, too; above one of the best bars in the county and situated in picturesque Ramelton. (by Colm MacMeanman) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Really great food - service was impeccable and the atmosphere was lovely and cozy - would highly recommend. (by Sarah) [2 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - High end food for very reasonable prices! I loved everything about this restaurant. The service was excellent and the food was exquisite. Great selection of local foods presented beautifully and cooked to perfection. Can't wait for our next visit to the Bridge Bar Restaurant. (by Niamh Dalton) [3 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Dinner in the Bridge bar last night was a wonderful experience,friendlyl barman downstairs started us with a drink.We were then welcomed upstairs by very professional,interesting looking  ,well informed,cool staff!My scallop starter was delicious,followed by prawn risotto,affogato and coffee.Food was very tasty,a rarity these days,reasonable priced for what we got.The atmosphere was cosy and welcoming,despite only being able to aquire an early booking,so myself and my 3 friends ate solo.I can't wait to return!! (by Anita Browne) [2 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Wonderful bar with great atmosphere and food. Gavin the barman couldnt have been more friendly and helpful (by rory mcgrath) [2 months ago]

name: Bridge Inn Dungloe
address: Lower Main St, Dunglow, Dungloe, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 4 stars - Gastro-pub in Dungloe Main Street.  Dogs friendly. Visited with family twice last week. Food is good but bit pricey and long waiting time even if looks like not many people in. 17.95 for a beef burger. Taste good but size for that price should be bigger. Seafood pie very nice. Steak sandwich bit small. Good chips.
Need 20+ euro for a main with drink. (by eM Wu) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Stayed for a weekend and used the bridge as base to explore the area. The room we had was excellent and if you want to cook a basic meal you can. Bed was very comfortable, important when you are walking over 20km a day, and the shower was one of the best I have experienced. The bar is lively with music every night and the food was great. Parking directly outside at the rear and it‚Äôs wheelchair accessible. I can‚Äôt recommend the place enough. (by Dave) [a year ago] | Review 3: 4 stars - Good food in this pub. We were pleased by surprisingly original and very tasty dishes at a reasonable price. Service was friendly, polite yet cordial. The menu offered sufficient variation to make our choices difficult but we didn't regret any. Thanks!! (by Thijs) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Came for the Airbnb and it was absolutely perfect, and the bar was great too! Staff was incredibly friendly and helpful without being overbearing, felt very genuinely nice and lovely. Fantastically helpful to have such a late check in time, took so much pressure off of our day and really helped us enjoy our trip. Similarly really appreciate being able to pay in cash! Also the whole room and bathroom being accessible to people with mobility issues was amazing - being disabled myself means that I often struggle with rented accommodations but not here! The recommended breakfast spots were also so nice ‚ô•Ô∏è ‚ô•Ô∏è ‚ô•Ô∏è (by thisnightsrevels) [a month ago] | Review 5: 4 stars - Myself and my partner stayed here for three nights, likely will be back. Apartment rooms are fantastic. Plenty of amenities, very clean and had everything we needed. However, the internet was more or less unusable for the entire stay. This was the same throughout the establishment and not just our room. I‚Äôm not sure if this was just a situational thing or if this is always the case. We tried the resteraunt for one night and it was lovely. Quality of food was decent enough, and the prices weren‚Äôt bad either. However, our table was very sticky, one of the staff said it may need sanded. Great selection of food and veg options If that‚Äôs your thing. Staff were lovely the entire time, no complaints there. Checkout was easy and quick. Overall, 4 stars. Well done guys. (by Odhr√°n) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - So we picked this place because it‚Äôs dog friendly.

On arrival we went into the bar and was escorted to our studio by a very helpful member of staff.

We had studio 1 which was on the ground floor which was ideal for us.

Big spacious room with a double and single beds, a small kitchenette and a big bathroom. We were only staying for one night but it would be ideal if you were staying longer in the area.

In the evening we went across the road for food as the kitchen wasn‚Äôt serving but returned to the bar for the evening. Not very busy but busy enough for a week night.

The barman was polite and friendly and we had a nice evening.

Definitely a place we will stay in again. (by 6373nerd) [Edited 3 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Lovely food. Very friendly staff and we could bring our dog inside! Really enjoyed our meal. (by Marian Flynn) [2 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Just back home from here. Place is unreal, will definitely be back. Staff were amazing specially Keith and wee Ellie.. live music last night was amazing place was buzzing. Met the most loveliest people and their dog well known dog there our wee joker lol. If they see this hopefully get in contact.. thank use so much for an amazing stay felt so welcomed and beds were amazing lol (by Stacey Cassidy) [3 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - We where able to book the studio at an hour's notice for three nights, the accommodation was excellent, spotless and had all one needed. In the centre of the town, and our young Cockapoo was made more than welcome, even in the bar. Staff and locals absolutely friendly and the proprietor and his wife, made us feel relaxed and welcome. Highly recommend the bridge inn for atmosphere and if you want to explore the local scenery of Donegal. We will definitely be back. Betty Charlie and Mitzi. (by Charles Mcnally) [6 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Its great place to stay staff friendly live music weekends .only negative nowhere for a good breakfast .but it is self catering. (by Rob n claire daniels) [a month ago]

name: Cedars Restaurant
address: Lougheask Demesne, Lough Eske, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Ate at Cedars Restaurant as part of our stay at the majestic Lough Eske hotel in Donegal. Dinner was fabulous, service was great and the setting couldn‚Äôt be better. Very private and intimate.
Had the west coast crab (baby gems, compressed granny smith, avocado and green goddess puree, rye melba) for starter, the featherblade of Irish beef (pomme Anna, caramelised red onion, carrot gel) for my main and the rum baba (coconut sorbet, candied lime & mango) for dessert. Flavors were great, the beef was tender and cooked to perfection. (by Ben Nickel-D'Andrea) [5 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Excellent food and wonderful services dinner was quite loud, however breakfast was more relaxing. Choice of the love buffet, and you can still order off of the menu. (by Lena Antiskay) [4 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - One of the most perfectly cooked steak I have had, and everything served along with it was perfectly balanced. Have to say the assorted vegetables served as a side was just amazing!!Our starters and dessert as well were 5/5üëåüèº

Thank you chef! Everything tasted so good, as well as perfectly presented.

Even though the restaurant was busy, the service was on point . The only thing I would say is we wished the restaurant more cozy and intimate considering it‚Äôs a castle hotel but instead felt we were in an extended dinning hall. There were so many rooms within the castle that could be used for dining including the Father Browne bar which I think could be a restaurant instead of a bar, as most guests visit the upstairs bar anyways.

Overall like I said meal was the highlight and was fantasticü§åüèºüëåüèº (by Adweeth S) [a year ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - We ate dinner here one night of our stay at the hotel. The service was great - our waitress was Annie and she was lovely, so helpful. We had the wine pairings with our meal and she was great at explaining them briefly and serving them promptly.

I had the haddock kiev to start which was amazing, followed by hake which was good too. I'm not a dessert person but they were very good here - especially loved the tirami-choux. (by Janine M) [3 years ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Nice spacious restaurant, very polite staff, good choice of food which is very tasty .
On Sundays they have special courses both for adults and kids. The view is towards the hotel's park and it's great on a sunny day.
The only thing I didn't like too much is the back side of the restaurant where there isn't much sunlight coming from the windows due to a wooden library-kind of wall which separates it from the front side.
The car park is in less than a minute Walk from the entrance. They also have an entrance for disabled people. (by A.) [2 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - The most incredible service, excellent staff, amazing food. Beautiful atmosphere. Our large party had been traveling all day, got turned away from the pub, but inquired at Cedars and was immediately welcomed, and the highest quality service given to us even though we were not guests of the hotel and just passing through late in the evening. Did not make us feel uncomfortable, underdressed, or out of place ‚Ä¶ the staff went above and beyond to welcome us and make it a delightful experience! Outstanding food! And the best hospitality - thank you!! (by Lydia Smith) [4 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - First time eating in Cedars Fine Dining restaurant... New summer menu has alot of tasty options and I was so happy with my selection of scallops to start and pork fillet for main and rhubarb souffle to finish. Service was both professional and friendly. Attention to detail was up there with the best without being interfering. Food is rich and portions are well sized! Can't wait to return. Breakfast is also served here and it is of a high standard. Pastries are fresh and delicious. Coffee needs to be a little better, a flat white I ordered came with a large amount of foam, a quick barista course would help make it perfect! (by John Cahalin) [4 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - We had an incredible meal at Cedars, we were so well looked after by Adrian, James and the rest of the staff. Amazing food, great service and atmosphere in a beautiful location. Highly recommended! I'm vegan and I've attached a pic of the vegan menu - so great to have so many options to choose from! And I really recommend the vegan mushroom pappardelle, it was sooo delicious! (by Liz Manning) [2 years ago] | Review 9: 4 stars - I only came for a few drinks. The bar was great. Good atmosphere great service. The bar staff were efficient, polite and helpful. Good selection of drink to choose from. Lots of rooms just to sit in and relax by a fire. Very nice.
I'd like to come back again and maybe stay a night try the spa, meal etc. (by Manjinder Singh) [8 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Delicious! I recommend the monkfish. The chocolate desert is very good (very chocolatey so you must love chocolate). (by Lara Sandford) [5 years ago]

name: Blas
address: Lough Eske Rd, Mullans, Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 4 stars - Blas is an absolute gem in Donegal Town üåø ‚Äî a place where warm hospitality meets exceptional food. The setting is cosy yet stylish, with a lovely balance of modern touches and rustic charm that makes you want to linger.

The staff are genuinely welcoming and attentive. You can tell they care about both the food and the people they serve.

On my visit, I had the breaded chicken fillet burger üçî ‚Äî perfectly crispy on the outside, juicy and tender chicken fillet , served in a fresh bun with vibrant, well-seasoned chips and side salad. For dessert, I went for the marbled red velvet brownie üç´üç∞, which was rich, indulgent, and beautifully presented ‚Äî the kind of sweet treat you remember long after the last bite.

The relaxed atmosphere make Blas a must-visit. Whether you‚Äôre stopping in for breakfast, lunch, or just coffee and cake ‚òï, you‚Äôll leave feeling well-fed and well-looked-after.

Highly recommended for locals and visitors alike üåü.

I would recommend to pre book the slot for lunch or breakfast even on the weekdays as they are absolutely favorites for the locals.

It also has ample of parking and is wheelchair accessible as well (by ajay harmale) [3 weeks ago] | Review 2: 3 stars - Kind staff. Food doesn‚Äôt seem that fresh ü•π ; soup & fish were not really good ; smoothie was not home made neither. We didnt stay for the desserts so üò¨ü´£! But nice location and welcoming staff (by Tiffany Lmn) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - We had such a lovely breakfast here today! Donna was so welcoming and even gave us some recommendations for breakfast. The Blas platter is a great idea if you want to try out 2 dishes but aren‚Äôt sure which to get and can even have a mixture of savoury and sweet. ü•ûüç≥ (by Ciara Fl) [a month ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - We came in as a group of seven for breakfast, even though we weren‚Äôt hotel guests, and the staff warmly welcomed us and quickly found us a lovely table. Our waitress was incredibly attentive. Not only did she take our orders efficiently, but she also remembered that I had asked for soya milk in my drink and thoughtfully checked if I‚Äôd like my porridge made the same way (which I had completely forgotten to mention).

The food was outstanding, and everyone at the table left happy. Most of the portions (especially the porridge, Greek yoghurt, and pancakes) were very generous, while the avocado crush and pan boxty were more standard in size. I highly recommend the matcha latte and the porridge with fresh berries and honey, both were delicious! ü´∂üèªü´∂üèª (by Estrella) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 4 stars - Cute spot for brunch with nice menu options. Note that it only opens at 10am to the public. My friends couldn‚Äôt decide what to get so got the half savoury half sweet option which was a good compromise. There was a slight problem with my omelette, but when I notified the staff they fully nulled the cost of it. I will say I didn‚Äôt feel like we got the warmest welcome, but again once I mentioned the issue with my meal they were very apologetic which I appreciated. (by Abigail Sinclair) [9 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Lovely spot for breakfast. We stayed at the Gateway Lodge and had a fantastic set menu for great value at Blas. Yogurt, tea/coffee, juice, and a large selection of hot breakfasts to choose from.. The French toast really is fantastic!! Great service and so many wonderful Christmas decorations when we went. (by Jessica Hewitt) [9 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - We were here for breakfast, and it all tasted really good, the waitresses were really nice and seemed to really like what they do. (by David) [a month ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Delicious food! Great atmosphere! Friendly service! So glad we came! Had the warm goat cheese tartlet :was amazing! Even the little side salad was perfect and bread so fresh.  We sat in this  Bright light cozy area. (by MaryAnn Lawrence) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Fantastic experience! Highest food quality, great service and magical atmosphere. We enjoyed breakfast here during our stay at the Gateway Lodge, highly recommended! (by Armida Montini) [8 months ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - The coffee is average but the food is delicious! Pancakes and eggs Benedict were very tasty and full of flavour! It would be good if it was served with actual sourdough rather than cheap bread..

Food was well presented and good value. Recommend. Service is kind and welcoming (90%) (by Lauren and Scott) [2 years ago]

name: The Lobster Pot
address: Burtonport, Co. Donegal, F94 HD91, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Food was excellent. Chowder was rich with every spoon full of seafood. The wings were as good as they should be - crispy and covered in a buffalo sauce that had just the right amount of butter. The two mains we got was the rutland sizzler and one of the specials for the night which was the whole Sea bass with roast garlic butter. The steak was great but I have to say the sea bass topped with the roast garlic butter and a squeeze of lemon, tasted incredible. For dessert we got the apple pie which I highly recommend. (by Akram M) [3 weeks ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Fabulous place!! Food is amazing. Holly was the sweetest host. The crab claw and prawn col au vent was EPIC. Proper throw back to my childhood. The chowder was wonderful too, but the open prawn cocktail sandwich was to die for!!

Would HIGHLY recommend üíö (by Emma Hunter) [3 weeks ago] | Review 3: 4 stars - The main restaurant in Burtonpoint, as far as I could see. Fairly busy at all times. The food was lovely, so there were no complaints. The staff were nice and fairly prompt with service. The owner/manager (i assume) was full of chat to all guests and helpful with questions about the food and where it was sourced, etc. I had the spicy wings , which are fairly hot and filling ,with a side of chips. Other meals were the steak baguette, which was very nice ,crab claw and prawns vol au vonts , which im told was very nice. The last dish was Crab claws, which was devoured by my daughter. She said they were gorgeous. Maybe a touch was expensive for 6 small claws, but that's life. All the food was very well presented and very tasty. Overall, there are no complaints at all and very nice food. It was midday, so it was relatively quiet, but by all accounts, it can get very busy. (by Andy) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - We had a beautiful meal ( 6 Adults and 1 Child) on Saturday 2nd August. The Food was fantastic and we all had different main courses which was fab. Tim and Anne were great hosts and hopefully we will be back very soon. Thoroughly  recommend The Lobster Pot for anyone wanting seriously good food, service and at a reasonable price. (by John Boyle) [a month ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Lovely place with the nicest staff you could ever find.  We had to wait for a table and loved that the manager knew who was next without a note of it or anything.  Nice pub to go to and not eat too. (by Susie Maxwell) [a month ago] | Review 6: 3 stars - Stopped for a bite after a trip to Arran. It took forever to get a seat and the staff just seemed disinterested. The food we had was fine but just the whole atmosphere was not inviting. Maybe they were having an off day. (by Dave) [a year ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - An outstanding pub - brought here at the recommendation of a friend and what a great choice it was!  Excellent food, tip top service (including from the owner/manager who spent time at our table to make sure everything was great) - HIGHLY recommend this establishment! (by K C) [4 weeks ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - My partner and I had the prawn and crab claw voulavont and the buffalo wings which were really good. For mains we got the steak sandwich and the lobster and chips.
The steak sandwich was really good, the beef was really tender, the lobster was so good with the butter drizzled over. Chips were cooked really nicely too. The blonde waitress was very friendly and welcoming too. We will be back üòä (by Jen D) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Had an excellent meal here! Best fish and chips, properly crisp and flavorful. Service was genuine and kind, and the space was cozy. Highly recommend. (by Harmony Haley) [11 months ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - This establishment is truly remarkable! The culinary offerings are of exceptional quality, the staff members are exceptionally friendly and relaxed, and the overall ambiance is highly commendable. I highly recommend visiting this establishment if you have the opportunity. (by Pran Raj Mundadan) [Edited a year ago]

name: Danny Minnies Country House
reviews:
Review 1: None - Amazing service and food, we had a really good family dinner on our holidays there. The pre dinner drinks in the cozy lounge area by the fire was a lovely touch. We had a lovely table setup and the food arrived in time as we sat down and had our sip of wine. Excellent selection of breads to start with and definitely recommend the lamb, the scallops and the duck liver patte. Definitely recommend. (by krithika ram) | Review 2: None - We went for dinner tonight for the first time and what an experience!! The welcome,  the pre drink and then the food was just incredible.  There was not a bad meal on the table and the entire experience was so amazing!! We will definitely be back and would highly recommend (by Kevin Arenhold) | Review 3: None - I'm giving this a four stars..look the food overall is really great with a few minor niggles...there was an unevenness in portion sizes. I enjoyed a huge wonderfully cooked Turbot fillet ..but my dining pals dishes, though very tasty, were a bit mean sized.. especially the sea trout. While the veg accompaniments were plentiful and also overall tasty, the red cabbage offering was a colorful but bland tasting and added nothing other than a splash of color. The variant dauphinoise were yummy but the young spuds were a tad wet.

The service was welcoming and familiar at the outset as we enjoyed pre dinner drinks in a comfy lounge before dinner..after that the service slipped. We had at least four different people attend our table during the night..with some pros and a few cons...at the end of the evening it would have been nice if one of the staff would be assigned to ensuring a thanks and goodbye...it would be a welcome touch.. after all.. while we found the prices generally reasonable for the quality of food it was not a cheap night out. So overall I would come back for the food but there is a need to tweak and improve on some details , notably on the service front and then this place would truly shine.

I should add, the potentially kitsch faux castle interior somehow works and makes for a cozy and comfortable restaurant setting. Very nice. (by Colm Fahy) | Review 4: None - My partner and I recently had the pleasure of staying at Danny Minnies in Donegal, and I can't express enough how wonderful our experience was. The warmth and care we received made us feel like we were part of the family, which truly touched our hearts. The food was exceptional, and I wholeheartedly recommend making time for dinner there when you visit Donegal. I left with a newfound love for their delicious beetroot and ginger jam‚Äîit‚Äôs simply delightful! üòä (by Jonathan Robert Khan) | Review 5: None - A great few days in Donegal topped off with an evening meal in this fabulous restaurant, the menu was exceptional and the staff efficient but unobtrusive.  Lovely to experience a venue with distinctive decor and furnishings unlike the usual corporate decor of most restaurants.  Bhi siad ar ris (by Stay735750) | Review 6: None - Girlie Trips |Have a most enjoyable stay in Danny Minnies last weekend.  From the moment we checked in we were made welcome.  The rooms were all decorated with an  eclectic mix of antiques.  The beds were comfortable and lovely linens. ‚Ä¶ (by Tourist03578496170) | Review 7: None - Been dying to get here, and I wasn't disappointed.  Sheila and the whole team we're so welcoming.  From tea, scones and pancakes on arrival in front of the fire to a glorious room with a 4 poster bed.  The food was exceptional, can't wait to go back.

I'll be back üòâ (by Julieanne Tutor) | Review 8: None - Great experience, got a table after walking in not knowing what to expect and as we were just looking for food near our accommodation. We were greeted and seated in a lovely cosy area and then brought to a gorgeous dining room - top class ‚Ä¶ (by 246saoirsec) | Review 9: None - What an amazing experience! The service and atmosphere was brilliant and the food devine. I enjoyed every aspect of the evening, when you arrive you‚Äôre seated in the bar and offered a drink and canap√© while choosing your dinner, a nice touch to start the meal. Can‚Äôt wait to go back (by Meadhbh) | Review 10: None - Beautiful ambience lots of atmosphere, food amazing. Recommended the wild Atlantic turbot.  It was so good we had, goat cheese, crab, and homemade pate as our starters and our main courses Belly of Pork and scallop, Seabass, sirloin steak ‚Ä¶ (by Bjorn00)

name: Simpsons Bar & Restaurant / Oliver‚Äôs restaurant
address: Tul Na R√≠, Tullanree, Tulnaree, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Popular with the locals. We enjoyed two meals here. We would go back despite a disappointment on Sunday.  We tried to make it for the Sunday roast on 6/8/25, we got there about 3:20, and were seated at a table at 3:35 PM. The roast ends at 3:30 PM sharp!!!  NO wiggle room at all. You would think you were in Germany not Ireland! There was no Yorkshire pudding to serve to us even though we ordered the roast beef dinner at 3:35PM and paid the regular price. The Yorkshire pudding is only available before 3:30! Otherwise, the food was good, we just can‚Äôt say anything about the Yorkshire pudding since we weren‚Äôt able to have it!! (by M M) [3 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Great, central location with a fabulous lunchtime menu. We had a hearty beef stew on a lovely sunny day passing through Carndonagh on our üö≤ üö¥‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è üöµ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è.  Liam and all his team looked after our large group wonderfully and we look forward to returning! Great spot. (by Joe Hennessy) [3 weeks ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - During our recent trip to Inishowen, my family and I had the pleasure of dining at Simpson‚Äôs Bar and Restaurant, a well-known and highly recommended spot in the area. With a history dating back to 1911 and a charming collection of antique showpieces, the restaurant offers a cozy and inviting atmosphere. Despite being a busy place, the service was impressively quick and efficient.

The food lived up to its great reputation. We started with Taco Chicken Tenders, which were incredibly crispy and fresh. For the mains, I had the Crispy Italian Chicken, which was packed with flavor‚Äîthe roasted pepper and tomato sauce added a delicious kick to every bite. The portion sizes were generous, making the meal even more satisfying.

The kids‚Äô menu was also impressive, both in portion size and taste. I was pleasantly surprised by the chicken curry with rice, which had the perfect blend of spices‚Äîso good that I couldn‚Äôt resist trying it myself!

To top it all off, we indulged in the cheesecake for dessert, which was absolutely delightful and made our experience even better.

Overall, Simpson‚Äôs Bar and Restaurant exceeded our expectations and truly lived up to the praise we had heard from the locals. We left with full stomachs and happy hearts, knowing we had made a great choice. If you‚Äôre ever in the area, this place is definitely worth a visit! (by Raoul Anthony) [6 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - The squid Starter was excellent. Very fresh and tasty.  A little spicy kick with the jalape√±o sauce but not too spicy. It was a perfect combination of flavors and not too heavy of a meal. I ordered this as my lunch. My daughter had the kids battered cod and chips and also very fresh. The batter was excellent. Very generous portions on the kids meal. We also had the Irish breakfast here and it was excellent. I highly recommend this place for great food, great service and a very cozy spot. (by Alzira Escobar-Pruitt) [9 months ago] | Review 5: 4 stars - A really lively meal, good sizportions too.
The Sirlion on hot skillet with stir-fried vegetables delicious.
Goats cheese and chicken and pesto was a strange combination, especially with BBQ sauce over it! (by Stuart Roberts) [3 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - I cannot stress how much of a good time the wife and I had here. Host saw that I was a bit out of place and stepped into make sure we had a drink and a table was prepared. The bartender made sure to give us great recommendations for food and drink and kept the libations coming at the perfect pace. Food was outstanding! Local beef was delicious and prepared to the requested temperature. Highly recommend! (by Phillip Ellis) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - After two weeks in Co. Donegal this was by far the best food we have had all holiday. It is never easy catering for a vegetarian a carnivore and a pescatarian at any restaurant but it was no problem here and each noted how outstanding the food was. This is a first in over 25 years of travelling together. That says a lot (by Dick Moriarty) [2 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Great place, super friendly staff, and amazing service. Super nice people, even with the mess of 100 people reaching out at same time with bikes. Great parking space for big crowds and spacious place to fit everybody.
Thanks very much for feeding us during our charity cycle supporting LauraLynn!! (by David Cristobal) [3 weeks ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - An absolute outstanding place, staff outstanding, food outstanding.  Stayed in Mamore gap, found  this place  30 minutes away,  went back 2 nights in a row, sat outside on our last day for 20 minutes  before it opened,  in the rain for breakfast . Everytime well worth it. Will I be back. Hell yes for the Roast of the day. Thank you to the amazing friendly staff for making our visit fun. 5üí• (by david claney) [2 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Amazing food, great selection on the menu and very friendly staff. Best meal we have had in a  long time. (by CatQ) [2 months ago]

name: Laurentic Bar
address: Dunree, Linsfort, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - We stayed in the Motorhome pitches  in August 2025. I highly recommend this stopover. Nice local pub the owner gave us a lot Of tips on where to visit - What a legend! (by Hugo Vitorino Trevizan) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - We stayed in the Motorhome pitches overnight in June 2025. The pub is on the Wild Atlantic Way track. Great stopover, nice local pub with friendly helpful staff. The pitches are concrete pads that are flat and level, with electric and water at each pitch. There is grass on the side with a picnic bench. Nice countryside view. We paid 20Euros for overnight pitch and electric.
Restaurant currently not open. (by Christine Martel) [3 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - A wonderful atmosphere and brilliant staff. No wonder Michael Duffy has won Barman of the Year twice. My first visit, but very impressed. (by Marcas O Murchu) [Edited 4 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - A great pint, great atmosphere, it also didn't hurt the pocket! Will definitely visit again at some point in the future! (by Ronan Sheehan) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Great bar with good quality beers.  We visited during a recent trip home to donegal.  Decor in the bar area was very interesting and cozy. (by Stephen Mc Laughlin) [2 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Lovely friendly bar hopefully restaurant will reopen soon definitely will be back
Lovely location and great for motorhome stopover
Stephen very friendly and accommodating owner wishing him all the success with his new venture üëç (by Ann Mcginty) [2 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Everyone is friendly, place is very clean and tidy. Bars to hold parties, meetings, what ever your need Nicola and Stephen will do all they can for you (by Carol Ann Morgan) [2 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Place was really busy. A bit disappointed to be put upstairs in a function room alone to eat our meal as there were no tables downstairs. The food however was fantastic and lovely staff (by S G) [6 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Excellent pub. Lovely staff great drink selection and new food menu for eat in and take away. Give it a go. You won't be disappointed üòÅ ‚Ä¶ (by Sally Davis) [7 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Beautiful place, welcoming staff and gorgeous food. We'll worth a visit. Put it on the 'Bucket List' (by Rena Donaghey) [5 years ago]

name: The Harbour Restaurant & Bar
address: Quay St, Donegal, F94 R660, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - There was a place across the street at the time that had way better food, service, atmosphere & decor. Dom's Pier 1! Hopefully it reopens!
This place was decent, I found it less in comparison but still a good meal. Its flashy on the outside so I guess that attracts people.
The meal at Doms had way better value for the money though & the man serving us seemed to actually care, which is rather hard to find in Irish restaurants! (by A J (Lexi)) [3 weeks ago] | Review 2: 3 stars - I ordered the veggie wok-fried stir-fry and really enjoyed it, fresh vegetables with a nice balance of flavour without feeling too heavy. My meat-eating friends, however, found their dishes a bit much. The seafood chowder and fish in white wine sauce were both quite rich, and the shepherd‚Äôs pie was also on the heavier side. If you‚Äôre looking for something lighter, I‚Äôd definitely recommend the stir-fry. Waiter was nice! (by Estrella) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - We had a large party of 7, and the seating was comfortable, the service was quick and super friendly, the drinks were delicious (cocktails, beers, and wine), and the food was solid. The lamb stew was a stand-out. Also treated ourselves to the profiteroles for dessert - perfect end to the night. (by Lesley Schmidt) [4 months ago] | Review 4: 4 stars - The muscles and soda bread was very good. The steak and peppercorn gravy was delicious. The fish/cod stew with muscles was delightful. The parking was about a block away. The place was packed but we did not have a problem getting in. The drinks were also very good and bartender made a wonderful old fashioned. It was a bit loud with all the tourists but still a great place to dine. (by Darren Curtis) [6 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Was visiting the area and went here for Sunday lunch. Food was really tasty, I had the turkey and ham roast which was great. They also had vegan options which was useful for a couple in our group.
Service was great, both waiters were extremely attentive and helpful.
Reasonably priced and good portion sizes.
Would definitely recommend if you‚Äôre visiting Donegal. (by Rob Harrington) [6 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - We came here for dinner and had an awesome experience. Wonderful food, friendly staff, prompt service, and an inviting atmosphere!! (by Veronica Smith) [4 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - I ate seafood chowder. It tastes very delicious üòã
My friends ate hamburger and roasted beef. They said it‚Äôs good üëçüèº. Atmosphere and service are wonderful. I highly recommend this place (by Beray (berayfashion)) [4 weeks ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Excellent!! We went in "not very hungry" and had 4 starters between the two of us (no main courses). They were all outstanding and we left VERY full. We had deep fried mushrooms; chicken wings; prawns; and seafood chowder. All were so yummy!! We also had the profiteroles for a shared dessert. We didn't actually NEED it, except that you ALWAYS need dessert... Right??? The only disappointment was that they didn't have any oysters on the menu. Other than that - no complaints!! Would recommend! We did NOT have a reservation and walked right in at 6:30 on a Tuesday, but it's not high season yet, either. I recommend booking a table. (by Margaret Rayner) [3 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Had a really great meal at the Harbour bar & Restaurant. The portions were big so we only had mains but both things were excellent. The menu has clear allergen guides. Staff were friendly & welcoming and got us seated quickly on drop in without booking. (by Susan Kinloch) [a month ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Top notch food and great ambiance right in the center of Donegal. Ordered the seafood pie since I've never seen it before, and it was terrific. The onion rings and fish and chips were excellent as well, as the breading was perfect. Pizza looked like it was worth a try, too. (by Sam Lovejoy) [a year ago]

name: Old Stone
address: unit 2/3 donegal carpark, Donegal, F94 T3PR, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Awesome cafe with great vegetarian options to choose from. Tried the veggie burger and the quinoa salad. Both were amazing. Lots of good options for kids to choose from. Mine tried the waffles and was happy with it mostly due to the maple syrup that came with it. Service is quick and the servers are all smiling which makes you feel welcomed. Finally, seemed like a busy place. We were there at 1pm Saturday and still it was full. We did get the table in a few minutes though. (by Ruchika Kakani) [3 months ago] | Review 2: 2 stars - Kind of disappointed. If the food would have been better, could have overlooked the service. Had the incorrect menu (brunch) for 10 minutes before we were finally able to get the correct one, and it wasn't because they were busy. They handed us the incorrect ones when we arrived. Food was presented nicely, but my "smash burger" was not a smash burger. It was a thick, overworked, dense beef patty that was cooked on one side and not flipped. It reminded me of the airport food. Service was 'meh' as well. Came here because of the reviews. (by Ben Taff) [2 weeks ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Enjoyed a lovely breakfast here in Donegal Town in a cosy cafe. We ordered poached egg with avocado and two small old stone breakfasts. Black pudding stood out with a spicy clove flavour to it. Great start to your day! (by Will Wong) [4 weeks ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - My family and I passed through Donegal and decided on this establishment based on the menu selections (proper coffee selections). It's a cute cafe with a great atmosphere located near a car park.

The food was amazing. My husband had the Pecan Belgium Waffle and loved it. It was sweet, but not too sweet. The bacon is more like ham, so if you're from America we want you to have proper expectations. My son had the Vegetable Soup, which he's tried at every restaurant we've stopped along the way. It had a sweet, fresh flavor with little bits of carrots in it. My daughter had the Old Stone Burrito which came with a side if potatoes she absolutely loved. The burrito was done well and paired with a sauce on the side. I had the Cinnamon French Toast. I was thrilled to see it came with proper berry compote. We've had compote at other places in Ireland and it was like canned pie filling. This tasted as if it was just made with my meal. It tasted very good and was light and fluffy. Must be the Irish milk that made the difference. Overall, we would eat here again.

The dirty Chai came as expected in a nice sized cup and truly hit the spot. My daughter had an iced caramel latte and didn't care much for that. I didn't mind it but wouldn't order it again.

The only thing lacking was service. We had to get up from the table to order food, to get more water and for to-go containers. No one came by after dropping food off to see how our meal was. (by Bridgette Stine) [a year ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Very cosy place with delicious food. I got the porridge and it was perfect! More on the priced side maybe, but you get what you pay for, which is tasty quality. Will be going back to try the waffles and pancakes for sure ü´†
Music was great too üëåüèª (by Adam Cunningham) [6 months ago] | Review 6: 3 stars - Ordered 3 coffees while passing through and unfortunately it seems the oat flat white was burned and found a hair on the plate. Also pretty cold inside the cafe, which was unfortunate as it was another rainy day in Ireland (shocker). Otherwise, staff was very nice and looked like a nice assortment of baked goods to choose from (by Abigail Sinclair) [9 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Loved it. Such a cosy place with great breakfast food. My partner got the full Irish and I went for the porridge. Both were so good! We also tried their cheesecake. Delicious!! Highly recommend this place. (by Alexandra Pigulewska) [6 months ago] | Review 8: 3 stars - Okayish place for brunch. I liked Scrambled Egg and Egg Benedict. I was expecting hashbrown in Irish breakfast. Pancakes were a bit hard and not fluffy. (by Rucha Ambilpure) [8 months ago] | Review 9: 1 star - Was very disappointed on Saturday the 6th of September around 10:30am, anytime I‚Äôve been here before the food was very good. The morning in discussion the service was so disappointing, I walked in with two others, there was three young staff members together behind the counter. We waited a few minutes, understandably as it was busy but when a waitress came over she was not in any way friendly or welcoming, pointing us down to our table instead of walking us to the table. We then waited longer than expected to get menus or an offer of giving a drink order while we waited. Eventually a different member of staff put a bunch of menus on the table without saying a word, we didn‚Äôt even have a chance to order a coffee or any drink while deciding what to order. We continued to wait 15 minutes if not more to order even a coffee nevermind food. Unfortunately we had to get up and leave, the staff I mentioned at first didn‚Äôt seem to even notice and were again together behind the counter talking. I say I was disappointed as I‚Äôve been here before and never encountered service like this. The food quality is great hence the visit just feel the staff really let it down on this occasion. (by kayleen Love) [3 weeks ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Oh, we wandered through Donegal town so fair,
With the cold Atlantic winds in the air.
A quick Google search led us right,
To Old Stone‚Äôs glow, a cozy delight.

The staff were warm, the cafe aglow,
Shielding us from the winds that blow.
An apple pie and a flat white grand,
To warm the heart and still the hand.

Just a night in Donegal we stay,
On our way to Galway Bay.
But Old Stone‚Äôs charm will linger long,
In this quaint Irish town, I wrote this  filling apple pie song!! (by Patrick Baker) [a year ago]

name: The Harbour Inn
reviews:
Review 1: None - An excellent evening meal. We were told when we arrived that they were very busy and we might have nit if a wait - but not too long and the food was excellent particularly the baked cod. The staff were exceptionally friendly and efficient. A great evening (by Peter Press) | Review 2: None - Went for Sunday lunch and could not fault it. Selection isn‚Äôt huge but it had all the traditional favourites- turkey and ham, roast beef etc. Manager was excellent and organised a table switch for us without fuss. Food was very tasty and value could not be beaten. (by U7557JJsuzanner) | Review 3: None - Just went in for food. Staff very pleasant and order taken quickly. Very popular place going by the amount of people who came in after we were seated. Food excellent and well priced. Worth a visit (by Mark Magee) | Review 4: None - Just back from my second stay at this hotel fantastic stay very spacious rooms very clean |Food in bar brilliant. Highly recommend this hotel staff friendly |Just across road great walk along the beach it took us 30 mins to walk into town ‚Ä¶ (by 43ballycastle) | Review 5: None - Good sized rooms, a little dated. Very comfortable beds. Bathroom could've been cleaner. Shower barely warm, called reception and was told they would check it and call back, but they didn't, very disappointing.
Had a delicious meal in the restaurant, lovely staff there. (by Vicki Page) | Review 6: None - Sorry to harbour inn we were really looking forward to our meal this evening. Our main order either got messed up or not put into the computer right. We waited at least 30 minutes from starter to main. No apology from staff. They came to double check our order after 20 minutes or so from when we got starters. The plates were not hot. The cod was middling temperature and the "roast potatoes" were clearly boiled and sitting around in some heating pot but they were not roasted. It was a pity because it was good quality fish. The salmon dish was fine. Overall disappointed in lack of apology and acknowledgement of the long wait time.

Thanks
Amy (by Amy Clarke) | Review 7: None - Fab meal. Couldnt fault it.Even with a busy night with the Rally! Starter Mussels Soo good. Just need to work on the Air conditioning. Very uncomfortable to sit through the evening . The poor staff had to work in that heat all evening. Come on the Harbour, sort the Air conditioning. No excuses. (by Voyager04361067910) | Review 8: None - The Harbour Inn is a lovely spot for couples looking to spend a night or two and use it as a base to explore the area by car. There are plenty of terrific places to discover within just 1‚Äì2 hours' drive, making it ideal for short trips. The breakfast is tasty and satisfying, the staff are friendly and welcoming, and the rooms are comfortable, clean, and well-kept. Overall, it‚Äôs a great place to relax after a day of adventure. Highly recommended for a cosy and convenient stay. (by Denis V) | Review 9: None - Everything about the Harbour Inn was OK.  Check in was without undue delay and efficient. The rooms seem to have had a recent refurbishment, clean, reasonably comfortable. The shower had a good strong power-shower pressure. We ate in the restaurant/bar (more restaurant than bar) on the first night of three,  it was OK but we didn't feel like going back. Breakfast ok, but awful coffee. Plenty of free parking,  great location,  quiet,  warm rooms. I've stayed in worse (by Gerard Clinton) | Review 10: None - Lovely quiet location, fast check in and nice, spacious airy room.
Comfortable beds and very clean.
Breakfast was fresh with a nice selection.
Staff lovely throughout.
Would definitely stay again. (by Lana)

name: Castle Grove Country House Hotel
reviews:
Review 1: None - Castlegrove is a delightful place to stay.  Very clean, comfortable and sitting in front of the drawing room log fire with a G&T is just heaven.  The meals were excellent and were only surpassed by the attentive but not intrusive staff.   I ‚Ä¶ (by Dilly61) | Review 2: None - Castle Grove Country House is my favourite Irish country home sitting on the shores of Lough Swilly in Co Donegal. You arrive a stranger and leave as a friend. The warmth of the welcome is unrivalled; the beauty of this historical home to the Sweeney family is captivating and I love to call it my home away from home. Eat here, drink here and sleep here while you experience Donegal - my favourite destination in the world. (by Eleanor McGillie) | Review 3: None - Stayed here last night and it was exceptional.
The service was top notch nothing was a bother, food and drinks even better.
Lovely relaxing atmosphere with old style decor.
The rooms are beautiful and the grounds even nicer. We cannot wait to return.
Thanks Caroline for a night we will remember. (by Deirdre Caldwell) | Review 4: None - From the moment we arrived, it was clear that this house wasn‚Äôt just a venue‚Äîit was the setting of a real-life fairy tale. Every detail, from the house to the impeccable service, made our wedding weekend truly magical.||||The staff went ‚Ä¶ (by 707dearbhlad) | Review 5: None - A friend of ours organized a trip to the Donegal area and booked us at the Castle  Grove, boy did we win the lottery! From the moment Caroline met us to the time we left our expectations were exceeded. Our room was very quiet, large with ‚Ä¶ (by 153pauln) | Review 6: None - Magical Weekend in Donegal

We had the most wonderful weekend break in a stunning Castlegrove  house nestled in the heart of Donegal. From the moment we arrived, we were welcomed with genuine warmth and hospitality that made the whole experience feel so special. The house itself is full of charm and character‚Äîelegant yet homely, with beautifully preserved period features and a tranquil atmosphere that instantly puts you at ease.

The food was absolutely outstanding‚Äîfresh, seasonal, and full of flavour. Every meal felt thoughtfully prepared and expertly cooked, with great attention to detail and presentation. The service throughout was faultless: attentive, friendly, and personal without ever being overbearing.

There‚Äôs something truly special about this place‚Äîit manages to feel both luxurious and comfortingly familiar. A real gem in Donegal, and one we‚Äôll definitely be returning to! (by Maeve O'Toole) | Review 7: None - What a wonderful magical experience. We were greeted at door by the lovely Irene who made us feel so welcome from time of our arrival. Our room oozed charm and elegance. The bed and linen were luxurious , our view spectacular. We ate in ‚Ä¶ (by Trek35744967538) | Review 8: None - A Fairytale Wedding at Castle Grove ‚Äì Simply Unforgettable!||||We had the absolute pleasure of attending Thomas & Dearbhla‚Äôs wedding on April 11th, 2025, and it‚Äôs safe to say ‚Äì it was nothing short of magical.||||From the moment we arrived ‚Ä¶ (by Nancysbarn1) | Review 9: None - Absolutely wonderful find we stumbled across on a day out. Not too far from Letterkenny and we wanted to try somewhere new. The staff were delightful, courtesy and kind. The food was amazing. Would highly recommend. (by Ciara Duffy) | Review 10: None - It‚Äôs like coming home, always a very warm welcome and beautiful decor with the most comfortable rooms.|Great food and wonderful value for money. (by charlesmB1019EE)

name: Chapmans Restaurant
address: The Central Hotel, The Diamond, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Firstly service was brilliant üëè most friendliest staff I ever encountered at a restaurant. Food was delicious and not over priced. Would highly recommend (by BARRY MCCABE) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Just Had dinner here. Ivan the waiter was absolutely fantastic. Entertaining and attentive. The food was 1st class. (by joanne ryman) [4 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - the burger i got was enormous, price was ok, and service was friendly and efficient (by jhoni) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Great food , great service, great staff. Thanks from Mark and Connect the Dots Tours of Ireland (by mark doherty) [5 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - The service was outstanding.
The waiter had a lot of humor and was very polite. It's a shame we're only here for a day.
I had the fish tacos and my husband had the chicken burger.
We were satisfied and happy.
The beer and wine recommendation was also a hit. (by Sabine ‚ÄúBine‚Äù G.) [5 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - A very nice restaurant. The food was very good and very tasty and the highlight was the waiter was very friendly and very funny. Especially when he noticed that we didn't speak English very well, at least I tried to speak slowly. Completely satisfied and would come again at any time. (by Dimitri Semin) [5 months ago]

name: Ripples Restaurant
address: Ranny, Kerrykeel, Co. Donegal, F92 VX00, Ireland
service_options: Tasty Bite Takeaway ¬∑ 4.5 stars ¬∑ 52 reviews ¬∑ Fast Food
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Lovely view with beautiful food. Highly recommend the mussels.
Good portions with a variety of choices on the menu. (by Paul G) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Amazing experience here today ! Great seafood menu.
Seen the lobster Thermidor for below ‚Ç¨40 and thought it had to be frozen, asked our wonderful host and she assured me her husband is the chef and only uses fresh local seafood.
What‚Äôs followed was nothing short of the best lobster I have ever eaten, so tender, full of flavour and even the meat in the claws has been deshelled.
I can‚Äôt wait to sample the rest of your menu, well worth the drive from Inishowen to visit. (by Jeremiah) [a month ago] | Review 3: 4 stars - Lovely, homely restaurant.
We enjoyed the chicken burger and the duck. (by LƒÅsma Kaƒ£e) [a week ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Lovely spot, right on the waters edge. We were there shortly after opening, so place was very quiet, and it was bucketing down, which was a bit of a bummer, but the food was lovely, I had seabass and my wife had scallops. Owner was a lovely lady, hope you had a lovely wedding anniversary break! We've recommended the place to others who were on the same campsite as us, well done. (by Martin Walsh) [a month ago] | Review 5: 1 star - Did not find manager very friendly, but staff were fine. Plenty of outside tables but even with warm sunny weather not available for use. My daughter got food poisoning from muscle in pasta dish has been very ill for 3 days. No apology just denial, but did not charge for that dish. Some of the food over cooked, some food good but could have been so much better. The location lovely. Felt like I had gone back 30 years to how things use to be rather than in the 21 century as so many other places we visited. (by Michael Lynch) [a month ago] | Review 6: 2 stars - Absolutely lovely setting with great views over broad water. I was forewarned that food could be hit or miss. Unfortunately they must have been having an off day when I visited. Service was slow. Food was subpar. Good parking and easily accessible. (by John Doe) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 4 stars - Nice food and rather busy which is good to see. The mussels were excellent. The Cajun chicken had a little too much cream for my liking but was still good. (by richard gil) [4 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Great restaurant with the best mussels in garlic sauce in the whole area! Beautiful terrace surrounded by glass, with a gorgeous view on the bay just beneath it.
Highly recommended place to stop and enjoy. If you drink beer, have a pint of Guinness with the mussels! Cheers! (by A.) [Edited 6 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Fantastic food, beautiful view, service was great. Highly recommend this restaurant. (by Marie Gillman) [3 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Great spot with delicious food. Dessie and Louise are brilliant hosts. Had the steak overlooking Mulroy Bay. Would highly recommend, can't wait to return (by Simon Doherty) [5 months ago]

name: Maddens Bridge Bar & Restaurant
address: Main St, Magheracar, Bundoran, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 1 star - I have already seen your concern for the guests, and the politeness of one of the team members too.... Even now your reputation does not allow you to apologize for the bad mood that lasted until the end of the day. And it would be better to value the friendly atmosphere and not create a restricted area where ordinary people, who even come for the first time and do not know the reservation, are forced to run around the terraces just to relax and drink delicious beer. Which I will tell you is excellent! Perhaps someday you will find a place not for protocol, but for human hospitality. (by Roman Drobot) [Edited a month ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - Popped in early in the day for lunch. We ordered mussels & the short rib. The food was absolutely excellent, highly recommend.
Beef was definitely expensive but it was so good that it didn't take away from the experience.
Service was lovely too. Would definitely go back for a nighttime meal and drinks after. (by Evan Balfe) [3 weeks ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - We stayed in Madden on 15/8/2025 and had a great time, the room was comfortable, clean and well equipped. The staff are first class the bar was busy with live music playing but no problem getting a drink thanks to the professional crew behind the bar. Next morning the breakfast was excellent with a great choice I would have no problem recommending Madden's for an over night stay it's in a great location with a sea view with good car parking. (by John) [a month ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Beautiful food. Lovely staff. Great view (by Helena Rogers) [a month ago] | Review 5: 3 stars - Our experience wasn't that great. The restaurant was quite expensive ‚Äì for example, a portion of fish and chips cost almost 25 euros, which felt too high.

The service wasn't very good either. The waiter gave us just a small piece of bread and didn't bring us more when we asked. That‚Äôs pretty stingy.

The only good part of our meal was the steak, which was tasty. But apart from that, our experience was not very enjoyable, and the value for money isn‚Äôt great. (by Andrea Angiolillo) [a year ago] | Review 6: 3 stars - The one vegan option was truly delicious, but insanely overpriced as is everything at this place. You're basically paying for the staff that are incredibly kind but it's easy to clock that they only treat everyone that way to keep people coming back, otherwise the prices would be simply unjustifiable, and already are... If you want to leave satisfied, you'll be spending a minimum of ‚Ç¨30 per person. (by Zylen X-H) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - We stumbled upon this place a way back in the noughties before we all had this powerful realtime phone food critic in our pockets but we never forgot the food, service and atmosphere which were exceptional even back then. Returning almost 20 years later we're delighted to be that real-time food critic and report it has improved exponentially! The food was thoughtfully prepared, fresh, interesting and delicious. Even the children's meal was prepared to the highest standards, the service was warm and accommodating and the interior renovations make this a truly beautiful space to share a meal. We will not be waiting 20 years to come back the next time! Many thanks... (by Conrad Wallace) [5 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Came across this lovely pub when visiting Bundoran. Food was excellent, staff were all very friendly and helpful. Will definitely be back when in Bundoran again. (by Nathan Doyle) [a week ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - It was a very good experience, from the attention from the entire staff, especially the young lady, to the delicious food. I tried the salmon with pistachios, which was very good, as well as the mussels, which were delicious; I loved them. Finally, the dessert was very good, but I was already full. Very good work, 100% recommended. I will return. (by Miguel Navarro) [3 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - We stopped for a late lunch and enjoyed the delicious onion and sage soup of the day which reminded me of a French onion soup. My husband had the very fresh oysters. Great meal and friendly service. (by Stephanie Corcoran) [3 months ago]

name: Blazers
address: The Central Hotel, The Diamond, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 4 stars - Went in for dinner during a trip. The burger and garlic fries were amazing. The chicken burger was a bit dry and flavourless, and the soda bottle was the smallest I've ever seen (like 200ml maybe?). The service was great though, so overall a nice experience üòä (by Amanda Karlsson) [2 years ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Turkey and Ham with Stuffing Par Excellence.

I popped into Blazers today and decided on the Turkey and Ham for lunch. The turkey stuffing was completely off the scales and exceeding normal standards. The red wine gravy was magnificent. Everything about the meal was very refreshing.
The restaurant manager Krzysztof is a real professional and goes above and beyond what is expected to make your visit memorable. The executive chef Joko is the real deal in the kitchen.

Well done. I'll be Back.

Kevin Lynch
Old Road
Tuam
Co Galway (by kevin lynch) [a year ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Well done fresh food. All chicken is halal.

Soup, stir fry are really good (by Andr√©s Bidegain) [a year ago] | Review 4: 1 star - My family had lunch at your restaurant Blaze this afternoon.
It was NOT a memorable experience. We could not order a whiskey sourbecause there was no bartender until 3pm,however others in our party were able to get a beer & Jameson & coke. Why was that?
The fish & chips were obviously from frozen & horrible as were the burgers.  I did ask the waitress if the fish was frozen, her response was "good question, I don't like fish " & dismissed us altogether.
Sorry to say I will not be recommending this place to anyone. (by Noreen Angelone) [2 years ago] | Review 5: 4 stars - Called in for a main course dinner, two people. Bistro style. Small queue, moved quickly. Lovely, cosy seat with plenty of space.  Simple order of fish & chips plus burger & sweet potato fries. Both excellent. Including tea & coffee - ‚Ç¨32. Well worth a visit. (by John O'Flaherty) [3 years ago] | Review 6: 1 star - Don't go here if you have somewhere to be. 45 minutes to get lunch except for a USA group that got theirs in 10 minutes when they walked in after other people. The food tasted lovely but several patrons walked out after a couple of mouthfuls to get back on their bus. Must do better or tell us it will be a long wait. (by Sandra Austin) [2 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Excellent and prompt service.  Christoph was great.  I stopped in for tea and coffee with my sister and her husband (by Connell Couchman) [8 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Food was totally worth it, Chicken was halal which was a pleasant surprise to know. Really good service. Will definitely come back (by shah bakhat) [2 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Fantastic food, a real hidden gem. Very friendly staff made us feel very welcome.  The chowder is a must have üëçüèª. Thanks Shaunaüòâ. ‚Ä¶ (by Robert Walsh) [3 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - The Food was very delicious and the Service very friendly. We ate two days here and love it! (by Hanna Thelen) [2 years ago]

name: Ocean View Bar and Restaurant
address: Magherabeg, Downings, Co. Donegal, F92 A991, Ireland
reviews: Review 1: 5 stars - Had a beautiful meal tonight in ocean view it was amazing. Same last Sunday the Turkey and ham was beautiful. Highly recommend ocean view for a great meal. Good to see Sean behind the bar. Great service (by kieran mc cauley) [3 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Food is amazing with a lovely,  relaxing atmosphere. Food is made fresh so it takes a little longer but it is worth the extra few minutes. The owners Ale and Barry are very easy to deal. Keep up the great work. (by Seamus Connor) [5 years ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Great food, busy atmosphere but great if you have children. Great drinks also! We were served free garlic bread due to a (little) wait. Nice staff (by Joshua ‚ÄúJJ‚Äù Whelan) [4 years ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Catered for a group of 20  of us . From the setting to the view the food and the service was all top class . Our younger group enjoyed the cocktails . Can‚Äôt wait to get back . Great experience thank you Barry and all his staff . (by Maureen McEleney) [3 years ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Food was great. Staff were all lovely. Can't ask for more than that. Definitely recommend it. (by Rosemary Purdy) [4 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - A wonderful place.food and staff so nice.service very efficient and a great pint. (by PJ Corkery) [3 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Great children friendly place for a family meal with great staff. Very accommodating. (by Greg Hughes) [2 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - 16 of us sat in and the service was top class. The T bone steaks were huge (by Peter Doherty) [2 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Had an amazing family reunion here.  The food and service were spot on! Xxx (by Leanne McNamara) [3 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Great food and setting. Very friendly hosts. Great place all round. (by Thomas Mc menamin) [3 years ago]

name: Tank and Skinny's
address: Main St, Muff, Co. Donegal, F93 XC9H, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Tank & Skinny's is a restaurant chain from Donegal specialising in breakfast and lunch. I visited the Muff branch and was really impressed with the branding, interior and the menu.
There are a number of vegan options but I tried the Vegan breakfast which was delicious. The portion was amazing and the prices reasonable, it was very busy and I can see why! I would definitely advise trying it out and I would love to them spread further in NI, I think they would do fantasticly in Belfast! Overall very good experience will definitely be back üòä (by Tiarn√°n Byrne) [3 weeks ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Having been a regular customer for years, this place has worked out the kinks to provide great service.
The coffee tastes great and the food follows suit.
Prices are reasonable for the quality of food and service (see in photos).
A regular favourite is the breakfast burrito and a new favourite (pictured) is Hungers Mother with a delicious sweet chilli cheese mayo.
Be prepared to wait for a seat as people regularly flock here for a nice time to spend with family and friends. (by Laura Doherty) [a year ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Visited twice on our four day trip to Muff. Incredible food, reasonable prices and friendly service. Would 100% recommend. (by Leah Ellingham) [4 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Absolutely amazing food and service for a busy Sunday afternoon. 8 of us landed hoping for 2 tables, but they knocked it out of the park being able to seat us all at the same table. I was doubly impressed by the vegan options and the thought given to making sure side salads etc were also vegan ü•∞ the salt n chilli wrap n Ultimate Vegan chips were amazing! Will have to be back üíï (by Clare Gallagher) [10 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - First timers and holiday makers here. We came to the village to stock up on outdoor gear in Borderland. We headed in here for refreshments after. I ordered the Tandoori chicken wrap with crisps or salad for ‚Ç¨9.90 and a Strawberry milkshake at ‚Ç¨3.90. Both thoroughly enjoyed. My husband opted for Bang bang chicken as a main ‚Ç¨10.90. He loved it and reported it was flavoursome and very filling. He also ordered an Americano at ‚Ç¨3.20 and was pleased with it. Our two kids shared one portion of Kids chicken goujons and chips at ‚Ç¨5.90. They devoured this and also managed to make a substantial dent in my milkshake. When we arrived we had to wait 10 minutes for a table but it was worth the wait. The place was buzzing and the menu has some original and very tasty elements. Overall this place is a must if you are passing through or near this Donegal village. Impressive and plenty of parking out the back. We will definitely return if in the vicinity. (by Emily O'Connor) [a year ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - What a Gem of a place!  Friendly staff!  Great aesthetic!  Delicious food!  We ordered off the breakfast menu and each one of us was delighted!
