My homemade granola, cherry compote, fresh berries and yogurt was so dreamy!  We will be back again soon‚Ä¶maybe even tomorrow! (by Lisa Stewart) [3 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Great location with plenty of parking around the back. Lovely atmosphere inside with very cool decor. The food was very tasty, plenty of options on the menu and lots of choices for hot drinks/baked goods also.
Overall, a lovely place for coffee, breakfast or lunch. (by √ìrla Friel) [3 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Stopped in on our way through and had two excellent breakfasts. Seamless ordering and very friendly staff. Food and coffee piping hot and delicious. Wish we had a Tank and Skinny‚Äôs in County Down near us in Newcastle. I reckon it would be super busy!! Def 5 stars üåü (by Marian A) [4 months ago] | Review 9: 1 star - My partner and I came back here to give it one last try after 3 years and yet again we where let down.
The breakfast burrito had extra things in it that is not stated on the menu such as onion, peppers and the last time there was mushrooms. the burrito was soggy and disappointing a bit like the atmosphere in the cafe.
We both had a shock when the ‚Ç¨4.20 chips arrived as it appeared half the portion was missing as surely it couldn‚Äôt be ‚Ç¨4 for a child‚Äôs sized handful of chips?
Drinks, especially the matcha are well below average.
Inside is very loud and not relaxing, it‚Äôs impossible to have a conversation, last time I had the experience in here was at a cattle market.

Just avoid it, it‚Äôs disappointing and underwhelming compared to their cafe in Letterkenny. (by Shay Melaugh) [2 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Amazing place! The food was amazing, as was the coffee. Claire on check in was so friendly, all the staff seemed to like their jobs. We all noticed them chatting and laughing with the customers. A brilliant spot for lunch! Alittle queue on arrival but two separate parties commented on how "it was worth the wait" and it certainly was! A real hidden gem! (by Clare Martin) [2 years ago]

name: Nancy's Barn Ballyliffin
address: Main St, Ballyliffin, Clonmany, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 4 stars - Gave feedback that the ‚Äòhungry goat‚Äô ciabatta sandwich was rock hard on top & scalding hot beneath, very obviously pre-made & heated up in a microwave however the hostess then discounted our dessert from our bill as an apology for not enjoying the food which was very courteous and kind. The carrot cake was HEAVENLY! I did ask for ice cream served with instead of whipped cream & it still came with whipped cream so had to send that back but was worth the wait. Decor is very nice & atmosphere is welcoming and warm. Coffee wasn‚Äôt a desired taste so would avoid next time & the sun dried tomatoes were so chewy & burned I couldn‚Äôt even cut through them but I am intrigued so will be back. My husband enjoyed the seafood chowder & would order it again. (by Anne Mac) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - This restaurant is known for its chowder and I can see why! We also got the tempura which was lovely and the garlic&chili fries were so crispy and delicious. (by Akram M) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Stopped in for dinner with 12 ppl (7 of which are kids!).
Great atmosphere, service and food. The sizzling duck smelt amazing every time the chef brought it past and the burgers the others had where fat n juicy (as they should be)!!
All the kids ate well, the fish n chips also went down well, even if the adult meal was just about too big for my 11 year old! (by John Harrison) [4 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - What an amazing place to eat! Everything was perfect, from the food (especially the chowder, which was absolutely delicious) to the warm and friendly service.
The atmosphere is cosy and charming, making it the perfect spot to relax and enjoy a great meal. Highly recommend! (by Luana S) [3 weeks ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Lovely place serving tasty food. It would be great if they opened late every day I‚Äôd certainly come for dinner. (by Gary Breen) [a month ago] | Review 6: 4 stars - I can‚Äôt quite put my finger on why I like the place so much; it‚Äôs a vibe though. Food is alright (though the chowder really is very good)

But the look and feel of the place makes me feel all kinds of warm and fuzzy; especially love the back extension, it‚Äôs such a cosy, happy little spot for some lunch (by Mat Lake) [4 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - We‚Äôve had a veggie Irish breakfast and it was delicious. We also loved the vibe at Nancy‚Äòs and the service was very attentive and friendly. (by E W) [3 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Decided to head to Nancy's Barn after a recommendation on their Chowder! It did not disappoint. They were booked out, took our number and rang when a table was available!

The seafood was out of this world. I've eaten fresh crab, prawns and squid all over Ireland, Nancy's beat them all hands down!

Get the Seafood Platter, it'll not disappoint!

We were in the area on holiday, but this would be worth the 3 hour drive from home! (by Noel Maguire) [Edited 8 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - We were here for lunch today, the food was deliciousüòã, we left our plates empty. Chowder was the most delicious I have ever eaten in my life! When we were leaving the restaurant we talked for a while with the owner and chef,very nice and friendly people üòä. Service very nice and we got our food very quickly. I recommend with a clear conscience. ü´° (by Karolina Nobert) [8 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Arrived without booking (tried phoning several times - could not connect). Staff made room for the 3 of us over looking the courtyard. Lunch was very good, my companions enjoying the Chowder - I'm vegetarian so I passed on it.
Overall a pleasant experience especially when coupled with a walk on the beach on a beautiful day. (by John Thomson) [a month ago]

name: Spice Waves
address: Unit 5, Bundoran Retail Park, Station Rd, Drumacrin, Bundoran, Co. Donegal, F94 XO43, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Could not find one negative thing to say about our experience at Spice Waves in Bundoran. Took a chance and walked in, but would recommend a reservation. My family and I got a different starter each and shared a bit each as the portions are so generous. We had the samosas, shish kebab and the onion bhaji and each one was delicious. I had a lamb korma for my main and again it was delicious, my wife got the biryani and my daughter goth the sizzling kebab and it was all just fantastic. We got a couple of garlic naan bread and drinks and the lot came to ‚Ç¨103. Some might say that was expensive but the quality was second to none and I can‚Äôt think of another Indian restaurant in Ireland that comes close to this one. The staff were also helpful and friendly and offered suggestions if you are not someone who regularly goes to Indian restaurants. Would definitely recommend a visit. I would highly recommend a visit to this hidden gem. (by Thomas Clarke) [2 weeks ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Wow, wow, wow, an absolutely fantastic meal. Loads of free parking right outside the door. We popped in on the of chance and we just about managed to get a table so I'd recommend making a reservation. The service was really good, our waiter even offered to give us suggestions if we needed help. We got 3 different starters between us and we all had a bit of each to try them. The onion bhaji were the best I've ever tasted. The shish kebabs and samosas were fab. For mains we had a korma, mains Shish kebabs and a biryani. My biryani was absolutely amazing, so aromatic, fresh and so tasty I used very little of the accompanying sauce. My husband loved his korma and the lamb was so tender. This is by far the best Indian I have had in year's. We cant wait to go back. (by Lisa Clarke) [2 weeks ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Beautiful meal at Spice Waves. We had the Veg Platter for starter, Korma for main and a chef special and a side of garlic and coriander naan bread and it was all delicious! The guys really looked after us
And we had a really lovely and relaxing night out! Will be back soon! (by Aine Balfe) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Amazing. I got the chicken karahi which was phenomenal and the tandoori roti which was just succulent. The staff were lovely and hospitable too. They give you a free appetizer before your meal. The food is also halal. 10/10 would come again. (by Trecia Onyah) [a month ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - What a beautiful place! Very nicely appointed and the food and service was just amazing! Such wonderful flavors! I can't wait for my next visit, thank you to all the staff at Spice Waves! (by Michael O'Keeffe) [a year ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Lovely friendly welcome, very nice decor. Monday night and still busy, would advise booking just in case.  Food lovely and a special touch was at the end when the chef came around each table asking if you enjoyed your food.  I thought this was a thoughtful touch. I would highly recommend. (by Joanne Day) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 4 stars - I walked into Spice Waves expecting a fantastic meal, and to be fair, it didn‚Äôt disappoint - though there's room for some refinement.

Food:

The food was solid, but there‚Äôs room to take it to the next level. I had the Chicken Biryani, which was flavorful, though I would have liked a bit more of the aromatic spices to really make it pop. The Lamb Rogan Josh was tender, well-cooked, and packed with flavor, I‚Äôd love to see a little more heat and intensity in the sauce. I can tell there‚Äôs potential here - just needs a bit more balance and oomph to really make it sing.

Service:

Service was friendly and attentive, which is always a plus. The staff made sure we were looked after, though a touch more efficiency wouldn‚Äôt hurt - especially when it comes to getting the food to the table at the same time. But, no complaints; they were doing their best, and that‚Äôs all you can ask for.

Ambiance:

The ambiance was cozy and welcoming, perfect for a casual meal. It‚Äôs a nice spot to sit back and relax, though it does get a bit tight when it‚Äôs busy. I‚Äôd love to see just a little more space, but the vibe was good overall.

Conclusion:

Spice Waves has got a lot going for it. The food was tasty, the service was warm, and the atmosphere was inviting. With just a little more attention to balancing the flavors and refining the timing, this place could be incredible. I‚Äôll be back for sure - it‚Äôs a solid spot with the potential to be even better. (by Murtaza Aamir) [a month ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Lovely service and food plenty of flavour would recommend (by Mary Jane O Regan) [2 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Best Indian food in donegal town I believe.. Indian food lover‚Äôs this is the best place to be in for your Indian food cravings.
Polite and humble staff, lovely experience i had after visiting first time here..
Kiddos to chef for there hard work turns to happy and flavourful meals in spice waves. (by Rituraj Poddar) [a month ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - I had a fantastic dining experience at spice wave  The food was delicious, with authentic flavors and a great variety of dishes.  With indian touch The service was prompt and courteous, and the ambiance was warm and inviting. Overall, a top-notch Indian restaurant that I highly recommend! (by Jignasha Chundaria) [a year ago]

name: Goose & Gander Downings. Pizzeria, Cocktail Bar & Old Tramore Inn Irish Pub
reviews:
Review 1: None - Stayed here recently. Had a wonderful few days. From breakfast to late night pints amazing staff. Couldn‚Äôt do enough for you. Rooms are immaculate, very modern. Location perfect for anyone wanting to play golf. Highly recommend. Everyone so friendly and will be back (by Mike Dowling) | Review 2: None - Ordered the fire and ice cocktail. Not sure what I got but it was nothing like the description, they brought a sticky sweet pink concoction that I couldn‚Äôt get down.
Caprese salad was canned tomatoes absolutely swimming in oil.
Truffle pizza also incredibly oily.

The crust of the pizza was lovely and I‚Äôm sure there are good things on the menu. Unfortunately seems like they were having an off night. (by Kat Bootz) | Review 3: None - Staying in the area with family and playing golf we came across the Goose & Gander. I have to admit pizza isn't my first choice for an evening meal but I was pleasantly surprised by the quality and flavour choices of pizza and all at a reasonable price. Nice choice of salads etc to accompany the pizza also. Staff were super attentive and friendly. A wednesday night and probably 20 seated outside with another 50 inside when we left- that answers the question on it's reputation and I certainly would recommend it to try. Great drinks selection apart from not having a nice rose wine and just zinfandel. (by Steven B) | Review 4: None - This is a review of the pizzeria! It is absolutely worth the wait! According to my husband, their gluten free pizzas are the best he has ever had since developing Celiacs and my ‚ÄúPear Thomas‚Äù was one of my top favorite pizzas of all time.  One of our dinner guests who is a self-proclaimed ‚Äúpizza hater‚Äù said after his pizza ‚ÄúI may be a convert‚Äù.  Definitely a must eat if you‚Äôre in the area and like good pizza. (by Rachel Howell) | Review 5: None - Unbelievable hospitality. Breakfast was top class and the pizzeria attached was as good as it gets. The staff go out of their way to look after you and I would recommend this place to anyone, especially if you‚Äôre coming to play golf in Rosapenna! (by Adam McCormac) | Review 6: None - Amazing Pizza and brilliant atmosphere.

I somehow managed to loose my phone while there last week, but was on my way back to London before the staff found it. Not a problem as it was posted back to me by Chris. Thanks a million guys. (by John McDaid) | Review 7: None - Great night. Cocktails a great way to start as we waited for table, food beautiful. Lovely lively atmosphere, staff so friendly & few laughs.. went into bar afterwards, buzzing atmosphere! Very busy so factor in a little wait time for when you hope to eat and go earlier! (by Eliza0157) | Review 8: None - Food was amazing!!! We got the spicy pepperoni, margarita, kuri kuri, and the sour cream and truffle pizza. All such unique flavors. The drinks were also incredible. I got a margarita and it was so sour in the best way. Wasnt expecting such great pizza in a little town but LOVED eating here (by Rachel Zafarana) | Review 9: None - Excellent pizzas. Really enjoyed ours. My wife is not a fan of pizzas and she said that her perri Perri chicken pizza was delicious and the best pizzas she has ever tasted. (by Liam Smyth) | Review 10: None - Lovely place to eat. Very accommodating for our ten month old daughter.
Food was excellent and staff very friendly. (by Paul G)

name: Lighthouse Tavern
address: Arryheernabin, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Great pub was made to feel welcome as soon as I walked in amazing atmosphere great service. food van outside that that do pizzas and the best pizza I have had landloard let me put van in car park and stay there as many pints of Guinness was had lol A MUST Visit if In the area (by Andrew Hill) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - A great pub in a remote location. Great selection of beer and the landlord, James, is a very friendly guy. The locals were very welcoming and made for a great night. (by Stephen Dempsey) [3 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - A lovely little gem of a pub! We dropped in when we stayed at Fanad lighthouse. Great service, great value pint!! üòÄ The pizza van outside was excellent! What a perfect combo!! (by Leo Harrigan) [a week ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - This is a great little pub. The owner is very welcoming and there is great pizza available from the pizza truck out front.
This place welcomes campervans in the spacious carpark at the rear. (by John O'Connor) [a month ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Great spot for a couple of drinks or a bite to eat in an amazing location. We had our dinner here twice on a 2 night stay in the lighthouse. Staff were fantastic and the food was very tasty. Can't wait to go back!! (by Owen McGrane) [5 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Such a fab wee pub near the Fanad Lighthouse! Lots of seating outside and great views! Definitely worth getting a Napoli pizza while the food van is there! (by Mairi K) [a year ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Great bar serving local lager and IPA. Fabulous views and a pizza van on site. Friendly staff and locals and our dog was made very welcome. It was a bonus to be able to stay overnight in our campervan behind the bar. (by Jude Agnew) [a year ago] | Review 8: 4 stars - Grand little place to have a drink. Opens at 6pm on weekend. Staff and people were friendly and inviting (by Anthony Connaughton) [6 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - What a great lunch spot! We came here after visiting the light house and had an absolutely delicious lunch. The Outdoor terrace is lovely and gets a lot of afternoon sun. Staff is very friendly and attentive. Try the seafood chowder, its delicious üòä ‚Ä¶ (by Laura Dorst) [2 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Wonderful lunch today for a group of 8 of us. The food was exceptional freshly cooked service excellent not a single thing to complain about. Staff very friendly and helpful. Look forward to our next visit. Highly recommend it. Many thanks to chefs and ladies who served us one being Noeleen. (by Monica Gilligan) [2 years ago]

name: Charleys Cafe
address: Pearse Rd, Letterkenny, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Absolutely serious scran, chips were gorgeous, lovely bitta fish (by Josh Maples) [a week ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - Stopped in the evening for a meal when travelling.  Was very filling.  Good service. (by John Chalmers) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Stopped in there after a long drive ordered the big breakfast very nice...the cafe  was very clean and the staff were very friendly if im ever back in letterkenny ill drop in again üëè (by Michael Collins) [2 weeks ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Great Gluten free options. Food is fantastic and  the service is great. Food is prepared fresh and served quick. They are very accommodating and helpful. (by Ronan Sharkey) [11 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Always great food couldn't complain and it's so clean and tidy. Gill's is doing a great job (by Madeline Ramsay) [3 months ago] | Review 6: 2 stars - Had fish and chips. Not worth the money and I won't be back here. Had a photo but deleted it. Fish wasn't great portion,  batter was rock hard, some might describe as "crispy". Was deep fried in oil that flavoured the fish. I guess the fish was deep fried, then reheated in microwave. Could be wrong but it was exceptionally hot. Chips were home made and should have tasted better. I really don't like giving negative reviews. So that's all I'll say. I won't be back. (by Gerry Gallagher) [9 months ago] | Review 7: 4 stars - Had a big breakfast  12.00 euros  small  but tasty (by OWEN McFADDEN) [a month ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - First impression walking in, looks great.  The floor is very well kept.  Friendly prompt service. Food looked and tasted good,  our table of 3 were happy with meal and service. Staff kept bust, serving, clearing and sanitising tables. Keep up the good work.  We'll done everyone.  A positive experience (by Evelyn Odonnell) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Fish & Chips Are Delicious It Has No Bones On It The Delivery Driver Is Very Friendly And The Coke Zero 500ml Was Great It Has Return Deposit Scheme On It

I Would Like To Order It Again (by Jack Brosnan) [6 months ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - Nice food . Helpful staff . Definitely worth a stop if you need somewhere handy. (by Odhr√°n Gillespie) [7 months ago]

name: The Drift Inn
address: Railway Rd, Ballymacarry Lower, Buncrana, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 4 stars - Pub in old Buncrana railway station a bit outside the town centre
Nice bar area inside , Bar built from a old boat  and roof timbers like a upturned keel of a ship ,Real fire nice and cosy
Pizza only and then only weekends
Some reviews say it‚Äôs dog friendly but bar staff said dogs not allowed in bar only in outside area (by D Murphy) [a month ago] | Review 2: 3 stars - Nice old converted railway ticket station bar. Large outdoor seating area. Even though next to seafront, no views. Great DJ knocking out the 80‚Äôs hits! (by Martina Slattery) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - When you open the door of the Drift Inn, you step into a dimly lit pub which is brimming with maritime artifacts on the walls and  the dancing flames of a delightful log fire in a stone hearth. The atmosphere is relaxed and pleasant. The pints of Guinness are top class. Presently, due to Covid the restaurant is closed but tasty pizzas are available. There is ample outdoor dining and a hot food van attends close by on Fridays and Sundays. Live music is also back. For a most pleasant atmosphere, don't let a visit to Buncrana pass without stopping off at the Drift Inn. You shouldn't be disappointed. (by Dave M) [4 years ago] | Review 4: 2 stars - Sorely disappointed upon return... First we had to wait 30 minutes before they took our order because they were ‚Äúso busy‚Äù There really weren‚Äôt that many people. The chicken wings were by far the worst I have ever tried. They were deep fried with a meanest amount of franks hot sauce. I asked for more and didn‚Äôt see the waiter again until we sought him out to pay. Really disappointed. Wont be back. (by Grainne Doherty) [Edited 5 years ago] | Review 5: 4 stars - We really enjoyed our evening here. Excellent pint of Guinness, and the view was beautiful in the outdoor seating area. We had pleasant weather, which was in our favor because a rowdy bunch was inside watching soccer. However, that meant we were outside with the smokers. Pizza and chips was on the menu. Seems like it varies from night to night. A very easy place to have a group gather. (by Hannah Terry) [2 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Great place for pint & pizza , lovely atmosphere
Lovely Guinness , (by laoise garvey) [2 weeks ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - The Mail was Very nice The Service is Very good so call into The Drift Inn and have pint or two Bar staff are very friendly and helpful (by John Devereaux) [2 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Lovely pub in an old railway station that is over 150 years old. Pints are great. Nice big open fire too. Best bar in Buncrana. Would highly recommend. (by Colin Farrell) [3 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - They serve delicious pizza, and the Guinness is so good. Great atmosphere at the weekends. (by Breda Bradley) [6 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - I love this bar. First stepped foot in here over 20 years ago, and still love dropping into it. It has a great atmosphere, good food and drink, and just always a good experience. (by Damien Gallagher) [Edited 6 years ago]

name: THE RAMBLING HOUSE BAR & RESTAURANT
address: Main St, Laghy, Laghey, Co. Donegal, F94 Y048, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 4 stars - If you're looking for nice and peaceful restaurant in a country side then this place should be on your list to explore. The restaurant is at Main Street of small town  Laghey. They serve food all day with bar food served separately. We ordered Vegetable curry with Tofu option and Chicken Grilled Burger and to complete the meal at last we had ordered their Chocolate and Guinness Cake. The food was not the fancy one but was quite ok as there was nothing great to differentiate but their Chocolate and Guinness Cake made our evening special.
The staff were knowledgeable and helpful, offering great recommendations to try from the menu.  The service was top notch and pretty handy when we asked to lower the TV volume as we had a child with us. The restaurant is huge and has loads of seating area and tables to accommodate a very large number of people. The soft lighting and comfortable seating created a relaxing and inviting environment. One can just freshen their mind by just looking at the decorative and creative pieces and arts all around. Every hanging piece of art had their own caption and own meaning to standout.
The bar section is totally a place to look at. It was perfectly organized highlighting all the types of liquor they serve.
Talking about the parking, there is plenty of parking space available at the back of the restaurant and they also have outdoor sitting as well to enjoy in the nice weather.
Do not keep high expectations on food. The food tasted decent enough to eat so not a problem for eaters like me who do not seek 5 star taste and service everywhere.
Overall a nice place to enjoy your time. (by ajay harmale) [3 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - We were traveling from the States and this was the best food so far. The atmosphere was welcoming and the staff was kind and helpful, and it was the best fish n chips I think I‚Äôve ever had! Thank you! (by Nicole Feltman) [a week ago] | Review 3: 2 stars - I stopped in after seeing all the road signs, and it was one of the few places open that was not fast food. The burger didn‚Äôt taste like a burger, nor did it look like a burger. The best thing about the burger were the onion rings that came on it. The fries tasted as if they had come out of the freezer with no flavor and were ‚Äúhard‚Äù on the inside. A fast food burger and fries would have been more tasty and a lot cheaper. The goat cheese tart was average. Overall, a disappointing meal. The restaurant was empty save for a couple of couples getting drinks. Perhaps the atmosphere would be more lively with more people, but it was dead. The server was kind and checked in on me. I would not go back for food; perhaps on a night with music and socializing I would go for entertainment. (by Kristy Fountain) [3 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Great food, great service!
Maura is a gem. She told us a lot about the area and the history of Derry and Ireland. She explained the Irish language and generally made us feel welcome.
The fish and chips are spectacular. The roast beef was next level.
Fast service and great food.
Don't miss it! (by Aya Jarvis) [3 months ago] | Review 5: 4 stars - If you're looking for nice and peaceful restaurant then this place should be on your list for sure -- THE RAMBLING HOUSE BAR & RESTAURANT.
These restaurant is at Main St, Laghy, Laghey, Co. Donegal.
The food we ordered was served incredibly fresh and was flavorful as required. We ordered Vegetable curry with Tofu option and Chicken Grilled Burger and to complete the meal at last we had ordered their Chocolate and Guinness Cake. The food was quite okay as there was nothing great to differentiate from other restaurants taste wise but their Chocolate and Guinness Cake was just yummmmmmmmmmmm.
The staff were knowledgeable and helpful, offering great recommendations to try from the menu. The restaurant is huge and has loads of seating area and tables to accommodate a very large number of people. The soft lighting and comfortable seating created a relaxing and inviting environment. The ambience was very creative and relaxing. One can just freshen their mind by just looking at the decorative and creative pieces and arts all around. Every hanging piece of art had their own caption and own meaning to standout.
The bar section is totally a place to look at. It was perfectly organized highlighting all the types of liquor they serve.
Talking about the parking, there is plenty of parking space available at the back of the restaurant and they also have outdoor sitting as well to enjoy in the nice weather.
Do not keep high expectations on food. The food tasted decent enough to eat so not a problem for eaters like me who do not seek 5 star taste and service everywhere.
Overall a nice place to enjoy your time. (by Devangi Dave) [6 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - We had our son‚Äôs christening meal with around 40 of our family together for the occasion. We were made feel so welcome and relaxed when we arrived. The food was delicious, everyone had a great meal. We enjoyed it that much we went back for dinner a few days later and it was just as good. Great staff, great food and warm relaxed atmosphere. (by Mary Timoney) [a month ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Fantastic lunch!  My wife and I loved the fish and chips, and it always goes down well with a Guinness!  The service was great and personable, had a very nice chat with the tender/waitress.  Thank you! (by Nick Bush) [a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - We stopped here Friday night on our way to Ardara. They had plenty space in the restaurant, it was quiet in a good way.
There is plenty of parking, too.
The service was lovely and so was the food, we loved it. The cajun chicken wings were a marvellous surprise, so crispy and tasty. Would absolutely recommend! (by Mar√≠a Bertogli) [2 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Great food, friendly & efficient service. The starter of spring rolls with noodles was excellent as was the main course combination of monkfish with prawns. Would highly recommend this restaurant (by Tony Collins) [a month ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - We have been to the Rambling House now several times, always excellent. We also have had a large family gathering just last  week and everything was delicious from start to finish with Brilliant service.. So good to have somewhere so good to go on our doorstep. Thank you to all the team especially  Patrick, Caroline, Tamara and Mairead. keep up the good work and see you soon from the McMenamin Crew. ü•∞ (by Sara Mcmenamin) [3 months ago]

name: Rosato‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant
address: 7 Malin Rd, Ballynally, Moville, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Rosatos has been a favourite eatery of our family for 10 years! It‚Äôs only gotten better over the years and this was our first time visiting under the new management. Loved to see it‚Äôs still a great spot with some nice new additions. Food is excellent and we will be regulars for the foreseeable future (by Dan Wesley) [5 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Excellent restaurant in Moville. Lovely food, great service and wonderful atmosphere (by Sean O'Sullivan) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - The atmosphere and food here is amazing! It was pretty busy,, for a Tuesday, but I'm not sure since I'm not from here. Seems to be a very popular place, recommended by multiple locals. Server kind of forgot about us lol, but again it was very busy so I understand. Food came out very promptly, maybe only 10/15 minutes for such a busy day. And again, very very delicious! (by The Alvarez Brothers) [a year ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Been here many times and the food is always amazing! Such a cosy atmosphere and the staff always go above and beyond. Recently celebrated a birthday here where the staff made the effort to put candles in the dessert and sing happy birthday. Can‚Äôt recommend it enough and will definitely be retuning soon. (by Zoe Devenney) [5 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - If you haven't tried Rosatos, you should! The guinness is as good as you will get. The food and service are outstanding. We had seafood chowder to start, and it was lovely and full of big chunks of fish. It wasn't a massive portion, but it was enough. We both had the haddock and chips, and it was beautiful. The batter was really crispy, and the chips were homemade. There is plenty on the menu to suit everyone, and we will definitely return. Highly recommended!!! (by Keith) [a year ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Lovely little place in moville I've been three times now & every time has been delightful. Good atmosphere, attentive staff & food is gorgeous. Highly recommend this beautiful place if you're in Moville. I especially liked the seafood chowder for starters & steak burger with garlic fries as a side. Absolutely divine! (by lilo3116) [a year ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Great food.  Most of the group had pizza.  The beef stew and potatoes (other than fish and chips only one of two or three menu items which could be considered Irish) was very good.  Our friends treated so not sure of pricing.  Interior decor is eclectic but cramped.  No view of beautiful Foyle as it is situated off and perpendicular to the beach. (by David Lagerlef) [4 months ago] | Review 8: 3 stars - A bit of chaos with information. We ordered drinks while waiting to order from menu outside. After drinks came we were told we could only have pizza and sides sitting in the outdoor pods after 5pm. We hadn't intended getting pizza but. This was at 6:15, however the table opposite were eating other items from the menu. Some signage and/or clarity from staff would be great.
Food was fine. (by Loulou) [4 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Lovely Italian restaurant/ pub. Really friendly bar staff. Fully booked first time we tried but they booked us in for the next evening. (by Mark Raven) [a month ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - First time at the Bar and staff very friendly and helpful.
The food was excellent, I had the haddock and chips and the batter was light and crispy. The pub was doing a good trade with all the tables taken you need to book, to be not disappointed.üëè (by Peter Winterburn) [4 months ago]

name: Mrs B's Coffee House
address: Main St, Killybegs, Co. Donegal, F94 XY91, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Came for a quick lunch while traveling through. The food was amazing and the ladies were wonderful. Was quite busy but the service was rather quick! (by Amanda Leighton) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - We came for cappacino‚Äôs and breakfast and it was the best we‚Äôve had on our trip in Ireland! The staff were lovely and the vibe was warm and cozy.  Delicious Irish breakfast, scones and coffee made with love! (by Angela Wilson) [3 days ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Chanced upon this lovely Coffee House in Killibegs. What a great find. Food was wonderful, both my husband and I had the seafood chowder yum yum. Staff were lovely.  Service was very good. A friendly and happy place. (by Cathi Howell) [3 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - A busy and cozy little cafe with friendly service and good fair trade coffee. (by Lauri Donahue) [4 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Fantastic breakfast. Highly recommend. (by Dr Jeremy Law) [2 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - My wife & I were just finishing off a few enjoyable days in Donegal. To top it all off was our visit to Mrs B's which came highly recommended by two of our new friends (Stephen & Pauline from Killybegs). Amazing food, atmosphere & staff. We will definitely be back again for sure. ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê (by campbell best) [a year ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Happy friendly service here. The food was good and typical cafe type pastries plus hot food. All the food we had was well received and delicious. (by brettroberts987) [a month ago] | Review 8: 4 stars - A cute little cafe, perfect for grabbing some breakfast. They had good vegetarian options as well. The food and service was great, although it was a tiny bit expensive for the quantity. And they have a nice variety of cakes and pastries as well. (by Vatsal Mishra) [2 years ago] | Review 9: 4 stars - Went here for Saturday late breakfast /brunch. Cute little cafe on the main street that feels very cosy. They have decorated the entrance with seasonal plants and flowers so looks very welcoming. It was very busy when I arrived but got a table pretty quickly. I noticed lot of locals come to this place so that is a great sign. The staff is polite and attentive. I got granola and coffee here. Granola pot was lovely and coffee was decent. My friend got veggie breakfast, veggie sausages were bit weird to taste but rest was alright. We mentioned it to the staff as a feedback and they apologised and reduced the price for us. I am sure the regular Irish breakfast would be lovely, there is also a great selection cakes here. Overall a good place to go. (by Ruch ..) [3 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Loved it. The staff were so welcoming and friendly
Cafe was spotless clean. We would definitely  go  back there again. (by Linda Morris) [a month ago]

name: Little Mac's Chipper
address: Newrow, Donegal, F94 F95V, Ireland
service_options: Shamrock Chinese Takeaway ¬∑ 4.0 stars ¬∑ 57 reviews ¬∑ Chinese Takeout, Apache Pizza Donegal ¬∑ 3.0 stars ¬∑ 150 reviews ¬∑ Pizza Delivery
reviews:
Review 1: 1 star - Avoid and go hungry instead, you will thank me. Has to be worst take away ever seen. Order a cod and chips, donar kebab, onion rings and cheese chips. None of it was editable. Cod batter was dark brown soild piece of batter that has been cooked in oil that probably there since 2012. Even the fish inside wasnt editable. Onion rings the same , donor kebab was some sort of meat in a tray , the tray just leaked orange colour sauce all over the place. As i was passing through I will get onto bank for a charge back as I couldn't get back to shop to dump the food. (by P) [Edited 6 months ago] | Review 2: 1 star - We just ordered two kids chicken burger meals, Chinese udon noodle box and a taco chip. Absolutely disgusting.  ZERO seasoning on anything, the noodles were over cooked and slimy, extremely unpleasant to eat. Everything just tasted like it was frozen and then boiled in water and soya sauce. Taco chip was watery from the mince. It was absolutely disgusting and for what they are charging.  Disgraceful. (by Dallaire) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 1 star - Absolutely awful. Had me waiting 45 minutes. Asked me 3 times what I ordered and forgot to make it twice .

Honestly if I hadn‚Äôt of paid already I would have walked out .

How hard is it to get sausage and chips . What a mess of a chippy .

Food then wasn‚Äôt even that nice .

Please avoid if you value your time , money and taste buds . (by Tim Wardlow) [5 months ago] | Review 4: 1 star - We bought for about 5-6 people and it almost cost around ‚Ç¨76.00 would honestly not recommend the chicken is like rubber, the chips are overly greasy and the chicken
Saut√© looked exactly like what I feed my cats it‚Äôs just really not good all together I‚Äôd far rather go to marinas (by Ding Dong) [a month ago] | Review 5: 1 star - It's not nice  very much food just wrapped quickly. (by Breege Kenny) [a month ago] | Review 6: 1 star - So called "Donner kebab meal". The dog wouldn't eat it. Disgusting. Won't be back.
Donner meat was more like a bad quality beef burger cut up. And covered in Sweet chilli sauce. And just sitting on top of a big naan bread. Who does that?! Only thing edible were the chips. (by M92) [4 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Well we thought we would try here just for a bag of chips with plenty of salt and vinegar.
It did not disappoint.
I can only assume beef dripping was used to fry the chips. They tasted lovely.
The staff were polite and engaging.
And the service was excellent. The price was surprisingly cheaper than most.
Keep the pans on little mac's we will be back for sure. Mmmmmmmmmm (by paul nelson) [a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Traditional chipper & does Chinese dishes as well ‚Ä¶ reasonably priced & has seating to eat takeaway ‚Ä¶ (by Mary Thomas) [5 months ago] | Review 9: 1 star - Needs a bit more food practice and prep .not tasty ... (by Eamonn Cunnane) [a month ago] | Review 10: 1 star - Disgusting fish and chips, fish was soaked in cold oil which was laing on it like white fat, don't go there if you don't want to be sick (by Danuta Black) [2 years ago]

name: O'Donnells Bar & Restaurant Donegal
reviews:
Review 1: None - We were there for 2 nights. The room was clean and tidy but the bar has a nightclub below, we were kept awake until 2:30 am on the Friday night and 3:30 am on the Sunday night, definitely wouldn‚Äôt recommend staying there over a weekend if you want to get a good nights sleep! (by Misty035) | Review 2: None - Absolutely a gem !!! Unbelievably helpful staff.. great pints.. wildfire pizzas offered..
Historic and beautiful inside and out!!! (by John Walling) | Review 3: None - Avoid at all costs ! This was booked for 20 of us who were staying in Donegal town for dinner and drinks to celebrate one of the party getting married. 2 hours before arrival , the accommodation was contacted to give our arrival time and we ‚Ä¶ (by 913cleaf) | Review 4: None - Popped in here for pizza. We just drove from Westport to Donegal and were famished. Our pizza came really quick. Service was excellent. I only wish there was more basil on my pizza. (by Nichelle S) | Review 5: None - Comfortable stay in the heart of Donegal Town on the diamond. Lovely view of the diamond and the shops. The hostess was so helpful and friendly! I'd stay here again for sure. (by R4170ZHmikes) | Review 6: None - Wouldn't recommend for food, but the beer was nice and I've heard the atmosphere is lovely on busier nights (by Katie) | Review 7: None - Great room size, perfect location, get pub underneath. Staff are super friendly too and great craic (by Claire) | Review 8: None - Located in a fantastic area right in the town centre, when we arrived we sat in the bar part of the premises, the front bar was warm when the back part where we sat was very cold with no heating on, staff was very friendly showed us to our room. Rooms where in a good condition for the price, the carpet was stained, and there was some floaters in the kettle. The heating in the room was extremely hot this left me unable to sleep, when we return to the room and I noticed the radiators were blasting I turned all off, also my partner burnt his hands on the water as it was extremely hot very quickly.
Overall it was an ok spot for the price (by Debragh Kelly) | Review 9: None - They bad people. Stay away!!!!||They own me money. No pay. No vacation ||WRC coming! Owners pure trash ||STAY AWAY!! DONT EVER ENTER (by E2354LNattilak) | Review 10: None - Such amazing food! Everything we ordered tasted absolutely fantastic. The kitchen here is amazing!

Ordered a hot and spicy pizza, hot chicken sandwich, fish and chips, and smash burger. The buns and pizza crust are of a quality I haven't had before. I'd eat here everyday if I wasn't traveling (by J P)

name: Sip and Slice
address: 6 Bridge St, Ballyboe, Rathmelton, Co. Donegal, F92 N1K2, Ireland
reviews: Review 1: 5 stars - Good hearty meal, tasty and full of flavour...will deffo be back (by markrugby) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Loved Sip and Slice today. Delicious food, not too heavy but filling. Good pricing. Lovely wee outdoor and indoor seating area. Really friendly staff. Highly recommend ü•∞ (by Rhema Mc Gilloway) [2 years ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - We had chips and a drink. Lovely dog friendly, kid friendly and pizzas looked amazing. (by Sabrina Leneghan) [a month ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Great spot for coffee and superb sourdough toasted sandwiches. Perfect for brunch and also does great pizzas. Happy to support a local business offering freshly made food with quality ingredients......and good humour. (by Jeanette Abraham) [7 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - I‚Äôve been in here before for a sourdough toastie and it was great. But tonight I decided to try the pizza it was amazing I had nduja sausage pepperoni and mozzarella. Best pizza I‚Äôve had in a long time. Would highly recommend ! (by Chris Dalton) [6 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Fantastic spicy warm chicken salad. Huge portion, great value to match the taste. (by tom murray) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Great food, pizzas are the nicest aorund and the loaded chips are class. Really good value and they have done an amazing job with the place. (by Ruth Mc Nulty) [6 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Friendly staff, great food and good prices (by Ross Dunne) [a month ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Nicky and staff are brilliant serving the best Pizza etc üëçüèø (by martin blake) [4 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Pizzas were amazing! Will definitely be back. Best pizza I've had in Donegal üòä (by Emma Duddy) [2 years ago]

name: Quay West Restaurant & Terrace
address: W End, Magheracar, Bundoran, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 2 stars - First I‚Äôll say this restaurant has a great location and a great view of the Atlantic. They were able to accommodate me in my food requests and the burgers were quite nice. It went a bit downhill with the soup‚Ä¶wet cardboard has more flavour than what was served to me. I had to ask for garlic mayo three times before it was given to me, and by that time, my chips were already cold. I also asked for water for the table and was given a single glass of water, and the waitress ran away before I could ask for more water for everyone else. Overall, the food wasn‚Äôt bad but the service was terrible. (by Brady Douglass) [3 months ago] | Review 2: 1 star - I appreciated the variety of vegan options available at this restaurant, which was a big plus. However, I had a very disappointing experience. The staff was quite unfriendly, which affected the overall atmosphere. We didn`t feel welcome at all! Additionally, the noodle dishes were swimming in oil, making them very greasy and not very enjoyable. (by Styx) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 4 stars - Nice place to go for a semi formal lunch. Not too noisy to sit and have a chat, or celebrate a special occasion

The food was nice and service friendly as well

The fish and chips was ok, but the Brie and cranberry carried the meal for us
Portion size is good, but your paying more for the lovely environment (by C T) [a year ago] | Review 4: 2 stars - I gave a good review in January and April, however I was there today and the service has declined, no mention of specials, poor attitude from waiting staff, 30min wait for the main course.

Expecting better service for the price

Starter was small, less than half mozzarella for the caprese

The young waitress did not make us feel welcome this time, maybe having a bad day.

We asked if possible to seat at the front with seaview but we were told a group was coming.
We left 90mins later and the seats were still empty with other guests who arrived after us seated on some of the "reserved" tables.

As I went to Quay West a number of times, I know the "reserved" sign is always there on the seats with the best view, it's down to the waitress to pick who who seats there.

The steak sandwitch was good but I dont think I will go back. (by M D) [Edited 3 years ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Staff is very helpful üëç
Food tasty üòã
Atmosphere and view üëå üòç ‚ú®Ô∏è (by Jurgita Kulikauskiene) [6 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Beautiful view from dining room. Great staff and good food (by Jurica Flajpan) [3 years ago] | Review 7: 2 stars - Had an issue with my meal, had a salad as a main that only came with the meat and lettuce leaves, was very dry chicken and barely any sauce, asked the manager with the hope of getting some tomatoes or something to add into it and also wanted to order another drink. They told me they would "go see" then never came back, continued to walk past me repeatedly without looking my direction and then another waiter came and gave me my bill and took away my food. Which I was still hoping to eat. Asked the waiter could I speak to the manager again, they said they would get them but she proceeded to ignore me and kept walking past. Annoyed as I left hungry and very annoyed when all I wanted was another drink and maybe a tomato. Other staff seemed lovely, manager not so much (by S McD) [4 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - This restaurant has the most amazing food and the loveliest of staff. I would highly highly recommend it to anyone. I am ceoliac and was catered to with no problem and everything from starter to desert was delicious (by marian Owens) [5 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Staff were amazing and food was brilliant and very reasonably priced! Will definitely come back (by Rebecca Kavanagh) [2 years ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - Solid bar food, prices are fair but the salmon was not the best. It has convenient parking across the road and the staff were very good and attentive (by Keith Dowling) [7 years ago]

name: Leo's Tavern
address: Meenaleck, Crolly, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Great food, no matter what you order! My seafood chowder was full of shrimp, mussels, calamari, and chunks of tender fish. The sirloin steak special with pepper sauce was perfectly well done to perfection; another the same with medium and the chicken paprika was perfectly tender. (by Barbara DeBaere Poppy) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - This pub lives up to its reputation of a proper Irish pub with friendly staff, great food and lively music. (by Michelle Brenton) [a month ago] | Review 3: 4 stars - Had a super time yesterday evening. Met a few people and enjoyed the company. Service was excellent and so was the Ceili Music......Will definitely be returning üëå (by Eoin Davis) [3 weeks ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - 3/5/2024
It was one of our best experiences!!!
First of all, I want to say that the service was fantastic. The staff was very professional and very friendly, ready to serve and answer any question you had about the place.
Leo's Tavern has a wide variety of beers, and the food that they served there was served, giving you the impression that it is supposed to be served like that.
Thank you for the experience we had and I urge everyone to at least go there once.
I am sorry for not knowing the names of the staff so I can give gratitude.
Since I am from greece, I don't know if I will be able to visit Leo's Tavern again, but if I visit Ireland again, I will surely go again.
Until then,I will miss you... (by Mike Apostolakis) [Edited a year ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Came here Saturday afternoon after my nieces christening. Food was amazing! We‚Äôre visiting from London and have compared every other meal to this one. The beef was so tender and the apple crumble was delicious. Staff were very attentive for a large party - thank you! (by Lauren Maybank) [2 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - We actually stumbled across Leos and we were not disappointed. Staff were really busy but we were seated and served instantly. We ordered the stir-fry and it was delicious, really different but couldnt fault it and we of course had to try the dessert menu and the Apple Cake, Custard and Ice Cream was exactly like my Granny used to make it...amazing! (by Noel Maguire) [2 years ago] | Review 7: 3 stars - Service was very quick and courteous, but the food was lacking. I asked for a steak sandwich with the meat medium rare. When it arrived, it was unevenly cooked, with one end almost medium rare and the other end less than rare, almost uncooked, and the meat had a lot of grizzle.  My wife's fish and chips was ok.
Bathrooms were somewhat clean, but they are in need of a serious renovation (by Pat Caffrey) [a month ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Amazing food, great atmosphere and friendly staff and owner. Great stir fry, very fresh ingredients. (by Floss Grey) [3 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - My best friend and I just did a bucket-list trip to Ireland. He's a big Enya fan, so he was excited to visit sights around Donegal associated with her and her music, including Leo's Tavern, opened by her father, and now owned by one of her brothers. The whole Donegal area is beautiful, and Leo's Tavern was a great, traditional Irish pub with a great atmosphere. They have some great local beers - I had a delicious red ale from Errigal Brewing Company. We also had their Mussels appetizer and Fish & Chips for dinner. Both very good. The walls of the restaurant display a lot of mementos and awards from both Enya's career and her family's group, Clannad. If you're in the Donegal area, I recommend making a stop at Leo's. (by Paul Kenney) [a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - First came here 40 years ago and so nice to be back with youngest son now he can drink pints as well. Great food and service and good live music. Friendly staff a certain familiarity in the decor and a must for Clannad and Enya fans. Oh and ‚Ç¨5.50 for Guinness what more could you want. (by Jonathan Simpson) [3 weeks ago]

name: Carrigart One 8
address: Main St, Carrickart, Co. Donegal, F92 E6N2, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 1 star - Friendly(ish) staff. Terrible food. I had a "meh" burger for 18 Euros and my wife had the vegetable quesadilla for an eye-watering 23 Euros. It consisted of two dry tortillas with a fairly tasteless stewed green pepper filling, and no cheese - so just a "dilla" then, and not a "quesadilla". Not recommended. (by Scott Bolton) [a month ago] | Review 2: 1 star - Sadly a very disappointing experience. Ordered a roasted butternut squash risotto. What I got was rice in cream and cheese with carrots, potatoes, courgettes, peppers, onions. Vegetables were steamed not roasted. Extremely odd! (by Mary Miller) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Gorgeous restaurant! Had a fab night here for a work function and it was delicious.

I had the chicken samosa to start, duck main and apple and rhubarb crumble for dessert - every course was amazing. Each member of our party of four was well impressed with the standard of food.

Great atmosphere and staff were also very friendly. Will definitely be back on the regular! (by Michelle McCarron) [3 years ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Carrigart One 8 excelled in every possible way this evening when a friend and I booked in for what turned out to be the best Donegal seafood feast I can remember. The place buzzed with a busy friendly neighbourhood bistro atmosphere and the trademark Wendy attention to detail was in evidence for every single course. I ordered chips with my delicate creamy mussels and will be back for more
The lobster speaks for itself ! Wine list is good with a specially good French red ‚Ä¶
Thanks Wendy and 108 team. (by christine boyce) [3 years ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Beautiful food, well cooked. There is music, but it‚Äôs not so loud that it interrupts your conversation. (by Hugh Marcus) [2 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - We had a lovely meal. The lobster special was fab! (by Gillian McCann) [a year ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - We had a lovely meal in July. Food was excellent. Great service and very friendly, helpful staff. The restaurant is tastefully decorated and has a lovely atmosphere. Music in the background was just right, both in terms of content and volume. We will definitely be back. (by Margaret Scott) [2 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Lovely cozy restaurant. Food was excellent, we had 3 people in our party, all had different dishes, starters, dinner, dessert, everything was amazing. Would HIGHLY recommend! (by Marie Gillman) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Have just left this restaurant after having a superb meal. Starters, Mains and desserts all excellent quality. Great atmosphere. Great tunes. Top class staff. I will definitely be back. (by James Mulhall) [2 years ago] | Review 10: 1 star - I went to this restaurant with my family and it was a very disappointing experience.
Me and my dad ordered a blue cooked steak which was really good and well made and I wont deny.
Although, my sister ordered a 28 EUROS seafood plate that contained barely anything consistent and a very very miserly portion of sea food. I'm talking like 10 mussels a tiny crab claw and a morsel amount of hake which could have easily been mistaken for a starter.
I cannot believe you would charge that much money for so little food.
Apart from that, the waitress that served us was very nice and friendly.
Upon leaving and paying, my sister brought up the quantity of food in her plate to the cook and she didn't even apologize or have any consideration, instead, she just got mad at her staff and at our waitress who was very very uncomfortable and didn't deserve such treatment.
Overall, good tasting food but very poor quantities and a very rude chef, would not recommend. (by B) [2 years ago]

name: Ballyliffin Lodge & Spa
reviews:
Review 1: None - 7 of us stayed here for 6 nights. Our room 209 was spacious and comfortable with a beautiful view of the Atlantic. A hearty breakfast was included with lots of choice. Continental, full Irish, pancakes, waffles, salmon, porridge. We had ‚Ä¶ (by Dianebg) | Review 2: None - Came here to stay for a friends wedding and stayed here for two nights.   Warmly welcomed by a receptionist.   Room was spacious and lovely.   Breakfast was amazing and we had the wedding meal that day it was lovely.   Next day we had ‚Ä¶ (by Morrisson24) | Review 3: None - Myself and my husband spent three nights in this stunning hotel as part of a group of nineteen people last weekend. From arrival to departure our break was amazing. Our room had spectacular views of the beach. The food and staff were ‚Ä¶ (by W8332SMannd) | Review 4: None - Beautiful hotel in great location. Walking distance to a beach and easy drive to lots of interesting places. Room and bed very comfortable, staff so helpful and friendly and overall I had a great experience here. I'm not a spa fan so can't comment on that. (by Maureen Scott) | Review 5: None - 2025 a great stay at the Ballyliffin Hotel & Spa.
The room we were staying in was just updated to the new standard and as you can see from photographs below it is too high standard. (All rooms will be upgraded to this style)
The Bed and pillows were made for a very good night's sleep. The walk-in shower with its easy to use controls was excellent for us older folk.
We were at the back of the hotel so the views were not great. but we stayed in a room at the front before so we know the views from there are stunning looking over Pollen Bay to Malin head in the distance.
I always maintain that staff are what makes a stay enjoyable in a hotel and the staff of the Ballyliffin hotel & spa go the extra mile to make your stay memorable.

The Restaurant and Jacks bar food is of a high quality and good value (Only small gripe service can be slow & confusing. Maybe if staff were allocated serving areas it would reduce waiting time and mixed up orders) Loved the main meal but the crunchy ice cream dessert was a knockout blow for me wow tasty tasty.
There is so much to see and do around the Ballyliffin area, we visited the Famine village as we were aware of the treble fire at the start of the year and had to show are support for Pat & Majella who work so hard there. Then a quick drive up to Malin Head the most Northerly point in Ireland with stunning views over the wild Atlantic.
Our overall stay was fantastic, enjoyable, relaxing and we would highly recommend staying here as we plan to return with family in September. (by Tommy Oh Byrne) | Review 6: None - Room

We had a lovely, spacious room with a view down to the beach (weather permitting) and of the front of the hotel. Both bedroom and bathroom had all necessary amenities, clean and plenty of space.

Staff

Everyone working at the hotel was friendly and helpful. They also had great chat and gave us some tips on where to visit locally to make the most of our trip (as over for a wedding).

Food and bar

Great selection of food and drinks in the bar. The restaurant had options for all dinners - in particular an impressive number of vegeterian and vegan options. Breakfast was an absolute treat - lots of choice and some of the best porridge I've had! (by Laura Osborne) | Review 7: None - What a beautiful hotel and great setting. Hotel is fantastic lovely rooms and brilliant spa and fitness centre. Lovely bar and restaurant, perfect for any occasion. We had the bar food and seat in the conservatory which overlooks the bay and golf course. It was excellent. For golfers it‚Äôs right becide the Ballyliffin golf course. (by Eddie Doherty) | Review 8: None - We booked this hotel as a large group of men who were heading to Ballyliffin to take part in the All Ireland Horseshoe Pitching Competition. From the first point of contact over the phone to make the booking back in March, up to our arrival ‚Ä¶ (by michaeldF7027HY) | Review 9: None - Just returned from a long weekend for a wedding.  240 person wedding all at the lodge.  And it was amazing.  Best weekend ever.  |Everything was perfect.  Amazing ceremony party.  Decor.  Hotel is beautiful. Rooms clean.  Cleaners so lovely ‚Ä¶ (by laurasW1050TC) | Review 10: None - I cannot fault this hotel. Having completed an extensive road trip around Ireland (over 2000km and over 2 weeks) staying in lots of 4* hotels, this was our favourite. The staff were lovely; friendly and helpful, the views were amazing, it's only a short walk to the beach, food was quality and the hotel itself was of a high standard. Highly recommended by this visitor!!
The only improvement I would suggest is the addition of EV charging points as they are quite scarce in this area of Ireland at the time of writing. (by Mark Smith)

name: Olde Castle Seafood Bar
address: Castle St, Donegal, Donegal Town, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 4 stars - Stopped in for lunch. Seafood chowder was very good, definitely a 10 out of 10. The pork sandwich was just average. Wouldn‚Äôt recommend ordering extra chips ‚Äî ‚Ç¨6 per portion and they tasted over-fried in old oil.

Service was fast with drinks and decent with food. Atmosphere was nice and relaxed, no loud music, even though the place was busy.

Overall, a solid 4 out of 5. Would go back for the seafood chowder alone. Definitely recommend that. (by Marina) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - The food was absolutely amazing! I had the superfood salad, which was fresh, colourful, and full of flavour. Courgettes were a little on the dry side, but the salsa chickpeas completely made up for it. My meat-eating friends were thrilled with the lobster (priced at ‚Ç¨48) and said it was worth every cent.

We finished with the Summer Berry Tart, which was just as delightful. Crisp pastry, sweet-tart berries, and the perfect amount of cream. Highly recommend! (by Estrella) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Lovely atmosphere at the Olde Castle Bar.  A bit of a wait for a table at peak dinner time but we were happy to grab some ginger beer (with bitters and lemon per the barkeeper‚Äôs recommendation) and sit in the cosy bar area.  Excellent seafood and a mean lamb stew as well. (by Kate) [3 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - We were lucky to get a tight corner table on a Saturday afternoon. Food & service were great. Gluten free beer available- and very good! Also love the Kinnegar beer - and their marketing vibe is really fun. See the poster! Enjoy!! Even if your table is a tad uncomfortable üçªüòÇ (by John Pozer) [3 months ago] | Review 5: 3 stars - Even though the restaurant is quite large, it fills up quickly. As soon as we were seated, a line started forming at the door. Feels like one of those spots all the tourists go to. With so many people, the service was pretty much absent.

I tried the burger and the seafood linguine. The burger was a tad salty and the linguine was lacking in flavor. Maybe we came at a bad time. (by Tony Yu) [3 weeks ago] | Review 6: 4 stars - Went for lunch here, nice atmosphere and a lovely building. The goats cheese salad was delicious, plenty of cheese included, ravioli was also lovely. All reasonably priced and the staff were welcoming and friendly. (by George Nugent) [3 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - We ordered steak, seafood chowder, seafood platter, 4.5 Guinness, lemon meringue and 2 Irish coffee for around ‚Ç¨150. Fantastic value for money given the cosy venue and food was genuinely delicious. Definitely worth a visit as part of your trip to Donegal Town! (by Will Wong) [4 weeks ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Loved it! What is better than fresh drafted beer and tasty oysters at the bar on a saturday afternoon?? the locals were very
welcoming and you better appreciate the hospitality! üáÆüá™ (by B√©n√© B) [a month ago] | Review 9: 3 stars - We waited about an hour for a table on a Tuesday night. It has good reviews here so why not? We had the oysters, which was not as great as the other ones we‚Äôve had in Ireland. My son got the mussels which were fine ‚Äî how can you mess that up, right? And we also ordered the penne pasta and were warned ahead of time that it was spicy. We‚Äôve been to Thailand, we‚Äôve had really spicy Thai, Mexican and Indian food, this was going to be fine, right? Wrong! The chef decided to put only red pepper flakes in it. I mean, you definitely get the hear but where was the flavor?? The garlic and tomato flavor did not come through because of how much red pepper flakes were in the dish. We also ordered a caprese salad which helped to counter the spiciness. There were also two flies buzzing around the whole time we were eating so it was not very appetizing. (by Nichelle S) [2 months ago] | Review 10: 3 stars - Middle of the afternoon, took 10 min to get a table since only head waitress is allowed to assign tables. Staff tired and treating customers (not just us) poorly. Food arrived after 30 min (just chucked oysters). (by Frederic Jacquemin) [2 months ago]

name: Dawros Bay House
address: Eden, Co. Donegal, F94 XR66, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Genuinely one of the best restaurant experiences I have ever had. The location is stunning and the food is incredible. Everything you eat is completely fresh and sourced right down the road.

I got the seafood platter which had oysters, prawns, crab meat, crab claws, Mackrell, and battered fish. It is impossible to say what was the best part of the dish. It was incomparable to anything I have had before. My girlfriend had the lobster and agrees that it was by far the best seafood she has ever had in her life.

If anyone is looking for a hidden gem that gives you a world class experience I recommend this place. I cannot believe it is not talked about more.

Can't wait to come back. (by Fiachra Devenney) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - The view here is amazing and somehow the food is even better. I highly recommend getting a reservation and enjoying their hospitality. (by Ben McKenzie) [4 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Awesome location to try locally farmed oysters ü¶™ with some excellent views of the harbor üåÖ Very friendly staff üòå Dog friendly ü•∞ (by Andrei) [3 weeks ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - I had one of the best experiences of my life here. My friend and I were out for a long day driving along the Atlantic Way and found this spot on Google maps. On Google it said it was open so we drove an hour to eat here, but apparently they actually were closed. Pam and Maria were kind enough to serve us anyway. We had the most delicious and FRESH lobster and crab. They told us we couldn't have chips because the fryer was off, but their brother (sorry I didn't catch your name!) brought us chips anyway, which was so sweet. This is a family business and has been for decades and this fact is so apparent in the quality of food and friendliness of service. I hope to return here every time I'm back in Ireland.

Loved chatting. ü§ç

Just call ahead to ensure they're open üòâ (by Renee Cornue) [a year ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - I don't understand how this isn't rated 5 stars. Everything about our experience was just absolutely wonderful and honestly one of the best experiences I have had at a resteraunt. The service was so warm and friendly, sincere and kind. The location is just breathtaking, and we felt so relaxed and at ease inside. and the food was just fantastic.  Can't recommend enough. (by Matt Corroon) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Fabulous spot, amazing fresh fish and sea views. (by Dee L) [5 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Stayed for a magical night in this house with Joe and Maria and ate an exquisite seafood dinner ! Can't explain how atmospheric and unique this house/pub/restaurant is.  Wonderful spectacular views, generous friendly hosts, quirky funky decor with antique charm, delicious local food.  An artists paradise.  A gem of a place that people want to keep a secret - it should be preserved and supported and really is a charming and incredibly wild spot ! We are definitely returning for a longer stay. (by Anita Davis-Wheeler) [2 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Lovely food in unique setting. Rustic bar with great views and very welcoming staff. Recommend you ring in advance to make sure it‚Äôs open as times can vary throughout the summer. Also bring cash as card machine broken!! (by Sean O Connell) [3 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Dawros bay House is Irish character and charm in a box. Whilst it may look like just somebody's house from the inside, the inside is warm and welcoming. An obligatory bar stocked with the basics, sofas and chairs, a cosy fireplace and an extension eating maybe 10 people.

The food was delicious and clearly made with love and fresh ingredients.
The owners are friendly and inviting and the the guest we met there are even friendlier.

It's a must must visit if you're.in the Portnoo area and are looking for something different. (by Rodrigo Alejandro Navarro Flores) [a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Apparently experiences at this place have varied, based on the mood of the 'patron', but the night we were there it was wonderful, especially the seafood. They even sent us off with some of their home made soap! (by Niall Leonard) [2 months ago]

name: Proper Street Food
address: Unit 7, Super value, The Glebe, Glebe, Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - We have been to Proper Street Food several times, it's our favourite when visiting Donegal.  There were 9 of us altogether and everyone enjoyed their meals.  The portions are generous, in fact several of us took doggy bags home.  The food is super tasty with a great variety of cuisines available.  Staff are friendly and super helpful.  Love this place. (by vivienne watson) [a week ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - I had such a great experience !
The burger was fresh and delicious, full of flavour, and the shawarma was juicy and so yummy. My son is usually very picky with food, but even he loved it .and that says a lot! The whole family enjoyed the meal. Definitely a place we‚Äôll be coming back to. Highly recommend!
The best think I like as mom ,the kitchen and the shop is very clean, normally I do t eat outside but I really love to eat or order from here üòÅ (by Yaaa 6530) [2 weeks ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - I wonder how this place is not in the list of best things to visit in donegal.
It is one of the best street styled food in the town, it has a separate breakfast menu and a lunch menu as well.
I do recommend to go for the specials as well as they hard to miss.
We had ordered one of thier specials Korean fried chicken burger and Lebanese styled falafels taco which was served with salad and chips on the sides.
I was absolutely delighted with the burger and would highly recommend to have it if it is on the menu if you are to visit this place.
The tacos were also good which were served with chips and salad.
They also serve delicious cakes and pastry which are a must have after the lunch or a sides
The well brewed coffee cannot be said undone as well.
The service was top notch as we had a bit of confusion with the menu and the server were fortunate enough to help us  with it.
There is ample of parking available as well in the locality. (by ajay harmale) [11 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - This place is one of the best street styled food in the donegal town. They have a separate breakfast and  lunch menu which is served accordingly.
They also have specials for the day which is mentioned on the black board on the wall.
I wonder why this place is not in the top list or on the must visit place in town.
We went for lunch at this place and the place was almost full. No doubt why this place is always full. The food served here was spectacular and lip smacking as the name suggests "Proper Street Food".
We had ordered one from their specials -- Korean fried chicken burger and other from the lunch menu -- Lebanese styled falafels taco which was served with salad and chips on the sides.
We were absolutely delighted with the burger and would highly recommend having it if it is on the specials menu the day you visit.
The tacos were also excellent which was served with chips and salad on the side.
Not to forget the well brewed coffee, who doesn't like a nice coffee.
They also serve delicious desserts like cakes and pastry which are a must have after such delightful meal.
The service was top notch and the staff were very friendly and polite all the time. The food was served hot and fresh within a reasonable time.
There is plenty of space available for parking outside the restaurant.
I would recommend this place to all my friends and colleagues and also to people who read my review to please visit this place if you crave some fantastic street food with quality, quantity and most importantly taste. (by Devangi Dave) [11 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Definitely a place you have to try! They have really good food, which I wasn‚Äôt fully expecting. It was busy and there‚Äôs minimal setting so you may have to wait or order takeout. Staff is super friendly and you can tell the food was fresh! Would try the fish tacos and loaded fries! Slightly on the more expensive side but worth it! (by Abigail Torres) [8 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Great variety of street food - curries, noodles, burgers etc. All super fresh and delicious. Large portions, superb value. Regular specials and new additions.

Lunch specials for school kids are great - only 6.50 for a fresh meal and a drink. Adults can avail of the lunch special for 8.50 - if you get a chance, you should definitely grab a lunch special!

A must visit! (by Emma Corry) [Edited a year ago] | Review 7: 1 star - Hello. We‚Äôd like to share our disappointing experience at your caf√©. We approached a staff member (not sure if they were a cashier or a waiter) to ask about the price of the tiramisu. Unfortunately, they didn‚Äôt know and just ran off saying ‚Äúone moment‚Äù ‚Äî we ended up waiting for about three minutes while they were gone. Eventually, they came back and told us it was ‚Ç¨3 for a portion of tiramisu served in a plastic container, around 200 grams.

Sadly, the dessert was very disappointing: it was hard in texture, had an overpowering smell of alcohol, and the taste was unpleasant ‚Äî we couldn‚Äôt finish it and had to throw it away. Moreover, no one told us if we were allowed to sit anywhere, so we ended up eating on a worn-out bench in the shopping centre. We also had to ask for spoons separately. Overall, there was no proper service and the quality of the food was extremely poor. (by Julia Kaleeva) [2 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - The food was very tasty, however the burger was a bit fat. The salad and chips was included so it was big portion. Salad was very tasty with nice dressing. Chips were very good also. Great value for the money. (by Marcin Nowak) [2 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - A great alternative to eating at the high priced restaurants in downtown Donegal. This place has great food, attentive staff, local vibe and solid playlist. My wife and I tried the Baja fish taco and fish & chips, both were delicious! (by Roadlesstraveledguy) [2 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Did a quick search and plumped for here for lunch. Glad we did, the food was gorgeous.

The place was busy when we came at just after 1pm hard to find a car parking space and then a 10 minute wait whilst a table came free.

We ordered the Baja fish tacos, chilli garlic stir fry and kids chicken nuggets.

Service was friendly and good, good came quickly after ordering.

The fish tacos were superb. Two soft tacos, three large goujons of battered fish, spicy mayo and a big helping of fresh zingy salsa. Heavenly.

The weather outside wasn't Baja, but the food was! (by Grant Mackie) [a year ago]

name: The Wheelhouse Cafe
address: Leckenagh, Burtonport, Co. Donegal, FN4N9V6, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 4 stars - Nice meal here recently. The staff were friendly and the menu had lots of options. Not dog friendly unfortunately (by Linda Ayres) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - I was defeated by the pancakes! So delish! And very friendly, attentive staff. My partner enjoyed a toastie with soup. A great find.  We'll be back, nxt adventure. (by Maz C) [7 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Lovely place for lunch with a view. Food is exceptionally good. We‚Äôve ordered soup, mushroom Thai salad, burger, avocado toast, breakfast and smoothie, everything was amazing! Portions are generous. Staff is lovely! (by Tanya Nekrassova) [3 years ago] | Review 4: 4 stars - Visited several times with my non Vegan friend. We both enjoyed lunch, dinner, and hot drinks. Would definitely recommend and visit again if in the area. My only improvement suggestion would be for vegan desserts. Portions were great (my friend said her fish and chips was too much but I'm sure a bloke would be happily full) (by Tracy Cole) [3 years ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - The help to do it justice but it's just one of the best places near dungloe for breakfast. Staff very friendly. Toilets very clean.
Parking has no height restrictions so meant could park with roofbox or campervan easily. Space for about 15-20 cars probably and extra parking roadside probably possible.

Seems to share a path with their wheelhouse pods which would be handy.

Food was amazing. If we had have found this sooner we would have eat here everyday.

They also have a milkshake menu I think but I never got photo of it (by Ryan O donnell) [2 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Proper little cafe this one, lots of options, reasonable pricing. Good views out the window.
Great service yummy food cool interior
Little wait for a table but that‚Äôs the nature of the beast
I will never be back but I wish I could (by Ben Harding) [5 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Stopped here for brunch and will definitely be back. We had the fish and chips and the goats cheese panini. Really good service, friendly staff and the food was great - generous portions. Lovely decor inside and out, lots of parking and clean toilets- what more could you ask for?! It got really busy around 1230 so we were glad we were there early. (by Mary Coulter) [3 years ago] | Review 8: 2 stars - The food was covered in multiple servings of sauce, the eggs were cold and very runny and the avocado I paid extra for came on the side of the toast and was no where near ripe, it was too hard for even my fork to get through. (by Alexandra Doherty) [a month ago] | Review 9: 3 stars - Unfortunately this lovely wee place is Not Dog Friendly.

No dogs inside and they decide when to serve you outside.

So don‚Äôt bother going folks if you have the wee doggies with you. On the other hand the food was grand the last time they served us (by Tim D) [3 weeks ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - Cozy caf√© to get breakfast or lunch. Fast and very friendly service. I had the Peri Peri chicken burger which was presented quite good. Tasted good as well. A little bit spicy but i like that.

Toilets could be cleaner and TP was empty, also in the ladies room.

I recommend this place with good food! (by Benjamin Migom) [4 years ago]

name: The Orchard Gastropub & Garden
address: High Rd, Letterkenny, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - I had dinner there for two days in a row and I found amazing food and amazing service! Shout out to the waiter who recognized me the second day: you were so nice! Keep up with the good job :) (by Luca Baraldi) [6 months ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - Calls itself a Gatro pub, that‚Äôs a bit OTT, but very good pub grub.
Steak night on Wednesday, my ribeye had some tough gristle but overall was cooked to my liking.
