Very good Guinness. (by Duncan Edwards) [5 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Food is always excellent here for the price really fresh and tasty! Very impressed to get restaurant quality in a pub! (by Daithi O‚ÄôConnor) [2 weeks ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Went for Sunday lunch , top class üëå excellent service and staff, food was excellent, definitely would recommend (by Shaun Boyce) [9 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - An absolute gem of a pub. Food was unreal. Great portions presentation and filling. The beers are excellent. The conversations in this pub are so friendly and fun.  Really cool place to unwind and be with great company. Highly recommend (by Dave Schneider) [6 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Awesome Food, Awesome Service, Great Beer, super quick! Awesome. (by Paul Tohill) [a month ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Great food, excellent service. (by Elaine Scanlon) [2 months ago] | Review 8: 3 stars - An okay okayish place if you're looking for a quiet nice.Food is also okay,but not out of this world.Music is fair (by Sikhanyisile Dube) [6 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Good food, nice pub, friendly staff. And there are vegetarian options! (by Fiona Schauer) [8 months ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - This place has bery nice and hard working staff. Social Distancing is in place for whom is concerned. They food is great and service is quick. Very nice, well done. (by Aaron Doherty) [4 years ago]

name: Supermac's & Papa John's Donegal
address: R267, Drumlonagher, Co. Donegal, F94 N24R, Ireland
service_options: Apache Pizza Donegal ¬∑ 3.0 stars ¬∑ 150 reviews ¬∑ Pizza Delivery, Shamrock Chinese Takeaway ¬∑ 4.0 stars ¬∑ 57 reviews ¬∑ Chinese Takeout
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Found this place by chance and popped in, tried SuperSubs and was delighted by the choice and quality. They were able to cater for dairy and gluten intolerant member of our party, with staff being knowledgeable and considerate.

Thoroughly recommend. In fact we went back a couple of days later.

First time I had the Cajun chicken sub on sourdough. Second time had a chicken & pesto salad box. (by Grant Mackie) [2 years ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - fantastic food and service.  apart of waiting times for food everything was just great (by Monika Szylczak-Witulska) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 4 stars - Quickly tasty food at super subs. We asked for gluten free, given a few options, server was more than helpful. Would highly recommend.
Back a few months later, gad supermacs today, did not disappoint (by Patricia McDonnell) [Edited a year ago] | Review 4: 2 stars - Late afternoon on a Saturday.  It was busy alright but not for me.  Coffee cold. Sandwich salad counter closed.  Burgers take it or leave it and pizza of course. (by Dan Joseph) [7 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Best papa and supermacs lovely outstanding staff go the extra mile (by Fionnbar Owens) [2 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Always brilliant food and staff a1 (by Aaron McKeown) [3 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Tidy ! Very busy though... not many seats (by Robert Clarkson) [4 months ago] | Review 8: 4 stars - Good food, good staff, but food is pricey (by Ken Duke) [7 months ago] | Review 9: 4 stars - It's our family go to treat. We do always have to check our order as there is normally some mistake or missing. But the staff are mostly helpful and friendly. The cleaning, can be great somedays and others you really need to be ok to wipe down the baby seats and table. (by Karen Byrne) [3 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - very good place for a break in the journey, good service and delicious food (by Pawel Bialon) [7 months ago]

name: The Lagoon Restaurant & Guesthouse Donegal
reviews:
Review 1: None - Called in here today after a walk in Ards, delighted we did, service, food and atmosphere were fantastic. Darragh was very nice and friendly,  talked and made us feel very welcome. Lovely big fire on, place was spotless, toilets were very clean and loads of hand wash and hot water. Will certainly be back and highly recommend this place for food. (by Grainne McGowan) | Review 2: None - Terrible!  Shocking actually.  We visited the restaurant/bar around 8.30pm.
Filthy paper menu to start.  They felt disgusting to hold and we should have walked out, however we had drinks in front of us and there was nowhere else to eat in the area at that time.
We ordered fish & chips, thinking we hardly go too wrong.  When the food arrived, the batter was thick and dark brown.  Clearly the ‚Äúfreshly battered fish‚Äù had been fried in filthy old oil.  I couldn‚Äôt eat the batter, it was so disgusting.  I picked out the fish which was hardly there, must have been a small piece of cod before it was lathered in thick batter.  The chips needed a little more cooking and the mushy peas were directly out of a tin.
I rarely write bad reviews, I prefer not to damage a struggling business.  I just need to let other know so they can manage their expectations should they have the absolute need to eat here. (by Hazel Johnston) | Review 3: None - We stopped in here for a spot of dinner and really enjoyed the very traditional atmosphere. The bar man and server were lovely, friendly and so helpful.

We enjoyed it so much that we went back the second night for dinner as well. The food was lovely, freshly cooked and the dessert were sweet and tasty.

There was a lovely log fire burning in the background and we‚Äôre definitely recommend here for dinner. (by Ted Carnduff) | Review 4: None - Excellent food, very friendly service, thank you Anne for your kindness, we have enjoyed our 3 dinners in your restaurant. (by Sophie Derouwaux) | Review 5: None - Stopped here for dinner - I had chicken wings, daughter had chicken strips or gougon as they are called here - the chef knows what he is doing - dara was our server and was helpful with tourist advice and where to stay (by ruth thorne) | Review 6: None - Food & service great, enjoyable feed & handy to stop off on your journey (by Ann-Marie Duggan) | Review 7: None - I only used the restaurant.
Great food and staff are very friendly !!!
Good value for money . (by Daniel Murray) | Review 8: None - Great food,  definitely I will back üòã (by bad boy nice) | Review 9: None - Stopped in for dinner while on holiday. Service was inattentive. When it came time to settle the bill, my card was ran twice with error. Decided to settle up with cash. The next day after leaving town I saw that the charges had gone through. Called back to the restaurant the next three days to correct the mistake. Each time I was told no manager was on duty but that they'd pass my number to them and never got a call back.

I've since disputed the charges since coming home. (by Brandon Macbride) | Review 10: None - We stopped here for lunch and were made to feel welcome. We were able to bring our dogs into the pub section which was really nice. The food was good and reasonably priced. (by Michelle Brenton)

name: Curry Cottage Indian Restaurant Stranorlar Ballybofey
address: Main St, Stranorlar, Ballybofey, Co. Donegal, F93 NY8H, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - The Curry Cottage is a bustling little jewel of a restaurant in Stranorlar. The waiters are really lovely. The food is simply delicious and we were all delighted with our meals. I had the chicken Jalfrezi special and it was yum. Spicy enough without been too hot. The good thing is that the food is consistently good, in the 3+ years that we have been going there. We'll definitely be returning. (by L B) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Went to the Curry Cottage today with the family, and every one of us left delighted, each dish had beautiful spices and tasted gorgeous, even the cheesecake I got for dessert was fresh and tasted amazing,
I went for the Garlic chilli chicken bhuna and it would recommend to try it, very good blend of flavours and spices
On top of the food being amazing, the waiters are top notch, so friendly and always had a smile üòä
Will be returning üòÄ (by Ryan Wilson) [3 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Fantastic. I had a Lamb sag, vindaloo hot, and it was. My wife‚Äôs pasanda was lovely. Lemon rice was the best I‚Äôve had in years. It was my birthday and I mentioned that when I was waiting for my takeaway. The guy behind the counter immediately gave me a free beer while I waited. Great experience.

Update 9 months on. I ordered the same again and there was a big mix up! I had to take it back. I‚Äôd ordered a lamb sag and I got a chicken sag. Or did I? The chef was adamant it was lamb, I was adamant it was chicken. The problem was it was ‚Äú‚Äùtikka‚Äù! I never ever order tikka, I want the meat, not the frozen marinaded stuff. Even when I got the replacement they‚Äôd still used tikka lamb and honestly I‚Äôd have still argued it was chicken!

But, it was gorgeous, extremely tasty lemon rice and mushroom rice. But seriously, I DO NOT want tikka. If I‚Äôd wanted tikka I‚Äôd have ordered tikka.

Through this mistake, the staff were fantastic. Professional, attentive, not at all defensive. Couldn‚Äôt do enough to sort it out. It‚Äôs honestly down to just serving what is ordered, not what you think the customer wants. (by C) [Edited 3 weeks ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - They have excellent service. My wife is a vegan due to dietary restrictions and they have always been wonderful. The server we usually end up getting always remembers her being a vegan and answers all her questions about dishes. There are plenty of vegan dishes here for her. The food tastes amazing and the portion sizes are great as well. Overall an amazing experience. (by Ciara Glackin) [5 months ago] | Review 5: 3 stars - I had read all the reviews, so last Wednesday  16th April, drove an hour and a half to go try this restaurant.  Sadly, it did not live up to my expectations.  I've been to many many Indian restaurants, in various countries and would consider myself a reasonable judge of good Indian food.  My first genuine Indian meal was 50 yrs ago, in my friends house ! The food here is just ok. Service was ok. Staff seemed friendly.  Would I go back? NO. Try it out for yourself but it's not for me. (by Gerry Gallagher) [5 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - I was Honestly blown away when I visited Curry cottage. The staff were incredibly welcoming and attentive, and the food was great! By far the best Indian food in the Balleybofey-Stranorlar area. (by Sean Gorman) [2 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - You can taste the quality in every bite. Best Indian food in Donegal ‚Äî a must-try! (by Nazrul Islam) [2 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - The food here is always fresh and delicious. Definitely the top spot for Indian cuisine in Donegal! (by Foysol Ahmed) [2 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Delicious food every time. Curry Cottage is a gem ‚Äî easily the best Indian food in Donegal. (by Mdliponahmed) [2 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Fantastic flavours, great prices. Curry Cottage is hands down the best Indian restaurant in Donegal. (by Md Nurul Isalm) [2 months ago]

name: The Shamrock Bar
address: Margarita‚Äôs Cocktail Bar, Falcarragh, Letterkenny, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - During my recent trip to Donegal, my hosts introduced me to a true hidden gem - The Shamrock LodgeüçÄNestled in the heart of town, this cozy pub is far more than a place for a pint - it‚Äôs a gathering spot where the local community comes together, stories flow as freely as the laughter, and friendships are built.
What struck me most was that you don‚Äôt need to raise a glass of Irish beer to feel the spirit of the place - the warmth, camaraderie, and hospitality embrace you the moment you step inside.
If you ever find yourself in Donegal, don‚Äôt miss this little haven. A heart, heritage, and a true Irish welcome! Here‚Äôs to new friends, timeless traditions, and finding community wherever you go.
#Donegal#ShamrockLodge#IrishHospitality#FromIndiaToIreland#HiddenGem#GlobalFriendship #FromIndiaWithLove (by Betty Thomas) [5 days ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - This bar is truly special! It has such an authentic Irish bar feel, and I was so warmly welcomed by everyone I met! I miss them all so very much! I even got to meet the owner and he was super welcoming as well! I had an absolutely fantastic time and can't wait to go back! (by Shannon Clark) [3 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Great place to bring in your own food from nearby take aways and grab a table and order your favorite beverage. Great wood fired Pizza food trailer right out the front door and gluten free fish and chips a few doors down at Something Fishy. (by Barbara DeBaere Poppy) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Lovely pub with lots of seating, great history and energy. Loved our time for a wee drink. (by Will Bowen) [a month ago] | Review 5: 4 stars - No food available but we had a drink. Staff friendly and helpful. Drink was good value. Lovely quirky decor. Very atmospheric and interesting to sit and read all the slogans and quotes while enjoying a drink. Would love to go back again when it's busy. I'd say it's great craic. (by Ann) [2 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - A HUGE thumbs up to the Shamrock bar for allowing dogs inside and recognising what customers want.

There is not a single other bar, cafe, restaurant, shop or building within Falcarragh or all the surrounding towns that will allow dogs inside. Every place we've tried have rejected us with our small cockapoo dog. They really need to recognise the changing times and what customers want, they are losing so much business. The rest of the world is changing and starting to understand what their customers want and Ireland is being left behind, again.

If someone was to open a dog friendly cafe and advertise the fact in a busy place like Dunfanaghy etc they would get a roaring trade from dog owners and those that like to pet dogs.

Come on, get with the times and recognise what your customers want, there is a reason why the rest of the world is starting to allow dogs in.

Well done to The Shamrock Lodge bar!!!!!! (by Andy Czyzewski) [Edited a year ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - I've been to The Shamrock Lodge couple times on my travels now.  Great Pub to grab a pint of Guinness.  It's set up as a traditional Irish Pub.  Smaller front bar, and a larger area in the rear with a pool table and juke box.
There's an outside patio in the rear, with a few tables.  Even sheltered tables for smokers that don't want to get wet.  Both didn't work for me that night.  The wind was crazy.  Don't miss the mural of the story of legend of Balor. He's pretty famous in this region.  It shows Balor's death by Lugh, the princess that was sent to Tory Island.  The mural has seen better days, but it is outside and the weather can take its toll on it.
Food is not served here, but there are takeout menu's around.  The place wasn't crowded on this particular Saturday night, but neither was the other pub I visited while waiting for my cab. Don't Drink and Drive! (by Robert Paflitzko) [7 years ago] | Review 8: 2 stars - Nice enough bar but clean robbery. Bought 3 drinks (the exact same drink everytime) and the price of my drink increased everytime. Started at ‚Ç¨12.50 and by the third drink it was ‚Ç¨14.50. Daylight robbery, ‚Ç¨12.50/14.50 for one drink is an absolute joke, ‚Ç¨45 odds for 3 drinks. Joke (by T T) [5 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Lovely pub. Amazing atmosphere. Got served by Aaron and I‚Äôve never had better service in my life. I was treated like family. (by Ronan McHugh) [6 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - If anyone gets as far north as Falcarragh in Southern Island and wants a night out. This is the place. Quirky bars and saloons, authentic Irish music. Great atmosphere. (by Paul Rane) [2 years ago]

name: Brewery Bar and Restaurant
address: Market Square, Letterkenny, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - A good-feeling place. The servers and who I believe was the manager were jovial and pleasant. The food was good  as were the prices. We stopped to get a quick bite midday.
There was just us and some people from our corner of the world in there! It was quite funny being 8 hours plane away from home, finding people who live 1 hr away from you in the same town less traveled by most tourists. Sept 12, 2024 (by A J (Lexi)) [3 weeks ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Honestly the most delicious food and amazing, friendly service, wish I could remember the ladies name! Awesome atmosphere (by Penny Aldridge) [6 days ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - We've called in a few times for a drink and decided today to have the good. Service was fantastic and the food came quite quickly. Every part of our meal was absolutely delicious. We had a local ipa with our meal which was also really nice. Also really lovely atmosphere. Definitely coming back. Highly recommend üëå (by Siobhan Tierney) [6 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - The fish and chips truly hit the spot! For ‚Ç¨18, the portion was generous, and every bite was delicious. I also liked the mushy peas. I was pleasantly surprised by how quickly the food arrived, and the quieter atmosphere in the smaller Wee Bar made for a really enjoyable meal. (by Benjamin C.) [5 months ago] | Review 5: 4 stars - Nice food and Pleasant environment. We had a very good fish and chips! (by Daniele Alba) [2 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - One of the best pub and restaurant in Letterkenny. Friendly and fast service. The staff were very attentive and made sure we had everything and a good time.
Delicious food with good portions.
Love the ambiance of the place.
We went there twice in a row for dinner. It wasn‚Äôt crowded on a Wednesday evening and had a very calm & quiet time. but thr place was super crowded on the evening before a holiday and it had a very loud bit cheerful vibe. Loved the overall experience there. (by Sammani Rambukwella) [a year ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Had a steak sandwich. Chips 4.8 / 5. Crispy on the outside, fluffy on the inside, best chips I had in a while. Why not 5 / 5? Maybe add a little twist like adding a bit of beef fat Iin the fryer. Steak 4.5 / 5 perfectly medium but a little bit anaemic looking, bit hotter pan for a good maillard reaction but definitely a good steak. Not a salad person but this one was good, maybe some vinaigrette to keep it mouster. Goes perfectly with a Kinnegar Craggy Bay IPA. Will I be back? For sure! Overall 4.6 (by Paddy Pleiner) [6 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Great place to adventure to for drinks, and local experience for a tourist to enjoy. Food was amazing and portions were plenty. Staff all welcoming and helpful. (by Gale Lynn Porter) [a year ago] | Review 9: 1 star - I‚Äôm a coeliac and was delighted to see loads of gf options on the menu. Me and my non gf friend both got chicken wings. I was charged ‚Ç¨1 more than him just for being gluten free- didn‚Äôt get gf bread or different sauce. Our plates were the exact same. Management maintains it‚Äôs for the ‚Äúextra work‚Äù to make the food gluten free which I‚Äôve never heard of and is quite frankly discrimination. I told the manager this and he said ‚Äúwell that‚Äôs the way it is my dear‚Äù. Very dismissive of a paying customer. It‚Äôs not about the money, I can spare the euro. But eating out with an allergy is enough of a nightmare without the restaurant not only making you feel like an inconvenience for deciding to support their business but charging you for it! (by Caitriona Duddy) [2 weeks ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - During our 1 week holiday in the Letterkenny area, we have visited the Brewery 3 times for dinner. There are a lot of options to choose from, and all of them delicious! Good portions, great beer & cider, plus very friendly staff :). We kept coming back! (by Maartje Mulder) [2 months ago]

name: Seaview Tavern
reviews:
Review 1: None - This place is absolutely stunning, all the atmosphere and localisation makes you want to stay there forever.
Very nice and cozy rooms, comfortable beds, and breakfast what should be presented as an example of perfection. Restaurant also very recommended- I‚Äôve got hake with lime risotto- and was beautiful.
Apart of all of that - what makes this place incredible is their staff. I‚Äôm travelling a lot and in Seaview Tavern I met most friendly and care staff ever. They are treasure. (by Marek Z) | Review 2: None - We Had the sea food sharing platter and it was all so fresh. The highlight has to be the Crab toes and King Prawns which were served warm, the rest comes served cold. The mussels another standout, beautiful and really fresh too. No problem with accomdating children. (2 under 3s).
Set in arguably one of the most stunning locations in all of Ireland to have lunch or dinner.
Great service from the always friendly and helpful staff. All round excellent. (by Calvin Gallen) | Review 3: None - Myself and a friend eat here two nights in a row - we had different dishes each night all fish based - the food was excellent and so fresh. I had salmon on night two and it was the best i've ever eaten.
The service was exceptional
A great restaurant (by seaclin) | Review 4: None - A nice bar restaurant near Malin Head. A few comfortable rooms for overnight stays.
Old public bar area leads to lounge and a bright open garden room area.
Large restaurant that is popular and serves good food. 4-6 picnic tables to front allow outside eating with a nice north view out into the Atlantic. (by Mark H) | Review 5: None - We thought this was a sea food specialist however the sea food section was only a third of the menu, with the rest being the usual burger menu etc .  We had the sea food platter which is one of the most expensive items on the menu but is was a disappointment.  The prawns seem to be from lidl and were cold, the mussels were cold seem to be from a jar or tin, the crab legs were nice( all 4 of them)  and the platter was bulked out with a salad. The smoked salmon was OK. Overall not a Plate to warrant the cost. My colleagues thought the pasta was poor for the price. The location is fabulous with a great view of the Atlantic from the windows,  it's a shame they allow cars to park in front of the window to block the view.  Overall not a sea food restaurant as expected and certainly not compared to others around the world I have visited. (by Stephen Mc Laughlin) | Review 6: None - Glorious location with a fabulous menu. We had scones, pastries, soup, sambos & coffee on a lovely sunny morning passing through Malin on our üö≤ üö¥‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è üöµ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è. Catriona and all her team looked after our large group wonderfully and we look forward to returning! Great spot. (by Joe Hennessy) | Review 7: None - we loved this restaurant, outstanding food at great prices. we stayed in the malin head area for 5 days and visited the restaurant every day it was that good. fish landed 100m away ensures the freshest possible fish, and homemade chips to die for. (by Sylvia Clayton) | Review 8: None - A real jewel in the most northern spot of Ireland. Wonderful place, with astonishing views and super friendly staff. And soon with more rooms to accommodate more people. I've been there a few times during the last years, and I will be back!! Is a must after visiting Malin Head.
Thanks very much for feeding us during our charity cycle supporting LauraLynn!! (by David Cristobal) | Review 9: None - We did a small wedding here and it was the perfect venue for a small reception! We had an amazing time, got incredible help from the staff and ate some amazing food. If you want to do a small wedding, do it here! The area is gorgeous. We travelled from Canada to use this as our space. (by JennaMike) | Review 10: None - Stopped at the Seaview Hotel for breakfast while visiting the area..this a must for anyone coming up to Malin Head. As soon as we arrived we were made to feel welcome by all the lovely staff..my husband and I both had the cooked ‚Ä¶ (by Q2016FLclarec)

name: Market House Restaurant
address: Donegal, Diamond, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Had a wonderful meal here during our stay in Donegal, food was excellent and our server Sandra was very knowledgeable on the menu and very personable! (by John Abbott) [5 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Food looks good and very tasty üòã üòç
Highly recommend üëå üëç (by Jurgita Kulikauskiene) [4 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - The service is at a high level, the food is delicious.  We were greeted with a compliment from the restaurant, the bread was incredibly delicious.
Linguini were perfectly cooked.
And the coffee.. many thanks for the coffee, Italian espresso ‚òï
Prices are ‚Ç¨‚Ç¨ (by Yani Terzieva) [Edited a year ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - What an excellent place, the food was outstanding, the decor is so nice and the staff was excellent to.
Would highly recommend here, every one of the group loved it.
Lamb excellent, steak excellent, fish excellent nothing more to say but try it. (by Padraig McGuire (BusManPaddy)) [2 years ago] | Review 5: 1 star - Food was overpriced and not good. We got the burger and seafood risotto, and both lacked flavor. Bread was hard to cut and hard (I don‚Äôt think it was supposed to be). Save yourself the money and try something else. (by Allison McLaughlin) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Beautiful food , portion size very appropriate,some lovely touches and a great waitress , thank you to the lady on front desk for fitting us in without a reservation and to our taxi driver who recommended it . Everything was perfect. (by Franky Crowley) [3 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Had the steak on the stone just to die for,lovely staff especially Anne really good. (by Pius Mcfadden) [5 days ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - We stayed at the Abbey Hotel and had dinner downstairs at the Market house in May 2023. I still think about the food we had that night! Especially the Fish Pie! (by Treva Pletscher) [a month ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - The food was beautiful and the service was amazing. Very attentive and friendly staff .
The atmosphere was very classy and convenient for a special birthday night .
Very highly recommended .
Thx for the special gesture on my husband's birthday.  Very well appreciated üëè (by Liliane Davidson) [6 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Just a quick stop for food, I had Turkey and ham it was delicious. The staff here are so friendly had a good laugh. I then ended up running the new guinness 00. yes that right, non alcoholic. try this place out you wont be disappointed (by Daithi Aye) [4 years ago]

name: The Courthouse Restaurant
address: The Heritage Centre, Drumbaran, Ardara, Co. Donegal, F94 TDE9, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Amazing food, some of the best we‚Äôve had in Ireland thus far (by Emily Ryan) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Friendly staff and fresh, wonderful food!  We had the Seafood Chowder (filled to the top) & bread and Fishcakes (2 large) with mixed greens, tomato, red onion, beetroot, coleslaw, carrots, potato salad & garlic bread.  Also had hot chocolate and tea - the total meal cost was ‚Ç¨33.  Two people left happy with full stomachs! (by Eric C.) [a year ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Spontaneous trip to Ardara and happened to come here for lunch and to escape the rain. Food was spectacular and staff were so friendly and helpful. The best food we had during our trip! Will definitely be back and recommending here to friends. (by Neesha) [3 years ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Lovely bakery/restaurant. The food was delicious and the portions very generous. The staff were super friendly and helpful. We bought cake slices home and those were very yummy too. Would definitely recommend. (by cris metcalfe) [4 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Excellent Restaurant and Bakery, food and service were amazing.

Only negative, as it was very busy we were in a back room/overflow and not the quaint front room.

Will be back for the fish and chips, and the mushy peas, best ever! (by John O'Brien) [2 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Absolutely amazing food and service. I had the smoked salmon salad which came with delicious wheaten bread. 10/10 and will definitely be back again! (by Joanne Loftus) [a year ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Lovely food! A great little place in the town, with friendly staff :) We had an open prawn salad, spicy chicken salad and a warm goats cheese salad - all 10/10 (by Siobhan McGill) [2 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - today was soup of the day, vegetarian.  very tasty, at first I thought it will be not enough, but in the end I took the second course in a lunch box with me, because soup  was incredibly tasty and satisfying.  when I started to try the second dish, the fish ball inside the crispy crust turned out to be very tender pieces of salmon.  the dish was complemented by vegetables and salads, so it was amazing and I liked everything, thanks for the pleasant atmosphere (by Daria Zhyvchenko) [Edited 2 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - What a fantastic place to visit
The Courthouse Restaurant.
Thank you to the very kind staff, the food is absolutely spectacular. A place to go and have lunch when visiting Ardara. I really loved the carrot cake. (by Catriona Hegarty) [Edited a year ago] | Review 10: 4 stars - Decent food. Lovely staff. Easy location. Food was pricey for lunch especially for kids but tasty. (by Cliona Flynn) [2 months ago]

name: Harvey's Point
reviews:
Review 1: None - Attended a wedding at the hotel. Ceremony and reception. The location is really nice on the banks of the lake. Weather allowed for the ceremony to be outside.
The hotel rooms were huge and of a very high quality. Food was exceptional wedding related and food eaten at other times. Staff were really nice and helpful. By far the best hotel stayed in, in some time. (by Ian Keoghan) | Review 2: None - Great hotel in a very picturesque location which arguably should be a 5 star. Food is excellent and staff are friendly and helpful. Rooms are fantastic.
Downsides are location and the price of accommodation. Location great if only staying there, not so much if plan is to head to Donegal Town. (by Ciaran McConville) | Review 3: None - My wife and I spent 2 nights in Harvey‚Äôs Point to celebrate our wedding anniversary. Upgraded to a lovely Lakeshore Suite üëç|Food was fantastic. Breakfast excellent, dinner even better. Lovely walks and a great switch off location, Highly Recommended. Will most certainly be returning. ‚Ä¶ (by Explorer8137) | Review 4: None - We treated ourselves to a 2 night stay at Harvey's for my husbands birthday and as always it never disappoints. We have spent so many wonderful nights here and have very fond memories. The staff are amazing and nothing is too much trouble. ‚Ä¶ (by deancZ5044BM) | Review 5: None - Magnificent Harvey‚Äôs Point Donegal |"Our stay at  Harvey‚Äôs Point was  exceptional! From the moment we arrived, the staff were attentive and went out of their way to make us feel so comfortable, Nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were ‚Ä¶ (by B5005YMannetteg) | Review 6: None - Harvey's continues to excel in all aspects of hospitality and accommodation. Room was very spacious, pristine, excellently serviced and bed extremely comfortable and clean. Hotel staff were personable, courteous, efficient and welcoming. ‚Ä¶ (by Y5256KXmichaelb) | Review 7: None - Wonderful stay at Harvey's Point for 40th Wedding anniversary. We booked a mountain view room with balcony and could have spent all our time just soaking in the view. This hotel was the highlight of our road trip. Breakfast was the best ‚Ä¶ (by Y9889PJangelam) | Review 8: None - Best not to go for just one night but it was how it worked out for us.  I will be saying the same things over again, lol....Especial thanks to Geraldine and all the restaurant staff not forgetting Orhan, and of course Chef for the wonderful ‚Ä¶ (by Fair-Foodie) | Review 9: None - Harvey's Point never fails to get the best feedback from all my guests who've stayed here. They rave about the spacious rooms, relaxed atmosphere and extremely friendly and helpful staff. I'd highly recommend this hotel. (by Northwest Sherpa Tours) | Review 10: None - Harvey‚Äôs Point is a special place. While it‚Äôs a distance out of Donegal town, it‚Äôs a hotel where you can spend several days, not leave, and thoroughly enjoy yourselves. Elegant rooms, upscale restaurant and bar scene, immaculate service. A ‚Ä¶ (by 714jimr)

name: Ahoy Cafe
address: Shore Rd, Killybegs, Co. Donegal, F94 V322, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 4 stars - A great place for fresh seafood with a few gluten-free options. Jealous of my sister‚Äôs fish taco but the crab and avocado sandwich on gluten free bread was great. The unexpected find of a bit of cling film in my sandwich was quickly rectified by their gracious staff. Accidents happen. Highly recommend. (by Linda Shearer) [2 weeks ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Great place for lunch or breakfast. Staff are friendly and very attentive. The crab burgers on brioche bun were excellent as were the curved chips ( best chips we‚Äôve had!). For breakfast, try the frenchie toast with fruit on brioche bread ‚Äî- very tasty. Avocado toast was good but could have used a bit more avocado - otherwise excellent! Atmosphere is great. Beautiful views from inside the restaurant or outside on the patio. (by Shirle Ternan) [2 years ago] | Review 3: 2 stars - We arrived and waited to be seated. We waited and waited... And waited to have our orders taken. The food arrived. Small thin portion of haddock and small portion of chips served in a little basket. The food was very average. Not awful. Not great. (by Paul Ramwell) [2 weeks ago] | Review 4: 2 stars - Sadly a disappointing breakfast. Have been going here for 5 years. Usually a wait so asked for our hot drinks to be brought with food. Told could not be done as policy to bring out drinks first. Turned out to be an extra long wait. Pancakes like doorstops with none of the fruit or garnishes. Rest of the food was mediocre. Annoyed did not complain at the time. (by Louise Kehoe) [a month ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Definitely the best choice for lunch! üôÇ A place with a great atmosphere, spectacular food and very friendly staff. Very good coffee too! We will be back 100% üí´ (by Nicole Kelly) [7 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - What a great spot, especial as you're first breakfast after crossing the North Atlantic. The breakfast sandwich was fantastic. The warm scone with the berry compote and whipped cream (let's call it that, because I'm sure there is a better Irish word for it) was awesome. (by Trevor Harris) [3 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Great view, excellent service and fresh and tasty breakfast. What more could you ask for?
They were kind enough to furnish a veggie breakfast as well, even though they didn't have it on the menu. (by Vatsal Mishra) [2 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Got the crab avocado sandwich, probably the best sandwich I‚Äôve ever had. Fish chowder and vegetable soup were also delicious. Nice atmosphere and lovely staff. Definitely recommend! (by Weronika Lesniak) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Although we have visited and eaten in Killybegs before,  we were advised to visit here.

There is some seating outside and some steps to the entrance but there is also a small path and the actual entrance is step free as well.

Seating inside is bright and airy with a fantastic view of the harbour and the big fishing boats.

The lady serving us was helpful and polite and the food came out promptly.

I had the fish (haddock) and chips served with a small side salad. The fish was wrapped in a lovely batter and the chips are amazingly scrumptious.

I live 30+ miles away and it takes about 50 minutes to get here but I would definitely come here again, we‚Äôll worth the visit. (by 6373nerd) [2 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Called in to this cafe on way to Sliabh Liag cliffs which are close by. It's been expanded since my last visit, only bought coffee, which as before was excellent. It's on the edge of Killybegs, plenty of part and mighty views of the port and the fishing vessels (by Donnchadh Kilgallon) [a month ago]

name: Cove Restaurant
address: Rockhill, Portnablagh, Co. Donegal, F92 C970, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - What an experience. We were celebrating my partners birthday and I don‚Äôt think there would have been a better for it, just the two of us. Beautiful AMAZING food. And staff who are too lovely to be true :) I couldn‚Äôt recommend it more üçΩÔ∏è Super attentive, and professional. I don‚Äôt leave many reviews, but this one was necessary!!!! ‚Ä¶ (by CORO) [a week ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Where do I start with this amazing restaurant!

Firstly when I was trying to book I was doing a solo trip and couldn't get a table for one online, but after a few emails to Siobh√°n she got one for me, which I'm so glad of now.

Siobh√°n greeted me as I came in and was very friendly and helpful.

I went for 3 courses and a glass of wine. They have a great wine list and the one I got was great, I heard others also loving their wine.

For starters I got the Croquettas, they were so delicious, the mayo, the chorizo and cheese combination, it was great.

Next up for the main, I choose the Noones free range chicken. This may be the best chicken dish I have had in my life, really crispy skin around the chicken breast, the chicken drumstick was super tender and the mash was perfect. This was such a great main, and for my side I had got the glazed carrots and they were absolutely divine.

Lastly for the desert, I got the Chocolate orange delice, this was fantastic also although I was bursting at the brim by this point. The smooth creamy chocolate delice and the walnut and blueberry combo was perfect.

The staff were very friendly and very helpful.

The atmosphere was great, it was quiet for me which was great as I had a book, and the music also was very good.

I love the decor as well, there are amazing paintings all along the wall upstairs and I wanted to go around looking at them as if in a gallery.

From my seat as well I could also see out to the cliffs and water which was amazing.

This was a truly amazing dining experience, thanks to the Cove Restaurant for giving me such a good time. (by Gary conlon) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 3 stars - To say I was disappointed here would be an understatement but my wife had a better experience than I hence the three out of five instead of one/two.

To start it seemed the night we visited they may have been short staffed or missing a manager - the three wait staff were doing their best but I‚Äôd say need some older/experienced guidance. The menu definitely sets up the belief that this will be a five star experience - but it falls short‚Ä¶

The starters were by far the best experience of the night they arrived fairly quick and were delicious - zero issues here.

An hour and 15 minutes after this our mains arrived, my wives was excellent exactly what she was expecting - my lamb shoulder was partially cold and lacking in quantity and quality with about 1/5 of what it was being gristle or bone/fat which was inedible.

Other issues were trying to get attention of staff towards the end and unsure if it was the owner or someone else sat chatting to them instead of letting them clear up for the evening.

A comment from my wife was that the room was fairly filled with smoke from the kitchen, some better ventilation required.

All in all what seemed like it would be a delicate and nice experience turned into something that McDonalds could have rivalled for atmosphere and speed. Seems previous awards no longer represent what is possible at least on this night. (by Shane Porter) [3 weeks ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - I went there with my family last night. It was 5 star from start to finish. The food was fantastic and so was the service. I would highly recommend the mussels as a starter. (by Evan Reid) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Cove restaurant and owner Siobhan exceeded any expectations we might have had ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
The most beautiful , relaxed atmosphere. Our table overlooking the water was so special .
Our dinners were delicious !
You can tell when someone loves the work they do . So much effort has gone into making the guests enjoy every moment.
Our 50 th wedding Anniversary at Cove will be a night to remember .
Thank you ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è (by Debbie G) [6 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - The Cove is just a fantastic experience. Great local food, fantastic service and the ambiance is so chilled. Definitely worth experiencing. (Regularly) Siobhan and Team are so welcoming. (by Brian Gilfedder BSSc Hons) [6 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - You wouldn't think much from the fairly anonymous building but inside the restaurant is really nice.   The menu was a problem for me - I wanted to try EVERYTHING.  I settled for the baked beetroot starter which was delicious, but also enjoyed a good helping muscles.  These were local and superb.  My lamb with harissa main was delicious.  There were plenty of good options on the wine list which were very reasonably priced compared to what I am used to in the UK.  Service was very friendly, we received a warm welcome, everything went to the exactly the right pace.  Overall, a very pleasing meal in a lovely restaurant.  I hope I get a another chance to eat here. (by Peter campbell-burns) [2 weeks ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - This place is a treasure 'Cove' üòâ.
The ambience, personal welcome, high standard of food, delicious wine and fabulous service is a tribute to all involved. Please, please, keep your Chef. Best meal out I've had in ages. As Arnie would say..."I'll be back!"üòé (by Jenny McRoberts) [2 weeks ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Delicious, fresh food prepared and presented with craft and care. Everything we ordered was shared and enjoyed. Friendly service from the wonderful team made for a very special evening. (by Gillian Wilson) [2 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Absolutely superb menu. Carefully sourced ingredients assembled with creativity. Always a nice atmosphere; very chilled.

Have been coming to Cove for years now and have always had a wonderful experience.

Thanks to Siobhan, Peter and team (by Phil Patterson) [3 months ago]

name: The Only Plaice
address: The Only Plaice, The Pier, Downies, Downings, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Wonderful spot. Wonderful idea. Wonderful setting. Wonderful fish quality. Wonderful owner. Everything was wonderful. Not to be missed (and might be your favorite meal of the entire trip). (by Aric S. Queen) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - One of the best fish and chips I‚Äôve ever had!!! The staff are so lovely and the views sitting upstairs were incredible. Can‚Äôt recommend this place enough üòÅ (by Cat Gundry-Beck) [5 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - My husband, children and I have eaten here twice in the past week and plan to return a couple of times before we return home. Loving Donegal and the blue flag beach view from the outside tables at this place. Seemingly there are tables upstairs also which we may use later in the week. Both times we chose 'the sharing box' for our family of 4: haddock, scampi, calamari, chips, tartar sauce and mushy peas for ‚Ç¨26. Bottle of water is ‚Ç¨2.50 & fruit shoot is ‚Ç¨2. Delicious & all was devoured. So so good after a run around on the beach. Highly recommended if in the area. The Only Plaice to be for fresh fish. Continued success. (by Emily O'Connor) [a year ago] | Review 4: 4 stars - We will definitely be back!! Friendly staff, beautiful food (own cut chips) and a great location on the pier!
It was ‚Ç¨15 for the box in the picture, ‚Ç¨30 for 2 people without drinks, or side sauces is why there is a star missing! (by maia jones) [a year ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - We absolutely loved this place. It's unique, good food and great staff. It sits on the pier in a converted double decker. We ordered a whole lot of stuff to pick at and share. The food was amazing. The fish was perfectly crispy all throughout. Not one soggy but. The best fish and chips I had on the emerald isle. And the wonderful staff were so friendly and helpful, providing table service. And it was easy for us to park and eat in. Make sure you don't miss this plaice lol. (by Carlito) [2 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - We enjoyed the quirky atmosphere and great views while eating delicious fish and chips with mushy peas and tartare sauce on the top of a double decker bus, set up with tables for dining informally. (by LoveGreen Spaces) [a year ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Just had one of the most fantastic fish and chips with a brilliant viewing experience. In the middle of the storm and the rocking of the bus didn‚Äôt stop these guys from cooking up a storm. Can‚Äôt believe the value and the flavour. Will be back!
Hit all three marks for me- Value, Flavour and most importantly quality üíõ (by Catherine James) [a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Was in here a few days ago when I was in Downing‚Äôs for weekend. Lovely little set up. Kitchen downstairs & you can sit upstairs. Pictures of menu provided and a little video from outside. (by Oisin O) [2 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Absolutely delicious, the taste lasts forever and you cannot stop eating. The sharing box was full and top standard, and the mushy peas were divine. I definitely recommend! (by Elisabeth Meuleman) [4 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Very friendly lovely staff
Goujons and cod tasted very fresh straight from the sea
Chips beautifully cooked (by Cynthia Britton) [a month ago]

name: Chapter Twenty @ Mill Park Hotel
address: The Mullins, Mullans, Donegal, F94 HD99, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - I had a wonderful lunch today at Chapter Twenty at the Mill Park Hotel. I started with a pint of Guinness, the lunch special was roasted leg of lamb with mashed potatoes and roasted vegetables. Absolutely delicious!! I normally don‚Äôt get dessert, but I was tempted by the Baileys cheesecake. It was served with the dip of vanilla ice cream,  whipped cream and strawberries. It was wonderful! I ended the meal with a Baileys coffee which was made perfectly. The food was fantastic, the service was impeccable! I definitely recommend this restaurant with five stars! (by Judy Sullivan) [4 months ago] | Review 2: 3 stars - Underwhelming. Server Graeme was especially unfriendly, no eye contact.. no chat, very direct. Seemed to be tension between staff, as no staff engaged with us at all apart from the female ma√Ætre d. Would expect more for the cost of food & drinks. Low music also. Drinks more expensive than temple bar, although I was impressed they offered gluten free pasta. Unfortunately it was quite dry, not creamy at all & the huge portion was wasteful. Won‚Äôt be returning, although visually the venue is fantastic (by Anne Mac) [5 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - This is one the best restaurants in donegal town. The hype of the restaurant comes in light with it's huge queue before the dinner starts. I am not sure if they take walkins as I have been to this place twice but had booked in advance. Seeing the crowd at the restaurant I would definitely recommend to book the table well in advance even when you planning on a weekday but surely book  if coming on a weekend.

There is a great variety of dishes with vegetarian and meat options. The second time I visited, we had ordered spring rolls and seafood chowder for starters. They were absolutely tasty and came within record time I'll say. For mains we had ordered carbonara, chicken Supreme with sauce, kofta balls, and a burger with fries.
The food and the service was amazing and couldn't hold back with the amazing deserts as well.

The staff were very friendly and welcoming at all the time. Toilets were kept clean and tidy to the point. Photos might give you a better insight of the place and food.
Do visit this place if you are in Donegal time and looking for some great place for fine dine. (by Devangi Dave) [7 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - The restaurant is fancy and well worth the price! There are few places that do good vegetarian food, and this place was absolutely amazing. All the dishes I ordered tasted great. The service was timely and the staff was friendly. (by Tushti Singla) [11 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - This is one the finest restaurants I have been in donegal. The hype of the restaurant comes in light with it's huge queue before the dinner starts. There is usually waiting list for around 20 mins time but it's good to go ahead and pre-book it one the weekends especially.
There is a great variety of dishes with vegetarian and meat options. We had ordered spring rolls and seafood chowder for starters. They were absolutely tasty and came within record time I'll say. For mains we had ordered carbonara, chicken Supreme with sauce, kofta balls, and a burger with fries.
The food and the service was amazing and couldn't hold back with the amazing deserts as well. (by ajay harmale) [Edited 8 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Raining hard tonight in Donegal ‚Ä¶ decided to stay in for dinner (definitely not my norm).
Really outstanding meal for our family group of 10. Remarkable wine list with some very well priced wines. Apps, meals, desserts all excellent. Worth staying in for. Even the cappuccino was amazing. (by Tom Wood) [a year ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - It was our first time to stay in this hotel and we stayed two nights to mark a special birthday. We dined with reservation in advance the first night of our stay and were impressed with our meal and experience. We split a bottle of Montepulciano priced at ‚Ç¨31.
We shared a Prawn and Salmon platter with bloody Mary dressing and brown bread starter at ‚Ç¨12.50 which was excellent (we devoured it and forgot to take a picture of it). My husband had the king prawn and chorizo Linguini in a creamy white wine sauce ‚Ç¨23.50 with garlic bread for an extra ‚Ç¨3 which he adored. I had the Fillet of Hake with chorizo samphire spinach and herb vegetable rosti at ‚Ç¨25 which was very good. Total bill came to ‚Ç¨95. Staff picked up on a throwaway comment by me in reference to the birthday boy (it was my husband's birthday and a significant one) and marked it which I was impressed with and loved so thank you ‚ù§Ô∏è I'd highly recommend dining here if you are staying in the hotel or if you are nearby. (by Emily O'Connor) [9 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - I had a wonderful dinner with my family at this restaurant.  The staff was very friendly and attentive.  We only ordered main dishes, but each dish was nicely presented and perfectly cooked.  Lamb was cooked medium, as ordered, and the fish was cooked just right.  The only negative is that fish dishes were under seasoned, but that was easily solved by salt and pepper that we had at the table.
Overall, this was a very good  experience, and I can definitely recommend this restaurant. (by Slava Kramarov) [2 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Very good food, fresh. thank you to the waitress named Daria, she made my time very pleasant, the only nice service there was from her ‚ù§Ô∏è (by Magdalena Klimasara) [11 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - We stayed at the Mill Park Hotel and went for an evening meal at this restaurant. It was just great. The staff were friendly and attentive and food tasted great. We can highly recommend this restaurant. (by Alice Weiss) [a year ago]

name: Andersons Boathouse Restaurant And Accommodation
address: Main St, Cashelcummin, Killybegs, Co. Donegal, F94 X21X, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Outstanding dining experience. At the end of the meal, Garry came out to say hi. What a great guy. What an amazing team. The food is fantastic. Everything we ate was carefully prepared and delicious. It‚Äôs a must if you find yourself in Killybegs. (by Seamus McEvoy) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - This was the first time my boyfriend and I visited Anderson's boathouse restaurant and we were both impressed. The place was busy when we arrived for our 8:15pm reservation. (Booking is definitely recommended so not to be disappointed if you can't get a table just by walking in). We were there on 12th July which also fell on a Saturday so it was busy with holiday makers and locals too. We were welcomed by a member of staff when we came in, only took a minute or so, if even. We were shown to our table which just needed to be wiped down as the previous couple of people had not long left. This was fine, we could see how busy they were. We were told about the specials and who would be serving us and we took our seats. We both got to order a drink each quite promptly and they came out quick enough. I got a gin bramble and my boyfriend got a bottle of Peroni. We then decided what we'd like and shared the mussels to start, the portion was quite small for 2 to share but would have been ample for one. They were tasty and then we had both ordered a fish dish each for our main. My boyfriend had the monkfish and I had the hake, we both tried each others and they were both very tasty meals. We thoroughly enjoyed our drinks and food. The staff were very friendly, attentive and efficient. The atmosphere was buzzing, the position we were in, we were getting a lovely breeze from the open doors at the other end and could see the harbour. We could hear low playing music which was nice and it wasn't so loud in the restaurant with others that you couldn't hear each other speak. We would definitely return, we had booked on short notice but still managed to get a table so that was wonderful. I have no negatives from our experience. (by Megan Chism) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - The food was delicious and beautifully presented, the staff were so attentive and friendly. There is a great buzz in the place, and great decor, even the loos got a thumbs up! Great cocktails too! Very good value for money. (by Catherine Waldron) [5 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - We ate here Saturday night. We didn‚Äôt book ahead and chanced our arm and luckily got a table for 2. Food was absolutely beautiful and a great buzz around. A lady with red hair was particularly attentive and friendly. I live 3 hours away and would happily drive back just to eat here again. 5 stars ‚≠êÔ∏è (by Niamh Kerr) [a month ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - One of the best meals of my life üòç

We had the prawn and monkfish starter - rich, creamy, and so delicious. I got the John Dory special for the main - never had this fish before and I hope to have again in the future - the dish was incredible. We topped off our meal with the sticky toffee pudding and was so gooooood! Staff were super nice, helpful, and welcoming and loved the chill ambiance of the restaurant - thank you! (by Caroline Martin) [a year ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Wonderful absolutely wonderful, the risotto was splendid perfectly balanced with just the right amount of portions mixed with the right amount of spices. The tiramisu was dusted and soaked to perfection. Special thanks to Gary and our server Jamie for accommodating us. (by Justin Hartley) [6 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Bit late to review as it was nearly 2 weeks ago we ate here but really wanted to give this place the review it deserves! It was outstanding, one of the best meals I have had in very long time. One that will be listed to friends as top five meals every had. (by Alan Jordan) [a month ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - I have visited this restaurant 6 times in the last 8 months, each time bringing a different group of family or friends to dine with us and it never fails.
Anderson‚Äôs Boathouse Restaurant is seamlessly run restaurant with the nicest staff and offers a delicious selection of starters, mains, desserts & cocktails. The seafood is the nicest I‚Äôve tasted anywhere in Ireland. This place is not to be taken lightly! When you go, you just want to indulge in all the beautiful food & drinks. The staff are so personal, from the waitresses, to the manager to Garry himself coming out of the kitchen for a chat. Thank you for amazing service and food.. see you again in a few weeks. (by Rois√≠n Brennan) [Edited a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Celebrated my birthday recently here on 5th May. I can only say everything was absolutely flawless. I had the croustillant (highly recommend this!) to start and the seafood platter for main, both beautiful. Great wine menu, lovely surroundings looking out on Killybegs Harbour. Staff were fantastic, friendly and knowledgeable. A solid 10/10 and I'll come back to Killybegs not just for the lovely place that it is but especially for Anderson's Boathouse Restaurant. (by Laura M Mutch) [a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Excellent experience. Outstanding selection of fish and seafood offered. Everything we ate was cooked to perfection and the staff looked after us so well. If we lived closer, my family would be regulars for sure. (by A B) [a month ago]

name: Sean √ìg Bar & Restaurant
address: Middletown, Derrybeg, Co. Donegal, F92 AC84, Ireland
reviews: Review 1: 5 stars - Food was delicious, pint of Murphy's was the best I've had in a long time! Fast service, friendly and lovely staff, would highly recommend! (by Laura Mclaughlin) [4 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Lovely bar, ample parking and brilliant staff. It was my partners birthday and they brought our cake out for us with a happy birthday message on it - really really lovely. Food was excellent too - would highly recommend! (by B) [a year ago] | Review 3: 4 stars - The Food is top Class I would say this place should be called a Gastro Pub the food is so good. This is a must, you must book at the height of the summer it will be packed out. Will have  live traditional music on as well. Staff are very attentive look after your very well and you feel at ease when you sit down to your food I cannot stress how good the food is. (by Sean Brennan) [5 years ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - I had the most amazing Seafood Tagliatelle - it was the special for the night - followed by excellent quality ice creams.  Lovely friendly  service. I was recommended to go by my guest house in Bunbeg, it was a 25 minute walk but so worth it. Can't remember having a better Tagliatelle. (by Anne K) [a year ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Great food, nice vibe and helpful staff. Worth a visit (by Lydia Wafer) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - spent 2 nights here drinking and playing pool, good craic your man is a bit grumpy but sound once you get used to him, prices are good, it is Small enough so it's be easy to get it full, food is excellent the first night we had it booked second night we were late trying to book it and couldn't get in the door üòû, restaurant part is a fair size with plenty of seats, lots of parking around (by paul) [Edited a month ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Great food but the side salad ü•ó was a bit small the rest is excellent üëå highly recommended (by Sara Jones) [a month ago] | Review 8: 3 stars - Positive... we were able to eat outside in sheltered seating are and the food was very good.  Negatives...no menus in Irish (in the Gaeltacht?). Also the waitress didn't seem to know what beers they had, so we ended up having to go back inside the restaurant to see the options. (by G S) [3 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Absolutely amazing food and service. Big portions beautifully cooked. Among the best food  we've had in a lomg time. I'm posting this as we're eating to take a break from the food!! Service was equally good. Nothing was a problem. Wonderful!! Thanks to everyone!! (by Bastable-Warren Irish-Dancers) [6 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Lovely food and lovely people. I visited every night during my trip to Gweedore. Definitely order the sticky toffee!!! (by Rayna Ketch) [3 months ago]

name: The Red Door Country House
reviews:
Review 1: None - We always have a great time at the Red Door.
The food is always delicious and it is a lovely place to celebrate a special occassion as the grounds are beautiful, as is the interior.  Food is always good.

This time we just dropped in foe bar food. It was delicious. There was a good choice on the bar food menu and it was reasonably priced for the quality of the meal we had. (by Kathryn Callaghan) | Review 2: None - Had a very nice meal here on a weekday evening.  It was not too busy and the staff were very attentive.  We didn‚Äôt stay in the accommodation but looks a good location and nice place for a lakeside wedding. (by Brian Haggis) | Review 3: None - A beautiful building with a stylish interior and a garden where you can also sit outside. We were in the bar area, where food is also served. The staff were friendly, but there‚Äôs room for improvement (taking glasses from the table with fingers inside is unprofessional, and after the meal, they didn‚Äôt ask if everything was okay).

The starters (pork belly and ham croquettes) were very good, but the main course disappointed us. The fish tacos were very dry ‚Äì just adding some juicy vegetables would have made a big difference. It‚Äôs not a bad place, but both the service and the food could use some improvement. (by BB) | Review 4: None - Early evening dinner. Beautiful location. Sadly the interior was a little shoddy and smelled mouldy.  The service was polite, but that's about it. The food also missed the mark... the dishes felt unfinished and the tastes were tuned to bland rather than wow. It's a shame, it could have been so much better (by smaryj66) | Review 5: None - This place is genuinely something special. I've photographed quite a few weddings at the Red Door, and every time I'm blown away. Francis and the whole team are just brilliant, they really go above and beyond, and it shows in every little detail. The setting itself is a dream: tucked-away woodland paths, thee iconic swing, and views overlooking Lough Swilly that make for absolutely stunning backdrops. It‚Äôs one of those places where you‚Äôre spoiled for choice with photo opportunities. And the food? Next level. They really know how to host a wedding here, elegance at best! Till next time.. (by James Aiken) | Review 6: None - I attended a wedding here in October 2024 and it was so amazing I had to write a review. The location is stunning, the grounds are immaculate, the house feels very welcoming and warm with beautiful decor. On top of that, this was hands down the best food I‚Äôve had at a wedding, really fine dining quality. What makes or breaks a place is the staff though and not only were they super efficient and professional, they were all exceptionally nice to deal with. I‚Äôd go back in a heartbeat. (by Geraldine Harp) | Review 7: None - The place is fabulous but we will not be eating there again because of the very poor quality food. (by Donata Romano) | Review 8: None - I came with my family to have their ‚Ç¨53pp 3 course festive menu. We come every year and are always impressed by the quality of food and service but, unfortunately, the standard has significantly dropped. The food was mostly average and my sister‚Äôs mushroom risotto was tasteless and unappealing. No one checked how our food was and they collected the uneaten risotto at the end without any remark. Once we pointed it out, they did apologise and took some money off her meal. Hoping they can improve as this is a beautiful venue in a stunning location. (by Helen) | Review 9: None - To be fair, you cannot match the atmosphere of the restaurant, it makes you feel like you are in a movie. The service was lovely and attentive, we got served bread and butter and a wee appetizer, which was such a nice treat. When it comes to the food, the starter was really really good! The mains all look amazing, and they delivered! The only negative point is that the starter and side was a bit colder than expected, and therefore felt like they had been made a while ago, otherwise, a very pleasant and recommended experience. (by Ferran Arlandis) | Review 10: None - I‚Äôve shot several weddings here and the staff and management are always fantastic to work with, attentive to detail, great at keeping the day flowing and the grounds are kept to a high standard and impeccably maintained, the atmosphere is cosy and personal for wedding guests and I haven‚Äôt tried the Guinness but it looks amazing.

Fridays wedding had adverse weather where it poured down the entire day and management were on the ball with opening areas for me to shoot and super helpful and on hand for any indoor shoot locations!

Looking forward to my 2025 weddings here, keep up the amazing work folks :)

Mark Hamill Photography (by Mark Hamill)

name: The Treehouse Restaurant
address: Main St, Muff, Co. Donegal, F93 XV9R, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Called today for a beer and ended up getting a meal. Place is beautiful and very friendly staff from the barman to man who served us our food. Definitely worth a visit (by Martin Ferris) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Amazing food and a lovely place.     Friendly staff. (by jonathan ball) [a month ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Beautiful restaurant got to say the food was fantastic. I had a steak sandwich with garlic potatoes, which was very flavoursome wife had 50 /50 chicken and steak and she loved loved it, daughter then went for the Burger and chips and said it wad the nicest burger she ever had. Finished with amazing deserts will definitely be back. (by Steven Lowery) [a year ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - We were staying in a nearby town and tried this place for our tea and I have to say food and service was amazing.  I wish this place was closer to home. Outstanding service and our meals were very tasty.  Not overpriced and the portion sizes are huge. When we went it was very busy but the wait was not long at all. (by Lyndsey Owens) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Just had a lovely Sunday lunch. Got squeezed in when i made last minute booking. Staff very friendly and attentive. Lunch really hit the spot with good mix of traditional and other options. (by Deirdre Rawdon) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Beautiful food and decor. Staff were super friendly and went out of their way to ensure my child's allergies were catered for. Thank you so much. (by Milisa T) [a month ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Dropped in for lunch and was pleasantly surprised.

Clean new decor, just built. Easy car park. Great location on main road. Interesting poems written on the walls.

Friendly staff with good service.

Very clean well thought out toilets. Mesh decking under the urinals for the sloppy gents with bad aim!! Great idea.

Seafood chowder soup very tasty with delicious brown bread.

Tomato soup home made with great flavour.

Rhubarb tart with ice cream hit the spot with nice lumps of rhubarb.

Fish and chips. Light batter with fluffy white cod inside. Excellent tartare sauce and mushy peas.

2 cocktails for ‚Ç¨10 and Heineken for ‚Ç¨3 seems very good value.

Well worth a visit. (by Francis Moore) [6 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Had a lovely meal here last weekend. Food and service were great. (by Sinead McLaughlin) [2 months ago] | Review 9: 4 stars - Place was absolutely lovely inside, the tress the lighting was 100% perfect wouldn‚Äôt change the lay out at all. Food again was perfect, wouldn‚Äôt change it! Loved every single bite from the starter to my main, unfortunately I didn‚Äôt get a picture of my brownie but it was so so good! My only complaint was that the waiting staff was very slow‚Ä¶ so much so I had to call the person running the front door to ask could I order my dessert, maybe it was just busy, but can say it was lovely. (by Michael Harley) [3 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - First time visiting The Treehouse Bar & Restaurant,  from the moment we arrived  the service was excellent, very friendly staff , there was a good choice of food on the menu also a choice of a 2 or 3 course, we ordered turkey&ham and roast beef & as you can see from the photos I've posted it certainly didn't disappoint. The Bar/Restaurant was very well laid out. Good high ceiling & open.  Will I be back most certainly (by Geraldine Mullen) [2 years ago]

name: Quay West Restaurant Donegal Town
address: Quay St, Donegal, F94 E2A2, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Genuinely the most incredible seafood dishes I‚Äôve ever had, you NEED to try here. Jo is an absolute darling too, everything about this place was perfection, make sure you book in advance to get a table
Definitely recommend any of their king prawn & hake dishes, as well as their elderflower fizz (by Claire) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - very tasty food and big portions. i ate the haddock, it was tender, the batter was crispy. under the piece on top, there was a smaller one under it. i changed the chips to black garlic and parmesan fries (by m) [2 weeks ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - One of the best dining experiences our family has EVER had. The staff went above and beyond to accommodate for us and our 6 month old. They provided a blanket for him and toys and were so sweet. The food was amazing! Had a nice lobster and chips. Our favorite spot in Donegal. (by Patrick Sabol) [a month ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - We spent our last night in Donegal dining at Quay, and it didn‚Äôt disappoint. From the exceptional service to the high-quality food, everything was perfect. The steak was definitely chef-approved (we dined with a hotel chef)

Plus, we were able to get a reservation for the same day. ‚≠êÔ∏èThanks a lot! (by Precious Anne -) [10 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - We were immediately impressed by the hostess when we walked in - she seemed to know everyone, and greeted everyone like they were old friends. This was a random stop for dinner, and we enjoyed our food and service here. The food itself was decent, but we most enjoyed the people here. (by Deb L) [a year ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - We had a wonderful evening at Quay West on a recent visit to Donegal.  We were seated upstairs at a high-top.  When we arrived there were a couple of large parties already seated and we thought we'd feel crowded out.  However, this wasn't the case at all.  The service was excellent and the food was delicious.  I would not hesitate to recommend Quay West. (by David Brennan) [a month ago] | Review 7: 4 stars - I recently had the pleasure of dining at an establishment in Donegal, where I enjoyed a delightful Parmigiana Chicken. The chicken was expertly prepared, with a batter that achieved the perfect level of crispiness. This delightful texture contrasted beautifully with the rich, tangy tomato sauce, creating a harmonious balance of flavors. Accompanying the dish were perfectly roasted, crunchy potato cubes that added an additional layer of satisfaction to the meal.

Additionally, I sampled the aromatic chicken curry, which was a true delight. The curry was exquisitely seasoned, with a complex blend of spices that complemented the tender chicken beautifully. Paired with a fragrant bed of rice, the dish was a wonderful example of culinary craftsmanship. This establishment in Donegal proved to be a charming venue, offering a memorable dining experience. (by J J) [a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Love that everything is sourced locally, enjoyed a Donegal whiskey. Very busy - I recommend booking ahead, I had a feeling we would need to and was glad I did! A charming lady seated us upstairs, where we had a great view of the river at sunset. Lovely interiors. Everyone joined in with singing happy birthday. (by apricotbaker pj) [a month ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - I had emailed the owner to book a table for 2 to celebrate a big birthday for my husband and mentioned to her of the occasion at the time of booking. She requested further information with a professional attention to detail. On arrival to the restaurant, I was very happy with our table by the window. The owner herself took our order and was very warm and friendly introducing herself and having the chat. We shared a Bottle of Spanish Tempranillo for ‚Ç¨28 which was good. We both decided to forego a starter to focus on the main event. I chose the 10z Rib Eye Steak (‚Ç¨32.50) with mushroom and onions and silkie whiskey and maple sauce (recommended by the owner) and included side of my choice (fries). My husband picked the 9oz Sirloin steak (‚Ç¨30.95) with mushrooms and onions and peppercorn sauce and (upgraded) side of garlic herb roasted potatoes with a supplement of ‚Ç¨1.50. We both added 4 craft beer battered king prawns for ‚Ç¨6.95 each to our steaks. We were both impressed with the steak (& how they were cooked to our asking), battered prawns, respective sauces, mushrooms and herby potatoes. We thought there was excess onions on each of our plates.
We shared the infamous caramel crunchie Sundae at ‚Ç¨9.50 which was good. Overall, I did think the dessert options were an area to improve on the menu. I was delighted that staff marked my husband's birthday with a flare candle suitably embarrassing him. I loved the fuss made of him and the occasion so big thank youüôåü•≥ I would recommend here for dinner and a special occasion where a deserved fuss is made on request. Hope to return in the future when we are up that neck of the woods. (by Emily O'Connor) [9 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Just had a beautiful meal here tonight. The food and the service was second to none. Jo the owner went out of her way to ensure we were well looked after. We had a very tasty meal and the recommendations were superb. Would definitely recommend. The view from the window seat overlooking the bay is lovely if you manage to secure one there. (by Wendy Davison) [4 months ago]

name: Elliotts Traditional Irish Bar
address: Meenagowan, Lettermacaward, Co. Donegal, F94 YKD4, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Friendly, traditional pub with a really nice and helpful owner. Two TV screens, pool table, regular music nights, open fire. We preferred this to the more corporate type pub up the road. Recommended -note no food served and dogs not allowed . (by Jennifer Rance) [4 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Very welcoming and cosy pub. Really helpful in showing a premiership rugby game. Only wish we could have stayed for the music night! (by John Rance) [4 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Good pint of Guinness
Didn‚Äôt get a chance to listen to the music so I‚Äôll have to come back
Welcoming service
Reasonable prices (by Ben Harding) [5 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Fantastic Irish pub Daniel the owner is brilliant atmosphere was fantastic would recommend to anyone üëç gave me a sign to remember them by  fantastic it's now going in my man cave pride of place (by Dan Wainwright) [a month ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Real homely pub, very friendly bar man, and the locals ready for a chat. The Guinness was up there with the best I ever drank. (by Mick Horan) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - We were in Lettermacaward for the weekend of St. Patricks Day. Elliot's was a really welcoming pub - the owner was a top guy and the locals were super friendly.  The Friday night musicians were excellent. So lovely to have an authentic Irish night out. Great place & well worth a visit if you're in the area. (by Traz Mac) [6 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - What a beautiful bar in Leitir. Ppl are so friendly and the service is second to none. Absolutely loved it. Very popular with the locals who will give you an ambulance of advice on this beautiful area. Owner went out of his way to make our visit very welcoming. Thank you. (by Tina McBrearty) [4 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Very friendly pub with great music and all the craic needed for a great night out. (by Gwyneth Richards) [3 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - A great place to go for a drink, game of pool and to chat with the locals. Danny runs a lovely traditional Irish pub with plenty of space to sit down and 2 pool tables for a game of winner stays on or killer pool with some of the locals. The Guinness is delicious and sitting in beside the warm fire on a wet, cold evening is just what an Irish summer needs. (by Maedhbh Gordon) [a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Beautiful traditional Irish bar very close to Dooey beach. Pints of Guinness for first class. The staff and locals are incredibly welcoming and friendly (by Luke Joyce) [3 years ago]

name: The Railway Tavern
address: Station Road, Figary, Fahan, Co. Donegal, F93 TVF2, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 3 stars - The service was ok, a little slow but somewhat friendly.

The food however was decent.  My steak was perfect medium/rare. It was interesting to be able to watch the guy grill our steaks. However I felt VERY lucky as he was sweeping up the floor of wood bits and dirt etc and he used the pan to throw this filth into the fire and at the same time coving some of the steaks for other people......gross. definitely ignorant practise that needs to stop. It would put us off going again incase we are not so lucky and get extra u wanted seasoning next time. (by Gee) [3 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - We had the opportunity to eat at this fine place for a wedding reception, and they were amazing! The staff was very friendly and helpful. The layout of the restaurant is awesome, and it has an old train car cooking all the food! You can even have a chance to sit near it! I would recommend this place to anyone! Lovely people, fantastic food, and a wonderful atmosphere! 5 stars for sure! (by Jay Preston) [9 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Really nice steak, it being actually grilled makes a huge difference in taste. The vibe is great and service fast and friendly. (by Maciek Grzeszczuk) [6 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - This place is absolutely amazing. Such a beautiful location and so cosy and homely inside. The food and service is always really good. Came today and got the steak stack with the crispy cabbage, which I had never tried before, and it was absolutely delicious!! Waitress said there was a secret sauce on it which I would now love to find out. Defo recommend this place! (by s k) [a year ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Fabulous Steakhouse. Flame grilled steak grilled on open fire in front of us.
The flavour of open fire was so good on steak. Brought me back about 30 years!
Fabulous atmosphere. Lovely lovely staff. I‚Äôd walk 500 miles for those Parmesan & Truffle Fries again. Everything was perfect. Thank you!!! (by Elaine Cassells) [Edited a year ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Wow! I was not expecting such amazing food to come out of a hidden tavern like this. Had a drink at the bar then sat for dinner. I got the ribeye with buttery mash and oh my goodness it was divine. It was also grand seeing the old train as the steak grill- as well as the other nods towards it being an old train station! We went with a large group and they were extremely accommodating. (by Rachel Zafarana) [3 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Had been here once before for a works night out, and always wanted to return, so we did for a belated Valentine's treat. And it did not disappoint!
The interior is full of charm and memorabilia from the railway days of old. Staff were friendly and we were seated in front of the firebox grill, with flames jumping and the noise so comforting, as was the pleasant heat and mouthwatering smells of food!
I ordered a half pint of Guinness, and it was perfect. We ordered Ribeye steak and the burger. Fascinating to see the steak getting nicely done on the grill. It came out looking amazing, and cooked exactly as I'd asked, medium to well. My other halfs burger looked good also. My champ was delicious as were his chips. We left full and satisfied, too full to even attempt dessert! However we will be back again for sure. Highly recommend. (by v g) [Edited a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - What a gem of a restaurant..
Food üëå
Service üëå
Atmosphere üëå.
