Fabulous restaurant with a beautiful menu to choose from..comfortable seating for you to sit and enjoy your beautiful food and have a drink with friends..the staff are so pleasant and helpful andefficient...lovely location beside the sea for a walk after ur food and to enjoy the beach Donegal scenery..
If ur in the area don't pass it..well worth a visit.. (by Derek Liddy) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - One of the best restaurants we have been in, the food was amazing and the staff were so nice and accommodating to us. its a real gem and would love to go back there again, would recommend . (by Aoife Jones) [4 weeks ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Food never disappoints. Fish cake and goats cheese starters were beautiful. The fillet steak and T-bone steak were excellent and perfectly cooked. Great staff and Mark, the manager is excellent at his job. Highly recommended!!! (by Keith) [2 years ago]

name: La Bella Donna Restaurant
address: 2 Bridge St, Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Went to La Bella Donna for dinner and really enjoyed it. I had the Pollo Diavolo which was full of flavour and had just the right kick, while my wife had a pizza that was fresh and delicious. The staff were really patient and accommodating with our little ones, which we really appreciated. Great food and a relaxed atmosphere ‚Äì we‚Äôll definitely be back. (by JP) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Great food, good atmosphere.
If nitpicking risotto was a bit undercooked and there was some dust on the divider.
However all and all will be back (by Jurica Flajpan) [4 months ago] | Review 3: 4 stars - The food at La Bella Donna was excellent, and our waitress was really great. We expected a bit of a wait since the menu mentioned that everything is made fresh, but we ended up waiting over an hour for our food. A couple of tables seated around the same time had already finished and left before we were served. That said, our server was very apologetic and kept checking in with updates, which we really appreciated. The only other downside to the experience was the woman who seemed to be the host or manager. She was not pleasant to interact with and came across as quite rude. (by Megan Dwyer) [a month ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Such a wonderful place to visit, so much we came back twice.

My wife and I were in Donegal for two nights and got dinner the first night where we met Ann (the owner) who served us a wonderful Italian meal. Having gluten free pasta for my wife was a huge highlight and such a treat especially when traveling.

After dinner the first night Ann offered us some wonderful suggestions for areas to visit while we were in town.

The second night we came back after visiting a local pub for some Irish music and grabbed dessert. Again we saw Ann who remembered us and we stayed probably for half an hour talking to her about the history of the restaurant, what we have left in our trip and overall just great conversation.

We both would HIGHLY recommend coming to visit La Bella Donna for your gluten free items and dessert of course! (by CJ) [a year ago] | Review 5: 3 stars - Food was lovely, but way over priced.
Services mediocre.  Seems very disjointed.  No one appears to be taking charge.  Many things being missed.  Shame as food so good, has makings of a top class restaurant. (by Paddy Cool) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Lovely atmosphere, delicious pizza, my husband was OBSESSED with the carbonara pasta. The slow gin fizz and mai tai were also delicious. Highly recommend the lemon tart! So yummy! Staff were super friendly and pleasant and checked in on us frequently which we really appreciated. (by Riley Whalen) [2 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - My sister Melissa and I dined there tonight. We are visiting Donegal for a few days from the US so based on positive reviews we called and made a reservation for 5pm which is opening time. We were not disappointed. I wish I knew our server‚Äôs name. She was lovely and very attentive. We had the bruschetta which was one of the best we‚Äôd ever eaten and each had a Caesar salad for our entree. Absolutely delicious and the portions were great. We even had dessert‚Äîmy sister had the gelato trio and I had the Tiramisu which I found out is made in house. So delicious I ate every bit of it. Would definitely recommend and eat there again . (by Sheila Baston) [3 years ago] | Review 8: 3 stars - My wife and myself visited here on Saturday of st Patricks weekend. Very busy as you might expect so I could forgive the service for our orders being a bit slow.
However we were seated in front of the bar and there simply isn't room for a table here, other couples were in the same situation.
The food was good and plenty of it, value was good also. The atmosphere is too bright in my opinion, just my own taste.
I can see why this is popular in Donegal town. (by Bert Carolan) [6 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Delicious food, will come back to eat here for sure. A bit noisy at the evening, but it‚Äôs every where like that in Donegal. Very kind waiters. Good service! üíõ (by AnastasiIa Marianska) [a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Fantastic food! Definitely highly recommend. Very fresh and flavorful. Great portion sizes as well. (by Jordan Heckley) [a year ago]

name: Yellow Pepper
address: 36 Lower Main St, Letterkenny, Co. Donegal, F92 K125, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - One of the best restaurants we visited on our entire trip to Ireland. I can't recommend this place enough if you are a vegetarian! The shepardless pie was amazing! The sweet potato salad was great as well. I really appreciated the large selection of local craft beer. (by Althea Fitzpow) [4 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Amazing. Great quality, great portions, presentation on point, great staff, lovely place. (by Brenda C.A.) [a month ago] | Review 3: 4 stars - Good place for a meal alone or in a group. Fast, attentive service.
Prawn starter was slightly over cooked, prawns were slightly chewy but tasty.
Braised beef mains was very good. I dread to think how much butter or cream was in the mash. (by Duncan Edwards) [5 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Food was amazing. I had the venison pasta special. Great collection of local beers as well. But the shining star was our waiter! Service here was excellent. Usually you don't need to tip in Ireland but we left our waiter a tip because he was great (by Cameron Dallas) [3 weeks ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Fantastic food and welcoming service in a cosy atmosphere (by Sean Bonner) [2 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Food quality really really good. People kind, good location and atmosphere. (by Cristina Ferrandi) [a month ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - I go here for special occasions all the time and love it. I really wish they‚Äôd bring back the slow cooked beef rib because that was honestly the best dish I‚Äôve had at this restaurant. (by Akram M) [9 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Three friends from Dublin.. We booked in advance and glad we did its a busy place. We were greeted warmly shown to our table. Service fast water brought drinks order taken. Given time to read the menu  as we did this I noticed a lot of lamb coming out from kitchen so that's what I ordered. My friends ordered fish and chips. The fish was in golden batter light to taste they both commented how crispy the chips were delicious.  Now the lamb shank... lips smacking good  fell of the bone no struggle  it was served with creamy mash velvety jus that looked rich in colour and was equally rich in flavour..Delicious.  I was drive so had a cappuccino and Ice cream to finish. The coffee was hot which I love usually cappuccino is only warm  and it was served with a smile a bit of banter. Service throughout was professional friendly not intrusive.  Good atmosphere too..If in Letterkenny book your table and enjoy.
Ann Jean Marcella. (by Ann Maher) [2 months ago] | Review 9: 2 stars - We were excited to give it a try after a long day as it came highly recommended. We made a reservation and the restaurant was packed and lively when we arrived. The presentation and service were good, but unfortunately, the food (chilli prawns & pasta, fish & chips) tasted of nothing. The pasta tasted like my own home cooking (passable but unremarkable) and the generous fish portion had no flavor at all. Just disappointed. (by Jeff Zhao) [8 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - The best meal we have had in years. Seafood platter was amazing, a king‚Äôs feast. Seafood stew/soup was to die for, just amazing. The sauces used for the chicken appetizer was out of this world, an interesting combination of sweet and dairy. We would suggest it highly to anyone visiting the area. (by Timothy Brennan) [2 years ago]

name: Chandpur Restaurant
address: Main Street Car Park, Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 3 stars - We wanted to take a break from Irish food so popped in here for dinner. We love Indian food and have it often, but I think Indian food in Ireland may just be different from what we‚Äôre used to in Portland. We ordered the tikka masala, tandoori chicken and some garlic naan. The masala was super sweet. I am more used to a umami masala and less coconut flavoring. The naan‚Äôs texture was more along the lines of a thin crusted pizza. And lastly, the tandoori chicken was actually delicious. Without the tandoori chicken and basmati rice, I don‚Äôt think would have been satisfying. The service was excellent! (by Nichelle S) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - We were quite pleasantly surprised to find first rate Indian food at Chandpur in Donegal village. I had Chicken Tikka Jalfrezi which was tender, full flavored and perfectly spiced. My wife had Saag Paneer which she has ordered in dozens of restaurants, and proclaimed this was the second best she has ever had. (by Jeffer Sonian) [3 weeks ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - One of best Indian restaurant out of India, From appetizers to desserts, this restaurant exceeded all my expectations.
(Ambiance)-elegant, sophisticated, luxurious, refined, intimate, chic, inviting, opulent, charming, or romantic.
(Service)-attentive, impeccable, professional, courteous, knowledgeable, accommodating, top-notch, first-class.
Never seen beautiful restaurant like Chandpur. Thanks for great service. (by Sandeep Loomba) [10 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - The restaurant was recommended from a friend in the states. It lived up to expectations. The food and service were excellent. The staff was also knowledgeable about gluten restrictions (celiac disease). We would highly recommend Chandpur when in the area. (by Katherine O) [Edited 2 weeks ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - We had the Type A ,all special.  They were excellent in their craft. Perfectly prepared. (by Christopher McCarthy) [4 months ago] | Review 6: 1 star - Quite literally the worst service I've ever had in any restaurant. After 1 hour 45 of waiting for our main courses (just 2 of us), I asked the waiter if the food was coming soon. His response was "You've come in at 6 o'clock on a Saturday evening!" as if to infer 'what do you expect?' No apology at all. Apparently going for dinner at 6pm at the weekend is the customer's fault now.

We paid for the wine that we ordered and then left, not having even seen the food. (by Chris Walsh) [a month ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - The food was incredible, very authentic Indian dishes. The servers were attentive and very kind, going above and beyond to ensure we had a great experience..especially dining with a baby. Highly recommend! (by Aideen Stack) [3 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Myself and my family went to Chandpur for the first time a few weeks back, we got a big array of different foods, including samosas, madras, jalfrezi, etc.., and every single dish was delicious, you could taste the flavors and spices, everything was cooked brilliantly. I have to admit that this restaurant is one of the best for authentic Indian dishes, offering a proper Indian dining experience with its music and decor.
We will be coming back, 10/10 (by Ryan Wilson) [3 months ago] | Review 9: 1 star - I genuinely don't understand how this restaurant has received such glowing reviews. The service was shockingly poor. We asked for water twice and only received it 20 minutes later‚Äîafter the wine had already been served. Even then, we had to ask three more times to get the water jug refilled.

When I inquired whether the Chicken Makhani or Butter Chicken could be made spicy, the waiter was condescending and dismissive. He claimed cream-based dishes *can‚Äôt* be made spicy, which is simply not true. He went on to say that the restaurant prepares food to suit the majority of Irish preferences. While that‚Äôs somewhat understandable, it‚Äôs not an excuse for refusing a reasonable request‚Äîor for making assumptions about your customers. He even said that *if* he were in India, he could make any dish spicy. Since when is did the waiters  at this establishment also become the chef? He didn‚Äôt even offer to ask the kitchen if my request could be accommodated.

I ended up ordering the lamb biryani instead, which I absolutely would not recommend. The lamb was dry, and the rice tasted like it had been pre-cooked days in advance‚Äîcompletely lacking depth and flavor. Other members of my group ordered different dishes, and sadly, none of them stood out. Everything tasted dull and uninspired.

Overall, the experience was extremely disappointing. Between the rude service and the lackluster food, I would not return and cannot recommend this place to anyone expecting quality food or hospitality. (by S) [2 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - One of the best Indian I had so far . And I had a lot as it‚Äôs one of my favorite cuisines.
Staff was amazing as well . Will definitely come back . (by Neringa Janulaite) [2 months ago]

name: Shannons Corner Restaurant
address: Townparks, Ballyshannon, Co. Donegal, F94 NF83, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Fantastic food and service.

This is definitely our place for breakfast or mains.

The restaurant has recently been renovated with new management and I would certainly recommend this to anyone in the area or passing. (by resat ozkan) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - One of the best decaf coffees i have ever had. Didnt need any syrup or sugar. The staff are so welcoming and helpful.  Cant wait to come back and try the food (by Cody Collum) [3 days ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Good was AMAZING! All their food is homemade and made to order. By far one of my best meals in Ireland so far.
Had the curry chicken and rice, and the chicken with chili sauce. Both came with chips. Fresh. Hot. Filling.

The ladies were able to fit us in before a large lunch group at 1pm. Highly recommend. (by Emily J) [2 years ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Had the fry this morning with a colleague when in town for a bridge inspection. It was one of the best fry, I have eaten in a long time. The quality of the ingredients was top drawer. (by Brian Solan) [Edited a year ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Great restaurant/cafe. Fantastic prices and menu. Very good service and friendly staff. (by Martina keogan) [2 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Great food and atmosphere, restaurant filled with locals and I know why. The staff
was the best part of everything. (by Torbj√∂rn Appehl) [2 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - The Perfect Breakfast Experience
Nice Ambiente, great Service, Delicious Food, Fast, Kind perfect!
If it would be possible 6 Stars! (by Johannes Benk) [a month ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Outstanding home cooked food!

So many restaurants now seem to plate up pre-prepared / wholesale (probably defrosted that morning) servings - which is why the all taste (and even look) the same.

Shannon‚Äôs is different. This is food the way your Mom used to cook it ( or you wished she would have in my case üòÇ)

Service was quick, atmosphere was lovely, decor was homely without being kitsch.

I had the pork chops with spuds and I‚Äôve never had pork chops so tender but still with bite, lovely (clearly home made) apple sauce on the side and mashed spuds with peas, carrots and broccoli. YUM!

What a gem!!
Pity there aren‚Äôt six stars to give üëè (by Gerry Baker) [3 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Fantastic breakfast, friendly staff and according to my son the best toast you get for miles! (by Lucy Rush) [6 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Fast and friendly service. Cod and chips were lovely and the egg mayonnaise starter was top top. (by The Whippet) [5 years ago]

name: Thatch Bar & Restaurant
address: Main Street, Drumnasillagh, Glenties, Co. Donegal, F94 C3CD, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - First night of the new menu with the new ownership and we are absolutely delighted! The staff is super friendly, I am in seven heaven because they serve Kinnegar Scraggy Bay and the food was original, delicious and looked amazing. We had the seafood chowder, yellow fin tuna salad, roast beef, Philadelphia chicken and the fish & chips and all the dishes were absolutely wonderful. (by Roy Cohen) [a year ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Visited here for the first time. Staff are very friendly & fast. Pub is amazing, spotless. Food is lovely, will be back. (by Sinead O Reilly) [3 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Called in for food while passing through. Food and staff fantastic. Highly recommend. Special mention to the lady running the show. Unbelievably good at her job. Under major pressure on busy match day and nothing was too much trouble and everyone greeted and served with a smile. You can tell the staff enjoy working here. (by Fionnuala Marley) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 4 stars - the people were great and the food‚Ä¶ was ok, wouldn‚Äôt go here agian but don‚Äôt wish i never went. (by Sullivan Cooper) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Epic! Fantastic Food! Traditional look yet very clean modern feel! Great staff! Great Beer! Everything great! What more can you ask for? (by Paul Tohill) [a month ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - I had my first fish pie and loved it. Tried a new gin (or 2) and a bit of sherry trifle for dessert. Absolutely lovely. The staff were professional and quite friendly. I highly recommend, particularly after a long day of cycling. (by Mark McCoy) [3 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Everything about this restaurant was awesome. In particular, they have the best desserts in Donegal. The Sticky Toffee Pudding was incredible. The steaks were great and the chips were cooked perfectly. The pepper sauce was so good for both as well. The staff were very friendly, welcoming, and honest. We appreciated everything they did for us and they made us feel like locals. You really should not miss this place if you are in the area. We drove from Dungloe three times just to eat there, it‚Äôs that good. We have travelled too far away now and already miss it. Just make sure you get dessert, it‚Äôs the best part. (by James Stevenson) [3 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Myself and a friend stopped of here for a snack and decided to have dinner instead. It's immaculately clean. Fantastic menu and delicious food. We had our dinner in the open back resultant. The service was exceptional. Very friendly staff with a lovely smile and some banter as well.Ethna was extremely pleasant and I'm sure she is an asset to the Thatch Bar.
The Guinness is well worth trying.
The toilet's and the whole pub and restaurant were immaculately clean.
Well done guys keep up the excellent work (by Noel McBreen) [3 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - It was my family's (3 generations) 1st time to eat here. We had stayed in Glenties 4 nights. The Thatch had been closed Tuesday and Wednesday so we ate here on the Thursday which was seafood special night and our last night in town. I ordered 1x chicken goujon and chips to share between the kids (both aged under 5). My Mum ordered John Dory special reasonably priced at ‚Ç¨23. She was extremely satisfied with her fish and gave it 10/10. I ordered the 8 oz Rib eye Steak with chips, carrots, broccoli, asparagus, pepper sauce, mushrooms and onions at ‚Ç¨22.50. To be honest, I was disappointed with my steak (quality, cut and way it was cooked) but then perhaps I'm a tough customer to please living on a beef farm. Furthermore, green beans and slivers of Courgettes replaced the advertised and promised asparagus. The wait between ordering and the food arriving was half an hour. Staff were friendly. I was pleasantly surprised when I went to pay to be informed that the kids meal was free when ordered with an adult meal. As a result, the overall rating for here swung towards excellent especially for value. Advice order fish specials on seafood special night (Thursday). (by Emily O'Connor) [a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Highly recommend, the food, deserts & cocktails are amazing. The staff are the nicest I have ever came across, so welcoming and friendly, they honestly cannot do enough for you which is so hard to come across. We will definitely be back, thank you xxx from family from Dublin xxx (by Ruth Kinsella) [2 months ago]

name: China Town
address: Lough Eske Rd, Drumroosk West, Donegal, Ireland
service_options: Shamrock Chinese Takeaway ¬∑ 4.0 stars ¬∑ 57 reviews ¬∑ Chinese Takeout, Apache Pizza Donegal ¬∑ 3.0 stars ¬∑ 150 reviews ¬∑ Pizza Delivery
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Food is delicious. Probably the best Chinese in town and in the whole area. Only problem is they don't take cards, but if you have cash it's the best place you can order food. (by Shannon Wilde) [a week ago] | Review 2: 1 star - Omg this restaurant don't go ok first service,when i entered the mat is sticky?my feat had stickyness then at the register the girl who is Chinese is almost impossible to understand what she's saying and INCREDIBLY RUDE! she has dead no interest in you at all and when you collect your food she asks what i ordered "I ordered chi-" she's gone comes back with bag,what else you want "salt" gives me 2 pieces of the little salts,and she almost doesn't understand you too I say "I want a fanta,club orange,water please"she goes to fridge right behind her and asks again fanta clu-? And looks at me???And the cherry on top she forgot one of my orders only the food is nice when you first eat it,then a few minutes after you'll feel sick  i mean I do not recommend!!

I don't know what's with these five star review? (by Leslie-mae) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - The best takeaway in town. Always quick, tasty, and made with fresh ingredients.
Only thing I‚Äôd say is ‚Äî it‚Äôd be great if the opening hours were added on Google Maps. Other than that, top notch! (by –û–ª—è –ü–æ–¥–Ω–µ–±–µ—Å–Ω–∞—è) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 4 stars - The atmosphere isn‚Äôt the best as the couch is a bit old and sticky but apart from that it was grand. The service wasn‚Äôt bad there was just a language barrier. Food was amazing best spice bag I ever had. (by Aleks Wach) [3 months ago] | Review 5: 1 star - The rudest Irish woman in the world works in this establishment FACT!!!! She was working this evening 10/3/23 I called to place an order on the phone and she started shouting and telling me that what I ordered was horrible and disgusting as if she was the one eating it. Definitely should be Fired on the spot!!!!! Other wise the food is delicious and the owner is lovely and always polite on the phone and in person. (by Radek Radoslaw) [2 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - I got a delicious chicken in orange this evening in this Donegal town Chinese. A lovely friendly lady served me. I highly recommend Chinatown . Best Chinese I ever had . (by Teresa Mcenroy) [a year ago] | Review 7: 1 star - Ordered food was very poor quality, decided to try it a few months later and when I went to collect my food the person answering the phone had not placed my order as she said she could not understand me as I in a hands free in my car. And then was rude to me when I was asking for an explanation and had let me drive 5km to collect my food knowing that she had not placed the order. (by Sadie McDowell) [a year ago] | Review 8: 1 star - The rudest woman in the world works in this establishment FACT!!!! She was working this evening 26/2/21 when I telephoned in my order. It was like I was asking her a huge favour to place my order and when I asked for no sauce on crispy chicken I thought she was going to blow a fuse!!! She was so abrupt and rude on the phone and I thought that level of rudeness could not be topped but when my husband collected the food she truly outdid herself with her bad manners. I have gone here before and to be fair I would share my business between the three chinese takeaways in town but I will never return here again after this evening. This 'lady' is doing this business no favours with her 'service' and they would want to rethink her employment if they want to keep their customers. (by milky_way:3) [4 years ago] | Review 9: 4 stars - Fantastic food but staff should wear hair nets to prevent hair from getting into food as I found a big long hair in my food and nearly swallowed it!!
Other than that it's great. (by Jack Kennedy) [2 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Best Chinese in Donegal. Reasonable prices for the standard and quality of food. Didn't have to wait long for our takeaway which was a large order. (by Sue Barrington Photography) [2 years ago]

name: McGarrigles Restaurant
address: Main St, Drumacrin, Bundoran, Co. Donegal, F94 TR23, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Fabulous food. Put McGariggles on your list to visit. Lovely staff, menu is brilliant. A great variety for all the family. Early bird menu is fab too. Chicken curry, lamb dinner, spaghetti bolognese, steaks and so much more. Thrilled we found this place ‚òòÔ∏è (by Louise Coghlan) [3 months ago] | Review 2: 4 stars - I had the chicken and mushroom vol-au-vent.  The pastry was flaky and the filling creamy.  It was rich and comforting, perfect for a cozy meal. Service was prompt and friendly. (by Heather Stronge) [3 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - A lovely place to sit and spend a bit of time while in Bundoran. The barman was friendly and extremely polite.
A good pint of Guinness.
I didnt order food so can't comment on that. Very good facilities (by Moll) [a month ago] | Review 4: 4 stars - Food was ok. I had chowder, teenagers had fish and chips. Seafood in chowder not great quality, a bit rubbery. Serving girl very pleasant. Clean & tidy place. (by MAURICE LOOBY FITNESS) [a month ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Fantastic food and staff, always so welcoming, I really enjoy my dining here.
First class as always! (by Michael O'Keeffe) [Edited 4 months ago] | Review 6: 4 stars - Everything was great, until we paid the bill without a deal ‚Äî there should've been 2 courses for ‚Ç¨20, but they took full price. So be careful and check your bill. (by Julianna Tsaruk) [a year ago] | Review 7: 3 stars - Unfortunately, the main courses we had were disappointing and overpriced, in our opinion. The sirloin steak was served on the bone (which wasn't mentioned on the menu, which may put some people off). The desserts and coffee were delicious  - definitely worth a try! Service was friendly but slow. (by Anne Ryan) [2 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - If you are in Bundoran make sure you pay a visit to this place. The food is absolutely amazing. A bit dear but well worth it.  I tried the bangers and mash with onions and mushrooms and gravy omg 5 stars , I also tried the stew, couldn't finish it, it felt like the bowl was endless and also tried the chicken goujons,  what can I say but omg üòã pay it a visit seriously, you will not be disappointed. The staff are so friendly and helpful. (by jeanette burke) [a month ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Food is always fabulous.  Service is brilliant. Don't have to wait. Staff so friendly and helpful. Wouldn't go anywhere else when I'm in Bundoran. (by Josephine Grimes) [a month ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - I've been here over 20 times and still can not wait to go back. The food is amazing and treated extremely well. The drinks are great. The staff absolutely phenomenal. If you want a exceptional meal you should definitely choose this place. (by Michael Hornsby) [3 years ago]

name: The Gateway Lodge,Donegal Town
reviews:
Review 1: None - Great hotel! Rooms were clean and seemed to have been updated recently. The breakfast was amazing and really well presented (see photos). Location was an easy 5 minute walk to restaurants and bars / center of town. Would stay here again. (by Heather VL) | Review 2: None - Staff at the Gateway was wonderful and friendly, and breakfast was excellent. Our room was good, with a nice comfy bed, but it was warm. We had to open the window, and in doing so were woken up by the lads coming home around 2am. We also heard a couple getting freaky in the next room, so not the quietest sleep. Overall, a very decent stay! (by Devin Gourley) | Review 3: None - Lovely inn located very close to the town square. Our room and bathroom were huge. A king sized bed‚Äîwhat a treat in Ireland! The whole place was full of charm. Parking was right out front and free. The breakfast was 12 euro per room‚Äîour friends had a full Irish, we just grabbed some coffees. (by BethAnnSH123) | Review 4: None - We loved our very brief one-night! We stayed at the Lodge in early April. My favorite part: we could walk to town‚Ä¶ and we did. For dinner AND THEN‚Ä¶ early the next morning we walked in to town & enjoyed a magical walk along the Bank Walk (also known as the Fairy Bank) ‚ú® do it - you will love it! - it was one of the most charming, unexpected finds on our trip to Ireland. The staff friendly & helpful. The lodge - quaintly laid out with rooms tucked up and around one another w/plenty of space to lay out your suitcases. The next morning, we enjoyed a lovely Irish breakfast at the lodge‚Äôs restaurant. (by Debbie Lucas) | Review 5: None - My partner and I recently stayed at The Gateway Lodge while attending a wedding at Harveys Point, and we were absolutely delighted with our experience. The location was ideal, just a short and easy 10-minute drive to the hotel.

From the moment we arrived and were able to check in early, the staff were incredibly welcoming and went above and beyond to ensure we had everything we needed. We had booked three rooms in total, and the price was fantastic ‚Äì the best we found in the area.

Our room was spotless, comfortable, and absolutely perfect for our needs. We couldn't have asked for a better base for our wedding weekend. Highly recommend The Gateway Lodge! (by cian donohoe) | Review 6: None - Ideal for a couple of nights as we stayed in Donegal for golf. Perfect location within easy walk of the triangle and couldn't fault anything. Good size rooms, clean & modern and as with most of our experience in Ireland, very friendly. (by philip992) | Review 7: None - We stopped in the Gateway for a coffee break whilst out for the day on Bank Holiday Sunday. I'm writing this review purely on the fact that the scones were the best I've tasted in s long time. Crispy on the outside and melt in your mouth ‚Ä¶ (by sarahmarylucas) | Review 8: None - Located within walking distance of the center of town, the Gateway has nicely updated rooms and bathrooms that are spacious.  There a few missing necessities like luggage racks but other than that no real gaps in the property.  Breakfast ‚Ä¶ (by A3337ZEscottr) | Review 9: None - Room was clean, comfortable, and had everything I needed. The staff were friendly and helpful throughout my stay. The location was excellent, close to the town centre. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others. (by Callum Dougherty) | Review 10: None - Lovely room very quite, easy walk to town centre maybe 7 minutes, terrific breakfast, super clean.  Highly recommend. (by Ann Britton)

name: Harvey‚Äôs Bar & Terrace
address: Harvey's Point, Lough Eske, Friary, Donegal, F94 E771, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 4 stars - Had a great time here. Very laid back in the bar.
Staff were good. Offered table service.
Live music was good.  Huge drink selection. (by Manjinder Singh) [8 years ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Beautiful location and view (by Gerome George) [5 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Beautiful Location. Very welcoming and professional.  Attended my sister's 70th birthday last Sunday, and the staff couldn't be nicer. Beautifully attended gardens and just very tranquil. Wonderful Food. Can't wait to return. (by Pauline McHugh) [3 years ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - We wandered off into the fine dining restaurant, but we wanted to eat at the bar. After we explained our mistake, we had a lovely dinner and got served as royalty; absolutely amazing experience. (by Teade Kuipers) [a year ago] | Review 5: 1 star - Amazing setting and beautiful hotel but my advice is go to Biddie O‚ÄôBarnes as food is superior and price performance better, we felt let down by the arrogance of the kitchen, over 20 years we have had family members get married in Harvey‚Äôs, family stay in the hotel and I usually recommend this over all places in donegal but after my last experience that will not happen anymore. We decided to go for a family meal. Service was a little slow initially but nothing noteworthy, I had ordered the steak and thought it was somewhat dry, afterwards I happened to notice on the menu that the dish should of had a pepper sauce, I did mention this to a staff member but when I received the bill this error by the kitchen was not accounted for, when I noted this the waitress went to check with other senior staff and returned to tell me that as I didn‚Äôt complain earlier they would not adjust the price even though they served the dish incomplete. I then raised the issue with a senior staff member who‚Äôs first question was to ask me whether I was a resident in the hotel (why should that matter?). After deliberation, he returned to tell me that they would not charge me for a glass of house wine. To say we were disappointed is an understatement. (by Gary Coffey) [3 years ago] | Review 6: 4 stars - Lovely food and staff, nice room layout, was evening so will have to revisit some afternoon to enjoy the views (by Vivienne Rooney) [6 years ago] | Review 7: 4 stars - Very pleasant and wonderful setting beside the lake, had a enjoyable light lunch and coffee, excellent service and very well priced. (by Barney Mc Laughlin) [6 years ago] | Review 8: 4 stars - Beautiful location I had the best steak sandwich ever. Staff extremely well trained. (by Catherine Mcgroary) [6 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Was there for a birthday party, everything was great, staff wonderful, would love more vegan options please as standard.... (by Noreen) [6 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - It was absolutely amazing I would 110% reccomend to anyone who's looking to have a nice time and meal. (by Dean MG) [6 years ago]

name: the 'Weaver's Loft' bistro
address: The Diamond, Donegal, F94 AVN2, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - The place is located on the first floor inside a shop, with a super cozy atmosphere, excellent service, and incredible food. The dishes were well-served (fair portions, not too much or too little), and the coffee was wonderful (the machine is well-tuned and they make the coffee well). The best breakfast I've had in Ireland. (by Thaisse Nascimento) [a week ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - We visited this place on the August Bank Holiday weekend as it was recommended by a local. The food was superb. We ate some seafood chowder and toasted sandwiches.  Everything was so well seasoned.  The staff were super friendly and helpful.  Would highly recommend a visit and can't wait to return. (by Susan Reddy) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Great food! We had the seafood chowder and Prawn salmon salad.

The staff was lovely. Highly recommend! (by Vernon Dsouza) [a month ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - If I could give more stars, I would. We are on holiday touring through Ireland and have had some great meals but this is by far the best and the one I'll remember years from now. Everything we ate (grilled salmon, smoked salmon, soup) was Michelin-star quality. (by Deb B) [a year ago] | Review 5: 3 stars - We happened to be in town and fancied breakfast so here seemed a good bet. I had the avocado +poached eggs and decided to add bacon, whilst my companion had the large fry
The bread, avocado and poached egg were nice, in fact the basil oil around the plate added an extra zing...I do wish I hadn't added the bacon as it appeared either deep fried or re cooked in some way as it was brittle and lacked flavour
The fry was below par. Plenty of it but over cooked and perhaps not drained as the over whelming flavour was oil. I swapped one of my poached for my partner's fried egg and wished I hadn't as it was very far from runny and oily tasting.
The staff are attentive and friendly and run the front of house efficiently but I do think the meals are a little on the pricy side (by Hazel Stanton) [9 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - The best breakfast I have had in a long time - would highly recommend (by sorcha boyle) [a year ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - The best place you can eat!
We had a salmon and a shepards pie and a brownie... They were divine!
And the price is reasonable.
Finger-, plate- and fork liking good experience! (by Monika Kerme) [3 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Always the best breakfasts in town. There are too many great options to choose from so this time I had the ranch eggs with bacon and my wife had the small fry. Again, it didn't disappoint - just the right amount of food and friendly staff. (by Ronan McLoughlin) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - While on holiday last week, I visited Magee's shop and cafe along with some friends. A smiling attendant (Trina by name) came to our table, greeted us and helped us choose an open sandwich on some scrumptious brown bread. While we waited for our order to come through, she engaged with other customers whom she recognised from last year. They were stunned that she remembered them!
Trina is such an asset to the staff and she embodies the best of Irish hospitality. Her friendliness, competence and customer care was all done efficiently and with a smile. She made our visit such a pleasant experience. (by Eavan Walsh) [a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Food was delicious, there were freshly baked scones.
I really liked the vibe of the place.
Cafe is on the first floor of Magee store. (by Ekta Bhardwaj) [Edited 9 months ago]

name: Johnnys Ranch
address: Gamble square, Rathmelton, Ramelton, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - First Class!!!

I have to say Johnny was fantastic from the minute we paid him a visit.

He rembered me from a previous visit a few years back when I used to work across the county. His customer service was first class. Good quality food and very affordable. Using local suppliers and an excellent representative of the wholesome people of Ramelton.

3 good pieces of delicous lightly battered haddock cooked to perfection. Nice crispy chips and tasty curry sauce!

Wishing you every success for the future and look forward to seeing you again soon!

Keep up the good work üé£üíõüíöüíõüíöüëå

Best Keith (by Keith Millar) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - I had delicious fish and chips (kids portion). Perfectly cooked haddock from Killybegs with crispy on the outside and fluffy inside hand-cut chips. Highly Recommended! (by Radoslaw) [4 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - By pure chance I bumped into a lady the day before who recommend Johnny‚Äôs street food in Ramelton and so glad she did, the fish and chips were probably one of the best I‚Äôve had, tasted amazing, freshly cooked and what better place to sit and eat them with the sun shining along side the river.    I did hear someone had complained about the van being there and is trying to get them closed down - shame on you !!! üò° Let‚Äôs hope the local council come to their senses and allow them to keep trading especially when they the food is so good and it‚Äôs their livelihood!!!! (by Kate D) [a month ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Johnny‚Äôs Ranch came highly recommended during our visit to Ramelton. We have eaten from Johnny‚Äôs both evenings. Fish and Chips were absolutely delicious so we decided to go back for some more today and had a burger and curry with chips! 5 stars all the way! (by Joanne Hawe) [2 months ago] | Review 5: 4 stars - Lovely fellas that work in the van, very friendly. Chips & fish were very tasty but the goujons were a little over cooked.  Excellent portion sizes! (by Aishling N√≠Duibhne (Irechan)) [2 years ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Proper fish and chips!!! Excellent fresh killybegs fish and crispy chips, great value too. Call in to Johnny you won‚Äôt be disappointed. (by John Rooney) [a year ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Great food truck experience in Donegal! Johnny was an absolute sweetheart, so warm and welcoming. He took the time to chat with us about our trip, our lives, and even shared some fascinating history about the town. His attentiveness and kindness made the experience even more special.

As for the food, Stunning! The fish and chips were some of the best I‚Äôve ever had, and the Irish goujons were incredibly tasty, all freshly handmade by Johnny himself. You can really taste the quality and care in every bite.

Highly recommend this spot to anyone passing through! (by Mateus S√°) [7 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - For a street food van to turn out food like is amazing. The battered haddock was the best I've ever had, the hand cut chips are what all chips should be. If you're in the area give it a go, you really won't be disappointed! (by Brian McConnell) [2 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - I don't know what they're doing in that magical little van but holy cow that was a great burger!!! Great chips and great vegetable curry... Lovely chunky vegetables too (by Andrew ‚ÄúDogfish‚Äù Cronin) [Edited a year ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Ordered food and it was the best takeaway I have ever had ! everything was so fresh . Johnny and staff so helpful . Will DEFINITELY be back ! (by Lucy Scanlon) [a month ago]

name: The Church Restaurant, Bar & Cafe
address: Rockhill House Estate, Rockhill, Letterkenny, Co. Donegal, F92 EC5H, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 4 stars - Really beautiful area only a short drive from letterkenny town centre.

The grounds are beautiful to the house which you need to book

The resteraunt was lovely for lunch then dinner that night ,with great attentivestsff and fresh food. I had the ribeye and it was the best steak i have had in a long time.

They were very good at making your cocktail to suit if you did not want it too over powering.

Great little circular booths for children and lots of home made cookies. (by Eilish Mackle) [6 months ago] | Review 2: 1 star - We visited here alongside a package in The Wellhouse, part of this package we were given pizzas in The Church Restaurant. The place was really quiet, which did surprise us given the summer period. The staff were helpful to a degree but would not say it was high quality service. Our pizzas were clearly frozen and took 35 minutes to arrive, my husbands beer was also not good and very dead. Although our package didn‚Äôt include anything additional, we weren‚Äôt given the opportunity to order any sides which we would have been happy to pay for separately. There was another customer who brought back her cocktail to the bar staff and then explained how to make a cocktail. Other customers I heard ask for their drinks and when told cocktails can take longer to make, responded that it had already been 35 minutes. The staff member making drinks clearly did not know what they were doing, I appreciate they may have been new but there was no one providing any training or guidance to them. This was a highly disappointing visit as we loved the spa area, definitely won‚Äôt be returning. (by Rebecca Waugh) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - We were staying at Rockhill House and popped down to the Church both nights we were staying. Food was great and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. There seemed to only be one barman and one waitress and they were busy but everything ran like clockwork! Great location too! Will definitely be back! (by Gavin Wilson) [a month ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - A wonderful place for dinner.  Whenever in Donegal, we try to fit in a date night at The Church.  The food is devine, and the service is exceptional.  We love the mussels and guiness bread, I was able to purchase a loaf to take home too üòÜ A lovely restaurant for a special meal. (by Clairsy's Cakes) [a year ago] | Review 5: 4 stars - Beautiful location, lovely restaurant. Staff were really attentive. Manager was great, she really looked after everyone.
A small annoyance was  arents allowing their kids to run around, especially since they kept opening outside doors & leaving them open. (by Jim Hunter) [3 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Stunning setting and a real treat of quality served food at very reasonable prices by excellent staff. I ordered the bruschetta to start then the beetroot and goats cheese sourdough sandwich for my main followed by the Carmel panna cotta all where delicious. Looking forward to returning already great place (by Craig Veitch) [4 years ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Excellent food, attentive service and covid regulations are well implemented with good spacing between tables in the outdoor seating area. Food was very good as were the prices. Highly recommended. (by richard gil) [4 years ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Fantastic food here and a real personal touch with all the staff chatting to us! We ate here two nights in a row and everything was top class (by Sinead Doran) [5 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Had our sons Christening here over the weekend, staff were friendly and helpful, food was delicious and accommodating for a guest who is a coeliac. Everyone was complimenting the food! (by Amy Emery) [2 years ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - What a find!  Lovely setting, smart but relaxed bar and dining areas, great food! (by John James) [a month ago]

name: Pizza Max Donegal - Donegal, Ireland
address: UNIT 1, Main St, Donegal, F94 FX53, Ireland
service_options: Apache Pizza Donegal ¬∑ 3.0 stars ¬∑ 150 reviews ¬∑ Pizza Delivery, Shamrock Chinese Takeaway ¬∑ 4.0 stars ¬∑ 57 reviews ¬∑ Chinese Takeout
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Pizza Max in Donegal Town was just as fantastic as the one in Derry! We tried a variety of dishes, and everything was delicious,flavours were spot-on, portions generous, and we left completely satisfied. The staff were really friendly as well; the guy working there was happy to answer our questions and made our visit even more enjoyable.
We would definitely recommend Pizza Max in Donegal Town to anyone looking for a tasty, satisfying meal! (by Sam Walsh) [a month ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Pizza max, you are a credit to the town. Ordered a pizza and within 20 minutes our food was delivered. It was exactly how we ordered and hot on arrival. The delivery driver was so nice and friendly. Such a great accessory to the town. Thank you so much guys!! (by Ciara Thomas) [a year ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Food is good and customer service is also great. (by ANANDHA KEERTHANAN) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Fantastic service. I was in Ireland from the Uk and I had no data and they helped me out.

Great food also (by John C) [9 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Great food,fresh & tasty ,best pizza in town ! Kebabs are huge big feed ,great value for money ! (by Kamil Kostrzewa) [a year ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - Great pizza! (by Kristine Wilt) [5 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Far better than Apache pizza (by bob riley) [a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - Excellent experience.. (by Shaiby Thomas) [a year ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Hellooooo (by Conor McGuinness) [9 months ago]

name: Vardon Restaurant - Rosapenna Hotel
address: Rosapenna Hotel & Golf Resort, Sheephaven Bay, Downings, Co. Donegal, F92 PN73, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - From the moment we arrived at Rosa Penna Golf Resort, it was clear we were in for an exceptional experience. The resort boasts three outstanding golf courses, each offering a unique challenge and breathtaking scenery. Whether it was the meticulously maintained fairways, the clever course designs, or the stunning natural surroundings, every round felt world-class.

The service throughout the resort was without doubt some of the best in the business. Every staff member we encountered was professional, attentive, and genuinely committed to ensuring our stay was perfect. It‚Äôs rare to find such consistently high standards across the board.

Dining at the Vardon Restaurant was another unforgettable highlight. The food was truly outstanding beautifully presented, rich in flavor, and clearly crafted with the finest ingredients. Whether it was a casual lunch or a formal evening meal, every dish exceeded expectations.

In short, Rosa Penna Golf Resort delivers luxury, quality, and hospitality at the very highest level. It‚Äôs a must-visit for any golf enthusiast or anyone looking for a five star resort experience. (by Mike Timson) [5 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - The food is outstanding with a generous selection both in the restaurant and the bar. The atmosphere is so comfortable enhanced by a staff that clearly love their jobs.
The whole resort is just great. The gold courses are nothing short of spectacular.
I‚Äôve been there at least three times and will be going back again! (by Kevin Haggerty) [4 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - Rosapenna is truly a golfers paradise!
The scenery was Caribbean like and all the courses we played were unforgettable, particularly St. Patrick‚Äôs. The rooms we stayed in at the hotel were huge and so comfortable, but the highlight was the breakfast, lunch and dinner @ the Vardon restaurant. What a fantastic 4 days. The food was superb and the staff treated us like royalty‚Ä¶ an experience not to be forgotten. I would recommend Rosapenna and the Vardon to anyone and we will be back next year without a doubt! A real 5Star experience.
Paul Crosbie
Captain of Clonakilty GC (by paul crosbie) [4 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - The Vardon Restaurant is a spectacular experience. The food, setting and service is outstanding. The Hotel is first class with luxurious rooms. The value is tremendous. Add the three golf courses to the menu and we have a package that is "best of class" not only in Ireland but worldwide. Finally, the Casey family are genuinely great people and they personally make you feel like their most important guest. The staff culture is based on pleasing and welcoming their guests. Exceptional destination spot! (by Bill Barry) [4 months ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - We recently enjoyed a terrific dinner at the recently-remodeled Vardon restaurant. The updated decor makes the whole space seem lighter and airier. Tables are spaced nicely apart, but there was a lively buzz about the place which made for a great ambiance.

As for the food, coming from the US Pacific Northwest, I'm a salmon snob and I have to say the salmon was outstanding, as was our salad -- in my experience, not always the case in Ireland.

I was pleased to learn one thing that had not changed about the Vardon was the availability of the Scraggy Bay IPA -- my choice for best craft beer in Ireland!

We always look forward to our visits to Rosapenna, but the new Vardon has elevated the entire resort to another level. (by David Mihm) [4 months ago] | Review 6: 5 stars - The Vardon restaurant at the Rosapenna Resort is simply spectacular. The setting is one of the best in the world as you dine overlooking beautiful sheep-haven bay. The service is second to none as meals are presented by a very friendly staff from all over the world. The meals are delicious as the chef uses locally caught and grown ingredients which are served with a perfect assortment of side dishes. The wine selection is also excellent. Dining at the Vardon is a special night on the town. (by Quentin Lutz) [4 months ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - I have dinner at The Vardon Restaurant on many occasions both when staying at the Hotel and as just a guest for the day.

The view from the restaurant is sensational over looking the bay, equally matched by the exceptional service, crisp white tables cloths and delicious food. On a recent visit, I enjoyed fresh local lobster. It was sublime. Just writing this review is getting me excited for my next visit to the Vardon Restaurant.

It comes highly recommended!! (by Patrick Home) [4 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - The staff and service are top-notch, the food is always amazing, and there is plenty of it. The views of the ocean are spectacular, making the atmosphere magical. When I arrive in June, this will be my seventh time, and I eat breakfast and dinner every day the entire week I am there. The way you are treated feels like home. I highly recommend dining at the Vardon Restaurant.

Dr Frank (by Frank Berzanskis) [4 months ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - I  have come to Ireland for golf since the mid 1980‚Äôs playing the links courses all over. After my first game years ago at Rosapenna it became my annual destination. The top quality hospitality, service, facilities and dining enhance the world class golf experience. The level of cooperation between Rosapenna and the surrounding community and other golf facilities is remarkable. The staff treat guests like family: Highly recommended!! (by Tom Ackert) [5 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - We make a trip to Rosapenna each year and the Vardon restaurant is a fantastic part of our trip.  The food is excellent, the staff is warm and friendly, and the view of Sheephaven Bay is breathtaking.  There is a wide selection of entrees and the wine list is superb.  I highly recommend dining at the Vardon! (by Yogi Spence) [4 months ago]

name: Pirates of the Coffeebean
address: Beach, An Fhearthainn, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - Our favourite regular place in Donegal! Everyone is so kind. The food is always delicious : salad, soup, and the new evening menu is incredible! Just so happy to come here all the time! Because of the success it gets busy at summertime : best to come off-peak if you can. A great place for the whole family anytime in the day. (by L D) [2 months ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - After a long beach walk this cafe on the edge of the car park was perfect. Dog friendly with breakfast, lunch, and dinner options. We had coffees and a toastie but were certainly tempted by the array of traybakes and cakes. (by Stephen McCalden) [2 months ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - A lovely spot right beside the beach. The food was lovely, staff were friendly and very helpful. Its dog friendly too which was an added bonus so we didn't have to worry about our pooch being too hot in the car. Will definately return the next time we're in the area! (by C G) [2 months ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - Stayed at the caravan park beside the cafe for the 2nd year in a row and would be in cafe throughout the whole weekend. The staff are so friendly and professional, the food is always great and we loved the seaside decor inside. (by Stewart Thomson) [a month ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - A must-visit if you‚Äôre in the area. Great selection of food catering for different dietary requirements and staff are very friendly. It‚Äôs a popular spot so can be busy but always worth the wait! (by Larisa) [5 months ago] | Review 6: 4 stars - A cute little pet-friendly spot in Portnoo. We only went in for coffee, but we were warmly welcomed and the doggo's each got a free puppachino. The staff were really friendly. (by Marli Heyneke) [a year ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - Must stop. Great coffee. Great soup. Great sandwich. Right along the beach. Excellent stop after hiking. Great atmosphere. Friendly staff. (by Paul Nickisch) [4 months ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - 5 Stars in every respect!

We visited every day for 4 weeks, as we did last summer. All of the food was delicious. Our family favourites were:
Cinnamon bun (the best)
Overnight oats
Ham & cheese croissant
Spicy chicken on sourdough bread/focaccia
Parma ham & pear pizza

Everything at Pirates was just as good if not better than we get back home in London.

Excellent service, staff happy and smiley ‚Ä¶..

We'll be back again next year.

The Kenny Family (by Frances Kenny) [2 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Gorgeous food, and really good gluten free options. Lovely servers too. (by Sharon Gilleece) [11 months ago] | Review 10: 5 stars - Visited today with family and had a lovely lunch - pizzas were delicious , pumpkin soup fab and the best sourdough sandwich I‚Äôve ever had ! Homemade buns / cheesecake were the end to a perfect lunch.  Thanks ! (by James McGreevy) [2 years ago]

name: Smugglers Creek Inn
reviews:
Review 1: None - Delicious Gluten free options,  dog friendly,  great spot, super view, best monkfish and prawn ceasar salad I've ever eaten.  The dressing was gorgeous too. Had sea food special for main,  hake, John dory, prawn and scallops with a sauce I ‚Ä¶ (by lisarV138SU) | Review 2: None - We were visiting Rossnowlagh and had seen Smugglers creek online however there were so many recent bad reviews we were going to give it a miss, however   We thought we‚Äôd keep an open mind and give it a try! Well we were pleasantly surprised ‚Ä¶ (by BradF683) | Review 3: None - Lovely setting and food was delicious |Staff very friendly and welcoming. |It was a gorgeous day and we were lucky to get a table. Best to book before arriving. (by Collette12345) | Review 4: None - Location beautiful....however kettle and cups in room but no tea or coffee!  Mouldy toast for breakfast.  Will not stay here again.  We ate in restaurant the night we arrived.  Food was ok but nothing special.  Our room was above bar.  Very noisy until well into the early hours so not much sleep. (by Audajohns1997) | Review 5: None - Stay clear. Not family friendly. Bad food

Very poor customer service. Basically non existent. Arrived and told to wait to be seated and then 10mins later had to ask could we site down. Asked a male member of staff where the baby changing area was and he said he didn‚Äôt know. It was in the toilet and it was wet and dirty.
Food was no good. Childs portions for 18‚Ç¨
Never asked if we needed anything and charges 75‚Ç¨ for overpriced food. All frozen food. Nothing fresh. name: The One&One
address: Malones Garage, Drumaghy, Ardara, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews:
Review 1: 5 stars - The food was top class, i had the crab starter and Prawns &  Lobster main. Both were way above my expectations.
Staff very friendly, place setup well to deal with  covid-19 spacing, hand sanitizing etc (by Lenny McCarthy) [5 years ago] | Review 2: 5 stars - Excellent experience in Michaelangelos, first time here from Dublin. Beautiful decor and wonderful service, with an amazing view across the golf course. I ate the gambas prawns and steak (cooked to perfection) and enjoyed a mango daiquiri for dessert. I would 100% recommend this restaurant if your in the area or near by, definitely worth a spin from the surrounding area, lots of good food about Portnoo but this place is something special. (by Saoirse Nimharnain) [4 years ago] | Review 3: 5 stars - We decided to have the street food option aka the silver bullet today and we came away more than happy. The fish and chips were the way they should be cooked, light crispy batter, good quality fish, great tartare and nice fries.I had the loaded fries that were extremely tasty (by Hazel Stanton) [3 years ago] | Review 4: 5 stars - The most wonderful food! Absolutely loved this place üòä And the service was amazing, too. Highly recommended üíö ‚Ä¶ (by Darren MacRae) [3 years ago] | Review 5: 5 stars - Best chips around. Great service, great food. There's always something a little different to try like their homemade pink sauce - the kids went home to try to recreate it üòÅ  Not at all your regular chipper! (by Clare Barrett) [a year ago] | Review 6: 2 stars - They call themselves gourmet food truck, but they are in fact just chipper on wheels. Very average food in not the best location.

Fish and chips were tasty, but there was way too much chips and not enough fish. Burger was ok, fried chicken not so much as it wasn't fried for long enough to become crunchy. Coleslaw was terrible, probably the worst one I ever had with huge chunks of very old cabbage. None of the ingredients were impressive, seems like they are using low quality ones unfortunately.

Location is not the best, in the middle of a petrol station's car park with only a few seats available and surrounded with litter bins and disgusting smell coming from them.

Service was nice, portions were generous and prices were acceptable. (by Dragutin Cividini) [a year ago] | Review 7: 5 stars - I love this place, I make sure to visit every time Im in Donegal with the kids. The food is always top notch, espwcially the fiah and chips, and the staff are lovely. (by Trio M) [a year ago] | Review 8: 5 stars - We had an unexpectedly delicious meal here on our camping trip to Donegal. I had the crab claws and we both had the delightfully tender chicken supreme. I almost forgot the improvised Passionfruit daiquiri! (by Jess O'Riordan) [5 years ago] | Review 9: 5 stars - Beautiful food cooked from scratch, very generous portions and it is very reasonable price too..
